TEXT: 1.2.2 Natural ventilation of occupied spaces must be achieved by providing a net openable area of windows or other openings to the outside of no less than 5% of the floor area.

TEXT: 1.1.1 A fence erected to ensure security against unauthorised access to storage and treatment facilities shall comply with F5/AS1 Construction and Demolition Hazards.
LRML: if(and(or(and(is(facility.purpose, storage), is(storage.type, waste)), and(is(facility.purpose, treatment), is(treatment.type, waste))), is(waste.type, industrialLiquid), has(facility, securityFence))), then(and(obligation(complyWith(securityFence.construction, nzbc_f5as1)), obligation(complyWith(securityFence.demolition, nzbc_f5as1))))

LRML: if(and(is(system.purpose, disposal), is(disposal.type, waste), is(waste.type, industrialLiquid), not(for(waste.treatment, sewer)), is(disposal.method, discharge), to(discharge, sewer), has(disposal.method, approval), by(approval, networkUtilityOperator))), then(obligation(complyWith(system, nzbc_g13as2)))

TEXT: Calculations of fire resistance; The following parameters shall apply: a) Post-flashover species yield for soot is Ysoot = 0.14 kg/kgfuel b) Post-flashover species yield for CO is YCO = 0.40 kg/kgfuel, and c) Design FLEDs shall be as specified in Table 2.2 for activities within buildings.
LRML: if(is(fire.resistance, required)), then(and(obligation(equal(ysoot, 0.14 kg/kgFuel)), equal(yco, 0.4 kg/kgFuel), complyWith(fled, table), equal(table.key, t2.2)))

TEXT: 1.4 Calculating occupant loads 1.4.1 The occupant load shall be determined from the risk group and number of people in each space of the building. The occupant load may need to be evaluated not only for each risk group but also for: a) A space or open floor area involving one or more activities, and b) A floor containing more than one risk group, and c) A single firecell, and d) Each floor within a firecell.
LRML: if(or(loop(in(forEach(buildingStorey), firecell), and(define(count(space.occupant), x0), define(space.riskGroup, x1), include(space, openFloorArea), greaterThan(count(space.activities), 1))), loop(in(forEach(space), firecell), and(define(count(space.occupant), x2), define(space.riskGroup, x3), include(space, openFloorArea), greaterThan(count(space.activities), 1))))), then(obligation(include(occupantLoad.calculation, and(x0, x2, x1, x3))))

TEXT: 1.4.2 Occupant loads shall be calculated from the occupant densities given in Table 1.2 based on the floor area of the part of the building housing the activity. Table 1.2 Occupant densities; Activity; Occupancy density (m2/ person).
LRML: if(and(define(space.floorArea, x0), define(occupantLoadDensity, x1), obligation(asPer(x1, table)), obligation(equal(table.key, t1.2)))), then(obligation(equal(space.occupantLoad, 'x0 / x1')))

TEXT: 1.4 Calculating occupant loads 1.4.3 Duplication shall be avoided by: a) Ensuring that, where people may be involved in more than one activity, they are counted only once.
LRML: if(and(has(space, occupant), in(occupant.involvement, activity), greaterThan(count(activity), 1))), then(and(obligation(include(occupantLoad.calculation, occupant)), is(occupant.instance, distinct)))

TEXT: 1.4.4 Occupant load assessment shall take account of the actual arrangement and number of seats for fixed seating (see Paragraph 3.7.4). Where additional floor area abuts the fixed seating, additional occupants are permitted in that floor area based on standing space density (see Table 1.2), provided the escape route is not obstructed.
LRML: if(and(define(count(fixedSeating.seat), x0), adjoin(space, fixedSeating), has(space, occupant), define(space.occupantLoad, x1), not(is(escapeRoute, obstructed)))), then(and(obligation(is(space.activity, standing)), obligation(asPer(x1, table)), obligation(equal(table.key, t1.2)), obligation(equal(occupantLoad, 'x0 + x1'))))

TEXT: 1.4.5 The requirements of this Acceptable Solution account for the fact that other people may be present in the building or firecell and additional calculations are not required when an occupant load is derived by bed spaces (i.e. for risk groups SM and SI). 1.4.6 For the purposes of risk group SI the term ‘bed’ means the number of people that are under care or detention. It can include people on: a) Beds, or b) Recliner or lounge chairs, or c) Dentist chairs, or d) Treatment tables, or e) Any other furniture where an occupant may be for a period of treatment, in care or detention.
LRML: if(and(or(is(space.activity, sleeping), is(space.riskGroup, or(sm, si))), define(count(bed), x0), include(bed, or(recliner, loungeChair, dentistChair, treatmentTable, treatmentFurniture)), is(x0, occupantLoad), for(x0, fireSafetyDesign), define(count(space.occupant), x1))), then(and(equal(space.occupantLoad, x0), obligation(not(is(x1, calculated)))))

TEXT: 1.4.6 For the purposes of risk group SI the term 'bed' means the number of people that are under care or detention. It can include people on: a) Beds, or b) Recliner or lounge chairs, or c) Dentist chairs, or d) Treatment tables, or e) Any other furniture where an occupant may be for a period of treatment, in care or detention.
LRML: if(and(or(is(space.activity, sleeping), is(space.riskGroup, si)), define(count(bed), x0), include(bed, or(recliner, loungeChair, dentistChair, treatmentTable, treatmentFurniture)))), then(and(obligation(is(x0, occupantLoad)), for(x0, fireSafetyDesign)))

TEXT: 1.4.7 If, in a particular situation, the occupant load derived from Table 1.2 is clearly more than that which will occur, the basis of any proposal for a lesser occupant load shall be substantiated to the building consent authority.
LRML: if(and(define(occupantLoadDensity, x0), asPer(x0, table), equal(table.key, t1.2), define(space.occupantLoad, x1), is(x1, or(actual, expected)), greaterThan(x0, x1), for(x1, fireSafetyDesign))), then(obligation(is(x1, justified)))

TEXT: 1.4.8 If the maximum occupant load is greater than that calculated from Table 1.2, the higher number shall be used as the basis for the fire safety design and will need to be justified to the building consent authority.
LRML: if(and(define(occupantLoadDensity, x0), from(x0, table), equal(table.key, t1.2), define(space.occupantLoad, x1), is(x1, or(actual, expected)), greaterThan(x1, x0))), then(and(obligation(for(x1, fireSafetyDesign)), obligation(is(x1, justified))))

TEXT: 2.1.1 The floor area of firecells shall be limited in accordance with Table 2.1.
LRML: if(is(space, firecell)), then(and(obligation(complyWith(firecell.floorArea, table)), obligation(equal(table.key, t2.1))))

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is one of three Acceptable Solutions that provide a means of establishing compliance with NZBC Clauses C1 to C6 Protection from Fire. It can be used for the building activities covered by risk groups specified in Paragraph 1.1.1 and described in Table 1.1.
LRML: if(and(obligation(complyWith(building, or(nzbc_c1, nzbc_c2, nzbc_c3, nzbc_c5, nzbc_c6))), asPer(building.riskGroup, table), equal(table.key, t1.1), asPer(building.riskGroup, rule), equal(rule.key, 1.1.1))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.fireProtection, nzbc_cas2)))

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; For risk group SH, please refer to Acceptable Solution C/AS1.
LRML: if(obligation(is(building.riskGroup, sh))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.fireProtection, nzbc_cas1)))

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; For backcountry huts, please refer to Acceptable Solution BCH/AS1.
LRML: if(obligation(is(building.activity, backcountryHut))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.fireProtection, nzbc_bchas1)))

TEXT: 1.1.1 The scope of this Acceptable Solution is restricted to all risk groups listed in Table 1.1 except for risk group SH (refer to C/AS1).
LRML: if(and(asPer(building.riskGroup, table), equal(table.key, t1.1), not(is(building.riskGroup, sh)))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.fireProtection, nzbc_cas2)))

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Sleep (SM).
LRML: if(or(is(building.activity, sleeping), equal(building.riskGroup, sm))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.fireProtection, nzbc_cas2)))

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Are unable to self-evacuate without assistance through requiring special care or treatment, or they are restrained, or their liberties are restricted (SI).
LRML: if(or(is(building.activity, or(care, detention)), equal(building.riskGroup, si))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.fireProtection, nzbc_cas2)))

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Congregate, participate in group activities or where professional services or retail are provided (CA).
LRML: if(or(is(building.activity, or(crowd, educational, personalService)), equal(building.riskGroup, ca))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.fireProtection, nzbc_cas2)))

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Work (WB - Business, professional services, industrial).
LRML: if(or(is(building.activity, or(business, professionalService, industrial)), equal(building.riskGroup, wb))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.fireProtection, nzbc_cas2)))

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Store goods and other materials (WS - Storage and trade service).
LRML: if(or(is(building.activity, or(storage, tradeService)), equal(building.riskGroup, ws))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.fireProtection, nzbc_cas2)))

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Park vehicles (VP).
LRML: if(or(is(building.activity, vehicleParking), equal(building.riskGroup, vp))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.fireProtection, nzbc_cas2)))

TEXT: 1.2.2 If a building contains a number of different activities which individually may be categorised in different risk groups, the risk group designated for the building shall be that of the primary risk group.
LRML: if(and(greaterThan(count(building.activity), 1), loop(in(max(activity.riskGroup), building), define(riskGroup.stringency, x0)))), then(obligation(is(building.riskGroup, x0)))

TEXT: If a building contains a number of different activities which individually may be categorised in different risk groups, the risk group designated for a particular firecell within a building shall be that of the primary risk group.
LRML: if(and(greaterThan(count(firecell.activity), 1), loop(in(max(activity.riskGroup), firecell), define(riskGroup.stringency, x0)))), then(obligation(is(firecell.riskGroup, x0)))

TEXT: 1.2.2 If a building contains a number of different activities which individually may be categorised in different risk groups, the risk group designated for a particular room within a building shall be that of the primary risk group.
LRML: if(and(greaterThan(count(space.activity), 1), loop(in(max(activity.riskGroup), space), define(riskGroup.stringency, x0)))), then(obligation(is(space.riskGroup, x0)))

TEXT: Other risk groups may be able to be incorporated within the same space provided these are ancillary to, and support, the primary risk groups.
LRML: if(and(is(space.activity, ancillary), partOf(space, firecell), is(firecell.riskGroup, primaryRiskGroup))), then(obligation(is(space.riskGroup, primaryRiskGroup)))

TEXT: 1.2.3 Depending on the particular building and the uses or activities within that building, there may be several primary risk groups, with one or more on each floor.
LRML: if(has(building, primaryRiskGroup)), then(permission(greaterThan(count(primaryRiskGroup), 1)))

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.6 Floors shall have an FRR for exposure from the underside.
LRML: if(is(building.element, floor)), then(obligation(has(undersideOf(floor), fireResistanceRating)))

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.7 The FRR of a primary element integral with a fire separation shall be no less than that of the fire separation.
LRML: if(and(is(building.element, primary), integralWith(building.element, fireSeparation), define(fireSeparation.fireResistanceRating, x0))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(fireResistanceRating.element, x0)))

TEXT: 2.3.11 Structural framing members connected to building elements with an FRR shall be rated at no less than the building elements to which they are connected. Alternatively their connections and supports shall be designed so that their collapse during fire will not cause collapse of the fire rated elements.
LRML: if(and(define(building.element, x0), adjoin(x0, structuralFramingMember), define(x0.fireResistanceRating, x1))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(structuralFramingMember.fireResistanceRating, x1)))

TEXT: 3.1.1 All buildings shall have means of escape from fire which include escape routes. An escape route (see Figure 3.1) shall provide protection to any occupant escaping to a safe place from a fire within a building.
LRML: if(and(in(fire, building), has(building, occupant))), then(and(obligation(has(occupant, meansOfEscape)), obligation(include(meansOfEscape, escapeRoute)), obligation(to(escapeRoute, safePlace))))

TEXT: 3.1.2 The components of an escape route, in ascending order of protection, are the: a) Open paths, and b) Exitways (these may comprise of smoke lobbies and safe paths), and c) Final exits (see Figure 3.1).
LRML: if(and(include(escapeRoute.component, and(openPath, exitway, finalExit)), define(openPath.degreeOfProtection, x0), define(exitway.degreeOfProtection, x1), define(finalExit.degreeOfProtection, x2))), then(and(obligation(lessThan(x0, x1)), obligation(lessThan(x1, x2)), greaterThan(count(escapeRoute.component), 1)))

TEXT: 3.1.2 The components of an escape route are the: Exitways (these may comprise of smoke lobbies and safe paths).
LRML: if(is(escapeRoute.component, exitway)), then(or(obligation(is(exitway, or(smokeLobby, safePath))), obligation(is(exitway, and(smokeLobby, safePath)))))

TEXT: 3.1.2 The components of an escape route, in ascending order of protection, are from: a) Open paths, to c) Final exits (see Figure 3.1).
LRML: if(and(define(escapeRoute.origin, x0), define(escapeRoute.destination, x1), define(x0.degreeOfProtection, x2), define(x1.degreeOfProtection, x3))), then(obligation(greaterThan(x3, x2)))

TEXT: 3.1.3 Provided the allowable lengths of open paths (Table 3.2) are not exceeded, an escape route may comprise only an open path and final exit.
LRML: if(and(complyWith(openPath.length, table), equal(table.key, t3.2))), then(permission(include(escapeRoute.component, and(openPath, finalExit))))

TEXT: 3.1.4 Escape routes shall comply with NZBC D1.
LRML: if(in(escapeRoute, building)), then(obligation(complyWith(escapeRoute, nzbc_d1)))

TEXT: Ramps, stairs, ladders, landings, handrails, doors, vision panels and openings shall comply with Acceptable Solution D1/AS1.
LRML: if(is(building.element, or(ramp, stair, ladder, landing, handrail, door, visionPanel, opening))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.element, nzbc_d1as1)))

TEXT: 3.2.1 Except where Paragraph 3.13 allows the use of single escape routes, every occupied space in a building shall be served by two or more escape routes (see Figure 3.2).
LRML: if(and(define(count(escapeRoute), x0), greaterThan(x0, 1), complyWith(x0, rule), equal(rule.key, 3.13))), then(loop(greaterThanEqual(forEach(space.occupantLoad), 1), obligation(greaterThanEqual(count(escapeRoute), 2))))

TEXT: 4.1.1 Adjoining firecells are required to be fire separated from each other by the highest: a) Life rating specified in Paragraph 2.3 if both firecells are under common ownership, or b) Property rating specified in Paragraph 2.3 if both firecells are under different ownership.
LRML: if(and(adjoin(space1, space2), is(space1, firecell), is(space2, firecell), define(space1.owner, x0), define(space2.owner, x1))), then(and(loop(max(fireSeparation.rating), or(and(obligation(is(fireSeparation.rating, lifeRating)), equal(x0, x1)), and(is(fireSeparation.rating, propertyRating), not(equal(x0, x1))))), asPer(lifeRating, rule), asPer(propertyRating, rule), equal(rule.key, 2.3.0)))

TEXT: 1.0.1 This acceptable solution applies to below ground and above ground piped water supply systems.
LRML: if(is(pipedWaterSupplySystem.type, or(belowGround, aboveGround))), then(obligation(complyWith(pipedWaterSupplySystem, nzbc_g12as1)))

TEXT: Piped water supply systems 2.1.1 Components of the water supply system shall not contaminate potable water.
LRML: if(has(pipedWaterSupplySystem, component)), then(prohibition(not(by(potableWater.contamination, component))))

TEXT: Piped water supply systems 2.2.1 Pipe and pipe fitting materials shall comply with Table 1.
LRML: if(is(pipedWaterSupplySystem.component, or(pipe, pipeFitting))), then(and(obligation(complyWith(pipe.material, nzbc_g12as1_t1)), obligation(complyWith(pipeFitting.material, nzbc_g12as1_t1))))

TEXT: Water tanks in roof spaces shall be located and supported as detailed in Figure 4.
LRML: if(in(waterTank, roofSpace)), then(and(obligation(complyWith(waterTank.location, nzbc_g12as1_f4)), obligation(complyWith(waterTank.support, nzbc_g12as1_f4))))

LRML: if(has(pipedWaterSupplySystem, potableWaterTank)), then(obligation(has(potableWaterTank, cover)))

LRML: if(and(has(pipedWaterSupplySystem, waterTank), is(waterTank.location, roofSpace))), then(obligation(has(waterTank, cover)))

TEXT: Covers to water tanks shall be removable or shall contain a covered opening to allow access for inspection and maintenance. A minimum height clearance of 350 mm above the opening is necessary for easy access.
LRML: if(has(waterTank, cover)), then(or(obligation(is(cover, removable)), and(obligation(has(cover, coveredOpening)), obligation(is(coveredOpening.heightClearance, 350 mm)))))

TEXT: Piped water supply system; The method illustrated in Figure 4 is acceptable for water tanks up to 150 litre capacity and the maximum height to breadth ratio of 1:1.
LRML: if(and(has(pipedWaterSupplySystem, waterTank), lessThanEqual(waterTank.capacity, 150 l), lessThanEqual(waterTank.heightToBreadthRatio, 1.0))), then(complyWith(waterTankSupport, nzbc_g12as1_f4))

TEXT: Piped water supply system; 5.3.1 Pipe sizing; Pipes shall be sized: a) To achieve the flow rates given in Table 3, b) Using the sizes given in Table 4.
LRML: if(has(pipedWaterSupplySystem, pipe)), then(or(obligation(complyWith(pipe.flowRate, nzbc_g12as1_t3)), obligation(complyWith(pipe.size, nzbc_g12as1_t4))))

LRML: if(is(waterHeater.type, storage)), then(obligation(complyWith(waterHeater.drain, nzbc_g12as1_f7)))

TEXT: 6.1.1 Water heaters shall comply with Table 5.
LRML: if(is(waterHeater, true)), then(obligation(complyWith(waterHeater, nzbc_g12as1_t5)))

TEXT: 6.2.1 Storage water heaters shall be supplied with cold water at a pressure not exceeding their working pressure by means of a: a) Water tank, b) Pressure reducing valve, c) Pressure limiting valve, or d) Mains pressure supply.
LRML: if(is(waterHeater.type, storage)), then(and(obligation(has(waterHeater, coldWaterSupply)), obligation(lessThanEqual(coldWaterSupply.pressure, workingPressure)), or(obligation(by(coldWaterSupply.workingPressure, or(waterTank, pressureReducingValve, pressureLimitingValve))), obligation(is(coldWaterSupply, mainsPressureSupply)))))

TEXT: 6.2.2 Storage water heaters supplied by other than a water tank shall include a non-return valve as shown in Figures 7, 8, 9 and 10 to prevent the storage water heater emptying and hot water flowing into the cold water supply and thence from the cold water taps.
LRML: if(and(is(waterHeater.type, storage), has(waterHeater, waterSupply), not(is(waterSupply, waterTank)))), then(and(obligation(has(waterHeater, nonReturnValve)), obligation(complyWith(nonReturnValve, and(nzbc_g12as1_f7, nzbc_g12as1_f8, nzbc_g12as1_f9, nzbc_g12as1_f10)))))

LRML: if(is(waterHeater.type, or(electricStorage, gasStorage))), then(and(obligation(has(waterHeater.temperature, controller)), is(controller, thermostat), loop(in(forEach(unit), waterHeater), obligation(has(unit, thermostat)))))

TEXT: 6.3.2 Open vented storage water heaters shall have a vent pipe complying with Paragraph 6.8.
LRML: if(is(waterHeater.type, openVentedStorage)), then(and(obligation(has(waterHeater, ventPipe)), obligation(complyWith(ventPipe, 'nzbc_g12as1_6.8'))))

TEXT: Water heater system 6.3.3 Valve vented (unvented) systems shall have: a) An expansion control valve b) A vacuum relief valve to prevent collapse of the storage water heater where it is not designed to withstand a full vacuum, and c) Valves complying with Table 6.
LRML: if(is(waterHeaterSystem.type, or(valveVented, unvented))), then(and(obligation(has(waterHeaterSystem, expansionControlValve)), or(obligation(has(waterHeaterSystem, vacuumReliefValve)), obligation(for(waterHeaterSystem.design, fullVacuum))), obligation(complyWith(expansionControlValve, nzbc_g12as1_t6)), obligation(complyWith(vacuumReliefValve, nzbc_g12as1_t6))))

LRML: if(is(waterSupplySystem.type, potable)), then(and(obligation(has(waterSupplySystem, backflowProtection)), obligation(for(backflowProtection, or(water, contaminant)))))

LRML: if(is(backflowProtection.status, inService)), then(obligation(is(backflowProtection, testable)))

LRML: if(and(define(overflowPipe.flowRate, x0), define(inletPipe.flowRate, x1))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(x0, x1)))

LRML: if(is(backflowPreventionDevice, reducedPressureZoneDevice)), then(obligation(complyWith(reducedPressureZoneDevice, nzs_2845_1_12)))

LRML: if(is(backflowPreventionDevice, doubleCheckValveDevice)), then(obligation(complyWith(doubleCheckValveDevice, nzs_2845_1_10)))

TEXT: 1.2.2 Natural ventilation of occupied spaces must be achieved by providing a net openable area of windows or other openings to the outside of no less than 5% of the floor area.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.2.2 Natural ventilation of occupied spaces must be achieved by providing a net openable area of windows or other openings to the outside of no less than 5% of the floor area.
LRML: if(and(is(space.naturalVentilation, true),greaterThan(space.occupantLoad, 0))), then(obligation(and(has(space, wall),is(wall.isExternal, true),has(wall, opening),define(sum(opening.area, x0)),define(space.floorArea, x1),greaterThanEqual(x0, '0.05 * x1'))))
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.2.2 Natural ventilation of occupied spaces must be achieved by providing a net openable area of windows or other openings to the outside of no less than 5% of the floor area.
LRML: if(and(is(space.naturalVentilation, true),greaterThan(space.occupantLoad, 0))), then(obligation(and(has(space, opening),is(opening.isExternal, true),define(sum(opening.netArea, x0)),define(space.floorArea, x1),greaterThanEqual(x0, '0.05 * x1'))))
PARAPHRASE: If a space has natural ventilation and is occupied then the net area of openings to the outside must be greater than 5% of the floor area.
COMMENTS:
Natural ventilation is a precondition. This rule stands only if a natural ventilation was chosen or is required.
Do we need to infer the wall as an intermediate, or just define the opening (Refering to openableElement in IFC).
Do I have all of the logic in the obligation or in the then branch?
Should different notations be used: Objects -> Upper Case, Properties, Lower Case. opening vs openings.
How about nested dot-notations? Difficult to translate back into LRML?
AUTHOR: Stefan

LRML: if(and(for(pipingSystem, industrialLiquidWaste), is(pipingSystem.gravityFlow, possible))), then(obligation(is(pipingSystem.method, gravityFlow)))

COMMENTS: pipingSystem.gravityFlow vs gravityFlow to implement the exception

TEXT: 2.0 Conveyance of industrial liquid waste 2.1.3 Gravity flow pipelines should have sufficient gradient to provide flow velocities that prevent the settlement of entrained solids and grit.
LRML: if(is(pipingSystem.method, gravityFlow)), then(obligation(and(for(pipingSystem.gradient, flowVelocity), prevent(flowVelocity, settlement),is(settlement.type, or(entrainedSolid, grit)))))

is(pipingSystem.method, gravityFlow) vs gravityFlowPipeline
Is assuming there is a mehtod called gravity flow better than extracting the entire phrase?
prevent vs not cause

TEXT: 1.4.2 Storage tanks may be placed below ground provided: a) Precautions are taken to avoid: i) health or safety hazards, ii) corrosion that threatens the integrity of the tank or associated plant, and b) Tanks are designed to withstand the effects of associated loads.
LRML: if(below(storageTank.location, groundLevel)), then(and(obligation(not(cause(storageTank, and(healthHazard, safetyHazard)))), obligation(has(storageTank, corrosionResistance)),obligation(greaterThan(storageTank.designLoad, trueLoad))))

designLoad and trueLoad -> Omniclass: uniformDesignLoad, trueLoad

TEXT: 1.5.1 All materials in contact with industrial liquid waste shall be resistant to corrosion, chemical attack, and any abrasion or physical abuse that can be reasonably expected.
LRML: if(exposedTo(material, industrialLiquidWaste)), then(obligation(has(material, and(corrosionResistance, chemicalAttackResistance, abrasionResistance, physicalAbuseResistance))))

chemicalAttackResistance - omniclass: chemicalResistance
physicalAbuseResistance - omniclass: impactResistance
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.5.2 Any corrosion allowance provided in the design of equipment handling liquid waste shall be adequate for the intended life of the facilities.

intended life - omniclass: expectedLifeSpan
adquate to - similarTo

TEXT: 1.8.1 Vehicle access areas for the collection of industrial liquid waste shall: where possible, access layout shall provide sufficient space for vehicles to drive in and out of the facility without reversing or interference with other activities on the site.

TEXT: 4.0.1 Where waste chutes with side-entry hoppers (see Figure 2) are used as an alternative to common storage areas, the chute shall: a) Have a minimum internal diameter of 450 mm, b) Be self-cleaning, vertical and have smooth joints, c) Be vented at the top above the roof line, and at the bottom above the container, and d) Terminate centrally over a suitable container located in a room complying with Paragraphs 3.0.1 to 3.0.9.

TEXT: 4.0.2 Side-entry hoppers (see Figure 2) shall: a) Have a maximum opening diameter of 250 mm, b) Have self-closing, tight-fitting doors to prevent odours escaping, c) Have an easily cleaned wall surface surrounding the opening for 300 mm (this may be galvanised steel, ceramic tiles or similar material), d) Be located outside any dwelling or enclosed stair access, and away from any habitable space or food preparation area, and e) Have adequate ventilation, preferably by being located in the open air (e.g. on an outside balcony). Where hoppers are inside buildings, they shall be located in separate ventilated compartments complying with NZBC G4.
LRML: if(exist(sideEntryHopper)), then(and(obligation(lessThanEqual(opening.diameter, 250 mm)), obligation(has(sideEntryHopper, door)), obligation(is(door.operationType, selfClosing)), obligation(is(door.installationType, tightFitting)), obligation(is(wall.surfaceFinish, easilyCleaned)), permission(is(surface.material, galvanisedSteelSheet)), obligation(not(is(sideEntryHopper.location, and(dwelling, enclosedStairAccess)))), obligation(not(adjacent(sideEntryHopper.location, and(habitableSpace, foodPreparationArea)))), obligation(is(ventilation.level, adequate)), or(obligation(is(sideEntryHopper.location, openAir)), and(obligation(is(sideEntryHopper.location, ventilatedCompartment)), loop(forEach(ventilatedCompartment), obligation(is(count(sideEntryHopper), 1))), obligation(complyWith(sideEntryHopper, nzbc_g4))))))

TEXT: 1.0.1 The method of solid waste disposal in multi-unit and group dwellings shall be by the provision of moveable containers having a capacity of at least 80 litres for each dwelling unit.

TEXT: G15 Solid waste 1.0.3 If a common storage area such as a ground floor rubbish area is provided within the building, it shall be adequately ventilated to the open air in compliance with NZBC G4.

TEXT: 3.0.9 Mechanical ventilation: Where mechanical ventilation is used, it shall: a) Provide no less than 6 air changes per hour, b) Maintain a negative pressure within the storage area relative to adjacent areas (if any), and c) Discharge foul air to a safe place to avoid the likelihood of exhaust air entering any building.

TEXT: 3.0.9 Mechanical ventilation: Where mechanical ventilation is used, it shall: a) Provide no less than 6 air changes per hour, b) Maintain a negative pressure within the storage area relative to adjacent areas (if any), and c) Discharge foul air to a safe place to avoid the likelihood of exhaust air entering any building.

Ventilation rate added.
align negateive pressure relative to adjacent areas to uniclas: absoluteAirPressure

TEXT: Water heater system 6.3.3 Valve vented (unvented) systems shall have: a) An expansion control valve b) A vacuum relief valve to prevent collapse of the storage water heater where it is not designed to withstand a full vacuum, and c) Valves complying with Table 6.

PARAPHRASE: Where any fixture or tank has more than one inlet pipe, the air gap separation shall be greater than 25 mm and greater than twice the sum of the inlet pipe diameters and shall also comply with G12/AS1 3.5.2.

TEXT: 3.4.6 All backflow prevention devices must be testable in service to verify effective performance.

TEXT: Piped Water Supply System 3.7.2 Reduced pressure zone devices shall be tested and verified as meeting the test requirements of AS 2845.3 or NZ backflow testing standard.

TEXT: Piped Water Supply System 3.7.2 Double check valves shall be tested and verified as meeting the test requirements of AS 2845.3 or NZ backflow testing standard.

TEXT: Piped Water Supply System 3.7.2 Pressure vacuum breakers shall be tested and verified as meeting the test requirements of AS 2845.3 or NZ backflow testing standard.

TEXT: 5.1.1 To ensure the health and safety of people in the event of the water main supply being interrupted, buildings having the classification of Community Care (e.g. hospitals, old people's homes, prisons) shall be provided with cold water storage of no less than 50 litres per person.
LRML: if(is(building.classifiedUse, communityCare)), then(and(obligation(has(building, coldWaterStorage)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(coldWaterStorage.capacity, 50 l/person))))
PARAPHRASE: Buildings having the classification of Community Care shall be provided with cold water storage with a capacity of no less than 50 litres per person.

TEXT: 1.1.1 Where a building has not been specifically designed to support a solar water heater, this Acceptable Solution can be used for the support and fixing of a solar collector on buildings that meet the structural requirements specified in any one of the following: • NZS 3604: 1990 • NZS 3604: 1999 • NZS 3604: 2011 • NZS 4203 • AS/NZS 1170: Parts 0, 1, 2, 3 and NZS 1170: Part 5. But only when all of the following requirements are met: a) the weight of solar collector, including frames, fittings, and heat transfer fluid, has a combined weight of no more than 22 kg per square metre (based on the gross area of the solar collector), and b) the hot water storage tank is not installed on or above the roof.
LRML: if(and(not(for(building.specificDesign, solarWaterHeater)), on(solarCollector.installation, building), complyWith(building.structure, or(nzs_3604_1990, nzs_3604_1999, nzs_3604_2011, nzs_4203, nzs_1170_0, nzs_1170_1, nzs_1170_2, nzs_1170_3, nzs_1170_5)),include(solarCollector.combinedWeight, and(frame, fitting, heatTransferFluid)), define(solarCollector.combinedWeight, x0), define(solarCollector.grossArea, x4),lessThanEqual(solarCollector.combinedWeight, '22 kg * x4'), not(on(hotWaterStorageVessel.installation, roof)), not(above(hotWaterStorageVessel.installation, roof)))), then(and(permission(complyWith(solarCollector.support, nzbc_g12as2)), permission(complyWith(solarCollector.fixing, nzbc_g12as2))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building has not been specifically designed for a solar water heater, but the solar collector is on the building and the buildings structure complies with NZS 3604: 1990, NZS 3604: 1999, NZS 3604: 2011, NZS 4203, AS/NZS 1170: Parts 0, 1, 2, 3 or NZS 1170: Part 5. And only if the weight of solar collector, including frames, fittings, and heat transfer fluid, is no more than 22 kg per square metre (based on the gross area of the solar collector), and if the hot water storage tank is not installed on or above the roof. Then the support and fixing of a solar collector may comply with G12/AS2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Water heater system 6.3.3 Valve vented (unvented) systems shall have: a) An expansion control valve b) A vacuum relief valve to prevent collapse of the storage water heater where it is not designed to withstand a full vacuum, and c) Valves complying with Table 6.

TEXT: 6.6.2 Pressure relief valves and expansion control valves shall have: a) A flow rate capacity of no less than the rate of cold water supply, and b) A maximum pressure rating of no more than the working pressure of the hot water storage vessel.

QUESTIONABLE

TEXT: 6.6.3 Expansion control valves shall have a pressure rating of no less than that of the water supply pressure to the storage water heater, but less than the pressure rating of the relief valve.
LRML: if(has(storageWaterHeater, expansionControlValve)), then(and(obligation(and(has(storageWaterHeater, waterSupply),define(waterSupply.pressure, x0),greaterThanEqual(expansionControlValve.pressureRating, x0))), obligation(and(has(storageWaterHeater, reliefValve),define(reliefValve.pressureRating, x1),lessThan(expansionControlValve.pressureRating, x1))))

TEXT: Piped water supply system; Pipes penetrating concrete or masonry elements shall be either wrapped with a flexible material, or passed through a sleeve or duct, to permit free movement for expansion and contraction.
LRML: if(and(has(pipedWaterSupplySystem, pipe), into(pipe, element), is(element.material, or(concrete, masonry)))), then(or(and(obligation(and(has(pipe, wrapping),is(wrapping.material, flexible))), ), obligation(inBetween(sleeve, and(element, pipe))), obligation(inBetween(duct, and(element, pipe)))))
PARAPHRASE: Pipes penetrating concrete or masonry elements shall be either wrapped with a flexible material, or passed through a sleeve or duct, to permit free movement for expansion and contraction.
AUTHOR: Stefan

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.1 Where a building has not been specifically designed to support a solar water heater, this Acceptable Solution can be used for the support and fixing of a solar collector on buildings that meet the structural requirements specified in any one of the following: • NZS 3604: 1990 • NZS 3604: 1999 • NZS 3604: 2011 • NZS 4203 • AS/NZS 1170: Parts 0, 1, 2, 3 and NZS 1170: Part 5. But only when all of the following requirements are met: a) the weight of solar collector, including frames, fittings, and heat transfer fluid, has a combined weight of no more than 22 kg per square metre (based on the gross area of the solar collector), and b) the hot water storage tank is not installed on or above the roof.
LRML: if(and(not(for(building.design, solarWaterHeater)), on(solarCollector.installation, building), complyWith(building.structure, or(nzs_3604_1990, nzs_3604_1999, nzs_3604_2011, nzs_4203, nzs_1170_0, nzs_1170_1, nzs_1170_2, nzs_1170_3, nzs_1170_5)), define(solarCollector.weight, x0), define(frame.weight, x1), define(fitting.weight, x2), define(heatTransferFluid.weight, x3), equal(combinedWeight, 'x0 + x1 + x2 + x3'), define(solarCollector.grossArea, x4), equal(weight.perUnitArea, 'combinedWeight / x4'), lessThanEqual(weight.perUnitArea, 22 kg), not(on(hotWaterStorageTank.installation, roof)), not(above(hotWaterStorageTank.installation, roof)))), then(and(permission(complyWith(solarCollector.support, nzbc_g12as2)), permission(complyWith(solarCollector.fixing, nzbc_g12as2))))
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.1 Where a building has not been specifically designed to support a solar water heater, this Acceptable Solution can be used for the support and fixing of a solar collector on buildings that meet the structural requirements specified in any one of the following: • NZS 3604: 1990 • NZS 3604: 1999 • NZS 3604: 2011 • NZS 4203 • AS/NZS 1170: Parts 0, 1, 2, 3 and NZS 1170: Part 5. But only when all of the following requirements are met: a) the weight of solar collector, including frames, fittings, and heat transfer fluid, has a combined weight of no more than 22 kg per square metre (based on the gross area of the solar collector), and b) the hot water storage tank is not installed on or above the roof.
LRML: if(and(not(for(building.specificDesign, solarWaterHeater)), on(solarCollector.installation, building), complyWith(building.structure, or(nzs_3604_1990, nzs_3604_1999, nzs_3604_2011, nzs_4203, nzs_1170_0, nzs_1170_1, nzs_1170_2, nzs_1170_3, nzs_1170_5)),include(solarCollector.combinedWeight, and(frame, fitting, heatTransferFluid)), define(solarCollector.combinedWeight, x0), define(solarCollector.grossArea, x4),lessThanEqual(solarCollector.combinedWeight, '22 kg/m2 * x4'), not(on(hotWaterStorageVessel.installation, roof)), not(above(hotWaterStorageVessel.installation, roof)))), then(and(permission(complyWith(solarCollector.support, nzbc_g12as2)), permission(complyWith(solarCollector.fixing, nzbc_g12as2))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building has not been specifically designed for a solar water heater, but the solar collector is on the building and the buildings structure complies with NZS 3604: 1990, NZS 3604: 1999, NZS 3604: 2011, NZS 4203, AS/NZS 1170: Parts 0, 1, 2, 3 or NZS 1170: Part 5. And only if the weight of solar collector, including frames, fittings, and heat transfer fluid, is no more than 22 kg per square metre (based on the gross area of the solar collector), and if the hot water storage tank is not installed on or above the roof. Then the support and fixing of a solar collector may comply with G12/AS2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

PARAPHRASE: If material is used to install the solar water heater, the material must: a) meet the durability requirements of NZBC Clause B2, and b) be suitable for their use, location and environment as shown in G12/AS2 Table 1, and c) be compatible with adjoining materials as shown in G12/AS2 Table 2, and d) be compatible with materials subject to run-off as shown in G12/AS2 Table 3 and not as described in G12/AS2 Paragraph 2.1.2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Solar Water Heaters 2.1.4 Table 2 shows that galvanized fixings must be used rather than stainless steel when in contact with galvanized cladding and zinc-aluminium-magnesium (combinations) coated cladding. (This includes mounting brackets and straps.).
LRML: if(and(has(solarWaterHeater, fixing), adjoin(fixing, or(galvanisedCladding, zincAluminiumMagnesiumCoatedCladding)))), then(obligation(and(is(fixing.material, galvanised),asPer(fixing.material, nzbc_g12a2_t2))))
PARAPHRASE: If the solar water heater's fixings are in contact with galvanized cladding and zinc-aluminium-magnesium coated cladding, galvanized fixings shall be used as per G12/AS2 Table 2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.2.3 A solar water heater which meets the requirements described in Paragraphs 3.2.1 and/or 3.2.2 satisfies NZBC Clause H1.3.4.
LRML: if(complyWith(solarWaterHeater, or('nzbc_g12as2_3.2.1', 'nzbc_g12as2_3.2.2'))), then(complyWith(solarWaterHeater, 'nzbc_h1_3.4'))
PARAPHRASE: If a solar water heater meets the requirements described in G12/AS2 Paragraphs 3.2.1 or 3.2.2, the solar water heater satisfies NZBC Clause H1 3.4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.3.1 Solar water heaters must have a minimum of 50 litres of hot water storage per square metre of collector area.
LRML: if(has(solarWaterHeater, solarCollector)), then(and(obligation(and(has(solarWaterHeater, hotWaterStorage),define(solarCollector.area, x0), is(x0.unit, m2), greaterThanEqual(hotWaterStorage.capacity, '50 l * x0')))))
PARAPHRASE: If a solar water heaters has a collector must have a minimum of 50 litres of hot water storage per square metre of collector area.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.3.1 Solar water heaters must have a minimum of 50 litres of hot water storage per square metre of collector area.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(and(obligation(and(has(solarWaterHeater, hotWaterStorage),has(solarWaterHeater, solarCollector),define(solarCollector.area, x0), greaterThanEqual(hotWaterStorage.capacity, '50 l/m2 * x0')))))
PARAPHRASE: A solar water heater must have a minimum of 50 litres of hot water storage per square metre of collector area.

collector - buvo: solarCollector
infer capacity - : ifc property: waterStorageCapacity

TEXT: 6.1 Water heaters 6.5.2 Energy cut-off devices shall be designed to: b) Disconnect the energy supply before the water temperature exceeds 95°C.
LRML: if(has(waterHeater, energyCutoffDevice)), then(obligation(and(has(energyCutoffDevice.design, energySupplyDisconnect),define(greaterThan(waterHeater.waterTemperature, 90 degC), x0),before(x0, energySupplyDisconnect))))
PARAPHRASE: If a water heater has an energy cut-off device, the energy cut-off device shall be designed to: b) Disconnect the energy supply before the waterHeater's water temperature exceeds 95°C.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
energySupplyDisconnect - omniclass: electricalDisconnect (Different meaning though)
Nested function in define.

TEXT: 6.6.3 Expansion control valves shall have a pressure rating of no less than that of the water supply pressure to the storage water heater, but less than the pressure rating of the relief valve.
LRML: if(has(storageWaterHeater, expansionControlValve)), then(and(obligation(and(has(storageWaterHeater, waterSupply),define(waterSupply.pressure, x0),greaterThanEqual(expansionControlValve.pressureRating, x0))), obligation(and(has(storageWaterHeater, reliefValve),define(reliefValve.pressureRating, x1),lessThan(expansionControlValve.pressureRating, x1)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a storage water heater has an expansion control valves, the expansion control valves shall have a pressure rating of no less than that of the water supply pressure to the storage water heater, but the expansion control valves shall have a pressure rating less than the pressure rating of the relief valve.

TEXT: 6.6.4 The following valves shall have an energy rating greater than that of the energy sources heating the water: Temperature/pressure relief valve.
LRML: if(has(waterHeater, temperaturePressureReliefValve)), then(and(obligation(and(has(waterHeater, energySource), define(energySource.energyRating, x0), greaterThan(temperaturePressureReliefValve.energyRating, x0)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the water heater has a Temperature/pressure relief valve, the valve shall have an energy rating greater than that of the energy sources of the water heater.

TEXT: Pressure relief valves shall be located no further than 1 metre from the storage water heater.
LRML: if(and(has(storageWaterHeater, pressureReliefValve))), then( obligation(and(define(storageWaterHeater.location, x0),lessThanEqual(pressureReliefValve.location, 'x0 + 1 m'))))
PARAPHRASE: Pressure relief valves shall be located no further than 1 metre from the storage water heater.

TEXT: 7.0.1 Water supply systems shall be installed to comply with the durability requirements of NZBC B2.
LRML: if(exist(waterSupplySystem)), then(obligation(complyWith(waterSupplySystem.installation, nzbc_b2_durabilityRequirements)))
PARAPHRASE: Water supply systems shall be installed to comply with the durability requirements of NZBC B2.

TEXT: Pipes penetrating concrete or masonry elements shall be either wrapped with a flexible material, or passed through a sleeve or duct, to permit free movement for expansion and contraction.
LRML: if(and(into(pipe, element), is(element.material, or(concrete, masonry)))), then(or(obligation(and(has(pipe, wrapping),is(wrapping.material, flexible))), obligation(through(pipe, and(sleeve, duct)))))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes go into concrete or masonry elements, the pipes shall be either wrapped with a flexible material, or passed through a sleeve or duct.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 7.1.1 Pipes and their supports shall be electrochemically compatible.
LRML: if(has(pipe, support)), then(obligation(and(inBetween(compatibility, and(pipe, support)),is(compatibility.type, electrochemical))))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes have support, the pipes and supports shall be electrochemically compatible.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Piped water supply system; 7.4.1 An acceptable method of installing uPVC pipe is given in NZS 7643.
LRML: if(is(pipe.material, uPvc)), then(permission(asPer(pipe.installation, nzs_7643)))
PARAPHRASE: The installation of uPVC pipe may follow NZS 7643.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.0.2 To comply with this Acceptable Solution solar water heaters must also comply with the appropriate requirements of G12/AS1.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(obligation(complyWith(solarWaterHeater, nzbc_g12as1)))
PARAPHRASE: Solar water heaters must comply with G12/AS1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Solar water heater; This Acceptable Solution meets the requirements of NZBC Clauses B1, B2, E2, G12 and H1.
LRML: if(complyWith(solarWaterHeater, nzbc_g12as2)), then(complyWith(solarWaterHeater, and(nzbc_b1, nzbc_b2, nzbc_e2, nzbc_g12, nzbc_h1)))
PARAPHRASE: If a solar water heater complies with G12/AS2, it complies with NZBC Clauses B1, B2, E2, G12 and H1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.1 Where a building has not been specifically designed to support a solar water heater, this Acceptable Solution can be used for the support and fixing of a solar collector on buildings that meet the structural requirements specified in any one of the following: • NZS 3604: 1990 • NZS 3604: 1999 • NZS 3604: 2011 • NZS 4203 • AS/NZS 1170: Parts 0, 1, 2, 3 and NZS 1170: Part 5. But only when all of the following requirements are met: a) the weight of solar collector, including frames, fittings, and heat transfer fluid, has a combined weight of no more than 22 kg per square metre (based on the gross area of the solar collector), and b) the hot water storage tank is not installed on or above the roof.
LRML: if(and(not(for(building.design, solarWaterHeater)), on(solarCollector.installation, building), complyWith(building.structure, or(nzs_3604_1990, nzs_3604_1999, nzs_3604_2011, nzs_4203, nzs_1170_0, nzs_1170_1, nzs_1170_2, nzs_1170_3, nzs_1170_5)), define(solarCollector.weight, x0), define(frame.weight, x1), define(fitting.weight, x2), define(heatTransferFluid.weight, x3), equal(combinedWeight, 'x0 + x1 + x2 + x3'), define(solarCollector.grossArea, x4), equal(weight.perUnitArea, 'combinedWeight / x4'), lessThanEqual(weight.perUnitArea, 22 kg), not(on(hotWaterStorageTank.installation, roof)), not(above(hotWaterStorageTank.installation, roof)))), then(and(permission(complyWith(solarCollector.support, nzbc_g12as2)), permission(complyWith(solarCollector.fixing, nzbc_g12as2))))
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.1 Where a building has not been specifically designed to support a solar water heater, this Acceptable Solution can be used for the support and fixing of a solar collector on buildings that meet the structural requirements specified in any one of the following: • NZS 3604: 1990 • NZS 3604: 1999 • NZS 3604: 2011 • NZS 4203 • AS/NZS 1170: Parts 0, 1, 2, 3 and NZS 1170: Part 5. But only when all of the following requirements are met: a) the weight of solar collector, including frames, fittings, and heat transfer fluid, has a combined weight of no more than 22 kg per square metre (based on the gross area of the solar collector), and b) the hot water storage tank is not installed on or above the roof.
LRML: if(and(not(for(building.specificDesign, solarWaterHeater)), on(solarCollector.installation, building), complyWith(building.structure, or(nzs_3604_1990, nzs_3604_1999, nzs_3604_2011, nzs_4203, nzs_1170_0, nzs_1170_1, nzs_1170_2, nzs_1170_3, nzs_1170_5)),include(solarCollector.combinedWeight, and(frame, fitting, heatTransferFluid)), define(solarCollector.combinedWeight, x0), define(solarCollector.grossArea, x4),lessThanEqual(solarCollector.combinedWeight, '22 kg * x4'), not(on(hotWaterStorageTank.installation, roof)), not(above(hotWaterStorageTank.installation, roof)))), then(and(permission(complyWith(solarCollector.support, nzbc_g12as2)), permission(complyWith(solarCollector.fixing, nzbc_g12as2))))
PARAPHRASE:
If a building has not been specifically designed for a solar water heater, but the solar collector is on the building and the buildings structure complies with NZS 3604: 1990, NZS 3604: 1999, NZS 3604: 2011, NZS 4203, AS/NZS 1170: Parts 0, 1, 2, 3 or NZS 1170: Part 5. And only if the weight of solar collector, including frames, fittings, and heat transfer fluid, is no more than 22 kg per square metre (based on the gross area of the solar collector), and if the hot water storage tank is not installed on or above the roof. Then
G12/AS2 can be used for the support and fixing of a solar collector on buildings
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 7.0.1 Water supply systems shall be installed to comply with the durability requirements of NZBC B2.

PARAPHRASE: The durability of water supply systems shall comply with NZBC B2.

TEXT: Where the solar water heater stores potable water and is used as a pre-heater for an instantaneous water heater, either: a) the hot water storage tank connected to the solar collector must be fitted with supplementary heating and a controller operating to meet the conditions outlined in Paragraph 3.5.1, b) the instantaneous water heater must heat all water passing through it to not less than 70°C.
LRML: if(and(has(solarWaterHeater, potableWaterStorage), is(solarWaterHeater, preHeater), for(preHeater, instantaneousWaterHeater))), then(or(obligation(and(connect(solarWaterHeater.solarCollector, hotWaterStorageTank),has(hotWaterStorageTank, and(supplementaryHeating, controller)),complyWith(controller, 'nzbc_g12as2_3.5.1'))), obligation(and(through(water, instantaneousWaterHeater),greaterThanEqual(water.temperature, 70 degC)))))
PARAPHRASE: Where the solar water heater has potable water storage and is used as a pre-heater for an instantaneous water heater, either: a) the hot water storage tank connected to the solar collector must be fitted with supplementary heating and a controller operating to meet the conditions outlined in G12/AS2 Paragraph 3.5.1, b) the water passing through instantaneous water heater must be heated to not less than 70°C.

TEXT: Where the solar water heater stores potable water and is used as a pre-heater for an instantaneous water heater, either: a) the hot water storage tank connected to the solar collector must be fitted with supplementary heating and a controller operating to meet the conditions outlined in Paragraph 3.5.1, b) the instantaneous water heater must heat all water passing through it to not less than 70°C.
LRML: if(and(has(solarWaterHeater, potableWaterStorage), is(solarWaterHeater, preHeater), for(preHeater, instantaneousWaterHeater))), then(or(obligation(and(connect(solarWaterHeater.solarCollector, hotWaterStorageTank),has(hotWaterStorageTank, and(supplementaryHeating, controller)),complyWith(controller, 'nzbc_g12as2_3.5.1'))), obligation(and(through(water, instantaneousWaterHeater),greaterThanEqual(water.temperature, 70 degC)))))
PARAPHRASE: Where the solar water heater has potable water storage and is used as a pre-heater for an instantaneous water heater, either: a) the hot water storage tank connected to the solar collector must be fitted with supplementary heating and a controller operating to meet the conditions outlined in G12/AS2 Paragraph 3.5.1, b) the water passing through instantaneous water heater must be heated to not less than 70°C.

TEXT: 3.0 Solar Water Heater Requirements; For protection from freezing, collectors installed in climate zones 1 and 2 (as shown in Figure 1) must: pass the level 1 test described in AS/NZS 2712 Appendix E, or have an automatic drain-down system.
LRML: if(is(solarCollector.location, or(climateZone_1, climateZone_2))), then(or(obligation(and(test(solarCollector, level_1_test),asPer(level_1_test, nzs_2712_appendixE))), obligation(has(solarCollector, automaticDraindownSystem))))
PARAPHRASE: Solar collectors installed in climate zones 1 and 2 must: pass the level 1 test described in AS/NZS 2712 Appendix E, or have an automatic drain-down system.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.2.1 Solar collectors must face within +/- 90 degrees of geographic north (ie between east and west) to satisfy the requirements of NZBC Clause H1.3.4(a).
LRML: if(exist(solarCollector)), then(obligation(within(solarCollector.orientation,' +/- 90 degreesOfGeographicalNorth')))
PARAPHRASE: Solar collectors must face within +/- 90 degrees of geographic north.

TEXT: 5.0.1 Solar water heaters must be installed in accordance with the requirements of AS/NZS 3500 Part 4, unless modified by this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(or(obligation(complyWith(solarWaterHeater.installation, nzs_3500_4)), obligation(by(nzs_3500_4.modification, nzbc_g12as2))))
PARAPHRASE: Solar water heaters must be installed in accordance with the requirements of AS/NZS 3500 Part 4, unless AS/NZS 3500 Part 4 is modified by G12/AS2.

TEXT: 5.0.2 Water storage tanks that form part of a solar water heater must have drain pipes that: a) have an easily reached isolating valve, and terminate with a cap or plug to empty the vessel for maintenance, or b) terminate outside the building with a cap only.
LRML: if(partOf(waterStorageTank, solarWaterHeater)), then(and(obligation(has(waterStorageTank, drainPipe)), or(and(obligation(and(has(drainPipe, isolatingValve),is(isolatingValve, easilyReached),has(drainPipe.terminationPoint, or(cap, plug)))), and(obligation(by(drainPipe.terminationPoint, cap)), obligation(outside(drainPipe.terminationPoint, building))))))
PARAPHRASE: If water storage tanks are part of a solar water heater, the water storage tank must have drain pipes that: a) have an easily reached isolating valve, and terminate with a cap or plug, or b) terminate outside the building with a cap only.

TEXT: 5.0.2 Water storage tanks that form part of a solar water heater must have drain pipes that: a) have an easily reached isolating valve, and terminate with a cap or plug to empty the vessel for maintenance, or b) terminate outside the building with a cap only.

TEXT: Where the solar water heater stores potable water and is used as a pre-heater for an instantaneous water heater, either: a) the hot water storage tank connected to the solar collector must be fitted with supplementary heating and a controller operating to meet the conditions outlined in Paragraph 3.5.1, b) the instantaneous water heater must heat all water passing through it to not less than 70°C.
LRML: if(and(has(solarWaterHeater, potableWaterStorage), is(solarWaterHeater, preHeater), for(preHeater, instantaneousWaterHeater))), then(or(and(obligation(has(hotWaterStorageVessel, and(supplementaryHeating, controller))), obligation(complyWith(controller, 'nzbc_g12as2_3.5.1'))), and(obligation(is(instantaneousWaterHeater.output, water)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(water.temperature, 70 degC)))))
PARAPHRASE: Where the solar water heater has potable water storage and is used as a pre-heater for an instantaneous water heater, either: a) the hot water storage tank connected to the solar collector must be fitted with supplementary heating and a controller operating to meet the conditions outlined in Paragraph 3.5.1, b) the instantaneous water heater must heat all water passing through it to not less than 70°C.

TEXT: Where the solar water heater stores potable water and is used as a pre-heater for an instantaneous water heater, either: a) the hot water storage tank connected to the solar collector must be fitted with supplementary heating and a controller operating to meet the conditions outlined in Paragraph 3.5.1, b) the instantaneous water heater must heat all water passing through it to not less than 70°C.
LRML: if(and(has(solarWaterHeater, potableWaterStorage), is(solarWaterHeater, preHeater), for(preHeater, instantaneousWaterHeater))), then(or(obligation(and(connect(solarWaterHeater.solarCollector, hotWaterStorageVessel),has(hotWaterStorageVessel, and(supplementaryHeating, controller)),complyWith(controller, 'nzbc_g12as2_3.5.1'))), obligation(and(is(instantaneousWaterHeater.output, water),greaterThanEqual(water.temperature, 70 degC)))))
PARAPHRASE: Where the solar water heater has potable water storage and is used as a pre-heater for an instantaneous water heater, either: a) the hot water storage tank connected to the solar collector must be fitted with supplementary heating and a controller operating to meet the conditions outlined in G12/AS2 Paragraph 3.5.1, b) the instantaneous water heater must heat all water passing through it to not less than 70°C.

TEXT: Where the solar water heater stores potable water and is used as a pre-heater for an instantaneous water heater, either: a) the hot water storage tank connected to the solar collector must be fitted with supplementary heating and a controller operating to meet the conditions outlined in Paragraph 3.5.1, b) the instantaneous water heater must heat all water passing through it to not less than 70°C.
LRML: if(and(has(solarWaterHeater, storage), is(storage.content, potableWater), is(solarWaterHeater.usage, preHeating), for(preHeating.purpose, instantaneousWaterHeater))), then(or(and(obligation(has(hotWaterStorageTank, and(supplementaryHeating, controller))), obligation(complyWith(controller, 'nzbc_g12as2_3.5.1'))), and(obligation(is(instantaneousWaterHeater.output, water)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(water.temperature, 70 degC)))))

TEXT: Where the solar water heater stores potable water and is used as a pre-heater for an instantaneous water heater, either: a) the hot water storage tank connected to the solar collector must be fitted with supplementary heating and a controller operating to meet the conditions outlined in Paragraph 3.5.1, b) the instantaneous water heater must heat all water passing through it to not less than 70°C.

TEXT: 5.2.9 Sealant used in the installation of solar water heaters must be a neutral cure silicone sealant and must be used in conjunction with mechanical fasteners. The sealant must comply with: a) Type F, Class 2OLM or 25LM of ISO 11600, or b) low modulus Type II Class A of Federal Specification TT-S-00230C.
LRML: if(has(solarWaterHeater.installation, sealant)), then(and(obligation(is(sealant.type, neutralCureSilicone)), obligation(adjoin(sealant, mechanicalFastener)), obligation(complyWith(sealant, or(iso_11600_typeF, iso_11600_class_20lm, iso_11600_class_25lm, tts_00230cLowModulusTypeIiClassA)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the installation of solar water heaters uses sealant, the sealant must be a neutral cure silicone sealant and must be used in conjunction with mechanical fasteners. The sealant must comply with: a) Type F of ISO 11600, Class 2OLM of ISO 11600 or Class 25LM of ISO 11600, or b) low modulus Type II Class A of TT-S-00230C.

TEXT: 6.4.2 Solar collectors mounted parallel to the roof that are elevated up to 50 mm above the roof cladding must be supported by: a) underlying purlins conforming to Paragraph 6.4.1 (a) or (b), or b) underlying rafters or trusses with connections conforming with Paragraphs 6.4.1 (a) or (c), or c) collector support rails conforming to Paragraph 6.5.

PARAPHRASE: If solar collectors are orientated parallel to the roof and elevated up to 50 mm above the roof cladding, the solar collector must be supported by: a) underlying purlins conforming to Paragraph 6.4.1 (a) or (b), or b) underlying rafters or trusses with connections conforming with Paragraphs 6.4.1 (a) or (c), or c) collector support rails conforming to Paragraph 6.5.

TEXT: 6.4.2 Solar collectors mounted parallel to the roof that are elevated up to 50 mm above the roof cladding must be supported by: a) underlying purlins conforming to Paragraph 6.4.1 (a) or (b), or b) underlying rafters or trusses with connections conforming with Paragraphs 6.4.1 (a) or (c), or c) collector support rails conforming to Paragraph 6.5.
LRML: if(and(is(solarCollector.orientation, parallel), towards(solarCollector.orientation, roof), above(solarCollector.elevation, roofCladding), lessThanEqual(solarCollector.elevation, 50 mm))), then(or(obligation(and(is(solarCollector.support, underlyingPurlin),complyWith(underlyingPurlin, or('nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.a', 'nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.b')))), obligation(and(is(solarCollector.support, or(underlyingRafter, underlyingTrus)),complyWith(underlyingRafter.connection, or('nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.a', 'nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.c'),complyWith(underlyingTruss.connection, or('nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.a', 'nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.c')))    ),obligation(and(is(solarCollector.support, collectorSupportRail),complyWith(underlyingRafter.connection, or('nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.a', 'nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.c'),complyWith(underlyingTruss.connection, or('nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.a', 'nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.c')))    )))

TEXT: 3.2.1 Under normal operating conditions, fixture traps shall retain a water seal depth of not less than 25 mm (see Figure 1).
LRML: if(is(fixtureTrap.operatingCondition, normal)), then(obligation(and(has(fixtureTrap, waterSeal),greaterThanEqual(waterSeal.depth, 25 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the fixture trap's operating condition is normal, the fixture trap shall retain a water seal depth of not less than 25 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.4.1 Floor waste outlets shall have a removable grating that is flush with the floor.
LRML: if(has(floorWaste, outlet)), then(obligation(and(has(outlet,grating), is(grating,removable),is(removableGrating.location,flushWithfloor))))
PARAPHRASE: If the floor waste has outlets, the outlets shall have a removable grating that is flush with the floor.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.4.2 The floor waste, and the water trap if used, shall have a minimum diameter of 40 mm.
LRML: if(or(exist(floorWaste), exist(waterTrap))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(floorWaste.diameter, 40 mm)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(waterTrap.diameter, 40 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: The floor waste, and the water trap if used, shall have a minimum diameter of 40 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.4.2 The floor waste, and the water trap if used, shall have a minimum diameter of 40 mm.
LRML: if(or(exist(floorWaste), exist(waterTrap))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(floorWaste.diameter, 40 mm)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(waterTrap.diameter, 40 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: The floor waste, and the water trap if used, shall have a minimum diameter of 40 mm.
COMMENTS: TODO: Or in if-statement causes problems for then-statement (or/and?)
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: A floor waste shall: Be trapped, discharge 50 mm above the grating of a gully trap.
LRML: if(exist(floorWaste)), then(and(obligation(has(floorWaste,gullyTrap)),obligation(and(has(gullyTrap,grating),above(floorWaste.discharge,grating),inBetween(distance, and(discharge, grating)),equal(distance,50 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: A floor waste shall have a gully trap and the floor waste shall have discharge 50 mm above the grating of a gully trap.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Floor waste pipes may be combined to form a floor waste stack and shall have a diameter not less than that given in Table 3 (see Figure 3).
LRML: if(and(has(floorWaste, and(pipe, stack)), include(stack, pipe))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(pipe.diameter, value)), obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(pipe.diameter,value),asPer(value,nzbc_g13as1_t3)))))
PARAPHRASE: Floor waste pipes may be combined to form a floor waste stack and shall have a diameter not less than the values given in G13/AS1 Table 3.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Individual floor waste pipes connected to a floor waste stack need not be vented (see Figure 3).
LRML: if(and(has(floorWaste, and(pipe, stack)), connect(pipe, stack))), then(permission(not(is(pipe, vented))))
PARAPHRASE: Individual floor waste pipes connected to a floor waste stack need not be vented (see Figure 3).
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Individual floor waste pipes connected to a floor waste stack need not be vented (see Figure 3).
LRML: if(within(pipe, floorWasteStack)), then(permission(not(has(pipe, ventilation)))))
PARAPHRASE: Individual pipes in a floor waste stack need not be vented.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: All trap charging systems shall incorporate backflow prevention in accordance with G12/AS1.
LRML: if((trapChargingSystem, true)), then(and(obligation(has(trapChargingSystem, backflowPrevention)), obligation(complyWith(backflowPrevention, nzbc_g12as1))))
PARAPHRASE: All trap charging systems shall incorporate backflow prevention in accordance with G12/AS1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: All trap charging systems shall incorporate backflow prevention in accordance with G12/AS1.
LRML: if(exist(trapChargingSystem)), then(and(obligation(has(trapChargingSystem, backflowPrevention)), obligation(complyWith(backflowPrevention, nzbc_g12as1))))
PARAPHRASE: All trap charging systems shall incorporate backflow prevention in accordance with G12/AS1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.4.1 The gradient of discharge pipes shall be not less than that required in Table 4 for the relevant discharge unit loading.
LRML: if(exist(dischargePipe)), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(dischargePipe.gradient,value),asPer(value,nzbc_g13as1_t4))))
PARAPHRASE: The gradient of discharge pipes shall be not less than that required in Table 4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 6.6.3 The edge of the panel elevated above the roof plane is to be supported by hot dip galvanized steel or stainless steel angle struts which are: 30 x 30 x 3 mm angle for struts up to 1.4 m long.
LRML: if(and(is(panel.edge, elevated), above(panel.edge, roof), lessThanEqual(angleStrut.length, 1.4 m))), then(and(obligation(has(panel.edge, support)), obligation(is(support.type, angleStrut)), obligation(is(angleStrut.material, or(hotDipGalvanisedSteel, stainlessSteel))), obligation(equal(angleStrut.width, 30 mm)), obligation(equal(angleStrut.length, 30 mm)), obligation(equal(angleStrut.thickness, 3 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the panel is elevated and above the roof and angle struts are over 1.4 m long, then the edge of the paned is to be supported by hot dip galvanized steel angle struts or stainless steel angle struts which are: a) 30 mm width x 30 mm length x 3 mm thickness.

TEXT: 6.6.3 The edge of the panel elevated above the roof plane is to be supported by hot dip galvanized steel or stainless steel angle struts which are: 40 x 40 x 3 mm angle for struts up to 2.4 m long.
LRML: if(and(is(panel.edge, elevated), above(panel.edge, roof), lessThanEqual(angleStrut.length, 2.4 m))), then(and(obligation(has(panel.edge, support)), obligation(is(support.type, angleStrut)), obligation(is(angleStrut.material, or(hotDipGalvanisedSteel, stainlessSteel))), obligation(equal(angleStrut.width, 40 mm)), obligation(equal(angleStrut.length, 40 mm)), obligation(equal(angleStrut.thickness, 3 mm))))

TEXT: Solar Water Heating System 7.1.1 A permanent label must be fixed to a prominent part of the system which includes all markings required in the appropriate Standard identified in Paragraph 3.1.1.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeatingSystem)), then(obligation(and(has(solarWaterHeatingSystem.part, label),is(label, permanent),is(solarWaterHeatingSystem.part, prominent),is(label.content, marking),asPer(marking, 'nzbc_g12as2_3.1.1'))))
PARAPHRASE: Solar water heating systems shall have a permanent label on a prominent part of the system. The label content has all markings required in the appropriate Standard identified in Paragraph 3.1.1.

TEXT: 7.2.1 Solar water heaters and their components must meet the durability requirements specified in NZBC Clause B2.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(and(obligation(complyWith(solarWaterHeater.durability, nzbc_b2)), obligation(and(has(solarWaterHeater, component),complyWith(component.durability, nzbc_b2)))))
PARAPHRASE: Solar water heaters and their components must meet the durability requirements specified in NZBC Clause B2.

TEXT: 7.2.2 A solar water heater is easy to access and moderately difficult to replace and therefore the durability requirement is 15 years.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(solarWaterHeater.durability, 15 years)))
PARAPHRASE: For a solar water heater the durability requirement is 15 years.

TEXT: 1.0.1 This acceptable solution applies to below ground and above ground piped water supply systems.
LRML: if(is(pipedWaterSupplySystem.type, or(belowGround, aboveGround))), then(applyTo(nzbc_g12as1, pipedWaterSupplySystem))
PARAPHRASE: If a piped water supply systems is below ground or above ground, G12/AS1 applies to the piped water supply systems.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.0.1 This Acceptable Solution applies to solar water heaters installed in or on buildings.
LRML: if(or(within(solarWaterHeater.installation, building), on(solarWaterHeater.installation, building))), then(applyTo(nzbc_g12as2, solarWaterHeater))
PARAPHRASE: If solar water heaters installed in or on buildings, G12/AS2 applies to the solar water heaters.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.0.1 This Acceptable Solution applies to above-ground non-pressure (gravity flow) sanitary plumbing for buildings having 3 levels or less and includes all pipework for foul water within, or on the building, including any basements.
LRML: if(and(lessThanEqual(building.buildingStorey, 3), has(building, sanitaryPlumbing), is(sanitaryPlumbing.type, nonPressure), above(sanitaryPlumbing.location, ground), or(within(foulWaterPipework, building), on(foulWaterPipework, building)))), then(and(obligation(complyWith(sanitaryPlumbing, nzbc_g13as1)), obligation(complyWith(foulWaterPipework, nzbc_g13as1))))
PARAPHRASE: If above-ground non-pressure (gravity flow) sanitary plumbing for buildings having 3 levels or less and includes all pipework for foul water within, or on the building, including any basements.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.0.1 This Acceptable Solution applies to above-ground non-pressure (gravity flow) sanitary plumbing for buildings having 3 levels or less and includes all pipework for foul water within, or on the building, including any basements.
LRML: if(and(is(sanitaryPlumbing, aboveGround), is(sanitaryPlumbing.type, or(nonPressure, gravityFlow)), for(sanitaryPlumbing, building), lessThanEqual(building.buildingStorey, 3),or(within(foulWaterPipework, building), on(foulWaterPipework, building)))), then(and(obligation(complyWith(sanitaryPlumbing, nzbc_g13as1)), obligation(complyWith(foulWaterPipework, nzbc_g13as1))))
PARAPHRASE: If sanitary plumbing is above-ground and non-pressure (gravity flow) sanitary plumbing for buildings having 3 levels or less, G13AS1 applies to the sanitary plumbing and includes all pipework for foul water within, or on the building, including any basements.

TEXT: 2.1.1 Materials for sanitary plumbing systems using gravity flow shall comply with Table 1.
LRML: if(is(sanitaryPlumbingSystem.type, gravityFlow)), then(obligation(complyWith(sanitaryPlumbingSystem.material, nzbc_g13as1_t1)))
PARAPHRASE: If sanitary plumbing uses gravity flow, the material of the sanitary plumbing shall comply with G13/AS1 Table 1.

TEXT: 3.1.1 Discharge points from sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances shall have a water trap to prevent foul air from the plumbing system entering the building.
LRML: if(or(has(sanitaryFixture, dischargePoint),has(sanitaryAppliance, dischargePoint))),then(obligation(has(dischargePoint, waterTrap)))
PARAPHRASE: If sanitary fixtures or sanitary appliances have discharge points, the discharge points shall have a water trap.

TEXT: 3.1.2 Water traps shall be: a) Removable, b) Able to be dismantled, or c) Fitted with a cleaning eye.
LRML: if(exist(waterTrap)), then(obligation(or(is(waterTrap, or(removable, dismantleable)),has(waterTrap, cleaningEye))))
PARAPHRASE: Water traps shall be: a) Removable, b) Able to be dismantled, or c) Fitted with a cleaning eye.

TEXT: 3.1.2 Water traps shall be: a) Removable, b) Able to be dismantled, or c) Fitted with a cleaning eye.
LRML: if(exist(waterTrap)), then(obligation(or(is(waterTrap, or(removable, dismantleable)),has(waterTrap, cleaningEye))))
PARAPHRASE: Water traps shall be removable, able to be dismantled, or fitted with a cleaning eye.

TEXT: 3.1.2 Water traps shall be: a) Removable, b) Able to be dismantled, or c) Fitted with a cleaning eye.
LRML: if(exist(waterTrap)), then(obligation(or(is(waterTrap, or(removable, dismantleable)),has(waterTrap, cleaningEye))))
PARAPHRASE: Water traps shall be removable, able to be dismantled, or have a cleaning eye.

TEXT: 3.2.1 Under normal operating conditions, fixture traps shall retain a water seal depth of not less than 25 mm (see Figure 1).
LRML: if(is(fixtureTrap.operatingCondition, normal)), then(obligation(and(has(fixtureTrap, waterSeal),greaterThanEqual(waterSeal.depth, 25 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the fixture trap's operating condition is normal, the fixture trap shall retain a water seal depth of not less than 25 mm (see Figure 1).

TEXT: 3.2.1 Under normal operating conditions, fixture traps shall retain a water seal depth of not less than 25 mm (see Figure 1).
LRML: if(is(fixtureTrap.operatingCondition, normal)), then(obligation(and(has(fixtureTrap, waterSeal),greaterThanEqual(waterSeal.depth, 25 mm))  ))
PARAPHRASE: If the fixture trap's operating condition is normal, the fixture trap shall retain a water seal depth of not less than 25 mm.

TEXT: 4.5.1 Waste water fixture discharge pipes shall discharge either to: a) A gully trap, in accordance with Figure 5 of G13/AS1 and Figure 3 of G13/AS2, or b) A discharge stack as in Paragraph 4.7 and Figures 7 and 8.

PARAPHRASE: Discharge pipes of waste water fixture shall discharge either to: a) A gully trap, in accordance with Figure 5 of G13/AS1 and Figure 3 of G13/AS2, or b) A discharge stack as in G13/AS1 Paragraph 4.7 and Figures 7 and 8.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 6.4.2 Solar collectors mounted parallel to the roof that are elevated up to 50 mm above the roof cladding must be supported by: a) underlying purlins conforming to Paragraph 6.4.1 (a) or (b), or b) underlying rafters or trusses with connections conforming with Paragraphs 6.4.1 (a) or (c), or c) collector support rails conforming to Paragraph 6.5.

PARAPHRASE: If solar collectors are orientated parallel to the roof and elevated up to 50 mm above the roof cladding, the solar collector must be supported by: a) purlins under the solar collector with the purlins conforming to G12/AS2 Paragraph 6.4.1.a or 6.4.1.b, or b) rafters under the solar collector with the rafter connections conforming with G12/AS2 Paragraphs 6.4.1.a or 6.4.1.c or trusses under the solar collector with the truss connections conforming with G12/AS2 Paragraphs 6.4.1.a or 6.4.1.c, or c) support rails conforming to G12/AS2 Paragraph 6.5.
