TEXT: 3.4.2 The floor waste shall have a minimum diameter of 40 mm.
LRML: if(exist(floorWaste)), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(floorWaste.diameter, 40 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: The floor waste shall have a minimum diameter of 40 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: A floor waste shall: Be trapped, discharge 50 mm above the grating of a gully trap.
LRML: if(exist(floorWaste)), then(and(obligation(has(floorWaste,gullyTrap),),obligation(and(has(gullyTrap,grating),above(floorWaste.discharge,grating),inBetween(distance, and(discharge, grating)),equal(distance,50 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: A floor waste shall have a gully trap and the floor waste shall have discharge 50 mm above the grating of a gully trap.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Floor waste pipes may be combined to form a floor waste stack and shall have a diameter not less than that given in Table 3 (see Figure 3).
LRML: if(has(floorWaste, pipes) ), then(and(permission(is(connect(pipes), floorWasteStack)), obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(pipe.diameter,value),asPer(value,nzbc_g13as1_t3)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the floor waste has pipes, the pipes may be combined to form a floor waste stack and shall have a diameter not less than the values given in G13/AS1 Table 3.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Individual floor waste pipes connected to a floor waste stack need not be vented (see Figure 3).
LRML: if(within(pipe, floorWasteStack)), then(permission(not(has(pipe, ventilation)))))
PARAPHRASE: Individual pipes in a floor waste stack need not be vented.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 6.6.3 The edge of the panel elevated above the roof plane is to be supported by hot dip galvanized steel or stainless steel angle struts which are: a) 25 x 25 x 3 mm angle for struts up to 1.0 m long.
LRML: if(and(is(panel, elevated), above(panel, roof), lessThanEqual(angleStrut.length, 1.0 m))), then(and(obligation(has(panel.edge, support)), obligation(is(support.type, angleStrut)), obligation(is(angleStrut.material, or(hotDipGalvanisedSteel, stainlessSteel))), obligation(equal(angleStrut.width, 40 mm)), obligation(equal(angleStrut.length, 40 mm)), obligation(equal(angleStrut.thickness, 3 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the panel is elevated and above the roof and angle struts are over 1.0 m long, then the edge of the paned is to be supported by hot dip galvanized steel angle struts or stainless steel angle struts which are: a) 25 mm width x 25 mm length x 3 mm thickness.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
Additional rule required which says that angle struts are required.

TEXT: 6.6.3 The edge of the panel elevated above the roof plane is to be supported by hot dip galvanized steel or stainless steel angle struts which are: 40 x 40 x 3 mm angle for struts up to 2.4 m long.
LRML: if(and(is(panel.edge, elevated), above(panel.edge, roof), lessThanEqual(angleStrut.length, 2.4 m))), then(and(obligation(has(panel.edge, support)), obligation(is(support.type, angleStrut)), obligation(is(angleStrut.material, or(hotDipGalvanisedSteel, stainlessSteel))), obligation(equal(angleStrut.width, 40 mm)), obligation(equal(angleStrut.length, 40 mm)), obligation(equal(angleStrut.thickness, 3 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the panel is elevated and above the roof and angle struts are over 2.4 m long, then the edge of the paned is to be supported by hot dip galvanized steel angle struts or stainless steel angle struts which are: a) 40 mm width x 40 mm length x 3 mm thickness.

TEXT: Cuts or holes made in steel after galvanizing are to be protected from corrosion.
LRML: if(and(has(steel, penetration), after(penetration, galvanising))), then(obligation(has(penetration, corrosionProtection)))
PARAPHRASE: If penetrations are made in steel after galvanizing, the penetration are to be protected from corrosion.

TEXT: 7.2.2 A solar water heater is easy to access and moderately difficult to replace and therefore the durability requirement is 15 years.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(solarWaterHeater.durability, 15 years)))
PARAPHRASE: For a solar water heater the durability requirement is 15 years.

TEXT: 1.0.1 This Acceptable Solution applies to above-ground non-pressure (gravity flow) sanitary plumbing for buildings having 3 levels or less and includes all pipework for foul water within, or on the building, including any basements.
LRML: if(and(is(sanitaryPlumbing, aboveGround), is(sanitaryPlumbing.type, or(nonPressure, gravityFlow)), above(sanitaryPlumbing.location, ground), for(sanitaryPlumbing, building), lessThanEqual(building.buildingStorey, 3),or(within(foulWaterPipework, building), on(foulWaterPipework, building)))), then(and(obligation(complyWith(sanitaryPlumbing, nzbc_g13as1)), obligation(complyWith(foulWaterPipework, nzbc_g13as1))))
PARAPHRASE: If sanitary plumbing is above-ground and non-pressure (gravity flow) sanitary plumbing for buildings having 3 levels or less, G13AS1 applies to the sanitary plumbing and includes all pipework for foul water within, or on the building, including any basements.

TEXT: 1.0.2 The solution does not include: a) Specialised types of sanitary fixtures or sanitary appliances used within buildings such as hospitals, laboratories and factories.
LRML: if(and(or(and(is(sanitaryFixture.type, specialised),within(sanitaryFixture, building)),and(is(sanitaryAppliance.type, specialised),within(sanitaryAppliance, building))),similarTo(building.type, or(hospital, laboratory, factory)))), then(and(applyTo(nzbc_g13as1, sanitaryFixture),applyTo(nzbc_g13as1, sanitaryAppliance)))
PARAPHRASE: If specialised types of sanitary fixtures or sanitary appliances are used within buildings such as hospitals, laboratories and factories, then G13/AS1 does not apply to the sanitary fixtures or sanitary appliances.

TEXT: 3.4.1 Floor waste outlets shall have a removable grating that is flush with the floor.

PARAPHRASE: For a solar water heater the durability requirement is 15 years.

TEXT: 1.0.1 This Acceptable Solution applies to above-ground non-pressure (gravity flow) sanitary plumbing for buildings having 3 levels or less and includes all pipework for foul water within, or on the building, including any basements.
LRML: if(and(is(sanitaryPlumbing, aboveGround), is(sanitaryPlumbing.type, or(nonPressure, gravityFlow)), for(sanitaryPlumbing, building), lessThanEqual(building.buildingStorey, 3),)), then(and(applyTo(nzbc_g13as1, sanitaryPlumbing),include(sanitaryPlumbing, pipework),is(pipework.type, foulWater),or(within(pipework, building), on(pipework, building)),include(building, basement)))
PARAPHRASE: If sanitary plumbing is above-ground and non-pressure (gravity flow) sanitary plumbing for buildings having 3 levels or less, G13AS1 applies to the sanitary plumbing and includes all pipework for foul water within, or on the building, including any basements.

TEXT: 1.0.2 The solution does not include: a) Specialised types of sanitary fixtures or sanitary appliances used within buildings such as hospitals, laboratories and factories.
LRML: if(and(include(building, or(sanitaryFixture, sanitaryAppliance)), or(is(sanitaryFixture.type, specialised), is(sanitaryAppliance.type, specialised)), similarTo(building.type, or(hospital, laboratory, factory)))), then(and(prohibition(complyWith(sanitaryFixture, nzbc_g13as1)), prohibition(complyWith(sanitaryAppliance, nzbc_g13as1))))
PARAPHRASE: If specialised types of sanitary fixtures or sanitary appliances used within buildings such as hospitals, laboratories and factories.

TEXT: Sanitary Plumbing 1.0.2 The solution does not include: The conveyance of industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer without pretreatment.
LRML: if(or(for(sanitaryPlumbing, or(industrialLiquidWaste, chemicalWaste, toxicWaste)), and(for(sanitaryPlumbing, waste),towards(waste.discharge, sewer), requires(waste.discharge, pretreatment)))), then(prohibition(complyWith(sanitaryPlumbing.conveyance, nzbc_g13as1)))
PARAPHRASE: If the sanitary plumbing conveys industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer it it has no treatment.

TEXT: Sanitary Plumbing 1.0.2 The solution does not include: The conveyance of industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer without pretreatment.
LRML: if(or(for(sanitaryPlumbing, or(industrialLiquidWaste, chemicalWaste, toxicWaste)), and(for(sanitaryPlumbing, waste),towards(waste.discharge, sewer), requires(waste.discharge, pretreatment)))), then(not(applyTo(nzbc_g13as1, sanitaryPlumbing)))
PARAPHRASE: If the sanitary plumbing conveys industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer it it has no treatment, G13/AS1 does not apply to the sanitary plumbing

TEXT: 3.1.1 Discharge points from sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances shall have a water trap to prevent foul air from the plumbing system entering the building.
LRML: if(or(has(sanitaryFixture, dischargePoint),has(sanitaryAppliance, dischargePoint))),then(obligation(has(dischargePoint, waterTrap)))
PARAPHRASE: Discharge points from sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances shall have a water trap.

TEXT: 3.2.1 Under normal operating conditions, fixture traps shall retain a water seal depth of not less than 25 mm (see Figure 1).
LRML: if(and(is(trap.type, fixture), is(trap.operatingCondition, normal))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(trap.waterSealDepth, 25 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: Under normal operating conditions, fixture traps shall retain a water seal depth of not less than 25 mm (see Figure 1).

TEXT: Floor waste pipes may be combined to form a floor waste stack and shall have a diameter not less than that given in Table 3 (see Figure 3).
LRML: if(has(floorWaste, pipes) ), then(and(permission(and(connect(pipes), include(floorWaste.stack, pipes))), obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(pipe.diameter,value),asPer(value,nzbc_g13as1_t3)))))

TEXT: Floor waste pipes may be combined to form a floor waste stack and shall have a diameter not less than that given in Table 3 (see Figure 3).

TEXT: Below ground 2.1 Fill materials 2.1.1 Fill materials, as shown in Figure 7, shall be: a) Bedding material of clean granular non-cohesive material with a maximum particle size of 20 mm, b) Selected fill of fine-grained soil or granular material that is free from topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm, or c) Ordinary fill of excavated material.
LRML: if(exist(fillMaterial)), then(or(obligation(and(is(fillMaterial,beddingMaterial),is(beddingMaterial, and(clean,granular,nonCohesive)),lessThanEqual(beddingMaterial.size, 20mm))), obligation(and(is(fillMaterial,selectedFill),is(fillMaterial,or(fineGrainedSoil,granularMaterial)),not(include(granularMaterial,or(topsoil,rubbish))),has(fill.material,particle),lessThanEqual(particle.size,20mm))), obligation(and(is(fill.type,ordinary),is(fill.material,excavated)))))
PARAPHRASE: Fill materials shall be: a) Bedding material of clean granular non-cohesive material with a maximum particle size of 20 mm, b) Selected fill of fine-grained soil or granular material that is free from topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm, or c) Ordinary fill of excavated material.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.2.1 Any connection to a drain, excluding vent pipe connections, shall be made by means of sweep or oblique junctions. The angle that the branch makes at the point of entry with the main drain, shall be no greater than 60° (see Figure 1).
LRML: if(and(has(drain, connection), not(is(connection, ventPipe)))), then(and(obligation(is(connection.type, or(sweepJunction, obliqueJunction))), obligation(lessThanEqual(connection.angle, 60 deg))))
PARAPHRASE: Any connection to a drain, excluding vent pipe connections, shall be made by means of sweep or oblique junctions. The angle that the branch makes at the point of entry with the main drain, shall be no greater than 60°.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.0.1 This Acceptable Solution is for below ground non-pressure (gravity flow) foul water drains having a diameter of no greater than 150 mm.
LRML: if(and(for(drain, foulWater), below(drain, ground), is(drain.type, gravityFlow), lessThanEqual(drain.diameter, 150 mm))), then(permission(complyWith(drain, nzbc_g13as2)))
PARAPHRASE: This Acceptable Solution is for below ground non-pressure (gravity flow) foul water drains having a diameter of no greater than 150 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.0.1 This Acceptable Solution is for below ground non-pressure (gravity flow) foul water drains having a diameter of no greater than 150 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(foulWaterDrain, belowGround), is(foulWaterDrain.type, or(nonPressure, gravityFlow)), lessThanEqual(foulWaterDrain.diameter, 150 mm))), then(applyTo(nzbc_g13as2, foulWaterDrain))
PARAPHRASE: This Acceptable Solution is for below ground non-pressure (gravity flow) foul water drains having a diameter of no greater than 150 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.0.2 It does not apply to foul water drainage systems where it is necessary to dispose of industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer without pre-treatment.
LRML: if(and(is(drain.medium, foulWater), or(is(drain.medium, or(indLiquidWaste, chemicalWaste, toxicWaste)), and(is(drain.medium, waste), obligation(has(drain.medium, treatment)), obligation(into(drain.discharge, sewer)))))), then(prohibition(complyWith(drain, nzbc_g13as2)))
PARAPHRASE: It does not apply to foul water drainage systems where it is necessary to dispose of industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer without pre-treatment.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.0.2 It does not apply to foul water drainage systems where it is necessary to dispose of industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer without pre-treatment.
LRML: if(and(is(drain.medium, foulWater), or(is(drain.medium, or(indLiquidWaste, chemicalWaste, toxicWaste)), and(is(drain.medium, waste), obligation(has(drain.medium, treatment)), obligation(into(drain.discharge, sewer)))))), then(prohibition(complyWith(drain, nzbc_g13as2)))
PARAPHRASE:
It does not apply to foul water drainage systems where it is necessary to dispose of industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer without pre-treatment.

If the sanitary plumbing conveys industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer if it has no treatment, G13/AS1 does not apply to the sanitary plumbing
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.0.2 It does not apply to foul water drainage systems where it is necessary to dispose of industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer without pre-treatment.
LRML: if(and(is(drain.medium, foulWater), or(is(drain.medium, or(indLiquidWaste, chemicalWaste, toxicWaste)), and(is(drain.medium, waste), obligation(has(drain.medium, treatment)), obligation(into(drain.discharge, sewer)))))), then(prohibition(complyWith(drain, nzbc_g13as2)))
PARAPHRASE:
Where it is necessary to dispose of industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer without pre-treatment
G13/AS2 does not apply to foul water drains.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.0.2 It does not apply to foul water drainage systems where it is necessary to dispose of industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer without pre-treatment.
LRML: if(or(for(foulWaterDrain, or(industrialLiquidWaste, chemicalWaste, toxicWaste)), and(for(foulWaterDrain, waste),towards(waste.discharge, sewer), requires(waste.discharge, pretreatment)))), then(not(applyTo(nzbc_g13as1, foulWaterDrain)))
PARAPHRASE:
Where foul water drains are for industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer without pre-treatment
G13/AS2 does not apply to foul water drains.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Below ground 2.1 Fill materials 2.1.1 Fill materials, as shown in Figure 7, shall be: a) Bedding material of clean granular non-cohesive material with a maximum particle size of 20 mm, b) Selected fill of fine-grained soil or granular material that is free from topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm, or c) Ordinary fill of excavated material.
LRML: if(exist(fillMaterial)), then(or(obligation(and(is(fillMaterial,beddingMaterial),is(beddingMaterial, and(clean,granular,nonCohesive)),lessThanEqual(beddingMaterial.size, 20mm))), obligation(and(is(fillMaterial,selectedFill),is(selectedFill,or(fineGrainedSoil,granularMaterial)),not(include(granularMaterial,or(topsoil,rubbish))),lessThanEqual(granularMaterial.particleSize,20mm))), obligation(and(is(fillMaterial, ordinaryFill),is(ordinaryFill, excavatedMaterial)))))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.1.1 To reduce the risk of blockages, the foul water drainage system shall: a) Have a simple layout that incorporates the least number of changes of direction, b) Use bends having a radius of the practical maximum, and c) Be laid only in straight lines between bends or junctions (both horizontally and vertically).
LRML: if(exist(foulWaterDrain)), then(and(obligation(and(is(foulWaterDrain.layout, simple),is(layout.changeInDirection, minimum))), obligation(and(define(foulWaterDrain.bend, x0),is(x0.radius, practicalMaximum))),obligation(and(inBetween(pipe, and(bend, junction)),is(pipe, straight)))))
PARAPHRASE: The foul water drainage system shall: a) Have a simple layout that incorporates the least number of changes of direction, b) Use bends having a radius of the practical maximum, and c) Be laid only in straight lines between bends or junctions).
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.2.1 Any connection to a drain, excluding vent pipe connections, shall be made by means of sweep or oblique junctions. The angle that the branch makes at the point of entry with the main drain, shall be no greater than 60° (see Figure 1).
LRML: if(and(has(drain, connection), not(is(connection, ventPipe)))), then(and(obligation(is(connection, or(sweepJunction, obliqueJunction))), obligation(lessThanEqual(connection.angle, 60 deg))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain has a connection, which is not with the vent pipe, the connection shall be a sweep junction or oblique junction. The angle that the branch makes at the point of entry with the main drain, shall be no greater than 60°.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.2.1 Any connection to a drain, excluding vent pipe connections, shall be made by means of sweep or oblique junctions. The angle that the branch makes at the point of entry with the main drain, shall be no greater than 60° (see Figure 1).
LRML: if(and(has(drain, connection), not(is(connection, ventPipe)))), then(and(obligation(is(connection, or(sweepJunction, obliqueJunction))), obligation(lessThanEqual(connection.angle, 60 deg))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain has a connection, which is not with the vent pipe, the connection shall be a sweep junction or oblique junction. The angle of the conection shall be no greater than 60°.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall be constructed to prevent the ingress of surface water and foreign bodies likely to cause a blockage, shall be located within the legal boundary of the land on which the building is erected.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(and(obligation(and(prevent(gullyTrap, ingress),is(ingress, and(surfaceWater, foreignBodies)))),obligation(within(gullyTrap.location, siteBoundary))))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.3.1 Fixture vent pipes, branch vent pipes, discharge stack vents and relief vents shall have a diameter of no less than that given in Table 6.
LRML: if(or(for(ventilationPipe, or(fixture, branch)), for(ventilation, or(dischargeStack, relief)))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(ventilationPipe.diameter, value),greaterThanEqual(ventilation.diameter, value),asPer(value, nzbc_g13as1_t6))))
PARAPHRASE: Ventilation pipes for fixtures and branches and ventilation ofr discharge stacks and reliefs shall have a diameter of no less than the value given in Table 6.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.3.1 Fixture vent pipes, branch vent pipes, discharge stack vents and relief vents shall have a diameter of no less than that given in Table 6.
LRML: if(or(for(ventilationPipe, or(fixture, branch)), for(ventilation, or(dischargeStack, relief)))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(ventilationPipe.diameter, value),greaterThanEqual(ventilation.diameter, value),asPer(value, nzbc_g13as1_t6))))
PARAPHRASE: Ventilation pipes for fixtures and branches and ventilation ofr discharge stacks and reliefs shall have a diameter of no less than the value given in G13/AS1 Table 6.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Where not acting as a drain vent the discharge stack vent pipe shall have a diameter of not less than that required in Table 6.
LRML: if(and(for(ventilationPipe, dischargeStack),not(is(ventilationPipe, drainVentilationPipe)))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(ventilationPipe, value),asPer(value, nzbc_g13as1_t6))))
PARAPHRASE: If the ventilation pipe is for the discharge stack but not for the drain ventilation, the ventilation pipe shall have a diameter of not less than the value required in Table 6.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Air admittance valves that form an integral part of a fixture trap shall only be used as a trap vent.
LRML: if(and(partOf(airAdmittanceValve, fixtureTrap), is(airAdmittanceValve, integral))), then(obligation(and(for(airAdmittanceValve, ventilation),for(ventilation, fixtureTrap),not(for(ventilation, other)))))
PARAPHRASE: If air admittance valves are part of a fixture trap and are integral, the air admittance valves shall be used as ventilation for the fixture trap but not for other.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 6.1.1 Jointing methods for PVC-U pipe shall comply with AS/NZS 2032.
LRML: if(is(pipe.material, pvcU)), then(obligation(complyWith(pipe.jointingMethod, nzs_2032)))
PARAPHRASE: If the pipe material is PVC-U, the pipe jointing method shall comply with NZS 2032.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 6.4.1 Fire stopping shall be fitted to pipes passing through fire separations in accordance with C/AS2 Paragraph 4.4.
LRML: if(through(pipe, fireSeparation)), then(and(obligation(has(pipe, fireStop)), obligation(asPer(fireStop, 'nzbc_cas2_4.4'))))
PARAPHRASE: Fire stopping shall be fitted to pipes passing through fire separations in accordance with C/AS2 Paragraph 4.4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 6.4.1 Fire stopping shall be fitted to pipes passing through fire separations in accordance with C/AS2 Paragraph 4.4.
LRML: if(through(pipe, fireSeparation)), then(and(obligation(has(pipe, fireStop)), obligation(asPer(fireStop, 'nzbc_cas2_4.4'))))
PARAPHRASE: Fire stopping shall be fitted to pipes passing through fire separations in accordance with C/AS2 Paragraph 4.4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 6.4.1 Fire stopping shall be fitted to pipes passing through fire separations in accordance with C/AS2 Paragraph 4.4.
LRML: if(through(pipe, fireSeparation)), then(and(obligation(has(pipe, fireStop)), obligation(asPer(fireStop, 'nzbc_cas2_4.4'))))

TEXT: Sanitary Plumbing 1.0.2 The solution does not include: The conveyance of industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer without pretreatment.
LRML: if(or(for(sanitaryPlumbing, or(industrialLiquidWaste, chemicalWaste, toxicWaste)), and(for(sanitaryPlumbing, waste),towards(waste.discharge, sewer), requires(waste.discharge, pretreatment)))), then(not(applyTo(nzbc_g13as1, sanitaryPlumbing)))
PARAPHRASE: If the sanitary plumbing conveys industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer if it has no treatment, G13/AS1 does not apply to the sanitary plumbing
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.0.1 This Acceptable Solution is for below ground non-pressure (gravity flow) foul water drains having a diameter of no greater than 150 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(foulWaterDrain, belowGround), is(foulWaterDrain.type, or(nonPressure, gravityFlow)), lessThanEqual(foulWaterDrain.diameter, 150 mm))), then(applyTo(nzbc_g13as2, foulWaterDrain))
PARAPHRASE: If foul water drains are below ground, their type is non-pressure or gravity flow and the foul water drains diameter is no greater than 150 mm, then G13/AS2 applies to the foul water drain.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.10 Nails used to fix straps to roof or ceiling framing shall be spaced at no less than 35 m in Radiata Pine.
LRML: if(and(partOf(framing, or(roof, ceiling)), has(framing, fixture), is(framing, strap), is(fixture.method, nail), is(framing.material, radiataPine))), then(obligation(and(for(nail, fixture), greaterThanEqual(nail.spacing, 35 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If straps are fixed to a framing and the framing is part of the roof or ceiling, the nails used for the fixture shall be spaced at no less than 35 m in Radiata Pine.

TEXT: 1.7.15 Fixing brackets shall be spaced at no less than 320 mm centres for stacks wider than 600 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(bracket.type, fixing), greaterThan(stack.width, 600 mm))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(bracket.spacing, 320 mmCentres)))
PARAPHRASE: If brackets are type fixing and stacks are wider than 600 mm, the brackets shall be spaced at no less than 320 mm centres.

TEXT: 1.7.16 Fixing ties shall comprise 4 mm galvanised wire hairpins, which are hooked behind the reinforcing ducts and secured to the required adjacent double studding with four heavy duty fencing staples.
LRML: if(is(tie.type, fixing)), then(obligation(and(is(tie.type,wireHairpin),is(wireHairpin.type,galvanised),is(wireHairpin.size,4 mm),behind(tie.hook,reinforcingDuct),towards(tie.fixing,doubleStudding),adjacent(reinforcingDuct, doubleStudding),by(tie.fixing,fencingStaple),is(fencingStaple.type,heavyDuty),equal(count(fencingStaple),4))))
PARAPHRASE: Fixing ties shall be 4 mm galvanised wire hairpins, which are hooked behind the reinforcing ducts and have fixing to the double studding adjacent to the reinforcing ducts. The ties fixing is done by four heavy duty fencing staples.

TEXT: 1.7.16 Fixing ties shall comprise 4 mm galvanised wire hairpins, which are hooked behind the reinforcing ducts and secured to the required adjacent double studding with four heavy duty fencing staples.
LRML: if(is(tie.type, fixing)), then(obligation(and(is(tie.type,wireHairpin),is(wireHairpin.type,galvanised),is(wireHairpin.size,4 mm),behind(tie.hook,reinforcingDuct),towards(tie.fixing,doubleStudding),adjacent(reinforcingDuct, doubleStudding),by(tie.fixing,fencingStaple),is(fencingStaple.type,heavyDuty),equal(count(fencingStaple),4))))
PARAPHRASE: Fixing ties shall be 4 mm galvanised wire hairpins, which are hooked behind the reinforcing ducts and have fixing to the double studding adjacent to the reinforcing ducts. The ties fixing is done by four heavy duty fencing staples.

TEXT: Fixing ties shall be located in mortar joints between the units.
LRML: if(is(tie.type, fixing)), then(and(obligation(and(in(tie.location, mortarJoint),inBetween(mortarJoint.location, units)))  ))
PARAPHRASE: Fixing ties shall be located in mortar joints between the units.

TEXT: Fixing Ties; The ties shall be at no less than 160 mm centres for stacks wider than 600 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(tie.type, fixing), greaterThan(stack.width, 600 mm))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(tie.location, 160 mmCentres)))
PARAPHRASE: If fixing ties are for stacks wider than 600 mm, the ties shall be at no less than 160 mm centres.

TEXT: Fixing Ties; The ties shall be located at no less than 320 mm centres for stacks up to 600 mm wide.
LRML: if(and(is(tie.type, fixing), for(tie, stack),lessThanEqual(stack.width, 600 mm))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(tie.location, 320 mmCentres)))
PARAPHRASE: If the fixing ties are for stacks up to 600 mm wide, ties shall be located at no less than 320 mm centres.

TEXT: Fixing ties shall be located in mortar joints between the units.
LRML: if(is(tie.type, fixing)), then(and(obligation(and(within(tie.location, mortarJoint),inBetween(mortarJoint.location, units)))))
PARAPHRASE: Fixing ties shall be located in mortar joints between the units.

TEXT: The brackets shall comprise a 50 mm x 4 mm hot dip galvanised steel strap placed around the chimney.
LRML: if(exist(bracket)), then(obligation(and(is(bracket.type,strap),equal(strap.length,50 mm),equal(strap.depth,4 mm),is(strap.material,steel),is(steel.type,hotDipGalvanised),around(strap,chimney))))
PARAPHRASE: The brackets shall be a strap with 50 mm length, 4 mm depth with material hot dip galvanised steel and the strap is placed around the chimney.

TEXT: 1.7.6 Brick chimneys; Brick chimneys shall be restrained at roof level by a zinc coated 50 x 1.0 mm mild steel 'U' strap used in conjunction with closely spaced wall ties.
LRML: if(is(chimney.material, brick)), then(and(obligation(and(has(chimney, fixing),is(fixing.elevation, roofLevel), include(fixing.type, and(uStrap, wallTie)), is(uStrap.material, mildSteel), is(uStrap.type, zincCoated), equal(uStrap.size, '50 x 1.0 mm'), greaterThanEqual(uStrap.spacing, 50 mm), is(wallTie.spacing, close)))))
PARAPHRASE: Brick chimneys shall be fixed at roof level by 'U' straps and wall ties. The 'U' straps are zinc coated 50 x 1.0 mm mild steel 'U' strap used in conjunction with closely spaced wall ties.

TEXT: 1.7.6 Brick chimneys; Brick chimneys shall be restrained at roof level by a zinc coated 50 x 1.0 mm mild steel 'U' strap used in conjunction with closely spaced wall ties.
LRML: if(is(chimney.material, brick)), then(and(obligation(and(has(chimney, fixing),is(fixing.elevation, roofLevel), include(fixing.type, and(uStrap, wallTie)), is(uStrap.material, mildSteel), is(uStrap.type, zincCoated), equal(uStrap.length, '50 mm'), equal(uStrap.depth, 1 mm), is(wallTie.spacing, close)))))
PARAPHRASE: Brick chimneys shall be fixed at roof level by 'U' straps and wall ties. The 'U' straps are zinc coated 50 length, 1.0 mm depth, mild steel and wall ties are closely spaced.

TEXT: 1.7.7 Wall ties (see Figure 7(a)) shall be located in mortar joints at 225 mm maximum centres up each side of the chimney for chimneys not wider than 600 mm.
LRML: if(and(lessThanEqual(chimney.width, 600 mm), has(chimney, wallTie))), then(obligation(and(within(wallTie,mortarJoint),loop(forEach(chimney.side),lessThanEqual(wallTie.location, 225 mmCentres)))))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys are not wider than 600 mm and have wall ties, the wall ties shall be located in mortar joints at 225 mm maximum centres up each side of the chimney.

TEXT: 1.7.7 Wall ties (see Figure 7(a)) shall be located in mortar joints at 225 mm maximum centres up each side of the chimney, except that pairs of ties shall be used for chimneys wider than 600 mm.
LRML: if(and(greaterThan(chimney.width, 600 mm), has(chimney, wallTie))), then(and(obligation(in(wallTie.location, mortarJoint)), obligation(at(wallTie.location, 225 mm maximumCentresUpEachSideOfTheChimney)), obligation(in(wallTie.usage, pairs))))
PARAPHRASE: Wall ties (see Figure 7(a)) shall be located in mortar joints at 225 mm maximum centres up each side of the chimney, except that pairs of ties shall be used for chimneys wider than 600 mm.

TEXT: 1.6.1 Reinforcing of chimney stacks (see Figures 2 to 5 inclusive) shall comprise: a) D12 bars at 400 mm maximum centres vertically. Laps in bars shall be no less than 300 mm. b) R6 bars at 200 mm centres horizontally. These will be in the form of closed stirrups in the stack.
LRML: if(partOf(reinforcing, chimneyStack)), then(and(obligation(and(include(reinforcing, reinforcingBar),is(reinforcingBar.type,d12),is(reinforcingBar.location,400 mmCentres),is(reinforcingBar.orientation, vertical),greaterThanEqual(reinforcingBar.lap,300 mm))),obligation(and(include(reinforcing, reinforcingBar),is(reinforcingBar.type,r6),is(reinforcingBar.location,200 mmCentres),is(reinforcingBar.orientation, horizontal),is(reinforcingBar.type, stirrup),is(stirrup.type, closed)))))
PARAPHRASE: Reinforcing part of chimney stacks shall include: a) D12 reinforcing bars at 400 mm maximum centres vertically. Laps in reinforcing bars shall be no less than 300 mm. b) R6 reinforcing bars at 200 mm centres horizontally. These will be in the form of closed stirrups.

TEXT: 1.6.1 Reinforcing of foundation walls, chimney bases (including the gathers) and chimney stacks (see Figures 2 to 5 inclusive) shall comprise: Double horizontal reinforcing at any change in direction of the vertical steel (e.g. at the gather/stack intersection).
LRML: if(and(partOf(reinforcing, or(foundationWall, chimneyBase, chimneyGather, chimneyStack)), include(reinforcing, reinforcingBar), is(reinforcingBar.orientation, vertical),has(reinforcingBar, changeInDirection))), then(obligation(and(include(reinforcing, reinforcingBar),equal(count(reinforcingBar), 2),is(reinforcingBar.orientation, horizontal),is(reinforcingBar.location, changeInDirection))))
PARAPHRASE: If reinforcing is for foundation walls, chimney bases, chimney gathers, and chimney stacks and includes a vertical reinforcing bar with change in direction, then the reinforcing shall include two horizontal reinforcing bars at the change in direction.

TEXT: 1.1.1 Building elements, including materials, components and systems, complying with a publication referenced in the Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods, satisfy B2 requirements only when the conditions of use stated in the publication and Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods prevail.
LRML: if(and(or(has(nzbc_b2as, reference), has(nzbc_b2vm, reference)), towards(reference, publication), or(complyWith(building.element, publication), complyWith(building.material, publication), complyWith(building.component, publication), complyWith(building.system, publication)), is(publication.conditionOfUse, true),is(nzbc_b2as.conditionOfUse, true),is(nzbc_b2vm.conditionOfUse, true))), then(and(complyWith(building.element, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.material, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.component, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.system, nzbc_b2)))
PARAPHRASE: If a publication is referenced in B2/AS or B2/VM, and building elements, materials, components or systems comply with the publication, and the conditions of use stated in the publication and B2/AS and B2/VM are true, then the building elements, materials, components or systems comply with NZBC B2.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
Should "building element include" be translated literaly? - What is the scope of this, does

TEXT: 1.1.1 Building elements, including materials, components and systems, complying with a publication referenced in the Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods, satisfy B2 requirements only when the conditions of use stated in the publication and Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods prevail.
LRML: if(and(or(has(nzbc_b2as, reference), has(nzbc_b2vm, reference)), towards(reference, publication), or(complyWith(building.element, publication), complyWith(building.material, publication), complyWith(building.component, publication), complyWith(building.system, publication)), is(publication.conditionOfUse, true),is(nzbc_b2as.conditionOfUse, true),is(nzbc_b2vm.conditionOfUse, true))), then(and(complyWith(building.element, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.material, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.component, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.system, nzbc_b2)))
PARAPHRASE: If a publication is referenced in B2/AS or B2/VM, and building elements, materials, components or systems comply with the publication, and the conditions of use stated in the publication and B2/AS and B2/VM are true, then the building elements, materials, components or systems comply with NZBC B2.

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is one of three Acceptable Solutions that provide a means of establishing compliance with NZBC Clauses C1 to C6 Protection from Fire. It can be used for the building activities covered by risk groups specified in Paragraph 1.1.1 and described in Table 1.1.
LRML: if(and(complyWith(building, nzbc_cas2), asPer(building.riskGroup, and('nzbc_cas2_1.1.1', 'nzbc_cas2_t1.1')))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.fireProtection, and(nzbc_c1, nzbc_c2, nzbc_c3, nzbc_c5, nzbc_c6))))nzbc_cas2
PARAPHRASE: CAS2 provides a means of establishing compliance with NZBC Clauses C1 to C6. It can be used for the building activities covered by risk groups specified in CAS2 Paragraph 1.1.1 and Table 1.1.

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; For risk group SH, please refer to Acceptable Solution C/AS1.
LRML: if(is(building.riskGroup, sh)), then(permission(complyWith(building, nzbc_cas1)))
PARAPHRASE: For risk group SH, the building may comply with C/AS1.

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; For backcountry huts, please refer to Acceptable Solution BCH/AS1.
LRML: if(obligation(is(building.activity, backcountryHut))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.fireProtection, nzbc_bchas1)))
PARAPHRASE: For backcountry huts, the building may comply with BCH/AS1.

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; For backcountry huts, please refer to Acceptable Solution BCH/AS1.
LRML: if(is(building.activity, backcountryHut)), then(obligation(complyWith(building, nzbc_bchas1)))
PARAPHRASE: For backcountry huts, the building may comply with BCH/AS1.

TEXT: Where buildings are based on NZS 3604, but require specific engineering design input, the framing shall be of at least equivalent stiffness to the framing provisions of NZS 3604.
LRML: if(and(complyWith(building.design, nzs_3604), has(building.design, specificEngineeringRequirement))), then(obligation(and(has(building, framing), complyWith(framing.stiffness, nzs_3604))))

TEXT: Maintenance shall be carried out as necessary (Rule 2.5.0.2) to achieve the required durability of materials, components and junctions.
LRML: if(or(obligation(has(building.material, durability)), obligation(has(building.component, durability)), obligation(has(building.junction, durability)))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.maintenance, 'nzbc_e2as1_2.5.0.2')))

TEXT: The extent and nature of necessary maintenance is dependent on the: a) Type of cladding or components used, b) Position of cladding or components on the building, c) Geographical location of the building, and d) Specific site conditions.
LRML: if(obligation(has(building, maintenance))), then(obligation(and(has(maintenance.extent,dependency),has(maintenance.nature,dependency),is(dependency.base,or(claddingType,componentType)),is(dependency.base,or(claddingPosition,componentPosition)),is(dependency.base,and(buildingLocation,siteCondition)))))

TEXT: uPVC flashings shall be a minimum of 0.75 mm thick. uPVC flashings shall comply with the requirements of the following Clauses of AS/NZS 4256: Part 2: a) Clause 9.2 Impact resistance, b) Clause 9.3 Tensile strength, and c)  Clause 9.4 Colourfastness and impact resistance following ultraviolet light exposure.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, uPvc)), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(flashing.thickness, 0.75 mm)), obligation(complyWith(flashing, and('nzs_4256_2_9.2', 'nzs_4256_2_9.3', 'nzs_4256_2_9.4')))))

TEXT: Where uPVC flashings are exposed to the weather, they shall also comply with Section 8 of AS/NZS 4256: Part 2.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.material, uPvc), to(flashing.exposure, weather))), then(obligation(complyWith(flashing, nzs_4256_2_8)))

TEXT: uPVC flashings shall have a finish colour with a reflectance of 40% or more, as outlined in Paragraph 2.4.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, uPvc)), then(obligation(and(has(flashing,finishColour),greaterThanEqual(finishColour.reflectance,40percent))))

TEXT: Flexible flashing tape shall comply with Parts 3.2 and 4 of ICBO Acceptance Criteria AC148, shall be compatible with adjacent building wall underlay or roof underlay, and be used only in fully concealed applications.
LRML: if(is(flashingTape, flexible)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(flashingTape,and('icbo_ac148_3.2',icbo_ac148_4)),has(adjacentBuilding,or(wallUnderlay,roofUnderlay)),include(flashingTape.compatibility,or(wallUnderlay,roofUnderlay)),in(flashingTape.application,fullyConcealedApplication))))

TEXT: Aluminium flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 0.7 mm, and formed from 5000 series in accordance with AS/NZS 1734.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, aluminium)), obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(flashing.thickness,0.7 mm),is(flashing.material,5000_series),complyWith(flashing,nzs_1734))))

TEXT: 4.3.6 Copper flashings; Copper flashings shall be: a) A minimum thickness of 0.5 mm, b) In compliance with AS 1566, and c) Alloy, designation C11000 or C12200.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, copper)), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(flashing.thickness,0.5 mm),complyWith(flashing,as_1566),equal(flashing.type,or(alloy_c11000,alloy_c12200)))))

TEXT: Butyl rubber and EPDM flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 1.0 mm, and shall comply with the following parts of Table 1 in ASTM D6134: a) Tensile strength, b) Elongation, c) Water absorption, d) Water vapour permeance, and e) Heat aging followed by: i) tensile strength ii) elongation.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, or(butylRubber, epdm))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(flashing.thickness,1 mm),complyWith(flashing.tensileStrength,astm_d6134_1),complyWith(flashing.elongation,astm_d6134_1),complyWith(flashing.waterAbsorption,astm_d6134_1),complyWith(flashing.waterVapourPermeance,astm_d6134_1),complyWith(flashing.heatAgingFollowedByTensileStrength,astm_d6134_1),complyWith(flashing.heatAgingFollowedByElongation,astm_d6134_1))))

TEXT: 4.4 Fixings; Fixings of metal flashings shall comply with Tables 20, 21 and 22.
LRML: if(and(has(flashing, fixing), is(fixing.material, metal))), then(obligation(complyWith(fixing, and(nzbc_e2as1_t20, nzbc_e2as1_t21, nzbc_e2as1_t22))))

TEXT: All flashings shall have expansion joints where required in Paragraph 4.5.2 to provide for thermal expansion.
LRML: if(and(has(flashing, expansionJoint), asPer(expansionJoint, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.5.2'))), then(obligation(and(has(flashing,expansionJoint),include(expansionJoint.provision,thermalExpansion))))

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: b) Expansion joints shall be provided for joined flashings with a combined length exceeding: i) 12 metres for light coloured steel and stainless steel. 8 metres for dark coloured steel, ii) 8 metres for copper, iii) 8 metres for aluminium.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.material, metal), has(flashing, join))), then(and(obligation(for(expansionJoint.provision, flashing)), or(obligation(and(is(flashing.material,or(lightColouredSteel,stainlessSteel)),greaterThanEqual(expansionJoint.combinedLength,12 m))), obligation(and(is(flashing.material,or(darkColouredSteel,copper,aluminium)),greaterThanEqual(expansionJoint.combinedLength,8 m))))))

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: When using uncoated galvanized steel, zinc, stainless steel or copper flashings, joints shall be riveted or soldered as described in the New Zealand Metal Roof and Wall Cladding Code of Practice.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.material, metal), has(flashing, expansionJoint), is(flashing.material, or(uncoatedGalvanizedSteel, uncoatedGalvanizedZinc, uncoatedGalvanizedStainlessSteel, uncoatedGalvanizedCopper)))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(asPer.method,newZealandMetalRoofAndWallCladdingCodeOfPractice),is(expansionJoint.method,or(riveted,soldered)))))

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: When using uncoated galvanized steel, zinc, stainless steel or copper flashings, joints shall be riveted or soldered as described in the New Zealand Metal Roof and Wall Cladding Code of Practice.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.material, metal), has(flashing, expansionJoint), is(flashing.material, or(uncoatedGalvanizedSteel, uncoatedGalvanizedZinc, uncoatedGalvanizedStainlessSteel, uncoatedGalvanizedCopper)))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(asPer.method,newZealandMetalRoofAndWallCladdingCodeOfPractice),is(expansionJoint.method,or(riveted,soldered)))))

TEXT: 4.3.2 All internal downpipes shall withstand without leakage, a water test with an applied head of 1.5 m of water, or a high pressure air test as described in E1/VM1 Paragraph 8.3.
LRML: if(is(downpipe.location, internal)), then(or(obligation(and(complyWith(downpipe,waterTest),equal(waterTest.appliedHead,1.5m))), obligation(and(complyWith(downpipe,airTest),asPer(airTest,'nzbc_e1vm1_8.3')))))
PARAPHRASE: All internal downpipes shall withstand without leakage, a water test with an applied head of 1.5 m of water, or a high pressure air test as described in E1/VM1 Paragraph 8.3.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.3.2 All internal downpipes shall withstand without leakage, a water test with an applied head of 1.5 m of water, or a high pressure air test as described in E1/VM1 Paragraph 8.3.
LRML: if(is(downpipe.location, internal)), then(or(obligation(and(test(downpipe,waterTest),equal(waterTest.appliedHead,1.5m))), obligation(and(test(downpipe,airTest),is(airTest.type, highPressure),asPer(airTest,'nzbc_e1vm1_8.3')))))
PARAPHRASE: All internal downpipes shall be tested with a water test with an applied head of 1.5 m, or tested with a high pressure air test as described in E1/VM1 Paragraph 8.3.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.1.1 Roof gutters shall discharge to downpipes that are sized as given in Paragraph 4.2.
LRML: if(is(gutter.location, roof)), then(obligation(and(into(gutter.discharge,downpipe),asPer(downpipe.size, 'nzbc_e1_as1_4.2'))))
PARAPHRASE: Roof gutters shall discharge to downpipes that are sized as given in Paragraph 4.2.

TEXT: 5.2.1 Roof gutter materials shall comply with the standards stated in Table 6.
LRML: if(exist(roofGutter)), then(obligation(complyWith(roofGutter.material, nzbc_e1as1_t6)))
PARAPHRASE: Roof gutter materials shall comply with Table 6.

TEXT: 5.2.1 Roof gutter materials shall comply with the standards stated in Table 6.
LRML: if(exist(roofGutter)), then(obligation(complyWith(roofGutter.material, nzbc_e1as1_t6)))
PARAPHRASE: Roof gutter materials shall comply with Table 6.

TEXT: 5.0 Roof Gutters 5.5.1 All internal gutters shall be fitted with overflow outlets which drain to the exterior of the building. The top of the outlet shall be set at least 50 mm below the top of the gutter.
LRML: if(and(is(roofGutter.type, internal), define(roofGutter.top, x0))), then(obligation(and(define(roofGutter.top, x0),include(roofGutter,overflowOutlet),towards(overflowOutlet.flow,buildingExterior),lessThanEqual(overflowOutlet.top,'x0-50mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: All internal roof gutters shall be fitted with overflow outlets which drain to the exterior of the building. The top of the outlet shall be set at least 50 mm below the top of the gutter.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.0 Roof Gutters 5.5.1 All internal gutters shall be fitted with overflow outlets which drain to the exterior of the building. The top of the outlet shall be set at least 50 mm below the top of the gutter.
LRML: if(is(roofGutter.type, internal)), then(obligation(and(has(roofGutter,overflowOutlet),towards(overflowOutlet.drain, buildingExterior),define(roofGutter.top, x0),lessThanEqual(overflowOutlet.top,'x0 - 50 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If a roof gutter is internal, the roof gutter shall be fitted with overflow outlets which drain to the exterior of the building. The top of the overflow outlet shall be set at least 50 mm below the top of the gutter.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.0 Roof Gutters 5.5.2 External gutters do not require overflow outlets but shall be installed to ensure any overflow from the gutter spills to the outside of the building.
LRML: if(is(roofGutter.type, external)), then(and(permission(not(has(roofGutter, overflowOutlet))), obligation(towards(roofGutter.overflow, buildingExterior))))
PARAPHRASE: External roof gutters do not require overflow outlets but shall be installed to ensure any overflow from the gutter spills to the outside of the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Boundary fences and other site development must not significantly hamper the flow of surface water from the site.

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.2.2 If a building contains a number of different activities which individually may be categorised in different risk groups, the risk group designated for a particular firecell within the building shall be that of the primary risk group. The primary risk group shall be that one within the firecell that has the most onerous fire safety requirements.
LRML: if(greaterThan(count(building.activity), 1)), then(obligation(and(has(building, firecell),is(firecell.riskGroup, primaryRiskGroup),has(building.firecell, riskGroups),define(max(riskgroups.fireSafetyRequirements), x0),is(primaryRiskGroup, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building contains a number of different activities, the risk group designated for a particular firecell within the building shall be that of the primary risk group. The primary risk group shall be the firecell's risk group that has the maximum fire safety requirements.

TEXT: 1.4.2 Occupant loads shall be calculated from the occupant densities given in Table 1.2 based on the floor area of the part of the building housing the activity. Table 1.2 Occupant densities; Activity; Occupancy density (m2/ person).
LRML: if(has(building.part, activity)), then(and(define(part.floorArea, x0),define(part.occupantDensity, x1), asPer(x1, 'nzbc_cas2_t1.2'),equal(part.occupantLoad, 'x0 * x1')))
PARAPHRASE: If a building part has an activity, the building part's occupant load shall be calculated by the parts floor area times the part's occupant density as given in C/AS2 Table 1.2.

TEXT: 2.2.2 In addition to Paragraph 2.2.1, the fire safety systems required for firecells in early childhood centres shall be as follows: If the early childhood centre is not located on the ground floor at least two separate places of safety shall be provided. Each place of safety shall be separated with fire separations designed to the property rating and have direct access to a safe path or final exit.
LRML: if(and(is(firecell.activity, earlyChildhoodCentre),not(is(firecell.location, groundFloor)))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(count(firecell.placeOfSafety),2),has(placeOfSafety,fireSeparation),asPer(fireSeparation.design,propertyRating),towards(placeOfSafety.directAccess,or(safePath,finalExit)))))
PARAPHRASE: If firecell activity is early childhood centre and it is not located on the ground floor, then at least two places of safety shall be provided. Each place of safety shall be separated with fire separations designed to the property rating and the place of safety shall have direct access to a safe path or final exit.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: If it is not practical, the alternative most direct practical route to the space served by the principal entrance shall be used.

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.1 Accessible routes shall be provided to give direct access to the principal entrance to the building where practical.
LRML: if(and(has(building, entrance), is(entrance.type, principal),towards(entrance, route),is(route.type, direct),is(route.accessibility, practical))), then(obligation(is(route, accessibleRoute)))
PARAPHRASE: If the entrance to the building is the principal entrance and the route to the building is direct, and the route's accessibility is practical, the route shall be the accessible route.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: If it is not practical, the alternative most direct practical route to the space served by the principal entrance shall be used.
LRML: if(and(has(building, entrance), is(entrance.type, principal),towards(entrance, route),is(route.type, direct),not(is(route.type, practical)))), then(obligation(is(route, accessibleRoute)))if(and(has(building, entrance), is(entrance, principal), not(is(accessibleRoute, practical)))), then(obligation(by(entrance.alternativeAccess, accessibleRoute)))
PARAPHRASE: If the entrance to the building is the principal entrance and an accessible route is not practical, an accessible routes shall be provided to the entrance.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.6.1 All surface water, except that collected directly from a roof, shall enter the drain via a sump.

TEXT: For Low, Medium, High and Very High wind zones, flashing upstands shall have either: 1) A hem or hook to Figure 5, with upstand dimensions as shown throughout the document, or 2) No hooks or hems, and flashing upstand dimensions increased by 25 mm beyond those shown.
LRML: if(and(is(windZone.type, or(low, medium, high, veryHigh)), has(flashing, upstand))), then(or(obligation(and(has(upstand,or(hem,hook)),complyWith(upstand.dimension,nzbc_e2as1))), obligation(and(not(has(upstand,and(hem,hook))),has(upstand,dimension),by(dimension.increase,25mm),above(dimension.increase,value),asPer(value,nzbc_e2as1)))))

TEXT: For Extra High wind zones, hooks and hems shall be used, and flashing upstand dimensions increased by 25 mm beyond those shown in Table 7 or elsewhere in the document.
LRML: if(and(is(windZone.type, extraHigh), has(flashing, upstand))), then(obligation(and(has(upstand,or(hem,hook)),has(upstand,dimension),greaterThanEqual(dimension, 'value + 25 mm'))))

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: b) Expansion joints shall be provided for joined flashings with a combined length exceeding: i) 12 metres for light coloured steel and stainless steel. 8 metres for dark coloured steel, ii) 8 metres for copper, iii) 8 metres for aluminium.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.material, metal), has(flashing, join))), then(and(obligation(for(expansionJoint.provision, flashing)), or(obligation(and(is(flashing.material,or(lightColouredSteel,stainlessSteel)),greaterThanEqual(expansionJoint.combinedLength,12 m))), obligation(and(is(flashing.material,or(darkColouredSteel,copper,aluminium)),greaterThanEqual(expansionJoint.combinedLength,8 m))))))

TEXT: 4.6 Flashing overlaps and upstands; Overlaps and upstands to flashings shall be as specified in this paragraph and Table 7.
LRML: if(has(flashing, or(overlap, upstand))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(overlap,and('nzbc_e2as1_4.6',nzbc_e2as1_t7)),complyWith(upstand,and('nzbc_e2as1_4.6',nzbc_e2as1_t7)))))

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: Refer to Figure 48 for example of use. The apron shall: i) be dimensioned to suit the roof cladding profile,.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), to(flashing.overlap, roofCladding), over(flashing.cover, metalRoofing), is(flashing, parallel), has(roofCladding, profile))), then(obligation(and(has(flashing.dimension,dependency),is(dependency.type, profile))))

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: Refer to Figure 48 for example of use. The apron shall: ii) for profiled metal roof cladding, cover at least two crests, (turned-up edge to full crest height constitutes a crest).
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), to(flashing.overlap, roofCladding), over(flashing.cover, metalRoofing), is(flashing, parallel), has(roofCladding, profile))), then(obligation(and(include(flashing.cover,crest),greaterThanEqual(count(crest),2))))

TEXT: 6.1.3 Air tests may be carried out in accordance with either clause 15.3 of AS/NZS 3500.2 or paragraph 8.3 of E1/VM1.

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.16 Fixing ties shall comprise 4 mm galvanised wire hairpins, which are hooked behind the reinforcing ducts and secured to the required adjacent double studding with four heavy duty fencing staples.

TEXT: The brackets shall comprise a 50 mm x 4 mm hot dip galvanised steel strap placed around the chimney.

TEXT: 1.7.6 Brick chimneys; Brick chimneys shall be restrained at roof level by a zinc coated 50 x 1.0 mm mild steel 'U' strap used in conjunction with closely spaced wall ties.
LRML: if(is(chimney.material, brick)), then(and(obligation(and(has(chimney, fixing),include(fixing.type, and(uStrap, wallTie)), is(fixing.location, roofLevel), is(uStrap.material, mildSteel), is(uStrap.type, zincCoated), equal(uStrap.size, '50 x 1.0 mm'), greaterThanEqual(uStrap.spacing, 50 mm), is(wallTie.spacing, close))), ))

TEXT: 1.7.6 Brick chimneys; Brick chimneys shall be restrained at roof level by a zinc coated 50 x 1.0 mm mild steel 'U' strap used in conjunction with closely spaced wall ties.
LRML: if(is(chimney.material, brick)), then(and(obligation(and(has(chimney, fixing),is(fixing.elevation, roofLevel), include(fixing.type, and(uStrap, wallTie)), is(uStrap.material, mildSteel), is(uStrap.type, zincCoated), equal(uStrap.size, '50 x 1.0 mm'), greaterThanEqual(uStrap.spacing, 50 mm), is(wallTie.spacing, close)))))
PARAPHRASE: Brick chimneys shall be fixed at roof level by 'U' straps and wall ties. The 'U' straps are zinc coated 50 length, 1.0 mm depth, mild steel and wall ties are closely spaced.

TEXT: 1.7.7 Wall ties (see Figure 7(a)) shall be located in mortar joints at 225 mm maximum centres up each side of the chimney for chimneys not wider than 600 mm.

PARAPHRASE: If chimneys are not wider than 600 mm and have wall ties, the wall ties shall be located in mortar joints at 225 mm maximum centres up each side of the chimney.

TEXT: 1.7.7 Wall ties (see Figure 7(a)) shall be located in mortar joints at 225 mm maximum centres up each side of the chimney, except that pairs of ties shall be used for chimneys wider than 600 mm.
LRML: if(and(greaterThan(chimney.width, 600 mm), has(chimney, wallTie))), then(obligation(and(within(wallTie,mortarJoint),loop(forEach(chimney.side),lessThanEqual(wallTie.elevation, 225 mmCentres)),is(count(wallTie), 2))))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys are wider than 600 mm and have wall ties, the wall ties shall be located in mortar joints at 225 mm maximum centres elevation each side of the chimney and the two wallties shall be used.

PARAPHRASE: If chimneys are wider than 600 mm and have wall ties, the wall ties shall be located in mortar joints at 225 mm maximum centres elevation each side of the chimney and the two wallties shall be used.

TEXT: 3.7.1 Access for maintenance shall be provided on all drains.
LRML: if(exist(drain)), then(obligation(has(drain, accessPoint)))
PARAPHRASE: All drains shall have access points.

TEXT: 3.7.3 Points of access are required at: Junctions of drains other than a drain, serving a single downpipe, that is less than 2.0 m long.
LRML: if(and(has(drain, junction), not(and(into(drain.flow, downpipe), equal(count(downpipe), 1), lessThan(downpipe.length, 2 m))))), then(and(obligation(has(drain, accessPoint)), obligation(is(accessPoint.location, junction))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain has a junction, and the drain flows not into a single downpipe, that is less than 2.0 m long, the drain shall have an access point at the junction.

TEXT: 3.7.3 Points of access are required at: Junctions of drains other than a drain, serving a single downpipe, that is less than 2.0 m long.

PARAPHRASE: If a drain has a junction, and the drain flows not into a single downpipe, that is less than 2.0 m long, the drain shall have an access point at the junction.

flow?

TEXT: 3.7.4 Inspection chambers or access chambers (see Figures 11 and 12) shall be provided where changes in both gradient and direction occur and where either is greater than 22.5°.

PARAPHRASE: Where changes in both gradient and direction occur in the same location and where the change in gradient or direction is greater than 22.5 deg, inspection chambers or access chambers shall be provided at the location of the change.

TEXT: 3.7.4 Inspection chambers or access chambers (see Figures 11 and 12) shall be provided where changes in both gradient and direction occur and where either is greater than 22.5°.
LRML: if(and(include(drain, and(changeInDirection, changeInGradient)), define(changeInGradient.location, x0), define(changeInDirection.location, x1), equal(x0, x1), or(greaterThan(changeInDirection, 22.5 deg), greaterThan(changeInGradient, 22.5 deg)))), then(obligation(and(has(drain, chamber),for(chamber, or(inspection, access)),is(accessPoint.location, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: Where changes in both gradient and direction occur in the same location and where the change in gradient or direction is greater than 22.5 deg, inspection chambers or access chambers shall be provided at the location of the change.

TEXT: 3.7.4 Inspection chambers or access chambers (see Figures 11 and 12) shall be provided where changes in both gradient and direction occur and where either is greater than 22.5°.

TEXT: 3.7.5 Where the depth to the invert of the drain exceeds 1.0 m, an inspection chamber is not acceptable and an access chamber shall be used.
LRML: if(and(towards(drain.depth, invert), greaterThan(drain.depth, 1 m))), then(and(prohibition(is(accessPoint.type, inspectionChamber)), obligation(is(accessPoint.type, accessChamber))))
PARAPHRASE: Where the depth to the invert of the drain exceeds 1.0 m, an inspection chamber is not acceptable as access point but an access chamber shall be used.

TEXT: 1.7.16 Fixing ties shall comprise 4 mm galvanised wire hairpins, which are hooked behind the reinforcing ducts and secured to the required adjacent double studding with four heavy duty fencing staples.
LRML: if(is(tie.type, fixing)), then(obligation(and(is(tie.type,wireHairpin),is(wireHairpin.type,galvanised),is(wireHairpin.size,4 mm),behind(tie.hook,reinforcingDuct),adjacent(reinforcingDuct, doubleStudding)connect(tie,doubleStudding),by(tie.fixing,fencingStaple),is(fencingStaple.type,heavyDuty),equal(count(fencingStaple),4))))

TEXT: 1.7.9 Where zinc coating of components is required it shall be no less than 300 g/m2 in accordance with AS 1397.

TEXT: 1.8.1 Brickwork; Brick chimney construction shall conform to the relevant sections of NZS 4210.
LRML: if(is(chimney.construction, brick)), then(obligation(complyWith(chimney.construction, nzs_4210)))
PARAPHRASE: Brick chimney construction shall conform to NZS 4210.

TEXT: 1.8.2 Chimney foundations of reinforced concrete shall comply with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109 for ordinary grade concrete.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, foundation), is(foundation.construction, reinforcedConcrete), is(concrete.grade, ordinary))), then(obligation(complyWith(foundation, nzs_3109)))
PARAPHRASE: Chimney foundations of reinforced concrete shall comply with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109 for ordinary grade concrete.

TEXT: 1.8.2 Chimney foundations of reinforced concrete shall comply with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109 for ordinary grade concrete.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, foundation), is(foundation.material, reinforcedConcrete), is(concrete.grade, ordinary))), then(obligation(complyWith(foundation, nzs_3109)))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys foundations are reinforced concrete and the reinforced concrete is ordinary grade, the foundations shall comply with NZS 3109.

TEXT: 1.8.2 Chimney foundations of reinforced concrete shall comply with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109 for ordinary grade concrete.

TEXT: Reinforcing used in chimneys is to conform to AS/NZS 4671.
LRML: if(has(chimney, reinforcing)), then(obligation(complyWith(reinforcing, nzs_4671)))
PARAPHRASE: The chimney's reinforcing shall conform to AS/NZS 4671.

TEXT: Reinforcing used in chimneys shall: a) For brick, be embedded centrally in the thickness of the grout.

PARAPHRASE: Reinforcing used in brick chimneys shall be embedded centrally in the grout.

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: Refer to Figure 48 for example of use. The apron shall: iii) for profiled metal roof cladding, overhang flashing a minimum 10 mm clear of crest and maximum 5 mm clear of trough as shown in Figure 47.

TEXT: All roof-to-wall junctions shall be made weathertight by using an apron flashing as outlined in Paragraph 4.6.1.1, and shown in Figure 7, that: a) Provides a minimum lap under the wall cladding of 75 mm in accordance with Table 7.

TEXT: 1.7.7 Wall ties (see Figure 7(a)) shall be located in mortar joints at 225 mm maximum centres up each side of the chimney for chimneys not wider than 600 mm.

wallTie if or then?
up -> elevation?

TEXT: 1.8.1 Brickwork; Brick chimney construction shall conform to the relevant sections of NZS 4210.

TEXT: 1.8.2 Chimney hearth slabs of reinforced concrete shall comply with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109 for ordinary grade concrete.

TEXT: 3.7.6 Drain under buildings; Any drain laid under a building shall be run in a straight line from one side to the other.

PARAPHRASE: The drain section under a building shall not include any changes in direction.

TEXT: 3.7.6 Drain under buildings; Any drain laid under a building shall be run in a straight line from one side to the other.

PARAPHRASE: The drain section under a building shall not include any changes in direction.

TEXT: 3.7.7 Access to a drain laid under a building shall be provided immediately outside the building. These points of access shall be located within 2.0 m of an exterior wall.
LRML: if(below(drain, building)), then(obligation(and(has(drain, accessPoint),outside(accessPoint.location, building),has(building, externalWall),define(externalWall.location, x0),within(accessPoint.location, 'x0 + 2 m'))))
PARAPHRASE: Access to a drain laid under a building shall be provided immediately outside the building. These points of access shall be located within 2.0 m of an exterior wall.

TEXT: 3.7.7 Access to a drain laid under a building shall be provided immediately outside the building. These points of access shall be located within 2.0 m of an exterior wall.
LRML: if(below(drain, building)), then(obligation(and(has(drain, accessPoint),outside(accessPoint.location, building),has(building, externalWall),define(externalWall.location, x0),within(accessPoint.location, 'x0 + 2 m'))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain is under a building, then drain's access point location shall be outside the building. These points of access shall be located within 2.0 m of an exterior wall of the building.

TEXT: 3.7.8 Under a building the only acceptable inlets to a drain are from sealed roof-water downpipes.

TEXT: Inlet to a drain under a building; Access shall be provided to the drain via a sealed access point in the downpipe immediately above ground floor level.

TEXT: Inlet to a drain under a building; Access shall be provided to the drain via a sealed access point in the downpipe immediately above ground floor level.

TEXT: 3.9.2 Bedding and backfilling; Figure 13 gives acceptable solutions for the bedding and backfilling of the drainage pipes listed in Table 1 except where: a) The trench is located within or above peat, or b) Scouring of the trench is likely due to unstable soils, or d) The cover H to the pipe is more than 2.5 m.
LRML: if(and(within(pipe, trench), has(trench, or(bedding, backfilling)), not(within(trench.location, peat)), not(above(trench.location, peat)), not(is(soil, unstable)), not(greaterThan(pipe.cover, 2.5 m)))), then(permission(and(complyWith(bedding, nzbc_e1as1_f13),complyWith(backfilling, nzbc_e1as1_f13))))
PARAPHRASE: If bedding and backfilling of the drainage pipes are listed in Table 1, and the trench is not located within or above peat, and scouring of the trench is not likely due to unstable soils, and the cover H to the pipe is not more than 2.5 m, then the bedding and backfilling may comply with E1/AS1 Figure 13.

TEXT: These anti-scour blocks shall be: Constructed from 150 mm thick concrete (17 MPa).

TEXT: 3.0 Timber 3.1.1 NZS 3604 Paragraph 1.3 Definitions Add (in the definition for Good Ground): "(liquefaction, lateral spread – for the Canterbury earthquake region only)" after "subsidence" in subparagraph (c).
LRML: if(and(is(structure.material, timber), define(x0, _new), is(x0, 'nzs_3604_1.3.goodground.c'))), then(and(obligation(has(x0.content, modification)), obligation(is(modification.type, add)), obligation(after(modification.location, 'subsidence')), obligation(equal(modification.text, '(liquefaction, lateral spread - for the Canterbury earthquake region only)'))))

TEXT: 1.1.1 Accessible routes shall be provided to give direct access to the principal entrance to the building where practical.

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: a) Rivets used for joining and sealing laps shall be spaced at a maximum of 50 mm centres, and be: i) compatible with the flashing material as per Table 21 and Table 22, and ii) sealed against moisture, or iii) of a sealing type or blind rivet,.

TEXT: 1.9.3 The number of bracing units to be provided for each chimney connection (see Paragraph 1.9.4) is given in Table 2.
LRML: if(exist(chimney)), then(obligation(loop(forEach(chimney.connection), asPer(count(bracing.unit), nzbc_b1as3_t2))))
PARAPHRASE: For each chimney connection the number of bracing units shall be as given in Table 2.

TEXT: 1.9.4 A chimney shall be considered as connected to the building when: At ground floor level: it is held by a floor bracket or the chimney base is integral with the building foundation wall,.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.elevation, groundFloorLevel), or(is(chimney.fixing, floorBracket), partOf(chimney.base, foundationWall)))), then(connect(chimney, building))
PARAPHRASE: If a chimney at ground floor level is fixed by a floor bracket or the chimney base is part of the building foundation wall, the chimney is considered connected to the building.

TEXT: 1.9.4 A chimney shall be considered as connected to the building when: At ground floor level: it is held by a floor bracket or the chimney base is integral with the building foundation wall,.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.elevation, groundFloorLevel), or(is(chimney.fixing, floorBracket), partOf(chimney.base, foundationWall)))), then(connect(chimney, building))
PARAPHRASE: If a chimney at ground floor level is fixed by a floor bracket or the chimney base is part of the building foundation wall, the chimney is considered connected to the building.

TEXT: 1.9.4 A chimney shall be considered as connected to the building when: At an intermediate floor level: it is held either by a floor bracket or by closely spaced wall ties spanning the floor.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.elevation, intermediateFloor), or(is(chimney.fixing, floorBracket), and(is(chimney.fixing, wallTie), is(wallTie.spacing, close),inBetween(wallTie.span, floor) )))), then(connect(chimney, building))
PARAPHRASE: If a chimney at an intermediate floor level is fixed by a floor bracket or by closely spaced wall ties spanning between the floor, the chimney is considered connected to the building.

TEXT: Structural diaphragms shall be provided at roof/ceiling level and at each floor level to which the chimney is connected. The diaphragms shall comply with all relevant clauses of NZS 3604 and NZS 4229.
LRML: if(and(has(building, chimney), or(is(building.buildingStorey, or(roof, ceiling)), connect(building.buildingStorey, chimney)))), then(obligation(and(has(buildingStorey, diaphragm),complyWith(diaphragm, and(nzs_3604,nzs_4229)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the building has a chimney and the building storey is roof or ceiling level, or the building storey is connected to the chimney, diaphragms shall be provided. The diaphragms shall comply with NZS 3604 and NZS 4229.

TEXT: 2.2.4 Hearth slabs for solid fuel burning appliances shall comply with AS/NZS 2918.
LRML: if(and(for(chimney, solidFuelBurningAppliance),on(solidFuelBurningAppliance.support, slab), is(slab.type, hearth))), then(obligation(complyWith(slab, nzs_2918)))

TEXT: 2.2.1 Solid fuel burning domestic appliances weighing no more than 130 kg shall be supported on a 65 mm thick hearth slab that is: a) Reinforced with 665 mesh, or D10 rods at 300 mm centres each way, placed centrally in the slab thickness, b) Supported on a timber or concrete floor, or integral with a concrete floor. (The floor supporting the hearth slab shall comply with NZS 3604 or NZS 4229 as appropriate), and c) Comprised of ordinary grade concrete complying with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109.
LRML: if(and(for(chimney, appliance),is(appliance.type, and(solidFuelBurning, domestic)),lessThanEqual(appliance.weight, 130 kg))),then(and(obligation(on(appliance.support, slab)), is(slab.type, hearth), greaterThanEqual(slab.thickness, 65 mm), is(slab.construction, concrete), has(concrete, reinforcing), or(and(is(reinforcing.type, 665 mesh), is(reinforcing.placement, centrallyInSlabThickness)), and(is(reinforcing.type, d10Rod), at(reinforcing.spacing, 300 mmCentresEachWay), is(reinforcing.placement, centrallyInSlabThickness))), or(and(on(slab.support, floor), is(floor.construction, or(timber, concrete)), complyWith(floor, or(nzs_3604, nzs_4229))), and(partOf(slab, floor), is(floor.construction, concrete))), is(concrete.grade, ordinary), complyWith(concrete.grade, nzs_3109)))

TEXT: 2.1.1 Chimneys for solid fuel burning appliances shall comply with Paragraph 1.0 or with the relevant sections of AS/NZS 3869 and AS/NZS 2918 for sheetmetal chimneys.
LRML: if(and(for(chimney, appliance),is(appliance.type, solidFuelBurning))), then(obligation(or(complyWith(chimney, nzbc_b1as3_1),and(is(chimney.material, sheetmetal),complyWith(chimney, and(nzs_3869, nzs_2918))))))
PARAPHRASE: Chimneys for solid fuel burning appliances shall comply with Paragraph 1.0 or sheetmetal chimneys shall comply with NZS 3869 and NZS 2918.

TEXT: 3.9.2 Bedding and backfilling; Figure 13 gives acceptable solutions for the bedding and backfilling of the drainage pipes listed in Table 1 except where: a) The trench is located within or above peat, or b) Scouring of the trench is likely due to unstable soils, or d) The cover H to the pipe is more than 2.5 m.
LRML: if(and(or(asPer(drainPipe.bedding, nzbc_e1as1_t1),asPer(drainPipe.backfilling, nzbc_e1as1_t1)),within(drainPipe, trench),not(within(trench.location, peat)), not(above(trench.location, peat)), not(is(trench.soil, unstable)), above(cover, drainPipe),lessThanEqual(cover.height, 2.5 m))), then(permission(and(complyWith(drainPipe.bedding, nzbc_e1as1_f13),complyWith(drainPipe.backfilling, nzbc_e1as1_f13))))
PARAPHRASE: If bedding and backfilling of the drainage pipes are listed in E1/AS1 Table 1, and the trench, the drainage pipe is in, is not located within or above peat, and the trench soil is not unstable, and the cover height to the pipe is not more than 2.5 m, then the bedding and backfilling may comply with E1/AS1 Figure 13.

TEXT: 3.9.3 Trench slope; Where the slope of the trench is 1 in 8 or greater, anti-scour blocks shall be provided.
LRML: if(greaterThanEqual(trench.slope, 1/8)), then(obligation(has(trench, antiScourBlocks)))

TEXT: These anti-scour blocks shall be: Keyed into the sides and floor of the trench by 150 mm.
LRML: if(include(trench, antiScourBlocks)), then(obligation(and(has(antiScourBlocks, keying),has(trench, and(side, floor)),into(keying, and(side, floor)),equal(keying.depth, 150 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: These anti-scour blocks shall have keying into the sides and floor of the trench with a keying depth of 150 mm.

TEXT: 3.9.3 Trench slope; These anti-scour blocks shall be: Spaced at: 7.5 m centres for trench slopes between 1 in 8 and 1 in 5.
LRML: if(and(include(trench, antiScourBlocks), greaterThanEqual(trench.slope, 8.0), lessThan(trench.slope, 5.0))), then(obligation(equal(antiScourBlocks.spacing, 7.5 mCentre)))

TEXT: 3.9.3 Trench slope; These anti-scour blocks shall be: Extended to ground level where the drain cover is less than 300 mm.
LRML: if(and(has(trench, antiScourBlocks),has(drain, cover),lessThan(cover.depth, 300 mm))), then(obligation(is(antiScourBlocks.elevation, groundLevel)))
PARAPHRASE: If the trench has anti-scour blocks and the drain cover is less than 300 mm, these anti-scour blocks shall be extended to ground level elevation.

PARAPHRASE: If the trench has anti-scour blocks and the drain cover is less than 300 mm, these anti-scour blocks shall be extended to ground level elevation.

TEXT: 3.9.3 Trench slope; These anti-scour blocks shall be: Spaced at: 7.5 m centres for trench slopes between 1 in 8 and 1 in 5.
LRML: if(and(include(trench, antiScourBlocks), greaterThanEqual(trench.slope, 1/8), lessThanEqual(trench.slope, 1/5))), then(obligation(equal(antiScourBlocks.spacing, 7.5 mCentre)))
PARAPHRASE: If the trench has anti-scour blocks and the trench slopes greater than or equal 1 in 8 and less than or equal 1 in 5, these anti-scour blocks shall be spaced at 7.5 m centres.

PARAPHRASE: If the trench has anti-scour blocks and the trench slopes greater than or equal 1 in 8 and less than or equal 1 in 5, these anti-scour blocks shall be spaced at 7.5 m centres.

TEXT: 3.9.3 Trench slope; These anti-scour blocks shall be: Spaced at: 5.0 m centres for trench slopes greater than 1 in 5.
LRML: if(and(include(trench, antiScourBlocks), greaterThan(trench.slope, 1/5))), then(obligation(equal(antiScourBlocks.spacing, 5.0 mCentre)))

LRML: if(and(has(trench, antiScourBlocks), greaterThan(trench.slope, 1/5))), then(obligation(equal(antiScourBlocks.spacing, 5.0 mCentre)))
PARAPHRASE: If the trench has anti-scour blocks and the trench slopes greater than 1 in 5, these anti-scour blocks shall be spaced at  5.0 m centres.

TEXT: 3.9.3 Trench slope; These anti-scour blocks shall be: Extended to ground level where the drain cover is less than 300 mm.
LRML: if(and(has(trench, antiScourBlocks),within(drain, trench),has(drain, cover),lessThan(cover.depth, 300 mm))), then(obligation(is(antiScourBlocks.elevation, groundLevel)))
PARAPHRASE: If the trench has anti-scour blocks, the drain is in the trench, and the drain cover is less than 300 mm, these anti-scour blocks shall be ground level elevation.

TEXT: 3.9.4 Trench width; The width B of the trench shall be no less than the pipe diameter D plus 200 mm. Trench width at the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm unless the pipe(s) in the trench are covered with concrete, as shown in Figure 13 (c).
LRML: if(within(pipe, trench)), then(and(obligation(and(define(pipe.diameter, x0),greaterThanEqual(trench.width, 'x0 + 200 mm'))), or(obligation(and(define(topOf(pipe), x1),is(trench.location, x1),lessThanEqual(trench.width, 600 mm))), obligation(and(has(trench, cover),is(cover.material, concrete))))))
PARAPHRASE: If the pip is in a trench, then the width of the trench shall be no less than the pipe diameter plus 200 mm. Trench width at the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm unless the pipe in the trench are covered with concrete.

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: Refer to Figure 48 for example of use. The apron shall: iii) for profiled metal roof cladding, overhang flashing a minimum 10 mm clear of crest and maximum 5 mm clear of trough as shown in Figure 47.

TEXT: 4.0 Flashings 4.6.1.2 Ridges and hips; Refer to Figure 46 for example of use. a) For notched turn-downs of the flashing leave a gap between the flashing and the roof cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.
