TEXT: 1.2.2 If a building contains a number of different activities which individually may be categorised in different risk groups, the risk group designated for a particular firecell within the building shall be that of the primary risk group. The primary risk group shall be that one within the firecell that has the most onerous fire safety requirements.
LRML: if(and(greaterThan(count(building.activity), 1),)), then(obligation(and(has(building.firecell, riskGroups),is(max(riskgroups.fireSafetyRequirements), primaryRiskGroup),is(firecell.riskGroup, primaryRiskGroup))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building contains a number of different activities which individually may be categorised in different risk groups, the risk group designated for a particular firecell within the building shall be that of the primary risk group. The primary risk group shall be that one within the firecell that has the most onerous fire safety requirements.

TEXT: 1.2.2 If a building contains a number of different activities which individually may be categorised in different risk groups, the risk group designated for a particular firecell within the building shall be that of the primary risk group. The primary risk group shall be that one within the firecell that has the most onerous fire safety requirements.
LRML: if(greaterThan(count(building.activity), 1)), then(obligation(and(has(building, firecell),is(firecell.riskGroup, primaryRiskGroup),has(building.firecell, riskGroups),define(max(riskgroups.fireSafetyRequirements), x0),is(primaryRiskGroup, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building contains a number of different activities, the risk group designated for a particular firecell within the building shall be that of the primary risk group. The primary risk group shall be the firecell's risk group that has the maximum fire safety requirements.
COMMENTS:
COMPLEX
riskGroups
Should the primary risk group be handled in a separate rule?

TEXT: 2.3.1 Unless explicitly stated otherwise in this Acceptable Solution, the fire resistance ratings (FRRs) that apply for each risk group shall be in accordance with Table 2.4.
LRML: if(exist(riskGroup)), then(obligation(asPer(riskGroup.fireResistanceRating, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.4')))
PARAPHRASE: Unless explicitly stated otherwise in this Acceptable Solution, the fire resistance ratings (FRRs) that apply for each risk group shall be in accordance with Table 2.4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3.11 Structural framing members connected to building elements with an FRR shall be rated at no less than the building elements to which they are connected.
LRML: if(and(define(building.element, x0), adjoin(x0, structuralFramingMember), define(x0.fireResistanceRating, x1))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(structuralFramingMember.fireResistanceRating, x1)))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3.11 Structural framing members connected to building elements with an FRR shall be rated at no less than the building elements to which they are connected.
LRML: if(and(has(building, element), has(building, structuralFramingMember), connect(structuralFramingMember, element), has(element, fireResistanceRating))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(structuralFramingMember.fireResistanceRating, fireResistanceRating)))
PARAPHRASE: Structural framing members connected to building elements with an FRR shall be rated at no less than the building elements to which they are connected.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3.11 Structural framing members connected to building elements with an FRR shall be rated at no less than the building elements to which they are connected.
LRML: if(and(has(building, structuralFramingMember), has(building, element), connect(building.structuralFramingMember, element), has(element, fireResistanceRating))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(structuralFramingMember.fireResistanceRating, fireResistanceRating)))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.3 If there is more than one risk group on one floor in the building, the highest required FRR shall be applied to common spaces and shared escape routes for that floor level.
LRML: if(and(greaterThan(count(buildingStorey.riskGroup), 1), or(is(buildingStorey.space, common)),and(is(buildingStorey.space, escapeRoute)),is(escapeRoute, shared))))), then(obligation(and(define(max(riskGroup.fireResistanceRating), x0),equal(space.fireResistanceRating, x0))))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.3 If there is more than one risk group on one floor in the building, the highest required FRR shall be applied to common spaces and shared escape routes for that floor level.

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.4 FRRs shall apply to the sides of primary elements and secondary elements which are exposed to fire.

If an element is primary or secondary

Fire resistance ratings shall apply to the sides of primary elements and secondary elements which are exposed to fire.

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Are unable to self-evacuate without assistance through requiring special care or treatment, or they are restrained, or their liberties are restricted (SI).

TEXT: 3.9.4 Trench width; The width B of the trench shall be no less than the pipe diameter D plus 200 mm. Trench width at the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm unless the pipe(s) in the trench are covered with concrete, as shown in Figure 13 (c).
LRML: if(within(pipe, trench)), then(and(obligation(and(define(pipe.diameter, x0),greaterThanEqual(trench.width, 'x0 + 200 mm'))), or(obligation(and(define(topOf(pipe), x1),define(trench.width, x2),is(x2.elevation, x1),lessThanEqual(x2, 600 mm))), obligation(and(has(pipe, cover),is(cover.material, concrete))))))
PARAPHRASE: If the pip is in a trench, then the width of the trench shall be no less than the pipe diameter plus 200 mm. Trench width at the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm or the pipe in the trench is covered with concrete.
COMMENTS:

within/for
width at top of -> trench.width.elevation

TEXT: Chimneys shall not cantilever more than 2.4 m above the fixing at roof level (refer Paragraph 1.7).
LRML: if(exist(chimney)), then(obligation(and(above(chimney.height, fixing),has(chimney, fixing),is(fixing.elevation, roofLevel),lessThanEqual(chimney.height, 2.4 m))))
PARAPHRASE: For chimneys, the chimney height above the fixing at roof level shall not be more than 2.4 m.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.3 Size; The width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed: a) For the foundation and chimney base – precast pumice concrete 1600 mm wide x 1050 mm deep.
LRML: if(or(has(chimney, foundation), has(chimney, chimneyBase))), then(obligation(and(or(define(foundation.width, x0), define(chimneyBase.width, x0)),is(x0.measurement, alongBuildingLine),or(define(foundation.depth, x1), define(chimneyBase.depth, x1)),is(x1.measurement, perpendicularBuildingLine), is(chimney.material, precastPumiceConcrete),lessThanEqual(x0, 1600 mm),lessThanEqual(x1, 1050 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: For the precast pumice concrete chimney's foundation and chimney base, the width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed 1600 mm width and 1050 mm depth.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.3 Size; The width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed: For a brick chimney stack – double skin (see Figure 3) - 1200 mm wide x 680 mm deep.
LRML: if(and(is(chimneyStack.material, brick),is(chimneyStack.type, doubleSkin))), then(obligation(and(define(chimneyStack.width, x0),is(x0.measurement, alongBuildingLine),define(chimneyStack.depth, x1),is(x1.measurement, perpendicularBuildingLine), lessThanEqual(x0, 1200 mm),lessThanEqual(x1, 680 mm))))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.4 Chimney liners; Where chimney liners are used they are to be separated from the chimney to ensure free thermal movement. This shall be achieved by coating the liner with a suitable debonding agent or by wrapping it in a combustible material no less than 0.25 mm thick.
LRML: if(has(chimney, chimneyLiner)), then(or(and(obligation(has(chimneyLiner, coating)), obligation(is(coating.material, debondingAgent))), and(obligation(has(chimneyLiner, wrapping)), obligation(is(wrapping.type, combustible)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(wrapping.thickness, 0.25 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: Where the chimney has chimney liners are used they are to be separated from the chimney to ensure free thermal movement. This shall be achieved by coating the liner with a suitable debonding agent or by wrapping it in a combustible material no less than 0.25 mm thick.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.2.1 Chimney wall thicknesses shall be no less than: a) Brick – single skin (see Figure 2) 155 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.material, brick), is(brick.type, singleSkin), has(chimney, wall))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(wall.thickness, 155 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: Brick – single skin chimneys shall have a wall thicknesses of no less than 155 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.3.3 The chimney foundation walls shall be 150 mm thick reinforced concrete, 190 mm thick concrete masonry, or brick construction complying with Figures 2 or 3. Vertical and horizontal reinforcing steel shall be as given in Paragraph 1.6.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, foundation), has(foundation, wall))), then(and(obligation(or(and(greaterThanEqual(wall.thickness,150 mm),is(wall.material,reinforcedConcrete)),and(greaterThanEqual(wall.thickness,190 mm),is(wall.material,concreteMasonry)),and(is(wall.material,brick),complyWith(wall, or(nzbc_b1as3_f2, nzbc_b1as3_f3))))),  obligation(asPer(wall.reinforcingSteel, 'nzbc_b1as3_1.6'))))
PARAPHRASE: The chimney foundation walls shall be 150 mm thick reinforced concrete, 190 mm thick concrete masonry, or brick construction complying with B1/AS3 Figures 2 or 3. Reinforcing steel shall be as given in B1/AS3 Paragraph 1.6.

TEXT: 2.2.1 Fire safety system types, as defined in Table 2.2, shall be provided throughout firecells and be as specified in: Table 2.2d for risk group VP.

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: a) In single storey early childhood centres, dedicated sleeping areas shall be protected with supplementary smoke detectors. The alarm system and any smoke detection system shall comply with NZS 4512.
LRML: if(and(equal(count(buildingStorey), 1), is(space.activity, and(earlyChildhood, sleeping)))), then(obligation(and(has(space,smokeDetector),is(smokeDetector,supplementary),complyWith(smokeDetector,nzs_4512))))
PARAPHRASE: If there is one building storey and the space activity is early childhood and sleeping, the space shall be protected with supplementary smoke detectors complying with NZS 4512.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE.
Would need to be split into two cases? sleeping and not sleeping?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.1 Building elements, including materials, components and systems, complying with a publication referenced in the Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods, satisfy B2 requirements only when the conditions of use stated in the publication and Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods prevail.
LRML: if(and(or(has(nzbc_b2as, reference), has(nzbc_b2vm, reference)), towards(reference, publication), or(complyWith(building.element, publication), complyWith(building.material, publication), complyWith(building.component, publication), complyWith(building.system, publication)), is(publication.conditionOfUse, true),is(nzbc_b2as.conditionOfUse, true),is(nzbc_b2vm.conditionOfUse, true))), then(and(complyWith(building.element, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.material, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.component, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.system, nzbc_b2)))
PARAPHRASE:
If a publication is referenced in the B2/AS or B2/VM and building elements, materials, components or systems comply with the publication, 

Building elements, including materials, components and systems, complying with a publication referenced in the Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods, satisfy B2 requirements only when the conditions of use stated in the publication and Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods prevail.

TEXT: 1.1.1 Building elements, including materials, components and systems, complying with a publication referenced in the Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods, satisfy B2 requirements only when the conditions of use stated in the publication and Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods prevail.
LRML: if(and(or(has(nzbc_b2as.reference, publication), has(nzbc_b2vm.reference, publication)), or(complyWith(building.element, publication), complyWith(building.material, publication), complyWith(building.component, publication), complyWith(building.system, publication)), is(publication.conditionOfUse, true),is(nzbc_b2as.conditionOfUse, true),is(nzbc_b2vm.conditionOfUse, true))), then(and(complyWith(building.element, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.material, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.component, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.system, nzbc_b2)))
PARAPHRASE: If a publication is referenced in B2/AS or B2/VM, and building elements, materials, components or systems comply with the publication, and the conditions of use stated in the publication and B2/AS and B2/VM are true, then the building elements, materials, components or systems comply with NZBC B2.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
Should "building element include" be translated literaly? - What is the scope of this, does this still apply to 2.1.2.0.2?

TEXT: 3.4.1 NZS 4297 and NZS 4299 are acceptable solutions for meeting the durability requirements of earth buildings within their scope.
LRML: if(is(building.material, earth)), then(permission(complyWith(building, and(nzs_4297, nzs_4299))))
PARAPHRASE: Earth buildings may comply with the durability requirements in NZS 4251: Part 1.

TEXT: 3.5.1 NZS 4223.2 is an Acceptable Solution for meeting the durability requirements of insulating glass units, within its scope.
LRML: if(exist(insulatedGlassUnit)), then(permission(complyWith(insulatedGlassUnit.durability, nzs_4223_2)))
PARAPHRASE: insulating glass units may comply with the durability requirements in NZS 4297 and NZS 4299.

TEXT: 3.4.1 NZS 4297 and NZS 4299 are acceptable solutions for meeting the durability requirements of earth buildings within their scope.
LRML: if(is(building.material, earth)), then(permission(complyWith(building.durability, and(nzs_4297, nzs_4299))))
PARAPHRASE: Earth buildings may comply with the durability requirements in NZS 4297 and NZS 4299.

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is one of three Acceptable Solutions that provide a means of establishing compliance with NZBC Clauses C1 to C6 Protection from Fire. It can be used for the building activities covered by risk groups specified in Paragraph 1.1.1 and described in Table 1.1.
LRML: if(and(complyWith(building, nzbc_cas2), asPer(building.riskGroup, and('nzbc_cas2_1.1.1', 'nzbc_cas2_t1.1')))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.fireProtection, and(nzbc_c1, nzbc_c2, nzbc_c3, nzbc_c5, nzbc_c6))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building complies to CAS2 and the building risk groups is in CAS2 Paragraph 1.1.1 and Table 1.1, the building establishing compliance with NZBC Clauses C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, and C6.

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; For backcountry huts, please refer to Acceptable Solution BCH/AS1.
LRML: if(obligation(is(building.activity, backcountryHut))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.fireProtection, nzbc_bchas1)))
PARAPHRASE: For backcountry huts, the building may comply with BCH/AS1.

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; For backcountry huts, please refer to Acceptable Solution BCH/AS1.
LRML: if(is(building.activity, backcountryHut)), then(obligation(complyWith(building, nzbc_bchas1)))
PARAPHRASE: For buildings with activity backcountry huts, the building may comply with BCH/AS1.

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: The apron shall: iii) for profiled metal roof cladding, overhang flashing a minimum 10 mm clear of crest and maximum 5 mm clear of trough as shown in Figure 47.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), above(flashing, metalRoofing), is(flashing, parallel),has(metalRoofing, cladding),is(cladding.material, profiledMetal))), then(obligation(and(has(cladding, crest),towards(flashing.clearance, crest),greaterThanEqual(flashing.clearance, 10 mm),has(cladding, trough),towards(flashing.clearance,trough),lessThanEqual(flashing.clearance, 5 mm),asPer(clearance, nzbc_e2as1_f47))))
PARAPHRASE: If apron flashings are over metal roofing, the flashings are parallel, and the metal roofing has profiled metal roof cladding, then the flashing shall have a minimum 10 mm clearance to the cladding crest and maximum 5 mm clearance to the cladding trough as shown in Figure 47.

TEXT: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: The apron shall: ii) for profiled metal roof cladding, cover at least two crests, (turned-up edge to full crest height constitutes a crest).
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), above(flashing, metalRoofing), is(flashing, parallel),has(metalRoofing, cladding),is(cladding.material, profiledMetal))), then(obligation(and(has(cladding, crest),include(flashing.cover, crest),greaterThanEqual(count(crest),2))))
PARAPHRASE: If apron flashings are over metal roofing, the flashings are parallel, and the metal roofing has profiled metal roof cladding, then the flashing shall cover at least two crests of the cladding.
COMMENTS:
flashing.cover or above(flashing, ...)
Connect crest to cladding?

TEXT: 1.8.5 Reinforcing steel; Reinforcing used in chimneys shall: For in-situ concrete, have cover to the steel in accordance with NZS 3109.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, reinforcingSteel), is(chimney.construction, inSituConcrete))), then(and(obligation(has(chimney.reinforcingSteel, cover)), obligation(complyWith(cover.thickness, nzs_3109))))
PARAPHRASE: Reinforcing steel used in chimneys shall: For in-situ concrete, have cover to the steel in accordance with NZS 3109.

TEXT: 1.8.5 Reinforcing steel; Reinforcing used in chimneys shall: For in-situ concrete, have cover to the steel in accordance with NZS 3109.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, reinforcingSteel), is(chimney.construction, inSituConcrete))), then(and(obligation(has(chimney.reinforcingSteel, cover)), obligation(complyWith(cover.thickness, nzs_3109))))

TEXT: 1.8.5 Reinforcing steel; Reinforcing used in chimneys shall: For in-situ concrete, have cover to the steel in accordance with NZS 3109.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, reinforcingSteel), is(chimney.material, inSituConcrete))), then(obligation(and(has(reinforcingSteel,cover),asPer(cover, nzs_3109))))
PARAPHRASE: Reinforcing steel used in in-situ concrete chimneys shall have cover to the reinforcing steel in accordance with NZS 3109.
COMMENTS: Kept the usage of the title. This might require review in earlier clauses.

TEXT: 1.9.3 The number of bracing units to be provided for each chimney connection (see Paragraph 1.9.4) is given in Table 2.
LRML: if(exist(chimney)), then(obligation(loop(forEach(chimney.connection), and(obligation(complyWith(count(bracing.unit), table)), obligation(equal(table.key, t2))))))
PARAPHRASE: For each chimney connection the number of bracing units to be provided for each chimney connection is given in Table 2.

TEXT: 1.9.3 The number of bracing units to be provided for each chimney connection (see Paragraph 1.9.4) is given in Table 2.
LRML: if(exist(chimney)), then(obligation(loop(forEach(chimney.connection), asPer(count(bracing.unit), nzbc_b1as3_t2))))
PARAPHRASE: For each chimney connection the number of bracing units shall be as given in Table 2.

TEXT: 1.9.4 A chimney shall be considered as connected to the building when: a) At roof level: it is held either by a roof bracket or by a roof tie.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.elevation, roofLevel), is(chimney.fixture, or(roofBracket, roofTie)))), then(connect(chimney, building))
PARAPHRASE: A chimney shall be considered as connected to the building when: a) At roof level: it is held either by a roof bracket or by a roof tie.

TEXT: 1.9.4 A chimney shall be considered as connected to the building when: a) At roof level: it is held either by a roof bracket or by a roof tie.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, fixing),is(fixing.type, or(roofBracket, roofTie)),is(fixing.elevation, roofLevel))), then(connect(chimney, building))
PARAPHRASE: If a chimney is fixed by a roof bracket or by a roof tie and the fixing elevation is roof level, the chimney is considered connected to the building.

TEXT: 1.9.4 A chimney shall be considered as connected to the building when: At an intermediate floor level: it is held either by a floor bracket or by closely spaced wall ties spanning the floor.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.elevation, intermediateFloorLevel), or(is(chimney.fixture, floorBracket), and(is(chimney.fixture, wallTie), inBetween(wallTie.span, floor), is(wallTie.spacing, close))))), then(connect(chimney, building))
PARAPHRASE: If a chimney at ground floor level is fixed by a floor bracket or the chimney base is part of the building foundation wall, the chimney is considered connected to the building.

TEXT: 1.9.4 A chimney shall be considered as connected to the building when: At an intermediate floor level: it is held either by a floor bracket or by closely spaced wall ties spanning the floor.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.elevation, intermediateFloor), or(is(chimney.fixture, floorBracket), and(is(chimney.fixture, wallTie), inBetween(wallTie.span, floor), is(wallTie.spacing, close))))), then(connect(chimney, building))

TEXT: Structural diaphragms shall be provided at roof/ceiling level and at each floor level to which the chimney is connected. The diaphragms shall comply with all relevant clauses of NZS 3604 and NZS 4229.
LRML: if(and(has(building, chimney), or(is(building.buildingStorey, or(roof, ceiling)), connect(building.buildingStorey, chimney)))), then(obligation(and(has(buildingStorey,diaphragm),complyWith(diaphragm, and(nzs_3604,nzs_4229)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the building has a chimney and the building storey is roof or ceiling level, or the building storey is connected to the chimney, diaphragms shall be provided. The diaphragms shall comply with NZS 3604 and NZS 4229.

TEXT: Structural diaphragms shall be provided at roof/ceiling level and at each floor level to which the chimney is connected. The diaphragms shall comply with all relevant clauses of NZS 3604 and NZS 4229.
LRML: if(and(has(building, chimney), or(is(building.buildingStorey, or(roof, ceiling)), connect(building.buildingStorey, chimney)))), then(obligation(and(has(buildingStorey,diaphragm),complyWith(diaphragm, and(nzs_3604,nzs_4229)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the building has a chimney and the building storey is roof or ceiling level, or the building storey is connected to the chimney, diaphragms shall be provided. The diaphragms shall comply with NZS 3604 and NZS 4229.

TEXT: The bracing units required as determined from Paragraph 1.9.3 shall be provided solely by that wall.
LRML: if(asPer(bracing.unit, 'nzbc_b1as3_1.9.3')), then(obligation(by(bracing.unit, wall)))
PARAPHRASE: The bracing units determined from B1/AS3 Paragraph 1.9.3 shall be provided by that wall.

TEXT: 2.1.1 Chimneys for solid fuel burning appliances shall comply with Paragraph 1.0 or with the relevant sections of AS/NZS 3869 and AS/NZS 2918 for sheetmetal chimneys.
LRML: if(for(chimney, solidFuelBurningAppliance)), then(obligation(or(complyWith(chimney, nzbc_b1as3_1),and(is(chimney.material, sheetmetal),complyWith(chimney, and(nzs_3869, nzs_2918))))))
PARAPHRASE: Chimneys for solid fuel burning appliances shall comply with Paragraph 1.0 or sheetmetal chimneys shall comply with NZS 3869 and NZS 2918.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
Can sheetmetal chimneys comply with 1.0?
omniclass: solidFuelFireplace

TEXT: Acceptable fill materials shown in Figure 13 are: Bedding material of clean granular non-cohesive material with a maximum particle size of 20 mm.
LRML: if(is(fillMaterial, beddingMaterial)), then(obligation(and(is(fillMaterial,and(clean,granular,nonCohesive)),lessThanEqual(fillMaterial.particleSize,20 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the fill material is bedding material, the fill material shall be of clean granular non-cohesive material with a maximum particle size of 20 mm.

TEXT: Acceptable fill materials shown in Figure 13 are: Selected compacted fill of any fine-grained soil or granular material which is free from topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm.
LRML: if(is(fillMaterial, beddingMaterial)), then(obligation(and(is(fillMaterial,and(clean,granular,nonCohesive)),lessThanEqual(fillMaterial.particleSize,20 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the Fill materials is selected compated fill, the fill materials shall be compacted and of any fine-grained soil or granular material, the fill material shall not include topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Acceptable fill materials shown in Figure 13 are: Selected compacted fill of any fine-grained soil or granular material which is free from topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(fillMaterial, beddingMaterial),is(fillMaterial.type, compacted))), then(obligation(and(is(fillMaterial,or(fineGrainedSoil, granular)),lessThanEqual(fillMaterial.particleSize,20 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the Fill materials is selected compated fill, the fill materials shall be compacted and of any fine-grained soil or granular material, the fill material shall not include topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Acceptable fill materials shown in Figure 13 are: Selected compacted fill of any fine-grained soil or granular material which is free from topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(fillMaterial, beddingMaterial),is(fillMaterial.type, compacted))), then(obligation(and(is(fillMaterial,or(fineGrainedSoil, granular)),not(include(fillMaterial, and(topsoil, rubbish)),lessThanEqual(fillMaterial.particleSize,20 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the Fill materials is selected compacted fill, the fill materials shall be of any fine-grained soil or granular material, the fill material shall not include topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm.

TEXT: Acceptable fill materials shown in Figure 13 are: Selected compacted fill of any fine-grained soil or granular material which is free from topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(fillMaterial, beddingMaterial),is(fillMaterial.type, compacted))), then(obligation(and(is(fillMaterial,or(fineGrainedSoil, granular)),not(include(fillMaterial, and(topsoil, rubbish)),lessThanEqual(fillMaterial.particleSize,20 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the Fill materials is selected compacted fill, the fill materials shall be of any fine-grained soil or granular material, the fill material shall not include topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm.

TEXT: 4.6 Flashing overlaps and upstands; Overlaps and upstands to flashings shall be as specified in this paragraph and Table 7.
LRML: if(has(flashing, or(overlap, upstand))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(overlap,and('nzbc_e2as1_4.6',nzbc_e2as1_t7)),complyWith(upstand,and('nzbc_e2as1_4.6',nzbc_e2as1_t7)))))

TEXT: Where a notched turn-down is used there shall be a gap between the edge of the flashing and the pan of the roof cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.
LRML: if(and(has(flashing, and(notchedTurnDown, edge)), has(roofCladding, pan))), then(obligation(and(inBetween(gap,and(edge,pan)),lessThanEqual(gap.size,5 mm))))

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Transverse flashing: Refer to Figure 7 for example of use. The apron shall have: ii) a minimum effective cover to roof cladding, excluding any soft edge or turn-down to the flashing, as shown in Table 7.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), include(flashing.overlap, roofCladding), over(flashing.cover, metalRoofing), is(flashing, transverse), has(flashing, or(softEdge, turnDown)))), then(obligation(and(has(flashing,minimumEffectiveCover),to(minimumEffectiveCover,roofCladding),exclude(minimumEffectiveCover,or(softEdge,turnDown)))))

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: Refer to Figure 48 for example of use. The apron shall: iii) for profiled metal roof cladding, overhang flashing a minimum 10 mm clear of crest and maximum 5 mm clear of trough as shown in Figure 47.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), to(flashing.overlap, roofCladding), over(flashing.cover, metalRoofing), is(flashing, parallel), has(roofCladding, profile))), then(obligation(and(include(flashing.clearance,crest),greaterThanEqual(crest.clearance,10 mm),include(flashing.clearance,trough),lessThanEqual(trough.clearance,5 mm))))

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: Refer to Figure 48 for example of use. The apron shall: iii) for profiled metal roof cladding, overhang flashing a minimum 10 mm clear of crest and maximum 5 mm clear of trough as shown in Figure 47.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), to(flashing.overlap, roofCladding), over(flashing.cover, metalRoofing), is(flashing, parallel), has(roofCladding, profile))), then(obligation(and(include(flashing.clearance,crest),greaterThanEqual(crest.clearance,10 mm),include(flashing.clearance,trough),lessThanEqual(trough.clearance,5 mm))))

TEXT: 4.0 Flashings 4.6.1.2 Ridges and hips; Refer to Figure 46 for example of use. a) For notched turn-downs of the flashing leave a gap between the flashing and the roof cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, ridgesAndHips), to(flashing.overlap, roofCladding), has(flashing, notchedTurnDown))), then(obligation(and(inBetween(gap,and(flashing,roofCladding)),lessThanEqual(gap.size,5 mm))))

TEXT: 4.0 Flashings 4.6.1.2 Ridges and hips; Refer to Figure 46 for example of use. b) There shall be a minimum effective cover to roof cladding, excluding any soft edge or turn-down to the flashing, in accordance with Table 7.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, ridgesAndHips), to(flashing.overlap, roofCladding))), then(obligation(and(has(flashing,minimumEffectiveCover),to(minimumEffectiveCover,roofCladding),exclude(minimumEffectiveCover,or(softEdge,turnDown)))))

TEXT: 1.7.7 Wall ties (see Figure 7(a)) shall be located in mortar joints at 225 mm maximum centres up each side of the chimney for chimneys not wider than 600 mm.
LRML: if(and(lessThanEqual(chimney.width, 600 mm), has(chimney, wallTie))), then(obligation(and(within(wallTie,mortarJoint),loop(forEach(chimney.side),lessThanEqual(wallTie.elevation, 225 mmCentres)))))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys are not wider than 600 mm and have wall ties, for each side of the chimney the wall tie shall be located in mortar joints at 225 mm maximum centres elevation.
COMMENTS:
wallTie if or then?
up -> elevation?

TEXT: 1.7.7 Wall ties (see Figure 7(a)) shall be located in mortar joints at 225 mm maximum centres up each side of the chimney for chimneys not wider than 600 mm.
LRML: if(and(lessThanEqual(chimney.width, 600 mm), has(chimney, wallTie))), then(obligation(loop(forEach(chimney.side),and(      within(wallTie,mortarJoint),lessThanEqual(wallTie.elevation, 225 mmCentres)))))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys are not wider than 600 mm and have wall ties, for each side of the chimney the wall tie shall be located in mortar joints at 225 mm maximum centres elevation.

wallTie if or then?
up -> elevation?

TEXT: 1.7.6 Brick chimneys; Brick chimneys shall be restrained at roof level by a zinc coated 50 x 1.0 mm mild steel 'U' strap used in conjunction with closely spaced wall ties.
LRML: if(is(chimney.material, brick)), then(and(obligation(and(has(chimney, fixing),is(fixing.elevation, roofLevel), include(fixing.type, and(uStrap, wallTie)), is(uStrap.material, mildSteel), is(uStrap.type, zincCoated), equal(uStrap.length, 50 mm'), equal(uStrap.depth, 1 mm), is(wallTie.spacing, close)))))
PARAPHRASE: Brick chimneys shall be fixed at roof level by 'U' straps and wall ties. The 'U' straps are zinc coated 50 length, 1.0 mm depth, mild steel and wall ties are closely spaced.

TEXT: 1.7.6 Brick chimneys; Brick chimneys shall be restrained at roof level by a zinc coated 50 x 1.0 mm mild steel 'U' strap used in conjunction with closely spaced wall ties.
LRML: if(is(chimney.material, brick)), then(and(obligation(and(has(chimney, fixing),is(fixing.elevation, roofLevel), include(fixing.type, and(uStrap, wallTie)), is(uStrap.material, mildSteel), is(uStrap.type, zincCoated), equal(uStrap.length, 50 mm), equal(uStrap.depth, 1 mm), is(wallTie.spacing, close)))))
PARAPHRASE: Brick chimneys shall be fixed at roof level by 'U' straps and wall ties. The 'U' straps are zinc coated 50 length, 1.0 mm depth, mild steel and wall ties are closely spaced.

TEXT: 1.7.9 Where zinc coating of components is required it shall be no less than 300 g/m2 in accordance with AS 1397.
LRML: if(obligation(has(component, zincCoating))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(zincCoating.density,300 g/m2),asPer(zincCoating.density,as_1397))))
PARAPHRASE: Where zinc coating of components is obliged it shall be no less than 300 g/m2 in accordance with AS 1397.

TEXT: 1.7.9 Where zinc coating of components is required it shall be no less than 300 g/m2 in accordance with AS 1397.
LRML: if(obligation(has(component, zincCoating))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(zincCoating.density, 300 g/m2),asPer(zincCoating.density, as_1397))))
PARAPHRASE: Where zinc coating of components is obliged it shall be no less than 300 g/m2 in accordance with AS 1397.

TEXT: 1.7.9 Where zinc coating of components is required it shall be no less than 300 g/m2 in accordance with AS 1397.
LRML: if(obligation(has(component, zincCoating))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(zincCoating.density, 300 g/m2),asPer(zincCoating.density, as_1397))))
PARAPHRASE: Where zinc coating of components is obliged it shall be no less than 300 g/m2 in accordance with AS 1397.

TEXT: 1.8.2 Chimney foundations of reinforced concrete shall comply with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109 for ordinary grade concrete.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, foundation), is(foundation.construction, reinforcedConcrete), is(concrete.grade, ordinary))), then(obligation(complyWith(foundation, nzs_3109)))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys foundations are reinforced concrete and the reinforced concrete is ordinary grade, the foundations shall comply with NZS 3109.

TEXT: 1.8.2 Concrete; Chimneys of reinforced concrete, shall comply with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109 for ordinary grade concrete.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.material, reinforcedConcrete), is(reinforcedConcrete.grade, ordinary))), then(obligation(complyWith(chimney, nzs_3109)))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys are reinforced concrete and the reinforced concrete is ordinary grade, the chimney shall comply with NZS 3109.

TEXT: 1.8.2 Chimney foundations of reinforced concrete shall comply with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109 for ordinary grade concrete.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, foundation), is(foundation.material, reinforcedConcrete), is(reinforcedConcrete.grade, ordinary))), then(obligation(complyWith(foundation, nzs_3109)))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys foundations are reinforced concrete and the reinforced concrete is ordinary grade, the foundations shall comply with NZS 3109.

TEXT: 1.8.2 Chimney hearth slabs of reinforced concrete shall comply with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109 for ordinary grade concrete.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, slab), is(slab.type, hearth), is(slab.construction, reinforcedConcrete), is(reinforcedConcrete.grade, ordinary))), then(obligation(complyWith(slab, nzs_3109)))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys hearth slabs are reinforced concrete and the reinforced concrete is ordinary grade, the slab shall comply with NZS 3109.

TEXT: 1.8.4 Concrete masonry; Concrete masonry construction for chimney foundation walls shall conform to the relevant sections of NZS 4229.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, foundation), has(foundation, wall), is(wall.construction, concreteMasonry))), then(obligation(complyWith(wall.construction, nzs_4229)))
PARAPHRASE: If the chimney's foundation walls are constructed with concrete masonry, the wall construction shall conform to the relevant sections of NZS 4229.

TEXT: 1.8.4 Concrete masonry; Concrete masonry construction for chimney foundation walls shall conform to the relevant sections of NZS 4229.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, foundation), has(foundation, wall), is(wall.construction, concreteMasonry))), then(obligation(complyWith(wall.construction, nzs_4229)))
PARAPHRASE: If the chimney's foundation walls are constructed with concrete masonry, the wall construction shall conform to NZS 4229.

TEXT: Reinforcing used in chimneys is to conform to AS/NZS 4671.
LRML: if(has(chimney, reinforcing)), then(obligation(complyWith(reinforcing, nzs_4671)))
PARAPHRASE: The chimney's reinforcing shall conform to NZS 4671.

TEXT: Where necessary, expansion joints shall be formed as shown in Figure 6, with: i) minimum 200 mm laps, and ii) sliding clips at both sides of the lap.
LRML: if(exist(expansionJoint)), then(obligation(and(asPer(expansionJoint, nzbc_e2as1_f6),has(expansionJoint, lap),greaterThanEqual(lap.width, 200 mm),has(lap.side, slidingClip))))
PARAPHRASE: If an expansion joint exist, then the expansion joint shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 6, with minimum 200 mm wide laps, and ii) sliding clips at both sides of the lap.

TEXT: 4.6 Flashing overlaps and upstands; Overlaps and upstands to flashings shall be as specified in this paragraph and Table 7.
LRML: if(has(flashing, or(lap, upstand))), then(obligation(and(asPer(lap, and('nzbc_e2as1_4.6', nzbc_e2as1_t7)),asPer(upstand, and('nzbc_e2as1_4.6', nzbc_e2as1_t7)))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings have laps or upstands, the laps and upstands shall be as specified in E2/AS1 4.6 and E2/AS1 Table 7.
COMMENTS:
Two ways, exist(flashing) vs has(flashing, overlap or upstand).
Exist might be invoked more often, but is clearer regarding the and/or.

TEXT: Where a turn-down to the cover flashing for profiled metal claddings is required, use: b) A notched turn-down or soft edge flashing for trapezoidal profiles with rib height not exceeding 30 mm and/or rib centres not exceeding 200 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.material, profiledMetal), has(cladding, flashing), is(flashing.type, cover), obligation(has(flashing, turnDown)), is(profiledMetal, trapezoidal), or(lessThanEqual(profiledMetal.ribHeight, 30 mm), lessThanEqual(profiledMetal.ribCentres, 200 mm)))), then(obligation(or(is(turnDown.type, notched),is(flashing.edge, soft))))
PARAPHRASE: If cladding material is profiled metal, the cladding has cover flashings, the flashing required a turn-down, and the profiled metal is trapezoidal and the profiled metal rib height is not exceeding 30 mm or profiled metal rib centres not exceeding 200 mm, then the turn-down shall be notched or flashing edges soft.

TEXT: Where a turn-down to the cover flashing for profiled metal claddings is required, use: c) A notched turn-down for trapezoidal profiles with rib height exceeding 30 mm and/or rib centres exceeding 200 mm.

PARAPHRASE: Where a turn-down to the cover flashing for profiled metal claddings is required, use: c) A notched turn-down for trapezoidal profiles with rib height exceeding 30 mm and/or rib centres exceeding 200 mm.

PARAPHRASE: If cladding material is profiled metal, the cladding has cover flashings, the flashing required a turn-down, and the profiled metal is trapezoidal and the profiled metal rib height is exceeding 30 mm or profiled metal rib centres exceeding 200 mm, then the turn-down shall be notched.

TEXT: Where a turn-down to the cover flashing for profiled metal claddings is required, use: d) A notched turn-down for trough profiles.

TEXT: Where a turn-down to the cover flashing for profiled metal claddings is required, use: d) A notched turn-down for trough profiles.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.material, profiledMetal), has(cladding, flashing), is(flashing.type, cover), requires(flashing, turnDown), is(profiledMetal.type, trapezoidal))), then(obligation(has(flashing, notchedTurnDown)))

TEXT: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Transverse flashing: Refer to Figure 7 for example of use. The apron shall have: i) for notched turn-downs, a gap between the flashing and the pan of the roof cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), above(flashing, metalRoofing), is(flashing, transverse), has(flashing, turnDown),is(turnDown.type, notched))), then(obligation(and(has(cladding, pan),inBetween(gap,and(flashing,pan)),lessThanEqual(gap.size,5 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If apron flashings are over metal roofing, and the flashings are transverse, and the flashing have notched turn-downs, then there shall be a gap between the flashing and the pan of the roof cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Transverse flashing: Refer to Figure 7 for example of use. The apron shall have: ii) a minimum effective cover to roof cladding, excluding any soft edge or turn-down to the flashing, as shown in Table 7.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), above(flashing, metalRoofing), is(flashing, transverse))), then(obligation(and(towards(flashing.minimumEffectiveCover,roofCladding),exclude(flashing.minimumEffectiveCover,or(softEdge,turnDown)),asPer(flashing.minimumEffectiveCover, nzbc_e2as1_t7))))
PARAPHRASE: If apron flashings are over metal roofing, and the flashings are transverse, and the flashing have notched turn-downs, then the flashing shall have: ii) a minimum effective cover to roof cladding, excluding any soft edge or turn-down to the flashing, as shown in E2/AS1 Table 7.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
Not connected: softEdge, turnDown
Split: softEdge

TEXT: 1.2.2 If a building contains a number of different activities which individually may be categorised in different risk groups, the risk group designated for a particular room within a building shall be that of the primary risk group.
LRML: if(and(greaterThan(count(space.activity), 1), loop(in(max(activity.riskGroup), space), define(riskGroup.stringency, x0)))), then(obligation(is(space.riskGroup, x0)))

TEXT: 1.2.2 If a building contains a number of different activities which individually may be categorised in different risk groups, the risk group designated for a particular firecell within the building shall be that of the primary risk group. The primary risk group shall be that one within the firecell that has the most onerous fire safety requirements.
LRML: if(greaterThan(count(building.activity), 1)), then(obligation(and(has(building, firecell),is(firecell.riskGroup, primaryRiskGroup),has(building.firecell, riskGroups),define(max(riskgroups.fireSafetyRequirements), x0),is(primaryRiskGroup, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building contains a number of different activities, the risk group designated for a particular firecell within the building shall be that of the primary risk group. The primary risk group shall be the firecell's risk group that has the maximum fire safety requirements.

TEXT: Other risk groups may be able to be incorporated within the same space provided these are ancillary to, and support, the primary risk groups.
LRML: if(and(is(space.activity, ancillary), partOf(space, firecell), is(firecell.riskGroup, primaryRiskGroup))), then(obligation(is(space.riskGroup, primaryRiskGroup)))

TEXT: 1.2.3 Depending on the particular building and the uses or activities within that building, there may be several primary risk groups, with one or more on each floor.
LRML: if(has(building, primaryRiskGroup)), then(permission(greaterThan(count(primaryRiskGroup), 1)))

TEXT: Where buildings are based on NZS 3604, but require specific engineering design input, the framing shall be of at least equivalent stiffness to the framing provisions of NZS 3604.

TEXT: Attached garages that are integral with the weathertightness envelope of the building are included within the scope of this Acceptable Solution.

TEXT: Attached garages that are integral with the weathertightness envelope of the building are included within the scope of this Acceptable Solution.

TEXT: 1.8.5 Reinforcing steel; Reinforcing used in chimneys shall: For precast pumice concrete, be placed with grout in the preformed ducts in the units.

TEXT: 1.9.4 A chimney shall be considered as connected to the building when: At an intermediate floor level: it is held either by a floor bracket or by closely spaced wall ties spanning the floor.

TEXT: 1.9.4 A chimney shall be considered as connected to the building when: At an intermediate floor level: it is held either by a floor bracket or by closely spaced wall ties spanning the floor.

TEXT: 1.4 Calculating occupant loads 1.4.3 Duplication shall be avoided by: Not including an occupant load for exitways, or for the occupant load determined for areas such as lift lobbies or sanitary facilities that are used intermittently by people already counted elsewhere in the building.
LRML: if(and(has(space, occupant), or(is(space.type, exitway), is(space.usage, intermittent)))), then(obligation(not(has(space, occupantLoad))))
PARAPHRASE: If a space has occupants but is an exitway or used intermittently, the space has no occupant load.

TEXT: 4.0 Flashings 4.6.1.2 Ridges and hips; Refer to Figure 46 for example of use. b) There shall be a minimum effective cover to roof cladding, excluding any soft edge or turn-down to the flashing, in accordance with Table 7.
LRML: if(for(flashing, or(ridge, hip))), then(obligation(and(towards(flashing.minimumEffectiveCover, cladding),exclude(flashing.minimumEffectiveCover, or(softEdge, turnDown)),asPer(flashing.minimumEffectiveCover, nzbc_e2as1_f7))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings is for ridges or hips and the flashing, then there shall be a minimum effective cover to the cladding, excluding any soft edge or turn-down to the flashing, in accordance with E2/AS1 Table 7.

TEXT: 4.0 Flashings 4.6.1.3 Change in metal roof pitches; Refer to Figure 44 for example of use. a) There shall be a minimum effective lap under roof cladding in accordance with Table 7, with a hem at upper edge.
LRML: if(and(has(metalRoofing.pitch, change),for(flashing, change))), then(obligation(and(below(lap, cladding),is(lap, minimumEffective),asPer(lap, nzbc_e2as1_t7),is(lap.edge, upper),has(lap.edge,hem))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are for changed metal roofing pitches, then there shall be a minimum effective lap under the cladding, and the lap shall be in accordance with Table 7, have a hem at the upper edge.

TEXT: 4.0 Flashings 4.6.1.2 Ridges and hips; a) For notched turn-downs of the flashing leave a gap between the flashing and the roof cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.
LRML: if(and(for(flashing, or(ridge, hip)), has(flashing, turnDown),is(turnDown.type, notched))), then(obligation(and(inBetween(gap, and(flashing, cladding)),above(flashing, cladding),lessThanEqual(gap.size, 5 mm))))

TEXT: Firecells shall be fire separated from each other by the higher of the two FRRs if the adjoining firecell has a higher FRR (refer to Paragraph 2.3).
LRML: if(and(adjoin(firecells), not(equal(firecells.fireResistanceRating)))), then(obligation(and(inBetween(fireSeparation, firecells),define(max(firecells.fireResistanceRating), x0),is(fireSeparation.fireResistanceRating, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If the adjoining firecells have different fire resistance ratings, the firecells shall have fire separation between them, with the greater of the higher of the two fire resistance ratings.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Firecells shall be fire separated from each other by the higher of the two FRRs if the adjoining firecell has a higher FRR (refer to Paragraph 2.3).

TEXT: 1.1.3 Where accessible units of Community service buildings are provided, an accessible route shall connect all accessible units to reception areas, offices, shops, dining rooms, kitchens, laundries, ablution blocks, recreation rooms and any other communal facilities.
LRML: if(and(is(building.activity, communityService), has(building, accessibleUnit), is(communalFacility, or(reception, office, shop, diningRoom, kitchen, laundry, ablutionBlock, recreationRoom)))), then(obligation(and(inBetween(accessibleRoute, and(accessibleUnit, communalFacility)),include(communalFacility, and(reception, office, shop, diningRoom, kitchen, laundry, ablutionBlock, recreationRoom)))))
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.3 Where accessible units of Community service buildings are provided, an accessible route shall connect all accessible units to reception areas, offices, shops, dining rooms, kitchens, laundries, ablution blocks, recreation rooms and any other communal facilities.
LRML: if(and(is(building.activity, communityService), has(building, unit), is(unit, accessible))), then(obligation(and(inBetween(accessibleRoute, and(unit, communalFacility)),include(communalFacility, and(reception, office, shop, diningRoom, kitchen, laundry, ablutionBlock, recreationRoom)))))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Specific design for preventing the ingress of snow melt water is required when the open ground snow load Sg, as defined in NZS 3604, exceeds 1.0 kPa, and the roof is constructed in a way that is likely to cause a build-up of snow.
LRML: if(and(asPer(openGroundSnowLoad, nzs_3604), greaterThan(openGroundSnowLoad, 1 kPa), cause(roof.construction, snowBuildUp))), then(obligation(and(has(roof, specificDesign),for(specificDesign, ingressPrevention), is(ingressPrevention.type, snowMeltWater))))
PARAPHRASE: If the open ground snow load defined in NZS 3604 exceeds 1.0 kPa, and the roof construction can cause build-up of snow, then the roof shall have specific design for preventing the ingress of snow melt water.

PARAPHRASE: If the open ground snow load defined in NZS 3604 exceeds 1.0 kPa, and the roof construction can cause build-up of snow, then the roof shall have specific design for preventing the ingress of snow melt water.

TEXT: Aluminium flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 0.7 mm, and formed from 5000 series in accordance with AS/NZS 1734.

TEXT: Galvanized steel flashings shall: a) have a BMT of 0.55 mm minimum b) be grade G550, or G300 for rolled or crimped flashings c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.material, steel), is(steel.coating, galvanised))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(flashing.bmt, 0.55 mm)), obligation(or(equal(flashing.grade, g550),and(equal(flashing.grade, g300), is(flashing.type, or(rolled, crimped))))),obligation(and(asPer(flashing.corrosionProtection,intendedExposureZone),asPer(intendedExposureZone,nzbc_e2as1_t20)))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are made of galvanized steel, the flashing shall have a BMT of 0.55 mm minimum. Flashing shall be grade G550, or G300 for rolled or crimped flashings. The flashing's corrosion protection shall be according to the intended exposure zone as shown in E2/AS1 Table 20.

TEXT: Galvanized steel flashings shall: a) have a BMT of 0.55 mm minimum b) be grade G550, or G300 for rolled or crimped flashings c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.

TEXT: Aluminium-zinc-magnesium coated steel shall: a) have a BMT of 0.55 mm minimum b) be grade G550, or G300 for curved or crimped flashings c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.material, steel), is(steel.coating, aluminiumZincMagnesium))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(flashing.bmt, 0.55 mm)), or(obligation(equal(flashing.grade, g550)), and(obligation(equal(flashing.grade, g300)), obligation(is(flashing.type, or(curved, crimped))))), obligation(for(flashing.selection, corrosionProtection)), obligation(has(flashing.selection, dependency)), obligation(is(dependency.type, intendedExposureZone)), obligation(asPer(flashing, nzbc_e2as1_t20))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are made of steel with Aluminium-zinc-magnesium coating, the flashing shall have a BMT of 0.55 mm minimum. Flashing shall be grade G550, or G300 for rolled or crimped flashings. The flashing's corrosion protection shall be according to the intended exposure zone as shown in E2/AS1 Table 20.

TEXT: 4.3.5 Stainless steel flashings; Stainless steel flashings shall be: a) Minimum thickness of 0.45 mm, and b) 304 or 316 stainless steel in accordance with Table 1 of ISO/TS 15510.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, stainlessSteel)), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(flashing.thickness,0.45 mm),equal(stainlessSteel.grade,or(304,316)),asPer(stainlessSteel.grade, isots_15510_t1))))
PARAPHRASE: Flashings with material stainless steel shall be minimum thickness of 0.45 mm, and stainless steel grade 304 or 316 in accordance with Table 1 of ISO/TS 15510.

TEXT: Lead sheet flashings shall: a) Comply with AS 1804, and b) Have a minimum unit mass of 17 kg/m2.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, leadSheet)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(flashing,as_1804),greaterThanEqual(flashing.unitMass,17 kg/m2))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are of material lead sheet, the flashings shall comply with AS 1804, and have a minimum unit mass of 17 kg/m2.

TEXT: Zinc sheet flashings shall only be used in accordance with Tables 20, 21 and 22. Zinc sheet flashings shall be: a) A minimum thickness of 0.7 mm, and b) In compliance with BS EN 988.

TEXT: Where a disused drain is being reinstated, the disused drain shall be tested to verify that the drain is sound.
LRML: if(is(drain, and(disused, reinstated))), then(obligation(test(drain, soundness)))
PARAPHRASE: Where a disused drain is being reinstated, the disused drain shall be tested for soundness.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.2 B1/AS gives an Acceptable Solution for small chimneys (referred to in Paragraph 8.0).
LRML: if(and(is(structure, chimney), is(chimney.size, small))), then(permission(complyWith(structure.design, nzbc_b1as1)))

TEXT: Structure Design 1.2 B1/AS gives an Acceptable Solution for small chimneys (referred to in Paragraph 8.0).

TEXT: 1.0.1 This Acceptable Solution is limited to buildings and sitework having a catchment area of no more than 0.25 hectares and which are: a) Free from a history of flooding, b) Not adjacent to a watercourse, c) Not located in low lying area, and d) Not located in a secondary flow path.

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.0.1 This Acceptable Solution is limited to buildings and sitework having a catchment area of no more than 0.25 hectares and which are: a) Free from a history of flooding, b) Not adjacent to a watercourse, c) Not located in low lying area, and d) Not located in a secondary flow path.

TEXT: 2.0.1 Suspended floors and slabs on ground: a) For sites level with or above the road shall no less than 150 mm above the road crown.
LRML: if(and(greaterThanEqual(site.elevation, road),or(is(floor.type, suspended),on(slab, ground)))), then(obligation(and(define(roadCrown.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(floor.elevation,'x0 + 150 mm'),greaterThanEqual(slab.elevation,'x0 + 150 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the site's elevation is with or above the road and floors are suspended and slabs are on ground, the floors and slabs shall be no less than 150 mm above the road crown.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Drains shall be capable of handling the rainfall during a storm. No drain shall have an internal diameter of less than 85 mm.
LRML: if(exist(drain)), then(obligation(and(for(drain, stormWater),greaterThanEqual(drain.internalDiameter, 85 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: Drains shall be for storm water. Drain shall have an internal diameter of no less than 85 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.2.2 Figure 3 provides a method for selecting the correct pipe size for a calculated modified catchment area, given as: Modified catchment area = 0.01 Al, where A = area being drained comprising plan roof area (m2) plus paved area (m2), and l is rainfall intensity.
LRML: if(exist(modifiedCatchmentArea)), then(and(define(planRoof.area, x0), define(pavedArea.area, x1), define(rainfallIntensity, x2),equal(modifiedCatchmentArea, '0.01 * (x0 + x1) * x2'),permission(and(for(pipe, modifiedCatchmentArea),asPer(pipe.size, nzbc_e1as1_f3)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a pipe is for the modified catchment area, the modified catchment area  equals 0.01 Al, where A is the plan roof area plus paved area and l is rainfall intensity, the pipe for the modified catchment area may have a pipe size as provided in E1/AS1 Figure 3.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The ground level adjacent to any downpipe discharging to the bubble-up chamber is at least 150 mm higher than the level of the top of the chamber outlet.
LRML: if(into(downpipe.discharge, bubbleupChamber)), then(obligation(and(adjacent(ground, downpipe), define(topOf(bubbleupChamber.outlet), x0),define(x0.elevation, x1),greaterThanEqual(ground.elevation, 'x1 + 150'))))
PARAPHRASE: If adownpipe is discharging to the bubble-up chamber, the elevation of the ground adjacent to the downpipe shall be at least 150 mm higher than the elevation of the top of the bubble-up chamber outlet.

TEXT: 3.5.1 All joints in drains shall be watertight and prevent the infiltration of groundwater and the intrusion of tree roots.
LRML: if(include(drain, joint)), then(and(obligation(is(drain.joint, watertight)), obligation(has(drain.joint, and(antiGroundwaterInfiltration, antiTreeRootIntrusion)))))

TEXT: Specific design for preventing the ingress of snow melt water is required when the open ground snow load Sg, as defined in NZS 3604, exceeds 1.0 kPa, and the roof is constructed in a way that is likely to cause a build-up of snow.
LRML: if(and(asPer(openGroundSnowLoad, nzs_3604), greaterThan(openGroundSnowLoad, 1 kPa), cause(roof.construction, snowBuildUp))), then(obligation(and(has(roof, specificDesign),for(specificDesign, ingressPrevention), for(ingressPrevention, snowMeltWater))))
PARAPHRASE: If the open ground snow load defined in NZS 3604 exceeds 1.0 kPa, and the roof construction can cause build-up of snow, then the roof shall have specific design for ingress prevention of snow melt water.

TEXT: Buildings, components or junction details not included or shown in this Acceptable Solution require specific design.
LRML: if(not(include(nzbc_e2as1, or(building, component, junctionDetail)))), then(obligation(and(has(building, specificDesign),has(component, specificDesign),has(junctionDetail, specificDesign))))
PARAPHRASE: If Buildings, components or junction details not included or shown in this Acceptable Solution require specific design.

TEXT: Buildings, components or junction details not included or shown in this Acceptable Solution require specific design.

PARAPHRASE: If E2/AS1 does not include buildings, components or junction details, then the  buildings, components and junction details shall have specific design.

TEXT: Moisture contained in the building structure at completion of construction shall not be permitted to damage the building elements.
LRML: if(and(is(building.construction, completed), include(building.structure, moisture))), then(prohibition(and(has(building.element, damage),by(damage,moisture))))
PARAPHRASE: If at completion of construction the building structure contains moisture, then th building element sshall not have damage by the moisture.

TEXT: Construction moisture includes the moisture contained in: a) Timber products as a result of a treatment or manufacturing process, b) Green timber, and timber or other materials that have been exposed to the weather, and c) Concrete, mortar or plaster that is not completely cured.
LRML: if(or(and(include(product, moisture), is(product.material, timber), is(moisture.reason, or(treatmentProcess, manufacturingProcess))), and(include(product, moisture), include(product.material, and(greenTimber, timber)), is(moisture.reason, weather)), and(include(product, moisture), is(product.material, or(concrete, mortar, plaster)), not(is(material, completelyCured))))),then(has(building.construction, moisture))

TEXT: Construction moisture includes the moisture contained in: a) Timber products as a result of a treatment or manufacturing process, b) Green timber, and timber or other materials that have been exposed to the weather, and c) Concrete, mortar or plaster that is not completely cured.
LRML: if(or(and(include(product, moisture), is(product.material, timber), by(moisture, or(treatmentProcess, manufacturingProcess))), and(include(material, moisture), or(is(material, and(greenTimber, timber)), has(material, weatherExposure))), and(include(material, moisture), is(material, or(concrete, mortar, plaster)), not(is(material, completelyCured))))),then(has(building.construction, moisture))
PARAPHRASE: If timber products include moisture as a result of a treatment or manufacturing process, materials include moisture and materials are green timber, and timber or other materials that have been exposed to the weather, and c) Concrete, mortar or plaster include moisture that is not completely cured.

TEXT: Construction moisture includes the moisture contained in: a) Timber products as a result of a treatment or manufacturing process, b) Green timber, and timber or other materials that have been exposed to the weather, and c) Concrete, mortar or plaster that is not completely cured.
LRML: if(or(and(include(product, moisture), is(product.material, timber), by(moisture, or(treatmentProcess, manufacturingProcess))), and(include(material, moisture), or(is(material, and(greenTimber, timber)), has(material, weatherExposure))), and(include(material, moisture), is(material, or(concrete, mortar, plaster)), not(is(material, completelyCured))))),then(has(building.construction, moisture))
PARAPHRASE: If timber products include moisture as a result of a treatment or manufacturing process, materials include moisture and materials are green timber and timber or other materials that have been exposed to the weather, and materials include moisture and are concrete, mortar or plaster and is not completely cured, then the building construction has moisture.

TEXT: 1.2.1 Slope in direction of travel; Acceptable slopes for different types of access routes are shown in Figure 2.
LRML: if(exist(accessRoute)), then(obligation(asPer(accessRoute.slope, 'nzbc_d1as1_f2.1')))

TEXT: 1.4.1 Access routes shall have height clearances complying with Table 1 and as shown in Figure 3.
LRML: if(has(building, accessRoute)), then(and(obligation(and(complyWith(accessRoute.heightClearance, 'nzbc_d1as1_t1.1'),asPer(accessRoute.heightClearance, 'nzbc_d1as1_f3.1')))))

TEXT: 1.0.1 This Acceptable Solution is limited to buildings and sitework having a catchment area of no more than 0.25 hectares and which are: a) Free from a history of flooding, b) Not adjacent to a watercourse, c) Not located in low lying area, and d) Not located in a secondary flow path.
LRML: if(and(or(lessThanEqual(building.catchmentArea, 0.25 ha), not(is(building, floodProne)), not(adjacent(building, watercourse)), not(is(building.location, lowLying)), not(within(building.location, secondaryFlowPath))), or(lessThanEqual(sitework.catchmentArea, 0.25 ha), not(is(sitework, floodProne)), not(adjacent(sitework, watercourse)), not(is(sitework.location, lowLying)), not(within(sitework.location, secondaryFlowPath))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_e1as1, and(building, sitework)))
PARAPHRASE: If buildings having a catchment area of no more than 0.25 hectares and which are not flood prone, not adjacent to a watercourse, not located in low lying area, and not located in a secondary flow path or sitework having a catchment area of no more than 0.25 hectares and which are not flood prone, not adjacent to a watercourse, not located in low lying area, and not located in a secondary flow path, then E1/AS1 applies to the building or sitework.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.0.1 Suspended floors and slabs on ground: a) For sites level with or above the road shall no less than 150 mm above the road crown on at least one cross-section through the building and roadway (see Figure 1).
LRML: if(and(define(suspendedFloor.elevation, x0), define(slabOnGround.elevation, x1), define(site.elevation, x2), define(road.elevation, x3), greaterThanEqual(x2, x3), define(roadCrown.elevation, x4))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(x0, 'x4 + 150 mm')), obligation(greaterThanEqual(x1, 'x4 + 150 mm'))))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.1.1 Pipe materials shall comply with the standards given in Table 1.
LRML: if(exist(pipe)), then(obligation(complyWith(pipe.material, nzbc_e1as1_t1)))

TEXT: R-values for walls, roofs and ceilings shall be no less than: For single skin normal weight masonry based wall construction without a cavity, 0.6.

TEXT: R-values for walls, roofs and ceilings shall be no less than: For roof or ceilings of any construction, 1.5.

TEXT: 3.2.2 Figure 3 provides a method for selecting the correct pipe size for a calculated modified catchment area, given as: Modified catchment area = 0.01 Al, where A = area being drained comprising plan roof area (m2) plus paved area (m2), and l is rainfall intensity.

TEXT: The change in direction of a drain shall not exceed 90° at any point.
LRML: if(has(drain, changeInDirection)), then(obligation(lessThan(changeInDirection, 90 deg)))
PARAPHRASE: The change in direction of a drain shall not exceed 90 deg at any point.

TEXT: The change in direction of a drain where practical should be kept to less than 45° as illustrated in Figure 4.
LRML: if(and(has(drain, changeInDirection), is(changeInDirection.smallChange, practical))), then(obligation(lessThan(changeInDirection, 45 deg)))
PARAPHRASE: Where a small change in direction of a drain is practical, the change in direction should be less than 45 deg.

TEXT: Flexible flashing tape shall comply with Parts 3.2 and 4 of ICBO Acceptance Criteria AC148, shall be compatible with adjacent building wall underlay or roof underlay, and be used only in fully concealed applications.
LRML: if(is(flashingTape, flexible)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(flashingTape,and('icbo_ac148_3.2',icbo_ac148_4)),has(adjacentBuilding,or(wallUnderlay,roofUnderlay)),towards(flashingTape.compatibility,or(wallUnderlay,roofUnderlay)),is(flashingTape.application,fullyConcealed))))
PARAPHRASE: Flexible flashing tape shall comply with Parts 3.2 and 4 of ICBO AC148, shall be compatible with adjacent building wall underlay or roof underlay, and be used only in fully concealed applications.

TEXT: Flexible flashing tape shall comply with Parts 3.2 and 4 of ICBO Acceptance Criteria AC148, shall be compatible with adjacent building wall underlay or roof underlay, and be used only in fully concealed applications.

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Transverse flashing: Refer to Figure 7 for example of use. The apron shall have: ii) a minimum effective cover to roof cladding, excluding any soft edge or turn-down to the flashing, as shown in Table 7.

QUESTIONABLE
Not connected: softEdge, turnDown
Split: softEdge

TEXT: Apron flashing; The apron shall have: ii) a minimum effective cover to roof cladding, excluding any soft edge or turn-down to the flashing, as shown in Table 7.

TEXT: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: Refer to Figure 48 for example of use. The apron shall: ii) for profiled metal roof cladding, cover at least two crests, (turned-up edge to full crest height constitutes a crest).
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), to(flashing.overlap, roofCladding), over(flashing.cover, metalRoofing), is(flashing, parallel), has(roofCladding, profile))), then(obligation(and(include(flashing.cover,crest),greaterThanEqual(count(crest),2))))
PARAPHRASE: If apron flashings are over metal roofing, and the flashings are transverse, and the flashing have notched turn-downs, then there shall be a gap between the flashing and the pan of the roof cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.

TEXT: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: Refer to Figure 48 for example of use. The apron shall: ii) for profiled metal roof cladding, cover at least two crests, (turned-up edge to full crest height constitutes a crest).
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), to(flashing.overlap, roofCladding), over(flashing.cover, metalRoofing), is(flashing, parallel), has(roofCladding, profile))), then(obligation(and(include(flashing.cover,crest),greaterThanEqual(count(crest),2))))
PARAPHRASE: If apron flashings are over metal roofing, and the flashings are parallel, then the flashing shall be dimensioned to suit the metal roofing cladding profile.

TEXT: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: Refer to Figure 48 for example of use. The apron shall: ii) for profiled metal roof cladding, cover at least two crests, (turned-up edge to full crest height constitutes a crest).
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), above(flashing, metalRoofing), is(flashing, parallel),has(metalRoofing, cladding),is(cladding.material, profiledMetal))), then(obligation(and(include(flashing.cover,crest),greaterThanEqual(count(crest),2))))
PARAPHRASE: If apron flashings are over metal roofing, the flashings are parallel, and the metal roofing has profiled metal roof cladding, then the flashing shall cover at least two crests.

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: Refer to Figure 48 for example of use. The apron shall: iii) for profiled metal roof cladding, overhang flashing a minimum 10 mm clear of crest and maximum 5 mm clear of trough as shown in Figure 47.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), above(flashing, metalRoofing), is(flashing, parallel),has(metalRoofing, cladding),is(cladding.material, profiledMetal))), then(obligation(and(has(cladding, crest),towards(flashing.clearance, crest),greaterThanEqual(flashing.clearance, 10 mm),has(cladding, trough),towards(flashing.clearance,trough),lessThanEqual(flashing.clearance, 5 mm),asPer(clearance, nzbc_e2as1_f47))))

TEXT: 4.0 Flashings 4.6.1.2 Ridges and hips; Refer to Figure 46 for example of use. a) For notched turn-downs of the flashing leave a gap between the flashing and the roof cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.
LRML: if(and(for(flashing, or(ridge, hip)), has(flashing, turnDown),is(turnDown.type, notched))), then(obligation(and(inBetween(gap, and(flashing, cladding)),above(flashing, cladding),lessThanEqual(gap.size,5 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings is for ridges or hips and the flashing has notched turn-downs, then the the flashing shall leave a gap between the flashing and the cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.

TEXT: 3.6 Surface water inlets to drains; 3.6.1 All surface water, except that collected directly from a roof, shall enter the drain via a sump.
LRML: if(and(has(drain, inlet),towards(surfaceWater, inlet), not(awayFrom(surfaceWater, roof)))), then(obligation(is(inlet, sump)))
PARAPHRASE: Surface water, except that collected directly from a roof, shall enter the drain via a sump.

TEXT: 3.6 Surface water inlets to drains; Via a sump which has: a) A grating, hinged or removable for maintenance access. The grating shall comprise at least 35% openings. The smaller dimension of any individual opening shall not exceed 35 mm.
LRML: if(exist(sump)), then(obligation(and(has(sump, grating),is(grating, or(hinged, removable)),has(grating, openings),define(grating.area, x0),greaterThanEqual(openings.area, 0.35 * x0),lessThanEqual(min(opening.dimension), 35 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: A sump shall have: A grating that is hinged or removable. The grating shall have openings, where the openings area is at least 35% of the gratings area. The smaller dimension of any individual opening shall not exceed 35 mm.

TEXT: 3.6 Surface water inlets to drains; Via a sump which has: Capacity at the bottom for settlement of silt and debris.
LRML: if(exist(sump)), then(obligation(and(has(sump.bottom, capacity),for(capacity, settlement),is(settlement, and(silt, debris)))))
PARAPHRASE: A sump shall have capacity at the bottom for settlement of silt and debris.

TEXT: 3.6 Surface water inlets to drains; Via a sump which has: Capacity at the bottom for settlement of silt and debris.

PARAPHRASE: A sump shall have capacity at the bottom for settlement of silt and debris.

TEXT: 3.6 Surface water inlets to drains; Via a sump which has: A submerged (or trapped) outlet which prevents floatable solids entering the drain.
LRML: if(exist(sump)), then(obligation(and(has(sump, outlet),is(outlet, or(submerged, trapped))  )))
PARAPHRASE: A sump shall have a submerged or trapped outlet.

TEXT: 3.7.1 Access for maintenance shall be provided on all drains.
LRML: if(exist(drain)), then(obligation(has(drain, accessPoint)))
PARAPHRASE: All drains shall have access points.

TEXT: 3.7.2 Points of access shall be spaced at no further than: 100 m where inspection points, inspection chambers or access chambers are used.

TEXT: 3.7.3 Points of access are required at: Changes in direction of greater than 45°,.

TEXT: 3.7.3 Points of access are required at: Changes in gradient of greater than 45°.

PARAPHRASE: If a drain has changes in gradient of greater than 45 deg, the drain shall have an access point at the change in gradient.

TEXT: 3.7.3 Points of access are required at: Junctions of drains other than a drain, serving a single downpipe, that is less than 2.0 m long.
LRML: if(and(has(drain, junction), into(drain.flow, downpipe), not(and(equal(count(downpipe), 1), lessThan(downpipe.length, 2 m))))), then(and(obligation(has(drain, accessPoint)), obligation(is(accessPoint.location, junction))))

TEXT: 3.9.2 Bedding and backfilling; Figure 13 gives acceptable solutions for the bedding and backfilling of the drainage pipes listed in Table 1 except where: a) The trench is located within or above peat, or b) Scouring of the trench is likely due to unstable soils, or d) The cover H to the pipe is more than 2.5 m.

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: Refer to Figure 48 for example of use. The apron shall: iii) for profiled metal roof cladding, overhang flashing a minimum 10 mm clear of crest and maximum 5 mm clear of trough as shown in Figure 47.

TEXT: 4.0 Flashings 4.6.1.2 Ridges and hips; Refer to Figure 46 for example of use. a) For notched turn-downs of the flashing leave a gap between the flashing and the roof cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.
