TEXT: 1.5.1 The widths of openings in chimney breasts, and their supporting lintels, shall comply with Table 1.
LRML: if(exist(chimneyBreast)), then(obligation(and(has(chimneyBreast, opening),complyWith(opening.width,nzbc_b1as3_t1),complyWith(opening.lintel,nzbc_b1as3_t1))))
PARAPHRASE: The widths of openings in chimney breasts, and the openings' lintels, shall comply with B1/AS3 Table 1.

TEXT: 1.6.1 Reinforcing of foundation walls and chimney bases (including the gathers) (see Figures 2 to 5 inclusive) shall comprise: a) D12 bars at 400 mm maximum centres vertically. Laps in bars shall be no less than 300 mm. b) R6 bars at 200 mm centres horizontally. These will be in the form of U bars.
LRML: if(partOf(reinforcing, or(foundationWall, chimneyBase, chimneyGather))), then(and(obligation(and(include(reinforcing, reinforcingBar),is(reinforcingBar.type,d12),is(reinforcingBar.location,400 mmCentres),is(reinforcingBar.orientation, vertical),greaterThanEqual(reinforcingBar.lap,300 mm))),obligation(and(include(reinforcing, reinforcingBar),is(reinforcingBar.type,r6),is(reinforcingBar.location,200 mmCentres),is(reinforcingBar.orientation, horizontal),is(reinforcingBar.type,uBar)))))
PARAPHRASE: Reinforcing part of foundation walls, chimney bases, and chimney gathers shall comprise: a) D12 reinforcing bars at 400 mm maximum centres vertically. Laps in reinforcing bars shall be no less than 300 mm. b) R6 reinforcing bars at 200 mm centres horizontally. These will be in the form of U bars.

TEXT: 1.4 Calculating occupant loads 1.4.3 Duplication shall be avoided by: a) Ensuring that, where people may be involved in more than one activity, they are counted only once.
LRML: if(and(has(space, person), within(person, activity), greaterThan(count(activity), 1))), then(obligation(equal(count(person), 1)))
PARAPHRASE: Where people are involved in more than one activity, they are counted only once.

TEXT: 1.4 Calculating occupant loads 1.4.3 Duplication shall be avoided by: Not including an occupant load for exitways, or for the occupant load determined for areas such as lift lobbies or sanitary facilities that are used intermittently by people already counted elsewhere in the building.
LRML: if(and(has(space, person), or(is(space.type, exitway), is(space.usage, intermittent)))), then(obligation(not(has(space, occupantLoad))))
PARAPHRASE: If a space has people but is an exitway or used intermittently, the space shall have no occupant load.

TEXT: 1.4.4 Occupant load assessment shall take account of the actual arrangement and number of seats for fixed seating (see Paragraph 3.7.4). Where additional floor area abuts the fixed seating, additional occupants are permitted in that floor area based on standing space density (see Table 1.2), provided the escape route is not obstructed.
LRML: if(has(space, fixedSeating)), then(and(obligation(and(define(count(fixedSeating.seat), x0), asPer(space.occupantLoad, x0))),permission(and(adjoin(floorArea, fixedSeating),define(floorArea.occupantLoad, x1), asPer(floorArea.occupantLoad, standingSpaceDensity), asPer(standingSpaceDensity, 'nzbc_cas2_t1.2'),include(space.occupantLoad, x1)))))
PARAPHRASE: Occupant load assessment shall take account of the actual arrangement and number of seats for fixed seating (see Paragraph 3.7.4). Where additional floor area abuts the fixed seating, additional occupants are permitted in that floor area based on standing space density (see Table 1.2), provided the escape route is not obstructed.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.1.1 The floor area of firecells shall be limited in accordance with Table 2.1.
LRML: if(exist(firecell)), then(obligation(asPer(firecell.floorArea, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.1')))
PARAPHRASE: The floor area of firecells shall be limited in accordance with C/AS2 Table 2.1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.1 Fire safety system types, as defined in Table 2.2, shall be provided throughout firecells and be as specified in: Table 2.2a for risk groups SM and SI.
LRML: if(is(space.riskGroup, or(sm, si))), then(and(obligation(complyWith(space.fireSafetySystem, table)), equal(table.key, t2.2.a)))
PARAPHRASE: Fire safety system types, as defined in Table 2.2, shall be provided throughout firecells and be as specified in: Table 2.2a for risk groups SM and SI.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: A direct connection to Fire and Emergency New Zealand is not required if automatic heat or smoke detection systems are provided in addition to the systems required by this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(and(has(space.fireSafetySystem, supplementary), is(fireSafetySystem.type, or(heatDetection, smokeDetection)), is(fireSafetySystem.type, automatic))), then(permission(not(has(fireSafetySystem, fireServiceDirectConnection))))
PARAPHRASE: If a space has an supplementary fire safety system for automatic heat or smoke detection, a fire service direct connection is not required.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.6 Where fire separations are not needed between different risk groups on the same floor level, the fire safety systems adopted for the firecell shall be those of the primary risk group (as defined in Paragraph 1.2.2).
LRML: if(and(greaterThan(count(buildingStorey.riskGroup), 1), permission(not(has(riskGroup, fireSeparation))))), then(obligation(and(define(primaryRiskGroup.fireSafetySystem, x0),is(firecell.fireSafetySystem, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If there are different risk groups on the same floor level and fire separations are not needed between different risk groups are not needed, the firecell's fire safety systems should be the fire safety systems of the primary risk group.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.9 In risk group SI alerting all building occupants in the event of fire is not required where it is deemed appropriate to alert management and staff without notifying other occupants.
LRML: if(and(is(riskGroup.type, si), has(building, fireAlarmSystem), has(fireAlarmSystem, alertingDevice), obligation(reach(alertingDevice.output, occupant)), obligation(is(occupant.type, staff)))), then(and(permission(reach(alertingDevice.output, occupant)), permission(is(occupant.type, all))))
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.2.1 Downpipes sized using Table 5 are acceptable. Other downpipes are acceptable provided their cross-sectional area is no less than that required by Table 5, and they permit passage of a 50 mm diameter sphere.
LRML: if(exist(downpipe)), then(or(obligation(asPer(downpipe.size, nzbc_e1as1_t5)), obligation(and(complyWith(downpipe.crossSectionalArea, nzbc_e1as1_t5),greaterThan(downpipe.diameter, 50 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: Downpipes shall have a size acoording to Table 5. Otherwise the downpipe have a cross-sectional area complying with Table 5 and a diameter greater than 50 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.1.2 It is the responsibility of the person specifying the building element to determine normal maintenance requirements. These may be based on the manufacturer's recommendations and may also include periodic inspections of elements not readily observable without a specific effort (e.g. access to roof or subfloor spaces).

These may be based on the manufacturer's recommendations and may also include periodic inspections of elements not readily observable without a specific effort (e.g. access to roof or subfloor spaces).

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.10 Allowance for expansion of corrugated and trapezoidal roof cladding; Where Table 16 requires profiled washers, allowance shall be made for expansion by: a) Fixing the top 50% (closest to the ridge) with conventional fixings, and b) Fixing the lower 50% with sealing washers fixed over profiled washers as shown in Figure 39, and: i) using oversized holes, and ii) positioning fixing in centre of hole.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.application, roof), is(cladding.system, profiledMetal), is(cladding.profile, or(corrugated, trapezoidal)), asPer(cladding.expansion, nzbc_e2as1_t16), obligation(has(cladding.expansion, profiledWasher)))), then(obligation(and(has(cladding,expansionJoint),has(cladding.topHalf,conventionalFixing),has(cladding.bottomHalf,fixing),by(fixing,sealingWasher),over(sealingWasher.fixing,profiledWasher),has(cladding.crest,hole),is(hole,oversized),has(hole.centre,positioningFixing))))

TEXT: Butyl rubber and EPDM flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 1.0 mm, and shall comply with the following parts of Table 1 in ASTM D6134: a) Tensile strength, b) Elongation, c) Water absorption, d) Water vapour permeance, and e) Heat aging followed by: i) tensile strength ii) elongation.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, or(butylRubber, epdm))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(flashing.thickness, 1 mm),complyWith(flashing.tensileStrength, astm_d6134_t1),complyWith(flashing.elongation, astm_d6134_t1),complyWith(flashing.waterAbsorption, astm_d6134_t1),complyWith(flashing.waterVapourPermeance, astm_d6134_t1),complyWith(flashing.heatAging, astm_d6134_t1),after(flashing.tensileStrength, heatAging),after(flashing.elongation, heatAging))))
PARAPHRASE: Butyl rubber and EPDM flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 1.0 mm, and the flashing's  a) Tensile strength, b) Elongation, c) Water absorption, d) Water vapour permeance, and e) Heat aging followed by: i) tensile strength ii) elongation shall comply with the following parts of Table 1 in ASTM D6134.

TEXT: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: The apron shall: i) be dimensioned to suit the roof cladding profile,.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), above(flashing, metalRoofing), is(flashing, parallel))), then(obligation(and(has(metalRoofing.roofCladding, profile), asPer(flashing.dimension, profile))))
PARAPHRASE: If apron flashings are over metal roofing, and the flashings are parallel, then the flashing shall be dimensioned to suit the metal roofing cladding profile.

TEXT: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Transverse flashing: The apron shall have: i) for notched turn-downs, a gap between the flashing and the pan of the roof cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), above(flashing, metalRoofing), is(flashing, transverse), has(flashing, turnDown),is(turnDown.type, notched))), then(obligation(and(has(metalRoofing.cladding, pan),inBetween(gap,and(flashing,pan)),lessThanEqual(gap.size,5 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If apron flashings are over metal roofing, and the flashings are transverse, and the flashing have notched turn-downs, then there shall be a gap between the flashing and the pan of the metal roofing cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.

TEXT: 4.2.1 Downpipes sized using Table 5 are acceptable. Other downpipes are acceptable provided their cross-sectional area is no less than that required by Table 5, and they permit passage of a 50 mm diameter sphere.
LRML: if(exist(downpipe)), then(or(obligation(asPer(downpipe.size, nzbc_e1as1_t5)), obligation(and(complyWith(downpipe.crossSectionalArea, nzbc_e1as1_t5),greaterThan(downpipe.diameter, 50 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: Downpipes shall have a size acoording to Table 5. Otherwise the downpipe have a cross-sectional area complying with Table 5 and a diameter greater than 50 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.3.1 Where thermal movement of downpipes cannot be accommodated by movement of the guttering, expansion joints shall be incorporated.
LRML: if(and(define(downpipe.thermalExpansion, x0), has(downpipe.gutter, movement), lessThan(movement, x0))), then(obligation(include(downpipe, expansionJoint)))

PARAPHRASE: Roof gutters shall discharge to downpipes that are sized as given in Paragraph 4.2.

TEXT: 5.0 Roof Gutters 5.1.4 In no case shall the cross-sectional area of any gutter be less than 4000 mm2.

PARAPHRASE: Roof gutter shall have a cross-sectional area of no less than 4000 mm2.

TEXT: 5.0 Roof Gutters 5.5.1 All internal gutters shall be fitted with overflow outlets which drain to the exterior of the building. The top of the outlet shall be set at least 50 mm below the top of the gutter.
LRML: if(and(is(roofGutter.type, internal), define(roofGutter.top, x0))), then(obligation(and(define(roofGutter.top, x0),include(roofGutter,overflowOutlet),towards(overflowOutlet.flow,buildingExterior),lessThanEqual(overflowOutlet.top,'x0 - 50 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: All internal roof gutters shall be fitted with overflow outlets which drain to the exterior of the building. The top of the outlet shall be set at least 50 mm below the top of the gutter.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.0 Roof Gutters 5.5.1 All internal gutters shall be fitted with overflow outlets which drain to the exterior of the building. The top of the outlet shall be set at least 50 mm below the top of the gutter.
LRML: if(is(roofGutter.type, internal)), then(obligation(and(define(roofGutter.top, x0),include(roofGutter,overflowOutlet),towards(overflowOutlet.flow,buildingExterior),lessThanEqual(overflowOutlet.top,'x0 - 50 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: All internal roof gutters shall be fitted with overflow outlets which drain to the exterior of the building. The top of the outlet shall be set at least 50 mm below the top of the gutter.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.0 Roof Gutters 5.5.2 External gutters do not require overflow outlets but shall be installed to ensure any overflow from the gutter spills to the outside of the building.
LRML: if(is(roofGutter.type, external)), then(and(permission(not(has(roofGutter, overflowOutlet))), obligation(towards(roofGutter.overflow, buildingExterior))))
PARAPHRASE: External roof gutters do not require overflow outlets but overflow from the gutter  shall go to the outside of the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Boundary fences and other site development must not significantly hamper the flow of surface water from the site.
LRML: if(exist(siteDevelopment)), then(prohibition(and(not(include(siteDevelopment, obstruction)),to(obstruction, surfaceWaterFlow))))
PARAPHRASE: Site development must not significantly hamper the flow of surface water from the site.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Boundary fences and other site development must not significantly hamper the flow of surface water from the site.
LRML: if(exist(siteDevelopment)), then(prohibition(and(not(cause(siteDevelopment, obstruction)),towards(obstruction, surfaceWaterFlow))))
PARAPHRASE: Site development must not cause obstruction to the flow of surface water.

TEXT: Rodding points rather than inspection points are preferred in landscaped or sealed areas.
LRML: if(is(are, or(landscaped, sealed))), then(obligation(is(accessPoint.preference, roddingPoint)))
PARAPHRASE: If an area is landscaped or sealed, rodding points are preferred.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Rodding points rather than inspection points are preferred in landscaped or sealed areas.
LRML: if(is(area, or(landscaped, sealed))), then(obligation(is(accessPoint.preference, roddingPoint)))
PARAPHRASE: If an area is landscaped or sealed, access points are preferred to be rodding points.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Where buildings are based on NZS 3604, but require specific engineering design input, the framing shall be of at least equivalent stiffness to the framing provisions of NZS 3604.
LRML: if(and(complyWith(building.design, nzs_3604), has(building.design, specificEngineeringRequirement))), then(and(has(building, framing), obligation(complyWith(framing.stiffness, nzs_3604))))

TEXT: A risk assessment of the proposed design shall be carried out using a building envelope risk matrix. This allows the risks related to various features to be aggregated, resulting in a risk score for the design.
LRML: if(is(design, proposed)), then(obligation(and(has(design,riskAssessment),include(riskAssessment,riskMatrix),is(riskMatrix.type,buildingEnvelope),include(riskAssessment,riskAggregation),is(riskAggregation.object,features),is(riskAssessment.result,riskScore),has(design,riskScore))))

TEXT: Table 2 sets out the risk matrix that shall be used to define the risk score for a building within the scope of this Acceptable Solution. A risk score is calculated for each external face of the building. Claddings are then selected from Table 3 according to the risk scores.
LRML: if(and(equal(table.key, t2), include(t2, riskMatrix), has(building, riskScore), complyWith(building, nzbc_e2as1))), then(and(obligation(by(riskScore.definition, riskMatrix)), loop(in(forEach(externalFace), building), obligation(and(define(externalFace.riskScore,x0),asPer(cladding.selection,nzbc_e2as1_t3))))))

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Pre-painted aluminium roofing shall have a factory-applied finish complying with AS/NZS 2728.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.application, roof), is(cladding.system, profiledMetal), is(cladding.material, and(aluminium, prePainted)))), then(obligation(and(has(cladding.material,factoryAppliedFinish),complyWith(factoryAppliedFinish,nzs_2728))))

TEXT: Steel 8.4.6 Structure; The maximum span and fixing patterns of profiled metal roof cladding between purlins to comply with this Acceptable Solution are given in Table 11, Table 12 or Table 13, 14 and 15.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.application, roof), is(cladding.system, profiledMetal), is(cladding.material, steel), inBetween(cladding.span, purlin), inBetween(cladding.fixingPattern, purlin), complyWith(cladding, nzbc_e2as1))), then(and(obligation(asPer(max(cladding.span), and(nzbc_e2as1_t11, nzbc_e2as1_t12, nzbc_e2as1_t13, nzbc_e2as1_t14, nzbc_e2as1_t15))), obligation(asPer(cladding.fixingPattern, and(nzbc_e2as1_t11, nzbc_e2as1_t12, nzbc_e2as1_t13, nzbc_e2as1_t14, nzbc_e2as1_t15)))))

TEXT: Steel 8.4.6 Structure; The maximum span and fixing patterns of profiled metal roof cladding between purlins to comply with this Acceptable Solution are given in Table 11, Table 12 or Table 13, 14 and 15.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.application, roof), is(cladding.system, profiledMetal), is(cladding.material, steel), inBetween(cladding.span, purlin), inBetween(cladding.fixingPattern, purlin), complyWith(cladding, nzbc_e2as1))), then(obligation(and(asPer(max(cladding.span),and(nzbc_e2as1_t11,nzbc_e2as1_t12,nzbc_e2as1_t13,nzbc_e2as1_t14,nzbc_e2as1_t15)),asPer(cladding.fixingPattern,and(nzbc_e2as1_t11,nzbc_e2as1_t12,nzbc_e2as1_t13,nzbc_e2as1_t14,nzbc_e2as1_t15)))))

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.8 Fixings: corrugated and trapezoidal; Fixings shall be as shown in Tables 11, 12, 14 and 15, and shall be a minimum 12-gauge screw, as shown in Figure 39, which complies with Class 4 of AS 3566: Part 2.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.application, roof), is(cladding.system, profiledMetal), is(cladding.profile, or(corrugated, trapezoidal)), has(cladding, fixing))), then(and(obligation(complyWith(fixing, and(nzbc_e2as1_t11, nzbc_e2as1_t12, nzbc_e2as1_t14, nzbc_e2as1_t15))), obligation(is(min(screw.size), 12 gauge)), obligation(complyWith(screw, class_4)), obligation(in(class_4, as_3566_2))))

TEXT: 8.5 Membrane Roofs and Decks; The application of directly applied wearing or decorative surfaces to membranes is not covered in this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(and(is(membrane.application, or(roof, deck)), to(surface.application, membrane), is(surface, or(wearing, decorative)))), then(prohibition(complyWith(surface.application, nzbc_e2as1)))

TEXT: 10.3 Measuring moisture content 10.3.2 Concrete floors; Measurement shall be made in accordance with BRANZ Bulletin 330 Thin Flooring Materials using hygrometers calibrated to ASTM E 104 - 2002 Standard practice for maintaining constant relative humidity by means of aqueous solutions.
LRML: if(is(floor.material, concrete)), then(obligation(and(has(floor, moistureContent),complyWith(moistureContent.measurement,branzBulletin_330),by(moistureContent.measurement,hygrometer),complyWith(hygrometer.calibration,astm_e_104_2002))))
PARAPHRASE: Measuring moisture content 10.3.2 Concrete floors; Measurement shall be made in accordance with BRANZ Bulletin 330 Thin Flooring Materials using hygrometers calibrated to ASTM E 104 - 2002 Standard practice for maintaining constant relative humidity by means of aqueous solutions.

TEXT: Materials used to construct the building envelope shall be: a) In accordance with the durability requirements of NZBC B2, b) Suitable for their end-use, location and environment as shown in Table 20, and c) Compatible with adjoining materials as shown in Table 21 and Table 22.
LRML: if(include(buildingEnvelope.construction, material)), then(and(obligation(complyWith(material.durability, nzbc_b2)), obligation(include(material.suitability, and(endUse, location, environment))), obligation(asPer(material.suitability, nzbc_e2as1_t20)), obligation(include(material.compatibility, adjoiningMaterial)), obligation(complyWith(material.compatibility, and(nzbc_e2as1_t21, nzbc_e2as1_t22)))))
PARAPHRASE: Materials used to construct the building envelope shall be: a) In accordance with the durability requirements of NZBC B2, b) Suitable for their end-use, location and environment as shown in Table 20, and c) Compatible with adjoining materials as shown in Table 21 and Table 22.

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.10.1 Where a drain or part of a drain is no longer required, it shall be disconnected from the foul water drainage system at the junction with the live drain or at the property boundary.

PARAPHRASE: Where a drain or part of a drain is not required, it shall be disconnected from the foul water drainage system at the junction with the live drain or at the property boundary.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Where drains are laid at gradients of 1:80 or less, verifiable levelling devices shall be used to ensure uniform and accurate gradients.
LRML: if(lessThanEqual(drain.gradient, 1/80)), then(obligation(and(requires(drain.installation,levellingDevice),is(levellingDevice,verifiable))))
PARAPHRASE: Where drains are laid at gradients of 1:80 or less, verifiable levelling devices shall be used to ensure uniform and accurate gradients.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Where drains are laid at gradients of 1:80 or less, verifiable levelling devices shall be used to ensure uniform and accurate gradients.
LRML: if(lessThanEqual(drain.gradient, 1/80)), then(obligation(and(requires(drain.installation,levellingDevice),is(levellingDevice,verifiable))))
PARAPHRASE: Where drains are laid at gradients of 1:80 or less, a verifiable levelling devices shall is required for the drain installation.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.3.1 Figure 7 gives acceptable methods for the bedding and backfilling of the drainage pipes listed in Table 1 except where: a) The trench is located within or above peat, b) Scouring of the trench is likely due to unstable soils, or d) The cover H to the pipe is more than 2.5 m.
LRML: if(and(asPer(drainPipe, nzbc_g13as2_t1), not(within(trench.location, peat)), not(above(trench.location, peat)), not(is(soil.type, unstable)), define(ground.elevation, x0), define(topOf(pipe.elevation), x1), greaterThan('x0 - x1', 2.5 m))), then(obligation(complyWith(drain.system, nzbc_g13as2_f7)))
PARAPHRASE: If drainage pipes are listed in G13/AS2 Table 1, the trench is not located within or above a peat, soil is not unstable, and the cover H to the pipe is no more than 2.5 m, then bedding and backfilling may be according to G13/AS2 Figure 7.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.3.1 Figure 7 gives acceptable methods for the bedding and backfilling of the drainage pipes listed in Table 1 except where: a) The trench is located within or above peat, b) Scouring of the trench is likely due to unstable soils, or d) The cover H to the pipe is more than 2.5 m.
LRML: if(and(asPer(drainPipe, nzbc_g13as2_t1), not(within(trench.location, peat)), not(above(trench.location, peat)), not(is(soil.type, unstable)), greaterThan(drainPipe.coverHeight, 2.5 m))), then(obligation(complyWith(drain.system, nzbc_g13as2_f7)))
PARAPHRASE: If drainage pipes are listed in G13/AS2 Table 1, the trench is not located within or above a peat, soil is not unstable, and the cover height of the pipe is no more than 2.5 m, then bedding and backfilling may be according to G13/AS2 Figure 7.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The extent and nature of necessary maintenance is dependent on the: a) Type of cladding or components used, b) Position of cladding or components on the building, c) Geographical location of the building, and d) Specific site conditions.
LRML: if(has(building, maintenance)), then(obligation(and(has(maintenance.extent,dependency),has(maintenance.nature,dependency),is(dependency,or(claddingType,componentType)),is(dependency,or(claddingPosition,componentPosition)),is(dependency,and(buildingLocation,siteCondition)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the building has maintainance, the extent and nature of the maintenance is dependent on the: a) Type of cladding or components, b) Position of cladding or components, c) location of the building, and d) site conditions.

TEXT: A risk assessment of the proposed design shall be carried out using a building envelope risk matrix. This allows the risks related to various features to be aggregated, resulting in a risk score for the design.
LRML: if(is(design, proposed)), then(obligation(and(has(design,riskAssessment),include(riskAssessment,buildingEnvelopeRiskMatrix),include(buildingEnvelopeRiskMatrix,riskAggregation),for(riskAggregation,features),is(riskAssessment.result,riskScore),has(design,riskScore))))
PARAPHRASE: If design is proposed, the design shall have a risk assessment using a building envelope risk matrix. The building envelope risk matrix allows risk aggregation for various features with the result being a risk score of the design.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
Second sentence could be deleted?
for/of?
Process...

TEXT: Table 1 sets out the definitions of risk levels relating to the location and design features of the building.
LRML: if(has(building, or(location, designFeature))), then(and(for(riskLevel, and(location, designFeature)),asPer(riskLevel.definition, nzbc_e2as1_t1)))
PARAPHRASE: If the building's location or design features have a risk, the definitions of location and design features are described in E2/AS1 Table 1.

TEXT: Table 2 sets out the risk matrix that shall be used to define the risk score for a building within the scope of this Acceptable Solution. A risk score is calculated for each external face of the building. Claddings are then selected from Table 3 according to the risk scores.
LRML: if(and(include(nzbc_e2as1_t2, riskMatrix), has(building, riskScore), complyWith(building, nzbc_e2as1))), then(and(obligation(by(riskScore.definition, riskMatrix)), loop(in(forEach(externalFace), building), obligation(and(define(externalFace.riskScore,x0),asPer(cladding.selection,nzbc_e2as1_t3))))))

TEXT: 3.3 Wall claddings; The following wall cladding systems are covered in this Acceptable Solution: a) Masonry veneer Paragraph 9.2 b) Stucco Paragraph 9.3 c) Timber weatherboards Paragraph 9.4 d) Fibre cement weatherboards Paragraph 9.5 e) Profiled metal wall claddings Paragraph 9.6 f) Fibre cement sheet Paragraph 9.7 g) Plywood sheet Paragraph 9.8 h) EIFS Paragraph 9.9.
LRML: if(is(wallCladdingSystem, or(masonryVeneer, stucco, timberWeatherboard, fibreCementWeatherboard, profiledMetalWallCladding, fibreCementSheet, plywoodSheet, eifs))), then(obligation(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, wallCladdingSystem)))
PARAPHRASE: If the wall cladding system is masonry veneer, stucco, timber weatherboards, fibre cement weatherboards, profiled metal wall claddings, fibre cement sheet, plywood sheet, or EIFS, then E2/AS1 applies to the wall cladding system.

TEXT: a) Masonry veneer b) Stucco c) Timber weatherboards d) Fibre cement weatherboards e) Profiled metal wall claddings f) Fibre cement sheet g) Plywood sheet h) EIFS. Other wall claddings are outside the scope of this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(and(not(is(wallCladdingSystem, and(masonryVeneer, stucco, timberWeatherboard, fibreCementWeatherboard, profiledMetalWallCladding, fibreCementSheet, plywoodSheet, eifs))))), then(not(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, cladding)))

TEXT: a) Masonry veneer b) Stucco c) Timber weatherboards d) Fibre cement weatherboards e) Profiled metal wall claddings f) Fibre cement sheet g) Plywood sheet h) EIFS. Other wall claddings are outside the scope of this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(not(is(wallCladdingSystem, and(masonryVeneer, stucco, timberWeatherboard, fibreCementWeatherboard, profiledMetalWallCladding, fibreCementSheet, plywoodSheet, eifs)))), then(not(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, cladding)))
PARAPHRASE: If the wall cladding system is not masonry veneer, stucco, timber weatherboards, fibre cement weatherboards, profiled metal wall claddings, fibre cement sheet, plywood sheet, and EIFS, then E2/AS1 applies not to the wall cladding system.

TEXT: Risk score 3.4.1.1 As all faces score low, cladding options from Table 3 are: a) Direct fixed claddings: i) Timber weatherboards – all types shown ii) Fibre cement weatherboards iii) Vertical profiled metal – corrugated and symmetrical trapezoidal only iv) Fibre cement sheet – not flush-finished v) Plywood sheet.
LRML: if(and(has(building.faces, riskScore),is(riskScore, low)is(cladding.application, wall), has(cladding, fixing), is(cladding.type, or(timberWeatherboard, fibreCementWeatherboard, verticalProfiledMetal, fibreCementSheet, plywoodSheet)))), then(permission(and(has(building, cladding),is(cladding.type, directFixed),is(cladding.type, or(timberWeatherboard, fibreCementWeatherboard, verticalProfiledMetal, fibreCementSheet, plywoodSheet)))))

TEXT: Risk score 3.4.1.1 As all faces score low, cladding options from Table 3 are: a) Direct fixed claddings: i) Timber weatherboards – all types shown ii) Fibre cement weatherboards iii) Vertical profiled metal – corrugated and symmetrical trapezoidal only iv) Fibre cement sheet – not flush-finished v) Plywood sheet.
LRML: if(and(has(building.faces, riskScore),is(riskScore, low))), then(permission(and(has(building, cladding),has(cladding, fixing),is(fixing, direct),is(cladding.type, or(timberWeatherboard, fibreCementWeatherboard, verticalProfiledMetal, fibreCementSheet, plywoodSheet)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the risk scores for all faces of the building are low, the building cladding may be direct fixed and be of type: Timber weatherboards, Fibre cement weatherboards, Vertical profiled metal, Fibre cement sheet, or Plywood sheet.
COMMENTS:
Example
should forEach be used?
Relevant information removed?

TEXT: Cladding system 4.1 Materials for flashings; Acceptable materials for flashing junctions and penetrations are described in Paragraph 4.3.
LRML: if(has(flashing, or(junction, penetration))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(junction.material,'nzbc_e2_as1_4.3.0.1'),complyWith(penetration.material,'nzbc_e2_as1_4.3.0.1'))))

TEXT: 3.3.1 Drains shall be laid on a uniform line and gradient between points of access (see Paragraph 3.7).
LRML: if(inBetween(drain.section, accessPoints)), then(obligation(not(include(drain.section, and(changeInDirection, changeInGradient)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drains section is between points of access, the drain section shall not include any changes in direction and gradient.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The change in direction of a drain where practical should be kept to less than 45° as illustrated in Figure 4.
LRML: if(and(has(drain, changeInDirection), is(changeInDirection.small, practical))), then(obligation(and(lessThan(changeInDirection, 45 deg),asPer(changeInDirection, nzbc_e1as_f4))))
PARAPHRASE: Where a small change in direction of a drain is practical, the change in direction should be less than 45 deg as illustrated in E1/AS1 Figure 4.

TEXT: 3.3.2 Where two drains intersect, the directions of flow as shown in Figure 5 shall be at an angle of 60° or less.
LRML: if(include(drain, drainIntersection)), then(obligation(lessThanEqual(flowDirection.angle, 60 deg)))
PARAPHRASE: Where two drains intersect, the flow directions as shown in Figure 5 shall be at an angle of 60° or less.

TEXT: 3.0 Drainage System Materials and Construction; 3.4.2 Restricted fall to outlet; Where the surface water sewer, road channel or other outfall is at too high a level to allow the gradient required by Table 2, the bubble-up chamber system shown in Figures 6 and 7 may be used.
LRML: if(and(greaterThan(outfall.elevation, value), asPer(value, nzbc_e1as1_t2))), then(permission(has(drain, bubbleupChamber)))
PARAPHRASE: Where the outfall elevation has a greater value as required by Table 2, the drain may have a bubble-up chamber.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
include(outfall, or(water sewer, road channel, other outfal) seems problematic, so removed it?

TEXT: 3.0 Drainage System Materials and Construction; The bubble-up chamber system shown in Figures 6 and 7 may be used provided that: The connections between the drain and downpipes are sealed.
LRML: if(has(drain, bubbleupChamber)), then(and(obligation(inBetween(connection, and(drain, downpipe))), obligation(is(connection, sealed))))
PARAPHRASE: If the drain has a bubble-up chamber, the connections between the drain and downpipes shall be sealed.

TEXT: 3.0 Drainage System Materials and Construction; The bubble-up chamber system shown in Figures 6 and 7 may be used provided that: The total chamber depth does not exceed 1.0 m.
LRML: if(has(drain, bubbleupChamber)), then(obligation(lessThanEqual(bubbleupChamber.depth, 1 m)))
PARAPHRASE: If the drain has a bubble-up chamber, the total chamber depth ahall not exceed 1.0 m.

TEXT: 3.5.2 Acceptable jointing methods and the relevant standards are given in Table 3. Jointing of drains shall be subject to the tests called for in Paragraph 3.8.
LRML: if(has(drain, joint)), then(obligation(and(asPer(joint, nzbc_e1as1_t3),asPer(test(joint), 'nzbc_e1as1_3.8.0.1'))))
PARAPHRASE: Acceptable jointing methods and the relevant standards are given in Table 3. Jointing of drains shall be subject to the tests called for in Paragraph 3.8.

TEXT: 3.5.2 Acceptable jointing methods and the relevant standards are given in Table 3. Jointing of drains shall be subject to the tests called for in Paragraph 3.8.
LRML: if(has(drain, joint)), then(obligation(and(asPer(joint, nzbc_e1as1_t3),asPer(test(joint), 'nzbc_e1as1_3.8.0.1'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the drain has a joint, the joint shall be as given in E1/AS1 Table 3 and tested as in E1/AS1 Paragraph 3.8.

TEXT: 3.5.2 Acceptable jointing methods and the relevant standards are given in Table 3. Jointing of drains shall be subject to the tests called for in Paragraph 3.8.
LRML: if(has(drain, joint)), then(obligation(and(asPer(joint, nzbc_e1as1_t3),asPer(test(joint), 'nzbc_e1as1_3.8.0.1'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the drain has a joint, the joint shall be as given in E1/AS1 Table 3 and tested as in E1/AS1 Paragraph 3.8.

TEXT: Where a drain consists of concrete, ceramic, vitrified clay or rubber ring jointed steel or uPVC, a flexible joint shall be installed within 225 mm of the outside wall of any access chamber or inspection chamber, but outside the line of the base (see Figures 11 and 12).
LRML: if(and(is(drain.material, or(concrete, ceramic, vitrifiedClay, rubberRingJointedSteel, uPvc)), has(drain, chamber), is(chamber.purpose, or(access, inspection)), define(chamber.wall, x0), is(x0, outside))), then(obligation(and(has(drain, joint),is(joint, flexible),has(drain, chamber), for(chamber, or(access, inspection)),has(chamber, externalWall),define(externalWall.location, x0),within(joint.location,'x0 + 255 mm'),has(drain, base),outside(joint.location, base))))
PARAPHRASE: Where a drain consists of concrete, ceramic, vitrified clay or rubber ring jointed steel or uPVC, a flexible joint shall be installed within 225 mm of the outside wall of any access chamber or inspection chamber, but outside the line of the drain base.

TEXT: 4.3.1 Where thermal movement of downpipes cannot be accommodated by movement of the guttering, expansion joints shall be incorporated.

TEXT: Finish colours for flush-finished fibre cement sheet and EIFS shall have a reflectivity of 40% or more when measured in accordance with ASTM C1549.
LRML: if(or(and(is(fibreCementSheet.type, flushFinished), has(fibreCementSheet, finishColour)), has(eifs, finishColour))), then(obligation(and(has(finishColour, reflectivity),greaterThanEqual(reflectivity,40 percent),asPer(reflectivity.measurement,astm_c1549))))
PARAPHRASE: If flush-finished fibre cement sheet or EIFS have finish colours, the finish colour shall have a reflectivity of 40% or more when measured in accordance with ASTM C1549.

TEXT: 5.3.1 Figure 7 gives acceptable methods for the bedding and backfilling of the drainage pipes listed in Table 1 except where: a) The trench is located within or above peat, b) Scouring of the trench is likely due to unstable soils, or d) The cover H to the pipe is more than 2.5 m.
LRML: if(and(asPer(drainPipe, nzbc_g13as2_t1), not(within(trench.location, peat)), not(above(trench.location, peat)), not(is(soil.type, unstable)), lessThanEqual(drainPipe.coverHeight, 2.5 m))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(drain.bedding, nzbc_g13as2_f7),complyWith(drain.backfilling, nzbc_g13as2_f7))))
PARAPHRASE: If drainage pipes are listed in G13/AS2 Table 1, the trench is not located within or above a peat, soil is not unstable, and the cover height of the pipe is no more than 2.5 m, then bedding and backfilling may comply with G13/AS2 Figure 7.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.4.1 Hearth slabs shall be of concrete no less than 75 mm thick, reinforced with D10 bars located centrally at 225 mm centres each way. See Figure 1.

PARAPHRASE: Hearth slabs shall be of concrete no less than 75 mm thick, reinforced with D10 bars located centrally at 225 mm centres each way.

TEXT: 1.4.1 Hearth slabs shall be of concrete no less than 75 mm thick, reinforced with D10 bars located centrally at 225 mm centres each way. See Figure 1.

TEXT: 1.6.1 Reinforcing of foundation walls and chimney bases (including the gathers) (see Figures 2 to 5 inclusive) shall comprise: a) D12 bars at 400 mm maximum centres vertically. Laps in bars shall be no less than 300 mm. b) R6 bars at 200 mm centres horizontally. These will be in the form of U bars.

PARAPHRASE: Reinforcing part of foundation walls, chimney bases, and chimney gathers shall comprise: a) D12 reinforcing bars at 400 mm maximum centres vertically. Laps in reinforcing bars shall be no less than 300 mm. b) R6 reinforcing bars at 200 mm centres horizontally. These will be in the form of U bars.

TEXT: 1.6.1 Reinforcing of chimney stacks shall comprise: a) D12 bars at 400 mm maximum centres vertically. Laps in bars shall be no less than 300 mm. b) R6 bars at 200 mm centres horizontally. These will be in the form of closed stirrups in the stack.

TEXT: Cladding system 4.1 Materials for flashings; Acceptable materials for flashing junctions and penetrations are described in Paragraph 4.3.
LRML: if(has(flashing, or(junction, penetration))), then(obligation(and(asPer(junction.material,'nzbc_e2_as1_4.3.0.1'),asPer(penetration.material,'nzbc_e2_as1_4.3.0.1'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the flashing has junctions or penetrations, the junction and penetration materials shall be as described in E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.3.

TEXT: Flashing materials shall take into account the following factors: a) The requirements of NZBC Clause B2 Durability, b) The environment where the building is located, c) The specific conditions of use, and d) Consideration of the surrounding materials.
LRML: if(exist(flashing)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(flashing.material,nzbc_b2),asPer(flashing.material,and(buildingEnvironment,conditionOfUse,surroundingMaterial)))))
PARAPHRASE: Flashing materials shall comply with NZBC Clause, and be accoring to the building environment, the conditions of use, surrounding materials.

TEXT: Flashing materials shall be selected according to the relevant exposure conditions as defined in Table 20 to minimise corrosion.
LRML: if(has(flashing, material)), then(obligation(and(asPer(flashing.material,exposure),asPer(exposure,nzbc_e2as1_t20))))
PARAPHRASE: Flashing materials shall be according to the exposure in E2/AS1 Table 20.

TEXT: 4.2.2 Surrounding materials; Uncoated metals shall not be used where carbon deposits or chemical contaminants may accumulate.
LRML: if(and(has(material, accumulation),is(accumulation.type, and(carbonDeposit, chemicalContamination)))), then(prohibition(and(is(material, metal),is(metal.type, uncoated))))
PARAPHRASE: Uncoated metals shall not be used where carbon deposits or chemical contaminants may accumulate.

TEXT: uPVC flashings shall be a minimum of 0.75 mm thick. uPVC flashings shall comply with the requirements of the following Clauses of AS/NZS 4256: Part 2: a) Clause 9.2 Impact resistance, b) Clause 9.3 Tensile strength, and c)  Clause 9.4 Colourfastness and impact resistance following ultraviolet light exposure.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, uPvc)), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(flashing.thickness, 0.75 mm)), obligation(complyWith(flashing, and('nzs_4256_2_9.2', 'nzs_4256_2_9.3', 'nzs_4256_2_9.4')))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are made of uPVC, the flashing shall be a minimum of 0.75 mm thick and comply with NZS 4256 Part 2 Clause 9.2, 9.3 Tensile strength, and 9.4.

TEXT: uPVC flashings shall be a minimum of 0.75 mm thick. uPVC flashings shall comply with the requirements of the following Clauses of AS/NZS 4256: Part 2: a) Clause 9.2 Impact resistance, b) Clause 9.3 Tensile strength, and c)  Clause 9.4 Colourfastness and impact resistance following ultraviolet light exposure.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, uPvc)), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(flashing.thickness,0.75mm),complyWith(flashing,and('nzs_4256_2_9.2','nzs_4256_2_9.3','nzs_4256_2_9.4')))))

TEXT: uPVC flashings shall have a finish colour with a reflectance of 40% or more, as outlined in Paragraph 2.4.

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Store goods and other materials (WS - Storage and trade service).
LRML: if(or(is(building.activity, or(storage, tradeService)), equal(building.riskGroup, ws),and(has(building, part),or(    is(part.activity, or(storage, tradeService)), equal(part.riskGroup, ws))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_cas2, and(building, part)))
PARAPHRASE: If a buildings or parts of buildings has activity storage or trade service or risk group wb, CAS2 applies to the building and part.

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.4 FRRs shall apply to the sides of primary elements and secondary elements which are exposed to fire.
LRML: if(and(is(element.type, or(primary, secondary)),has(sideOf(building.element), exposure), is(exposure.type, fire))), then(obligation(has(sideOf(building.element), fireResistanceRating)))
PARAPHRASE:
If an element is primary or secondary

Fire resistance ratings shall apply to the sides of primary elements and secondary elements which are exposed to fire.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.4 FRRs shall apply to the sides of primary elements and secondary elements which are exposed to fire.
LRML: if(and(is(element.type, or(primary, secondary)),has(element, fireResistanceRating),has(element, side),exposedTo(element.side, fire))), then(obligation(applyTo(fireResistanceRating, side)))
PARAPHRASE: If an element is primary or secondary and has a fire resistance rating and a side is exposed to fire, then the fire resistance rating shall apply to this side.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.4 FRRs shall apply to the sides of primary elements and secondary elements which are exposed to fire.

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.6 Floors shall have an FRR for exposure from the underside.
LRML: if(exist(floor)), then(obligation(has(floor.underside, fireResistanceRating)))
PARAPHRASE: The underside of floors shall have an fire resistance ratings.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.7 The FRR of a primary element integral with a fire separation shall be no less than that of the fire separation.
LRML: if(and(is(element.type, primary), partOf(element, fireSeparation))), then(obligation(and(define(fireSeparation.fireResistanceRating, x0),greaterThanEqual(fireResistanceRating.element, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If a primary element is part of a fire separation, the element's fire resistance ratings shall be no less than the fire resistance rating of the fire separation.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.1.1 All buildings shall have means of escape from fire which include escape routes. An escape route (see Figure 3.1) shall provide protection to any occupant escaping to a safe place from a fire within a building.
LRML: if(exist(building)), then(obligation(and(has(building,meansOfEscapeFromFire),include(meansOfEscapeFromFire,escapeRoute),has(escapeRoute, fireProtection))))
PARAPHRASE: All buildings shall have means of escape from fire which include escape routes. An escape route shall provide protection to any occupant escaping to a safe place from a fire within a building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.1.2 The components of an escape route, in ascending order of protection, are the: a) Open paths, and b) Exitways (these may comprise of smoke lobbies and safe paths), and c) Final exits (see Figure 3.1). Two or more of these components will be necessary.
LRML: if(include(escapeRoute.component, and(openPath, exitway, finalExit))), then(obligation(and(define(openPath.degreeOfProtection, x0), define(exitway.degreeOfProtection, x1), define(finalExit.degreeOfProtection, x2)lessThan(x0,x1),lessThan(x1,x2),greaterThan(count(escapeRoute.component), 1))))
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.9.4 Trench width; The width B of the trench shall be no less than the pipe diameter D plus 200 mm. Trench width at the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm unless the pipe(s) in the trench are covered with concrete, as shown in Figure 13 (c).
LRML: if(within(pipe, trench)), then(and(obligation(and(define(pipe.diameter, x0),greaterThanEqual(trench.width, 'x0 + 200 mm'))), or(obligation(and(define(topOf(pipe), x1),define(trench.width, x2),is(x2.elevation, x1),lessThanEqual(x2, 600 mm))), obligation(and(has(trench, cover),is(cover.material, concrete))))))
PARAPHRASE: If the pip is in a trench, then the width of the trench shall be no less than the pipe diameter plus 200 mm. Trench width at the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm unless the pipe in the trench are covered with concrete.

within/for
width at top of -> trench.width.elevation

TEXT: 3.4.2 The floor waste, and the water trap if used, shall have a minimum diameter of 40 mm.

TEXT: Individual floor waste pipes connected to a floor waste stack need not be vented (see Figure 3).
LRML: if(within(pipe, floorWasteStack)), then(permission(not(has(pipe, ventilation))))
PARAPHRASE: Individual pipes in a floor waste stack need not be vented.

TEXT: All trap charging systems shall incorporate backflow prevention in accordance with G12/AS1.

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: Refer to Figure 48 for example of use. The apron shall: iii) for profiled metal roof cladding, overhang flashing a minimum 10 mm clear of crest and maximum 5 mm clear of trough as shown in Figure 47.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), above(flashing, metalRoofing), is(flashing, parallel),has(metalRoofing, cladding),is(cladding.material, profiledMetal))), then(obligation(and(include(flashing.clearance,crest),greaterThanEqual(crest.clearance,10 mm),include(flashing.clearance,trough),lessThanEqual(trough.clearance,5 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If apron flashings are over metal roofing, the flashings are parallel, and the metal roofing has profiled metal roof cladding, then the flashing shall be dimensioned to suit the metal roofing cladding profile.

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: Refer to Figure 48 for example of use. The apron shall: iii) for profiled metal roof cladding, overhang flashing a minimum 10 mm clear of crest and maximum 5 mm clear of trough as shown in Figure 47.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), above(flashing, metalRoofing), is(flashing, parallel),has(metalRoofing, cladding),is(cladding.material, profiledMetal))), then(obligation(and(has(cladding, crest),towards(flashing.clearance, crest),greaterThanEqual(flashing.clearance, 10 mm),has(cladding, trough),towards(flashing.clearance,trough),lessThanEqual(flashing.clearance, 5 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If apron flashings are over metal roofing, the flashings are parallel, and the metal roofing has profiled metal roof cladding, then the flashing shall overhang a minimum 10 mm clear of crest and maximum 5 mm clear of trough as shown in Figure 47.

TEXT: 3.2.1 Except where Paragraph 3.13 allows the use of single escape routes, every occupied space in a building shall be served by two or more escape routes (see Figure 3.2).
LRML: if(and(greaterThan(space.occupantLoad, 0),not(permission(and(asPer(count(space.escapeRoute), 'nzbc_cas2_3.13'),equal(count(space.escapeRoute), 1)))))), then(or(obligation(and(equal(count(space.escapeRoute), 1),asPer(count(space.escapeRoute), 'nzbc_cas2_3.13'))),obligation(greaterThanEqual(count(space.escapeRoute), 2))))
PARAPHRASE: If the space's occupand load is greater 0 and C/AS2 3.13 does not allow single escape routes, then the spaces espace routes should be two ore more.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Firecells shall be fire separated from each other by the higher of the two FRRs if the adjoining firecell has a higher FRR (refer to Paragraph 2.3).
LRML: if(and(has(building, firecell), greaterThan(count(firecell), 1))), then(obligation(complyWith(firecell.fireSafetySystem, 'cap_cas2_2.2.3')))
PARAPHRASE: Firecells shall be fire separated from each other by the higher of the two fire resistance ratings if the adjoining firecell has a higher FRR.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Firecells shall be fire separated from each other by the higher of the two FRRs if the adjoining firecell has a higher FRR (refer to Paragraph 2.3).
LRML: if(and(adjoin(firecells), not(equal(firecells.fireResistanceRating)))), then(obligation(and(inBetween(fireSeparation, firecells),define(max(firecells.fireResistanceRating), x0),is(fireSeparation.fireResistanceRating, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If the adjoining firecells have different fire resistance ratings, the firecells shall have fire separation between them, with the greater of the higher of the two fire resistance ratings.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: R-values for walls, roofs and ceilings shall be no less than: For roof or ceilings of any construction, 1.5.

TEXT: 3.9.3 Trench slope; These anti-scour blocks shall be: Extended to ground level where the drain cover is less than 300 mm.
LRML: if(and(has(trench, antiScourBlocks),has(drain, cover),lessThan(cover.depth, 300 mm))), then(obligation(is(antiScourBlocks.elevation, groundLevel)))
PARAPHRASE: If the trench has anti-scour blocks and the drain cover is less than 300 mm, these anti-scour blocks shall be ground level elevation.

TEXT: 3.4.2 In buildings other than Housing, grease traps shall be provided where waste water is likely to convey grease.

TEXT: 3.4.3 The capacity of a grease trap shall be at least twice the capacity of all sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances discharging to it, and in no case less than 100 litres as shown in Figure 4.

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.4.4 For restaurants and cafés, the capacity of the grease trap shall be at least 5 litres for each person for whom seating is provided, and in no case less than that required by Paragraph 3.4.3.

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: For Low, Medium, High and Very High wind zones, flashing upstands shall have either: 1) A hem or hook to Figure 5, with upstand dimensions as shown throughout the document, or 2) No hooks or hems, and flashing upstand dimensions increased by 25 mm beyond those shown.

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: a) Rivets used for joining and sealing laps shall be spaced at a maximum of 50 mm centres, and be: i) compatible with the flashing material as per Table 21 and Table 22, and ii) sealed against moisture, or iii) of a sealing type or blind rivet,.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.material, metal), has(flashing.join, rivet), for(rivet, and(joinLap, sealLap)))), then(obligation(and(lessThanEqual(rivet.spacing, 50 mmCentres),inBetween(compatibility, and(rivet, material)),complyWith(compatibility,and(nzbc_e2as1_t21, nzbc_e2as1_t22)),or(against(rivet.sealing, moisture),is(rivet.type, or(sealing, blind))))))

TEXT: Structure Design 7.0 Glazing; Table 14 - Structural balustrade – cantilevered glass; Table 15 - Structural balustrade – two-edge point fixed; Table 16 - Structural balustrade – two-edge support; Table 17 - Structural balustrade – three-edge support. Design types and glass types not shown in Tables 14 to 17 require specific design.
LRML: if(and(is(structure, balustrade), not(is(balustrade.design, or(cantileveredGlass, twoEdgePointFixed, twoEdgeSupport, threeEdgeSupport))))), then(obligation(is(balustrade.design, specificDesign)))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.6.1 Reinforcing of chimney stacks (see Figures 2 to 5 inclusive) shall comprise: a) D12 bars at 400 mm maximum centres vertically. Laps in bars shall be no less than 300 mm. b) R6 bars at 200 mm centres horizontally. These will be in the form of closed stirrups in the stack.
LRML: if(partOf(reinforcing, chimneyStack)), then(and(obligation(and(include(reinforcing, reinforcingBar),is(reinforcingBar.type,d12),is(reinforcingBar.location,400 mmCentres),is(reinforcingBar.orientation, vertical),greaterThanEqual(reinforcingBar.lap,300 mm))),obligation(and(include(reinforcing, reinforcingBar),is(reinforcingBar.type,r6),is(reinforcingBar.location,200 mmCentres),is(reinforcingBar.orientation, horizontal),is(reinforcingBar.type, stirrup),is(stirrup.type, closed)))))
PARAPHRASE: Reinforcing part of chimney stacks shall comprise: a) D12 reinforcing bars at 400 mm maximum centres vertically. Laps in reinforcing bars shall be no less than 300 mm. b) R6 reinforcing bars at 200 mm centres horizontally. These will be in the form of closed stirrups.

TEXT: 1.6.1 Reinforcing of foundation walls, chimney bases (including the gathers) and chimney stacks (see Figures 2 to 5 inclusive) shall comprise: Double horizontal reinforcing at any change in direction of the vertical steel (e.g. at the gather/stack intersection).
LRML: if(and(partOf(reinforcing, or(foundationWall, chimneyBase, chimneyGather, chimneyStack)), is(reinforcing.type, verticalReinforcingBar))), then(loop(in(forEach(changeInDirection), verticalReinforcingBar), and(obligation(is(reinforcing.type, horizontalReinforcingBar)), obligation(equal(count(horizontalReinforcingBar), 2)))))
PARAPHRASE: Reinforcing of foundation walls, chimney bases, chimney gathers, and chimney stacks shall include: Double horizontal reinforcing at any change in direction of the vertical steel (e.g. at the gather/stack intersection).

TEXT: 1.1.1 The scope of this Acceptable Solution is restricted to all risk groups listed in Table 1.1 except for risk group SH (refer to C/AS1).

TEXT: Maintenance shall be carried out as necessary (Rule 2.5.0.2) to achieve the required durability of materials, components and junctions.

PARAPHRASE: If the buildings materials, components or junctions require durability, the building shall have maintenance complying to E2AS1 Rule 2.5.0.2.

TEXT: Maintenance shall be carried out as necessary (Rule 2.5.0.2) to achieve the required durability of materials, components and junctions.

PARAPHRASE: If the buildings materials, components or junctions require durability, the building shall have maintenance complying to E2AS1 Rule 2.5.0.2.

TEXT: The extent and nature of necessary maintenance is dependent on the: a) Type of cladding or components used, b) Position of cladding or components on the building, c) Geographical location of the building, and d) Specific site conditions.
LRML: if(obligation(has(building, maintenance))), then(obligation(and(has(maintenance.extent,dependency),has(maintenance.nature,dependency),is(dependency,or(claddingType,componentType)),is(dependency,or(claddingPosition,componentPosition)),is(dependency,and(buildingLocation,siteCondition)))))

TEXT: 3.4.4 For restaurants and cafés, the capacity of the grease trap shall be at least 5 litres for each person for whom seating is provided, and in no case less than that required by Paragraph 3.4.3.
LRML: if(is(building.activity, or(restaurant, cafe))), then(obligation(and(define(count(building.seating), x0),greaterThanEqual(greaseTrap.capacity, 'x0 * 5 l'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the building's acitivity is restaurant or cafe, the capacity of the grease trap shall be at least 5 litres for each person for whom seating is provided.
AUTHOR: Stefan

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.4 Grease traps 3.4.6 The top of the outlet junction shall be extended to finished ground level and fitted with a watertight rodding point access cover as shown in Figures 4 and 10.
LRML: if(exist(greaseTrap)), then(and(obligation(include(greaseTrap, outletJunction)), obligation(is(outletJunction.elevation, finishedGroundLevel)), obligation(has(outletJunction, roddingPoint)), obligation(include(roddingPoint.fixture, accessCover)), obligation(is(accessCover, watertight))))
PARAPHRASE: The top of the outlet junction shall be extended to finished ground level and fitted with a watertight rodding point access cover as shown in Figures 4 and 10.

TEXT: 3.4 Grease traps 3.4.6 The top of the outlet junction shall be extended to finished ground level and fitted with a watertight rodding point access cover as shown in Figures 4 and 10.

TEXT: 3.5.2 Drains shall be installed at the maximum practicable gradient.
LRML: if(is(drain.installation, true)), then(obligation(is(drain.gradient, maximumPracticable)))
PARAPHRASE: Drains shall be installed at the maximum practicable gradient.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.6.2 Drains shall have a diameter of not less than 100 mm where the drain does not serve only waste water fixtures.
LRML: if(and(for(drain, fixture),not(is(fixture, wasteWaterFixture)))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(drain.diameter, 100 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: Where the drain does not serve only waste water fixtures drains shall have a diameter of not less than 100 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.6.2 Drains shall have a diameter of not less than 80 mm where the drain serves only waste water fixtures.
LRML: if(and(for(drain, wasteWaterFixture),not(for(drain, fixture)),not(is(fixture, wasteWaterFixture)))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(drain.diameter, 80 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: Where the drain serves waste water fixtures and not fixtures that are not waste water fixtures, drains shall have a diameter of not less than 80 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.1.2 Every main drain, and every branch drain longer than 10 m, shall be ventilated in accordance with Table 3.

PARAPHRASE: Every main drain, and every branch drain longer than 10 m, shall be ventilated in accordance with Table 3.

TEXT: 5.1.1 Rigid pipes shall have flexible joints to resist damage from differential settlement.

LRML: if(is(pipe, rigid)), then(obligation(and(has(pipe,joint),is(joint,flexible))))

TEXT: 5.1.2 Jointing for PVC-U pipes and fittings shall be in accordance with the methods described in AS/NZS 2032.
LRML: if(or(is(pipe.material, pvcU), is(pipeFitting.material, pvcU))), then(obligation(and(asPer(pipe.joint, nzs_2032),asPer(pipeFitting.joint, nzs_2032))))

If cladding material is profiled metal, and the cladding has flashing

drop cover?

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall have (see Figures 2 and 3): Waste pipe outlets located at least 20 mm above water seal level, and at least 20 mm below the grating.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(has(gullyTrap, wastePipeOutlet), define(waterSeal.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(wastePipeOutlet.elevation,'x0 + 20 mm'),define(grating.elevation, x1),lessThanEqual(wastePipeOutlet.elevation,'x1 - 20 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: All gully traps shall have: Waste pipe outlets with elevation at least 20 mm above water seal elevation, and at least 20 mm below the grating elevation.
COMMENTS: "at least" is actual lessThanEqual in this case
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall have (see Figures 2 and 3): The top of the water seal no more than 600 mm below the top of the gully dish.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(define(topOf(gullyTrap.gullyDish), x0), greaterThanEqual(topOf(gullyTrap.waterSeal), 'x0 - 600 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: For all gully traps, the top of the water seal shall be no more than 600 mm below the top of the gully dish.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall have (see Figures 2 and 3): i) Adequate support from bedding and backfilling with: i) concrete no less than 75 mm thick surrounding the entire gully dish and which is separated from the building foundation, where the gully trap is likely to be damaged, and j) A minimum of 600 mm clear access space above the gully dish.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(and(obligation(has(gullyTrap, support)), obligation(is(support.type, and(bedding, backfilling))), obligation(and(include(support,separation),inBetween(separation,and(gullyDish,buildingFoundation)),include(support,concreteSurround),greaterThanEqual(concreteSurround.thickness,75mm),)),obligation(and(has(gullyDish,accessSpace),is(accessSpace,vertical),above(accessSpace,gullyDish),greaterThanEqual(accessSpace,600mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: All gully traps shall have: i) Adequate support from bedding and backfilling with: i) concrete no less than 75 mm thick surrounding the entire gully dish and which is separated from the building foundation, where the gully trap is likely to be damaged, and j) A minimum of 600 mm clear access space above the gully dish.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall have (see Figures 2 and 3): i) Adequate support from bedding and backfilling with: i) concrete no less than 75 mm thick surrounding the entire gully dish and which is separated from the building foundation, where the gully trap is likely to be damaged, and j) A minimum of 600 mm clear access space above the gully dish.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(and(obligation(has(gullyTrap, and(bedding, backfilling))), obligation(and(has(gullyTrap, gullyDish),around(concrete, gullyDish),greaterThanEqual(concrete.thickness, 75 mm),or(awayFrom(concrete, buildingFoundation),not(is(gullyTrap, damageProne))))),obligation(and(has(gullyDish,accessSpace),is(accessSpace,vertical),above(accessSpace,gullyDish),greaterThanEqual(accessSpace, 600 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: All gully traps shall have: i) bedding and backfilling with: i) concrete no less than 75 mm thick surrounding the entire gully dish and either the concrete is away from the building foundation or the gully trap is not damage prone, and j) A minimum of 600 mm clear access space above the gully dish.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.2 Gully trap which shall: Have a grating that will allow surcharge.
LRML: if(has(drain.system, gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(has(gullyTrap,grating),for(grating,surcharge))))
PARAPHRASE: Gully trap which shall: Have a grating that will allow surcharge.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.2 Gully trap which shall: Have a grating that will allow surcharge.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(has(gullyTrap,grating),for(grating,surcharge))))
PARAPHRASE: Gully trap shall have a grating for surcharge.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.4.1 Grease traps shall be provided for any discharge pipe serving a sink(s) where the foul water discharges to a soak pit.
LRML: if(and(for(dischargePipe, sink), is(drain.medium, foulWater), into(drain.discharge, soakPit))), then(obligation(has(dischargePipe, greaseTrap)))
PARAPHRASE: If discharge pipe serving a sink(s) and the foul water discharges to a soak pit, then the dicharge pipe shall have grease traps.
COMMENTS: Evaluation: Equaltiy for(a, b) == has(b, a)?
AUTHOR: Stefan
