TEXT: 3.4.2 In buildings other than Housing, grease traps shall be provided where waste water is likely to convey grease.
LRML: if(and(not(is(building.classifiedUse, housing)), include(building.wasteWater, grease))), then(obligation(has(drain, greaseTrap)))
PARAPHRASE: If a buildings classified use is not Housing and its waste water is likely to convey grease, grease traps shall be provided for the drain.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.4.3 The capacity of a grease trap shall be at least twice the capacity of all sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances discharging to it, and in no case less than 100 litres as shown in Figure 4.
LRML: if(exist(greaseTrap)), then(and(into(sanitaryFixtures.discharge, greaseTrap),define(sum(sanitaryFixtures.capacity), x0),into(sanitaryAppliances.discharge, greaseTrap),define(sum(sanitaryAppliances.capacity), x1),obligation(greaterThanEqual(greaseTrap.capacity, and('2 * (x0 + x1)', 100 l)))))
PARAPHRASE: The capacity of a grease trap shall be at least twice the capacity of all sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances discharging to it, and in no case less than 100 litres as shown in Figure 4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The extent and nature of necessary maintenance is dependent on the: a) Type of cladding or components used, b) Position of cladding or components on the building, c) Geographical location of the building, and d) Specific site conditions.
LRML: if(has(building, maintenance)), then(obligation(and(has(maintenance.extent,dependency),has(maintenance.nature,dependency),is(dependency,or(claddingType,componentType)),is(dependency,or(claddingPosition,componentPosition)),is(dependency,and(buildingLocation,siteCondition)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the building has maintainance, the extent and nature of the maintenance is dependent on the: a) Type of cladding or components, b) Position of cladding or components, c) location of the building, and d) site conditions.

TEXT: Table 1 sets out the definitions of risk levels relating to the location and design features of the building.
LRML: if(or(has(building.location, riskLevel), has(building.designFeature, riskLevel))), then(asPer(riskLevel.definition, nzbc_e2as1_t1))
PARAPHRASE: If the building has location and design features, the definitions of location and design features are described in E2/AS1 Table 1.

TEXT: Table 1 sets out the definitions of risk levels relating to the location and design features of the building.
LRML: if(has(building, or(location, designFeature))), then(and(for(riskLevel, and(location, designFeature)),asPer(riskLevel.definition, nzbc_e2as1_t1)))
PARAPHRASE: If the building has a location or design feature, the definitions of the risk level for the location and design feature are described in E2/AS1 Table 1.

TEXT: 3.3 Wall claddings; The following wall cladding systems are covered in this Acceptable Solution: a) Masonry veneer Paragraph 9.2 b) Stucco Paragraph 9.3 c) Timber weatherboards Paragraph 9.4 d) Fibre cement weatherboards Paragraph 9.5 e) Profiled metal wall claddings Paragraph 9.6 f) Fibre cement sheet Paragraph 9.7 g) Plywood sheet Paragraph 9.8 h) EIFS Paragraph 9.9.
LRML: if(is(wallCladdingSystem, or(masonryVeneer, stucco, timberWeatherboard, fibreCementWeatherboard, profiledMetalWallCladding, fibreCementSheet, plywoodSheet, eifs))), then(obligation(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, wallCladdingSystem)))
PARAPHRASE: If the wall cladding system is masonry veneer, stucco, timber weatherboards, fibre cement weatherboards, profiled metal wall claddings, fibre cement sheet, plywood sheet, or EIFS, then E2/AS1 applies to the wall cladding system.

TEXT: a) Masonry veneer b) Stucco c) Timber weatherboards d) Fibre cement weatherboards e) Profiled metal wall claddings f) Fibre cement sheet g) Plywood sheet h) EIFS. Other wall claddings are outside the scope of this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.application, wall), not(is(cladding.system, and(masonryVeneer, stucco, timberWeatherboard, fibreCementWeatherboard, profiledMetalWallCladding, fibreCementSheet, plywoodSheet, eifs))))), then(not(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, cladding)))

TEXT: a) Masonry veneer b) Stucco c) Timber weatherboards d) Fibre cement weatherboards e) Profiled metal wall claddings f) Fibre cement sheet g) Plywood sheet h) EIFS. Other wall claddings are outside the scope of this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(and(not(is(wallCladdingSystem, and(masonryVeneer, stucco, timberWeatherboard, fibreCementWeatherboard, profiledMetalWallCladding, fibreCementSheet, plywoodSheet, eifs))))), then(not(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, cladding)))
PARAPHRASE: If the wall cladding system is not masonry veneer, stucco, timber weatherboards, fibre cement weatherboards, profiled metal wall claddings, fibre cement sheet, plywood sheet, and EIFS, then E2/AS1 applies not to the wall cladding system.

TEXT: Risk score 3.4.1.1 As all faces score low, cladding options from Table 3 are: a) Direct fixed claddings: i) Timber weatherboards – all types shown ii) Fibre cement weatherboards iii) Vertical profiled metal – corrugated and symmetrical trapezoidal only iv) Fibre cement sheet – not flush-finished v) Plywood sheet.
LRML: if(and(has(building.faces, riskScore),is(riskScore, low))), then(permission(and(has(building, cladding),has(cladding, fixing),is(fixing, direct),is(cladding.type, or(timberWeatherboard, fibreCementWeatherboard, verticalProfiledMetal, fibreCementSheet, plywoodSheet)))))

TEXT: Risk score 3.4.1.1 As all faces score low, cladding options from Table 3 are: a) Direct fixed claddings: i) Timber weatherboards – all types shown ii) Fibre cement weatherboards iii) Vertical profiled metal – corrugated and symmetrical trapezoidal only iv) Fibre cement sheet – not flush-finished v) Plywood sheet.
LRML: if(and(has(building.faces, riskScore),is(riskScore, low))), then(permission(and(has(building, cladding),has(cladding, fixing),is(fixing, direct),is(cladding.type, or(timberWeatherboard, fibreCementWeatherboard, verticalProfiledMetal, fibreCementSheet, plywoodSheet)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the risk scores for all faces of the building are low, the building cladding may be direct fixed and be of type: Timber weatherboards, Fibre cement weatherboards, Vertical profiled metal, Fibre cement sheet, or Plywood sheet.
COMMENTS:
Example
should forEach be used?
Relevant information removed?

TEXT: Flashing materials shall take into account the following factors: a) The requirements of NZBC Clause B2 Durability, b) The environment where the building is located, c) The specific conditions of use, and d) Consideration of the surrounding materials.
LRML: if(exist(flashing)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(flashing.material,nzbc_b2),asPer(flashing.material,and(buildingEnvironment,conditionOfUse,surroundingMaterial)))))
PARAPHRASE: Flashing materials shall comply with NZBC Clause, and be accoring to the building environment, the conditions of use, surrounding materials.

TEXT: Flashing materials shall be selected according to the relevant exposure conditions as defined in Table 20 to minimise corrosion.
LRML: if(has(flashing, material)), then(obligation(and(has(flashing.material,exposure),asPer(exposure,nzbc_e2as1_t20))))
PARAPHRASE: Flashing materials shall be selected according to the relevant exposure conditions as defined in Table 20 to minimise corrosion.

TEXT: Flashing materials shall be selected according to the relevant exposure conditions as defined in Table 20 to minimise corrosion.
LRML: if(has(flashing, material)), then(obligation(and(asPer(flashing.material,relevantExposureCondition),asPer(flashing.material,nzbc_e2as1_t20))))
PARAPHRASE: Flashing materials shall be according to the exposure in Table 20 to minimise corrosion.

TEXT: 5.1.2 Jointing for PVC-U pipes and fittings shall be in accordance with the methods described in AS/NZS 2032.
LRML: if(or(is(pipe.material, pvcU), is(pipeFitting.material, pvcU))), then(obligation(and(asPer(pipe.joint, nzs_2032),asPer(pipeFitting.joint, nzs_2032))))
PARAPHRASE: Jointing for PVC-U pipes and PVC-U pipe fittings shall be in accordance with the methods described in AS/NZS 2032.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.10.1 Where a drain or part of a drain is no longer required, it shall be disconnected from the foul water drainage system at the junction with the live drain or at the property boundary.
LRML: if(or(not(is(drain, required)), not(is(drain.part, required)))), then(obligation(and(disconnect(drain, or(liveDrainJunction,propertyBoundary)),disconnect(drain.part, or(liveDrainJunction,propertyBoundary)))))
PARAPHRASE: Where a drain or part of a drain is no longer required, it shall be disconnected from the foul water drainage system at the junction with the live drain or at the property boundary.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Where drains are laid at gradients of 1:80 or less, verifiable levelling devices shall be used to ensure uniform and accurate gradients.
LRML: if(lessThanEqual(drain.gradient, 1/80)), then(obligation(and(requires(drain.installation,levellingDevice),is(levellingDevice,verifiable))))
PARAPHRASE: Where drains are laid at gradients of 1:80 or less, a verifiable levelling devices shall be used.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.3.1 Figure 7 gives acceptable methods for the bedding and backfilling of the drainage pipes listed in Table 1 except where: a) The trench is located within or above peat, b) Scouring of the trench is likely due to unstable soils, or d) The cover H to the pipe is more than 2.5 m.
LRML: if(and(asPer(drainPipe, nzbc_g13as2_t1), not(within(trench.location, peat)), not(above(trench.location, peat)), not(is(soil.type, unstable)), lessThanEqual(drainPipe.coverHeight, 2.5 m))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(drain.bedding, nzbc_g13as2_f7),complyWith(drain.backfilling, nzbc_g13as2_f7))))
PARAPHRASE: If drainage pipes are listed in G13/AS2 Table 1, the trench is not located within or above a peat, soil is not unstable, and the cover height of the pipe is no more than 2.5 m, then bedding and backfilling may be according to G13/AS2 Figure 7.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.3.1 Figure 7 gives acceptable methods for the bedding and backfilling of the drainage pipes listed in Table 1 except where: a) The trench is located within or above peat, b) Scouring of the trench is likely due to unstable soils, or d) The cover H to the pipe is more than 2.5 m.
LRML: if(and(asPer(drainPipe, nzbc_g13as2_t1), not(within(trench.location, peat)), not(above(trench.location, peat)), not(is(soil.type, unstable)), lessThanEqual(drainPipe.coverH, 2.5 m))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(drain.bedding, nzbc_g13as2_f7),complyWith(drain.backfilling, nzbc_g13as2_f7))))
PARAPHRASE: If drainage pipes are listed in G13/AS2 Table 1, the trench is not located within or above a peat, soil is not unstable, and the cover height of the pipe is no more than 2.5 m, then bedding and backfilling may comply with G13/AS2 Figure 7.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The width B of the trench shall be no less than the pipe diameter D plus 200 mm.
LRML: if(and(in(pipe.location, trench), define(pipe.diameter, x0))), then(obligation(and(define(pipe.diameter, x0),greaterThanEqual(trench.width, 'x0 + 200 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: The width of the trench shall be no less than the pipe diameter plus 200 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design 7.0 Glazing; All structural glass barriers safeguarding a fall of 1000 mm or more shall have interlinking rails.
LRML: if(and(is(structure.material, glass), is(structure, safetyBarrier), against(safetyBarrier, fall), greaterThanEqual(fall.height, 1000 mm))), then(obligation(and(has(structure,rail),is(rail,interlinked))))
PARAPHRASE: If a structure is made of glass and is a safety barrier against a fall of 1000 mm or more, the structure shall have interlinking rails.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design 2.0 Masonry 2.1 NZS 4229 subject to the following modifications: 2.1.1 NZS 4229 Clause 7.8.3 Delete clause 7.8.3. Replace with: Rule 2.1.1.1.
LRML: if(and(is(structure.material, masonry), define(x0, _new), is(x0, 'nzs_4229_7.8.3'))), then(and(obligation(complyWith(structure.design, nzs_4229)), obligation(has(x0.content, modification)), obligation(is(modification.type, replace)), obligation(is(modification.content, rule)), obligation(equal(rule.key, 2.1.1.1))))
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.1 Type; The acceptable solutions described in this document are for chimneys built of brickwork, concrete or precast pumice concrete, that are connected to timber frame or masonry buildings complying with NZS 3604 or NZS 4229.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.material, or(brickwork, concrete, precastPumiceConcrete)), connect(chimney, building), is(building.material, or(timberFrame, masonry)), complyWith(building, or(nzs_3604, nzs_4229)))), then(permission(complyWith(chimney, nzbc_b1as3)))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys are built of brickwork, concrete or precast pumice concrete and the chimneys are connected to timber frame buildings or masonry buildings complying with NZS 3604 or NZS 4229, B1/AS3 applies to the chimney.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.2 Height; The height of any chimney measured from the top of the chimney foundation slab to the top of the chimney stack shall not exceed 9 m.
LRML: if(exist(chimney)), then(obligation(and(has(chimney, foundation), define(topOf(foundation.slab), x0), define(topOf(chimney.stack), x1), inBetween(chimney.height, and(x0, x1)),lessThanEqual(chimney.height, 9 m))))
PARAPHRASE: For chimneys, the height of the chimney measured from the top of the chimney foundation slab to the top of the chimney stack shall not exceed 9 m.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Chimneys shall not cantilever more than 2.4 m above the fixing at roof level (refer Paragraph 1.7).
LRML: if(exist(chimney)), then(obligation(and(has(chimney, fixing),is(fixing.elevation, roofLevel),above(chimney.height, fixing),lessThanEqual(chimney.height, 2.4 m))))
PARAPHRASE: Chimneys shall not cantilever more than 2.4 m above the fixing at roof level.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Chimneys shall not cantilever more than 2.4 m above the fixing at roof level (refer Paragraph 1.7).
LRML: if(exist(chimney)), then(obligation(and(has(chimney, fixing),is(fixing.elevation, roofLevel),above(chimney.height, fixing),lessThanEqual(chimney.height, 2.4 m))))
PARAPHRASE: For chimneys, the chimney height above the fixing at roof level shall not be more than 2.4 m.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.6 Surface water inlets to drains; 3.6.1 All surface water, except that collected directly from a roof, shall enter the drain via a sump.
LRML: if(and(towards(surfaceWater, drain), not(awayFrom(surfaceWater, roof)))), then(obligation(and(has(drain, sump),through(surfaceWater, sump))))
PARAPHRASE: Surface water, except that collected directly from a roof, shall enter the drain via a sump.

TEXT: 3.6 Surface water inlets to drains; Via a sump which has: a) A grating, hinged or removable for maintenance access. The grating shall comprise at least 35% openings. The smaller dimension of any individual opening shall not exceed 35 mm.
LRML: if(exist(sump)), then(obligation(and(has(sump, grating),is(grating, or(hinged, removable)),equal(sumpGrating.opening,35 percent),lessThanEqual(min(sumpGrating.opening),35 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: A sump shall have: A grating, hinged or removable. The grating shall comprise at least 35% openings. The smaller dimension of any individual opening shall not exceed 35 mm.

TEXT: 3.7.2 Points of access shall be spaced at no further than: a) 50 m where rodding points are used.
LRML: if(is(accessPoint, roddingPoint)), then(obligation(lessThanEqual(accessPoint.spacing, 50 m)))
PARAPHRASE: If access points are rodding points, the access points shall be spaced at no further than 50 m.

TEXT: 3.7.3 Points of access are required at: Junctions of drains other than a drain, serving a single downpipe, that is less than 2.0 m long.
LRML: if(and(has(drain, junction), into(drain.flow, downpipe), not(and(equal(count(downpipe), 1), lessThan(downpipe.length, 2 m))))), then(and(obligation(has(drain, accessPoint)), obligation(is(accessPoint.location, junction))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain has a junction, and the drain flows not into a single downpipe, that is less than 2.0 m long, the drain shall have an access point at the junction.

TEXT: 3.7.3 Points of access are required at: Junctions of drains other than a drain, serving a single downpipe, that is less than 2.0 m long.
LRML: if(and(has(drain, junction), not(and(into(drain.flow, downpipe), equal(count(downpipe), 1), lessThan(downpipe.length, 2 m))))), then(and(obligation(has(drain, accessPoint)), obligation(is(accessPoint.location, junction))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain has a junction, and the drain flows not into a single downpipe, that is less than 2.0 m long, the drain shall have an access point at the junction.

TEXT: 3.7.4 Inspection chambers or access chambers (see Figures 11 and 12) shall be provided where changes in both gradient and direction occur and where either is greater than 22.5°.
LRML: if(and(include(drain, and(changeInDirection, changeInGradient)), define(changeInGradient.location, x0), define(changeInDirection.location, x1), equal(x0, x1), or(greaterThan(changeInDirection, 22.5 deg), greaterThan(changeInGradient, 22.5 deg)))), then(obligation(and(has(drain, chamber),for(chamber, or(inspection, access)),is(accessPoint.location, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: Where changes in both gradient and direction occur in the same location and where the change in gradient or direction is greater than 22.5 deg, chambers for inspection or access shall be provided at the location of the change.

TEXT: 3.7.5 Where the depth to the invert of the drain exceeds 1.0 m, an inspection chamber is not acceptable and an access chamber shall be used.
LRML: if(and(towards(drain.depth, invert), greaterThan(drain.depth, 1 m))), then(and(obligation(has(drain, accessPoint)), prohibition(is(accessPoint.type, inspectionChamber)), obligation(is(accessPoint.type, accessChamber))))
PARAPHRASE: Where the depth to the invert of the drain exceeds 1.0 m, an inspection chamber is not acceptable and an access chamber shall be used.

TEXT: 3.7.4 Inspection chambers or access chambers (see Figures 11 and 12) shall be provided where changes in both gradient and direction occur and where either is greater than 22.5°.
LRML: if(and(include(drain, and(changeInDirection, changeInGradient)), define(changeInGradient.location, x0), define(changeInDirection.location, x1), equal(x0, x1), or(greaterThan(changeInDirection, 22.5 deg), greaterThan(changeInGradient, 22.5 deg)))), then(obligation(and(has(drain, accessPoint),is(accessPoint.type, or(inspectionChamber, accessChamber)),is(accessPoint.location, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: Where changes in both gradient and direction occur in the same location and where the change in gradient or direction is greater than 22.5 deg, access points shall be provided as inspection chambers or access chambers at the location of the change.

TEXT: 3.7.6 Drain under buildings; Any drain laid under a building shall be run in a straight line from one side to the other.
LRML: if(below(drain.section, building)), then(obligation(not(include(drain.section, changeInDirection))))
PARAPHRASE: The drain section under a building shall not include any changes in direction.

TEXT: 3.7.7 Access to a drain laid under a building shall be provided immediately outside the building. These points of access shall be located within 2.0 m of an exterior wall.
LRML: if(below(drain, building)), then(obligation(and(has(drain, accessPoint),outside(accessPoint.location, building),has(building, externalWall),define(externalWall.location, x0),within(accessPoint.location, 'x0 + 2 m'))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain is under a building, then drain's access point location shall be outside the building. These points of access shall be located within 2.0 m of an exterior wall of the building.

TEXT: 3.7.8 Under a building the only acceptable inlets to a drain are from sealed roof-water downpipes.
LRML: if(below(drain.inlet, building)), then(obligation(and(is(inlet.type, downpipe),is(downpipe.type, sealed),for(downpipe, roofWater)))
PARAPHRASE: If the drain inlet is under the building, the inlet shall be a sealed roof-water downpipe.

TEXT: 3.9.3 Trench slope; These anti-scour blocks shall be: Extended to ground level where the drain cover is less than 300 mm.
LRML: if(and(include(trench, antiScourBlocks), lessThan(drainCover.depth, 300 mm))), then(obligation(is(antiScourBlocks.elevation, groundLevel)))
PARAPHRASE: These anti-scour blocks shall be: Extended to ground level where the drain cover is less than 300 mm.

TEXT: 3.4.3 The capacity of a grease trap shall be at least twice the capacity of all sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances discharging to it, and in no case less than 100 litres as shown in Figure 4.
LRML: if(exist(greaseTrap)), then(and(into(sanitaryFixtures.discharge, greaseTrap),define(sum(sanitaryFixtures.capacity), x0),into(sanitaryAppliances.discharge, greaseTrap),define(sum(sanitaryAppliances.capacity), x1),obligation(greaterThanEqual(greaseTrap.capacity, and('2 * (x0 + x1)', 100 l)))))
PARAPHRASE: The capacity of a grease trap shall be at least twice the capacity of all sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances discharging to it, and in no case less than 100 litres as shown in Figure 4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.4.5 Grease traps located outside a building shall be configured as shown in Figure 4.
LRML: if(outside(greaseTrap.location, building)), then(obligation(complyWith(greaseTrap.configuration, nzbc_g13as2_f4)))
PARAPHRASE: Grease traps located outside a building shall be configured as shown in G13/AS2 Figure 4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.4.5 Grease traps located outside a building shall be configured as shown in Figure 4.
LRML: if(outside(greaseTrap.location, building)), then(obligation(asPer(greaseTrap.configuration, nzbc_g13as2_f4)))
PARAPHRASE: Grease traps located outside a building shall be configured as shown in G13/AS2 Figure 4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Other types of grease trap such as those that separate or digest grease must be approved by the network utility operator as required by G14/VM1 1.2.
LRML: if(is(greaseTrap.type, other)), then(obligation(complyWith(greaseTrap.installation, 'nzbc_g14vm1_1.2')))
PARAPHRASE: Other types of grease trap such as those that separate or digest grease must be approved by the network utility operator as required by G14/VM1 1.2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.5.1 Drains shall: a) Be laid at an even grade, and b) Have no obstructions to flow.
LRML: if(is(drain.installation, true)), then(and(obligation(is(drain.grade, even)), obligation(not(include(drain.flow, obstruction)))))
PARAPHRASE: Drains shall be laid at an even grade, annd have no obstructions to flow.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.5.3 The gradient of drainage pipes shall be not less than that required in Table 2 for the relevant discharge unit loading.
LRML: if(exist(drainPipe)), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(drainPipe.gradient, value)), obligation(asPer(value, nzbc_g13as2_t2))))
PARAPHRASE: The gradient of drainage pipes shall be not less than the value required in G13/AS2 Table 2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.6.1 The diameter of a drain shall not decrease in size in the direction of flow.
LRML: if(exist(drain)), then(and(prohibition(has(drain.diameter, reduction)), prohibition(is(reduction.direction, flow))))
PARAPHRASE: The diameter of a drain shall not decrease in size in the direction of flow.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.6.1 The diameter of a drain shall not decrease in size in the direction of flow.
LRML: if(exist(drain)), then(prohibition(and(has(drain.diameter,reduction),is(reduction.direction,flow))))
PARAPHRASE: The diameter of a drain shall not decrease in the direction of flow.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.6.2 Drains shall have a diameter of not less than 80 mm where the drain serves only waste water fixtures.
LRML: if(and(for(drain, wasteWaterFixture),not(for(drain, other)))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(drain.diameter, 80 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: Where the drain serves waste water fixtures and not other, drains shall have a diameter of not less than 80 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.6.2 Drains shall have a diameter of not less than 100 mm where the drain does not serve only waste water fixtures.
LRML: if(and(for(drain, fixture),not(is(fixture, wasteWaterFixture)))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(drain.diameter, 100 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: Where the drain serves fixtures that are not waste water fixtures, the drain shall have a diameter of not less than 100 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.1.1 The drainage system shall be ventilated to allow a flow of air and to minimise the build up of foul air.

PARAPHRASE: The drain shall be ventilated.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.1.1 The drainage system shall be ventilated to allow a flow of air and to minimise the build up of foul air.

TEXT: 5.3.1 Figure 7 gives acceptable methods for the bedding and backfilling of the drainage pipes listed in Table 1 except where: a) The trench is located within or above peat, b) Scouring of the trench is likely due to unstable soils, or d) The cover H to the pipe is more than 2.5 m.

PARAPHRASE: If flashing material is bituminous, the flashing application shall be in accordance with E2/AS1 Table 20.

TEXT: 4.3.10 Bituminous flashings; Bituminous flashings shall only be used in accordance with Table 20.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, bituminous)), then(obligation(asPer(flashing.application, nzbc_e2as1_t20)))
PARAPHRASE: If flashing material is bituminous, the flashing application shall be in accordance with E2/AS1 Table 20.

TEXT: 4.3.10 Bituminous flashings; Flashings made from bitumen-impregnated material shall: a) Comply with AS/NZS 2904, and b) Be used only in fully concealed applications.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, bitumenImpregnated)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(flashing,nzs_2904),in(flashing.application,environment),is(environment,fullyConcealed))))
PARAPHRASE: Flashings made from bitumen-impregnated material shall: a) Comply with AS/NZS 2904, and b) Be used only in fully concealed applications.

TEXT: 4.3.10 Bituminous flashings; Flashings made from bitumen-impregnated material shall: a) Comply with AS/NZS 2904, and b) Be used only in fully concealed applications.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, bitumenImpregnated)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(flashing,nzs_2904),in(flashing.application,fullyConcealed))))
PARAPHRASE: Flashings made from bitumen-impregnated material shall: a) Comply with NZS 2904, and b) Be used only in fully concealed applications.

TEXT: 4.3.10 Bituminous flashings; Flashings made from bitumen-impregnated material shall: a) Comply with AS/NZS 2904, and b) Be used only in fully concealed applications.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, bitumenImpregnated)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(flashing,nzs_2904),is(flashing.application, fullyConcealed))))
PARAPHRASE: Flashings made from bitumen-impregnated material shall: a) Comply with NZS 2904, and b) Be used only in fully concealed applications.

TEXT: The width of the trench at the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm unless the pipes in the trench are covered with concrete, as shown in Figure 7 (c).
LRML: if(and(in(pipe.location, trench), define(topOf(pipe.elevation), x0), define(trench.elevation, x1), equal(x1, x0), greaterThan(trench.width, 600 mm))), then(obligation(is(trench.cover, concrete)))
PARAPHRASE: If the pipes located in the trench are not covered with concrete, the width of the trench at the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm unless the pipes in the trench are covered with concrete.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Drainage; Junctions beneath the building joining at an angle of not more than 45° (see Figure 13).
LRML: if(and(below(junction, building))), then(obligation(lessThanEqual(junction.angle, 45 deg)))
PARAPHRASE: If junctions are beneath the building, then the junctions shall have an angle of not more than 45 deg.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 6.1.1 All sections of the drainage system shall be tested by water test or air test to ensure watertightness.
LRML: if(partOf(drainSection, drainageSystem)), then(obligation(test(drainSection.watertightness,  or(waterTest, airTest))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain section is part of the drainage system, the drain section shall be tested for watertightness by water test or air test.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 6.1.1 All sections of the drainage system shall be tested by water test or air test to ensure watertightness.
LRML: if(partOf(drainSection, drainageSystem)), then(obligation(test(drainSection.watertightness,  or(waterTest, airTest))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain section is part of the drainage system, the drain section shall be tested for watertightness by water test or air test.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design 1.2 B1/AS gives an Acceptable Solution for small chimneys (referred to in Paragraph 8.0).
LRML: if(and(is(structure, chimney), is(chimney.size, small))), then(permission(complyWith(structure.design, nzbc_b1as1)))
PARAPHRASE: B1/AS1 applies to small sized chimneys structures.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.3 Size; The width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed: a) For the foundation and chimney base – precast pumice concrete 1600 mm wide x 1050 mm deep.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.material, precastPumiceConcrete),has(chimney, or(foundation,chimneyBase)))), then(obligation(and(or(define(foundation.width, x0), define(chimneyBase.width, x0)),is(x0.measurement, alongBuildingLine),or(define(foundation.depth, x1), define(chimneyBase.depth, x1)),is(x1.measurement, perpendicularBuildingLine), lessThanEqual(x0, 1600 mm),lessThanEqual(x1, 1050 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: For the precast pumice concrete chimney's foundation and chimney base, the width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed 1600 mm width and 1050 mm depth.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.3 Size; The width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed: For a brick chimney stack – single skin (see Figure 2) 500 mm wide x 500 mm deep.
LRML: if(and(is(chimneyStack.material, brick),is(chimneyStack.type, brick))), then(obligation(and(define(chimneyStack.width, x0),is(x0.measurement, alongBuildingLine),define(chimneyStack.depth, x1),is(x1.measurement, perpendicularBuildingLine), lessThanEqual(x0, 500 mm),lessThanEqual(x1, 500 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: For a brick chimney stack type single skin, the width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed 500 mm width and 500 mm depth.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.3 Size; The width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed: For a brick chimney stack – single skin (see Figure 2) 500 mm wide x 500 mm deep.
LRML: if(and(is(chimneyStack.material, brick),is(chimneyStack.type, brick))), then(obligation(and(define(chimneyStack.width, x0),is(x0.measurement, alongBuildingLine),define(chimneyStack.depth, x1),is(x1.measurement, perpendicularBuildingLine), lessThanEqual(x0, 500 mm),lessThanEqual(x1, 500 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: For a brick chimney stack type single skin, the width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed 500 mm width and 500 mm depth.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.3 Size; The width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed: For a brick chimney stack – single skin (see Figure 2) 500 mm wide x 500 mm deep.
LRML: if(and(is(chimneyStack.material, brick),is(chimneyStack.type, singleSkin))), then(obligation(and(define(chimneyStack.width, x0),is(x0.measurement, alongBuildingLine),define(chimneyStack.depth, x1),is(x1.measurement, perpendicularBuildingLine), lessThanEqual(x0, 500 mm),lessThanEqual(x1, 500 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: For a brick chimney stack type single skin, the width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed 500 mm width and 500 mm depth.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.4 Chimney liners; Where chimney liners are used they are to be separated from the chimney to ensure free thermal movement. This shall be achieved by coating the liner with a suitable debonding agent or by wrapping it in a combustible material no less than 0.25 mm thick.
LRML: if(has(chimney, chimneyLiner)), then(or(obligation(and(has(chimneyLiner,coating),is(coating.material,debondingAgent))), obligation(and(has(chimneyLiner,wrapping),is(wrapping.material,combustible),greaterThanEqual(wrapping.thickness,0.25mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: Where the chimney has chimney liners, chimney liners shall have coating with a debonding agent or wrapping with combustible material and the wrapping is no less than 0.25 mm thick.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.2.1 Chimney wall thicknesses shall be no less than: a) Brick – single skin (see Figure 2) 155 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.material, brick), is(brick.type, singleSkin))), then(obligation(and(has(chimney, wall),greaterThanEqual(wall.thickness, 155 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: Brick – single skin chimneys shall have a wall thicknesses of no less than 155 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.2.1 Chimney wall thicknesses shall be no less than: a) Brick – double skin (see Figure 3) 245 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.material, brick), is(brick.type, doubleSkin)  )), then(obligation(and(has(chimney, wall),greaterThanEqual(wall.thickness, 245 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: Brick – double skin chimney shall have a wall thicknesses of 245 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.2.1 Chimney wall thicknesses shall be no less than: Concrete 170 mm.
LRML: if(is(chimney.material, concrete)), then(obligation(and(has(chimney, wall),greaterThanEqual(wall.thickness, 170 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: Concrete chimneys shall have a wall thicknes of no less than 170 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Where a turn-down to the cover flashing for profiled metal claddings is required, use: b) A notched turn-down or soft edge flashing for trapezoidal profiles with rib height not exceeding 30 mm and/or rib centres not exceeding 200 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.material, profiledMetal), has(cladding, flashing), is(flashing.type, cover), requires(flashing, turnDown), is(profiledMetal, trapezoidal), or(lessThanEqual(profiledMetal.ribHeight, 30 mm), lessThanEqual(profiledMetal.ribCentres, 200 mm)))), then(obligation(or(is(turnDown.type, notched),is(flashing.edge, soft))))

TEXT: The width B of the trench shall be no less than the pipe diameter D plus 200 mm.
LRML: if(for(trench, pipe)), then(obligation(and(define(pipe.diameter, x0),greaterThanEqual(trench.width, 'x0 + 200 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: The width of the trench for the pipe shall be no less than the pipe diameter plus 200 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.1.2 It is the responsibility of the person specifying the building element to determine normal maintenance requirements. These may be based on the manufacturer's recommendations and may also include periodic inspections of elements not readily observable without a specific effort (e.g. access to roof or subfloor spaces).
LRML: if(has(building.element, specifier)), then(and(obligation(and(has(building.element, maintenanceRequirements),by(maintenanceRequirements, specifier))), permission(include(maintenance.requirement, and(manufacturersRecommendation, periodicInspection)))))
PARAPHRASE: The person specifying the building element shall to determine normal maintenance requirements. These may be based on the manufacturer's recommendations and may also include periodic inspections of elements not readily observable without a specific effort (e.g. access to roof or subfloor spaces).

TEXT: 2.2.1 Scheduled maintenance comprises the inspection, maintenance and reporting procedures for building elements required to have a compliance schedule in terms of section 44 of the Building Act. The relevant maintenance procedures may include total replacement.
LRML: if(obligation(and(has(building.element,maintenanceSchedule),asPer(maintenanceSchedule,buildingAct_44)))), then(and(obligation(and(include(maintenanceSchedule, procedures),for(procedures,and(inspection,maintenance,reporting)),complyWith(procedure,buildingAct_44))),permission(include(maintenance.task, totalReplacement))))
PARAPHRASE: If building elements are required to have a maintenance schedule in terms of section 44 of the Building Act, the maintenance schedule includes the inspection, maintenance and reporting procedures. The relevant maintenance procedures may include total replacement.

TEXT: 2.2.1 Scheduled maintenance comprises the inspection, maintenance and reporting procedures for building elements required to have a compliance schedule in terms of section 44 of the Building Act. The relevant maintenance procedures may include total replacement.
LRML: if(obligation(and(has(building.element,maintenanceSchedule),asPer(maintenanceSchedule,buildingAct_44)))), then(and(obligation(and(include(maintenanceSchedule, procedures),for(procedures,and(inspection,maintenance,reporting)))),permission(include(procedures, totalReplacement))))
PARAPHRASE: If building elements are required to have a maintenance schedule in terms of section 44 of the Building Act, the maintenance schedule includes the inspection, maintenance and reporting procedures. The relevant maintenance procedures may include total replacement.

TEXT: 3.3.1 NZS 4251: Part 1 is an acceptable solution for meeting the durability requirements of cement plasters for walls, ceilings and soffits within its scope.
LRML: if(for(cementPlaster, or(wall, ceiling, soffit))), then(permission(complyWith(cementPlaster.durability, nzs_4251_1)))

TEXT: 3.5.1 NZS 4223.2 is an Acceptable Solution for meeting the durability requirements of insulating glass units, within its scope.
LRML: if(exist(insulatedGlassUnit)), then(permission(complyWith(insulatedGlassUnit.durability, nzs_4223_2)))
PARAPHRASE: The durability of insulating glass units may comply with NZS 4297 and NZS 4299.

TEXT: 3.4.1 NZS 4297 and NZS 4299 are acceptable solutions for meeting the durability requirements of earth buildings within their scope.
LRML: if(is(building.material, earth)), then(permission(complyWith(building.durability, and(nzs_4297, nzs_4299))))
PARAPHRASE: For earth buildings, the buildings durability may comply with NZS 4297 and NZS 4299.

TEXT: 3.6.1 SNZ TS 3404: SNZ TS 3404 is an Acceptable Solution for meeting the durability requirements of steel building elements within its scope.
LRML: if(is(buildingElement.material, steel)), then(permission(complyWith(buildingElement, snz_ts_3404)))
PARAPHRASE: Steel building elements may comply with the durability requirements in SNZ TS 3404.

TEXT: 3.6.1 SNZ TS 3404: SNZ TS 3404 is an Acceptable Solution for meeting the durability requirements of steel building elements within its scope.
LRML: if(is(buildingElement.material, steel)), then(permission(complyWith(buildingElement.durability, snz_ts_3404)))
PARAPHRASE: Steel building elements may comply with the durability requirements in SNZ TS 3404.

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is one of three Acceptable Solutions that provide a means of establishing compliance with NZBC Clauses C1 to C6 Protection from Fire. It can be used for the building activities covered by risk groups specified in Paragraph 1.1.1 and described in Table 1.1.
LRML: if(and(obligation(complyWith(building, or(nzbc_c1, nzbc_c2, nzbc_c3, nzbc_c5, nzbc_c6))), asPer(building.riskGroup, table), equal(table.key, t1.1), asPer(building.riskGroup, rule), equal(rule.key, 1.1.1))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.fireProtection, nzbc_cas2)))

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is one of three Acceptable Solutions that provide a means of establishing compliance with NZBC Clauses C1 to C6 Protection from Fire. It can be used for the building activities covered by risk groups specified in Paragraph 1.1.1 and described in Table 1.1.
LRML: if(and(complyWith(building, nzbc_cas2), asPer(building.riskGroup, and('nzbc_cas2_1.1.1', 'nzbc_cas2_t1.1')))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.fireProtection, and(nzbc_c1, nzbc_c2, nzbc_c3, nzbc_c5, nzbc_c6))))
PARAPHRASE: CAS2 provides a means of establishing compliance with NZBC Clauses C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, and C6. It can be used for the building activities covered by risk groups specified in CAS2 Paragraph 1.1.1 and Table 1.1.

TEXT: If a building contains a number of different activities which individually may be categorised in different risk groups, the risk group designated for a particular firecell within a building shall be that of the primary risk group.
LRML: if(and(greaterThan(count(firecell.activity), 1), loop(in(max(activity.riskGroup), firecell), define(riskGroup.stringency, x0)))), then(obligation(is(firecell.riskGroup, x0)))

TEXT: 3.7.4 Inspection chambers or access chambers (see Figures 11 and 12) shall be provided where changes in both gradient and direction occur and where either is greater than 22.5°.
LRML: if(and(include(drain, and(changeInDirection, changeInGradient)), define(changeInGradient.location, x0), define(changeInDirection.location, x1), equal(x0, x1), or(greaterThan(changeInDirection, 22.5 deg), greaterThan(changeInGradient, 22.5 deg)))), then(obligation(and(has(drain, chamber),for(chamber, or(inspection, access)),is(accessPoint.location, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: Where changes in both gradient and direction occur in the same location and where the change in gradient or direction is greater than 22.5 deg, inspection chambers or access chambers shall be provided at the location of the change.

TEXT: 3.7.4 Inspection chambers or access chambers (see Figures 11 and 12) shall be provided where changes in both gradient and direction occur and where either is greater than 22.5°.
LRML: if(and(include(drain, and(changeInDirection, changeInGradient)), define(changeInGradient.location, x0), define(changeInDirection.location, x1), equal(x0, x1), or(greaterThan(changeInDirection, 22.5 deg), greaterThan(changeInGradient, 22.5 deg)))), then(obligation(and(has(drain, chamber),for(chamber, or(inspection, access)),is(accessPoint.location, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: Where changes in both gradient and direction occur in the same location and where the change in gradient or direction is greater than 22.5 deg, chambers for inspection or access shall be provided at the location of the change.

TEXT: 3.7.4 Inspection chambers or access chambers (see Figures 11 and 12) shall be provided where changes in both gradient and direction occur and where either is greater than 22.5°.
LRML: if(and(include(drain, and(changeInDirection, changeInGradient)), define(changeInGradient.location, x0), define(changeInDirection.location, x1), equal(x0, x1), or(greaterThan(changeInDirection, 22.5 deg), greaterThan(changeInGradient, 22.5 deg)))), then(obligation(and(has(drain, chamber),for(chamber, or(inspection, access)),is(accessPoint.location, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: Where changes in both gradient and direction occur in the same location and where the change in gradient or direction is greater than 22.5 deg, chambers for inspection or access shall be provided at the location of the change.

TEXT: 3.7.6 Drain under buildings; Any drain laid under a building shall be run in a straight line from one side to the other.
LRML: if(below(drain.section, building)), then(prohibition(include(drain.section, changeInDirection)))
PARAPHRASE: The drain section under a building shall not include any changes in direction.

TEXT: 3.7.6 Drain under buildings; Any drain laid under a building shall be run in a straight line from one side to the other.
LRML: if(below(drain.section, building)), then(obligation(not(include(drain.section, changeInDirection))))
PARAPHRASE: The drain section under a building shall not include any changes in direction.

TEXT: 3.7.7 Access to a drain laid under a building shall be provided immediately outside the building. These points of access shall be located within 2.0 m of an exterior wall.
LRML: if(below(drain, building)), then(obligation(and(has(drain, accessPoint),outside(accessPoint.location, building),has(building, externalWall),define(externalWall.location, x0),within(accessPoint.location, 'x0 + 2 m'))))
PARAPHRASE: Access to a drain laid under a building shall be provided immediately outside the building. These points of access shall be located within 2.0 m of an exterior wall.

TEXT: 3.7.7 Access to a drain laid under a building shall be provided immediately outside the building. These points of access shall be located within 2.0 m of an exterior wall.
LRML: if(below(drain, building)), then(obligation(and(has(drain, accessPoint),outside(accessPoint.location, building),has(building, externalWall),define(externalWall.location, x0),within(accessPoint.location, 'x0 + 2 m'))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain is under a building, then drain's access point location shall be outside the building. These points of access shall be located within 2.0 m of an exterior wall of the building.

TEXT: 3.7.8 Under a building the only acceptable inlets to a drain are from sealed roof-water downpipes.
LRML: if(below(drain.inlet, building)), then(obligation(and(is(inlet.type, downpipe),is(downpipe.type, sealed),for(downpipe, roofWater)))
PARAPHRASE: If the drain inlet is under the building

TEXT: Inlet to a drain under a building; Access shall be provided to the drain via a sealed access point in the downpipe immediately above ground floor level.
LRML: if(below(drain.inlet, building)), then(obligation(and(has(drain.inlet,accessPoint),is(accessPoint,sealed),above(accessPoint,groundFloorLevel),is(accessPoint.location,downpipe))))

TEXT: Inlet to a drain under a building; Access shall be provided to the drain via a sealed access point in the downpipe immediately above ground floor level.
LRML: if(below(drain.inlet, building)), then(obligation(and(has(drain,accessPoint),is(accessPoint,sealed),is(accessPoint.location,downpipe)above(accessPoint.elevation, groundFloor),is(accessPoint.location,downpipe))))
PARAPHRASE: If the drain inlet is under the building, then the drain shall have an sealed access point in the downpipe, the elevation of the access point above ground floor.

TEXT: 3.9.2 Bedding and backfilling; Figure 13 gives acceptable solutions for the bedding and backfilling of the drainage pipes listed in Table 1 except where: a) The trench is located within or above peat, or b) Scouring of the trench is likely due to unstable soils, or d) The cover H to the pipe is more than 2.5 m.
LRML: if(and(or(asPer(drainPipe.bedding, nzbc_e1as1_t1),asPer(drainPipe.backfilling, nzbc_e1as1_t1)),within(drainPipe, trench),not(within(trench.location, peat)), not(above(trench.location, peat)), not(is(trench.soil, unstable)), above(cover, drainPipe),lessThanEqual(cover.height, 2.5 m))), then(permission(and(complyWith(drainPipe.bedding, nzbc_e1as1_f13),complyWith(drainPipe.backfilling, nzbc_e1as1_f13))))
PARAPHRASE: If bedding and backfilling of the drainage pipes are listed in E1/AS1 Table 1, and the trench, the drainage pipe is in, is not located within or above peat, and the trench soil is not unstable, and the cover height to the pipe is not more than 2.5 m, then the bedding and backfilling may comply with E1/AS1 Figure 13.

TEXT: Drainage; Junctions beneath the building joining at an angle of not more than 45° (see Figure 13).
LRML: if(and(below(junction, building))), then(obligation(lessThanEqual(junction.angle, 45 deg)))
PARAPHRASE: If junctions are beneath the building, then the junction shall have an angle of not more than 45 deg.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.9.1 Where two or more soil fixtures are connected to a branch drain beneath the building, access for cleaning shall be provided by a sealed floor level rodding point located downstream of the highest fixture connection to the branch drain (see Figures 10 and 13).
LRML: if(and(greaterThanEqual(soilFixture.count, 2), connect(soilFixture, drain), is(drain.type, branch), below(drain, building))), then(obligation(and(has(drain,cleaningAccess),is(cleaningAccess,roddingPoint),is(roddingPoint,floorLevel),is(roddingPoint.type,sealed),equal(roddingPoint.location,highestFixtureConnection))))
PARAPHRASE: Where two or more soil fixtures are connected to a branch drain beneath the building, access for cleaning shall be provided by a sealed floor level rodding point located at the highest fixture connection.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.9.1 Where two or more soil fixtures are connected to a branch drain beneath the building, access for cleaning shall be provided by a sealed floor level rodding point located downstream of the highest fixture connection to the branch drain (see Figures 10 and 13).
LRML: if(and(greaterThanEqual(soilFixture.count, 2), connect(soilFixture, drain), is(drain.type, branch), below(drain, building))), then(obligation(and(has(drain,cleaningAccess),is(cleaningAccess,roddingPoint),is(roddingPoint,floorLevel),is(roddingPoint.type,sealed),equal(roddingPoint.location,highestFixtureConnection))))
PARAPHRASE: Where two or more soil fixtures are connected to a branch drain beneath the building, access for cleaning shall be provided by a sealed floor level rodding point located at the highest fixture connection.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.9.3 Access points may be located in a space containing a soil fixture.
LRML: if(exist(accessPoint)), then(permission(and(within(accessPoint.location, space),include(space, soilFixture))))
PARAPHRASE: Access points may be located in a space containing a soil fixture.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 6.1.3 Air tests may be carried out in accordance with either clause 15.3 of AS/NZS 3500.2 or paragraph 8.3 of E1/VM1.
LRML: if(exist(airTest)), then(obligation(asPer(airTest, or('nzs_3500_2_15.3', 'nzbc_e1vm1_8.3'))))
PARAPHRASE: Air tests may be carried out in accordance with either clause 15.3 of NZS 3500.2 or paragraph 8.3 of E1/VM1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 6.1.5 Where a building is proposed to be built over an existing drain, the drain shall be verified as being sound both before and after construction.
LRML: if(and(above(building.construction, drain),is(drain, existing))), then(and(obligation(has(drain.soundness, verification)), obligation(before(verification, construction)), obligation(after(verification, construction))))
PARAPHRASE: Where a building is constructed over an existing drain, the drain soundness shall have verification both before and after construction.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.3.3 The chimney foundation walls shall be 150 mm thick reinforced concrete, 190 mm thick concrete masonry, or brick construction complying with Figures 2 or 3. Vertical and horizontal reinforcing steel shall be as given in Paragraph 1.6.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, foundation), has(foundation, wall))), then(and(obligation(or(and(greaterThanEqual(wall.thickness,150mm),is(wall.material,reinforcedConcrete)),and(greaterThanEqual(wall.thickness,190mm),is(wall.material,concreteMasonry)),and(is(wall.material,brick),complyWith(wall,figure),equal(figure,or(f2,f3))))),  obligation(complyWith(wall.reinforcingSteel, rule)), obligation(equal(rule.key, 1.6))))
PARAPHRASE: The chimney foundation walls shall be 150 mm thick reinforced concrete, 190 mm thick concrete masonry, or brick construction complying with Figures 2 or 3. Vertical and horizontal reinforcing steel shall be as given in Paragraph 1.6.

LRML: if(and(has(chimney, foundation), has(foundation, wall))), then(and(obligation(or(and(greaterThanEqual(wall.thickness,150mm),is(wall.material,reinforcedConcrete)),and(greaterThanEqual(wall.thickness,190mm),is(wall.material,concreteMasonry)),and(is(wall.material,brick),complyWith(wall,figure),equal(figure,or(f2,f3))))),  obligation(complyWith(wall.reinforcingSteel, rule)), obligation(equal(rule.key, 1.6))))

TEXT: 1.6.1 Reinforcing of foundation walls, chimney bases (including the gathers) and chimney stacks (see Figures 2 to 5 inclusive) shall comprise: Double horizontal reinforcing at any change in direction of the vertical steel (e.g. at the gather/stack intersection).
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, or(foundationWall, base, gather, stack)), partOf(reinforcing, or(foundationWall, base, gather, stack)), is(reinforcing.type, verticalReinforcingBar))), then(loop(in(forEach(changeInDirection), verticalReinforcingBar), and(obligation(is(reinforcing.type, horizontalReinforcingBar)), obligation(equal(count(horizontalReinforcingBar), 2)))))
PARAPHRASE: Reinforcing of foundation walls, chimney bases, chimney gathers, and chimney stacks shall include: Double horizontal reinforcing at any change in direction of the vertical steel (e.g. at the gather/stack intersection).

TEXT: 1.7.10 Nails used to fix straps to roof or ceiling framing shall be spaced at no less than 35 m in Radiata Pine.
LRML: if(and(partOf(framing, or(roof, ceiling)), has(framing, fixture), is(framing, strap), is(fixture.method, nail), is(framing.material, radiataPine))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(nail.spacing, 35 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: Nails used to fix straps to roof or ceiling framing shall be spaced at no less than 35 m in Radiata Pine.

TEXT: 1.7.10 Nails used to fix straps to roof or ceiling framing shall be spaced at no less than 70 mm in other timbers than Radiata Pine.
LRML: if(and(partOf(framing, or(roof, ceiling)), has(framing, fixture), is(framing, strap), is(fixture.method, nail),is(framing.material, timber),not(is(timber.type, radiataPine)))), then(obligation(and(for(nail, fixture), greaterThanEqual(nail.spacing, 70 mm))))

TEXT: 1.4.1 Access routes shall have height clearances complying with Table 1 and as shown in Figure 3.
LRML: if(exist(accessRoute)), then(and(obligation(and(complyWith(accessRoute.heightClearance, 'nzbc_d1as1_t1.1'),asPer(accessRoute.heightClearance, 'nzbc_d1as1_f3.1')))))

TEXT: Where a turn-down to the cover flashing for profiled metal claddings is required, use: d) A notched turn-down for trough profiles.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.material, profiledMetal), has(cladding, flashing), is(flashing.type, cover), requires(flashing, turnDown), is(profiledMetal.type, trapezoidal))), then(obligation(is(turnDown.type, notched)))
PARAPHRASE: If cladding material is profiled metal, the cladding has cover flashings, the flashing required a turn-down, and the profiled metal is trough, then the turn-down shall be notched.

TEXT: Where a turn-down to the cover flashing for profiled metal claddings is required, use: d) A notched turn-down for trough profiles.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.material, profiledMetal), has(cladding, flashing), is(flashing.type, cover), requires(flashing, turnDown), is(profiledMetal.type, trapezoidal))), then(obligation(is(turnDown.type, notched)))

TEXT: Where a turn-down to the cover flashing for profiled metal claddings is required, use: c) A notched turn-down for trapezoidal profiles with rib height exceeding 30 mm and/or rib centres exceeding 200 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.material, profiledMetal), has(cladding, flashing), is(flashing.type, cover), requires(flashing, turnDown), is(profiledMetal.type, trapezoidal), or(greaterThan(cladding.ribHeight, 30 mm), greaterThan(cladding.ribCentres, 200 mm)))), then(obligation(is(turnDown.type, notched)))
PARAPHRASE: If cladding material is profiled metal, the cladding has cover flashings, the flashing required a turn-down, and the profiled metal is trapezoidal and the profiled metal rib height is exceeding 30 mm or profiled metal rib centres exceeding 200 mm, then the turn-down shall be notched.

TEXT: The lowest zone within the Selwyn or Waimakariri District Council boundaries is within Zone 2. Areas within Selwyn District that are designated as Zone 1 in NZS 3604 shall become Zone 2.
LRML: if(or(and(is(zone, lowest),within(zone, boundary), for(boundary, or(selwynDistrictCouncil, waimakaririDistrictCouncil))), and(within(area, selwynDistrictCouncil), is(area, zone_1),asPer(area, nzs_3604)))), then(and(within(zone, zone_2), is(area, zone_2)))
PARAPHRASE: The lowest zone within the Selwyn District Council or Waimakariri District Council boundaries is within Zone 2. Areas within Selwyn District Council that are designated as Zone 1 in NZS 3604 is Zone 2.
AUTHOR: Stefan
