PARAPHRASE: Flexible flashing tape shall comply with Parts 3.2 and 4 of ICBO AC148, shall be compatible with adjacent building wall underlay or roof underlay, and be used only in fully concealed applications.

TEXT: Aluminium flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 0.7 mm, and formed from 5000 series in accordance with AS/NZS 1734.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, aluminium)), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(flashing.thickness,0.7 mm),is(aluminium.grade, 5000 series),asPer(aluminium.grade,nzs_1734))))
PARAPHRASE: Aluminium flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 0.7 mm, and aluminium grade shall be 5000 series in accordance with AS/NZS 1734.

TEXT: Aluminium flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 0.7 mm, and formed from 5000 series in accordance with AS/NZS 1734.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, aluminium)), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(flashing.thickness,0.7 mm),is(aluminium.grade, 5000 series),asPer(aluminium.grade,nzs_1734))))
PARAPHRASE: Aluminium flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 0.7 mm, and aluminium grade shall be 5000 series in accordance with AS/NZS 1734.

TEXT: Aluminium flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 0.7 mm, and formed from 5000 series in accordance with AS/NZS 1734.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, aluminium)), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(flashing.thickness,0.7 mm),is(aluminium.grade, 5000 series),asPer(aluminium.grade,nzs_1734))))
PARAPHRASE: Aluminium flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 0.7 mm, and aluminium grade shall be 5000 series and in accordance with NZS 1734.

TEXT: The width of the trench at the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm unless the pipes in the trench are covered with concrete, as shown in Figure 7 (c).
LRML: if(and(in(pipe.location, trench), is(trench.cover, concrete))), then(obligation(and( define(topOf(pipe.elevation), x0), define(trench.elevation, x1), equal(x1, x0), greaterThan(trench.width, 600 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the pipes located in the trench are not covered with concrete, the width of the trench whaere the trench elevation is the same as the elevation of the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 6.1.1 All sections of the drainage system shall be tested by water test or air test to ensure watertightness.
LRML: if(partOf(drainSection, drainageSystem)), then(obligation(test(drainSection.watertightness,  or(waterTest, airTest))))
PARAPHRASE: All drain sections part of the drainage system shall be tested by water test or air test.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 6.1.5 Where a building is proposed to be built over an existing drain, the drain shall be verified as being sound both before and after construction.
LRML: if(and(above(building.construction, drain),is(drain, existing))), then(and(obligation(has(drain.soundness, verification)), obligation(before(verification, construction)), obligation(after(verification, construction))))
PARAPHRASE: Where a building is constructed over an existing drain, the drain soundness shall have verification both before and after construction.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design 1.1 B1/AS1 contains Acceptable Solutions for Masonry (Paragraph 2.0), Timber (Paragraph 3.0), Earth Buildings (Paragraph 4.0) and Stucco (Paragraph 5.0), Drains (Paragraph 6.0) and Glazing (Paragraph 7.0).
LRML: if(or(is(structure.material, or(masonry, timber, earth, stucco)), for(structure, drain), partOf(glazing, structure))), then(permission(complyWith(structure.design, nzbc_b1as1)))
PARAPHRASE: B1/AS1 applies to structure materials Masonry, Timber, Earth and Stucco, and structures for Drains and Glazing as part of structures.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design 1.1 B1/AS1 contains Acceptable Solutions for Masonry (Paragraph 2.0), Timber (Paragraph 3.0), Earth Buildings (Paragraph 4.0) and Stucco (Paragraph 5.0), Drains (Paragraph 6.0) and Glazing (Paragraph 7.0).
LRML: if(or(is(structure.material, or(masonry, timber, earth, stucco)), for(structure, drain), partOf(glazing, structure))), then(applyTo(nzbc_b1as1, structure))
PARAPHRASE: B1/AS1 applies to structure materials Masonry, Timber, Earth and Stucco, and structures for Drains and Glazing as part of structures.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design 1.2 B1/AS gives an Acceptable Solution for small chimneys (referred to in Paragraph 8.0).
LRML: if(and(is(structure, chimney), is(chimney, small))), then(permission(complyWith(structure.design, nzbc_b1as1)))
PARAPHRASE: B1/AS1 applies to small chimneys structures.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.10 Nails used to fix straps to roof or ceiling framing shall be spaced at no less than 35 m in Radiata Pine.
LRML: if(and(partOf(framing, or(roof, ceiling)), has(framing, fixture), is(framing, strap), is(fixture.method, nail), is(framing.material, radiataPine))), then(obligation(and(for(nail, fixture), greaterThanEqual(nail.spacing, 35 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If straps are fixed to a framing and the framing is part of the roof or ceiling and framing material is Radiata Pine, the nails used for the fixture shall be spaced at no less than 35 m.

TEXT: 1.7.15 Fixing brackets shall be located in mortar joints between the units.
LRML: if(is(bracket.type, fixing)), then(obligation(and(within(bracket.location, mortarJoint),inBetween(mortarJoint.location,units))))
PARAPHRASE: Fixing brackets shall be located in mortar joints between the units.

TEXT: 1.7.15 Fixing brackets shall be spaced at no less than 480 mm centres for stacks up to 600 mm wide.
LRML: if(and(is(bracket.type, fixing), lessThanEqual(stack.width, 600 mm))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(bracket.spacing, 480 mmCentres)))
PARAPHRASE: Fixing brackets shall be spaced at no less than 480 mm centres for stacks up to 600 mm wide.

TEXT: 1.7.15 Fixing brackets shall be spaced at no less than 480 mm centres for stacks up to 600 mm wide.
LRML: if(and(is(bracket.type, fixing), lessThanEqual(stack.width, 600 mm))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(bracket.spacing, 480 mmCentres)))
PARAPHRASE: If brackets are type fixing and stacks are up to 600 mm wide, the brackets shall be spaced at no less than 480 mm centres.

TEXT: 1.7.15 Fixing brackets shall be located in mortar joints between the units.
LRML: if(is(bracket.type, fixing)), then(obligation(and(within(bracket.location, mortarJoint),inBetween(mortarJoint.location,units))))
PARAPHRASE: If brackets are type fixing, the brackets shall be located in mortar joints between the units.

TEXT: 1.7.16 Fixing ties shall comprise 4 mm galvanised wire hairpins, which are hooked behind the reinforcing ducts and secured to the required adjacent double studding with four heavy duty fencing staples.
LRML: if(is(tie.type, fixing)), then(obligation(and(is(tie.type,4mmgalvanisedWireHairpin),behind(tie.hook,reinforcingDuct),to(tie.fixing,adjacentDoubleStudding),by(tie.fixing,fencingStaple),is(fencingStaple.type,heavyDuty),equal(count(fencingStaple),4))))
PARAPHRASE: Fixing ties shall comprise 4 mm galvanised wire hairpins, which are hooked behind the reinforcing ducts and secured to the required adjacent double studding with four heavy duty fencing staples.

TEXT: The primary risk group shall be that one within the firecell that has the most onerous fire safety requirements.
LRML: if(and(greaterThan(count(firecell.activity), 1), loop(in(max(activity.riskGroup), firecell), define(riskGroup.stringency, x0)))), then(obligation(is(firecell.riskGroup, x0)))

TEXT: 1.4 Calculating occupant loads 1.4.3 Duplication shall be avoided by: a) Ensuring that, where people may be involved in more than one activity, they are counted only once.
LRML: if(and(has(space, occupant), partOf(occupant, activity), greaterThan(count(activity), 1))), then(and(obligation(include(occupantLoad.calculation, occupant)), is(occupant.instance, distinct)))

TEXT: 2.2.1 Fire safety system types, as defined in Table 2.2, shall be provided throughout firecells and be as specified in: Table 2.2c for risk groups WB and WS.
LRML: if(is(space.riskGroup, or(wb, ws))), then(and(obligation(complyWith(space.fireSafetySystem, table)), equal(table.key, t2.2.c)))
PARAPHRASE: For firecells with risk groups SM and SI, the firecell's fire safety system shall be as specified in Table 2.2a.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.0.1 Suspended floors and slabs on ground: a) For sites level with or above the road shall no less than 150 mm above the road crown on at least one cross-section through the building and roadway (see Figure 1).
LRML: if(and(greaterThanEqual(site.elevation, road),or(is(floor.type, suspended),on(slab, ground)))), then(obligation(and(define(roadCrown.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(floor.elevation,'x0 + 150 mm'),greaterThanEqual(slab.elevation,'x0 + 150 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the site's elevation is with or above the road and floors are suspended and slabs are on ground, the floors and slabs shall be no less than 150 mm above the road crown on at least one cross-section through the building and roadway (see Figure 1).
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.0.1 Suspended floors and slabs on ground shall be, for sites below the road, no less than 150 mm above the lowest point on the site boundary (see Figure 2).
LRML: if(and(lessThan(site.elevation, road),or(is(floor.type, suspended),on(slab, ground)))), then(obligation(and(define(min(siteBoundary.elevation), x0),greaterThanEqual(floor.elevation,'x0 + 150 mm'),greaterThanEqual(slab.elevation,'x0 + 150 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If sites are below the road and floors are suspended or slabs are on ground, floors and slabs shall be, no less than 150 mm above the lowest point on the site boundary (see Figure 2).
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: R-values for walls, roofs and ceilings shall be no less than: For light timber frame wall or other framed wall constructions with cavities, 1.5.
LRML: if(is(wall.type, or(lightTimberFraming, framingWithCavities))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(wall.rValue, 1.5)))
PARAPHRASE: If wall type is light timber framing or framing with cavities, then the wall's R-values for walls shall be no less than 1.5.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Parapets require a drained cavity for claddings except for vertical corrugated steel as outlined in Table 3.
LRML: if(and(is(parapet, true), not(is(cladding.type, corrugatedSteel)), is(corrugatedSteel, vertical))), then(obligation(and(has(parapet,drainedCavity),for(drainedCavity,cladding))))

TEXT: Parapets shall be capped with metal, butyl or EPDM membrane. Cappings shall comply with the requirements of Paragraph 4.0.
LRML: if(has(parapet, capping)), then(obligation(and(is(capping.material,or(metal,butyl,epdmMembrane)),complyWith(capping, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.0'))))

TEXT: Metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades. j) Where necessary, expansion joints shall be formed as shown in Figure 9 (g), and with: i) minimum 200 mm laps ii) sliding clips at both sides of the lap.
LRML: if(and(is(capping.material, metal), over(capping.installation, and(parapet, balustrade)), is(balustrade, enclosed), has(capping, expansionJoint))), then(obligation(and(has(expansionJoint,overlap),greaterThanEqual(overlap.length,200 mm),has(overlap.side,slidingClip))))

TEXT: 6.5 Membrane cappings; Butyl rubber and EPDM cappings shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.3.9, and comply with the following requirements: a) Tops of membrane cappings shall be free of any penetrations, and shall have a minimum slope of 10° (1:6).
LRML: if(is(capping.material, or(butylRubber, epdm))), then(and(obligation(complyWith(capping, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.9')), prohibition(and(define(topOf(capping), x0),has(x0, penetration))), obligation(greaterThanEqual(x0.slope, 10 deg))))

TEXT: 6.5 Membrane cappings; Butyl rubber and EPDM cappings shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.3.9, and comply with the following requirements: a) Tops of membrane cappings shall be free of any penetrations, and shall have a minimum slope of 10° (1:6).
LRML: if(is(capping.material, or(butylRubber, epdm))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(capping, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.9'),define(topOf(capping), x0),not(has(x0, penetration)),greaterThanEqual(x0.slope, 10 deg))))

TEXT: Butyl rubber and EPDM cappings shall comply with the following requirements: b) Sides of membrane cappings shall overlap the wall claddings as outlined in Table 7.
LRML: if(and(is(capping.material, or(butylRubber, epdm)), define(capping.side, x0), is(cladding.application, wall))), then(obligation(and(to(x0.overlap,cladding),asPer(x0,nzbc_e2as1_t7))))

TEXT: Butyl rubber and EPDM cappings shall comply with the following requirements: Joints shall be in accordance with Paragraph 8.5.5.2.
LRML: if(is(capping.material, or(butylRubber, epdm))), then(obligation(complyWith(capping.expansionJoint, 'nzbc_e2as1_8.5.5.2')))

TEXT: Cappings formed by using stucco, EIFS and flush-finished fibre cement materials shall not be used for parapets, (but may be used for enclosed balustrades as described in Paragraph 7.4).
LRML: if(is(capping.material, or(stucco, eifs, flushFinishedFibreCement))), then(and(prohibition(include(capping.usage, parapet)), permission(and(include(capping.usage, balustrade), is(balustrade, enclosed)))))

TEXT: The level of the upper surface of the slatted deck: a) Shall be a minimum of 50 mm below the threshold level for cantilevered decks as shown in Figures 14(b) and 16.
LRML: if(is(deck, and(slatted, cantilevered))), then(obligation(and(define(deck.upperSurfaceLevel, x0), define(deck.thresholdLevel, x1),below(x0,x1),from(height.measurement,x0),to(height.measurement,x1),greaterThanEqual(height,50mm))))

TEXT: 7.1.1 Slatted decks; The level of the upper surface of the slatted deck: May be at the same level as the threshold for non-cantilevered decks that are formed as shown in Figure 14(c).
LRML: if(and(is(deck, slatted), not(is(deck, cantilevered)))), then(permission(and(define(deck.upperSurfaceLevel, x0), define(deck.thresholdLevel, x1),equal(x0, x1))))

TEXT: 8.1.1 Weathertightness; Roof claddings shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2.2, and be specified and constructed in accordance with the provisions of Paragraph 8.1.2 to Paragraph 8.5.
LRML: if(is(cladding.application, roof)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(cladding,nzbc_e2_2),asPer(cladding.specification,and('nzbc_e2as1_8.1.2','nzbc_e2as1_8.2','nzbc_e2as1_8.3','nzbc_e2as1_8.4','nzbc_e2as1_8.5')),asPer(cladding.construction,and('nzbc_e2as1_8.1.2','nzbc_e2as1_8.2','nzbc_e2as1_8.3','nzbc_e2as1_8.4','nzbc_e2as1_8.5')))))

TEXT: 8.1.1 Weathertightness; Roof claddings shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2.2, and be specified and constructed in accordance with the provisions of Paragraph 8.1.2 to Paragraph 8.5.
LRML: if(is(cladding.application, roof)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(cladding,nzbc_e2_2),asPer(cladding.specification,and('nzbc_e2as1_8.1.2','nzbc_e2as1_8.2','nzbc_e2as1_8.3','nzbc_e2as1_8.4','nzbc_e2as1_8.5')),asPer(cladding.construction,and('nzbc_e2as1_8.1.2','nzbc_e2as1_8.2','nzbc_e2as1_8.3','nzbc_e2as1_8.4','nzbc_e2as1_8.5')))))

TEXT: 1.1.1 Type; The acceptable solutions described in this document are for chimneys built of brickwork, concrete or precast pumice concrete, that are connected to timber frame or masonry buildings complying with NZS 3604 or NZS 4229.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.material, or(brickwork, concrete, precastPumiceConcrete)), connect(chimney, building), is(building.material, or(timberFrame, masonry)), complyWith(building, or(nzs_3604, nzs_4229)))), then(applyTo(nzbc_b1as3, chimney)))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys are built of brickwork, concrete or precast pumice concrete and the chimneys are connected to timber frame buildings or masonry buildings complying with NZS 3604 or NZS 4229, B1/AS3 applies to the chimney.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Chimneys shall not cantilever more than 2.4 m above the fixing at roof level (refer Paragraph 1.7).
LRML: if(exist(chimney)and(is(chimney, cantilevered), at(chimney.base, roof))), then(obligation(and(has(chimney, fixing),is(fixing.elevation, roofLevel),above(chimney.height, fixing),lessThanEqual(chimney.height, 2.4 m))))
PARAPHRASE: Chimneys shall not cantilever more than 2.4 m above the fixing at roof level.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Chimneys shall not cantilever more than 2.4 m above the fixing at roof level (refer Paragraph 1.7).
LRML: if(exist(chimney)), then(obligation(and(above(chimney.height, fixing),has(chimney, fixing),is(fixing.elevation, roofLevel),lessThanEqual(chimney.height, 2.4 m))))
PARAPHRASE: For chimneys, the chimney height above the fixing at roof level shall not be more than 2.4 m.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.3 Size; The width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed: a) For the foundation and chimney base – precast pumice concrete 1600 mm wide x 1050 mm deep.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, foundation), )), then(obligation(and(define(foundation.width, x0), is(x0.measurement, alongBuildingLine), define(foundation.depth, x1), is(x1.measurement, perpendicularBuildingLine), is(chimney.material, precastPumiceConcrete)lessThanEqual(x0,1600mm),lessThanEqual(x1,1050mm))))
PARAPHRASE: The width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed: a) For the foundation and chimney base – precast pumice concrete 1600 mm wide x 1050 mm deep.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.3 Size; The width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed: a) For the foundation and chimney base – brickwork or concrete 1200 mm wide x 1050 mm deep.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, foundation), define(foundation.width, x0), is(x0.measurement, alongBuildingLine), define(foundation.depth, x1), is(x1.measurement, perpendicularBuildingLine), is(chimney.material, or(brickwork, concrete)))), then(and(obligation(lessThanEqual(x0, 1200 mm)), obligation(lessThanEqual(x1, 1050 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: For the brickwork or concrete chimney's foundation and chimney base, the width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed 1200 mm width and 1050 mm depth.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.2.1 Chimney wall thicknesses shall be no less than: a) Brick – single skin (see Figure 2) 155 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.material, brick), is(brick.type, singleSkin), has(chimney, wall))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(wall.thickness, 155 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: Brick – single skin chimney shall have a wall thicknesses of no less than 155 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.3 Size; The width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed: For a brick chimney stack – single skin (see Figure 2) 500 mm wide x 500 mm deep.
LRML: if(and(is(chimneyStack.material, brick),is(brick.type, singleSkin))), then(obligation(and(define(chimneyStack.width, x0),is(x0.measurement, alongBuildingLine),define(chimneyStack.depth, x1),is(x1.measurement, perpendicularBuildingLine), lessThanEqual(x0, 500 mm),lessThanEqual(x1, 500 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: For a chimney stack with material brick type single skin, the width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed 500 mm width and 500 mm depth.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.3.3 The chimney foundation walls shall be 150 mm thick reinforced concrete, 190 mm thick concrete masonry, or brick construction complying with Figures 2 or 3. Vertical and horizontal reinforcing steel shall be as given in Paragraph 1.6.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, foundation), partOf(wall, foundation))), then(and(or(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(wall.thickness, 150 mm)), obligation(is(wall.material, reinforcedConcrete))), and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(wall.thickness, 190 mm)), obligation(is(wall.material, concreteMasonry))), and(obligation(is(wall.material, brick)), obligation(complyWith(wall, figure)), obligation(equal(figure, or(f2, f3))))), obligation(complyWith(wall.reinforcingSteel, rule)), obligation(equal(rule.key, 1.6))))
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.4.1 Hearth slabs shall be of concrete no less than 75 mm thick, reinforced with D10 bars located centrally at 225 mm centres each way. See Figure 1.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, slab), is(slab.type, hearth))), then(obligation(and(is(slab.material,concrete),greaterThanEqual(slab.thickness,75mm),has(slab,reinforcingSteel),is(reinforcingBar.type,d10),loop(forEach(slab.way), is(reinforcingBar.location, 225 mmCentres))))))
PARAPHRASE: Hearth slabs shall be of concrete no less than 75 mm thick and has reinforcing bar type D10 located at 225 mm centres each way of the slab.

TEXT: 1.6.1 Reinforcing of foundation walls, chimney bases (including the gathers) and chimney stacks (see Figures 2 to 5 inclusive) shall comprise: Double horizontal reinforcing at any change in direction of the vertical steel (e.g. at the gather/stack intersection).
LRML: if(and(partOf(reinforcing, or(foundationWall, chimneyBase, chimneyGather, chimneyStack)), is(reinforcing.type, verticalReinforcingBar))), then(loop(in(forEach(changeInDirection), verticalReinforcingBar), and(obligation(is(reinforcing.type, horizontalReinforcingBar)), obligation(equal(count(horizontalReinforcingBar), 2)))))
PARAPHRASE: Reinforcing of foundation walls, chimney bases, chimney gathers, and chimney stacks shall include: Double horizontal reinforcing at any change in direction of the vertical steel (e.g. at the gather/stack intersection).

TEXT: Aluminium flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 0.7 mm, and formed from 5000 series in accordance with AS/NZS 1734.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, aluminium)), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(flashing.thickness,0.7 mm),is(aluminium.grade, 5000 series),asPer(aluminium.grade,nzs_1734))))
PARAPHRASE: Aluminium flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 0.7 mm, and aluminium grade shall be 5000 series and in accordance with NZS 1734.

TEXT: Aluminium flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 0.7 mm, and formed from 5000 series in accordance with AS/NZS 1734.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, aluminium)), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(flashing.thickness,0.7 mm),is(aluminium.grade, 5000 series),asPer(aluminium.grade,nzs_1734))))
PARAPHRASE: Aluminium flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 0.7 mm, and aluminium grade shall be 5000 series and in accordance with NZS 1734.

TEXT: Galvanized steel flashings shall: a) have a BMT of 0.55 mm minimum b) be grade G550, or G300 for rolled or crimped flashings c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.material, steel), is(steel.coating, galvanised))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(flashing.bmt, 0.55 mm)), obligation(or(equal(flashing.grade, g550),and(equal(flashing.grade, g300), is(flashing.type, or(rolled, crimped))))),obligation(and(asPer(flashing.corrosionProtection,intendedExposureZone),asPer(intendedExposureZone,nzbc_e2as1_t20)))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are made of galvanized steel, the flashing shall: a) have a BMT of 0.55 mm minimum b) be grade G550, or G300 for rolled or crimped flashings c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in E2/AS1 Table 20.

TEXT: Galvanized steel flashings shall: a) have a BMT of 0.55 mm minimum b) be grade G550, or G300 for rolled or crimped flashings c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.material, steel), is(steel.coating, galvanised))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(flashing.bmt, 0.55 mm)), obligation(or(equal(flashing.grade, g550),and(equal(flashing.grade, g300), is(flashing.type, or(rolled, crimped))))),obligation(and(asPer(flashing.corrosionProtection,intendedExposureZone),asPer(intendedExposureZone,nzbc_e2as1_t20)))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are made of galvanized steel, the flashing shall have a BMT of 0.55 mm minimum. Flashing shall be grade G550, or G300 for rolled or crimped flashings. The flashing's corrosion protection shall be according to the intended exposure zone as shown in E2/AS1 Table 20.

TEXT: Aluminium-zinc-magnesium coated steel shall: a) have a BMT of 0.55 mm minimum b) be grade G550, or G300 for curved or crimped flashings c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.material, steel), is(steel.coating, aluminiumZincMagnesium))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(flashing.bmt, 0.55 mm)), obligation(or(equal(flashing.grade, g550),and(equal(flashing.grade, g300), is(flashing.type, or(rolled, crimped))))),obligation(and(asPer(flashing.corrosionProtection,intendedExposureZone),asPer(intendedExposureZone,nzbc_e2as1_t20)))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are made of steel with Aluminium-zinc-magnesium coating, the flashing shall have a BMT of 0.55 mm minimum. Flashing shall be grade G550, or G300 for rolled or crimped flashings. The flashing's corrosion protection shall be according to the intended exposure zone as shown in E2/AS1 Table 20.

TEXT: 4.3.5 Stainless steel flashings; Stainless steel flashings shall be: a) Minimum thickness of 0.45 mm, and b) 304 or 316 stainless steel in accordance with Table 1 of ISO/TS 15510.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, stainlessSteel)), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(flashing.thickness,0.45 mm),equal(stainlessSteel.grade,or(304,316)),asPer(stainlessSteel.grade, isots_15510_t1))))

TEXT: 1.1.1 Accessible routes shall be provided to give direct access to the principal entrance to the building where practical.
LRML: if(and(has(building, entrance), is(entrance.type, principal),towards(entrance, route),is(route.type, direct),is(route.accessibility, practical))), then(obligation(is(route, accessibleRoute)))
PARAPHRASE: If the entrance to the building is the principal entrance and the route to the building is direct, and the route's accessibility is practical, the route shall be the accessible route.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.1 Accessible routes shall be provided to give direct access to the principal entrance to the building where practical.
LRML: if(and(has(building, entrance), is(entrance.type, principal),towards(entrance, route),is(route.type, and(direct, practical)))), then(obligation(is(route, accessibleRoute)))
PARAPHRASE: If the entrance to the building is the principal entrance and the route to the building is direct, and the route's accessibility is practical, the route shall be the accessible route.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: If it is not practical, the alternative most direct practical route to the space served by the principal entrance shall be used.
LRML: if(and(has(building, entrance), is(entrance.type, principal),towards(route, entrance),is(route.type, direct),not(is(route.type, practical)))), then(obligation(and(for(entrance, space),towards(route, space),is(route.type, and(alternativeMostDirect, practical)),is(route, accessibleRoute))))
PARAPHRASE: If the entrance to the building is the principal entrance and an accessible route is not practical, an accessible routes shall be provided to the entrance.
AUTHOR: Stefan

PARAPHRASE: If the entrance to the building is the principal entrance and the direct route to the entrance is not practical, the alternative most direct practical route to the space served by the principal entrance shall be used.

TEXT: 3.2.2 Figure 3 provides a method for selecting the correct pipe size for a calculated modified catchment area, given as: Modified catchment area = 0.01 Al, where A = area being drained comprising plan roof area (m2) plus paved area (m2), and l is rainfall intensity.
LRML: if(exist(modifiedCatchmentArea)), then(and(define(planRoof.area, x0), define(pavedArea.area, x1), define(rainfallIntensity, x2),equal(modifiedCatchmentArea, '0.01 * (x0 + x1) * x2'),permission(and(for(pipe, modifiedCatchmentArea),asPer(pipe.size, nzbc_e1as1_f3)))))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.3.1 Drains shall be laid on a uniform line and gradient between points of access (see Paragraph 3.7).
LRML: if(inBetween(drain.section, accessPoints)), then(obligation(not(include(drain.section, and(changeInDirection, changeInGradient)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drains section is between points of access, the drain section shall not include any changes in direction and gradient.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.3.1 Drains shall be laid on a uniform line and gradient between points of access (see Paragraph 3.7).

TEXT: The change in direction of a drain shall not exceed 90° at any point.
LRML: if(has(drain, changeInDirection)), then(obligation(lessThan(changeInDirection, 90 deg)))
PARAPHRASE: The change in direction of a drain shall not exceed 90 deg.

TEXT: The change in direction of a drain where practical should be kept to less than 45° as illustrated in Figure 4.
LRML: if(and(has(drain, changeInDirection), is(changeInDirection.small, practical))), then(obligation(and(lessThan(changeInDirection, 45 deg),asPer(changeInDirection, nzbc_e1as_f4))))
PARAPHRASE: Where a small change in direction of a drain is practical, the change in direction should be less than 45 deg as illustrated in E1/AS1 Figure 4.

TEXT: 3.3.2 Where two drains intersect, the directions of flow as shown in Figure 5 shall be at an angle of 60° or less.
LRML: if(intersect(drains)), then(obligation(lessThanEqual(drains.flowDirection, 60 deg)))
PARAPHRASE: Where two drains intersect, the flow directions shall be 60 deg or less.

TEXT: 8.0 Roof Claddings 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles; Metal flashings are generally supplied by the metal tile manufacturer, and shall comply with Paragraph 8.3.4.2 and Table 7, unless specifically shown otherwise in the details.

TEXT: 1.2.2 If a building contains a number of different activities which individually may be categorised in different risk groups, the risk group designated for a particular firecell within the building shall be that of the primary risk group. The primary risk group shall be that one within the firecell that has the most onerous fire safety requirements.
LRML: if(greaterThan(count(building.activity), 1)), then(obligation(and(has(building.firecell, riskGroups),is(max(riskgroups.fireSafetyRequirements), primaryRiskGroup),is(firecell.riskGroup, primaryRiskGroup))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building contains a number of different activities which individually may be categorised in different risk groups, the risk group designated for a particular firecell within the building shall be that of the primary risk group. The primary risk group shall be that one within the firecell that has the most onerous fire safety requirements.

TEXT: 2.3.1 Unless explicitly stated otherwise in this Acceptable Solution, the fire resistance ratings (FRRs) that apply for each risk group shall be in accordance with Table 2.4.
LRML: if(exist(riskGroup)), then(obligation(asPer(riskGroup.fireResistanceRating, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.4')))
PARAPHRASE: Unless explicitly stated otherwise in this Acceptable Solution, the fire resistance ratings (FRRs) that apply for each risk group shall be in accordance with Table 2.4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3.1 Unless explicitly stated otherwise in this Acceptable Solution, the fire resistance ratings (FRRs) that apply for each risk group shall be in accordance with Table 2.4.
LRML: if(and(not(has(riskGroup.fireResistanceRating, exception)), in(exception, nzbc_cas2))), then(obligation(asPer(riskGroup.fireResistanceRating, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.4')))
PARAPHRASE: If risk groups fire resistance rating has no exception in C/AS2, the fire resistance ratings for each risk group shall be in accordance with C/AS2 Table 2.4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3.1 Unless explicitly stated otherwise in this Acceptable Solution, the fire resistance ratings (FRRs) that apply for each risk group shall be in accordance with Table 2.4.

PARAPHRASE: If risk groups fire resistance rating has no exception in C/AS2, the fire resistance ratings for each risk group shall be in accordance with C/AS2 Table 2.4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3.11 Structural framing members connected to building elements with an FRR shall be rated at no less than the building elements to which they are connected.
LRML: if(and(has(building, structuralFramingMember), has(building, element), connect(structuralFramingMember, element), has(element, fireResistanceRating))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(structuralFramingMember.fireResistanceRating, fireResistanceRating)))
PARAPHRASE: If the building's structural framing members and elements are connected and the element has a fire resistance rating, the structural framing member's fire resistance rating shall be no less than the element's fire resistance rating.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.3 If there is more than one risk group on one floor in the building, the highest required FRR shall be applied to common spaces and shared escape routes for that floor level.

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.3 If there is more than one risk group on one floor in the building, the highest required FRR shall be applied to common spaces and shared escape routes for that floor level.
LRML: if(and(greaterThan(count(buildingStorey.riskGroup), 1), has(buildingStorey, space),or(is(space.type, common)),and(is(space.type, escapeRoute)),is(escapeRoute, shared))))), then(obligation(and(define(max(riskGroups.fireResistanceRating), x0),equal(space.fireResistanceRating, x0))))

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.6 Floors shall have an FRR for exposure from the underside.
LRML: if(exist(floor)), then(obligation(has(floor.underside, fireResistanceRating)))

TEXT: For Low, Medium, High and Very High wind zones, flashing upstands shall have either: 1) A hem or hook to Figure 5, with upstand dimensions as shown throughout the document, or 2) No hooks or hems, and flashing upstand dimensions increased by 25 mm beyond those shown.

TEXT: The change in direction of a drain where practical should be kept to less than 45° as illustrated in Figure 4.

PARAPHRASE: Where a small change in direction of a drain is practical, the change in direction should be less than 45 deg.

TEXT: 3.3.2 Where two drains intersect, the directions of flow as shown in Figure 5 shall be at an angle of 60° or less.
LRML: if(intersect(drains)), then(obligation(lessThanEqual(drains.flowDirection, 60 deg)))
PARAPHRASE: Where drains intersect, the flow directions shall be 60 deg or less.

PARAPHRASE: For surface water drains, the drains gradients shall be greater or equal as the value given in Table 2.

TEXT: The ground level adjacent to any downpipe discharging to the bubble-up chamber is at least 150 mm higher than the level of the top of the chamber outlet.

TEXT: 1.1.1 Accessible routes shall be provided to give direct access to the principal entrance to the building where practical.

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.4 Calculating occupant loads 1.4.3 Duplication shall be avoided by: Not including an occupant load for exitways, or for the occupant load determined for areas such as lift lobbies or sanitary facilities that are used intermittently by people already counted elsewhere in the building.
LRML: if(and(has(space, occupant), or(is(space.type, exitway), is(space.usage, intermittent)))), then(obligation(not(has(space, occupantLoad))))
PARAPHRASE: If a space has occupants but is an exitway or used intermittently, the space shall have no occupant load.

TEXT: 1.4.4 Occupant load assessment shall take account of the actual arrangement and number of seats for fixed seating (see Paragraph 3.7.4). Where additional floor area abuts the fixed seating, additional occupants are permitted in that floor area based on standing space density (see Table 1.2), provided the escape route is not obstructed.
LRML: if(has(space, fixedSeating)), then(and(obligation(and(define(count(fixedSeating.seat), x0), asPer(space.occupantLoad, x0))),permission(and(adjoin(floorArea, fixedSeating),define(floorArea.occupantLoad, x1), asPer(floorArea.occupantLoad, standingSpaceDensity), asPer(standingSpaceDensity, 'nzbc_cas2_t1.2'),include(space.occupantLoad, x1)))))
PARAPHRASE: Occupant load assessment shall take account of the actual arrangement and number of seats for fixed seating (see Paragraph 3.7.4). Where additional floor area abuts the fixed seating, additional occupants are permitted in that floor area based on standing space density (see Table 1.2), provided the escape route is not obstructed.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: a) In single storey early childhood centres, dedicated sleeping areas shall be protected with supplementary smoke detectors. The alarm system and any smoke detection system shall comply with NZS 4512.
LRML: if(and(is(space.activity, earlyChildhood), equal(count(buildingStorey), 1), is(space.activity, sleeping))), then(loop(is(forEach(space.activity), sleeping), and(obligation(has(space, smokeDetector)), obligation(is(smokeDetector, supplementary)), obligation(complyWith(smokeDetector, nzs_4512)))))
PARAPHRASE: If single storey early childhood centres, dedicated sleeping areas shall be protected with supplementary smoke detectors. The alarm system and any smoke detection system shall comply with NZS 4512.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: a) In single storey early childhood centres, dedicated sleeping areas shall be protected with supplementary smoke detectors. The alarm system and any smoke detection system shall comply with NZS 4512.

PARAPHRASE: If there is one building storey and the space activity is early childhood and sleeping, the space shall be protected with supplementary smoke detectors. The alarm system and any smoke detection system shall comply with NZS 4512.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.8 The alarm systems required in a building shall be configured to alert all building occupants in the event of fire.

TEXT: 2.2.8 The alarm systems required in a building shall be configured to alert all building occupants in the event of fire.

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: f) When using uncoated or coated lead flashings, maximum continuous lengths shall be 1300 mm for 17 kg or 1500 mm for 20 kg lead. Where the pitch of the flashing is 15° or less at the join, the lap at the join shall be 200 mm minimum and the flashing underneath the lap shall have a hook at the edge,.

TEXT: 1.1.1 Building elements, including materials, components and systems, complying with a publication referenced in the Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods, satisfy B2 requirements only when the conditions of use stated in the publication and Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods prevail.
LRML: if(and(or(has(nzbc_b2as, reference), has(nzbc_b2vm, reference)), towards(reference, publication), or(complyWith(building.element, publication), complyWith(building.material, publication), complyWith(building.component, publication), complyWith(building.system, publication)), is(publication.conditionOfUse, true),is(nzbc_b2as.conditionOfUse, true),is(nzbc_b2vm.conditionOfUse, true))), then(and(complyWith(building.element, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.material, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.component, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.system, nzbc_b2)))
PARAPHRASE:
If a publication is referenced in the B2/AS or B2/VM and building elements, materials, components or systems comply with the publication, 

Building elements, including materials, components and systems, complying with a publication referenced in the Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods, satisfy B2 requirements only when the conditions of use stated in the publication and Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods prevail.

TEXT: 1.1.1 Building elements, including materials, components and systems, complying with a publication referenced in the Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods, satisfy B2 requirements only when the conditions of use stated in the publication and Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods prevail.
LRML: if(and(or(has(nzbc_b2as, reference), has(nzbc_b2vm, reference)), towards(reference, publication), or(complyWith(building.element, publication), complyWith(building.material, publication), complyWith(building.component, publication), complyWith(building.system, publication)), is(publication.conditionOfUse, true),is(nzbc_b2as.conditionOfUse, true),is(nzbc_b2vm.conditionOfUse, true))), then(and(complyWith(building.element, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.material, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.component, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.system, nzbc_b2)))
PARAPHRASE: If a publication is referenced in B2/AS or B2/VM, and building elements, materials, components or systems comply with the publication, and the conditions of use stated in the publication and B2/AS and B2/VM are true, then the building elements, materials, components or systems comply with NZBC B2.

TEXT: 2.1.2 It is the responsibility of the person specifying the building element to determine normal maintenance requirements. These may be based on the manufacturer's recommendations and may also include periodic inspections of elements not readily observable without a specific effort (e.g. access to roof or subfloor spaces).
LRML: if(has(building.element, specifier)), then(and(obligation(and(has(building.element, maintenanceRequirements),by(maintenanceRequirements, specifier))), permission(include(maintenance.requirement, and(manufacturersRecommendation, periodicInspection)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building element has a specifier, the building element shall have maintainance requirements specified by this specifier. These maintainance requirements may include manufacturer's recommendations and periodic inspections.

TEXT: 2.2.1 Scheduled maintenance comprises the inspection, maintenance and reporting procedures for building elements required to have a compliance schedule in terms of section 44 of the Building Act. The relevant maintenance procedures may include total replacement.
LRML: if(obligation(and(has(building.element,maintenanceSchedule),asPer(maintenanceSchedule,buildingAct_44)))), then(and(obligation(and(include(maintenanceSchedule, procedures),for(procedures,and(inspection,maintenance,reporting)))),permission(include(procedures, totalReplacement))))
PARAPHRASE: If building elements are required to have a maintenance schedule in terms of section 44 of the Building Act, the maintenance schedule includes the inspection, maintenance and reporting procedures. The relevant maintenance procedures may include total replacement.

TEXT: 2.2.1 Scheduled maintenance comprises the inspection, maintenance and reporting procedures for building elements required to have a compliance schedule in terms of section 44 of the Building Act. The relevant maintenance procedures may include total replacement.
LRML: if(obligation(and(has(building.element,maintenanceSchedule),asPer(maintenanceSchedule,buildingAct_44)))), then(and(obligation(and(include(maintenanceSchedule, procedures),for(procedures,and(inspection,maintenance,reporting)))),permission(include(procedures, totalReplacement))))
PARAPHRASE: If building elements are required to have a maintenance schedule in terms of section 44 of the Building Act, the maintenance schedule includes procedures for inspection, maintenance and reporting. The procedures may include total replacement.

TEXT: 3.3.1 NZS 4251: Part 1 is an acceptable solution for meeting the durability requirements of cement plasters for walls, ceilings and soffits within its scope.
LRML: if(for(cementPlaster, or(wall, ceiling, soffit))), then(permission(complyWith(cementPlaster.durability, nzs_4251_1)))
PARAPHRASE: Cement plasters for walls, ceilings and soffits may comply with the durability requirements in NZS 4251: Part 1.

TEXT: 3.4.1 NZS 4297 and NZS 4299 are acceptable solutions for meeting the durability requirements of earth buildings within their scope.
LRML: if(is(building.material, earth)), then(permission(complyWith(building, and(nzs_4297, nzs_4299))))
PARAPHRASE: Earth buildings may comply with the durability requirements in NZS 4297 and NZS 4299.

TEXT: 3.4.1 NZS 4297 and NZS 4299 are acceptable solutions for meeting the durability requirements of earth buildings within their scope.

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: b) Expansion joints shall be provided for joined flashings with a combined length exceeding: i) 12 metres for light coloured steel and stainless steel. 8 metres for dark coloured steel, ii) 8 metres for copper, iii) 8 metres for aluminium.

TEXT: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Transverse flashing: Refer to Figure 7 for example of use. The apron shall have: i) for notched turn-downs, a gap between the flashing and the pan of the roof cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.

PARAPHRASE: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Transverse flashing: The apron shall have: i) for notched turn-downs, a gap between the flashing and the pan of the roof cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.

TEXT: 2.1.3 NZS 4229; Grade 500E welded steel mesh; Where Grade 500E welded steel mesh is specified, it shall meet the requirements of Paragraph 14.0 in B1/VM1.

TEXT: Structure Design 3.0 Timber 3.1 NZS 3604.

TEXT: Structure Design 7.0 Glazing; Table 14 - Structural balustrade – cantilevered glass; Table 15 - Structural balustrade – two-edge point fixed; Table 16 - Structural balustrade – two-edge support; Table 17 - Structural balustrade – three-edge support. Design types and glass types not shown in Tables 14 to 17 require specific design.
LRML: if(and(is(structure, balustrade), not(is(balustrade.design, and(cantileveredGlass, twoEdgePointFixed, twoEdgeSupport, threeEdgeSupport))))), then(obligation(is(balustrade.design, specificDesign)))
PARAPHRASE: If the design of a structural balustrade is not cantilevered glass, two-edge point fixed, two-edge support, and three-edge support, the balustrade requires specific design.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.1 Type; The acceptable solutions described in this document are for chimneys built of brickwork, concrete or precast pumice concrete, that are connected to timber frame or masonry buildings complying with NZS 3604 or NZS 4229.

PARAPHRASE: Chimneys built of brickwork, concrete or precast pumice concrete, that are connected to timber frame buildings or masonry buildings complying with NZS 3604 or NZS 4229, B1/AS3 applies to the chimney.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Where a turn-down to the cover flashing for profiled metal claddings is required, use: a) A soft edge flashing for corrugated profiles.

TEXT: 2.3.11 Structural framing members connected to building elements with an FRR shall be rated at no less than the building elements to which they are connected.
LRML: if(and(has(building, element), has(building, structuralFramingMember), connect(structuralFramingMember, element), has(element, fireResistanceRating))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(structuralFramingMember.fireResistanceRating, fireResistanceRating)))
PARAPHRASE: If the building's structural framing members and elements are connected and the element has a fire resistance rating, the structural framing member's fire resistance rating shall be no less than the element's fire resistance rating.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3.2 Structural elements in a single storey building need not be fire rated if FRRs are not required for any other reason.
LRML: if(and(equal(count(building.buildingStorey), 1), not(is(fireResistanceRating, required)))), then(permission(not(is(structural.element, fireRated))))
PARAPHRASE: Structural elements in a single storey building need not be fire rated if FRRs are not required for any other reason.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3.2 Structural elements in a single storey building need not be fire rated if FRRs are not required for any other reason.
LRML: if(and(equal(count(building.buildingStorey), 1),has(building.structure, element),not(requires(element, fireResistanceRating)))), then(permission(not(has(element, fireResistanceRating))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building has one storey and the building's structural elements require no fire resistance rating, then the element may not have fire resistance rating.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.3 If there is more than one risk group on one floor in the building, the highest required FRR shall be applied to common spaces and shared escape routes for that floor level.
LRML: if(and(greaterThan(count(buildingStorey.riskGroup), 1), or(is(buildingStorey.space, common)),and(is(buildingStorey.space, escapeRoute)),is(escapeRoute, shared))))), then(obligation(and(equal(space.fireResistanceRating, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If there is more than one risk group on one floor, the highest required FRR shall be applied to common spaces and shared escape routes for that floor level.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.4 FRRs shall apply to the sides of primary elements and secondary elements which are exposed to fire.
LRML: if(and(is(element.type, or(primary, secondary)),has(element, fireResistanceRating),has(element, side),exposedTo(element.side, fire))), then(obligation(applyTo(fireResistanceRating, side)))
PARAPHRASE:
If an element is primary or secondary

Fire resistance ratings shall apply to the sides of primary elements and secondary elements which are exposed to fire.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.7 The FRR of a primary element integral with a fire separation shall be no less than that of the fire separation.
LRML: if(and(is(element.type, primary), partOf(element, fireSeparation))), then(obligation(and(define(fireSeparation.fireResistanceRating, x0),greaterThanEqual(fireResistanceRating.element, x0))))

TEXT: 3.1.2 The components of an escape route, in ascending order of protection, are the: a) Open paths, and b) Exitways, and c) Final exits (see Figure 3.1). Two or more of these components will be necessary.
LRML: if(include(escapeRoute.component, and(openPath, exitway, finalExit))), then(obligation(and(define(openPath.degreeOfProtection, x0), define(exitway.degreeOfProtection, x1), greaterThan(exitway.degreeOfProtection, x0),greaterThan(finalExit.degreeOfProtection, x1),greaterThan(count(escapeRoute.component), 1))))
PARAPHRASE: 3.1.2 The components of an escape route are the: a) Open paths, and b) Exitways, and c) Final exits (see Figure 3.1). The exitway's degree of protection shall be greater than the open path's degree of protection, and the final exit's degree of protection shall be greater than the exitway's degree of protection. Two or more of the escape route's components will be necessary.
COMMENTS:

repeat allthough defined for readability?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.1.2 Exitways (these may comprise of smoke lobbies and safe paths).

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Transverse flashing: Refer to Figure 7 for example of use. The apron shall have: ii) a minimum effective cover to roof cladding, excluding any soft edge or turn-down to the flashing, as shown in Table 7.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), include(flashing.overlap, roofCladding), over(flashing.cover, metalRoofing), is(flashing, transverse), has(flashing, or(softEdge, turnDown)))), then(obligation(and(has(flashing,minimumEffectiveCover),to(minimumEffectiveCover,roofCladding),exclude(minimumEffectiveCover,or(softEdge,turnDown)))))
PARAPHRASE: If apron flashings are over metal roofing, and the flashings are transverse, and the flashing have notched turn-downs, then there shall be a gap between the flashing and the pan of the roof cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: Refer to Figure 48 for example of use. The apron shall: i) be dimensioned to suit the roof cladding profile,.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), to(flashing.overlap, roofCladding), over(flashing.cover, metalRoofing), is(flashing, parallel), has(roofCladding, profile))), then(obligation(and(has(flashing.dimension,dependency),is(dependency.type, profile))))
PARAPHRASE: If apron flashings are over metal roofing, and the flashings are transverse, and the flashing have notched turn-downs, then there shall be a gap between the flashing and the pan of the roof cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: Refer to Figure 48 for example of use. The apron shall: ii) for profiled metal roof cladding, cover at least two crests, (turned-up edge to full crest height constitutes a crest).
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), to(flashing.overlap, roofCladding), over(flashing.cover, metalRoofing), is(flashing, parallel), has(roofCladding, profile))), then(obligation(and(include(flashing.cover,crest),greaterThanEqual(count(crest),2))))
PARAPHRASE: If apron flashings are over metal roofing, and the flashings are transverse, and the flashing have notched turn-downs, then there shall be a gap between the flashing and the pan of the roof cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: Refer to Figure 48 for example of use. The apron shall: iii) for profiled metal roof cladding, overhang flashing a minimum 10 mm clear of crest and maximum 5 mm clear of trough as shown in Figure 47.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), to(flashing.overlap, roofCladding), over(flashing.cover, metalRoofing), is(flashing, parallel), has(roofCladding, profile))), then(obligation(and(include(flashing.clearance,crest),greaterThanEqual(crest.clearance,10 mm),include(flashing.clearance,trough),lessThanEqual(trough.clearance,5 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If apron flashings are over metal roofing, and the flashings are transverse, and the flashing have notched turn-downs, then there shall be a gap between the flashing and the pan of the roof cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.

TEXT: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Transverse flashing: Refer to Figure 7 for example of use. The apron shall have: i) for notched turn-downs, a gap between the flashing and the pan of the roof cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), above(flashing, metalRoofing), is(flashing, transverse), has(flashing, turnDown),is(turnDown.type, notched))), then(obligation(and(has(metalRoofing.cladding, pan),inBetween(gap,and(flashing,pan)),lessThanEqual(gap.size,5 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If apron flashings are over metal roofing, and the flashings are transverse, and the flashing have notched turn-downs, then there shall be a gap between the flashing and the pan of the metal roofing cladding. The gap shall be a maximum of 5 mm.

TEXT: 1.6.1 Reinforcing of foundation walls, chimney bases (including the gathers) and chimney stacks (see Figures 2 to 5 inclusive) shall comprise: Double horizontal reinforcing at any change in direction of the vertical steel (e.g. at the gather/stack intersection).
LRML: if(and(partOf(reinforcing, or(foundationWall, chimneyBase, chimneyGather, chimneyStack)), include(reinforcing, reinforcingBar), is(reinforcingBar.orientation, vertical),has(reinforcingBar, changeInDirection))), then(obligation(and(include(reinforcing, reinforcingBar),equal(count(reinforcingBar), 2),is(reinforcingBar.orientation, horizontal),is(reinforcingBar.location, changeInDirection))))
PARAPHRASE: Reinforcing of foundation walls, chimney bases, chimney gathers, and chimney stacks shall include: Double horizontal reinforcing at any change in direction of the vertical steel (e.g. at the gather/stack intersection).

TEXT: 1.7.10 Nails used to fix straps to roof or ceiling framing shall be spaced at no less than 70 mm in other timbers than Radiata Pine.
LRML: if(and(partOf(framing, or(roof, ceiling)), has(framing, fixture), is(framing, strap), is(fixture.method, nail),is(framing.material, timber),not(is(timber.type, radiataPine)))), then(obligation(and(for(nail, fixture), greaterThanEqual(nail.spacing, 70 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If straps are fixed to a framing and the framing is part of the roof or ceiling and framing material is other timbers than Radiata Pine., the nails used for the fixture shall be spaced at no less than 70 mm.

TEXT: 1.1.1 Building elements, including materials, components and systems, complying with a publication referenced in the Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods, satisfy B2 requirements only when the conditions of use stated in the publication and Acceptable Solutions and Verification Methods prevail.
LRML: if(and(or(has(nzbc_b2as.reference, publication), has(nzbc_b2vm.reference, publication)), or(complyWith(building.element, publication), complyWith(building.material, publication), complyWith(building.component, publication), complyWith(building.system, publication)), is(publication.conditionOfUse, true),is(nzbc_b2as.conditionOfUse, true),is(nzbc_b2vm.conditionOfUse, true))), then(and(complyWith(building.element, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.material, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.component, nzbc_b2), complyWith(building.system, nzbc_b2)))
PARAPHRASE: If a publication is referenced in B2/AS or B2/VM, and building elements, materials, components or systems comply with the publication, and the conditions of use stated in the publication and B2/AS and B2/VM are true, then the building elements, materials, components or systems comply with NZBC B2.

Should "building element include" be translated literaly? - What is the scope of this, does this still apply to 2.1.2.0.2?

TEXT: 2.1.2 It is the responsibility of the person specifying the building element to determine normal maintenance requirements. These may be based on the manufacturer's recommendations and may also include periodic inspections of elements not readily observable without a specific effort (e.g. access to roof or subfloor spaces).
LRML: if(has(building.element, specifier)), then(and(obligation(and(has(building.element, maintenanceRequirements),by(maintenanceRequirements, specifier))), permission(and(include(maintenanceRequirements, and(manufacturersRecommendation, periodicInspection)),for(periodicInspection, element),not(is(element, observable))))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building element has a specifier, the building element shall have maintainance requirements specified by this specifier. These maintainance requirements may include manufacturer's recommendations and periodic inspections of elements not readily observable without a specific effort.

TEXT: 2.1.2 It is the responsibility of the person specifying the building element to determine normal maintenance requirements. TEXT: 2.2.1 Scheduled maintenance comprises the inspection, maintenance and reporting procedures for building elements required to have a compliance schedule in terms of section 44 of the Building Act. The relevant maintenance procedures may include total replacement.
LRML: if(obligation(is(maintenance.type, scheduled))), then(and(obligation(include(maintenance.task, procedure)), obligation(include(procedure, and(inspection, maintenance, reporting))), obligation(complyWith(procedure, buildingAct_44)), permission(include(maintenance.task, totalReplacement))))
PARAPHRASE: Scheduled maintenance comprises the inspection, maintenance and reporting procedures for building elements required to have a compliance schedule in terms of section 44 of the Building Act. The relevant maintenance procedures may include total replacement.

TEXT: 2.2.1 Scheduled maintenance comprises the inspection, maintenance and reporting procedures for building elements required to have a compliance schedule in terms of section 44 of the Building Act. The relevant maintenance procedures may include total replacement.
LRML: if(obligation(and(has(building.element,maintenanceSchedule),asPer(maintenanceSchedule,buildingAct_44)))), then(and(obligation(and(include(maintenance.task,procedure),include(procedure,and(inspection,maintenance,reporting)),complyWith(procedure,buildingAct_44))),permission(include(maintenance.task, totalReplacement))))
PARAPHRASE: If building elements are required to have a maintenance schedule in terms of section 44 of the Building Act, Scheduled maintenance comprises the inspection, maintenance and reporting procedures . The relevant maintenance procedures may include total replacement.

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: f) When using uncoated or coated lead flashings, maximum continuous lengths shall be 1300 mm for 17 kg or 1500 mm for 20 kg lead. Where the pitch of the flashing is greater than 15° at the join, the lap at the join shall be 100 mm minimum. Where the pitch of the flashing is 15° or less at the join, the lap at the join shall be 200 mm minimum and the flashing underneath the lap shall have a hook at the edge,.
LRML: if(  and(is(flashing.material, metal), has(flashing, join), is(flashing.material, lead),is(lead.type, or(coated, uncoated)))), then(and(obligation(or(and(lessThanEqual(lead.continuousLength, 1300 mm),equal(lead.weight, 17 kg)),and(lessThanEqual(lead.continuousLength, 1500 mm),equal(lead.weight, 20 kg)))), obligation(or(and(greaterThan(join.pitch, 15 deg),greaterThanEqual(join.lap, 100 mm)),and(lessThanEqual(join.pitch, 15 deg),greaterThanEqual(join.lap, 200 mm),below(flashing, lap),has(flashing.edge, hook))))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are material metal and have joins and flahsings are uncoated or coated lead, then the maximum continuous lengths of the lead shall be 1300 mm and lead weight be 17 kg or the maximum continuous lengths of the lead shall be 1500 mm and lead weight 20 kg. The pitch at the join shall be greater than 15 deg and the lap at the join shall be 100 mm minimum or the pitch at the join shall be 15 deg or less and the lap at the join shall be 200 mm minimum and the flashing underneath the lap shall have a hook at the edge,.
COMMENTS:
Questionable
lead or flashing for requirement one?
At instead of location would resolve many problems and result in shorter representations.
Ignored the at for now.

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: Lap joins on other metal flashings (i.e. not rules 4.5.2.0.2.e.1 and 4.5.2.0.2.f.1) shall be sealed using a neutral cure silicone sealant in conjunction with mechanical fasteners. The sealant shall comply with: a) Type F, Class 20LM or 25LM of ISO 11600, or b) low modulus Type II Class A of Federal Specification TT-S-00230C.

PARAPHRASE: If flashings are material metal and the flashing join has laps and E2/AS1 4.5.2.0.2.e.1 and 4.5.2.0.2.f.1 do not apply to the flashing, then the lap shall be sealed using a neutral cure silicone sealant in conjunction with mechanical fasteners. The sealant shall comply with: a) ISO 11600 Type F Class 20LM or ISO 11600 Type F 25LM or TT-S-00230C low modulus Type II Class A.

PARAPHRASE: If flashings are material metal and the flashing join has laps and E2/AS1 4.5.2.0.2.e.1 and 4.5.2.0.2.f.1 do not apply to the flashing, then the lap shall be sealed using a neutral cure silicone sealant and mechanical fasteners. The sealant shall comply with ISO 11600 Type F Class 20LM or ISO 11600 Type F 25LM or TT-S-00230C low modulus Type II Class A.

TEXT: 4.6 Flashing overlaps and upstands; Overlaps and upstands to flashings shall be as specified in this paragraph and Table 7.

PARAPHRASE: Laps and upstands to flashings shall be as specified in E2/AS1 4.6 and E2/AS1 Table 7.
COMMENTS: Two ways, exist(flashing) vs has(flashing, overlap or upstand

TEXT: 3.1.3 Provided the allowable lengths of open paths (Table 3.2) are not exceeded, an escape route may comprise only an open path and final exit.

TEXT: 2.0.1 Suspended floors and slabs on ground shall be at least 150 mm above the finished level of the surrounding ground immediately adjacent to the building.
LRML: if(or(is(floor.type, suspended),on(slab, ground))), then(obligation(and(adjacent(ground, building),define(ground.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(floor.elevation,'x0 + 150 mm'),greaterThanEqual(slab.elevation,'x0 + 150 mm'))))

TEXT: R-values for walls, roofs and ceilings shall be no less than: For single skin normal weight masonry based wall construction without a cavity, 0.6.

TEXT: Where a drain consists of concrete, ceramic, vitrified clay or rubber ring jointed steel or uPVC, a flexible joint shall be installed within 225 mm of the outside wall of any access chamber or inspection chamber, but outside the line of the base (see Figures 11 and 12).
LRML: if(and(is(drain.material, or(concrete, ceramic, vitrifiedClay, rubberRingJointedSteel, uPvc)), has(drain, chamber), is(chamber.purpose, or(access, inspection)), define(chamber.wall, x0), is(x0, outside))), then(obligation(and(has(drain, joint),is(joint, flexible),has(drain, chamber), for(chamber, or(access, inspection)),has(chamber, externalWall),define(externalWall.location, x0),within(joint.location,'x0 + 255 mm'),has(drain, base),outside(joint.location, base))))
PARAPHRASE: Where a drain consists of concrete, ceramic, vitrified clay or rubber ring jointed steel or uPVC, a flexible joint shall be installed within 225 mm of the outside wall of any access chamber or inspection chamber, but outside the line of the drain base.

TEXT: 3.6 Surface water inlets to drains; 3.6.1 All surface water, except that collected directly from a roof, shall enter the drain via a sump.

PARAPHRASE: Surface water, except that collected directly from a roof, shall enter the drain via a sump.

TEXT: Acceptable fill materials shown in Figure 13 are: Selected compacted fill of any fine-grained soil or granular material which is free from topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(fillMaterial, beddingMaterial),is(fillMaterial.type, compacted))), then(obligation(and(is(fillMaterial,or(fineGrainedSoil, granular)),not(include(fillMaterial, and(topsoil, rubbish)),lessThanEqual(fillMaterial.particleSize,20 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the Fill materials is selected compacted fill, the fill materials shall be of any fine-grained soil or granular material, the fill material shall not include topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm.

obligation/permission?
if/then?
According to figure, this might be the best way to specify?
MAybe parent rule should still say that fillMaterial may be beddingMaterial or selected fill asPer f13

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is one of three Acceptable Solutions that provide a means of establishing compliance with NZBC Clauses C1 to C6 Protection from Fire. It can be used for the building activities covered by risk groups specified in Paragraph 1.1.1 and described in Table 1.1.

TEXT: 3.9.4 Trench width; The width B of the trench shall be no less than the pipe diameter D plus 200 mm. Trench width at the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm unless the pipe(s) in the trench are covered with concrete, as shown in Figure 13 (c).
LRML: if(within(pipe, trench)), then(and(obligation(and(define(pipe.diameter, x0),greaterThanEqual(trench.width, 'x0 + 200 mm'))), or(obligation(and(define(topOf(pipe), x1),define(trench.width, x2),is(x2.elevation, x1),lessThanEqual(x2, 600 mm))), obligation(and(has(trench, cover),is(cover.material, concrete))))))
PARAPHRASE: If the pip is in a trench, then the width of the trench shall be no less than the pipe diameter plus 200 mm. Trench width at the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm unless the pipe in the trench are covered with concrete.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
within/for
width at top of -> trench.width.elevation

TEXT: 4.1.2 Downpipes, gutters, roofing, fastenings and all adjoining components shall be of the same or a compatible material to eliminate the risk of galvanic corrosion.
LRML: if(and(define(component, x0),define(component, x1),is(x0.type, or(downpipe, gutter, roofing, fastening)),or(is(x1.type, or(downpipe, gutter, roofing, fastening)),adjoin(x0, x1)))), then(obligation(and(define(x0.material, x2),define(x1.material, x3),or(equal(x2, x3),and(inBetween(compatibility, and(x0, x1)),is(compatibility.type, galvanic)))), ))
PARAPHRASE: Given two components, if both componenst are downpipes, gutters, roofing, or fastenings, or if on component is downpipes, gutters, roofing, fastenings and the other component is adjoining, then the components materials shall be equal or have galvanic compatibility between them.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.2.1 Downpipes sized using Table 5 are acceptable. Other downpipes are acceptable provided their cross-sectional area is no less than that required by Table 5, and they permit passage of a 50 mm diameter sphere.
LRML: if(exist(downpipe)), then(or(obligation(complyWith(downpipe.size, nzbc_e1as1_t5)), and(obligation(complyWith(downpipe.crossSectionalArea, nzbc_e1as1_t5)), obligation(greaterThan(downpipe.diameter, 50 mm)))))
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.3.1 Where thermal movement of downpipes cannot be accommodated by movement of the guttering, expansion joints shall be incorporated.
LRML: if(and(define(downpipe.thermalExpansion, x0), has(downpipe.gutter, movement), lessThan(x0, movement))), then(obligation(has(downpipe, expansionJoint)))
PARAPHRASE: Where the downpipe's thermal expansion is by movement of the guttering, expansion joints shall be incorporated.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.3.2 All internal downpipes shall withstand without leakage, a water test with an applied head of 1.5 m of water, or a high pressure air test as described in E1/VM1 Paragraph 8.3.
LRML: if(is(downpipe.location, internal)), then(or(obligation(and(test(downpipe,waterTest),equal(waterTest.appliedHead,1.5m))), obligation(and(test(downpipe,airTest),is(airTest.type, highPressure),asPer(airTest,'nzbc_e1vm1_8.3')))))
PARAPHRASE: All internal downpipes shall be tested with a water test with an applied head of 1.5 m, or a high pressure air test as described in E1/VM1 Paragraph 8.3.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.1.1 Roof gutters shall discharge to downpipes that are sized as given in Paragraph 4.2.
LRML: if(is(gutter.location, roof)), then(obligation(and(into(gutter.discharge,downpipe),asPer(downpipe.size, 'nzbc_e1_as1_4.2'))))
PARAPHRASE: Roof gutters shall discharge to downpipes that are sized as given in Paragraph 4.2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.2.1 Roof gutter materials shall comply with the standards stated in Table 6.
LRML: if(is(gutter.location, roof)), then(obligation(complyWith(gutter.material, nzbc_e1as1_t6)))
PARAPHRASE: Roof gutter materials shall comply with Table 6.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.2.1 Roof gutter materials shall comply with the standards stated in Table 6.
LRML: if(exist(roofGutter)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(roofGutter.material, standards),asPer(standards, nzbc_e1as1_t6))))
PARAPHRASE: Roof gutter materials shall comply with the standards give in  Table 6.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.2.1 Roof gutter materials shall comply with the standards stated in Table 6.
LRML: if(exist(roofGutter)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(roofGutter.material, standards),asPer(standards, nzbc_e1as1_t6))))
PARAPHRASE: Roof gutter materials shall comply with the standards give in Table 6.

TEXT: 5.0 Roof Gutters 5.5.1 All internal gutters shall be fitted with overflow outlets which drain to the exterior of the building. The top of the outlet shall be set at least 50 mm below the top of the gutter.
LRML: if(is(roofGutter.type, internal)), then(obligation(and(has(roofGutter,overflowOutlet),towards(overflowOutlet.drain, buildingExterior),define(roofGutter.top, x0),lessThanEqual(overflowOutlet.top,'x0 - 50 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If a roof gutter is internal, the roof gutter shall be fitted with overflow outlets which drain to the exterior of the building. The top of the outlet shall be set at least 50 mm below the top of the gutter.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.0 Roof Gutters 5.5.2 External gutters do not require overflow outlets but shall be installed to ensure any overflow from the gutter spills to the outside of the building.
LRML: if(is(roofGutter.type, external)), then(and(permission(not(include(roofGutter, overflowOutlet))), obligation(towards(roofGutter.overflow, buildingExterior))))
PARAPHRASE: External roof gutters do not require overflow outlets but shall be installed to ensure any overflow from the gutter spills to the outside of the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.0 Roof Gutters 5.5.2 External gutters do not require overflow outlets but shall be installed to ensure any overflow from the gutter spills to the outside of the building.
LRML: if(is(roofGutter.type, external)), then(and(permission(not(has(roofGutter, overflowOutlet))), obligation(towards(roofGutter.overflow, buildingExterior))))
PARAPHRASE: External roof gutters do not require overflow outlets but overflow from the gutter  shall go to the outside of the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Boundary fences and other site development must not significantly hamper the flow of surface water from the site.
LRML: if(is(siteDevelopment, true)), then(and(prohibition(not(include(siteDevelopment, obstruction))), to(obstruction, surfaceWaterFlow)))
PARAPHRASE: Site development must not significantly hamper the flow of surface water from the site.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Boundary fences and other site development must not significantly hamper the flow of surface water from the site.
LRML: if(exist(siteDevelopment)), then(prohibition(and(not(cause(siteDevelopment, obstruction)),towards(obstruction, surfaceWaterFlow))))
PARAPHRASE: Site development must not cause obstruction to the flow of surface water.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Rodding points rather than inspection points are preferred in landscaped or sealed areas.
LRML: if(is(are, or(landscaped, sealed))), then(obligation(is(accessPoint.preference, roddingPoint)))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.2 Height; The height of any chimney measured from the top of the chimney foundation slab to the top of the chimney stack shall not exceed 9 m.
LRML: if(exist(chimney)), then(obligation(and(has(chimney, foundation), define(topOf(foundation.slab), x0), define(topOf(chimney.stack), x1), inBetween(chimney.height, and(x0, x1)),lessThanEqual(chimney.height, 9 m))))

TEXT: 1.1.3 Size; The width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed: a) For the foundation and chimney base – precast pumice concrete 1600 mm wide x 1050 mm deep.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.material, precastPumiceConcrete),has(chimney, or(foundation,chimneyBase)))), then(obligation(and(or(define(foundation.width, x0), define(chimneyBase.width, x0)),is(x0.measurement, alongBuildingLine),or(define(foundation.depth, x1), define(chimneyBase.depth, x1)),is(x1.measurement, perpendicularBuildingLine), lessThanEqual(x0, 1600 mm),lessThanEqual(x1, 1050 mm))))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.10 Nails used to fix straps to roof or ceiling framing shall be spaced at no less than 35 m in Radiata Pine.
LRML: if(and(partOf(framing, or(roof, ceiling)), has(framing, fixture), is(framing, strap), is(fixture.method, nail), is(framing.material, radiataPine))), then(obligation(and(for(nail, fixture), greaterThanEqual(nail.spacing, 35 mm))))

TEXT: 1.7.10 Nails used to fix straps to roof or ceiling framing shall be spaced at no less than 70 mm in other timbers than Radiata Pine.
LRML: if(and(partOf(framing, or(roof, ceiling)), has(framing, fixture), is(framing, strap), is(fixture.method, nail),is(framing.material, timber),not(is(timber.type, radiataPine)))), then(obligation(and(for(nail, fixture), greaterThanEqual(nail.spacing, 70 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If straps are fixed to a framing and the framing is part of the roof or ceiling and framing material is other timbers than Radiata Pine., the nails used for the fixture shall be spaced at no less than 70 mm.

TEXT: 1.7.10 Nails used to fix straps to roof or ceiling framing shall be spaced at no less than 35 m in Radiata Pine.

PARAPHRASE: If straps are fixed to a framing and the framing is part of the roof or ceiling and framing material is Radiata Pine, the nails used for the fixture shall be spaced at no less than 35 m.

TEXT: 1.7.15 Fixing brackets shall be spaced at no less than 320 mm centres for stacks wider than 600 mm.

TEXT: Roof; c) For internal, valley, and hidden gutters, have no fixings in gutter bottoms or sides, and be continuously supported on H1.2 minimum treated timber gutter boards or H3 ply which is separated from metal by roof underlay strip.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, gutter), is(gutter.type, or(internal, valley, hidden)))), then(obligation(and(not(has(gutter.bottom,fixing)),not(has(gutter.side,fixing)),is(gutter.support, continuous),or(and(on(gutter.support,board),is(board.material,timber),greaterThanEqual(timber.treatment,'h1.2')),and(on(gutter.support,plywood),is(plywood.treatment,h3),has(roof, underlay),inBetween(underlay.strip,and(plywood, metal)))))))

TEXT: Metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades, shall be as outlined in Paragraphs 6.0 and 7.4, and comply with the following requirements: a) Tops of cappings shall be free of any penetrations, b) Slope of top shall be 5° (1:12) minimum, c) The cover at the sides of the capping shall be in accordance with Table 7, d) All cappings shall have drip edges. The details shown in Figure 5 are acceptable minimum drip edges for parapets, e) Cappings shall be separated from underlying timber by roof underlay as shown in Figure 10.
LRML: if(and(is(capping.material, metal), above(capping.installation, and(parapet, balustrade)), is(balustrade, enclosed))), then(obligation(and(asPer(capping,and('nzbc_e2as1_6.0', 'nzbc_e2as1_7.4')),define(topOf(capping), x0),not(has(x0,penetration)),greaterThanEqual(x0.slope, 5 deg),has(capping.side, cover),asPer(cover, nzbc_e2as1_t7),has(capping,dripEdge),is(roofUnderlay,separation),inBetween(separation,and(capping,timber)),below(timber,capping))))
PARAPHRASE: If metal cappings are installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades, then the capping shall be as outlined in E2/AS1 Paragraphs 6.0 and 7.4, and the top of cappings shall be free of any penetrations, b) Slope of top shall be 5 deg minimum, c) The cover at the sides of the capping shall be in accordance with E2/AS1 Table 7, d) All cappings shall have drip edges. The details shown in Figure 5 are acceptable minimum drip edges for parapets, e) Cappings shall be separated from underlying timber by roof underlay as shown in Figure 10.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades, shall be as outlined in Paragraphs 6.0 and 7.4, and comply with the following requirements: a) Tops of cappings shall be free of any penetrations, b) Slope of top shall be 5° (1:12) minimum, c) The cover at the sides of the capping shall be in accordance with Table 7, d) All cappings shall have drip edges. e) Cappings shall be separated from underlying timber by roof underlay as shown in Figure 10.
LRML: if(and(is(capping.material, metal), above(capping.installation, and(parapet, balustrade)), is(balustrade, enclosed))), then(obligation(and(asPer(capping,and('nzbc_e2as1_6.0', 'nzbc_e2as1_7.4')),define(topOf(capping), x0),not(has(x0,penetration)),greaterThanEqual(x0.slope, 5 deg),has(capping.side, cover),asPer(cover, nzbc_e2as1_t7),has(capping, dripEdge),has(roof,underlay),inBetween(underlay,and(capping,timber)),below(timber, capping),asPer(underlay, nzbc_e2as1_f10))))

TEXT: Physical testing of glass barriers must include all components of the barrier system, including all structural connections.
