TEXT: Structure Design; Interlinking rails are not required for a heat-strengthened or toughened laminated safety glass barrier that: has a stiff interlayer and will, when both panes of the laminate are fractured, resist a 0.2 kN concentrated load and not deflect more than 250 mm (see note 2).
LRML: if(and(is(safetyBarrier.material, glass), is(glass.type, laminated), is(glass, or(heatStrengthened, toughened)), has(safetyBarrier, stiffInterlayer), is(safetyBarrier.panes, and(laminate, fractured)),against(panes.resistance, concentratedLoad), lessThanEqual(concentratedLoad, 0.2 kN), is(resistance.type, concentratedLoad), lessThanEqual(panes.deflection, 250 mm))), then(permission(not(is(safetyBarrier.rail, interlinked))))
PARAPHRASE: If the safety barrier is glass and the glass is laminated and heat-strengthened or toughened, and the safety barrier has a stiff interlayer and both safety barrier panes of the laminate are fractured and the panes resists a 0.2 kN concentrated load and the panes deflection is less than or equal 250 mm, then the safety barrier may not have interlinking rails.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Physical testing of glass barriers must include all components of the barrier system, including all structural connections. Loads and deflections must be applied and measured horizontally, at midspan, at the required barrier height. The concentrated load shall be applied over an area of 100 mm x 100 mm and for at least one minute.

PARAPHRASE: If glass barriers have physical testing, then the physical testing must include all components and structural connections of the barrier system. Loads and deflections must be applied and measured horizontally, at midspan, at the required barrier height. The concentrated load shall be applied over an area of 100 mm x 100 mm and for at least one minute.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.14 Fixing brackets (see Figure 7(b)) shall be made from 5.0 mm thick mild steel angle and drilled with: a) A 50 mm diameter hole to suit the reinforcing duct location, and b) A 14 mm diameter hole for the 12 mm diameter coach screw fixing to the double stud.

PARAPHRASE: If there are fixing brackets, the brackets shall be made from 5.0 mm thick mild steel angle and drilled with: a) A 50 mm diameter hole to suit the reinforcing duct location, and b) A 14 mm diameter hole for the 12 mm diameter coach screw fixing to the double stud.

TEXT: 10.3 Measuring moisture content 10.3.1 Timber; Measurement shall be by the recommended procedure in the Scion (New Zealand Forest Research Institute) publication 'Measurement of moisture content of Wood' using electrical resistance type moisture meters with insulated probes. Representative samplings of measurements shall be taken: a) With meters calibrated to AS/NZS 1080.1 Appendix E b) By inserting probes to at least 1/3 the depth of timber being measured, at a distance exceeding 200 mm from board ends c) Using correction factors for timber species, temperature, and treatment type (outlined in Scion publication above).
LRML: if(and(by(timber.moistureContent, measurement))), then(obligation(and(is(measurement.recommendedProcedure,measurementOfMoistureContentOfWood),asPer(measurement.recommendedProcedure,scionPublication),by(measurement,moistureMeter),is(moistureMeter.type,electricalResistance),has(moistureMeter,insulatedProbe),asPer(moistureMeter.calibration, nzs_1080_1_appendixE),by(measurement.sampling,probe),into(probe,timber),define(timber.depth, x0), greaterThanEqual(probe.depth,'1/3 * x0'),has(timber, board),define(board.end, x1),greaterThan(probe.location, 'x1 + 200 mm'),include(measurement.correctionFactor,and(timberSpecies,temperature,treatmentType)),asPer(measurement.correctionFactor,scionPublication))))
PARAPHRASE: If the moisture content of timber is measured, then the measurement shall be by the recommended procedure 'Measurement of moisture content of Wood' in the Scion publication, the measurement shall use electrical resistance type moisture meters with insulated probes. the moisture meters shall be calibrated to AS/NZS 1080.1 Appendix E, and doing the measurement sampling by inserting probes to at least 1/3 the depth of timber being measured, at a distance exceeding 200 mm from board ends c) Using measurement correction factors for timber species, temperature, and treatment type, and the measurement correction factors outlined in Scion publication.

TEXT: The maximum moisture contents shall be: a) For timber framing at the time of installing interior linings, the maximum acceptable moisture content shall be the lesser of: i) 20% for insulated buildings, 24% for non-insulated buildings, or ii) as specified in NZS 3602,.
LRML: if(and(is(framing.material, timber), define(interiorLining.installationTime, x0), to(interiorLining.installation, framing), has(framing, moistureContent), in(moistureContent.measurement, x0))), then(obligation(and(and(has(building,insulation),lessThanEqual(framing.moistureContent,20percent)),and(not(has(building,insulation)),lessThanEqual(framing.moistureContent,24percent))and(lessThanEqual(framing.moistureContent,value),asPer(value,nzs_3602)))))
PARAPHRASE: For timber framing at the time of installing interior linings, the framing moisture content shall be maximum 20 percent for insulated buildings, 24 percent for non-insulated buildings, and maximum the value specified in NZS 3602,.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Drainage of roof water; Spreaders shall: k) Be to any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.1 except 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 l) Be to Figure 20 and not be used on masonry tile roofs unless a roof underlay is installed m) Discharge directed away from roofing laps and clear of roof penetrations.
LRML: if(include(roof.drainage, spreader)), then(and(obligation(and(asPer(spreader.material, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.1'),not(asPer(spreader.material, or('nzbc_e2as1_4.3.9', 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.10', 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.11'))))),obligation(and(asPer(spreader, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.1'),or(not(is(roof.type, masonryTile)),and(is(roof.type, masonryTile),has(roof, underlay))))),obligation(and(has(roof, and(lap, penetration)),awayFrom(spreader.discharge, lap),not(has(spreader.discharge, penetration))))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof drainage includes spreaders, the spreaders shall be any of the materials outlined in E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.1 but not outlined in E2/AS1 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11. The spreaders shall be to Figure 20 and either roof type is not masonry tile, or the roof type is masonry tile and the roof has a underlay. The spreader discharge shall be directed away from roofing laps and clear of roof penetrations.
COMMENTS: has(roof, and(lap, penetration)) - That would not work?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Roof; c) For internal, valley, and hidden gutters, have no fixings in gutter bottoms or sides, and be continuously supported on H1.2 minimum treated timber gutter boards or H3 ply which is separated from metal by roof underlay strip.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, gutter), is(gutter.type, or(internal, valley, hidden)))), then(obligation(and(not(has(gutter.bottom,fixing)),not(has(gutter.side,fixing)),is(gutter.support, continuous),or(and(on(gutter.support,board),is(board.material,timber),greaterThanEqual(timber.treatment,'h1.2')),and(on(gutter.support,plywood),is(plywood.treatment,h3),has(roof, underlay),inBetween(underlay.strip,and(plywood, metal)))))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are internal, valley, and hidden, the gutter shall have no fixings in gutter bottoms or sides, and be continuously supported and the support is either on H1.2 minimum treated timber boards or the support is on H3 treated plywood and roof underlay strips are between the plywood and metal.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades, shall be as outlined in Paragraphs 6.0 and 7.4, and comply with the following requirements: a) Tops of cappings shall be free of any penetrations, b) Slope of top shall be 5° (1:12) minimum, c) The cover at the sides of the capping shall be in accordance with Table 7, d) All cappings shall have drip edges. e) Cappings shall be separated from underlying timber by roof underlay as shown in Figure 10.
LRML: if(and(is(capping.material, metal), above(capping.installation, and(parapet, balustrade)), is(balustrade, enclosed))), then(obligation(and(asPer(capping,and('nzbc_e2as1_6.0', 'nzbc_e2as1_7.4')),define(topOf(capping), x0),not(has(x0,penetration)),greaterThanEqual(x0.slope, 5 deg),has(capping.side, cover),asPer(cover, nzbc_e2as1_t7),has(capping, dripEdge),has(roof,underlay),inBetween(underlay,and(capping,timber)),asPer(underlay, nzbc_e2as1_f10))))
PARAPHRASE: If metal cappings are installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades, then the capping shall be as outlined in E2/AS1 Paragraphs 6.0 and 7.4, and the top of cappings shall be free of penetrations, and the slope of the top of the capping shall be 5 deg minimum, and the cover at the sides of the capping shall be in accordance with E2/AS1 Table 7, and the cappings shall have drip edges. The details shown in Figure 5 are acceptable minimum drip edges for parapets, e) Cappings shall be separated from underlying timber by roof underlay as shown in Figure 10.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.0 Roof Claddings 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles 8.3.10 Roof penetrations; Pipe penetrations shall be flashed using EPDM flashings similar to that shown for masonry tiles, Figure 29.

PARAPHRASE: If the roof cladding type is pressed metal tiles and the roof cladding has pipe penetrations, the penetrations shall be flashed using EPDM flashings similar to that shown for masonry tiles in Figure 29.

TEXT: 8.0 Roof Claddings 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles 8.3.10 Roof penetrations; Pipe penetrations shall be flashed using EPDM flashings similar to that shown for masonry tiles, Figure 29.

PARAPHRASE: If the roof cladding type is pressed metal tiles and the roof cladding has pipe penetrations, the penetrations shall be flashed using EPDM flashings similar to that shown for masonry tiles in E2/AS1 Figure 29.

TEXT: Steel for the manufacture of pressed metal tile and flashing systems shall: a) have a base metal thickness (BMT) of 0.39 mm minimum, b) be grade G300 or G250, c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.
LRML: if(and(is(pressedMetalTile.material, steel), is(flashing.material, steel))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(steel.baseMetalThickness, 0.39 mm),is(steel.grade, or(g300, g250)),for(steel.corrosionProtection, exposureZone),asPer(steel,nzbc_e2as1_t20))))
PARAPHRASE: If the material of pressed metal tile and flashing system is steel, then the steel shall have a minimum base metal thickness of 0.39 mm, the stell shall be grade G300 or G250, and the steel shall be chosen for corrosion protection based on the exposure zone as shown in E2/AS1 Table 20.

TEXT: 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles; The minimum roof pitches for metal tiles where rafter length does not exceed 12 m shall be limited to: a) 12° (1:4.75) for profiles resembling standard profiles, and b) 15° (1:3.75) for profiles resembling shingle or shake profiles.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, and(pressedMetalTile, rafter)),lessThanEqual(rafter.length, 12 m))), then(or(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,12 deg),similarTo(pressedMetalTile.profile, standardProfile))), obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,15 deg),is(pressedMetalTile.profile,or(shingle,shake))))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has pressed metal tiles and a rafter, and the rafter length does not exceed 12 m, then the roof pitches shall be either minimum 12 deg and the pressed metal tile's profiles similar to standard profiles or the roof pitches shall be minimum 15 deg and the pressed metal tile's profiles similar to shingle or shake profiles.

TEXT: 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles; The minimum roof pitches for metal tiles where rafter length does not exceed 12 m shall be limited to: a) 12° (1:4.75) for profiles resembling standard profiles, and b) 15° (1:3.75) for profiles resembling shingle or shake profiles.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, and(pressedMetalTile, rafter)),lessThanEqual(rafter.length, 12 m))), then(obligation(or(and(greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,12 deg),similarTo(pressedMetalTile.profile,standardProfile)),and(greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,15 deg),is(pressedMetalTile.profile,or(shingle,shake))))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has pressed metal tiles and a rafter, and the rafter length does not exceed 12 m, then the roof pitches shall be either minimum 12 deg and the pressed metal tile's profiles similar to standard profiles or the roof pitches shall be minimum 15 deg and the pressed metal tile's profiles similar to shingle or shake profiles.

TEXT: 8.0 Roof Claddings 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles; The minimum roof pitches for metal tiles where rafter length exceeds 12 m, increase minimum pitch (Rule 8.3.5.0.2) by 1° per additional 0.5 m.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, and(pressedMetalTile, rafter)),greaterThan(rafter.length, 12 m))), then(obligation(and(asPer(value, 'nzbc_e2as1_8.3.5.0.2'), define(rafter.length, x0),greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch, 'value + (x0 - 12) / 0.5'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has pressed metal tiles and a rafter, and the rafter length exceeds 12 m, then the roof pitch shall be the value from E2/AS1 Rule 8.3.5.0.2 plus 1 deg per additional 0.5 m rafter length.

TEXT: Pressed metal tiles shall be fixed as shown in Figure 33, with: a) 50 x 2.8 mm hot-dipped galvanized painted flat-head annular-grooved nails.
LRML: if(exist(pressedMetalTile)), then(obligation(and(asPer(pressedMetalTile.fixing, nzbc_e2as1_f33),by(pressedMetalTile.fixing, nail),is(nail.type,and(flatHead, annularGrooved)),is(nail,and(hotDippedGalvanised,painted)),is(nail.dimension,' 50 x 2.8 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If pressed metal tiles exist,then the pressed metal tiles shall be fixed as shown in Figure 33, with nails type flat-head annular-grooved, and the nails are hot-dipped galvanized and painted, and the nails are dimension 50 x 2.8 mm.

TEXT: 8.4.10 Allowance for expansion; Allowance shall be made for expansion of corrugated and trapezoidal roof cladding as shown in Table 16.
LRML: if(is(roofCladding, or(corrugated, trapezoidal))), then(obligation(asPer(roofCladding.expansionAllowance,nzbc_e2as1_t16)))
PARAPHRASE: If roof cladding is corrugated or trapezoidal, then the roof cladding shall have allowance for expansion as shown in Table 16.

TEXT: Pumice concrete units for use in precast chimneys shall: a) Have pumice aggregate which: i) is free of combustible and organic matter, and ii) has a maximum aggregate size of no greater than 19 mm, with at least 40% but not more than 60% of the aggregate retained by a 4.75 mm standard test sieve, and b) Have a mix ratio by volume of no more than five parts of mixed pumice aggregate to one part of cement, c) Have a compressive strength of no less than 7 MPa at 28 days when cured and tested in accordance with NZS 3112: Part 2, d) After adequate curing, be air dried and kept under cover during storage, transport and on the site, e) Be laid dry. (Work left unfinished should be protected from rain.) f) Be joined with mortar which complies with NZS 4210, and g) Have ducts filled with grout complying with NZS 4210.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.type, precast), has(chimney, unit), is(unit.material, pumiceConcrete))), then(obligation(and(has(pumiceConcrete, aggregate),not(include(aggregate, and(combustibleMaterial,organicMatter))),lessThanEqual(aggregate.size, 19 mm),test(sieve, aggregate),equal(sieve.size,4.75 mm),greaterThanEqual(sieve.remainder,40 percent),lessThanEqual(sieve.remainder,60 percent),define(aggregate.volume, x0),define(cement.volume, x1),greaterThanEqual(x1,'x0 / 5'),is(pumiceConcrete.mix,'x0 + x1'),has(aggregate,compressiveStrength),greaterThanEqual(pumiceConcrete.compressiveStrength,7 MPa),is(pumiceConcrete.compressiveStrength, 28 days),asPer(pumiceConcrete, nzs_3112_2),has(pumiceConcrete, protection),by(protection,and(curing,airDrying,covering)),within(protection,and(storage,transport,onSite)),against(protection,rain),connect(mortar,pumiceConcrete),complyWith(mortar, nzs_4210),has(unit, duct),include(duct, grout),complyWith(grout,nzs_4210))))
PARAPHRASE: If precast chimneys have pumice concrete units, the pumice concrete shall have aggregate which is free of combustible material and organic matter, and the aggregate size shall be no greater than 19 mm, a sieve shall test the aggregate, with the sieve size of 4.75 mm with sieve remainder of at least 40 percent but not more than 60 percent, and the pummiceConcrete shall have a mix ratio by volume of no more than five parts of mixed pumice aggregate to one part of cement, and the pumice concrete shall have a compressive strength of no less than 7 MPa at 28 days when cured and tested in accordance with NZS 3112: Part 2, and the pumice concrete shall have protection curing, air drying and covering during storage, transport and on the site, and should be protected from rain, the mortar that connects the pumice concrete shall comply with NZS 4210, and the unit shall have ducts filled with grout complying with NZS 4210.

TEXT: 1.9.1 The bracing described in Paragraphs 1.9.2 to 1.9.6 shall be provided in those buildings where one or more of the following apply: a) The area of the room containing the chimney exceeds 24 m2, c) The floor area on any level of the building, for a given chimney type (see Table 2), is less than: i) 50 m2 for chimney Type 1, ii) 75 m2 for chimney Types 2, 3 and 4, iii) 150 m2 for chimney Types 5, 6 and 7.
LRML: if(or(and(include(building.space, chimney), greaterThan(space.area, 24 m2)), and(lessThan(buildingStorey.floorArea, 50 m2),is(chimney.type, type_1)),and(lessThan(buildingStorey.floorArea, 75 m2),is(chimney.type, or(type_2, type_3, type_4))),and(lessThan(buildingStorey.floorArea, 150 m2),is(chimney.type, or(type_5, type_6, type_7))))), then(obligation(and(has(building, bracing),asPer(bracing, 'nzbc_b1as3_1.9.2 to nzbc_b1as3_1.9.6'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the building's space containing the chimney exceeds an area of 24 m2, or the floor area of a building storey is less than 50 m2 and chimney is Type 1, or the floor area of a building storey is less than 75 m2 and chimney is Types 2, 3 or 4, or the floor area of a building storey is less than 150 m2 and chimney is Types 5, 6 and 7, then the building shall have bracing as described in Paragraphs 1.9.2 to 1.9.6.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Rails, which in the event a glass pane breaks, spans the broken pane at the required barrier height and, i) resists Line and Concentrated design loads (SLS) specified in Tables 14 to 17, and ii) does not deflect more than 100 mm, in any direction, under the design loads.

TEXT: 10.3 Measuring moisture content 10.3.1 Timber; Measurement shall be by the recommended procedure in the Scion (New Zealand Forest Research Institute) publication 'Measurement of moisture content of Wood' using electrical resistance type moisture meters with insulated probes. Representative samplings of measurements shall be taken: a) With meters calibrated to AS/NZS 1080.1 Appendix E b) By inserting probes to at least 1/3 the depth of timber being measured, at a distance exceeding 200 mm from board ends c) Using correction factors for timber species, temperature, and treatment type (outlined in Scion publication above).

PARAPHRASE: If the moisture content of timber is measured, then the measurement shall be by the recommended procedure in the Scion (New Zealand Forest Research Institute) publication 'Measurement of moisture content of Wood' using electrical resistance type moisture meters with insulated probes. Representative samplings of measurements shall be taken: a) With meters calibrated to AS/NZS 1080.1 Appendix E b) By inserting probes to at least 1/3 the depth of timber being measured, at a distance exceeding 200 mm from board ends c) Using correction factors for timber species, temperature, and treatment type (outlined in Scion publication above).

TEXT: The maximum moisture contents shall be: a) For timber framing at the time of installing interior linings, the maximum acceptable moisture content shall be the lesser of: i) 20% for insulated buildings, 24% for non-insulated buildings, or ii) as specified in NZS 3602,.

TEXT: Clause 7.5.8.3 All slab-on-ground reinforcing shall extend to within 75 mm of the outside edge of the slab (including the foundation wall) and shall consist of a minimum 2.27 kg/m2 welded reinforcing mesh sheets (1.14 kg/m2 in each direction), which shall be lapped at sheet joints such that the overlap measurement between the outmost cross wires of each fabric sheet is equal to the greater of one of the following: - the spacing of cross wires plus 50 mm, - 150 mm or - the manufacturer's requirements. Slabs shall have a maximum dimension of 24 m between free joints.

TEXT: 1.7.14 Fixing brackets (see Figure 7(b)) shall be made from 5.0 mm thick mild steel angle and drilled with: a) A 50 mm diameter hole to suit the reinforcing duct location, and b) A 14 mm diameter hole for the 12 mm diameter coach screw fixing to the double stud.

PARAPHRASE: If there are fixing brackets, the brackets shall be made from 5.0 mm thick mild steel angle and drilled with: a) A 50 mm diameter hole to suit the reinforcing duct location, and b) A 14 mm diameter hole for the 12 mm diameter coach screw fixing to the double stud.

TEXT: 1.9.1 The bracing described in Paragraphs 1.9.2 to 1.9.6 shall be provided in those buildings where one or more of the following apply: a) The area of the room containing the chimney exceeds 24 m2, c) The floor area on any level of the building, for a given chimney type (see Table 2), is less than: i) 50 m2 for chimney Type 1, ii) 75 m2 for chimney Types 2, 3 and 4, iii) 150 m2 for chimney Types 5, 6 and 7.

TEXT: 2.2.1 Solid fuel burning domestic appliances weighing no more than 130 kg shall be supported on a 65 mm thick hearth slab that is: a) Reinforced with 665 mesh, or D10 rods at 300 mm centres each way, placed centrally in the slab thickness, b) Supported on a timber or concrete floor, or integral with a concrete floor. (The floor supporting the hearth slab shall comply with NZS 3604 or NZS 4229 as appropriate), and c) Comprised of ordinary grade concrete complying with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109.

TEXT: 2.1.3 Basic normal maintenance tasks shall include but not be limited to: a) Where applicable, following manufacturers' maintenance recommendations, b) Washing down surfaces, particularly exterior building elements subject to wind driven salt spray, c) Re-coating interior and exterior protective finishes, d) Replacing sealant, seals and gaskets in joints, e) Replacing valves, washers and similar high wear components in easily accessed service equipment and other building elements, f) Cleaning and replacing filters in building services systems, g) The regular servicing of boilers, cooling towers, lifts, escalators, emergency lighting and fire protection equipment, and h) The maintenance of signs for access, escape routes, emergency equipment and hazardous areas.
LRML: if(is(maintenance.type, or(normal, basic))), then(obligation(include(maintenance.task, and(manufacturersRecommendation, washDownSurface, recoatInteriorProtectiveFinish, recoatExteriorProtectiveFinish, replaceJointSealant, replaceJointSeal, replaceJointGasket, replaceValve, replacewashers, replaceHighWearComponents, cleanBuildingServiceSystemFilter, replaceBuildingServiceSystemFilter, regularBoilerService, regularCoolingTowerService, regularLiftService, regularEscalatorService, regularEmergencyLightingService, regularFireProtectionEquipmentService, accessSignMaintenance, escapeRouteMaintenance, emergencyEquipmentMaintenance, hazardousAreaMaintenance))))
PARAPHRASE: If the the maintenance is basic or normal, the maintenance tasks shall include the manufacturers recommendations, washing down surfaces, recoating interior protective finishes, recoating exterior protective finishes, replacing joint sealant, replacing joint seals, replacing joint gaskets, replacing valves, replacing washers and replacing high wear components, cleaning building services system filters and replacing building services system filters, regular boiler service, regular cooling tower service, regular lift service, regular escalator service, regular emergency lighting service, regular fire protection equipment service, access sign maintenance, escape route sign maintenance, emergency equipment sign maintenance and hazardous area sign maintenance. Maintenance does not include upgrading building elements to meet the demands of new technology or the increased environmental expectations of users.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 10.3 Measuring moisture content 10.3.1 Timber; Measurement shall be by the recommended procedure in the Scion (New Zealand Forest Research Institute) publication 'Measurement of moisture content of Wood' using electrical resistance type moisture meters with insulated probes. Representative samplings of measurements shall be taken: a) With meters calibrated to AS/NZS 1080.1 Appendix E b) By inserting probes to at least 1/3 the depth of timber being measured, at a distance exceeding 200 mm from board ends c) Using correction factors for timber species, temperature, and treatment type (outlined in Scion publication above).

PARAPHRASE: If the moisture content of timber is measured, then the measurement shall be by the recommended procedure 'Measurement of moisture content of Wood' in the Scion publication, the measurement shall use electrical resistance type moisture meters with insulated probes. the moisture meters shall be calibrated to AS/NZS 1080.1 Appendix E, and doing the measurement sampling by inserting probes to at least 1/3 the depth of timber being measured, at a distance exceeding 200 mm from board ends c) Using correction factors for timber species, temperature, and treatment type (outlined in Scion publication above).
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 9.0 Wall claddings; Masonry veneer shall be attached to wall framing by wall ties. Wall ties and their spacings and embedment shall be in accordance with the requirements of NZS 4210 and Tables 18A, 18B and 18C. PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are masonry veneer, the wall cladding shall be connected to wall framing by wall ties. Wall ties and their spacings and embedment shall be in accordance with NZS 4210 and E2/AS1 Tables 18.a, 18.b and 18.c. Screw fixings for the wall ties shall be minimum size 12 gauge, 35 mm long hex washer face, galvanised or stainless steel.

TEXT: 1.7.2 Where a packer (see Figures 2, 3, 6 and 7(b)) is shown between the chimney and building it shall be: a) Concrete, brick, steel (angle, channel or Z section), or any insulating material which has a long term operating temperature of no less than 150°C, b) Secured in place to prevent it dislodging, and c) Capable of withstanding a compressive force of 10 kN without shortening by more than 1.5 mm.

PARAPHRASE: If a packer is between the chimney and building, the packer shall be concrete, brick, steel angle, steel channel or steel Z section, or any insulating material which has a operating temperature of no less than 150 deg C, and the packer shall be fixed, and the packer shall have compressive resistance of 10 kN force without the packer shortening by more than 1.5 mm.

TEXT: 10.3 Measuring moisture content 10.3.1 Timber; Measurement shall be by the recommended procedure in the Scion (New Zealand Forest Research Institute) publication 'Measurement of moisture content of Wood' using electrical resistance type moisture meters with insulated probes. Representative samplings of measurements shall be taken: a) With meters calibrated to AS/NZS 1080.1 Appendix E b) By inserting probes to at least 1/3 the depth of timber being measured, at a distance exceeding 200 mm from board ends c) Using correction factors for timber species, temperature, and treatment type (outlined in Scion publication above).

PARAPHRASE: If the moisture content of timber is measured, then the measurement shall be by the recommended procedure 'Measurement of moisture content of Wood' in the Scion publication, the measurement shall use electrical resistance type moisture meters with insulated probes. the moisture meters shall be calibrated to AS/NZS 1080.1 Appendix E, and doing the measurement sampling by inserting probes to at least 1/3 the depth of timber being measured, and the probe located at a distance exceeding 200 mm from board ends c) Using measurement correction factors for timber species, temperature, and treatment type, and the measurement correction factors outlined in Scion publication.

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Where the tops to enclosed balustrades are formed using EIFS, they shall have a minimum fall of 10° (1:6), and be wrapped as shown in Figure 129 and 130, with a liquid waterproofing membrane approved by the supplier. The EIFS system shall be fully protected by the coating, and shall comply with the requirements of AS/NZS 4858 Table 8, Parts (a) to (e), except that bleach and detergent immersion set out in Appendix A1 shall not be required.

PARAPHRASE: If the tops to enclosed balustrades are material EIFS, the top of the balustrade shall have a minimum fall of 10 deg, and be wrapped as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 129 and 130, with a liquid waterproofing membrane approved by the supplier. The EIFS system shall be fully protected by the coating, and shall comply with the requirements of AS/NZS 4858 Table 8, Parts (a) to (e), except that bleach and detergent immersion set out in Appendix A1 shall not be required.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings 9.7.1 Limitations; This Acceptable Solution is limited to the following type of fibre cement sheet cladding systems: a) Flush-finished systems over a drained cavity using sheets of 7.5 mm minimum thickness, with i) fibre cement sheets manufactured with a rebated edge for this purpose, ii) if necessary for part sheets, rebated on site using a purpose-made tool, and iii) have all edges sealed, iv) joints, comprising a bedding compound and reinforcing tape, that are finished in accordance with Paragraph 9.7.10.4.

There shall be air movement restriction between the drained cavity and floor framing, drained cavity and wall framing, drained cavity and roof framing, drained cavity and attic roof space, and drained cavity and subfloor space. Either there is fixing in between cavity battens and the cavity battens shall have cavity spacers as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 67 and either E2/AS1 Paragraph 9.1.8.2 or Pargraph 9.1.8.4, or no fixing is in between cavity battens and the cavity
AUTHOR: Stefan

LRML: if(and(is(balustrade, enclosed), define(topOf(balustrade), x0), is(x0.material, eifs))), then(and(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(x0.fall,10 deg),asPer(x0.wrapping, and(nzbc_e2as1_f129, nzbc_e2as1_f130)),is(x0.wrapping, membrane),is(membrane.type, and(liquid, waterproofing)),approve(supplier, membrane),has(eifs.system,fullProtection),by(fullProtection, membrane),complyWith(eifs.system, 'nzs_4858_t8.a to nzs_4858_t8.e'))),permission(and(exclude(eifs.system, immersion),by(immersion, and(bleach, detergent)),asPer(immersion, nzs_4858_appendixA)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the tops to enclosed balustrades are material EIFS, the top of the balustrade shall have a minimum fall of 10 deg, and be wrapped as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 129 and E2/AS1 Figure 130, with a liquid waterproofing membrane approved by the supplier. The EIFS system shall be fully protected by the membrane, and shall comply with the requirements of NZS 4858 Table 8.a to NZS 4858 Table 8.e. The EIFS system may exclude bleach and detergent immersion described in NZS 4858 Appendix A1.
COMMENTS:
supplier of what?
coating -> membrane
fullProtection -> exclude(EIFS system , bleachAndDetergentImmersion)
split obligation?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Masonry tile roofs with underlays shall have anti-ponding boards installed to Figure 25. Where anti-ponding boards are used, these shall be set to a minimum fall of 5° (1:12), and shall be treated minimum H1.2 for solid timber and H3 for plywood.

PARAPHRASE: If the roof type is masonry tile and the roof has an underlay, then the roof shall have anti-ponding boards installed to Figure 25 and the anti-ponding boards shall have a minimum fall of 5 deg, and either the anti-ponding boards shall be treated minimum H1.2 and material solid timber or the anti-ponding boards shall be treated minimum H3 and be material plywood.

TEXT: All slab-on-ground reinforcing shall extend to within 75 mm of the outside edge of the slab (including the foundation wall) and shall consist of a minimum 2.27kg/m2 welded Grade 500E reinforcing mesh sheets (1.14 kg/m2 in each direction), which shall be lapped at sheet joints such that the overlap measurement between the outermost cross wires of each fabric sheet is equal to the greater of one of the following: the spacing of cross wires plus 50 mm, 150 mm, or the manufacturer's requirements. TEXT: Pumice concrete units for use in precast chimneys shall: a) Have pumice aggregate which: i) is free of combustible and organic matter, and ii) has a maximum aggregate size of no greater than 19 mm, with at least 40% but not more than 60% of the aggregate retained by a 4.75 mm standard test sieve, and b) Have a mix ratio by volume of no more than five parts of mixed pumice aggregate to one part of cement, c) Have a compressive strength of no less than 7 MPa at 28 days when cured and tested in accordance with NZS 3112: Part 2, d) After adequate curing, be air dried and kept under cover during storage, transport and on the site, e) Be laid dry. PARAPHRASE: If precast chimneys have pumice concrete units, the pumice concrete shall have aggregate which is free of combustible material and organic matter, and the aggregate size shall be no greater than 19 mm, a sieve shall test the aggregate, with the sieve size of 4.75 mm with sieve remainder of at least 40 percent but not more than 60 percent, and the pummiceConcrete shall have a mix ratio by volume of no more than five parts of mixed pumice aggregate to one part of cement, and the pumice concrete shall have a compressive strength of no less than 7 MPa at 28 days when cured and tested in accordance with NZS 3112: Part 2, and the pumice concrete shall have protection curing, air drying and covering during storage, transport and on the site, e) Be laid dry. (Work left unfinished should be protected from rain.) f Be joined with mortar which complies with NZS 4210, and g) Have ducts filled with grout complying with NZS 4210.

PARAPHRASE: If metal cappings are installed over parapets or enclosed balustrades and cappings are joined and either the capping's combined length exceeds 12 metres and capping material is light coloured steel or stainless steel, or the capping's combined length exceeds 8 metres and the capping material is dark coloured steel, copper, or aluminium, then expansion joints shall be provided for the cappings.
COMMENTS:
plural? ->cappings
Permission missing to not have expansion joint if those cases are not true

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings 9.7.1 Limitations; This Acceptable Solution is limited to the following type of fibre cement sheet cladding systems: a) Flush-finished systems over a drained cavity using sheets of 7.5 mm minimum thickness, with i) fibre cement sheets manufactured with a rebated edge for this purpose, ii) if necessary for part sheets, rebated on site using a purpose-made tool, and iii) have all edges sealed, iv) joints, comprising a bedding compound and reinforcing tape, that are finished in accordance with Paragraph 9.7.10.4.

TEXT: 10.3 Measuring moisture content 10.3.1 Timber; Measurement shall be by the recommended procedure in the Scion (New Zealand Forest Research Institute) publication 'Measurement of moisture content of Wood' using electrical resistance type moisture meters with insulated probes. Representative samplings of measurements shall be taken: a) With meters calibrated to AS/NZS 1080.1 Appendix E b) By inserting probes to at least 1/3 the depth of timber being measured, at a distance exceeding 200 mm from board ends c) Using correction factors for timber species, temperature, and treatment type (outlined in Scion publication above).

PARAPHRASE: If the moisture content of timber is measured, then the measurement shall be by the recommended procedure 'Measurement of moisture content of Wood' in the Scion publication, the measurement shall use electrical resistance type moisture meters with insulated probes. the moisture meters shall be calibrated to AS/NZS 1080.1 Appendix E, and doing the measurement sampling by inserting probes to at least 1/3 the depth of timber being measured, and the probe located at a distance exceeding 200 mm from board ends c) Using measurement correction factors for timber species, temperature, and treatment type, and the measurement correction factors outlined in Scion publication.

LRML: if(is(capping.material, or(butylRubber, epdm))), then(obligation(and(asPer(capping, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.9'),has(capping, top),not(has(top, penetration)),greaterThanEqual(top.slope, 10 deg))))
PARAPHRASE: If the capping material is butyl rubber or EPDM, the capping shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.3.9, and the top of the capping shall be free of any penetrations, and shall have a minimum slope of 10 deg.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The level of the upper surface of the slatted deck: a) Shall be a minimum of 50 mm below the threshold level for cantilevered decks as shown in Figures 14(b) and 16.
LRML: if(is(deck, and(slatted, cantilevered))), then(obligation(and(define(deck.thresholdLevel, x0),lessThanEqual(deck.upperSurfaceLevel, 'x0 - 50 mm'),asPer(deck.upperSurfaceLevel, and('nzbc_e2as1_f14.b', nzbc_e2as1_f16)))))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: For slatted decks, a minimum gap of 12 mm shall be provided between the exterior wall and the adjacent decking slat.
LRML: if(is(deck, slatted)), then(obligation(and(adjacent(deck.slat, wall),is(wall.type, exterior), inBetween(gap, and(wall, slat)),greaterThanEqual(gap,12 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the deck is slatted, a gap shall be provided between the exterior wall and the adjacent decking slat, the gap size shall be minimum 12 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.1.2 Limitations; The following roof cladding systems are covered in this Acceptable Solution: a) Masonry tiles Paragraph 8.2 b) Pressed metal tiles Paragraph 8.3 c) Profiled metal roof claddings Paragraph 8.4 d) Membrane roofing Paragraph 8.5.

PARAPHRASE: If the roof cladding is Masonry tiles, Pressed metal tiles, Profiled metal roof claddings, Membrane roofing, then E2/AS1 applies to the roof cladding

TEXT: a) Masonry tiles Paragraph 8.2 b) Pressed metal tiles Paragraph 8.3 c) Profiled metal roof claddings Paragraph 8.4 d) Membrane roofing Paragraph 8.5. Other roof claddings are beyond the scope of this Acceptable Solution.

TEXT: Maintenance of claddings shall be carried out as necessary to achieve the expected durability of the materials - refer to Paragraph 2.5.

TEXT: The maximum moisture contents shall be: a) For timber framing at the time of installing interior linings, the maximum acceptable moisture content shall be the lesser of: i) 20% for insulated buildings, 24% for non-insulated buildings, or ii) as specified in NZS 3602,.
LRML: if(and(is(framing.material, timber), towards(interiorLining.installation, framing))), then(obligation(and(define(interiorLining.installationTime, x0), has(framing, moistureContent), before(moistureContent.measurement, x0)and(has(building,insulation),lessThanEqual(framing.moistureContent,20 percent)),and(not(has(building,insulation)),lessThanEqual(framing.moistureContent,24 percent)),and(lessThanEqual(framing.moistureContent,value),asPer(value,nzs_3602)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the framing is timber and interior linings are installed to the framing, then the framing moisture content medasured at the time of installing interior linings shall be maximum 20 percent for insulated buildings, 24 percent for non-insulated buildings, and maximum the value specified in NZS 360.

TEXT: Metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades, shall be as outlined in Paragraphs 6.0 and 7.4, and comply with the following requirements: a) Tops of cappings shall be free of any penetrations, b) Slope of top shall be 5° (1:12) minimum, c) The cover at the sides of the capping shall be in accordance with Table 7, d) All cappings shall have drip edges. The details shown in Figure 5 are acceptable minimum drip edges for parapets, e) Cappings shall be separated from underlying timber by roof underlay as shown in Figure 10.

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades, shall be as outlined in Paragraphs 6.0 and 7.4, and comply with the following requirements: a) Tops of cappings shall be free of any penetrations, b) Slope of top shall be 5° (1:12) minimum, c) The cover at the sides of the capping shall be in accordance with Table 7, d) All cappings shall have drip edges. e) Cappings shall be separated from underlying timber by roof underlay as shown in Figure 10.

TEXT: 1.8.3 Precast pumice concrete; Pumice concrete units for use in precast chimneys shall: a) Have pumice aggregate which: i) is free of combustible and organic matter, and ii) has a maximum aggregate size of no greater than 19 mm, with at least 40% but not more than 60% of the aggregate retained by a 4.75 mm standard test sieve, and b) Have a mix ratio by volume of no more than five parts of mixed pumice aggregate to one part of cement, c) Have a compressive strength of no less than 7 MPa at 28 days when cured and tested in accordance with NZS 3112: Part 2, d) After adequate curing, be air dried and kept under cover during storage, transport and on the site, e) Be laid dry. (Work left unfinished should be protected from rain.) f) Be joined with mortar which complies with NZS 4210, and g) Have ducts filled with grout complying with NZS 4210.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.type, precast), has(chimney, unit), is(unit.material, pumiceConcrete))), then(obligation(and(has(pumiceConcrete,aggregate),not(include(pumiceConcrete.aggregate,or(combustible,organic))),lessThanEqual(aggregate.size,19mm),is(sieve.application,aggregate),is(sieve.output,retaint),equal(sieve.size,4.75 mm),greaterThanEqual(retaint.ratio,40 percent),lessThanEqual(retaint.ratio,60 percent),define(aggregate.volume,x0),define(cement.volume,x1),lessThanEqual(x1,'x0 / 5'),is(aggregate.mix,'x0 + x1'),has(aggregate,compressiveStrength),greaterThanEqual(compressiveStrength,7 MPa),is(compressiveStrength.measurement,28 days),complyWith(compressiveStrength,nzs_3112_2),has(pumiceConcrete,protection),for(protection,and(storage,transport,onSite)),include(protection.method,and(curing,airDrying,covering)),from(protection,rain),connect(mortar,pumiceConcrete),complyWith(mortar,nzs_4210),has(unit,duct),is(duct.filling,grout),complyWith(duct,nzs_4210))))

TEXT: 1.4.5 The requirements of this Acceptable Solution account for the fact that other people may be present in the building or firecell and additional calculations are not required when an occupant load is derived by bed spaces (i.e. for risk groups SM and SI). 1.4.6 For the purposes of risk group SI the term ‘bed’ means the number of people that are under care or detention. It can include people on: a) Beds, or b) Recliner or lounge chairs, or c) Dentist chairs, or d) Treatment tables, or e) Any other furniture where an occupant may be for a period of treatment, in care or detention.

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.4 For risk group VP firecells that require a fire sprinkler system (refer to Table 2.2d), the fire sprinkler system does not need to be extended throughout the remainder of the building where the risk group VP firecells are fire separated from the adjacent firecells. The fire separation between adjacent firecells is required to be provided with the greater of the property rating of the adjacent firecells (refer to Table 2.4).

TEXT: 8.0 Roof Claddings 8.1.4 Fixings; Fixings shall be as specified in Paragraph 8.2 to Paragraph 8.5. Materials for fixing roof claddings and flashings, where necessary, shall be selected from Tables 20, 21 and 22 to minimise corrosion.
LRML: if(or(has(cladding, fixing), has(flashing, fixing))), then(obligation(and(asPer(fixing, and('nzbc_e2as1_8.1.2 to nzbc_e2as1_8.5')),asPer(fixing.material,and(nzbc_e2as1_t20, nzbc_e2as1_t21, nzbc_e2as1_t22)))))
PARAPHRASE: If roof claddings or flashings have fixings, the fixings shall be as specified in E2/AS1 Paragraph 8.2 to Paragraph 8.5. The fixing materials shall be selected from Tables 20, 21 and 22.

TEXT: 8.1.5 Roof underlays; Underlays shall be: • Layed with minimum numbers of laps • Lapped at all side and end laps by minimum 150 mm • Run horizontally for roof pitches below 10° • Run horizontally or vertically for roof pitches above 10° • Have anti-ponding boards at lower edges of masonry tiles, refer Figure 25(b) and Paragraph 8.2.5.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(and(obligation(is(count(underlay.lap), minimum)), obligation(and(has(underlay, lap),is(lap, or(end, side)),greaterThanEqual(lap.size, 150 mm))), or(obligation(and(is(underlay.orientation,horizontal),lessThan(roof.pitch, 10 deg))), obligation(and(is(underlay.orientation,or(horizontal,vertical)),greaterThan(roof.pitch, 10 deg)))), obligation(is(roof.claddingSystem, masonryTile)), obligation(has(masonryTile.lowerEdge, antiPondingBoard))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has underlays, then the underlay shall have a minimum cound of laps. The underlay shall have laps and the side laps and end laps shall be minimum 150 mm size. The underlay shall be either horizontally and roof pitches below 10° or the underlay shall be horizontally or vertically for roof pitches above 10° • Have anti-ponding boards at lower edges of masonry tiles, refer Figure 25(b) and Paragraph 8.2.5.

TEXT: Prevent sagging of roof underlay by either: For R1 underlays, fully support with a corrosion resistant material • For R2 self supporting underlays, laid to maximum 1.2 metre span between adjacent supports.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(or(obligation(and(is(underlay.type, r1), has(underlay, support),is(support.material, corrosionResistant))), obligation(and(is(underlay.type, r2), is(underlay, selfSupporting),lessThanEqual(underlay.span, 1.2 m),inBetween(underlay.span, adjacentSupports)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has an underlay, the underlay type shall be either R1 and the underlay shall be fully support with a corrosion resistant material, or the underly shall be type R2 and self supporting and laid to maximum 1.2 metre span between adjacent supports.

TEXT: 4.1.1 Adjoining firecells are required to be fire separated from each other by the highest: a) Life rating specified in Paragraph 2.3 if both firecells are under common ownership, or b) Property rating specified in Paragraph 2.3 if both firecells are under different ownership.

PARAPHRASE: If multiple firecells are adjoining, there shall be a fire separation between the firecells, the fire separation's fire resistance rating shall be either the highest life rating of the firecells as specified in C/AS2 Paragraph 2.3 and both firecells have the same owner, or the fire separation's fire resistance rating shall be the highest property rating of the firecells as specified in C/AS2 Paragraph 2.3 and both firecells have not the same owner.

TEXT: Pumice concrete units for use in precast chimneys shall: a) Have pumice aggregate which: i) is free of combustible and organic matter, and ii) has a maximum aggregate size of no greater than 19 mm, with at least 40% but not more than 60% of the aggregate retained by a 4.75 mm standard test sieve, and b) Have a mix ratio by volume of no more than five parts of mixed pumice aggregate to one part of cement, c) Have a compressive strength of no less than 7 MPa at 28 days when cured and tested in accordance with NZS 3112: Part 2, d) After adequate curing, be air dried and kept under cover during storage, transport and on the site, e) Be laid dry. TEXT: 1.9.1 The bracing described in Paragraphs 1.9.2 to 1.9.6 shall be provided in those buildings where one or more of the following apply: a) The area of the room containing the chimney exceeds 24 m2, c) The floor area on any level of the building, for a given chimney type (see Table 2), is less than: i) 50 m2 for chimney Type 1, ii) 75 m2 for chimney Types 2, 3 and 4, iii) 150 m2 for chimney Types 5, 6 and 7.

PARAPHRASE: If the building's space containing the chimney exceeds an area of 24 m2, or the floor area on any level of the building, for a given chimney type (see Table 2), is less than: i) 50 m2 for chimney Type 1, ii) 75 m2 for chimney Types 2, 3 and 4, iii) 150 m2 for chimney Types 5, 6 and 7, then the building shall have bracing as described in Paragraphs 1.9.2 to 1.9.6.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 9.0 Wall claddings; 9.2.2 General 1) The materials and workmanship of masonry veneer shall be in accordance with SNZ HB 4236 and have a maximum mass of veneer of 220 kg/m2 and minimum veneer thickness of 70 mm.

PARAPHRASE: Soffit linings shall be finished to fascias, barges and wall claddings as outlined in E2/AS1 Figure 8A generally, or E2/AS1 Figure 114 for flush finished fibre cement. Wall underlays shall not be required behind soffit linings.

TEXT: Drainage of roof water; Spreaders shall: k) Be to any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.1 except 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 l) Be to Figure 20 and not be used on masonry tile roofs unless a roof underlay is installed m) Discharge directed away from roofing laps and clear of roof penetrations.

TEXT: Drainage of roof water; Spreaders shall: k) Be to any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.1 except 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 l) Be to Figure 20 and not be used on masonry tile roofs unless a roof underlay is installed m) Discharge directed away from roofing laps and clear of roof penetrations.

PARAPHRASE: If the roof drainage includes spreaders, the spreaders shall be any of the materials outlined in E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.1 but not outlined in E2/AS1 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11. TEXT: 8.1.6.1 Internal gutters; Internal gutters shall: a) Be formed with continuous butyl or EPDM strip complying with Paragraph 4.3.9, with no cross-joints in the gutter, or aluminium, copper, stainless steel, or zinc sheet to Paragraph 4.3, with joints that are welded.
LRML: if(is(gutter.type, internal)), then(obligation(or(and(is(gutter.material, or(butyl, epdm)),complyWith(gutter.material, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.9'),not(has(gutter, crossJoint))),and(has(gutter,joint),is(joint,welded),is(gutter.material,or(aluminium,copper,stainlessSteel,zinc))))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are internal, the gutter material shall be butyl or EPDM and comply with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.3.9, with no cross-joints in the gutter, or aluminium, copper, stainless steel, or zinc sheet to E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.3, with joints that are welded.

TEXT: 8.1.6.1 Internal gutters; Internal gutters shall: b) Where butyl or EPDM, be minimum 1.5 mm membrane thickness, or 1.0 mm thickness for gutters less than 1 metre wide.
LRML: if(and(is(gutter.type, internal), is(gutter.material, or(butyl, epdm)))), then(obligation(or(and(greaterThanEqual(gutter.thickness,1.5mm),greaterThanEqual(gutter.width, 1 m)),and(greaterThanEqual(gutter.thickness, 1 mm),lessThan(gutter.width, 1 m)))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are internal and gutter material is butyl or EPDM, the gutter shall be minimum 1.5 mm thickness and not less than 1 metre wide, or 1.0 mm thickness and gutters less than 1 metre wide.

TEXT: Metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades. h) Expansion joints shall be provided for joined cappings with a combined length exceeding: i) 12 metres for light coloured steel and stainless steel, 8 metres for dark coloured steel ii) 8 metres for copper iii) 8 metres for aluminium.
LRML: if(and(is(capping.material, metal), above(capping.installation, or(parapet, balustrade)), is(balustrade, enclosed), has(cappings, join),or(and(is(capping.material,or(lightColouredSteel,stainlessSteel)),greaterThanEqual(sum(cappings.length),12 m)),and(is(capping.material,or(darkColouredSteel,copper,aluminium)),greaterThanEqual(sum(cappings.length),8 m))))), then(obligation(for(expansionJoint,cappings)))

Permission missing to not have expansion joint if those cases are not true

TEXT: 4.1.1 Adjoining firecells are required to be fire separated from each other by the highest: a) Life rating specified in Paragraph 2.3 if both firecells are under common ownership, or b) Property rating specified in Paragraph 2.3 if both firecells are under different ownership.
LRML: if(adjoin(firecells)), then(obligation(and(inBetween(fireSeparation, firecells),max(firecells.rating), or(and(define(max(firecells.lifeRating), x0),asPer(firecells.lifeRating, 'nzbc_cas2_2.3.0'), is(fireSeparation.rating, x0), equal(spaces.owner)), and(define(max(firecells.propertyRating), x0),is(fireSeparation.rating, x0), not(equal(spaces.owner)))), asPer(lifeRating, 'nzbc_cas2_2.3.0'), asPer(propertyRating, 'nzbc_cas2_2.3.0'))))
PARAPHRASE: If multiple firecells are adjoining, there shall be a fire separation between the firecells, the fire separation shall be either the highest life rating of the firecells as specified in C/AS2 Paragraph 2.3 and both firecells have the same owner, or the fire separation shall be the highest property rating of the firecells as specified in C/AS2 Paragraph 2.3 and both firecells have not the same owner.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.1.3 Basic normal maintenance tasks shall include but not be limited to: a) Where applicable, following manufacturers' maintenance recommendations, b) Washing down surfaces, particularly exterior building elements subject to wind driven salt spray, c) Re-coating interior and exterior protective finishes, d) Replacing sealant, seals and gaskets in joints, e) Replacing valves, washers and similar high wear components in easily accessed service equipment and other building elements, f) Cleaning and replacing filters in building services systems, g) The regular servicing of boilers, cooling towers, lifts, escalators, emergency lighting and fire protection equipment, and h) The maintenance of signs for access, escape routes, emergency equipment and hazardous areas. COMMENT: Maintenance does not include such things as upgrading building elements to meet the demands of new technology or the increased environmental expectations of users.
LRML: if(is(maintenance.type, or(normal, basic))), then(obligation(and(include(maintenance.task, and(manufacturersRecommendation, washDownSurface, recoatInteriorProtectiveFinish, recoatExteriorProtectiveFinish, replaceJointSealant, replaceJointSeal, replaceJointGasket, replaceValve, replacewashers, replaceHighWearComponents, cleanBuildingServiceSystemFilter, replaceBuildingServiceSystemFilter, regularBoilerService, regularCoolingTowerService, regularLiftService, regularEscalatorService, regularEmergencyLightingService, regularFireProtectionEquipmentService, accessSignMaintenance, escapeRouteMaintenance, emergencyEquipmentMaintenance, hazardousAreaMaintenance)), exclude(maintenance.task, and(upgradeBuildingElementForNewTechnology, upgradeBuildingElementForIncreasedEnvironmentalUserExpectation)))))
PARAPHRASE: Basic normal maintenance tasks shall include but not be limited to: a) Where applicable, following manufacturers' maintenance recommendations, b) Washing down surfaces, particularly exterior building elements subject to wind driven salt spray, c) Re-coating interior and exterior protective finishes, d) Replacing sealant, seals and gaskets in joints, e) Replacing valves, washers and similar high wear components in easily accessed service equipment and other building elements, f) Cleaning and replacing filters in building services systems, g) The regular servicing of boilers, cooling towers, lifts, escalators, emergency lighting and fire protection equipment, and h) The maintenance of signs for access, escape routes, emergency equipment and hazardous areas. COMMENT: Maintenance does not include such things as upgrading building elements to meet the demands of new technology or the increased environmental expectations of users.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 9.0 Wall claddings; This Acceptable Solution is limited to masonry veneer cladding attached to timber wall framing outlined in NZS 3604. Masonry veneer is either: a) Clay brick, or b) Concrete brick or block.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall claddings; 9.2.2 General 1) The materials and workmanship of masonry veneer shall be in accordance with SNZ HB 4236 and have a maximum mass of veneer of 220 kg/m2 and minimum veneer thickness of 70 mm.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall claddings; Masonry veneer shall be attached to wall framing by wall ties. Wall ties and their spacings and embedment shall be in accordance with the requirements of NZS 4210 and Tables 18A, 18B and 18C. PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are masonry veneer, the wall cladding shall be connected to wall framing by wall ties. Wall ties and their spacings and embedment shall be in accordance with NZS 4210 and E2/AS1 Tables 18.a, 18.b and 18.c. Screw fixings for the wall ties shall be minimum size 12 gauge, 35 mm long hex washer face, galvanised or stainless steel.

Different cases - 9.2.1 connect is ok, here attachment is better because it can be modified.
Removed last part?
embedment?

TEXT: All slab-on-ground reinforcing shall extend to within 75 mm of the outside edge of the slab (including the foundation wall) and shall consist of a minimum 2.27kg/m2 welded Grade 500E reinforcing mesh sheets (1.14 kg/m2 in each direction), which shall be lapped at sheet joints such that the overlap measurement between the outermost cross wires of each fabric sheet is equal to the greater of one of the following: the spacing of cross wires plus 50 mm, 150 mm, or the manufacturer's requirements. Slabs shall have a maximum dimension of 18 m between free joints.
LRML: if(and(on(slab, ground),has(slab, reinforcing))), then(obligation(and(define(slab.outsideEdge, x0),within(reinforcing, 'x0 - 75 mm'),is(reinforcing, sheet),is(sheet.material, weldedReinforcingMesh),is(sheet.grade,500e),greaterThanEqual(sheets.weight,2.27 kg/m2),loop(forEach(slab.direction),greaterThanEqual(sheets.weight,1.14kg /m2)),has(sheets.joint,lap),has(sheets, crossWires),is(crossWires.location, outermost),inBetween(lap.measurement,crossWires),define(crossWires.spacing, x1), greaterThanEqual(lap.measurement, 'x1 + 50 mm'), greaterThanEqual(lap.measurement, 150 mm), greaterThanEqual(lap.measurement, manufacturerRequirement), inBetween(slab.dimension,freeJoints),equal(slab.dimension,18 m))))
PARAPHRASE: If slabs are on ground and have reinforcing, the reinforcing shall extend to within 75 mm of the outside edge of the slab and the reinforcing shall consist of sheets from welded reinforcing mesh with grade 500E and weight of minimum 2.27kg/m2 and the sheets shall have minimum 1.14 kg/m2 for each direction of the slab, and sheet joints shall be lapped such that the lap measurement is between the outermost cross wires of each fabric sheet and is greater than or equal the spacing of cross wires plus 50 mm, 150 mm, or the manufacturer's requirements. Slabs shall have a maximum dimension of 18 m between free joints.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
sheets?
max out of three values
equal to the greater of one of the following -> greater than equal all of them.

TEXT: Valley gutters and hidden gutters shall be constructed as shown in Figures 50 and 51 for the applicable roof cladding (except for membrane roofing) and: a) Not change direction in plan b) Have a minimum underlap to roof cladding as specified in Figures 27, 37, 50, and 51 for the relevant roof cladding c) Be formed from any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.3 except 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 d) Be fixed at upper ends only, and be secured with a purpose-made clip system for the remaining length to enable expansion/ contraction along the length of the gutter e) Discharge into an internal gutter or eaves gutter/spouting.
LRML: if(and(is(gutter.type, or(valley, hidden)),not(is(roof.type, membrane)))), then(obligation(and(asPer(gutter.construction,and(nzbc_e2as1_f50,nzbc_e2as1_f51)),not(is(gutter.changeInDirection,inPlan)),towards(gutter.underlap, cladding),asPer(gutter.underlap,and(nzbc_e2as1_f27,nzbc_e2as1_f37,nzbc_e2as1_f50,nzbc_e2as1_f51)),asPer(gutter.material,'nzbc_e2as1_4.3'),not(asPer(gutter.material,or('nzbc_e2as1_4.3.10','nzbc_e2as1_4.3.11'))),has(gutter.upperEnd, fixing),is(fixing.type, clipSystem),is(clipSystem, purposeMade),for(clipSystem,and(contractionAllowance, expansionAllowance)),into(gutter.discharge, or(internalGutter,eaveGutter)))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutter type is valley or hidden and the roof type is not membrane, then the gutter shall be constructed as shown in Figures 50 and 51, and the gutter shall not change direction in plan, the gutter shall have a minimum underlap to roof cladding as specified in Figures 27, 37, 50, and 51, and the gutter material shall be as outlined in E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.3 and not in 4.3.10 and 4.3.11, and the gutter shall be fixed at upper ends, and be secured with a purpose-made clip system to enable expansion/ contraction, and the gutter shall discharge into an internal gutter or eave gutter.

TEXT: In addition f) Have minimum slopes to Table 8 for valley gutters h) Spreaders not discharge directly into a valley gutter.

PARAPHRASE: If the gutter type is valley, the gutter shall have minimum slopes to E2/AS1 Table 8 and spreaders shall not discharge directly into the gutter.

TEXT: 10.3 Measuring moisture content 10.3.1 Timber; Measurement shall be by the recommended procedure in the Scion (New Zealand Forest Research Institute) publication 'Measurement of moisture content of Wood' using electrical resistance type moisture meters with insulated probes. Representative samplings of measurements shall be taken: a) With meters calibrated to AS/NZS 1080.1 Appendix E b) By inserting probes to at least 1/3 the depth of timber being measured, at a distance exceeding 200 mm from board ends c) Using correction factors for timber species, temperature, and treatment type (outlined in Scion publication above).

TEXT: b) If a gutter depth is reduced to allow entry of a valley gutter, the reduced depth must be used to calculate the capacity of the gutter.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.4 Profiles; Profiles covered in this Acceptable Solution are shown in Figure 38, and consist of: a) Corrugated – curved with a crest height of 16.5 mm minimum, b) Trapezoidal – symmetrical or asymmetrical with a minimum crest height of 19 mm, and for asymmetrical a flat or lightly profiled pan width of 210 mm maximum between crests, and c) Trough profile – with vertical ribs at a minimum height of 38 mm, and flat or lightly profiled pans of 210 mm maximum between crests.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), asPer(roofCladding.profile, nzbc_e2as1_f38),or(and(is(roofCladding.profile, and(corrugated, curved)), has(roofCladding.profile, crest), greaterThanEqual(crest.height, 16.5 mm)), and(is(roofCladding.profile, and(trapezoidal, symmetrical)), has(roofCladding.profile, crest), greaterThanEqual(crest.height, 19 mm)), and(is(roofCladding.profile, and(trapezoidal, asymmetrical)), has(roofCladding.profile, crest), greaterThanEqual(crest.height, 19 mm), has(roofCladding.profile, pan), is(pan, or(flat, lightlyProfiled)), inBetween(pan, crests), lessThanEqual(pan.width, 210 mm)), and(is(roofCladding.profile, trough), has(roofCladding.profile, rib), is(rib.orientation, vertical),greaterThanEqual(rib.height, 38 mm), has(roofCladding.profile, pan), is(pan, or(flat, lightlyProfiled)), inBetween(pan, crests), lessThanEqual(pan.width, 210 mm))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, roofCladding))
PARAPHRASE: If Profiled Metal Roof Cladding have profiles as shown in Figure 38, and the roof cladding profile is either corrugated and curved with a crest height of 16.5 mm minimum, or the roof cladding profile is trapezoidal and symmetrical with a minimum crest height of 19 mm or the roof cladding profile is trapezoidal and asymmetrical with a minimum crest height of 19 mm and have a flat or lightly profiled pan width of 210 mm maximum between crests, or the roof cladding profile is trough with vertically oriented ribs at a minimum height of 38 mm, and flat or lightly profiled pans of 210 mm maximum between crests, then E2/AS1 applies to the roof cladding.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Fixings shall: a) Be fixed through crests, b) Penetrate purlins by a minimum of 40 mm for nail fixings and 30 mm for screw fixings, c) Include sealing washers of: i) neoprene (having a carbon black content of 15% or less by weight).
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), has(cladding, fixing), has(cladding.profile, crest))), then(and(obligation(into(fixing, crest)), obligation(into(fixing.penetration, purlin)), or(and(obligation(is(fixing, nail)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(fixing.penetration, 40 mm))), and(obligation(is(fixing, screw)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(fixing.penetration, 30 mm)))), obligation(include(fixing, sealingWasher)), obligation(is(sealingWasher.type, neoprene)), obligation(lessThanEqual(sealingWasher.carbonBlackContent, 15 percent))))
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.0 Roof Claddings 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles 8.3.10 Roof penetrations; Pipe penetrations shall be flashed using EPDM flashings similar to that shown for masonry tiles, Figure 29.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.application, roof), is(cladding.system, metalTile), is(metalTile, pressed), has(metalTile, pipePenetration))), then(obligation(and(has(penetration, flashing), is(flashing.material, epdm), asPer(flashing, 'nzbc_e2as1_f29'))))
PARAPHRASE: For roof penetrations involving pressed metal tiles, pipe penetrations shall be flashed using EPDM flashings similar to those shown for masonry tiles in Figure 29.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.5 Roof pitch; For roofs up to 18 metres in length without end laps, pitches shall be: a) Corrugated – not less than 8° (1:7). b) Trapezoidal – not less than: i) 4° (1:14) where the crest height is less than 27 mm, or ii) 3° (1:20) where the crest height is 27 mm or higher. c) Trough profile – not less than 3° (1:20).
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), lessThanEqual(roof.length, 18 m), not(include(roof.length, endLap)))), then(or(and(obligation(is(roofCladding, corrugated)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch, 8 deg))), and(obligation(is(roofCladding, trapezoidal)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch, 4 deg)), obligation(has(roofCladding, crest)), obligation(lessThan(crest.height, 27 mm))), and(obligation(is(roofCladding, trapezoidal)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch, 3 deg)), obligation(has(roofCladding, crest)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(crest.height, 27 mm))), and(obligation(is(roofCladding.profile, trough)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch, 3 deg)))))
PARAPHRASE:
If roofs are up to 18 metres in length and the roof length does not include end laps, either roof claddings shall be corrugated and roof pitches shall be not less than 8 deg. Or, roof claddings shall be trapezoidal and roof pitches shall be not less than 4 deg and the roof cladding's crest height is less than 27 mm. Or, roof claddings shall be trapezoidal and roof pitches shall be not less than 3 deg and the roof cladding's crest height is 27 mm or higher. Or, roof claddings profile shall be trough and roof pitches shall be not less than 3 deg.
b) Trapezoidal – not less than: i) 4° (1:14) where the crest height is less than 27 mm, or ii) 3° (1:20) where the crest height is 27 mm or higher. c) Trough profile – not less than 3° (1:20).
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Steel 8.4.6 Structure; The maximum span and fixing patterns of profiled metal roof cladding between purlins to comply with this Acceptable Solution are given in Table 11, Table 12 or Table 13, 14 and 15.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding.material, steel))), then(obligation(and(inBetween(roofCladding.span, purlins), inBetween(roofCladding.fixingPattern, purlins), asPer(max(roofCladding.span),and(nzbc_e2as1_t11,nzbc_e2as1_t12,nzbc_e2as1_t13,nzbc_e2as1_t14,nzbc_e2as1_t15)),asPer(roofCladding.fixingPattern,and(nzbc_e2as1_t11,nzbc_e2as1_t12,nzbc_e2as1_t13,nzbc_e2as1_t14,nzbc_e2as1_t15)))))
PARAPHRASE: If profiled metal roof cladding are from steel, then the maximum span and fixing patterns between purlins are given in E2/AS1 Table 11, 12, 13, 14 and 15.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Fixings shall: a) Be fixed through crests, b) Penetrate purlins by a minimum of 40 mm for nail fixings and 30 mm for screw fixings, c) Include sealing washers of: i) neoprene (having a carbon black content of 15% or less by weight).
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), has(roofCladding, fixing))), then(obligation(and(has(roofCladding,crest),through(fixing,crest),into(fixing.penetration, purlin),or(and(is(fixing.type, nail),greaterThanEqual(fixing.penetration,40 mm)),and(is(fixing.type, screw),greaterThanEqual(fixing.penetration,30 mm))),include(fixing,sealingWasher),is(sealingWasher.type,neoprene),lessThanEqual(sealingWasher.carbonBlackContent,15 percent))))
PARAPHRASE: If the profile of Profiled Metal Roof Cladding has a fixing, then the fixings shall be through the crests of the roof cladding, the fixings shall penetrate purlins and either the fixings is a nail and the penetration is 40 mm or the fixing is a screw and the penetration is 30 mm, and the fixing shall include sealing washers of  neoprene and the sealing washer shall have a carbon black content of 15% or less.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Clip fixings for trough profiles and spans as shown in Table 13 shall be as shown in Figure 40, and shall: a) Have a minimum BMT of 0.9 mm b) Be a minimum width of 30 mm c) Be made from a material compatible with the cladding, refer to Tables 20 and 21 d) Have clips fastened with a minimum of two 10-gauge by 30 mm waferhead hot-dipped galvanised screws which comply with Class 3 of AS 3566: Part 2.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), has(roofCladding, fixing), is(fixing.type, clip),is(roofCladding.profile, trough), asPer(roofCladding.span, nzbc_e2as1_t20))), then(obligation(and(asPer(fixing, nzbc_e2as1_f40),greaterThanEqual(fixing.baseMetalThickness, 0.9 mm),greaterThanEqual(fixing.width,30 mm),has(fixing.material, compatibility),towards(compatibility, roofCladding),complyWith(fixing.material, and(nzbc_e2as1_t20,nzbc_e2as1_t21)),has(fixing, clip),is(clip.fastener, screw),greaterThanEqual(count(screw),2),is(screw.size,10 gauge),is(screw.length,30 mm),is(screw.type,and(waferhead,galvanised)),is(galvanised.form,hotDipped),complyWith(screw,as_3566_2_class_3))))
PARAPHRASE: If the Profiled Metal Roof Cladding has clip fixings and the roof cladding profile is trough and the roof cladding span is as shown in E2/AS1 Table 13, then the fixing shall be as shown in Figure 40, and the fixing shall have a minimum base metal thickness of 0.9 mm, and the fixing shall be a minimum width of 30 mm, and the fixing shall be a material compatible with the roof cladding, for the fixing material refer to Tables 20 and 21, and the fixing shall have clips fastened with a minimum of two screws, the screws are 10-gauge size and 30 mm length waferhead hot-dipped galvanised and the screws comply with Class 3 of AS 3566: Part 2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Closed-in construction spaces under membrane roofs and decks require adequate ventilation to prevent the accumulation of moisture under the membrane.
LRML: if(and(is(space.construction, closedIn),below(space, or(roof, deck)), is(roof.type, membrane),is(deck.type, membrane))), then(obligation(prevent(space.ventilation, moistureAccumulation)))
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Plywood substrates shall be fixed according to the following requirements: a) Panels shall be laid with staggered joints (brick bond), b) Panels shall be laid with the face grain at right angles to the main supports, c) Supports in b) shall be at 400 mm maximum centres, d) The edge of sheets shall be supported with dwangs or framing.
LRML: if(is(substrate.material, plywood)), then(obligation(and(has(substrate, pannel),is(pannel.arrangement,or(staggeredJoint,brickBond)),has(pannel.faceGrain,angle),towards(angle,support),is(support.type,main),lessThanEqual(support.location, 400 mmCentres),has(pannel.edge,or(dwang,framing)))))
PARAPHRASE: If substrates are from plywood, then the substrate shall substrate panels shall be arranged with staggered joints or brick bond, Panels shall be laid with the face grain at right angles to the main supports, and the supports shall be maximum located at 400 mm centres, and the edge of sheets shall have dwangs or framing.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.5.6 Roof and deck drainage; Membrane roofs shall be constructed to provide: a) Falls as shown in Figure 56 and details in Figures 57–64.
LRML: if(is(roof.type, membrane)), then(obligation(and(asPer(roof.fall,nzbc_e2as1_f56),asPer(roof, 'nzbc_e2as1_f57 to nzbc_e2as1_f64'))))

TEXT: Membrane roof; All control joints in the substrate shall be accommodated in the membrane roof design.
LRML: if(and(is(roof.type, membrane), above(membrane, substrate), has(substrate, controlJoint))), then(obligation(include(roof.design, controlJoint)))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof is a membrane roof and the membrane is above the substrate and the control joints is in the substrate, then the roof design shall include the control joint.

TEXT: The design of control joints for membrane roofing is subject to specific design and is outside the scope of this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(and(is(roof.type, membrane), for(controlJoint, roof))), then(and(obligation(has(controlJoint, specificDesign)), not(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, controlJoint))))
PARAPHRASE: If the control joint is for a membrane roof, the control joint shall have specific design and E2/AS1 does not apply to the control joint.

TEXT: The design of control joints for membrane roofing is subject to specific design and is outside the scope of this Acceptable Solution.

PARAPHRASE: If the control joint is for a membrane roof, the control joint shall have specific design and E2/AS1 does not apply to the control joint.

TEXT: 8.5.9 Penetrations; Penetrations through membrane roofs and decks shall be as shown in Figure 59 and Figure 60.
LRML: if(and(for(membrane, or(roof, deck)), has(membrane, penetration))), then(obligation(asPer(penetration,and(nzbc_e2as1_f59,nzbc_e2as1_f60))))

LRML: if(and(for(membrane, or(roof, deck)), has(membrane, post), for(post, handrail),for(fixing, post))), then(not(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, fixing)))

TEXT: 9.1 General; Wall claddings shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2.3.2 to E2.3.7, and comply with the provisions of Paragraph 9.1.1 to Paragraph 9.9.
LRML: if(exist(wallCladding)), then(and(obligation(complyWith(wallCladding, and('nzbc_e2_3.2 to nzbc_e2_3.7', 'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.1 to nzbc_e2as1_9.9'))), obligation(equal(rule.key, and(9.1, 9.2, 9.3, 9.4, 9.5, 9.6, 9.7, 9.8, 9.9)))))
PARAPHRASE: Wall claddings shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2.3.2 to E2.3.7, and comply with the provisions of Paragraph 9.1.1 to Paragraph 9.9.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; Claddings in Extra High wind zones require: a) Rigid underlays to Paragraph 9.1.7.2 b) Drained cavities to Paragraph 9.1.8 c) Hooks and hems on flashing upstands.
LRML: if(and(within(wallCladding, windZone), is(windZone, extraHigh))), then(obligation(and(has(wallCladding, underlay),is(underlay, rigid),complyWith(underlay,'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.7.2'),has(wallCladding,drainedCavity),complyWith(drainedCavity,'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.8'),has(wallCladding, flashing),has(flashing.upstand,and(hook,hem)))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are in Extra High wind zones, the wall claddings shall have rigid underlays to Paragraph 9.1.7.2 and the wall claddings shall have drained cavities to Paragraph 9.1.8 and the wall cladding flashing upstands shall have hooks and hems.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; Clearances to roof claddings and decks shall be minimum 35 mm – refer to Table 7 and Figure 18.

Clearances to roof claddings and decks shall be minimum 35 mm – refer to Table 7 and Figure 18.

PARAPHRASE:

TEXT: 7.1.2 Enclosed decks; This Acceptable Solution is limited to enclosed decks with a maximum area of 40 m2. For enclosed decks, the vertical separation between the opening threshold level and the upper surface of the finished deck surface shall be a minimum of 100 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(deck, enclosed), lessThanEqual(deck.area, 40 m2), is(deck.surface, finished), define(deck.upperSurfaceLevel, x0), define(deck.thresholdLevel, x1))), then(and(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, deck), obligation(and(define(deck.thresholdLevel, x0),is(deck.surface, finished), define(deck.upperSurfaceLevel, x1), inBetween(separation, and(x0, x1)),greaterThanEqual(separation, 100 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If enclosed decks have a maximum area of 40 m2, E2/AS1 applies to the deck. The separation between the threshold level and the deck's upper surface level shall be a minimum of 100 mm.

For correct apply to, we'd need to split into two rules?

split further?

TEXT: Maintenance of claddings shall be carried out as necessary to achieve the expected durability of the materials - refer to Paragraph 2.5.
LRML: if(and(has(cladding.material, durability),asPer(durability, 'nzbc_e2as1_2.5'))), then(obligation(requires(cladding, maintenance)))
PARAPHRASE: If cladding materials have a durability as shown in Paragraph 2.5, then the cladding requires maintenance.

TEXT: Maintenance of claddings shall be carried out as necessary to achieve the expected durability of the materials - refer to Paragraph 2.5.

TEXT: Drainage of roof water; Spreaders shall: k) Be to any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.1 except 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 l) Be to Figure 20 and not be used on masonry tile roofs unless a roof underlay is installed m) Discharge directed away from roofing laps and clear of roof penetrations.
LRML: if(include(roof.drainage, spreader)), then(and(obligation(and(asPer(spreader.material, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.1'),not(asPer(spreader.material, or('nzbc_e2as1_4.3.9', 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.10', 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.11'))))),obligation(and(asPer(spreader, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.1'),or(not(is(roof.type, masonryTile)),and(is(roof.type, masonryTile),has(roof, underlay)))) ),obligation(and(has(roof, and(lap, penetration)),awayFrom(spreader.discharge, lap),not(has(spreader.discharge, penetration))))))
