TEXT: 8.1.6.1 Internal gutters; Internal gutters shall: a) Be formed with continuous butyl or EPDM strip complying with Paragraph 4.3.9, with no cross-joints in the gutter, or aluminium, copper, stainless steel, or zinc sheet to Paragraph 4.3, with joints that are welded.
LRML: if(is(gutter.type, internal)), then(obligation(or(and(not(has(gutter, crossJoint)),is(gutter.material, or(butyl, epdm)),complyWith(gutter.material, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.9'),not(has(gutter, crossJoint))),and(has(gutter,joint),is(joint,welded),is(gutter.material,or(aluminium,copper,stainlessSteel,zinc))))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are internal, the gutter material shall be butyl or EPDM complying with Paragraph 4.3.9, with no cross-joints in the gutter, or aluminium, copper, stainless steel, or zinc sheet to Paragraph 4.3, with joints that are welded.

TEXT: 8.1.6.1 Internal gutters; Internal gutters shall: d) Be constructed to at least the minimum dimensions shown in Figure 52, or the capacity calculated to E1/AS1 plus an additional freeboard depth of 20 mm minimum.
LRML: if(is(gutter.type, internal)), then(obligation(or(asPer(gutter.dimension, nzbc_e2as1_f52),and(define(gutter.capacity, x0),asPer(x0.calculation, nzbc_e1as1),define(freeboard.depth,x1),greaterThanEqual(x1, 20 mm),equal(gutter.capacity,'x0 + x1')))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are internal, the gutter be at least the minimum dimensions shown in Figure 52, or the gutter capacity calculated to E1/AS1 plus an additional freeboard depth of 20 mm minimum.

TEXT: 8.1.6.1 Internal gutters; Internal gutters shall: For roofs other than membrane roofs: e) Discharge into a rainwater head as shown in Figure 63 (a) and (b).
LRML: if(and(is(gutter.type, internal), not(is(roof.type, membrane)))), then(obligation(and(into(gutter.discharge, rainwaterHead),asPer(gutter.discharge, and('nzbc_e2as1_f63.a', 'nzbc_e2as1_f63.b')))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are internal and roof type is not membrane roofs, the gutter shall discharge into a rainwater head, and the gutter discharge shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 63.a and Figure 63.b.

TEXT: The roofing shall be flashed at all boundaries to comply with the following: a) At edges discharging to gutters with eaves flashings where required in Figure 45(a) b) Soft edge to cover flashings complying with Paragraph 4.6. Refer to Figure 41 for example of use and Tables 21 and 22.c) Notched turn-downs to cover flashings shall comply with Paragraph 4.6. Refer to Figure 42 for example of use. d) Materials for flashings shall be compatible with the roof cladding material as per Table 21 and Table 22, and shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.3. e) Provide expansion joints in accordance with Paragraph 4.5.2.

TEXT: The roofing shall be flashed at all boundaries to comply with the following: a) At edges discharging to gutters with eaves flashings where required in Figure 45(a) b) Soft edge to cover flashings complying with Paragraph 4.6. Refer to Figure 41 for example of use and Tables 21 and 22.c) Notched turn-downs to cover flashings shall comply with Paragraph 4.6. Refer to Figure 42 for example of use. d) Materials for flashings shall be compatible with the roof cladding material as per Table 21 and Table 22, and shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.3. e) Provide expansion joints in accordance with Paragraph 4.5.2.
LRML: if(exist(roof)), then(and(obligation(has(roof.boundary, flashing)),obligation(and(has(roof.edge, discharge),towards(discharge, gutter),has(roof.edge, flashing),is(flashing.type, eave),asPer(flashing, 'nzbc_e2as1_f45.a'))),obligation(and(is(flashing.cover, softEdge),has(roof,softEdgeflashing),complyWith(softEdge, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.6'))),obligation(and(is(flashing.cover, notchedTurnDown),complyWith(notchedTurnDown,'nzbc_e2as1_4.6'),complyWith(flashing.material,and(nzbc_e2as1_t21,nzbc_e2as1_t22,'nzbc_e2as1_4.3')),has(flashing,expansionJoint),complyWith(expansionJoint,'nzbc_e2as1_4.5.2')))))

Notched turn-downs to cover flashings shall comply with E2/AS1  Paragraph 4.6. d) Materials for flashings shall be compatible with the roof cladding material as per E2/AS1 Table 21 and Table 22, and shall be in accordance with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.3. e) Provide expansion joints in accordance with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.5.2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The roofing shall be flashed at all boundaries to comply with the following: a) At edges discharging to gutters with eaves flashings where required in Figure 45(a) b) Soft edge to cover flashings complying with Paragraph 4.6. Refer to Figure 42 for example of use. d) Materials for flashings shall be compatible with the roof cladding material as per Table 21 and Table 22, and shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.3. e) Provide expansion joints in accordance with Paragraph 4.5.2.
LRML: if(exist(roof)), then(and(obligation(has(roof.boundary, flashing)),obligation(and(has(roof.edge, discharge),towards(discharge, gutter),has(roof.edge, flashing),is(flashing.type, eave),asPer(flashing, 'nzbc_e2as1_f45.a'))),obligation(and(is(flashing.cover, softEdge),has(roof,softEdgeflashing),complyWith(softEdge, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.6'))),obligation(and(is(flashing.cover, notchedTurnDown),complyWith(notchedTurnDown,'nzbc_e2as1_4.6'),)),obligation(and(define(flashing.material, x0),has(roof, roofCladding),define(roofCladding.material, x1),inBetween(compatibility, and(x0, x1)),asPer(compatibility, and(nzbc_e2as1_t21,nzbc_e2as1_t22,'nzbc_e2as1_4.3')))),obligation(and(has(flashing,expansionJoint),asPer(expansionJoint,'nzbc_e2as1_4.5.2')))))
PARAPHRASE: If a roof exists, the roof boundaries shall have flashings and a) At edges discharging to gutters with eaves flashings where required in E2/AS1 Figure 45.a. The flashing shall have soft edge as cover, and the soft edge shall comply with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.6. The flashing shall have notched turn-downs as cover, and the notched turn-downs shall comply with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.6. Materials for flashings shall be compatible with the roof cladding material as per E2/AS1 Table 21 and Table 22 and Paragraph 4.3. The flashing shall have expansion joints in accordance with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.5.2.

TEXT: 8.4.11.1 Fixing flashings a) When fixing flashings to the structure, use screws as for roofing (see Paragraph 8.4.8).
LRML: if(towards(flashing.fixing, roof)), then(obligation(and(is(fixing.type, screw),for(screw, roof))))
PARAPHRASE: If fixing flashings to the roof, use screws as as for roofing.

TEXT: 8.4.11.1 Fixing flashings a) When fixing flashings to the structure, use screws as for roofing (see Paragraph 8.4.8).

TEXT: Where end-laps are required in flashings, form these as shown in Figure 6 and, before joining the two parts, apply an 8 mm diameter bead of neutral cure sealant complying with: i) Type F, Class 20LM or 25LM of ISO 11600, or ii) low modulus Type II Class A of Federal Specification TT-S-00230C.

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Membrane roofs shall be constructed to provide: a) Falls as shown in Figure 56 and details in Figures 57–64.
LRML: if(is(roof.type, membrane)), then(obligation(and(asPer(roof.fall, nzbc_e2as1_f56),asPer(roof, 'nzbc_e2as1_f57 to nzbc_e2as1_f64'))))
PARAPHRASE: If roofs are membrane roofs, the roof fall shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 56 and roofs as in E2/AS1 Figures 57 to Figure 64.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The design of control joints for membrane roofing is subject to specific design and is outside the scope of this Acceptable Solution.

TEXT: The design of control joints for membrane roofing is subject to specific design and is outside the scope of this Acceptable Solution.

TEXT: 8.5.4 Butyl and EPDM 8.5.9 Penetrations; Penetrations through membrane roofs and decks shall be as shown in Figure 59 and Figure 60.

TEXT: 9.1 General; Wall claddings shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2.3.2 to E2.3.7, and comply with the provisions of Paragraph 9.1.1 to Paragraph 9.9.
LRML: if(is(cladding.application, wall)), then(and(obligation(complyWith(cladding, and('nzbc_e2_3.2', 'nzbc_e2_3.3', 'nzbc_e2_3.4', 'nzbc_e2_3.5', 'nzbc_e2_3.6', 'nzbc_e2_3.7', rule))), obligation(equal(rule.key, and(9.1, 9.2, 9.3, 9.4, 9.5, 9.6, 9.7, 9.8, 9.9)))))

TEXT: 9.1 General; Wall claddings shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2.3.2 to E2.3.7, and comply with the provisions of Paragraph 9.1.1 to Paragraph 9.9.
LRML: if(exist(wallCladding)), then(and(obligation(complyWith(wallCladding, and('nzbc_e2_3.2 to nzbc_e2_3.7', 'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.1 to nzbc_e2as1_9.9'))), obligation(equal(rule.key, and(9.1, 9.2, 9.3, 9.4, 9.5, 9.6, 9.7, 9.8, 9.9)))))

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; Claddings in Extra High wind zones require: a) Rigid underlays to Paragraph 9.1.7.2 b) Drained cavities to Paragraph 9.1.8 c) Hooks and hems on flashing upstands.
LRML: if(and(within(wallCladding, windZone), is(windZone, extraHigh))), then(obligation(and(has(wallCladding, underlay),is(underlay, rigid),complyWith(underlay,'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.7.2'),has(wallCladding,drainedCavity),complyWith(drainedCavity,'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.8'),has(wallCladding, flashing),has(flashing.upstand,and(hook,hem)))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are in Extra High wind zones, the wall claddings shall have rigid underlays to Paragraph 9.1.7.2 and the wall claddings shall have drained cavities to Paragraph 9.1.8 and the wall cladding flashing upstands shall have hooks and hems.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; Separations, clearances to ground level, and overlaps shall be as shown in Figure 65 and Table 18.
LRML: if(exist(wallCladding)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(wallCladding.separation,and(nzbc_e2as1_f65,nzbc_e2as1_t18)),towards(wallCladding.clearance, groundLevel), complyWith(wallCladding.clearance,and(nzbc_e2as1_f65,nzbc_e2as1_t18)),complyWith(wallCladding.lap,and(nzbc_e2as1_f65,nzbc_e2as1_t18)))))

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; Clearances to roof claddings and decks shall be minimum 35 mm – refer to Table 7 and Figure 18.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; Clearances to roof claddings and decks shall be minimum 35 mm – refer to Table 7 and Figure 18.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; Clearances to roof claddings and decks shall be minimum 35 mm – refer to Table 7 and Figure 18.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; 9.1.3 Bottom of cladding; Clearances shall be measured to: a) The finished plane of any adjacent horizontal surface.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; 9.1.3 Bottom of cladding; Clearances shall be measured to: a) The finished plane of any adjacent horizontal surface.

TEXT: 8.1.5 Roof underlays; Roof underlays shall be to Table 23 and NZS 2295, and be either: R1 heavy weight kraft, or R2 self supporting kraft.

TEXT: 8.1.5 Roof underlays; Roof underlays shall be to Table 23 and NZS 2295, and be either: R1 heavy weight kraft, or R2 self supporting kraft.

TEXT: 8.1.5 Roof underlays; Underlays shall be: • Layed with minimum numbers of laps • Lapped at all side and end laps by minimum 150 mm • Run horizontally for roof pitches below 10° • Run horizontally or vertically for roof pitches above 10° • Have anti-ponding boards at lower edges of masonry tiles, refer Figure 25(b) and Paragraph 8.2.5.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(and(obligation(is(count(underlay.lap), minimum)), obligation(loop(forEach(underlay.side), and(has(underlay.side, lap),greaterThanEqual(lap.end, 150 mm)))), obligation(greaterThanEqual(overlap.width, 150 mm)), or(obligation(and(is(underlay.orientation,horizontal),lessThan(roof.pitch, 10 deg))), obligation(and(is(underlay.orientation,or(horizontal,vertical)),greaterThan(roof.pitch, 10 deg)))), obligation(is(roof.claddingSystem, masonryTile)), obligation(has(masonryTile.lowerEdge, antiPondingBoard))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has underlays, then the underlay shall have a minimum cound of laps. The underlay shall have laps at each side and end laps by minimum 150 mm. The underlay shall be either horizontally and roof pitches below 10° or the underlay shall be horizontally or vertically for roof pitches above 10° • Have anti-ponding boards at lower edges of masonry tiles, refer Figure 25(b) and Paragraph 8.2.5.

TEXT: 8.1.5 Roof underlays; Underlays shall be: • Layed with minimum numbers of laps • Lapped at all side and end laps by minimum 150 mm • Run horizontally for roof pitches below 10° • Run horizontally or vertically for roof pitches above 10° • Have anti-ponding boards at lower edges of masonry tiles, refer Figure 25(b) and Paragraph 8.2.5.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(and(obligation(is(count(underlay.lap), minimum)), obligation(and(has(underlay, lap),is(lap, or(end, side)),greaterThanEqual(lap.size, 150 mm))), or(obligation(and(is(underlay.orientation, horizontal),lessThan(roof.pitch, 10 deg))), obligation(and(is(underlay.orientation, or(horizontal, vertical)),greaterThan(roof.pitch, 10 deg)))), obligation(is(roof.claddingSystem, masonryTile)), obligation(has(masonryTile.lowerEdge, antiPondingBoard))))

The underlay shall be either horizontally and roof pitches below 10° or the underlay shall be horizontally or vertically for roof pitches above 10° • Have anti-ponding boards at lower edges of masonry tiles, refer Figure 25(b) and Paragraph 8.2.5.

TEXT: 8.1.5 Roof underlays; Underlays shall be: • Layed with minimum numbers of laps • Lapped at all side and end laps by minimum 150 mm • Run horizontally for roof pitches below 10° • Run horizontally or vertically for roof pitches above 10° • Have anti-ponding boards at lower edges of masonry tiles, refer Figure 25(b) and Paragraph 8.2.5.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(and(obligation(is(count(underlay.lap), minimum)), obligation(and(has(underlay, lap),is(lap, or(end, side)),greaterThanEqual(lap.size, 150 mm))), or(obligation(and(is(underlay.orientation, horizontal),lessThan(roof.pitch, 10 deg))), obligation(and(is(underlay.orientation, or(horizontal, vertical)),greaterThan(roof.pitch, 10 deg)))), obligation(is(roof.claddingSystem, masonryTile)), obligation(has(masonryTile.lowerEdge, antiPondingBoard))))

The underlay shall be either horizontally and roof pitches below 10° or the underlay shall be horizontally or vertically for roof pitches above 10° • Have anti-ponding boards at lower edges of masonry tiles, refer Figure 25(b) and Paragraph 8.2.5.

TEXT: Valley gutters and hidden gutters shall be constructed as shown in Figures 50 and 51 for the applicable roof cladding (except for membrane roofing) and: a) Not change direction in plan b) Have a minimum underlap to roof cladding as specified in Figures 27, 37, 50, and 51 for the relevant roof cladding c) Be formed from any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.3 except 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 d) Be fixed at upper ends only, and be secured with a purpose-made clip system for the remaining length to enable expansion/ contraction along the length of the gutter e) Discharge into an internal gutter or eaves gutter/spouting.
LRML: if(and(is(gutter.type, or(valley, hidden)),not(is(roof.type, membrane)))), then(obligation(and(asPer(gutter.construction,and(nzbc_e2as1_f50,nzbc_e2as1_f51)),not(is(gutter.changeInDirection,inPlan)),towards(gutter.underlap, cladding),asPer(gutter.underlap,and(nzbc_e2as1_f27,nzbc_e2as1_f37,nzbc_e2as1_f50,nzbc_e2as1_f51)),complyWith(gutter.material,'nzbc_e2as1_4.3'),not(complyWith(gutter.material,or('nzbc_e2as1_4.3.10','nzbc_e2as1_4.3.11'))),is(gutter.upperEnd,fixed),is(gutter,secured),by(secured,clipSystem),is(clipSystem,purposeMade),by(secured,clipSystem),include(clipSystem.allowance,and(contraction,expansion)),into(gutter.discharge,or(internalGutter,eaveGutter)))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutter type is valley or hidden and the roof type is not membrane, then the gutter shall be constructed as shown in Figures 50 and 51, and the gutter shall not change direction in plan, the gutter shall have a minimum underlap to roof cladding as specified in Figures 27, 37, 50, and 51 for the relevant roof cladding c) Be formed from any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.3 except 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 d) Be fixed at upper ends only, and be secured with a purpose-made clip system for the remaining length to enable expansion/ contraction along the length of the gutter e) Discharge into an internal gutter or eaves gutter/spouting.

TEXT: Valley gutters and hidden gutters shall be constructed as shown in Figures 50 and 51 for the applicable roof cladding (except for membrane roofing) and: a) Not change direction in plan b) Have a minimum underlap to roof cladding as specified in Figures 27, 37, 50, and 51 for the relevant roof cladding c) Be formed from any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.3 except 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 d) Be fixed at upper ends only, and be secured with a purpose-made clip system for the remaining length to enable expansion/ contraction along the length of the gutter e) Discharge into an internal gutter or eaves gutter/spouting.
LRML: if(and(is(gutter.type, or(valley, hidden)),not(is(roof.type, membrane)))), then(obligation(and(asPer(gutter.construction,and(nzbc_e2as1_f50,nzbc_e2as1_f51)),not(is(gutter.changeInDirection,inPlan)),towards(gutter.underlap, cladding),asPer(gutter.underlap,and(nzbc_e2as1_f27,nzbc_e2as1_f37,nzbc_e2as1_f50,nzbc_e2as1_f51)),asPer(gutter.material,'nzbc_e2as1_4.3'),not(asPer(gutter.material,or('nzbc_e2as1_4.3.10','nzbc_e2as1_4.3.11'))),has(gutter.upperEnd, fixing),is(fixing.type, clipSystem),is(clipSystem, purposeMade),has(clipSystem,and(contractionAllowance, expansionAllowance)),into(gutter.discharge, or(internalGutter,eaveGutter)))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutter type is valley or hidden and the roof type is not membrane, then the gutter shall be constructed as shown in Figures 50 and 51, and the gutter shall not change direction in plan, the gutter shall have a minimum underlap to roof cladding as specified in Figures 27, 37, 50, and 51, and the gutter material shall be as outlined in E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.3 and not in 4.3.10 and 4.3.11, and the gutter shall be fixed at upper ends, and be secured with a purpose-made clip system for the remaining length to enable expansion/ contraction, and the gutter shall discharge into an internal gutter or eaves gutter.

TEXT: In addition: f) Have minimum slopes of 8° for hidden gutters g) Hidden gutters receive no discharge from downpipes or spreaders.
LRML: if(is(gutter.type, hidden)), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(gutter.slope, 8 deg)), prohibition(and(into(downpipe.discharge, gutter),into(spreader.discharge, gutter))))
PARAPHRASE: If the gutter type is hidden, the gutter shall have minimum slopes of 8 deg and the gutter shall not receive discharge from downpipes or spreaders.

TEXT: In addition f) Have minimum slopes to Table 8 for valley gutters h) Spreaders not discharge directly into a valley gutter.
LRML: if(is(gutter.type, valley)), then(and(obligation(asPer(gutter.slope, table)), prohibition(and(is(spreader.discharge, direct),into(spreader.discharge, gutter)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the gutter type is valley, the gutter shall have minimum slopes to E2/AS1 Table 8 and spreaders shall not discharge directly into the gutter.

TEXT: 8.1.7 Roof penetrations; Roof penetrations shall be made weathertight in accordance with Paragraph 8.2 to Paragraph 8.5.
LRML: if(is(penetration.application, roof)), then(obligation(and(is(penetration,weathertight),complyWith(penetration,and('nzbc_e2as1_8.2 to nzbc_e2as1_8.5')))))
PARAPHRASE: Roof penetrations shall be made weathertight in accordance with Paragraph 8.2 to Paragraph 8.5.

TEXT: The edge of roofing penetrations over 200 mm wide shall be supported in either direction with additional framing as shown in Figure 21.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, penetration), greaterThan(penetration.width, 200 mm), has(penetration, edge))), then(obligation(is(edge.support, framing)))
PARAPHRASE: The edge of roofing penetrations over 200 mm wide shall be supported in either direction with additional framing as shown in Figure 21.

TEXT: The edge of roofing penetrations over 200 mm wide shall be supported in either direction with additional framing as shown in Figure 21.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, penetration), greaterThan(penetration.width, 200 mm))), then(obligation(and(has(penetration, edge),loop(forEach(edge.direction),is(edge.support, framing)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has penetrations over 200 mm wide, then the edge of the penetration shall be supported in either direction with additional framing as shown in Figure 21.

TEXT: The edge of roofing penetrations over 200 mm wide shall be supported in either direction with additional framing as shown in Figure 21.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, penetration), greaterThan(penetration.width, 200 mm))), then(obligation(and(has(penetration, edge),loop(forEach(edge.direction),is(edge.support, framing)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has penetrations over 200 mm wide, then the edge of the penetration shall be supported in either direction with additional framing as shown in Figure 21.

TEXT: Closed-in construction spaces under membrane roofs and decks require adequate ventilation to prevent the accumulation of moisture under the membrane.
LRML: if(and(is(space.type, closedInConstruction), below(space, or(roof, deck)), is(roof.type, membrane),is(deck.type, membrane))), then(obligation(prevent(space.ventilation, moistureAccumulation)))
PARAPHRASE: If closed-in construction spaces are under membrane roofs and decks, the space shall have ventilation to prevent the accumulation of moisture.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Membranes installed over plywood substrates; Plywood shall be: a) A minimum of 17 mm complying with AS/NZS 2269, b) At least CD Grade Structural plywood with the sanded C face upwards, and c) H3 with treatment type compatible with membrane and adhesives used.

PARAPHRASE: If membranes are over plywood substrates, then the plywood shall be a minimum of 17 mm thick complying with NZS 2269, b) At least CD Grade Structural plywood with the sanded C face upwards, and c) H3 with treatment type compatible with membrane and adhesives used.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Membranes installed over plywood substrates; Plywood shall be: a) A minimum of 17 mm complying with AS/NZS 2269, b) At least CD Grade Structural plywood with the sanded C face upwards, and c) H3 with treatment type compatible with membrane and adhesives used.

TEXT: Membranes over plywood substrates 8.5.5 Installation 8.5.5.1 Plywood Substrates must be dry when membranes are applied. The plywood and timber substructure must be a maximum moisture content of 20% when a membrane is adhered.

TEXT: Plywood substrates shall be fixed according to the following requirements: a) Panels shall be laid with staggered joints (brick bond), b) Panels shall be laid with the face grain at right angles to the main supports, c) Supports in b) shall be at 400 mm maximum centres, d) The edge of sheets shall be supported with dwangs or framing.
LRML: if(and(is(substrate.form, sheet), is(substrate.material, plywood))), then(and(obligation(has(sheet, joint)), obligation(is(sheet.arrangement, or(staggered, brickBond))), obligation(is(sheet.faceGrain, perpendicular)), obligation(to(perpendicular, support)), obligation(is(support.type, main)), obligation(has(support.layout, measurement)), obligation(is(measurement, centre)), obligation(lessThanEqual(support.centre, 400 mm)), obligation(has(sheet.edge, or(dwangs, framing)))))
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4.10 Allowance for expansion of corrugated and trapezoidal roof cladding; Where Table 16 requires profiled washers, allowance shall be made for expansion by: a) Fixing the top 50% (closest to the ridge) with conventional fixings, and b) Fixing the lower 50% with sealing washers fixed over profiled washers as shown in Figure 39, and: i) using oversized holes, and ii) positioning fixing in centre of hole.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding, or(corrugated, trapezoidal)),asPer(roofCladding.profiledWasher, nzbc_e2as1_t16))), then(obligation(and(by(roofCladding.expansionAllowance, fixing),equal(roofCladding.top, 50 percent),has(roofCladding.top, fixing),is(fixing.type, conventional),equal(roofCladding.bottom, 50 percent),has(roofCladding.bottom, fixing),is(fixing.type, sealingWasher),above(sealingWasher, profiledWasher),asPer(sealingWasher, nzbc_e2as1_t16),has(roofCladding, penetration),is(penetration, oversized),has(penetration, centre),is(fixing.location, centre))))
PARAPHRASE: If roof claddings are corrugated or trapezoidal and the roof claddings have profiled washers  required in E2/AS1 Table 16, then the roof cladding shall have expansion allowed by having fixings and the roof cladding's top 50 percent shall have conventional fixings, and the roof cladding's bottom 50 percent shall have sealing washer fixings over profiled washers and the sealing wahsers as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 39, and the roof cladding penetrations shall be oversized and the fixing located in the center of the penetration.
COMMENTS:
hole/penetration
separate top and bottom fixings!

TEXT: 8.4.11.1 Fixing flashings a) When fixing flashings to the structure, use screws as for roofing (see Paragraph 8.4.8).
LRML: if(towards(flashing.fixing, roof)), then(obligation(and(is(fixing.type, screw),for(screw, roof))))
PARAPHRASE: If fixing flashings to the roof, use screws as as for roofing.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4.11.1 Fixing flashings b) When fixing flashings to other flashings or to roofing use: i) for galvanized steel, 4 mm diameter monel metal or stainless steel rivets, where compatible as per Table 21, ii) for aluminium-zinc coated steel, 4 mm diameter aluminium rivets, iii) for aluminium, 4 mm diameter aluminium rivets.
LRML: if(towards(flashing.fixing, or(flashing, roof))), then(or(obligation(and(is(flashing.material,galvanisedSteel),is(roof.material,galvanisedSteel),is(fixing.type,rivet),is(fixing.material,or(monelMetal,stainlessSteel)),equal(fixing.diameter,4 mm),asPer(fixing,nzbc_e2as1_t21))), obligation(and(is(flashing.material,or(aluminiumZincCoatedSteel,aluminium)),is(roof.material,or(aluminiumZincCoatedSteel,aluminium)),is(fixing.type,rivet),is(fixing.material,aluminium),equal(fixing.diameter,4 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If fixing flashings to other flashings or to the roof, either the flashing and roof shall be galvanized steel and the fixing 4 mm diameter monel metal or stainless steel rivets as per Table 21, or  the flashing and roof shall be aluminium-zinc coated steel or aluminium, and the fixings shall be 4 mm diameter aluminium rivets.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.11.1 Fixing flashings c) Flashing joins, including expansion joints where required, shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.5.2 and as shown in Figure 6.
LRML: if(has(flashing, or(join, expansionJoint))), then(obligation(and(asPer(join, and('nzbc_e2as1_4.5.2', nzbc_e2as1_f6)),asPer(expansionJoint, and('nzbc_e2as1_4.5.2', nzbc_e2as1_f6)))))
PARAPHRASE: Flashing joins, including expansion joints where required, shall be in accordance with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.5.2 and as shown in Figure 6.

TEXT: Where end-laps are required in flashings, form these as shown in Figure 6 and, before joining the two parts, apply an 8 mm diameter bead of neutral cure sealant complying with: i) Type F, Class 20LM or 25LM of ISO 11600, or ii) low modulus Type II Class A of Federal Specification TT-S-00230C.
LRML: if(requires(flashing, endLap)), then(obligation(and(asPer(endLap, nzbc_e2as1_f6),before(endLap.join, flashing),has(endLap.join,bead),equal(bead.diameter, 8 mm),is(bead, sealant),is(sealant.type,neutralCure),complyWith(sealant,or(iso_11600_class_20lmTypeF,iso_11600_class_25lmTypeF,tts_00230cClassA_lowModulusType_2)))))
PARAPHRASE: Where end-laps are required in flashings, the end-lap shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 6 and, before joining the end-lap and flashing, apply an 8 mm diameter bead of neutral cure sealant complying with ISO 11600 Class 20LM Type F or ISO 11600 Class 25LM Type F, or TT-S-00230C Class A low modulus Type II.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4.13 Stopends; The top ends of profiled metal roof cladding shall have stopends as shown in Figure 49 for trapezoidal and trough profile metal roof cladding, where: a) The roof pitch is less than 25°, or b) The building is in a High/Very High/Extra High wind zone.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding.profile, or(trapezoidal, trough)), or(lessThan(roof.pitch, 25 deg), is(building.windZone, or(high, veryHigh, extraHigh))))), then(obligation(and(has(cladding.topEnd, stopend), asPer(stopend, nzbc_e2as1_f49))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof cladding is profiled metal and the roof cladding have trapezoidal and trough profile and the roof pitch is less than 25°, or the building is in a High, Very High/, or Extra High wind zone, then the roof claddings top ends shall have stopends as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 49.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; 9.1.3 Bottom of cladding; Clearances shall be measured to: b) The top surface of any adjacent sloped or horizontal apron flashing.
LRML: if(has(wallCladding.bottom, clearance)), then(obligation(and(adjacent(flashing, wallCladding), is(flashing.type, apron), is(flashing, or(sloped, horizontal)), has(flashing, topSurface),towards(clearance.measurement, topSurface))))

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; 9.1.3 Bottom of cladding; Clearances shall be measured to: b) The top surface of any adjacent sloped or horizontal apron flashing.
LRML: if(has(wallCladding.bottom, clearance)), then(obligation(and(adjacent(flashing, wallCladding), is(flashing.type, apron), is(flashing, or(sloped, horizontal)), has(flashing, topSurface),towards(clearance.measurement, topSurface))))
PARAPHRASE: If the bottom of the wall cladding has a clearance, then the clearances shall be measured to the top surface of any adjacent sloped or horizontal apron flashing.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; 9.1.3 Bottom of cladding; Clearances shall be measured to: b) The top surface of any adjacent sloped or horizontal apron flashing.
LRML: if(has(wallCladding.bottom, clearance)), then(obligation(and(adjacent(flashing, wallCladding), is(flashing.type, apron), is(flashing, or(sloped, horizontal)), has(flashing, topSurface),towards(clearance.measurement, topSurface))))

TEXT: 8.1.5 Roof underlays; Underlays shall be: • Layed with minimum numbers of laps • Lapped at all side and end laps by minimum 150 mm • Run horizontally for roof pitches below 10° • Run horizontally or vertically for roof pitches above 10° • Have anti-ponding boards at lower edges of masonry tiles, refer Figure 25(b) and Paragraph 8.2.5.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(and(obligation(is(count(underlay.lap), minimum)), obligation(and(has(underlay, lap),is(lap, or(end, side)),greaterThanEqual(lap.size, 150 mm))), or(obligation(and(is(underlay.orientation, horizontal),lessThan(roof.pitch, 10 deg))), obligation(and(is(underlay.orientation, or(horizontal, vertical)),greaterThan(roof.pitch, 10 deg)))), obligation(and(has(roof, masonryTile),has(masonryTile.lowerEdge, antiPondingBoard)), ))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has underlays, then the underlay shall have a minimum cound of laps. The underlay shall have laps and the side laps and end laps shall be minimum 150 mm size. The underlay shall be either horizontally and roof pitches below 10 deg or the underlay shall be horizontally or vertically for roof pitches above 10 deg. The underlay shall have anti-ponding boards at lower edges of masonry tiles.

TEXT: Prevent sagging of roof underlay by either: For R1 underlays, fully support with a corrosion resistant material • For R2 self supporting underlays, laid to maximum 1.2 metre span between adjacent supports.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(or(obligation(and(is(underlay.type, r1), has(underlay, support),is(support.material, corrosionResistant))), obligation(and(is(underlay.type, r2), is(underlay, selfSupporting),lessThanEqual(underlay.span, 1.2 m),inBetween(underlay.span, adjacentSupports)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has an underlay, the underlay type shall be either R1 and the underlay shall be fully support with a corrosion resistant material, or the underly shall be type R2 and self supporting and laid to maximum 1.2 metre span between adjacent supports.

TEXT: 8.1.6 Gutters general; Gutters, downpipes and spreaders required for the drainage of roof water shall: a) Be to the minimum dimensions shown in this Acceptable Solution, or calculated to E1/AS1, whichever is the greater.
LRML: if(requires(roof.drainage, or(gutter, downpipe, spreader))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(gutter.dimension,nzbc_e1as1),complyWith(downpipe.dimension,nzbc_e1as1),complyWith(spreader.dimension,nzbc_e1as1),complyWith(gutter.dimension,nzbc_e2as1),complyWith(downpipe.dimension,nzbc_e2as1),complyWith(spreader.dimension,nzbc_e2as1))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof drainage requires gutters, downpipes and spreaders, then the gutters, downpipes and spreaders shall complye with the dimensions in E2/AS1 and E1/AS1

TEXT: b) If a gutter depth is reduced to allow entry of a valley gutter, the reduced depth must be used to calculate the capacity of the gutter.
LRML: if(and(has(gutter.depth, reduction), for(reduction, valleyGutter))), then(obligation(and(has(gutter, capacity),exclude(capacity.calculation, reduction))))
PARAPHRASE: If a gutter depth has a reduction for a valley gutter, then the calculation of the capacity of the gutter must exclude the reduction.

TEXT: d) Eaves gutters/spoutings shall: Be to any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.1 except 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 e) Have a minimum cross sectional area of 2500 mm2 f) Be designed to overflow water to the outside.
LRML: if(has(eave, gutter)), then(obligation(and(asPer(gutter.material,'nzbc_e2as1_4.1'),not(asPer(gutter.material,or('nzbc_e2as1_4.3.9', 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.10', 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.11'))),greaterThanEqual(gutter.crossSectionalArea, 2500 mm2),towards(gutter.overflow, outside))))
PARAPHRASE: If the eaves have gutters, the gutters material shall be as in E2/AS1 4.1 and not as in E2/AS1 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11, the gutters shall have a minimum cross sectional area of 2500 mm2, and the gutters shall overflow to the outside.

TEXT: Downpipes shall: g) Be formed from any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.1 except 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 h) Upper roofs shall drain via downpipes directly to ground level where possible, or i) Where discharging to a lower roof, be fitted with a spreader as detailed in Figure 20 j) Have a maximum catchment area of 25 m2 if discharging on to a lower roof area.
LRML: if(exist(downpipe)), then(obligation(and(asPer(downpipe.material, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.1'),not(asPer(downpipe.material, or('nzbc_e2as1_4.3.9', 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.10', 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.11'))),by(upperRoof.drainage,downpipe),or(to(upperRoof.drainage,groundLevel),and(to(upperRoof.drainage,lowerRoof),to(downpipe.fixture,spreader),lessThanEqual(downpipe.catchmentArea,25m2))))))
PARAPHRASE: If downpipes exist, the dowpipe shall be any of the materials outlined in E2/AS1 4.1 and not outlined in E2/AS1 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11. h) Upper roofs shall drain via downpipes directly to ground level where possible, or i) Where discharging to a lower roof, be fitted with a spreader as detailed in Figure 20 j) Have a maximum catchment area of 25 m2 if discharging on to a lower roof area.

TEXT: Downpipes shall: g) Be formed from any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.1 except 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 h) Upper roofs shall drain via downpipes directly to ground level where possible, or i) Where discharging to a lower roof, be fitted with a spreader as detailed in Figure 20 j) Have a maximum catchment area of 25 m2 if discharging on to a lower roof area.
LRML: if(exist(downpipe)), then(obligation(and(asPer(downpipe.material, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.1'),not(asPer(downpipe.material, or('nzbc_e2as1_4.3.9', 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.10', 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.11'))),by(upperRoof.drainage,downpipe),or(to(upperRoof.drainage,groundLevel),and(to(upperRoof.drainage,lowerRoof),to(downpipe.fixture,spreader),lessThanEqual(downpipe.catchmentArea,25m2))))))
PARAPHRASE: If downpipes exist, the dowpipe shall be any of the materials outlined in E2/AS1 4.1 and not outlined in E2/AS1 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11. h) Upper roofs shall drain via downpipes directly to ground level where possible, or i) Where discharging to a lower roof, be fitted with a spreader as detailed in Figure 20 j) Have a maximum catchment area of 25 m2 if discharging on to a lower roof area.

TEXT: For the catchment area of the roof above the penetration as shown in Figure 22, the roof length shall be limited to: i) for profiled metal roofing, Table 17 ii) for other roof claddings, the areas shown in Table 9.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, penetration), above(roof.catchmentArea, penetration), asPer(roof.catchmentArea, nzbc_e2as1_f22))), then(or(obligation(and(is(roof.type,profiledMetal),asPer(roof.length, nzbc_e2as1_t17))), obligation(and(not(is(roof.type,profiledMetal)),asPer(roof.length, nzbc_e2as1_t9)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has a penetration and the catchment area of the roof is above the penetration and the catchment area is as shown in Figure 22, then the roof length shall be limited to Table 17 and roof type is profiled metal, or roof type is not profiled metal and the roof length is as shown in Table 9.

TEXT: 8.2.1 Materials; Concrete tiles shall meet the requirements of NZS 4206 or AS 2049.
LRML: if(is(tile.material, concrete)), then(obligation(complyWith(tile, or(nzs_4206, as_2049))))
PARAPHRASE: Concrete tiles shall meet the requirements of NZS 4206 or AS 2049.

TEXT: 8.2.1 Materials; Concrete tiles shall meet the requirements of NZS 4206 or AS 2049.
LRML: if(is(tile.material, concrete)), then(obligation(complyWith(tile, or(nzs_4206, as_2049))))
PARAPHRASE: If the tile material is concrete, the tile shall meet the requirements of NZS 4206 or AS 2049.

TEXT: 8.2.1.1 Tile profiles; For the purposes of this paragraph, tiles shall be divided into three types as listed below: a) Type I: Double profile tiles having two distinct watercourses with a minimum watercourse depth of 18 mm.
LRML: if(is(tile.type, doubleProfile)), then(and(equal(count(tile.watercourse), 2), greaterThanEqual(watercourse.depth, 18 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: If the tile type is double profile, then the tiles having two distinct watercourses with a minimum watercourse depth of 18 mm.

TEXT: 8.2.1.1 Tile profiles; For the purposes of this paragraph, tiles shall be divided into three types as listed below: Type II: Single profile tiles having one water- course depth of a minimum of 25 mm.
LRML: if(is(tile.type, singleProfile)), then(and(equal(count(tile.watercourse), 1), greaterThanEqual(watercourse.depth, 25 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: If the tile type is double profile, then the tiles having two distinct watercourses with a minimum watercourse depth of 18 mm.

TEXT: 8.2.1.1 Tile profiles; c) Type III: Tiles not fitting the Type I (Double profile) or Type II (Single profile) categories, and includes flat tiles and those resembling slates, shakes and shingles.
LRML: if(is(tile.type, typeIii)), then(and(not(is(tile.type, or(singleProfile, doubleProfile))), include(tile, and(flatTile, resemblingSlate, resemblingShake, resemblingShingle))))
PARAPHRASE: If the tile type is Type III, then Tiles not fitting the Type I (Double profile) or Type II (Single profile) categories, and includes flat tiles and those resembling slates, shakes and shingles.

TEXT: 8.2.1.1 Tile profiles; Type II: Single profile tiles having one water- course depth of a minimum of 25 mm.
LRML: if(is(tile.type, singleProfile)), then(and(equal(count(tile.watercourse), 1), greaterThanEqual(watercourse.depth, 25 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: If the tile type is single profile, then the tiles having one water- course depth of a minimum of 25 mm.

TEXT: 8.2.3 Installation; Masonry tile roof cladding shall be installed in accordance with NZS 4206 or AS 2050 onto minimum H1.2 treated timber battens, except the minimum pitch shall be as specified in Table 10.
LRML: if(is(roofCladding.type, masonryTile)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(roofCladding.installation,or(nzs_4206,as_2050)),onto(roofCladding.installation, batten),is(batten.material, timber),greaterThanEqual(timber.treatment,'h1.2'),asPer(roofCladding.pitch,nzbc_e2as1_t10))))
PARAPHRASE: If roof cladding is masonry tile, then the roof cladding shall be installed in accordance with NZS 4206 or AS 2050 onto minimum H1.2 treated timber battens and the roof cladding pitch shall be as specified in Table 10.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Fixings shall: a) Be fixed through crests, b) Penetrate purlins by a minimum of 40 mm for nail fixings and 30 mm for screw fixings, c) Include sealing washers of: i) neoprene (having a carbon black content of 15% or less by weight).

TEXT: Plywood substrates shall be fixed according to the following requirements: a) Panels shall be laid with staggered joints (brick bond), b) Panels shall be laid with the face grain at right angles to the main supports, c) Supports in b) shall be at 400 mm maximum centres, d) The edge of sheets shall be supported with dwangs or framing.
LRML: if(is(substrate.material, plywood)), then(obligation(and(has(substrate, pannel),is(pannel.arrangement,or(staggeredJoint,brickBond)),has(pannel.faceGrain,angle),towards(angle,support),is(support.type,main),lessThanEqual(support.location, 400 mmCentres),has(pannel.edge,or(dwang,framing)))))
PARAPHRASE: If substrates are from plywood, then the substrate shall substrate panels shall be arranged with staggered joints or brick bond, Panels shall be laid with the face grain at right angles to the main supports, and the supports shall be at 400 mm maximum centres, d) The edge of sheets shall be supported with dwangs or framing.
AUTHOR: Stefan

LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding.profile, trough), has(roofCladding, fixing), is(fixing.type, clip))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(fixing.bmt, 0.9 mm)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(fixing.width, 30 mm)), obligation(has(fixing.material, compatibility)), obligation(is(compatibility.object, cladding)), obligation(complyWith(fixing.material, and(nzbc_e2as1_t20, nzbc_e2as1_t21))), obligation(is(clip.fastening, screw)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(count(screw), 2)), obligation(is(screw.size, 10 gauge)), obligation(is(screw.length, 30 mm)), obligation(is(screw.type, and(waferhead, galvanised))), obligation(is(galvanised.form, hotDipped)), obligation(complyWith(screw, class_3)), obligation(in(class3, as_3566_2))))

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.5 Roof pitch; For roofs up to 18 metres in length without end laps, pitches shall be: a) Corrugated – not less than 8° (1:7). b) Trapezoidal – not less than: i) 4° (1:14) where the crest height is less than 27 mm, or ii) 3° (1:20) where the crest height is 27 mm or higher. c) Trough profile – not less than 3° (1:20).
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), lessThanEqual(roof.length, 18 m), not(include(roof.length, endLap)))), then(or(obligation(and(is(roofCladding.profile,corrugated),greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,8 deg))), obligation(and(is(roofCladding.profile,trapezoidal),greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,4 deg),has(roofCladding,crest),lessThan(crest.height,27 mm))), obligation(and(is(roofCladding.profile,trapezoidal),greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,3 deg),has(roofCladding,crest),greaterThanEqual(crest.height,27 mm))), obligation(and(is(roofCladding.profile,trough),greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,3 deg)))))
PARAPHRASE:
If roofs are up to 18 metres in length and the roof length does not include end laps, either roof claddings shall be corrugated and roof pitches shall be not less than 8 deg. Or, roof cladding profile shall be trapezoidal and roof pitches shall be not less than 4 deg and the roof cladding's crest height is less than 27 mm. Or, roof cladding profile shall be trapezoidal and roof pitches shall be not less than 3 deg and the roof cladding's crest height is 27 mm or higher. Or, roof cladding profile shall be trough and roof pitches shall be not less than 3 deg.
b) Trapezoidal – not less than: i) 4° (1:14) where the crest height is less than 27 mm, or ii) 3° (1:20) where the crest height is 27 mm or higher. c) Trough profile – not less than 3° (1:20).
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.5 Roof pitch; For roofs up to 18 metres in length without end laps, pitches shall be: a) Corrugated – not less than 8° (1:7). b) Trapezoidal – not less than: i) 4° (1:14) where the crest height is less than 27 mm, or ii) 3° (1:20) where the crest height is 27 mm or higher. c) Trough profile – not less than 3° (1:20).
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), lessThanEqual(roof.length, 18 m), not(include(roof.length, endLap)))), then(or(obligation(and(is(roofCladding.profile,corrugated),greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,8 deg))), obligation(and(is(roofCladding.profile,trapezoidal),greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,4 deg),has(roofCladding,crest),lessThan(crest.height,27 mm))), obligation(and(is(roofCladding.profile,trapezoidal),greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,3 deg),has(roofCladding,crest),greaterThanEqual(crest.height,27 mm))), obligation(and(is(roofCladding.profile,trough),greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,3 deg)))))
PARAPHRASE:
If roofs are up to 18 metres in length and the roof length does not include end laps, either roof claddings shall be corrugated and roof pitches shall be not less than 8 deg. Or, roof cladding profile shall be trapezoidal and roof pitches shall be not less than 4 deg and the roof cladding's crest height is less than 27 mm. Or, roof cladding profile shall be trapezoidal and roof pitches shall be not less than 3 deg and the roof cladding's crest height is 27 mm or higher. Or, roof cladding profile shall be trough and roof pitches shall be not less than 3 deg.
b) Trapezoidal – not less than: i) 4° (1:14) where the crest height is less than 27 mm, or ii) 3° (1:20) where the crest height is 27 mm or higher. c) Trough profile – not less than 3° (1:20).
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Pressed metal tiles shall be fixed as shown in Figure 33, with: a) 50 x 2.8 mm hot-dipped galvanized painted flat-head annular-grooved nails.

TEXT: 9.1 General; Wall claddings shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2.3.2 to E2.3.7, and comply with the provisions of Paragraph 9.1.1 to Paragraph 9.9.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; Claddings in Extra High wind zones require: a) Rigid underlays to Paragraph 9.1.7.2 b) Drained cavities to Paragraph 9.1.8 c) Hooks and hems on flashing upstands.

TEXT: Valley gutters and hidden gutters shall be constructed as shown in Figures 50 and 51 for the applicable roof cladding (except for membrane roofing) and: a) Not change direction in plan b) Have a minimum underlap to roof cladding as specified in Figures 27, 37, 50, and 51 for the relevant roof cladding c) Be formed from any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.3 except 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 d) Be fixed at upper ends only, and be secured with a purpose-made clip system for the remaining length to enable expansion/ contraction along the length of the gutter e) Discharge into an internal gutter or eaves gutter/spouting.
LRML: if(and(is(gutter.type, or(valley, hidden)),not(is(roof.type, membrane)))), then(obligation(and(asPer(gutter.construction,and(nzbc_e2as1_f50,nzbc_e2as1_f51)),not(is(gutter.changeInDirection,inPlan)),towards(gutter.underlap, cladding),asPer(gutter.underlap,and(nzbc_e2as1_f27,nzbc_e2as1_f37,nzbc_e2as1_f50,nzbc_e2as1_f51)),asPer(gutter.material,'nzbc_e2as1_4.3'),not(asPer(gutter.material,or('nzbc_e2as1_4.3.10','nzbc_e2as1_4.3.11'))),has(gutter.upperEnd, fixing),is(fixing.type, clipSystem),is(clipSystem, purposeMade),for(clipSystem,and(contractionAllowance, expansionAllowance)),into(gutter.discharge, or(internalGutter,eaveGutter)))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutter type is valley or hidden and the roof type is not membrane, then the gutter shall be constructed as shown in Figures 50 and 51, and the gutter shall not change direction in plan, the gutter shall have a minimum underlap to roof cladding as specified in Figures 27, 37, 50, and 51, and the gutter material shall be as outlined in E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.3 and not in 4.3.10 and 4.3.11, and the gutter shall be fixed at upper ends, and be secured with a purpose-made clip system to enable expansion/ contraction, and the gutter shall discharge into an internal gutter or eave gutter.

TEXT: Valley gutters be minimum 250 mm wide where receiving run off from spreaders.
LRML: if(and(is(gutter.type, valley), into(spreader.discharge, gutter))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(gutter.width, 250 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: If the gutter type is valley and spreaders discharge into the gutter, the gutter shall be minimum 250 mm wide

TEXT: Where roof penetrations are required for large openings such as roof lights and chimneys, this Acceptable Solution is limited to the following requirements: Rules 8.1.7.0.2.a.1 and 8.1.7.0.2.b.1.
LRML: if(and(for(roof.penetration, opening), is(opening, large), similarTo(opening, and(roofLight, chimney)))), then(and(applyTo('nzbc_e2as1_8.1.7.0.2.a.1', penetration),applyTo('nzbc_e2as1_8.1.7.0.2.b.1', penetration)))

TEXT: The edge of roofing penetrations over 200 mm wide shall be supported in either direction with additional framing as shown in Figure 21.

TEXT: 8.2.1.1 Tile profiles; c) Type III: Tiles not fitting the Type I (Double profile) or Type II (Single profile) categories, and includes flat tiles and those resembling slates, shakes and shingles.

TEXT: 8.0 Roof claddings 8.2.3 Installation; Fixing and fixing patterns shall be to NZS 4206, with the exception that nails shall penetrate a minimum of 35 mm into timber battens, and the minimum pitches and roof underlay shall be as described in Table 10 and Table 23.
LRML: if(and(has(roofCladding, fixing), include(fixing, nail), is(batten.material, timber), is(underlay.application, roof))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(fixing, nzs_4206),complyWith(fixing.pattern ,nzs_4206),into(nail.penetration, batten),is(batten.material, timber), greaterThanEqual(nail.penetration, 35 mm),asPer(roofCladding.pitch, and(nzbc_e2as1_t10,  nzbc_e2as1_t23)),asPer(roofCladding.underlay, and(nzbc_e2as1_t10,  nzbc_e2as1_t23)))))

TEXT: Use 304 or 316 stainless steel fixings for corrosion zones B, C or hot dip galvanised fixings at 450 g/m2 for Zone B and Zone C.
LRML: if(and(is(corrosionZone.type, or(b, c)), for(fixing, corrosionZone))), then(obligation(or(and(is(fixing.material, stainlessSteel),is(stainlessSteel.grade, or(304, 306))),and(is(fixing.material, hotDipGalvanized),is(fixing.weight, 450g/m2)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the corrosion zones for the fixing is B or C, then fixing material shall be 304 or 316 stainless steel or hot dip galvanised fixings at 450 g/m2.

TEXT: 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles; All metal tile roofing shall have a roof underlay installed. Roof underlay shall be to Table 23. Refer to Paragraph 8.1.5 for installation details.

PARAPHRASE: If the roof type is pressed metal tile, then the roof shall have a underlay, and the underlay shall be as E2/AS1 Table 23, and the underlay installation as E2/AS1 Paragraph 8.1.5.

TEXT: 8.1.6.1 Internal gutters; Internal gutters shall: d) Be constructed to at least the minimum dimensions shown in Figure 52, or the capacity calculated to E1/AS1 plus an additional freeboard depth of 20 mm minimum.
LRML: if(is(gutter.type, internal)), then(obligation(or(asPer(gutter.dimension, nzbc_e2as1_f52),and(define(gutter.capacity, x0),asPer(x0.calculation, nzbc_e1as1),define(freeboard.depth,x1),greaterThanEqual(x1, 20 mm),equal(gutter.capacity,'x0 + x1')))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are internal, the gutter be at least the minimum dimensions shown in Figure 52, or the gutter capacity calculated to E1/AS1 plus an additional freeboard depth of 20 mm minimum.

TEXT: 8.1.6.1 Internal gutters; Internal gutters shall: For roofs other than membrane roofs: e) Discharge into a rainwater head as shown in Figure 63 (a) and (b).
LRML: if(and(is(gutter.type, internal), not(is(roof.type, membrane)))), then(obligation(and(into(gutter.discharge, rainwaterHead),asPer(gutter.discharge, and('nzbc_e2as1_f63.a', 'nzbc_e2as1_f63.b')))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are internal and roof type is not membrane roofs, the gutter shall discharge into a rainwater head, and the gutter discharge shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 63.a and Figure 63.b.

TEXT: In addition: f) Have minimum slopes of 8° for hidden gutters g) Hidden gutters receive no discharge from downpipes or spreaders.
LRML: if(is(gutter.type, hidden)), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(gutter.slope, 8 deg)), prohibition(and(into(downpipe.discharge, gutter),into(spreader.discharge, gutter))))

TEXT: In addition: f) Have minimum slopes of 8° for hidden gutters g) Hidden gutters receive no discharge from downpipes or spreaders.

TEXT: In addition f) Have minimum slopes to Table 8 for valley gutters h) Spreaders not discharge directly into a valley gutter.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.8 Fixings: corrugated and trapezoidal; Fixings shall be as shown in Tables 11, 12, 14 and 15, and shall be a minimum 12-gauge screw, as shown in Figure 39, which complies with Class 4 of AS 3566: Part 2.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal),  is(roofCladding.profile, or(corrugated, trapezoidal)), has(roofCladding, fixing))), then(obligation(and(asPer(fixing,and(nzbc_e2as1_t11,nzbc_e2as1_t12,nzbc_e2as1_t14,nzbc_e2as1_t15)),is(fixing.type, screw),greaterThanEqual(screw.size, 12 gauge),asPer(screw,nzbc_e2as1_f39),complyWith(screw, as_3566_2_class_4))))
PARAPHRASE: If the profile of Profiled Metal Roof Cladding is corrugated or trapezoidal, and the roof cladding has a fixing, then the fixing shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Tables 11, 12, 14 and 15, and the fixing shall be a minimum 12-gauge sized screw, as shown in Figure 39, which complies with Class 4 of AS 3566: Part 2.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.8 Fixings: corrugated and trapezoidal; Fixings shall be as shown in Tables 11, 12, 14 and 15, and shall be a minimum 12-gauge screw, as shown in Figure 39, which complies with Class 4 of AS 3566: Part 2.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal),  is(roofCladding.profile, or(corrugated, trapezoidal)), has(roofCladding, fixing))), then(obligation(and(asPer(fixing,and(nzbc_e2as1_t11,nzbc_e2as1_t12,nzbc_e2as1_t14,nzbc_e2as1_t15)),is(fixing.type, screw),greaterThanEqual(screw.size, 12 gauge),asPer(screw,nzbc_e2as1_f39),complyWith(screw, as_3566_2_class_4))))
PARAPHRASE: If the profile of Profiled Metal Roof Cladding is corrugated or trapezoidal, and the roof cladding has a fixing, then the fixing shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Tables 11, 12, 14 and 15, and the fixing shall be a minimum 12-gauge sized screw, as shown in Figure 39, which complies with Class 4 of AS 3566: Part 2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Fixings shall: a) Be fixed through crests, b) Penetrate purlins by a minimum of 40 mm for nail fixings and 30 mm for screw fixings, c) Include sealing washers of: i) neoprene (having a carbon black content of 15% or less by weight).
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), has(roofCladding, fixing))), then(obligation(and(has(roofCladding,crest),through(fixing,crest),into(fixing.penetration,purlin),or(and(is(fixing,nail),greaterThanEqual(fixing.penetration,40mm)),and(is(fixing,screw),greaterThanEqual(fixing.penetration,30mm))),include(fixing,sealingWasher),is(sealingWasher.type,neoprene),lessThanEqual(sealingWasher.carbonBlackContent,15percent))))
PARAPHRASE: If the profile of Profiled Metal Roof Cladding has a fixing, then the fixings shall be through the crests of the roof cladding
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Clip fixings for trough profiles and spans as shown in Table 13 shall be as shown in Figure 40, and shall: a) Have a minimum BMT of 0.9 mm b) Be a minimum width of 30 mm c) Be made from a material compatible with the cladding, refer to Tables 20 and 21 d) Have clips fastened with a minimum of two 10-gauge by 30 mm waferhead hot-dipped galvanised screws which comply with Class 3 of AS 3566: Part 2.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; Claddings in Extra High wind zones require: a) Rigid underlays to Paragraph 9.1.7.2 b) Drained cavities to Paragraph 9.1.8 c) Hooks and hems on flashing upstands.
LRML: if(and(within(wallCladding, windZone), is(windZone, extraHigh))), then(obligation(and(has(cladding, underlay),is(underlay, rigid),complyWith(underlay,'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.7.2'),has(cladding,drainedCavity),complyWith(drainedCavity,'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.8'),has(flashing.upstand,and(hook,hem)),for(flashing,cladding))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are in Extra High wind zones, the wall claddings shall have rigid underlays to Paragraph 9.1.7.2 and the wall claddings shall have drained cavities to Paragraph 9.1.8 and the wall cladding flashing upstands shall have hooks and hems.

TEXT: 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles; All metal tile roofing shall have a roof underlay installed. Roof underlay shall be to Table 23. Refer to Paragraph 8.1.5 for installation details.
LRML: if(is(roof.type, pressedMetalTile)), then(obligation(and(has(roof,underlay),asPer(underlay,nzbc_e2as1_t23),asPer(underlay.installation,'nzbc_e2as1_8.1.5'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof type is pressed metal tile, then the roof shall have a underlay, and the underlay shall be as E2/AS1 Table 23, and the underlay installation as E2/AS1 Paragraph 8.1.5.

TEXT: Pressed metal tiles shall be fixed as shown in Figure 33, with: a) 50 x 2.8 mm hot-dipped galvanized painted flat-head annular-grooved nails.
LRML: if(exist(pressedMetalTile)), then(obligation(and(asPer(pressedMetalTile.fixing, nzbc_e2as1_f33),by(pressedMetalTile.fixing,nail),is(nail.type,and(flatHead, annularGrooved)),is(nail,and(hotDippedGalvanised,painted)),is(nail.dimension,' 50 x 2.8 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If pressed metal tiles exist,then the pressed metal tiles shall be fixed as shown in Figure 33, with: a) 50 x 2.8 mm hot-dipped galvanized painted flat-head annular-grooved nails.

TEXT: 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles; The roof shall be flashed at all boundaries, except at the discharge to a gutter, using the details shown in Figure 34 to Figure 37.
LRML: if(is(roof.type, pressedMetalTile)), then(and(obligation(has(roof.boundary, flashing)), prohibition(and(towards(roof.discharge, gutter),has(roof.discharge, flashing))),obligation(asPer(flashing, 'nzbc_e2as1_f34 to nzbc_e2as1_f37'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof type is pressed metal tile, the roof boundaries shall have flashings. The roof discharge to a gutter shall not have flashings. The flashings shall be as shown in Figure 34 to Figure 37.

TEXT: 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles; Metal flashings are generally supplied by the metal tile manufacturer, and shall comply with Paragraph 8.3.4.2 and Table 7, unless specifically shown otherwise in the details.
LRML: if(and(is(roof.type, pressedMetalTile),has(roof, flashing),is(flashing.material, metal), has(pressedMetalTile, manufacturer))), then(and(include(manufacturer.supply, flashing), obligation(complyWith(flashing, and('nzbc_e2as1_8.3.4.2', nzbc_e2as1_t7)))))

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is limited to the following types of profiled metal roof cladding: a) Profiled as outlined in Paragraph 8.4.4, b) Valley gutters that do not change direction in plan, c) Not curved, and d) With sheets no more than 18 metres long.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), or(asPer(profiledMetal, 'nzbc_e2as1_8.4.4'),and(has(profiledMetal, gutter), is(gutter.type, valley), not(is(gutter.changeInDirection, inPlan))), not(is(profiledMetal, curved)), lessThanEqual(profiledMetal.length, 18 m)))), then(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, roofCladding)))
PARAPHRASE: If roof cladding is profiled metal and the profiled metal is as outlined in E2/AS1 Paragraph 8.4.4, or the profiled metal has valley gutters that do not change direction in plan, or the profiled metal is not curved, or the profiled metal is no more than 18 metres long, then E2/AS1 applies to the roof cladding.

TEXT: 9.1.3.5 Bottom of wall claddings for timber floor framing; Suspended timber floors shall meet the requirements of NZS 3604. Clearances from paved and unpaved surfaces to the wall framing shall be in accordance with NZS 3604, and Table 18.
LRML: if(and(adjacent(floor, wallCladding), is(floor, suspended), is(floor.material, timber))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(floor,nzs_3604),towards(wallCladding.clearance, surface),is(surface, or(paved, unpaved)),complyWith(wallCladding.clearance,and(nzs_3604,nzbc_e2as1_t18)))))
PARAPHRASE: 9.1.3.5 Bottom of wall claddings for timber floor framing; Suspended timber floors shall meet the requirements of NZS 3604. Clearances from paved and unpaved surfaces to the wall framing shall be in accordance with NZS 3604, and Table 18.

TEXT: 9.1.3.5 Bottom of wall claddings for timber floor framing; Suspended timber floors shall meet the requirements of NZS 3604. Clearances from paved and unpaved surfaces to the wall framing shall be in accordance with NZS 3604, and Table 18.
LRML: if(and(adjacent(floor, wallCladding), is(floor, suspended), is(floor.material, timber))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(floor, nzs_3604),towards(wallCladding.clearance, surface),is(surface, or(paved, unpaved)),asPer(wallCladding.clearance,and(nzs_3604,nzbc_e2as1_t18)))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are next to suspended timber floors, the floor shall meet the requirements of NZS 3604. The wall cladding clearances towards paved and unpaved surfaces shall be in accordance with NZS 3604, and E2/AS1 Table 18.

TEXT: 9.1.5 Wall underlays to wall openings; Prior to window or door installation: a) Flexible wall underlay shall be cut and dressed into all sides of openings as per Figure 72A and B,.
LRML: if(and(has(wall, opening), is(opening.type, or(window, door)))), then(obligation(and(loop(forEach(opening.side),has(opening.side, underlay)),for(underlay, wall),is(underlay, flexible),asPer(underlay, and('nzbc_e2as1_f72.a', 'nzbc_e2as1_f72.b')),define(opening.installation, x0),before(underlay.installation, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If the wall has an opening and the opening type is window or door, then all sides of openings shall have underlays and the underlays shall be for walls and shall be flexible and as per E2/AS1 Figure 72.a and Figure 72.b, and the undlay installation shall be before the installation of the opening.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall claddings; This Acceptable Solution is limited to masonry veneer cladding attached to timber wall framing outlined in NZS 3604. Masonry veneer is either: a) Clay brick, or b) Concrete brick or block.
LRML: if(and( is(wallCladding.type, masonryVeneer), connect(wallCladding, framing),  for(framing, wall),is(framing.material, timber), complyWith(framing, nzs_3604), is(masonryVeneer.type, or(clayBrick, concreteBrick, concreteBlock)))), then(permission(complyWith(cladding, nzbc_e2as1)))
PARAPHRASE: If the wall cladding is masonry veneer attached to timber wall framing outlined in NZS 3604. Masonry veneer is either: a) Clay brick, or b) Concrete brick or block.

TEXT: 8.2.1.1 Tile profiles; c) Type III: Tiles not fitting the Type I (Double profile) or Type II (Single profile) categories, and includes flat tiles and those resembling slates, shakes and shingles.

TEXT: Use 304 or 316 stainless steel fixings for corrosion zones B, C or hot dip galvanised fixings at 450 g/m2 for Zone B and Zone C.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Clip fixings for trough profiles and spans as shown in Table 13 shall be as shown in Figure 40, and shall: a) Have a minimum BMT of 0.9 mm b) Be a minimum width of 30 mm c) Be made from a material compatible with the cladding, refer to Tables 20 and 21 d) Have clips fastened with a minimum of two 10-gauge by 30 mm waferhead hot-dipped galvanised screws which comply with Class 3 of AS 3566: Part 2.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), has(roofCladding, fixing), is(fixing.type, clip),is(roofCladding.profile, trough), asPer(roofCladding.span, nzbc_e2as1_t20))), then(obligation(and(asPer(fixing, nzbc_e2as1_f40),greaterThanEqual(fixing.baseMetalThickness, 0.9 mm),greaterThanEqual(fixing.width,30 mm),has(fixing.material, compatibility),towards(compatibility, roofCladding),complyWith(fixing.material, and(nzbc_e2as1_t20,nzbc_e2as1_t21)),has(fixing, clip),is(clip.fastener, screw),greaterThanEqual(count(screw),2),is(screw.size,10 gauge),is(screw.length,30 mm),is(screw.type,and(waferhead,hotDippedGalvanised)),complyWith(screw,as_3566_2_class_3))))
PARAPHRASE: If the Profiled Metal Roof Cladding has clip fixings and the roof cladding profile is trough and the roof cladding span is as shown in E2/AS1 Table 13, then the fixing shall be as shown in Figure 40, and the fixing shall have a minimum base metal thickness of 0.9 mm, and the fixing shall be a minimum width of 30 mm, and the fixing shall be a material compatible with the roof cladding, for the fixing material refer to Tables 20 and 21, and the fixing shall have clips fastened with a minimum of two screws, the screws are 10-gauge size and 30 mm length waferhead hot-dipped galvanised and the screws comply with Class 3 of AS 3566: Part 2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.0 Roof Claddings 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles 8.3.10 Roof penetrations; Pipe penetrations shall be flashed using EPDM flashings similar to that shown for masonry tiles, Figure 29.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type,pressedMetalTile),has(roofCladding, penetration),for(penetration, pipe))),then(obligation(and(has(penetration, flashing),is(flashing.material, epdm),define(masonryTile.flashing, x0),similarTo(flashing, x0),asPer(x0, 'nzbc_e2as1_f29'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof cladding type is pressed metal tiles and the roof cladding has pipe penetrations, the penetrations shall be flashed using EPDM flashings similar to masonry tile flashing in E2/AS1 Figure 29.

TEXT: Steel for the manufacture of pressed metal tile and flashing systems shall: a) have a base metal thickness (BMT) of 0.39 mm minimum, b) be grade G300 or G250, c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.
LRML: if(and(is(pressedMetalTile.material, steel), is(flashing.material, steel))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(steel.baseMetalThickness, 0.39 mm),is(steel.grade, or(g300, g250)),for(steel.corrosionProtection, exposureZone),asPer(steel,nzbc_e2as1_t20))))
PARAPHRASE: If the material of pressed metal tile and flashing is steel, then the steel shall have a minimum base metal thickness of 0.39 mm, the stell shall be grade G300 or G250, and the steel shall be chosen for corrosion protection based on the exposure zone as shown in E2/AS1 Table 20.

TEXT: 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles 8.3.4.2 Steel; Paint coatings may include factory-applied finishes complying with AS/NZS 2728.
LRML: if(and(is(pressedMetalTile.material, steel), has(pressedMetalTile, paintCoating))), then(permission(and(include(paintCoating,factoryAppliedFinish),complyWith(factoryAppliedFinish,nzs_2728))))
PARAPHRASE: If the pressed metal tile's material is steel and the stell has paint coatings, the paint coatings may include factory-applied finishes complying with AS/NZS 2728.

TEXT: 8.0 Roof Claddings 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles 8.3.4.3 Aluminium; Aluminium for the manufacture of pressed metal tiles and flashing systems shall comply with AS/NZS 1734, and shall: a) Have a base metal thickness (BMT) of 0.7 mm minimum, b) Be minimum 5000 series, c) For pre-painted aluminium, have a factory-applied finish complying with AS/NZS 2728.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.application, roof), is(cladding.system, metalTile), is(metalTile, pressed), for(flashing, cladding), is(metalTile.material, aluminium), is(flashing.material, aluminium))), then(and(obligation(complyWith(aluminium, nzs_1734)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(aluminium.baseMetalThickness, 0.7 mm)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(aluminium.grade, 5000 series)), obligation(or(and(is(aluminium, prePainted),has(aluminium, factoryAppliedFinish),complyWith(factoryAppliedFinish, nzs_2728)),not(is(aluminium,prePainted))))))
PARAPHRASE: If the material of pressed metal tiles and flashings is aluminium, then the aluminium shall comply with NZS 1734 and the aluminium shall have a base metal thickness of at least 0.7 mm, the aluminium shall be a minimum of 5000 series, and the alumenium shall either be pre-painted and have a factory-applied finish complying with NZS 2728 or the aluminium shall not be pre-painted.

TEXT: 8.0 Roof Claddings 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles; The minimum roof pitches for metal tiles where rafter length exceeds 12 m, increase minimum pitch (Rule 8.3.5.0.2) by 1° per additional 0.5 m.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.application, roof), is(cladding.system, metalTile), is(metalTile, pressed), define(roof.rafterLength, x0), greaterThan(x0, 12 m), equal(rule.key, 'nzbc_e2as1_8.3.5.0.2'), define(rule.value, x1))), then(obligation(equal(min(roof.pitch), 'x1 + (x0 - 12)  * 2')))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has pressed metal tiles and a rafter, and the rafter length does not exceed 12 m, then the roof pitches shall

TEXT: 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles; All metal tile roofing shall have a roof underlay installed. Roof underlay shall be to Table 23. Refer to Paragraph 8.1.5 for installation details.
LRML: if(is(roof.type, pressedMetalTile)), then(obligation(and(has(roof,underlay),complyWith(underlay,nzbc_e2as1_t23),complyWith(underlay.installation,'nzbc_e2as1_8.1.5'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof type is pressed metal tile, then the roof shall have a underlay, and the underlay shall be as E2/AS1 Table 23, and the underlay installation as E2/AS1 Paragraph 8.1.5.

TEXT: Pressed metal tiles shall be fixed as shown in Figure 33, with: a) 50 x 2.8 mm hot-dipped galvanized painted flat-head annular-grooved nails.
LRML: if(exist(pressedMetalTile)), then(obligation(and(by(pressedMetalTile.fixing,nail),is(nail.type,annularGrooved),is(nail,and(galvanised,painted,flatHead)),is(galvanised.form,hotDipped),is(nail.dimension,' 50 x 2.8 mm'))))

TEXT: Pressed metal tiles shall be fixed as shown in Figure 33, with: a) 50 x 2.8 mm hot-dipped galvanized painted flat-head annular-grooved nails.
LRML: if(exist(pressedMetalTile)), then(obligation(and(asPer(pressedMetalTile.fixing, nzbc_e2as1_f33),is(pressedMetalTile.fixing, nail),is(nail.type,and(flatHead, annularGrooved)),is(nail,and(hotDippedGalvanised,painted)),is(nail.dimension,' 50 x 2.8 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If pressed metal tiles exist,then the pressed metal tiles shall be fixed as shown in Figure 33, with nails type flat-head annular-grooved, and the nails are hot-dipped galvanized and painted, and the nails are dimension 50 x 2.8 mm.

TEXT: Pressed metal tiles; For fixings through the top of the tiles, use neoprene washers containing no more than 15% by weight carbon black content.
LRML: if(has(pressedMetalTile.top, fixing)), then(obligation(and(is(fixing, neopreneWasher),lessThanEqual(neopreneWasher.carbonBlackContent, 15 percent))))
PARAPHRASE: If the top of the pressed metal tile has a fixing, the fixing shall be neoprene washers, and the neoprene washer's carbon black content shall be no more than 15 percent.

TEXT: 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles; Metal flashings are generally supplied by the metal tile manufacturer, and shall comply with Paragraph 8.3.4.2 and Table 7, unless specifically shown otherwise in the details.
LRML: if(and(is(roof.type, pressedMetalTile),has(roof, flashing),is(flashing.material, metal), has(pressedMetalTile, manufacturer))), then(and(has(pressedMetalTile, manufacturer),include(manufacturer.supply, flashing), obligation(complyWith(flashing, and('nzbc_e2as1_8.3.4.2', nzbc_e2as1_t7)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof type is pressed metal tile and the roof has flashings with material metal, then the manufacturer of the pressed metal tiles supplies the flashings. The flashings shall comply with E2/AS1 Paragraph 8.3.4.2 and Table 7.

TEXT: Membranes installed over plywood substrates; Plywood shall be: a) A minimum of 17 mm complying with AS/NZS 2269, b) At least CD Grade Structural plywood with the sanded C face upwards, and c) H3 with treatment type compatible with membrane and adhesives used.
LRML: if(and(above(membrane, substrate), is(substrate.material, plywood))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(plywood.thickness, 17 mm),complyWith(plywood.thickness, nzs_2269),greaterThanEqual(plywood.grade, cd),is(plywood.type,structural),is(plywood.sandedCFace,upward),is(plywood.treatment,h3),has(plywood.treatment,compatibility),towards(compatibility,and(membrane,adhesive)))))
PARAPHRASE: If membranes are over plywood substrates, then the plywood shall be a minimum of 17 mm thick complying with NZS 2269, the plywood shall be at least CD grade with the sanded C face upwards, and the plywood shall have H3 treatment compatible with membrane and adhesives used.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings 9.1.3.1 Concrete slabs; Slab levels shall be set to allow reinstatement of final landscaped ground levels as outlined in Figure 65 and Table 18.

TEXT: 9.1.3.5 Bottom of wall claddings for timber floor framing; Suspended timber floors shall meet the requirements of NZS 3604. Clearances from paved and unpaved surfaces to the wall framing shall be in accordance with NZS 3604, and Table 18.
LRML: if(and(adjacent(floor, wallCladding), is(floor, suspended), is(floor.material, timber))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(floor, nzs_3604),towards(wallCladding.clearance, surface),is(surface, or(paved, unpaved)),asPer(wallCladding.clearance,and(nzs_3604,nzbc_e2as1_t18)))))

If the wall has an opening and the opening type is window or door, then

TEXT: 9.1.5 Wall underlays to wall openings; Prior to window or door installation: a) Flexible wall underlay shall be cut and dressed into all sides of openings as per Figure 72A and B,.
LRML: if(and(has(wall, opening), is(opening.type, or(window, door)))), then(obligation(and(loop(forEach(opening.side),has(opening.side, underlay)),for(underlay, wall),is(underlay, flexible),asPer(underlay, and('nzbc_e2as1_f72.a', 'nzbc_e2as1_f72.b')),before(underlay.installation, and(window, door)))))

TEXT: Materials for flashings, gutters and fixings shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.0, and: a) Be selected from Table 20 to minimise corrosion, and b) Be compatible with mortar and bedding in accordance with Table 21 and Table 22.

TEXT: 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles 8.3.4.2 Steel; Paint coatings may include factory-applied finishes complying with AS/NZS 2728.

TEXT: 8.0 Roof Claddings 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles 8.3.4.3 Aluminium; Aluminium for the manufacture of pressed metal tiles and flashing systems shall comply with AS/NZS 1734, and shall: a) Have a base metal thickness (BMT) of 0.7 mm minimum, b) Be minimum 5000 series, c) For pre-painted aluminium, have a factory-applied finish complying with AS/NZS 2728.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.application, roof), is(cladding.system, metalTile), is(metalTile, pressed), for(flashing, cladding), is(metalTile.material, aluminium), is(flashing.material, aluminium))), then(and(obligation(complyWith(aluminium, nzs_1734)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(aluminium.baseMetalThickness, 0.7 mm)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(aluminium.grade, 5000 series)), obligation(or(and(is(aluminium, prePainted),has(aluminium, factoryAppliedFinish),complyWith(factoryAppliedFinish, nzs_2728)),not(is(aluminium,prePainted))))))
PARAPHRASE: If aluminum is used for the manufacture of pressed metal tiles and flashing systems, then the aluminum shall comply with NZS 1734 and the aluminium shall have a base metal thickness of at least 0.7 mm, the aluminium shall be a minimum of 5000 series, and the alumenium shall either be pre-painted and have a factory-applied finish complying with NZS 2728 or the aluminium shall not be pre-painted.

TEXT: 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles; The minimum roof pitches for metal tiles where rafter length does not exceed 12 m shall be limited to: a) 12° (1:4.75) for profiles resembling standard profiles, and b) 15° (1:3.75) for profiles resembling shingle or shake profiles.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, pressedMetalTile),has(roof, rafter),lessThanEqual(rafter.length, 12 m))), then(or(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch, 12 deg)), obligation(is(cladding.profile, standardProfile))), and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch, 15 deg)), obligation(is(cladding.profile, or(shingleProfile, shakeProfile))))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof cladding is pressed metal tiles and the rafter length does not exceed 12 m, then the minimum roof pitches for metal tiles shall be limited to 12 deg for profiles resembling standard profiles and 15 deg for profiles resembling shingle or shake profiles.

TEXT: 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles; The minimum roof pitches for metal tiles where rafter length does not exceed 12 m shall be limited to: a) 12° (1:4.75) for profiles resembling standard profiles, and b) 15° (1:3.75) for profiles resembling shingle or shake profiles.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, and(pressedMetalTile, rafter)),lessThanEqual(rafter.length, 12 m))), then(or(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,12 deg),is(cladding.profile,standardProfile))), obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,15 deg),is(cladding.profile,or(shingleProfile,shakeProfile))))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has pressed metal tiles and a rafter, and the rafter length does not exceed 12 m, then the minimum roof pitches shall be limited to 12 deg for profiles resembling standard profiles and 15 deg for profiles resembling shingle or shake profiles.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Clip fixings for trough profiles and spans as shown in Table 13 shall be as shown in Figure 40, and shall: a) Have a minimum BMT of 0.9 mm b) Be a minimum width of 30 mm c) Be made from a material compatible with the cladding, refer to Tables 20 and 21 d) Have clips fastened with a minimum of two 10-gauge by 30 mm waferhead hot-dipped galvanised screws which comply with Class 3 of AS 3566: Part 2.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), has(roofCladding, fixing), is(fixing.type, clip),is(roofCladding.profile, trough), asPer(roofCladding.span, nzbc_e2as1_t20))), then(obligation(and(asPer(fixing, nzbc_e2as1_f40),greaterThanEqual(fixing.baseMetalThickness, 0.9 mm),greaterThanEqual(fixing.width,30 mm),has(fixing.material, compatibility),towards(compatibility, roofCladding),complyWith(fixing.material, and(nzbc_e2as1_t20,nzbc_e2as1_t21)),has(fixing, clip),is(clip.fastener, screw),greaterThanEqual(count(screw),2),is(screw.size,10 gauge),is(screw.length,30 mm),is(screw.type,and(waferhead,hotDippedGalvanised)),complyWith(screw,as_3566_2_class_3))))
PARAPHRASE: If the Profiled Metal Roof Cladding has clip fixings and the roof cladding profile is trough and the roof cladding span is as shown in E2/AS1 Table 13, then the fixing shall be as shown in Figure 40, and the fixing shall have a minimum base metal thickness of 0.9 mm, and the fixing shall be a minimum width of 30 mm, and the fixing shall be a material compatible with the roof cladding, for the fixing material refer to Tables 20 and 21, and the fixing shall have clips fastened with a minimum of two screws, the screws are 10-gauge size and 30 mm length waferhead hot-dipped galvanised and the screws comply with Class 3 of AS 3566: Part 2.
AUTHOR: Stefan
