TEXT: Membranes composed of butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates; Plywood shall be: a) A minimum of 17 mm complying with AS/NZS 2269, b) At least CD Grade Structural plywood with the sanded C face upwards, and c) H3 with treatment type compatible with membrane and adhesives used.
LRML: if(and(above(membrane, substrate), is(substrate.material, plywood))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(plywood.thickness,17 mm),complyWith(plywood,nzs_2269),is(plywood.grade,cd),is(plywood.type,structural),is(plywood.sandedC_face,upward),is(plywood.treatment,h3),has(plywood.treatment,compatibility),include(compatibility,and(membrane,adhesive)))))
PARAPHRASE: Membranes composed of butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates; Plywood shall be: a) A minimum of 17 mm complying with AS/NZS 2269, b) At least CD Grade Structural plywood with the sanded C face upwards, and c) H3 with treatment type compatible with membrane and adhesives used.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Materials for flashings, gutters and fixings shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.0, and: a) Be selected from Table 20 to minimise corrosion, and b) Be compatible with mortar and bedding in accordance with Table 21 and Table 22.
LRML: if(for(material, and(flashing, gutter, fixing))), then(obligation(and(asPer(material,'nzbc_e2as1_4.0'),asPer(material, nzbc_e2as1_t20),include(material.compatibility,and(mortar,bedding)),asPer(material.compatibility,and(nzbc_e2as1_t21,nzbc_e2as1_t22)))))
PARAPHRASE: If materials are for flashings, gutters or fixings, then the material shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.0, and the material shall be selected from Table 20, and the material shall be compatible with mortar and bedding in accordance with Table 21 and Table 22.
COMMENTS:
for material?
compatibility include or towards or inbetween?

TEXT: Masonry tile roofs with underlays shall have anti-ponding boards installed to Figure 25. Where anti-ponding boards are used, these shall be set to a minimum fall of 5° (1:12), and shall be treated minimum H1.2 for solid timber and H3 for plywood.
LRML: if(and(is(roof.type, masonryTile), has(roof, underlay))), then(obligation(and(has(roof ,antiPondingBoard),greaterThanEqual(antiPondingBoard.fall, 5 deg),or(and(is(antiPondingBoard.material, timber),greaterThanEqual(timber.treatmentClass,'h1.2')),and(is(antiPondingBoard.material ,plywood),greaterThanEqual(plywood.treatmentClass, h3))))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof type is masonry tile and the roof has an underlay, then the roof shall have anti-ponding boards installed to Figure 25. Where anti-ponding boards are used, these shall be set to a minimum fall of 5° (1:12), and shall be treated minimum H1.2 for solid timber and H3 for plywood.

TEXT: Masonry tile roofs with underlays shall have anti-ponding boards installed to Figure 25. Where anti-ponding boards are used, these shall be set to a minimum fall of 5° (1:12), and shall be treated minimum H1.2 for solid timber and H3 for plywood.
LRML: if(and(is(roof.type, masonryTile), has(roof, underlay))), then(obligation(and(has(roof ,antiPondingBoard),asPer(antiPondingBoard.installation, nzbc_e2as1_f25),greaterThanEqual(antiPondingBoard.fall, 5 deg),or(and(is(antiPondingBoard.material, timber),greaterThanEqual(timber.treatment,'h1.2')),and(is(antiPondingBoard.material ,plywood),greaterThanEqual(plywood.treatmentClass, h3))))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof type is masonry tile and the roof has an underlay, then the roof shall have anti-ponding boards installed to Figure 25 and the anti-ponding boards shall have a minimum fall of 5 deg, and the anti-ponding boards shall be treated minimum H1.2 for solid timber and H3 for plywood.

TEXT: Masonry tile roofs with underlays shall have anti-ponding boards installed to Figure 25. Where anti-ponding boards are used, these shall be set to a minimum fall of 5° (1:12), and shall be treated minimum H1.2 for solid timber and H3 for plywood.
LRML: if(and(is(roof.type, masonryTile), has(roof, underlay))), then(obligation(and(has(roof ,antiPondingBoard),asPer(antiPondingBoard.installation, nzbc_e2as1_f25),greaterThanEqual(antiPondingBoard.fall, 5 deg),or(and(is(antiPondingBoard.material, timber),greaterThanEqual(timber.treatment,'h1.2')),and(is(antiPondingBoard.material ,plywood),greaterThanEqual(plywood.treatmentClass, h3))))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof type is masonry tile and the roof has an underlay, then the roof shall have anti-ponding boards installed to Figure 25 and the anti-ponding boards shall have a minimum fall of 5 deg, and either the anti-ponding boards shall be treated minimum H1.2 and material solid timber or the anti-ponding boards shall be treated minimum H3 and be material plywood.

TEXT: 8.4.10 Allowance for expansion; Allowance shall be made for expansion of corrugated and trapezoidal roof cladding as shown in Table 16.
LRML: if(is(roofCladding, or(corrugated, trapezoidal))), then(obligation(asPer(roofCladding.expansionAllowance,nzbc_e2as1_t16)))
PARAPHRASE: If roof cladding is corrugated or trapezoidal, then the roof cladding shall have allowance for expansion as shown in Table 16.

TEXT: Preformed compressible seals shall not be used at the eaves.
LRML: if(exist(eave)), then(prohibition(and(has(eave, seal),is(seal.type, and(preformed, compressible)))))
PARAPHRASE: If eaves exist, the eave shall not have preformed compressible seals.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Valley gutters shall be in accordance with catchment areas shown in Table 8, and as shown in Figure 51 and Paragraph 8.1.6.2.
LRML: if(is(gutter.type, valley)), then(obligation(and(asPer(gutter,catchmentArea),asPer(catchmentArea,nzbc_e2as1_t8),complyWith(gutter,and(nzbc_e2as1_f51,'nzbc_e2as1_8.1.6.2')))))
PARAPHRASE: Valley gutters shall be in accordance with catchment areas shown in Table 8, and as shown in Figure 51 and Paragraph 8.1.6.2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.17 Roof penetrations; The maximum length of profiled roof cladding above penetrations shall be as shown in Table 17.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), has(roofCladding, penetration))), then(obligation(and(above(cladding.length, penetration),asPer(max(cladding.length),nzbc_e2as1_t17))))

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; The edge of roofing penetrations over 200 mm wide shall be supported in either direction with additional framing as shown in Figure 21.

PARAPHRASE: If profiled metal roof cladings have penetrations and the penetration is over 200 mm wide, the edge of the penetration shall have for each direction framing as support, the framing shall be as shown in Figure 21.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.17 Roof penetrations; Roof penetrations shall be flashed as follows: a) Pipe penetrations up to 85 mm shall be flashed using an EPDM boot flashing as shown in Figure 53, b) Pipe penetrations up to 500 mm shall be flashed using a soaker flashing and EPDM boot flashing as shown in Figure 54, c) Rectangular penetrations up to 1200 mm wide shall be flashed using a soaker type flashing as shown in Figure 55.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.application, roof), is(cladding.system, profiledMetal), has(roof, penetration))), then(or(obligation(and(is(penetration.type,pipe),lessThanEqual(penetration.width,85 mm),has(penetration,flashing),is(flashing.type,epdmBoot))), obligation(and(is(penetration.type,pipe),lessThanEqual(penetration.width,500 mm),has(penetration,flashing),is(flashing.type,and(soaker,epdmBoot)))), obligation(and(is(penetration.type,rectangular),lessThanEqual(penetration.width,1200 mm),has(penetration,flashing),is(flashing.type,soaker)))))
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.17 Roof penetrations; Roof penetrations shall be flashed as follows: a) Pipe penetrations up to 85 mm shall be flashed using an EPDM boot flashing as shown in Figure 53, b) Pipe penetrations up to 500 mm shall be flashed using a soaker flashing and EPDM boot flashing as shown in Figure 54, c) Rectangular penetrations up to 1200 mm wide shall be flashed using a soaker type flashing as shown in Figure 55.
LRML: if(and(is(roof.type, profiledMetal), has(roof, penetration))), then(or(obligation(and(is(penetration.type,pipe),lessThanEqual(penetration.width,85 mm),has(penetration,flashing),is(flashing.type, epdmBoot),asPer(flashing, nzbc_e2as1_f53))), obligation(and(is(penetration.type,pipe),lessThanEqual(penetration.width,500 mm),has(penetration,flashing),is(flashing.type,and(soaker,epdmBoot)),asPer(flashing, nzbc_e2as1_f54))), obligation(and(is(penetration.type,rectangular),lessThanEqual(penetration.width,1200 mm),has(penetration,flashing),is(flashing.type,soaker),asPer(flashing, nzbc_e2as1_f55)))))
PARAPHRASE: If Profiled Metal Roof Cladding have penetrations, the penetrations shall be either for pipes and the penetrations shall be up to 85 mm wide shall and have an EPDM boot flashing as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 53, or the penetrations shall be for pipes and the penetration is up to 500 mm wide shall have a soaker flashing and EPDM boot flashing as shown in Figure 54, or the enetrations shall be rectangular and up to 1200 mm wide and have a soaker type flashing as shown in Figure 55.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Metal roof cladding and flashings shall be selected according to the exposure conditions in Table 20 as defined in: a) NZS 3604, or b) AS/NZS 2728.
LRML: if(or(is(roofCladding.material, metal), is(flashing.material, metal))), then(obligation(and(has(cladding.material,dependency),has(flashing.material,dependency),is(dependency,exposureCondition),asPer(exposureCondition,nzbc_e2as1_t20),within(exposureCondition.definition,or(nzs_3604,nzs_2728)))))
PARAPHRASE: Metal roof cladding and flashings shall be selected according to the exposure conditions in Table 20 as defined in: a) NZS 3604, or b) AS/NZS 2728.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Metal roof cladding and flashings shall be selected according to the exposure conditions in Table 20 as defined in: a) NZS 3604, or b) AS/NZS 2728.
LRML: if(or(is(roofCladding.material, metal), is(flashing.material, metal))), then(obligation(and(asPer(metal,exposureCondition),asPer(exposureCondition, nzbc_e2as1_t20),asPer(exposureCondition.definition,or(nzs_3604,nzs_2728)))))

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.3.3 Aluminium; Aluminium for the manufacture of profiled aluminium roofing shall comply with AS/NZS 1734, and be a minimum: a) Base metal thickness (BMT) of 0.7 mm, b) 5000 series.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding.material, aluminium))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(cladding.material,nzs_1734),greaterThanEqual(aluminium.bmt,0.7 mm),is(min(aluminium.type),5000 series))))
PARAPHRASE: Aluminium for the manufacture of profiled aluminium roofing shall comply with AS/NZS 1734, and be a minimum: a) Base metal thickness (BMT) of 0.7 mm, b) 5000 series.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.0 Roof Claddings 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles; The minimum roof pitches for metal tiles where rafter length exceeds 12 m, increase minimum pitch (Rule 8.3.5.0.2) by 1° per additional 0.5 m.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, and(pressedMetalTile, rafter)),greaterThan(rafter.length, 12 m))), then(obligation(and(asPer(value, 'nzbc_e2as1_8.3.5.0.2'), define(rafter.length, x0),greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch, 'value + (x0 - 12) / 0.5'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has pressed metal tiles and a rafter, and the rafter length exceeds 12 m, then the roof pitch shall be the value from E2/AS1 Rule 8.3.5.0.2 plus 1 deg per additional 0.5 m rafter length.

TEXT: Pressed metal tiles shall be fixed as shown in Figure 33, with: a) 50 x 2.8 mm hot-dipped galvanized painted flat-head annular-grooved nails.
LRML: if(exist(pressedMetalTile)), then(obligation(and(asPer(pressedMetalTile.fixing, nzbc_e2as1_f33),by(pressedMetalTile.fixing,nail),is(nail.type,and(flatHead, annularGrooved)),is(nail,and(hotDippedGalvanised,painted)),is(nail.dimension,' 50 x 2.8 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If pressed metal tiles exist,then the pressed metal tiles shall be fixed as shown in Figure 33, with: a) 50 x 2.8 mm hot-dipped galvanized painted flat-head annular-grooved nails.

TEXT: Pressed metal tiles shall be fixed as shown in Figure 33, with: a) 50 x 2.8 mm hot-dipped galvanized painted flat-head annular-grooved nails.
LRML: if(exist(pressedMetalTile)), then(obligation(and(asPer(pressedMetalTile.fixing, nzbc_e2as1_f33),by(pressedMetalTile.fixing, nail),is(nail.type,and(flatHead, annularGrooved)),is(nail,and(hotDippedGalvanised,painted)),is(nail.dimension,' 50 x 2.8 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If pressed metal tiles exist,then the pressed metal tiles shall be fixed as shown in Figure 33, with nails type flat-head annular-grooved, and the nails are hot-dipped galvanized and painted, and the nails are dimension 50 x 2.8 mm.

TEXT: Pressed metal tiles; For fixings through the top of the tiles, use neoprene washers containing no more than 15% by weight carbon black content.
LRML: if(has(pressedMetalTile.top, fixing)), then(and(obligation(include(fixing, neopreneWasher)), obligation(lessThanEqual(neopreneWasher.carbonBlackContent, 15 percent))))
PARAPHRASE: If the top of the pressed metal tile has a fixing, the fixing

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.10 Allowance for expansion of corrugated and trapezoidal roof cladding; Where Table 16 requires profiled washers, allowance shall be made for expansion by: a) Fixing the top 50% (closest to the ridge) with conventional fixings, and b) Fixing the lower 50% with sealing washers fixed over profiled washers as shown in Figure 39, and: i) using oversized holes, and ii) positioning fixing in centre of hole.
LRML: if(asPer(roof.profiledWasher, nzbc_e2as1_t16)), then(obligation(and(has(cladding,expansionJoint),has(cladding.topHalf,conventionalFixing),has(cladding.bottomHalf,fixing),by(fixing,sealingWasher),over(sealingWasher.fixing,profiledWasher),has(cladding.crest,hole),is(hole,oversized),has(hole.centre,positioningFixing))))
PARAPHRASE: If E2/AS1 Table 16 requires profiled washers for the roof, then expansion should be allowed by: a) Fixing the top 50% (closest to the ridge) with conventional fixings, and b) Fixing the lower 50% with sealing washers fixed over profiled washers as shown in Figure 39, and: i) using oversized holes, and ii) positioning the fixing in the center of the hole.

TEXT: 8.4.10 Allowance for expansion of corrugated and trapezoidal roof cladding; Where Table 16 requires profiled washers, allowance shall be made for expansion by: a) Fixing the top 50% (closest to the ridge) with conventional fixings, and b) Fixing the lower 50% with sealing washers fixed over profiled washers as shown in Figure 39, and: i) using oversized holes, and ii) positioning fixing in centre of hole.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding, or(corrugated, trapezoidal)),asPer(roofCladding.profiledWasher, nzbc_e2as1_t16))), then(obligation(and(by(roofCladding.expansionAllowance, fixing),equal(roofCladding.top, 50 percent),has(roofCladding.top, fixing),is(fixing.type, conventional),equal(roofCladding.bottom, 50 percent),has(roofCladding.bottom, fixing),is(fixing.type, sealingWasher),above(sealingWasher, profiledWasher),asPer(sealingWasher, nzbc_e2as1_t16),has(roofCladding, penetration),is(penetration, oversized),has(penetration, centre),is(fixing.location, centre))))
PARAPHRASE: If E2/AS1 Table 16 requires profiled washers for the roof, then expansion should be allowed by: a) Fixing the top 50% with conventional fixings, and b) Fixing the lower 50% with sealing washers fixed over profiled washers as shown in Figure 39, and: i) using oversized holes, and ii) positioning the fixing in the center of the hole.
COMMENTS:
hole/penetration
separate top and bottom fixings!

TEXT: 8.4.10 Allowance for expansion of corrugated and trapezoidal roof cladding; Where Table 16 requires profiled washers, allowance shall be made for expansion by: a) Fixing the top 50% (closest to the ridge) with conventional fixings, and b) Fixing the lower 50% with sealing washers fixed over profiled washers as shown in Figure 39, and: i) using oversized holes, and ii) positioning fixing in centre of hole.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding, or(corrugated, trapezoidal)),asPer(roofCladding.profiledWasher, nzbc_e2as1_t16))), then(obligation(and(by(roofCladding.expansionAllowance, fixing),equal(roofCladding.top, 50 percent),has(roofCladding.top, fixing),is(fixing.type, conventional),equal(roofCladding.bottom, 50 percent),has(roofCladding.bottom, fixing),is(fixing.type, sealingWasher),above(sealingWasher, profiledWasher),asPer(sealingWasher, nzbc_e2as1_t16),has(roofCladding, penetration),is(penetration, oversized),has(penetration, centre),is(fixing.location, centre))))
PARAPHRASE: If E2/AS1 Table 16 requires profiled washers for the roof, then expansion should be allowed by having fixings and the roof cladding's top 50 percent shall have conventional fixings, and the roof cladding's bottom 50 percent shall have sealing washer fixings over profiled washers and the sealing wahsers as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 39, and the roof cladding penetrations shall be oversized and the fixing located in the center of the penetration.
COMMENTS:
hole/penetration
separate top and bottom fixings!

TEXT: 4.0 Flashings 4.6.1.7 Inter-storey junctions; Overlap cover of the cladding to the flashing upstand, and clearance from the bottom of the cladding to the top of the slope of the head flashing, shall be in accordance with Table 7.

TEXT: 6.5 Membrane cappings; Butyl rubber and EPDM cappings shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.3.9, and comply with the following requirements: a) Tops of membrane cappings shall be free of any penetrations, and shall have a minimum slope of 10° (1:6).

TEXT: 8.4.10 Allowance for expansion of corrugated and trapezoidal roof cladding; Where Table 16 requires profiled washers, allowance shall be made for expansion by: a) Fixing the top 50% (closest to the ridge) with conventional fixings, and b) Fixing the lower 50% with sealing washers fixed over profiled washers as shown in Figure 39, and: i) using oversized holes, and ii) positioning fixing in centre of hole.

TEXT: The roofing shall be flashed at all boundaries to comply with the following: a) At edges discharging to gutters with eaves flashings where required in Figure 45(a) b) Soft edge to cover flashings complying with Paragraph 4.6. Refer to Figure 41 for example of use and Tables 21 and 22.c) Notched turn-downs to cover flashings shall comply with Paragraph 4.6. Refer to Figure 42 for example of use. d) Materials for flashings shall be compatible with the roof cladding material as per Table 21 and Table 22, and shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.3. e) Provide expansion joints in accordance with Paragraph 4.5.2.
LRML: if(exist(roof)), then(and(obligation(has(roof.boundary, flashing)),obligation(and(has(roof.edge, discharge),towards(discharge, gutter),has(roof.edge, flashing),is(flashing.type, eave),asPer(flashing, 'nzbc_e2as1_f45.a'))),obligation(and(is(flashing.cover, softEdge),has(roof,softEdgeflashing),complyWith(softEdge, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.6'))),obligation(and(is(flashing.cover, notchedTurnDown),complyWith(notchedTurnDown,'nzbc_e2as1_4.6'),)),obligation(and(define(flashing.material, x0),has(roof, roofCladding),define(roofCladding.material, x1),inBetween(compatibility, and(x0, x1)),asPer(compatibility, and(nzbc_e2as1_t21,nzbc_e2as1_t22,'nzbc_e2as1_4.3')))),obligation(and(has(flashing,expansionJoint),complyWith(expansionJoint,'nzbc_e2as1_4.5.2')))))

The flashing shall have soft edge as cover, and the soft edge shall comply with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.6. The flashing shall have notched turn-downs as cover, and the notched turn-downs shall comply with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.6. Materials for flashings shall be compatible with the roof cladding material as per E2/AS1 Table 21 and Table 22 and Paragraph 4.3. TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Materials for the manufacture of profiled steel roof cladding shall: a) have a BMT of 0.4 mm minimum b) be grade G550, or G300 for rolled, crimped, or trough profile roofing c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding.material, steel))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(steel.bmt, 0.4 mm)), obligation(or(and(is(steel.grade,g550),not(is(roofCladding.profile,and(rolled,crimped,trough)))),and(is(steel.grade,g300),is(roofCladding.profile,or(rolled,crimped,trough))))), obligation(and(for(steel.corrosionProtection, exposureZone),asPer(exposureZone, nzbc_e2as1_t20)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the material of profiled metal roof claddings is steel, the steel shall: a) have a BMT of 0.4 mm minimum. The steel shall be grade G550 and not for rolled, crimped, or trough profile roof cladding, or the steel shall be grade G300 and rolled, crimped, or trough profile roof cladding. The steel shall be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.3.3 Aluminium; Aluminium for the manufacture of profiled aluminium roofing shall comply with AS/NZS 1734, and be a minimum: a) Base metal thickness (BMT) of 0.7 mm, b) 5000 series.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.4 Profiles; Profiles covered in this Acceptable Solution are shown in Figure 38, and consist of: a) Corrugated – curved with a crest height of 16.5 mm minimum, b) Trapezoidal – symmetrical or asymmetrical with a minimum crest height of 19 mm, and for asymmetrical a flat or lightly profiled pan width of 210 mm maximum between crests, and c) Trough profile – with vertical ribs at a minimum height of 38 mm, and flat or lightly profiled pans of 210 mm maximum between crests.

PARAPHRASE: If Profiled Metal Roof Cladding have profiles as shown in Figure 38, and the roof cladding profile is either corrugated and curved with a crest height of 16.5 mm minimum, or the roof cladding profile is trapezoidal and symmetrical with a minimum crest height of 19 mm or the roof cladding profile is trapezoidal and asymmetrical with a minimum crest height of 19 mm and have a flat or lightly profiled pan width of 210 mm maximum between crests, or the roof cladding profile is trough with vertically oriented ribs at a minimum height of 38 mm, and flat or lightly profiled pans of 210 mm maximum between crests, then E2/AS1 applies to the roof cladding.
AUTHOR: Stefan

The flashing shall have soft edge as cover, and the soft edge shall comply with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.6. The flashing shall have notched turn-downs as cover, and the notched turn-downs shall  comply with E2/AS1  Paragraph 4.6. d) Materials for flashings shall be compatible with the roof cladding material as per E2/AS1 Table 21 and Table 22, and shall be in accordance with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.3. e) Provide expansion joints in accordance with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.5.2.

TEXT: Prevent sagging of roof underlay by either: For R1 underlays, fully support with a corrosion resistant material • For R2 self supporting underlays, laid to maximum 1.2 metre span between adjacent supports.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; 8.4.14 Turn-downs at gutters; The lower ends of trapezoidal and trough profile roofing shall be turned down at gutters, where the roof pitch is less than 10°. The turn-down shall be 30° from the plane of the sheet.

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; 8.4.14 Turn-downs at gutters; The lower ends of trapezoidal and trough profile roofing shall be turned down at gutters, where the roof pitch is less than 10°. The turn-down shall be 30° from the plane of the sheet.

softEdge, notchedTurnDown
asPer vs in accordance...

TEXT: Parapets shall be capped with metal, butyl or EPDM membrane. Cappings shall comply with the requirements of Paragraph 4.0.

PARAPHRASE: If parapets have cappings, then the capping material shall be metal, butyl or EPDM membrane. Cappings shall comply with the requirements of Paragraph 4.0.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades. i) Where both ends of a capping are constrained, allowance shall be made for expansion.
LRML: if(and(is(capping.material, metal), above(capping.installation, and(parapet, balustrade)), is(balustrade, enclosed),loop(forEach(capping.end),is(capping.end, constrained)))), then(obligation(has(capping, expansionAllowance)))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades. i) Where both ends of a capping are constrained, allowance shall be made for expansion.

PARAPHRASE: If metal cappings are installed over parapets and enclosed balustrade and each ends of a capping is constrained, then the capping shall have expansion allowance.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 6.5 Membrane cappings; Butyl rubber and EPDM cappings shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.3.9, and comply with the following requirements: a) Tops of membrane cappings shall be free of any penetrations, and shall have a minimum slope of 10° (1:6).

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Cappings formed by using stucco, EIFS and flush-finished fibre cement materials shall not be used for parapets, (but may be used for enclosed balustrades as described in Paragraph 7.4).
LRML: if(is(capping.material, or(stucco, eifs, flushFinishedFibreCement))), then(and(prohibition(for(capping, parapet)), permission(and(include(capping.usage, balustrade), is(balustrade, enclosed)))))

TEXT: The level of the upper surface of the slatted deck: a) Shall be a minimum of 50 mm below the threshold level for cantilevered decks as shown in Figures 14(b) and 16.
LRML: if(is(deck, and(slatted, cantilevered))), then(obligation(and(define(deck.thresholdLevel, x0),lessThanEqual(deck.upperSurfaceLevel, 'x0 - 50 mm'),from(height.measurement,x0),to(height.measurement,x1),greaterThanEqual(height, 50 mm))))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 7.1.1 Slatted decks; The level of the upper surface of the slatted deck: May be at the same level as the threshold for non-cantilevered decks that are formed as shown in Figure 14(c).
LRML: if(and(is(deck, slatted), not(is(deck, cantilevered)),asPer(deck, 'nzbc_e2as1_f14.c'))), then(permission(and(define(deck.thresholdLevel, x0),equal(deck.upperSurfaceLevel, x1))))
PARAPHRASE: If the deck is slatted and not cantilevered and as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 14.c, then the deck's upper surface level may be equal to the deck's threshold level.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: For slatted decks, a minimum gap of 12 mm shall be provided between the exterior wall and the adjacent decking slat.

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.17 Roof penetrations; The maximum length of profiled roof cladding above penetrations shall be as shown in Table 17.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; The edge of roofing penetrations over 200 mm wide shall be supported in either direction with additional framing as shown in Figure 21.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.application, roof), is(cladding.system, profiledMetal), has(roof, penetration), greaterThan(penetration.width, 200 mm))), then(obligation(and(has(penetration.edge,support),is(support,additionalFraming))))

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.17 Roof penetrations; Roof penetrations shall be flashed as follows: a) Pipe penetrations up to 85 mm shall be flashed using an EPDM boot flashing as shown in Figure 53, b) Pipe penetrations up to 500 mm shall be flashed using a soaker flashing and EPDM boot flashing as shown in Figure 54, c) Rectangular penetrations up to 1200 mm wide shall be flashed using a soaker type flashing as shown in Figure 55.
LRML: if(and(is(roof.type, profiledMetal), has(roof, penetration))), then(or(obligation(and(is(penetration.type,pipe),lessThanEqual(penetration.width,85 mm),has(penetration,flashing),is(flashing.type, epdmBoot),asPer(flashing, nzbc_e2as1_f53))), obligation(and(is(penetration.type,pipe),lessThanEqual(penetration.width,500 mm),has(penetration,flashing),is(flashing.type,and(soaker,epdmBoot)),asPer(flashing, nzbc_e2as1_f54))), obligation(and(is(penetration.type,rectangular),lessThanEqual(penetration.width,1200 mm),has(penetration,flashing),is(flashing.type,soaker),asPer(flashing, nzbc_e2as1_f55)))))
PARAPHRASE: If Profiled Metal Roof Cladding have penetrations, the penetrations shall be either for pipes and the penetrations shall be up to 85 mm wide shall and have an EPDM boot flashing as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 53, or the penetrations shall be for pipes and the penetration is up to 500 mm wide shall have a soaker flashing and EPDM boot flashing as shown in Figure 54, or the enetrations shall be rectangular and up to 1200 mm wide and have a soaker type flashing as shown in Figure 55.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Materials for the manufacture of profiled steel roof cladding shall: a) have a BMT of 0.4 mm minimum b) be grade G550, or G300 for rolled, crimped, or trough profile roofing c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding.material, steel))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(steel.baseMetalThickness, 0.4 mm)), obligation(or(and(is(steel.grade,g550),not(is(roofCladding.profile,and(rolled,crimped,trough)))),and(is(steel.grade,g300),is(roofCladding.profile,or(rolled,crimped,trough))))), obligation(and(for(steel.corrosionProtection, exposureZone),asPer(exposureZone, nzbc_e2as1_t20)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the material of profiled metal roof claddings is steel, the steel shall: a) have a BMT of 0.4 mm minimum. The steel shall be grade G550 and not for rolled, crimped, or trough profile roof cladding, or the steel shall be grade G300 and rolled, crimped, or trough profile roof cladding. The steel shall be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.3.3 Aluminium; Aluminium for the manufacture of profiled aluminium roofing shall comply with AS/NZS 1734, and be a minimum: a) Base metal thickness (BMT) of 0.7 mm, b) 5000 series.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding.material, aluminium))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(cladding.material,nzs_1734),greaterThanEqual(aluminium.baseMetalThickness,0.7 mm),greaterThanEqual(aluminium.grade, 5000 series))))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Pre-painted aluminium roofing shall have a factory-applied finish complying with AS/NZS 2728.

TEXT: 8.4.11.1 Fixing flashings b) When fixing flashings to other flashings or to roofing use: i) for galvanized steel, 4 mm diameter monel metal or stainless steel rivets, where compatible as per Table 21, ii) for aluminium-zinc coated steel, 4 mm diameter aluminium rivets, iii) for aluminium, 4 mm diameter aluminium rivets.
LRML: if(towards(flashing.fixing, or(flashing, roof))), then(or(obligation(and(is(flashing.material,galvanisedSteel),is(roof.material,galvanisedSteel),is(fixing.type,rivet),is(fixing.material,or(monelMetal,stainlessSteel)),equal(fixing.diameter,4 mm),asPer(fixing,nzbc_e2as1_t21))), obligation(and(is(flashing.material,or(aluminiumZincCoatedSteel,aluminium)),is(roof.material,or(aluminiumZincCoatedSteel,aluminium)),is(fixing.type,rivet),is(fixing.material,aluminium),equal(fixing.diameter,4 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If fixing flashings to other flashings or to the roof, either the flashing and roof shall be galvanized steel and the fixing 4 mm diameter monel metal or stainless steel rivets as per Table 21, or  the flashing and roof shall be aluminium-zinc coated steel or aluminium, and the fixings shall be 4 mm diameter aluminium rivets.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4.13 Stopends; The top ends of profiled metal roof cladding shall have stopends as shown in Figure 49 for trapezoidal and trough profile metal roof cladding, where: a) The roof pitch is less than 25°, or b) The building is in a High/Very High/Extra High wind zone.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding.profile, or(trapezoidal, trough)), or(lessThan(roof.pitch, 25 deg), is(building.windZone, or(high, veryHigh, extraHigh))))), then(obligation(and(has(cladding.topEnd, stopend), asPer(stopend, nzbc_e2as1_f49))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof cladding is profiled metal and the roof cladding have trapezoidal and trough profile and the roof pitch is less than 25°, or the building is in a High, Very High, or Extra High wind zone, then the roof claddings top ends shall have stopends as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 49.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.0 Roof Claddings 8.1.4 Fixings; Fixings shall be as specified in Paragraph 8.2 to Paragraph 8.5. Materials for fixing roof claddings and flashings, where necessary, shall be selected from Tables 20, 21 and 22 to minimise corrosion.
LRML: if(or(has(cladding, fixing), has(flashing, fixing))), then(obligation(and(asPer(fixing, and('nzbc_e2as1_8.1.2 to nzbc_e2as1_8.5')),asPer(fixing.material,and(nzbc_e2as1_t20, nzbc_e2as1_t21, nzbc_e2as1_t22)))))

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Pre-painted aluminium roofing shall have a factory-applied finish complying with AS/NZS 2728.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.4 Profiles; Profiles covered in this Acceptable Solution are shown in Figure 38, and consist of: a) Corrugated – curved with a crest height of 16.5 mm minimum, b) Trapezoidal – symmetrical or asymmetrical with a minimum crest height of 19 mm, and for asymmetrical a flat or lightly profiled pan width of 210 mm maximum between crests, and c) Trough profile – with vertical ribs at a minimum height of 38 mm, and flat or lightly profiled pans of 210 mm maximum between crests.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), asPer(roofCladding.profile, nzbc_e2as1_f38),or(and(is(roofCladding.profile, and(corrugated, curved)), has(roofCladding.profile, crest), greaterThanEqual(crest.height, 16.5 mm)), and(is(roofCladding.profile, and(trapezoidal, symmetrical)), has(roofCladding.profile, crest), greaterThanEqual(crest.height, 19 mm)), and(is(roofCladding.profile, and(trapezoidal, asymmetrical)), has(roofCladding.profile, crest), greaterThanEqual(crest.height, 19 mm), has(roofCladding.profile, pan), is(pan, or(flat, lightlyProfiled)), inBetween(pan.width, crests), lessThanEqual(pan.width, 210 mm)), and(is(roofCladding.profile, trough), has(roofCladding.profile, rib), is(rib.orientation, vertical),greaterThanEqual(rib.height, 38 mm), has(roofCladding.profile, pan), is(pan, or(flat, lightlyProfiled)), inBetween(pan.width, crests), lessThanEqual(pan.width, 210 mm))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, roofCladding))
PARAPHRASE: If Profiled Metal Roof Cladding have profiles as shown in Figure 38, and the roof cladding profile is either corrugated and curved with a crest height of 16.5 mm minimum, or the roof cladding profile is trapezoidal and symmetrical with a minimum crest height of 19 mm or the roof cladding profile is trapezoidal and asymmetrical with a minimum crest height of 19 mm and have a flat or lightly profiled pan width of 210 mm maximum between crests, or the roof cladding profile is trough with vertically oriented ribs at a minimum height of 38 mm, and flat or lightly profiled pans of 210 mm maximum between crests, then E2/AS1 applies to the roof cladding.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.5 Roof pitch; For roofs up to 18 metres in length without end laps, pitches shall be: a) Corrugated – not less than 8° (1:7). b) Trapezoidal – not less than: i) 4° (1:14) where the crest height is less than 27 mm, or ii) 3° (1:20) where the crest height is 27 mm or higher. c) Trough profile – not less than 3° (1:20).

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.5 Roof pitch; For roofs up to 18 metres in length without end laps, pitches shall be: a) Corrugated – not less than 8° (1:7). b) Trapezoidal – not less than: i) 4° (1:14) where the crest height is less than 27 mm, or ii) 3° (1:20) where the crest height is 27 mm or higher. c) Trough profile – not less than 3° (1:20).
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), lessThanEqual(roof.length, 18 m), not(include(roof.length, endLap)))), then(or(obligation(and(is(roofCladding.profile,corrugated),greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,8 deg))), obligation(and(is(roofCladding.profile,trapezoidal),greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,4 deg),has(roofCladding,crest),lessThan(crest.height,27 mm))), obligation(and(is(roofCladding.profile,trapezoidal),greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,3 deg),has(roofCladding,crest),greaterThanEqual(crest.height,27 mm))), obligation(and(is(roofCladding.profile,trough),greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,3 deg)))))
PARAPHRASE:
If roofs are up to 18 metres in length and the roof length does not include end laps, either roof claddings shall be corrugated and roof pitches shall be not less than 8 deg. Or, roof claddings shall be trapezoidal and roof pitches shall be not less than 4 deg and the roof cladding's crest height is less than 27 mm. Or, roof claddings shall be trapezoidal and roof pitches shall be not less than 3 deg and the roof cladding's crest height is 27 mm or higher. Or, roof claddings profile shall be trough and roof pitches shall be not less than 3 deg.
b) Trapezoidal – not less than: i) 4° (1:14) where the crest height is less than 27 mm, or ii) 3° (1:20) where the crest height is 27 mm or higher. c) Trough profile – not less than 3° (1:20).
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.1.6.1 Internal gutters; Internal gutters shall: d) Be constructed to at least the minimum dimensions shown in Figure 52, or the capacity calculated to E1/AS1 plus an additional freeboard depth of 20 mm minimum.

TEXT: Drainage of roof water 8.1.6.1 Internal gutters; Internal gutters shall: For roofs other than membrane roofs: e) Discharge into a rainwater head as shown in Figure 63 (a) and (b).

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.17 Roof penetrations; Roof penetrations shall be flashed as follows: a) Pipe penetrations up to 85 mm shall be flashed using an EPDM boot flashing as shown in Figure 53, b) Pipe penetrations up to 500 mm shall be flashed using a soaker flashing and EPDM boot flashing as shown in Figure 54, c) Rectangular penetrations up to 1200 mm wide shall be flashed using a soaker type flashing as shown in Figure 55.

PARAPHRASE: If Profiled Metal Roof Cladding have penetrations, the penetrations shall be either for pipes and the penetrations shall be up to 85 mm wide shall and have an EPDM boot flashing as shown in Figure 53, or the penetrations shall be for pipes and the penetration is up to 500 mm wide shall be flashed using a soaker flashing and EPDM boot flashing as shown in Figure 54, c) Rectangular penetrations up to 1200 mm wide shall be flashed using a soaker type flashing as shown in Figure 55.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Materials for the manufacture of profiled steel roof cladding shall: a) have a BMT of 0.4 mm minimum b) be grade G550, or G300 for rolled, crimped, or trough profile roofing c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.

The steel shall be grade G550 and not for rolled, crimped, or trough profile roof cladding, or the steel shall be grade G300 and rolled, crimped, or trough profile roof cladding. TEXT: Where the roof finishes within the length of an adjacent wall, a kick-out or stopend as detailed in Figure 8B shall be provided to direct water out from the wall cladding onto the roof cladding and gutter.

TEXT: Eaves shall be enclosed by installing soffit linings direct fixed to framing and comprising minimum 4.5 mm fibre cement sheet, or 7 mm H3 plywood, with joints, fixings and finishes as shown in Paragraphs 9.7 and 9.8.

TEXT: Soffit linings shall be finished to fascias, barges and wall claddings as outlined in Figure 8A generally, or Figure 114 for flush finished fibre cement. Wall underlays shall not be required behind soffit linings.

Behind soffit linings may be no wall underlays.

TEXT: Parapets shall be constructed as shown in Figure 10, and shall comply with the following requirements: a) Timber for framing and cavity battens shall comply with B2/AS1, b) Sloped packers under cappings shall be polystyrene or timber treated to B2/AS1, or minimum 9 mm H3 plywood on packers, and c) Framing shall be fully enclosed with wall underlay or roof underlay, in accordance with Table 23 for the specific cladding. d) claddings shall be installed over a cavity in accordance with Paragraph 9.1.8.

PARAPHRASE: If a parapet exists, the parapets shall be constructed as shown in Figure 10. a) The timber used in the parapet's framing and cavity battens shall comply with B2/AS1 b) Sloped packers under parapet cappings shall be polystyrene, timber or H3 plywood. Polystyrene and timber shall be treated to B2/AS1, and H3 plywood shall be minimum 9 mm thick. c) Framing shall be fully enclosed with wall underlay or roof underlay, in accordance with Table 23. d) Claddings shall be installed over a cavity in accordance with Paragraph 9.1.8.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The edge of roofing penetrations over 200 mm wide shall be supported in either direction with additional framing as shown in Figure 21.

TEXT: For the catchment area of the roof above the penetration as shown in Figure 22, the roof length shall be limited to: i) for profiled metal roofing, Table 17 ii) for other roof claddings, the areas shown in Table 9.

TEXT: 8.2.1 Materials; Clay tiles shall meet the requirements of AS 2049.

PARAPHRASE: If the tile material is clay, the tile shall meet the requirements of AS 2049.

TEXT: 8.2.1.1 Tile profiles; a) Type I: Double profile tiles having two distinct watercourses with a minimum watercourse depth of 18 mm.
LRML: if(is(tile.type, doubleProfile)), then(and(equal(count(tile.watercourse), 2), greaterThanEqual(watercourse.depth, 18 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: If the tile type is double profile, then the tiles having two distinct watercourses with a minimum watercourse depth of 18 mm.

TEXT: 8.2.1.1 Tile profiles; c) Type III: Tiles not fitting the Type I (Double profile) or Type II (Single profile) categories, and includes flat tiles and those resembling slates, shakes and shingles.

PARAPHRASE: If the tile type is double profile, then the tiles having two distinct watercourses with a minimum watercourse depth of 18 mm.

TEXT: Drainage of roof water; Spreaders shall: k) Be to any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.1 except 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 l) Be to Figure 20 and not be used on masonry tile roofs unless a roof underlay is installed m) Discharge directed away from roofing laps and clear of roof penetrations.

The spreader discharge shall be directed away from roofing laps and clear of roof penetrations.

TEXT: Valley gutters and hidden gutters shall be constructed as shown in Figures 50 and 51 for the applicable roof cladding (except for membrane roofing) and: a) Not change direction in plan b) Have a minimum underlap to roof cladding as specified in Figures 27, 37, 50, and 51 for the relevant roof cladding c) Be formed from any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.3 except 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 d) Be fixed at upper ends only, and be secured with a purpose-made clip system for the remaining length to enable expansion/ contraction along the length of the gutter e) Discharge into an internal gutter or eaves gutter/spouting.

TEXT: Valley gutters be minimum 250 mm wide where receiving run off from spreaders.

TEXT: Metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades. j) Where necessary, expansion joints shall be formed as shown in Figure 9 (g), and with: i) minimum 200 mm laps ii) sliding clips at both sides of the lap.

TEXT: Metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades. j) Where necessary, expansion joints shall be formed as shown in Figure 9 (g), and with: i) minimum 200 mm laps ii) sliding clips at both sides of the lap.
LRML: if(and(is(capping.material, metal), above(capping.installation, and(parapet, balustrade)), is(balustrade, enclosed))), then(obligation(and(has(capping, expansionJoint)has(expansionJoint,overlap),greaterThanEqual(overlap.length,200 mm),has(overlap.side,slidingClip))))
PARAPHRASE: If metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades, expansion joints shall be formed as shown in Figure 9 (g), and with: i) minimum 200 mm laps ii) sliding clips at both sides of the lap.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades. j) Where necessary, expansion joints shall be formed as shown in Figure 9 (g), and with: i) minimum 200 mm laps ii) sliding clips at both sides of the lap.
LRML: if(and(is(capping.material, metal), above(capping.installation, and(parapet, balustrade)), is(balustrade, enclosed))), then(obligation(and(has(capping, expansionJoint),asPer(expansionJoint, 'nzbc_e2as1_f9.g'),has(expansionJoint, lap),greaterThanEqual(lap.length,200 mm),loop(forEach(lap.side),has(lap.side, slidingClip)))))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 6.5 Membrane cappings; Butyl rubber and EPDM cappings shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.3.9, and comply with the following requirements: a) Tops of membrane cappings shall be free of any penetrations, and shall have a minimum slope of 10° (1:6).
LRML: if(is(capping.material, or(butylRubber, epdm))), then(obligation(and(asPer(capping, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.9'),define(topOf(capping), x0),not(has(x0, penetration)),greaterThanEqual(x0.slope, 10 deg))))
PARAPHRASE: If the capping material is butyl rubber or EPDM, the capping shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.3.9, and the top of the capping shall be free of any penetrations, and shall have a minimum slope of 10 deg.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Butyl rubber and EPDM cappings shall comply with the following requirements: b) Sides of membrane cappings shall overlap the wall claddings as outlined in Table 7.
LRML: if(is(capping.material, or(butylRubber, epdm))), then(obligation(and(define(capping.side, x0), is(cladding.application, wall),to(x0.overlap,cladding),asPer(x0,nzbc_e2as1_t7))))
PARAPHRASE: If cappings are material butyl rubber and EPDM, then the capping shall comply with the following requirements: b) Sides of membrane cappings shall overlap the wall claddings as outlined in Table 7.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Butyl rubber and EPDM cappings shall comply with the following requirements: b) Sides of membrane cappings shall overlap the wall claddings as outlined in Table 7.
LRML: if(is(capping.material, or(butylRubber, epdm))), then(obligation(and(has(capping, side), towards(side.lap, wallCladding),asPer(side.lap, nzbc_e2as1_t7))))
PARAPHRASE: If cappings are material butyl rubber and EPDM, then the sides of cappings shall overlap the wall claddings as outlined in Table 7.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Butyl rubber and EPDM cappings shall comply with the following requirements: Joints shall be in accordance with Paragraph 8.5.5.2.
LRML: if(is(capping.material, or(butylRubber, epdm))), then(obligation(asPer(capping.expansionJoint, 'nzbc_e2as1_8.5.5.2')))
PARAPHRASE: If cappings are material butyl rubber and EPDM, then the joints shall be in accordance with Paragraph 8.5.5.2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Cappings formed by using stucco, EIFS and flush-finished fibre cement materials shall not be used for parapets, (but may be used for enclosed balustrades as described in Paragraph 7.4).
LRML: if(is(capping.material, or(stucco, eifs, flushFinishedFibreCement))), then(and(prohibition(for(capping, parapet)), permission(and(for(capping, balustrade), is(balustrade, enclosed)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the capping material is stucco, EIFS and flush-finished fibre cement, the capping shall not be used for parapets, (but may be used for enclosed balustrades as described in Paragraph 7.4).
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.1.7 Roof penetrations; Roof penetrations shall be made weathertight in accordance with Paragraph 8.2 to Paragraph 8.5.
LRML: if(is(penetration.application, roof)), then(obligation(and(is(penetration,weathertight),complyWith(penetration,and('nzbc_e2as1_8.2 to nzbc_e2as1_8.5')))))
PARAPHRASE: Roof penetrations shall be made weathertight in accordance with E2/AS1 Paragraph 8.2 to Paragraph 8.5.

TEXT: The edge of roofing penetrations over 200 mm wide shall be supported in either direction with additional framing as shown in Figure 21.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, penetration), greaterThan(penetration.width, 200 mm))), then(obligation(and(has(penetration, edge),loop(forEach(edge.direction),is(edge.support, framing)),asPer(framing, nzbc_e2as1_f21))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has penetrations over 200 mm wide, then the edge of the penetration shall be supported in either direction with additional framing as shown in Figure 21.

TEXT: 8.2.1.1 Tile profiles; Type II: Single profile tiles having one water- course depth of a minimum of 25 mm.
LRML: if(is(tile.type, singleProfile)), then(and(equal(count(tile.watercourse), 1), greaterThanEqual(watercourse.depth, 25 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: If the tile type is single profile, then the tiles having one water- course depth of a minimum of 25 mm.

TEXT: 8.2.3 Installation; Masonry tile roof cladding shall be installed in accordance with NZS 4206 or AS 2050 onto minimum H1.2 treated timber battens, except the minimum pitch shall be as specified in Table 10.
LRML: if(is(roofCladding.type, masonryTile)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(roofCladding.installation,or(nzs_4206,as_2050)),onto(roofCladding.installation, batten),is(batten.material, timber),greaterThanEqual(timber.treatment,'h1.2'),asPer(roofCladding.pitch,nzbc_e2as1_t10))))
PARAPHRASE: If roof cladding is masonry tile, then the roof cladding shall be installed in accordance with NZS 4206 or AS 2050 onto minimum H1.2 treated timber battens and the roof cladding pitch shall be as specified in E2/AS1 Table 10.

TEXT: 8.0 Roof claddings 8.2.3 Installation; Fixing and fixing patterns shall be to NZS 4206, with the exception that nails shall penetrate a minimum of 35 mm into timber battens, and the minimum pitches and roof underlay shall be as described in Table 10 and Table 23.
LRML: if(and(has(roofCladding, fixing), include(fixing, nail), is(batten.material, timber), is(underlay.application, roof))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(fixing, nzs_4206),complyWith(fixing.pattern ,nzs_4206),into(nail.penetration, batten),is(batten.material, timber), greaterThanEqual(nail.penetration, 35 mm),asPer(roofCladding.pitch, and(nzbc_e2as1_t10,  nzbc_e2as1_t23)),asPer(roofCladding.underlay, and(nzbc_e2as1_t10,  nzbc_e2as1_t23)))))
PARAPHRASE: Fixing and fixing patterns shall be to NZS 4206, with the exception that nails shall penetrate a minimum of 35 mm into timber battens, and the roof cladding pitches and roof cladding underlay shall be as described in E2/AS1 Table 10 and Table 23.
COMMENTS: exceptions are just ands? would need a certain defeasibility strength?

TEXT: Use 304 or 316 stainless steel fixings for corrosion zones B, C or hot dip galvanised fixings at 450 g/m2 for Zone B and Zone C.
LRML: if(and(is(corrosionZone.type, or(b, c)), for(fixing, corrosionZone))), then(obligation(or(and(is(fixing.material, stainlessSteel),is(stainlessSteel.grade, or(304, 306))),and(is(fixing.material,hotDipGalvanized),is(fixing.weight,450g/m2)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the corrosion zones for the fixing is B or C, then fixing material shall be 304 or 316 stainless steel or hot dip galvanised fixings at 450 g/m2.

TEXT: Use 304 or 316 stainless steel fixings for corrosion zones B, C or hot dip galvanised fixings at 450 g/m2 for Zone B and Zone C.
LRML: if(and(is(corrosionZone, or(b, c)), for(fixing, corrosionZone))), then(obligation(or(and(is(fixing.material, stainlessSteel),is(stainlessSteel.grade, or(304, 306))),and(is(fixing.material, hotDipGalvanized),is(fixing.weight, 450g/m2)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the corrosion zones for the fixing is B or C, then fixing material shall be 304 or 316 stainless steel or hot dip galvanised fixings at 450 g/m2.

TEXT: Use 304 or 316 stainless steel fixings for corrosion zones B, C or hot dip galvanised fixings at 450 g/m2 for Zone B and Zone C.
LRML: if(and(is(corrosionZone, or(b, c)), for(fixing, corrosionZone))), then(obligation(or(and(is(fixing.material, stainlessSteel),is(stainlessSteel.grade, or(304, 306))),and(is(fixing.material, hotDipGalvanized),is(fixing.weight, 450g/m2)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the corrosion zones for the fixing is B or C, then fixing material shall be 304 or 316 stainless steel or hot dip galvanised fixings at 450 g/m2.

TEXT: Use 304 or 316 stainless steel fixings for corrosion zones D and E.
LRML: if(and(for(fixing, corrosionZone), is(corrosionZone.type, or(d, e)))), then(obligation(and(is(fixing.material, stainlessSteel),is(stainlessSteel.type, or(304, 306)))))

TEXT: Use 304 or 316 stainless steel fixings for corrosion zones D and E.
LRML: if(and(is(corrosionZone, or(d, e)),for(fixing, corrosionZone))), then(obligation(and(is(fixing.material, stainlessSteel),is(stainlessSteel.type, or(304, 306)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the corrosion zones for the fixing is B or C,

TEXT: a) Masonry tiles Paragraph 8.2 b) Pressed metal tiles Paragraph 8.3 c) Profiled metal roof claddings Paragraph 8.4 d) Membrane roofing Paragraph 8.5. Other roof claddings are beyond the scope of this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(not(is(roofCladding, or(masonryTile, pressedMetalTile, profiledMetalRoofCladding, membraneRoofing)))), then(not(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, roofCladding)))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof cladding is not Masonry tiles, Pressed metal tiles, Profiled metal roof claddings, Membrane roofing, then E2/AS1 applies to the roof cladding

TEXT: 8.1.2 Limitations; The following roof cladding systems are covered in this Acceptable Solution: a) Masonry tiles Paragraph 8.2 b) Pressed metal tiles Paragraph 8.3 c) Profiled metal roof claddings Paragraph 8.4 d) Membrane roofing Paragraph 8.5.
LRML: if(is(roofCladding, or(masonryTile, pressedMetalTile, profiledMetalRoofCladding, membraneRoofing))), then(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, roofCladding))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof cladding is Masonry tiles, Pressed metal tiles, Profiled metal roof claddings, or Membrane roofing, then E2/AS1 applies to the roof cladding

TEXT: Projecting eaves; Soffits and verges of all projecting eaves shall be closed in.
LRML: if(and(is(eave.type, projecting), has(eave, or(soffit, verge)))), then(obligation(and(is(soffit,closedIn),is(verge,closedIn))))
PARAPHRASE: If eaves are type projecting and has soffits and verges, the soffits and verges shall be closed in.

TEXT: 8.0 Roof Claddings 8.1.4 Fixings; Fixings shall be as specified in Paragraph 8.2 to Paragraph 8.5. Materials for fixing roof claddings and flashings, where necessary, shall be selected from Tables 20, 21 and 22 to minimise corrosion.
LRML: if(or(has(cladding, fixing), has(flashing, fixing))), then(obligation(and(asPer(fixing, and('nzbc_e2as1_8.1.2 to nzbc_e2as1_8.5')),asPer(fixing.material,and(nzbc_e2as1_t20, nzbc_e2as1_t21, nzbc_e2as1_t22)))))
PARAPHRASE: If roof claddings or flashings have fixings, the fixings shall be as specified in E2/AS1 Paragraph 8.2 to Paragraph 8.5. The fixing materials shall be selected from Tables 20, 21 and 22.

TEXT: 8.0 Roof Claddings 8.1.4 Fixings; Fixings shall be as specified in Paragraph 8.2 to Paragraph 8.5. Materials for fixing roof claddings and flashings, where necessary, shall be selected from Tables 20, 21 and 22 to minimise corrosion.
LRML: if(or(has(cladding, fixing), has(flashing, fixing))), then(obligation(and(asPer(fixing, and('nzbc_e2as1_8.1.2 to nzbc_e2as1_8.5')),asPer(fixing.material,and(nzbc_e2as1_t20, nzbc_e2as1_t21, nzbc_e2as1_t22)))))
PARAPHRASE: If roof claddings or flashings have fixings, the fixings shall be as specified in E2/AS1 Paragraph 8.2 to Paragraph 8.5. The fixing materials shall be selected from Tables 20, 21 and 22.

TEXT: 8.1.5 Roof underlays; Roof underlays shall be to Table 23 and NZS 2295, and be either: R1 heavy weight kraft, or R2 self supporting kraft.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(underlay, nzs_2295),complyWith(underlay, nzbc_e2as1_t23),is(underlay.type,or(r1HeavyWeightKraft,r2SelfSupportingKraft)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has underlays, the underlay shall comply with E2/AS1 Table 23 and NZS 2295, and be either: R1 heavy weight kraft, or R2 self supporting kraft.

TEXT: 8.1.5 Roof underlays; Roof underlays shall be to Table 23 and NZS 2295, and be either: R1 heavy weight kraft, or R2 self supporting kraft.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(underlay, nzs_2295),complyWith(underlay, nzbc_e2as1_t23),is(underlay.type, or(r1HeavyWeightKraft,r2SelfSupportingKraft)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has underlays, the underlay shall comply with E2/AS1 Table 23 and NZS 2295, and the underlay type shall be R1 heavy weight kraft, or R2 self supporting kraft.

TEXT: 8.1.5 Roof underlays; Underlays shall be: • Layed with minimum numbers of laps • Lapped at all side and end laps by minimum 150 mm • Run horizontally for roof pitches below 10° • Run horizontally or vertically for roof pitches above 10° • Have anti-ponding boards at lower edges of masonry tiles, refer Figure 25(b) and Paragraph 8.2.5.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(and(obligation(is(count(underlay.lap), minimum)), obligation(loop(forEach(underlay.side), has(underlay.side, lap))), obligation(greaterThanEqual(overlap.width, 150 mm)), or(and(obligation(is(underlay.orientation, horizontal)), obligation(lessThan(roof.pitch, 10 deg))), and(obligation(is(underlay.orientation, or(horizontal, vertical))), obligation(greaterThan(roof.pitch, 10 deg)))), obligation(is(roof.claddingSystem, masonryTile)), obligation(has(masonryTile.lowerEdge, antiPondingBoard))))

TEXT: Prevent sagging of roof underlay by either: For R1 underlays, fully support with a corrosion resistant material • For R2 self supporting underlays, laid to maximum 1.2 metre span between adjacent supports.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(or(and(is(underlay.type, r1), obligation(has(underlay, support)), obligation(is(support.material, corrosionResistant))), and(is(underlay.type, r2), obligation(is(underlay, selfSupporting)), obligation(lessThanEqual(underlay.span, 1.2 m)), obligation(inBetween(underlay.span, adjacentSupport)))))

TEXT: Prevent sagging of roof underlay by either: For R1 underlays, fully support with a corrosion resistant material • For R2 self supporting underlays, laid to maximum 1.2 metre span between adjacent supports.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(or(obligation(and(is(underlay.type, r1), has(underlay, support),is(support.material, corrosionResistant))), obligation(and(is(underlay.type, r2), is(underlay,selfSupporting),lessThanEqual(underlay.span,1.2m),inBetween(underlay.span,adjacentSupport)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has an underlay, the underlay type shall be either R1 and the underlay shall be fully support with a corrosion resistant material, or the underly shall be type R2 and self supporting and laid to maximum 1.2 metre span between adjacent supports.

TEXT: Prevent sagging of roof underlay by either: For R1 underlays, fully support with a corrosion resistant material • For R2 self supporting underlays, laid to maximum 1.2 metre span between adjacent supports.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(or(obligation(and(is(underlay.type, r1), has(underlay, support),is(support.material, corrosionResistant))), obligation(and(is(underlay.type, r2), is(underlay, selfSupporting),lessThanEqual(underlay.span, 1.2 m),inBetween(underlay.span, adjacentSupports)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has an underlay, the underlay type shall be either R1 and the underlay shall be fully support with a corrosion resistant material, or the underly shall be type R2 and self supporting and laid to maximum 1.2 metre span between adjacent supports.

TEXT: 3.1.1 To reduce the risk of blockages, the foul water drainage system shall: a) Have a simple layout that incorporates the least number of changes of direction, b) Use bends having a radius of the practical maximum, and c) Be laid only in straight lines between bends or junctions (both horizontally and vertically).
LRML: if(exist(foulWaterDrain)), then(and(obligation(and(is(foulWaterDrain.layout, simple),is(layout.changeInDirection, minimum))), obligation(and(define(foulWaterDrain.bend, x0),is(x0.radius, practicalMaximum))),obligation(and(inBetween(pipe, and(bend, junction)),is(pipe, straight)))))
PARAPHRASE: If foul water drainage system exists, then foul water drainage system shall: a) Have a simple layout that incorporates the least number of changes of direction, b) Use bends having a radius of the practical maximum, and c) Be pipes between bends or junctions are straight.

TEXT: 3.2.1 Any connection to a drain, excluding vent pipe connections, shall be made by means of sweep or oblique junctions. The angle that the branch makes at the point of entry with the main drain, shall be no greater than 60° (see Figure 1).
LRML: if(and(has(drain, connection), not(is(connection, ventPipe)))), then(and(obligation(is(connection, or(sweepJunction, obliqueJunction))), obligation(lessThanEqual(connection.angle, 60 deg))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain has a connection and the connection is not with the vent pipe, then the connection shall be a sweep junction or oblique junction. The angle of the conection shall be no greater than 60 deg.

TEXT: 3.2.1 Any connection to a drain, excluding vent pipe connections, shall be made by means of sweep or oblique junctions. The angle that the branch makes at the point of entry with the main drain, shall be no greater than 60° (see Figure 1).
LRML: if(and(has(drain, connection), not(is(connection, ventPipe)))), then(and(obligation(is(connection, or(sweepJunction, obliqueJunction))), obligation(lessThanEqual(connection.angle, 60 deg))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain has a connection and the connection is not with the vent pipe, then the connection shall be a sweep junction or oblique junction. The angle of the conection shall be no greater than 60 deg.

TEXT: 3.2.1 Any connection to a drain, excluding vent pipe connections, shall be made by means of sweep or oblique junctions. The angle that the branch makes at the point of entry with the main drain, shall be no greater than 60° (see Figure 1).
LRML: if(and(has(drain, connection), not(is(connection, ventPipe)))), then(and(obligation(is(connection, or(sweepJunction, obliqueJunction))), obligation(lessThanEqual(connection.angle, 60 deg))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain has a connection and the connection is not with the vent pipe, then the connection shall be a sweep junction or oblique junction. The angle of the conection shall be no greater than 60 deg.

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall be constructed to prevent the ingress of surface water and foreign bodies likely to cause a blockage, shall be located within the legal boundary of the land on which the building is erected.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(and(obligation(and(prevent(gullyTrap, ingress),for(ingress, and(surfaceWater, foreignBodies)))),obligation(within(gullyTrap.location, siteBoundary))))
PARAPHRASE: If gully traps exists, then gully traps shall prevent the ingress of surface water and foreign bodies, and gully traps shall be located within the site boundary.

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall have (see Figures 2 and 3): The overflow level of the gully dish no less than: 25 mm above paved surfaces.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(define(pavedSurface, x0),greaterThanEqual(gullyTrap.overflowLevel, 'x0 + 25 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If gully traps exists, then gully traps shall have a overflow level if no less than 25 mm above paved surfaces.

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall have (see Figures 2 and 3): The overflow level of the gully dish no less than: 100 mm above unpaved surfaces.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(define(unpavedSurface, x0),greaterThanEqual(gullyTrap.overflowLevel, 'x0 + 100 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If gully traps exists, then gully traps shall have an overflow level of no less than 100 mm above unpaved surfaces.

TEXT: Drainage; All gully traps shall have: b) A grating that will allow surcharge.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(has(gullyTrap, grating),for(grating, surcharge))))
PARAPHRASE: If gully traps exists, then gully traps shall have a grating that will allow surcharge.

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall have (see Figures 2 and 3): A water seal depth of at least 65 mm.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(has(gullyTrap,waterSeal),greaterThanEqual(waterSeal.depth,65 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If gully traps exists, then gully traps shall have a water seal with depth of at least 65 mm.

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall have (see Figures 2 and 3): A water seal depth of at least 65 mm.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(has(gullyTrap,waterSeal),greaterThanEqual(waterSeal.depth,65 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If gully traps exists, then gully traps shall have a water seal with depth of at least 65 mm.

TEXT: 3.3.1 All gully traps shall have (see Figures 2 and 3): Wastepipes that discharge to the gullytrap arranged to permit easy cleaning of the gullytrap.
LRML: if(towards(wastePipe, gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(for(wastePipe.arrangement, easilyCleaned),is(gullyTrap, easilyCleaned))))
PARAPHRASE: If waste pipes are towards the gullytrap, then the waste pipe shall be arranged to permit the gullytrap to be easily cleaned.

TEXT: 3.3.1 All gully traps shall have (see Figures 2 and 3): Wastepipes that discharge to the gullytrap arranged to permit easy cleaning of the gullytrap.
LRML: if(towards(wastePipe, gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(for(wastePipe.arrangement, easilyCleaned),is(gullyTrap, easilyCleaned))))
PARAPHRASE: If waste pipes are towards the gullytrap, then the waste pipe shall be arranged to permit the gullytrap to be easily cleaned.

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall have (see Figures 2 and 3): Waste pipe outlets located at least 20 mm above water seal level, and at least 20 mm below the grating.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(has(gullyTrap, wastePipeOutlet), define(waterSeal.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(wastePipeOutlet.elevation,'x0 + 20 mm'),define(grating.elevation, x1),lessThanEqual(wastePipeOutlet.elevation,'x1 - 20 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If gully traps exists, then gully traps shall have waste pipe outlets with elevation at least 20 mm above water seal elevation, and at least 20 mm below the grating elevation.
COMMENTS: "at least" is actual lessThanEqual in this case

TEXT: 8.1.6 Gutters general; Gutters, downpipes and spreaders, including eaves gutters/spoutings are required for the drainage of roof water.
LRML: if(exist(roof)), then(obligation(and(has(roof.drainage,and(gutter,downpipe,spreader)),has(roof.drainage,or(eaveGutter,eaveSpouting)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a roof exists, then the roof drainage shall have gutters, downpipes and spreaders, and the roof drainage shall have eave gutters or eave spoutings.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: d) Eaves gutters/spoutings shall: Be to any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.1 except 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 e) Have a minimum cross sectional area of 2500 mm2 f) Be designed to overflow water to the outside.
LRML: if(has(eave, gutter)), then(obligation(and(asPer(gutter.material,'nzbc_e2as1_4.1'),not(asPer(gutter.material,or('nzbc_e2as1_4.3.9', 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.10', 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.11'))),greaterThanEqual(gutter.crossSectionalArea, 2500 mm2),towards(gutter.overflow, outside))))
PARAPHRASE: If the eaves have gutters, then the gutters material shall be as in E2/AS1 4.1 and not as in E2/AS1 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11, the gutters shall have a minimum cross sectional area of 2500 mm2, and the gutters shall overflow to the outside.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Downpipes shall: g) Be formed from any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.1 except 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 h) Upper roofs shall drain via downpipes directly to ground level where possible, or i) Where discharging to a lower roof, be fitted with a spreader as detailed in Figure 20 j) Have a maximum catchment area of 25 m2 if discharging on to a lower roof area.
LRML: if(exist(downpipe)), then(obligation(and(asPer(downpipe.material, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.1'),not(asPer(downpipe.material, or('nzbc_e2as1_4.3.9', 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.10', 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.11'))),through(upperRoof.drainage, downpipe),or(towards(upperRoof.drainage,groundLevel),and(towards(upperRoof.drainage, lowerRoof),is(downpipe.fixture,spreader),asPer(downpipe.fixture, nzbc_e2as1_f20),lessThanEqual(downpipe.catchmentArea, 25 m2))))))
PARAPHRASE: If downpipes exist, then the dowpipe shall be any of the materials outlined in E2/AS1 4.1 and not outlined in E2/AS1 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11. Upper roofs shall have drainage through downpipes to the ground level, or upper roofs shall have drainage towards a lower roof, the downpipe shall be fitted with a spreader as detailed in E2/AS1 Figure 20 and the downpipe shall have a maximum catchment area of 25 m2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.1.6.1 Internal gutters; Internal gutters shall: b) Where butyl or EPDM, be minimum 1.5 mm membrane thickness, or 1.0 mm thickness for gutters less than 1 metre wide.
LRML: if(and(is(gutter.type, internal), is(gutter.material, or(butyl, epdm)))), then(obligation(or(and(greaterThanEqual(gutter.thickness, 1.5 mm),greaterThanEqual(gutter.width, 1 m)),and(greaterThanEqual(gutter.thickness, 1 mm),lessThan(gutter.width, 1 m)))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are internal and gutter material is butyl or EPDM, then the gutter shall be minimum 1.5 mm thickness and not less than 1 metre wide, or 1 mm thickness and gutters less than 1 metre wide.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.1.6.1 Internal gutters; Internal gutters shall: d) Be constructed to at least the minimum dimensions shown in Figure 52, or the capacity calculated to E1/AS1 plus an additional freeboard depth of 20 mm minimum.
LRML: if(is(gutter.type, internal)), then(obligation(or(asPer(gutter.dimension, nzbc_e2as1_f52),and(define(gutter.capacity, x0),asPer(x0.calculation, nzbc_e1as1),define(freeboard.depth,x1),greaterThanEqual(x1, 20 mm),equal(gutter.capacity,'x0 + x1')))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are internal, then the gutter be at least the minimum dimensions shown in Figure 52, or the gutter capacity calculated to E1/AS1 plus an additional freeboard depth of 20 mm minimum.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Valley gutters and hidden gutters shall be constructed as shown in Figures 50 and 51 for the applicable roof cladding (except for membrane roofing) and: a) Not change direction in plan b) Have a minimum underlap to roof cladding as specified in Figures 27, 37, 50, and 51 for the relevant roof cladding c) Be formed from any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.3 except 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 d) Be fixed at upper ends only, and be secured with a purpose-made clip system for the remaining length to enable expansion/ contraction along the length of the gutter e) Discharge into an internal gutter or eaves gutter/spouting.
LRML: if(and(is(gutter.type, or(valley, hidden)),not(is(roof.type, membrane)))), then(obligation(and(asPer(gutter.construction,and(nzbc_e2as1_f50,nzbc_e2as1_f51)),not(is(gutter.changeInDirection,inPlan)),towards(gutter.underlap, cladding),asPer(gutter.underlap,and(nzbc_e2as1_f27,nzbc_e2as1_f37,nzbc_e2as1_f50,nzbc_e2as1_f51)),asPer(gutter.material,'nzbc_e2as1_4.3'),not(asPer(gutter.material,or('nzbc_e2as1_4.3.10','nzbc_e2as1_4.3.11'))),has(gutter.upperEnd, fixing),is(fixing.type, clipSystem),is(clipSystem, purposeMade),for(clipSystem,and(contractionAllowance, expansionAllowance)),into(gutter.discharge, or(internalGutter,eaveGutter)))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutter type is valley or hidden and the roof type is not membrane, then the gutter shall be constructed as shown in E2/AS1 Figures 50 and 51, and the gutter shall not change direction in plan, the gutter shall have a minimum underlap to roof cladding as specified in E2/AS1 Figures 27, 37, 50, and 51, and the gutter material shall be as outlined in E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.3 and not in 4.3.10 and 4.3.11, and the gutter shall be fixed at upper ends, and be secured with a purpose-made clip system to allow expansion and contraction, and the gutter shall discharge into an internal gutter or eave gutter.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: In addition: f) Have minimum slopes of 8° for hidden gutters g) Hidden gutters receive no discharge from downpipes or spreaders.
LRML: if(is(gutter.type, hidden)), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(gutter.slope, 8 deg)), prohibition(and(into(downpipe.discharge, gutter),into(spreader.discharge, gutter)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the gutter type is hidden, then the gutter shall have minimum slopes of 8 deg and the gutter shall not receive discharge from downpipes or spreaders.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.8.1 Vehicle access areas for the collection of industrial liquid waste shall: Any spilled waste shall not enter the sewage system unless the spilled waste is acceptable as a discharge to the sewer by the network utility operator.
LRML: if(and(for(vehicleAccessArea, collection), is(collection.type, industrialLiquidWaste),not(accept(networkUtilityOperator, discharge)),into(discharge, sewer),is(discharge.type, waste))), then(prohibition(into(waste, sewer)))
PARAPHRASE: If a vehicle access area is for industrial liquid waste collection and the network utility operator does not accept the discharge of the waste to the sewer, then spilled waste shall not enter the sewer.

TEXT: 1.8.1 Vehicle access areas for the collection of industrial liquid waste shall: Any spilled waste shall: i) be contained on-site for subsequent removal, ii) not enter the surface water system.
LRML: if(and(for(vehicleAccessArea, collection), is(collection.type, industrialLiquidWaste),into(spilledWaste, vehicleAccessArea))), then(and(obligation(has(spilledWaste, containment)), prohibition(into(spilledWaste, surfaceWaterSystem))))
PARAPHRASE: If a vehicle access area is for industrial liquid waste collection and waste is spilled, the spilled waste shall be contained and not enter the sewer.

TEXT: 1.8.1 Vehicle access areas for the collection of industrial liquid waste shall: Any spilled waste shall: i) be contained on-site for subsequent removal, ii) not enter the surface water system.
LRML: if(and(for(vehicleAccessArea, collection), is(collection.type, industrialLiquidWaste),into(spilledWaste, vehicleAccessArea))), then(and(obligation(has(spilledWaste, containment)), prohibition(into(spilledWaste, surfaceWaterSystem))))
PARAPHRASE: If a vehicle access area is for industrial liquid waste collection and waste is spilled, then the spilled waste shall be contained and not enter the sewer.

TEXT: 1.9.1 Where unauthorised access to storage facilities may be hazardous, security shall be provided by: a) Locating the facilities in a lockable enclosed space within a building.
LRML: if(and(has(storageFacility, accessControl), is(storageFacility, hazardous))), then(obligation(and(within(storageFacility.location, building),is(storageFacility, lockable))))
PARAPHRASE: If unauthorised access to storage facilities may be hazardous, then the storage facility shall be located in a lockable space within a building.

TEXT: 1.9.1 Where unauthorised access to storage facilities may be hazardous, security shall be provided by: b) An external security fence with lockable gates if located in the open.
LRML: if(and(has(storageFacility, accessControl), is(storageFacility, hazardous),outside(storageFacility.location, building))), then(obligation(and(has(storageFacility, securityFence),is(securityFence.isExternal, true),has(securityFence, lockableGate))))
PARAPHRASE: If unauthorised access to storage facilities may be hazardous and the storage facility is located outside, then the storage facility shall have an external security fence with lockable gates.

TEXT: 1.9.1 Where unauthorised access to storage facilities may be hazardous, security shall be provided by: b) An external security fence with lockable gates if located in the open.

PARAPHRASE: If unauthorised access to storage facilities may be hazardous and the storage facility is located outside, then the storage facility shall have an external security fence with lockable gates.

PARAPHRASE: If unauthorised access to storage facilities may be hazardous and the storage facility is located outside, then the storage facility shall have an external security fence with lockable gates.

TEXT: 1.9.1 Where unauthorised access to storage facilities may be hazardous, security shall be provided by: b) An external security fence with lockable gates if located in the open.
LRML: if(and(has(storageFacility, accessControl), is(storageFacility, hazardous),outside(storageFacility.location, building))), then(obligation(and(has(storageFacility, securityFence),is(securityFence, external),has(securityFence, lockableGate))))
PARAPHRASE: If unauthorised access to storage facilities may be hazardous and the storage facility is located outside, then the storage facility shall have an external security fence with lockable gates.

LRML: if(and(has(treatmentFacility, accessControl), is(treatmentFacility, hazardous))), then(obligation(and(within(treatmentFacility.location, building),is(treatmentFacility, lockable))))
