TEXT: 9.1.3.3 Bottom of wall claddings for concrete ground slabs (except masonry veneer); At concrete slab level, the base of the cladding system shall be as shown in Table 18, and: a) Finish a minimum of: i) 100 mm above a paved surface, or ii) 175 mm above finished unpaved surface, b) Overlap the concrete slab by 50 mm, and c) Be offset horizontally by a minimum of 6 mm for direct fixed claddings to prevent capillary action.
LRML: if(and(not(is(wallCladding.system, masonryVeneer)), adjoin(slab, wallCladding),is(slab.type, ground),is(slab.material, concrete))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(wallCladding.bottom,nzbc_e2as1_t18),or(and(adjoin(surface, wallCladding),is(surface.type, paved),define(surface.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(wallCladding.bottom, 'x0 + 100 mm')),and(adjoin(surface, wallCladding),not(is(surface.type, paved)),define(surface.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(distance, 'x0 + 175 mm'))),towards(x0.overlap,floor),equal(overlap.measurement,50 mm),or(and(is(wallCladding.type,directFixed),is(x0.offset,horizontal),greaterThanEqual(x0.offset,6 mm),include(x0.offset,prevention),is(prevention.type,capillaryAction)),not(is(wallCladding.type,directFixed))))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are not masonry veneer and the concrete ground slab adjoins the wall cladding, then the bottom of the wall cladding shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Table 18, and: a) Finish a minimum of: i) 100 mm above a paved surface, or ii) 175 mm above finished unpaved surface, b) Overlap the concrete slab by 50 mm, and c) Be offset horizontally by a minimum of 6 mm for direct fixed claddings to prevent capillary action.

TEXT: 9.1.3.3 Bottom of wall claddings for concrete ground slabs (except masonry veneer); At concrete slab level, the base of the cladding system shall be as shown in Table 18, and: a) Finish a minimum of: i) 100 mm above a paved surface, or ii) 175 mm above finished unpaved surface, b) Overlap the concrete slab by 50 mm, and c) Be offset horizontally by a minimum of 6 mm for direct fixed claddings to prevent capillary action.
LRML: if(and(not(is(wallCladding.system, masonryVeneer)), adjoin(slab, wallCladding),is(slab.type, ground),is(slab.material, concrete))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(wallCladding.bottom,nzbc_e2as1_t18),or(and(adjoin(surface, wallCladding),is(surface.type, paved),define(surface.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(wallCladding.bottom, 'x0 + 100 mm')),and(adjoin(surface, wallCladding),not(is(surface.type, paved)),define(surface.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(distance, 'x0 + 175 mm'))),has(wallCladding.bottom, lap),towards(lap, slab),equal(lap.size, 50 mm),or(and(has(wallCladding.bottom, offset),is(offset, horizontal),greaterThanEqual(offset.size, 6 mm),is(wallCladding.type, directFixed),prevent(offset, capillaryAction)),not(is(wallCladding.type, directFixed))))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are not masonry veneer and the concrete ground slab adjoins the wall cladding, then the bottom of the wall cladding shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Table 18, and either the wall cladding bottom is at a minimum of 100 mm above a paved surface, or the wall cladding bottom is at a minimum of 175 mm above finished unpaved surface, and the wall cladding bottom overlaps the concrete slab by 50 mm size, and the wall cladding bottom shall be either offset horizontally by a minimum of 6 mm size for direct fixed claddings to prevent capillary action, or the wallcladding shall be not direct fixed.

TEXT: 8.1.5 Roof underlays; Underlays shall be: • Layed with minimum numbers of laps • Lapped at all side and end laps by minimum 150 mm • Run horizontally for roof pitches below 10° • Run horizontally or vertically for roof pitches above 10° • Have anti-ponding boards at lower edges of masonry tiles, refer Figure 25(b) and Paragraph 8.2.5.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(and(obligation(is(count(underlay.lap), minimum)), obligation(and(has(underlay, lap),is(lap, or(end, side)),greaterThanEqual(lap.size, 150 mm))), or(obligation(and(is(underlay.orientation, horizontal),lessThan(roof.pitch, 10 deg))), obligation(and(is(underlay.orientation, or(horizontal, vertical)),greaterThan(roof.pitch, 10 deg)))), obligation(and(has(roof, masonryTile),has(masonryTile.lowerEdge, antiPondingBoard)) )))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has underlays, then the underlay shall have a minimum cound of laps. The underlay shall have laps and the side laps and end laps shall be minimum 150 mm size. The underlay shall be either horizontally and roof pitches below 10 deg or the underlay shall be horizontally or vertically for roof pitches above 10 deg. The underlay shall have anti-ponding boards at lower edges of masonry tiles.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.1.6 Gutters general; Gutters, downpipes and spreaders, including eaves gutters/spoutings are required for the drainage of roof water.
LRML: if(exist(roof)), then(obligation(and(has(roof.drainage,and(gutter,downpipe,spreader)),has(roof.drainage,or(eaveGutter,eaveSpouting)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a roof exists, then the roof drainage shall have gutters, downpipes and spreaders, also the roof drainage shall have eave gutters or eave spoutings.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Drainage of roof water; Spreaders shall: k) Be to any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.1 except 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 l) Be to Figure 20 and not be used on masonry tile roofs unless a roof underlay is installed m) Discharge directed away from roofing laps and clear of roof penetrations.
LRML: if(include(roof.drainage, spreader)), then(and(obligation(and(asPer(spreader.material, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.1'),not(asPer(spreader.material, or('nzbc_e2as1_4.3.9', 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.10', 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.11'))))),obligation(and(asPer(spreader, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.1'),or(not(is(roof.type, masonryTile)),and(is(roof.type, masonryTile),has(roof, underlay))))),obligation(and(has(roof, and(lap, penetration)),awayFrom(spreader.discharge, lap),not(has(spreader.discharge, penetration))))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof drainage includes spreaders, then the spreaders shall be any of the materials outlined in E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.1 but not outlined in E2/AS1 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11. The spreaders shall be to Figure 20 and either roof type is not masonry tile, or the roof type is masonry tile and the roof has a underlay. The spreader discharge shall be directed away from roofing laps and clear of roof penetrations.
COMMENTS: has(roof, and(lap, penetration)) - That would not work?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.1.6.1 Internal gutters; Internal gutters shall: For roofs other than membrane roofs: e) Discharge into a rainwater head as shown in Figure 63 (a) and (b).
LRML: if(and(is(gutter.type, internal), not(is(roof.type, membrane)))), then(obligation(and(into(gutter.discharge, rainwaterHead),asPer(gutter.discharge, and('nzbc_e2as1_f63.a', 'nzbc_e2as1_f63.b')))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are internal and roof type is not membrane roofs, then the gutter shall discharge into a rainwater head, and the gutter discharge shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 63.a and Figure 63.b.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.1.3 Basic normal maintenance tasks shall include but not be limited to: a) Where applicable, following manufacturers' maintenance recommendations, b) Washing down surfaces, particularly exterior building elements subject to wind driven salt spray, c) Re-coating interior and exterior protective finishes, d) Replacing sealant, seals and gaskets in joints, e) Replacing valves, washers and similar high wear components in easily accessed service equipment and other building elements, f) Cleaning and replacing filters in building services systems, g) The regular servicing of boilers, cooling towers, lifts, escalators, emergency lighting and fire protection equipment, and h) The maintenance of signs for access, escape routes, emergency equipment and hazardous areas.
LRML: if(is(maintenance.type, or(normal, basic))), then(obligation(and(include(maintenance.task, manufacturersRecommendation), include(maintenance.task, washing), for(washing, surface), include(maintenance.task, recoating),for(recoating, and(interiorProtectiveFinish, exteriorProtectiveFinish)), include(maintenance.task, replacing),for(replacing, and(jointSeal, jointGasket, valve, washer, component)), is(component, highWear),include(maintenance.task, cleaning),for(cleaning, buildingServiceSystemFilter),for(replacing, buildingServiceSystemFilter),include(maintenance.task, service),is(service.type, regular),for(service, and(boiler, coolingTower, lift, escalator, emergencyLighting, fireProtectionEquipment)),include(maintenance.task, maintenance),for(maintenance, sign),is(sign.type, and(access, escapeRoute, emergencyEquipment, hazardousArea))  )))
PARAPHRASE: If the the maintenance is basic or normal, the maintenance tasks shall include the manufacturers recommendations, washing down surfaces, recoating interior protective finishes, recoating exterior protective finishes, replacing joint sealant, replacing joint seals, replacing joint gaskets, replacing valves, replacing washers and replacing high wear components, cleaning building services system filters and replacing building services system filters, regular boiler service, regular cooling tower service, regular lift service, regular escalator service, regular emergency lighting service, regular fire protection equipment service, access sign maintenance, escape route sign maintenance, emergency equipment sign maintenance and hazardous area sign maintenance.

TEXT: 2.1.3 Basic normal maintenance tasks shall include but not be limited to: a) Where applicable, following manufacturers' maintenance recommendations, b) Washing down surfaces, particularly exterior building elements subject to wind driven salt spray, c) Re-coating interior and exterior protective finishes, d) Replacing sealant, seals and gaskets in joints, e) Replacing valves, washers and similar high wear components in easily accessed service equipment and other building elements, f) Cleaning and replacing filters in building services systems, g) The regular servicing of boilers, cooling towers, lifts, escalators, emergency lighting and fire protection equipment, and h) The maintenance of signs for access, escape routes, emergency equipment and hazardous areas.
LRML: if(is(maintenance.type, or(normal, basic))), then(obligation(and(include(maintenance.task, manufacturersRecommendation), include(maintenance.task, washing), for(washing, surface), include(maintenance.task, recoating),for(recoating, and(interiorProtectiveFinish, exteriorProtectiveFinish)), include(maintenance.task, replacing),for(replacing, and(jointSealant, jointSeal, jointGasket, valve, washer, component)), is(component, highWear),include(maintenance.task, cleaning),for(cleaning, buildingServiceSystemFilter),for(replacing, buildingServiceSystemFilter),include(maintenance.task, service),is(service.type, regular),for(service, and(boiler, coolingTower, lift, escalator, emergencyLighting, fireProtectionEquipment)),include(maintenance.task, maintenance),for(maintenance, sign),is(sign.type, and(access, escapeRoute, emergencyEquipment, hazardousArea))  )))
PARAPHRASE: If the the maintenance is basic or normal, the maintenance tasks shall include the manufacturers recommendations, and the maintenance tasks shall include washing down surfaces, and the maintenance tasks shall include recoating interior protective finishes and exterior protective finishes, and the maintenance tasks shall include replacing joint sealant, joint seals, joint gaskets, valves, washers and high wear components, and the maintenance tasks shall include cleaning building services system filters and replacing building services system filters, and the maintenance tasks shall include the regular service of regular boiler, cooling tower, lift, escalator, emergency lighting, fire protection equipment, and the maintenance tasks shall include the maintenance for signs type access, escape route, emergency equipment and hazardous area.

TEXT: Table 2 sets out the risk matrix that shall be used to define the risk score for a building within the scope of this Acceptable Solution. A risk score is calculated for each external face of the building. Claddings are then selected from Table 3 according to the risk scores.
LRML: if(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, building)), then(obligation(and(asPer(riskMatrix, nzbc_e2as1_t2),asPer(building.riskScore, riskMatrix),loop(forEach(building.externalFace), and(define(externalFace.riskScore,x0),asPer(cladding.selection,nzbc_e2as1_t3))))))

TEXT: Table 2 sets out the risk matrix that shall be used to define the risk score for a building within the scope of this Acceptable Solution. A risk score is calculated for each external face of the building. Claddings are then selected from Table 3 according to the risk scores.
LRML: if(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, building)), then(obligation(and(asPer(riskMatrix, nzbc_e2as1_t2),loop(forEach(building.exteriorFace), and(asPer(exteriorFace.riskScore, riskMatrix),asPer(exteriorFace.cladding, and(riskScore, nzbc_e2as1_t3)))))))
PARAPHRASE: If E2/AS1 applies to a building, the risk matrix shall be as in E2/AS1 Table 2

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall have (see Figures 2 and 3): The top of the water seal no more than 600 mm below the top of the gully dish.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(define(topOf(gullyTrap.gullyDish), x0), greaterThanEqual(topOf(gullyTrap.waterSeal), 'x0 - 600 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If gully traps exists, then the top of the gully trap's water seal shall be no more than 600 mm below the top of the gully trap's gully dish.

TEXT: 8.0 Roof claddings 8.2.3 Installation; Fixing and fixing patterns shall be to NZS 4206, with the exception that nails shall penetrate a minimum of 35 mm into timber battens, and the minimum pitches and roof underlay shall be as described in Table 10 and Table 23.
LRML: if(has(roofCladding, or(fixing, fixingPattern))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(fixing, nzs_4206),complyWith(fixing.pattern, nzs_4206),into(nail.penetration, batten),is(batten.material, timber), include(fixing, nail),greaterThanEqual(nail.penetration, 35 mm),asPer(roofCladding.pitch, and(nzbc_e2as1_t10, nzbc_e2as1_t23)),asPer(roofCladding.underlay, and(nzbc_e2as1_t10, nzbc_e2as1_t23)))))
PARAPHRASE: If roof claddings have fixings or fixing patterns, then the fixing and fixing patterns shall be to NZS 4206, with the exception that nails shall penetrate a minimum of 35 mm into timber battens, and the roof cladding pitches and roof cladding underlay shall be as described in E2/AS1 Table 10 and Table 23.
COMMENTS:
exceptions are just ands? would need a certain defeasibility strength?
roof cladding underlay?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Use 304 or 316 stainless steel fixings for corrosion zones B, C or hot dip galvanised fixings at 450 g/m2 for Zone B and Zone C.
LRML: if(and(is(corrosionZone, or(b, c)), for(fixing, corrosionZone))), then(obligation(or(and(is(fixing.material, stainlessSteel),is(stainlessSteel.grade, or(304, 306))),and(is(fixing.material, hotDipGalvanized),is(fixing.weight, 450 g/m2)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the corrosion zones for the fixing is B or C, then the fixing material shall be 304 or 316 stainless steel or hot dip galvanised fixings at 450 g/m2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Materials for flashings, gutters and fixings shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.0, and: a) Be selected from Table 20 to minimise corrosion, and b) Be compatible with mortar and bedding in accordance with Table 21 and Table 22.
LRML: if(for(material, and(flashing, gutter, fixing))), then(obligation(and(asPer(material,'nzbc_e2as1_4.0'),asPer(material, nzbc_e2as1_t20),include(material.compatibility,and(mortar,bedding)),asPer(material.compatibility,and(nzbc_e2as1_t21,nzbc_e2as1_t22)))))
PARAPHRASE: If materials are for flashings, gutters or fixings, then the material shall be in accordance with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.0, and the material shall be selected from E2/AS1 Table 20, and the material shall be compatible with mortar and bedding in accordance with E2/AS1 Table 21 and Table 22.
COMMENTS:
for material?
compatibility include or towards or inbetween?
AUTHOR: Stefan

LRML: if(for(material, and(flashing, gutter, fixing))), then(obligation(and(asPer(material,'nzbc_e2as1_4.0'),asPer(material, nzbc_e2as1_t20),include(material.compatibility,and(mortar,bedding)),asPer(material.compatibility,and(nzbc_e2as1_t21,nzbc_e2as1_t22)))))
PARAPHRASE: If materials are for flashings, gutters or fixings, then the material shall be in accordance with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.0, and the material shall be selected from E2/AS1 Table 20, and the material shall be compatible with mortar and bedding in accordance with E2/AS1 Table 21 and Table 22.
