TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is limited to pressed metal tile roofs.
LRML: if(is(roof.type, pressedMetalTile)), then(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, roof))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof type is pressed metal tile, then E2/AS1 is applicable to the roof.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Pressed metal tiles shall be fixed as shown in Figure 33, with: a) 50 x 2.8 mm hot-dipped galvanized painted flat-head annular-grooved nails.
LRML: if(exist(pressedMetalTile)), then(obligation(and(asPer(pressedMetalTile.fixing, nzbc_e2as1_f33),is(pressedMetalTile.fixing, nail),is(nail.type,and(flatHead, annularGrooved)),is(nail,and(hotDippedGalvanised,painted)),is(nail.dimension,' 50 x 2.8 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If pressed metal tiles exist, then the pressed metal tiles shall be fixed as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 33, with nails type flat-head annular-grooved, and the nails are hot-dipped galvanized and painted, and the nails are dimension 50 x 2.8 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles; The roof shall be flashed at all boundaries, except at the discharge to a gutter, using the details shown in Figure 34 to Figure 37.
LRML: if(is(roof.type, pressedMetalTile)), then(and(obligation(has(roof.boundary, flashing)), prohibition(and(towards(roof.discharge, gutter),has(roof.discharge, flashing))),obligation(asPer(flashing, 'nzbc_e2as1_f34 to nzbc_e2as1_f37'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof type is pressed metal tile, then the roof boundaries shall have flashings. The roof discharge to a gutter shall not have flashings. The flashings shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 34 to Figure 37.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles; The roof shall be flashed at all boundaries, except at the discharge to a gutter, using the details shown in Figure 34 to Figure 37.
LRML: if(is(roof.type, pressedMetalTile)), then(and(obligation(has(roof.boundary, flashing)), prohibition(and(towards(roof.discharge, gutter),has(roof.discharge, flashing))),obligation(asPer(flashing, 'nzbc_e2as1_f34 to nzbc_e2as1_f37'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof type is pressed metal tile, then the roof boundaries shall have flashings. The roof discharge to a gutter shall not have flashings. The flashings shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 34 to Figure 37.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.11.1 Fixing flashings c) Flashing joins, including expansion joints where required, shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.5.2 and as shown in Figure 6.
LRML: if(or(has(flashing, join),requires(flashing, expansionJoint))), then(obligation(and(asPer(join, and('nzbc_e2as1_4.5.2', nzbc_e2as1_f6)),asPer(expansionJoint, and('nzbc_e2as1_4.5.2', nzbc_e2as1_f6)))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashing have joins or require expansion joints, then the joins and expansion joints shall be in accordance with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.5.2 and as shown in Figure 6.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.0.1 Where the network utility operator accepts the discharge of industrial liquid waste to a sewer, the waste shall be conveyed in a plumbing and drainage disposal system complying with NZBC G13 Foul Water.
LRML: if(and(accept(networkUtilityOperator, discharge),is(discharge.type, industrialLiquidWaste),into(discharge, sewer))), then(obligation(and( within(industrialLiquidWaste, disposalSystem),for(disposalSystem, and(plumbing, drainage)), complyWith(disposalSystem, nzbc_g13))))
PARAPHRASE: Where the network utility operator accepts the discharge of industrial liquid waste to a sewer, then the waste shall be conveyed in a disposal system for plumbing and drainage, which complies with NZBC G13.

TEXT: 2.1.2 Wherever possible, piping systems shall convey industrial liquid waste using gravity flow.
LRML: if(and(for(pipingSystem, industrialLiquidWaste), is(pipingSystem.gravityFlow, possible))), then(obligation(is(pipingSystem.method, gravityFlow)))
PARAPHRASE: If a piping system conveys industrial liquid waste and gravity flow is possible, then the piping system shall use gravity flow.
COMMENTS: pipingSystem.gravityFlow vs gravityFlow to implement the exception

TEXT: 2.0 Conveyance of industrial liquid waste 2.1.3 Gravity flow pipelines should have sufficient gradient to provide flow velocities that prevent the settlement of entrained solids and grit.
LRML: if(is(pipingSystem.method, gravityFlow)), then(obligation(and(for(pipingSystem.gradient, flowVelocity), prevent(flowVelocity, settlement),is(settlement.type, or(entrainedSolid, grit)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a piping system method is gravity flow, then the piping system should have a gradient that provides flow velocities that prevent the settlement of entrained solids and grit.
COMMENTS:
is(pipingSystem.method, gravityFlow) vs gravityFlowPipeline
Is assuming there is a mehtod called gravity flow better than extracting the entire phrase?
prevent vs not cause

TEXT: 2.0 Conveyance of industrial liquid waste 2.3.2 Joints, fittings and valves – The number of joints, fittings and valves in the piping system shall be kept to a practical minimum.
LRML: if(exist(pipingSystem)), then(obligation(and(is(count(pipingSystem.joint), practicalMinimum), is(count(pipingSystem.fitting), practicalMinimum), is(count(pipingSystem.valve), practicalMinimum))))
PARAPHRASE: If a piping system exists, then piping system shall have the practical minimum number of joints, fittings and valves.

TEXT: 2.0 Conveyance of industrial liquid waste 2.3.2 Joints, fittings and valves – The number of joints, fittings and valves in the piping system shall be kept to a practical minimum.
LRML: if(exist(pipingSystem)), then(obligation(and(is(count(pipingSystem.joint), practicalMinimum), is(count(pipingSystem.fitting), practicalMinimum), is(count(pipingSystem.valve), practicalMinimum))))
PARAPHRASE: If a piping system exists, then piping system shall have the practical minimum number of joints, fittings and valves.

TEXT: 2.0 Conveyance of industrial liquid waste 2.3.2 Joints, fittings and valves – The number of joints, fittings and valves in the piping system shall be kept to a practical minimum.
LRML: if(exist(pipingSystem)), then(obligation(and(is(count(pipingSystem.joint), practicalMinimum), is(count(pipingSystem.fitting), practicalMinimum), is(count(pipingSystem.valve), practicalMinimum))))
PARAPHRASE: If a piping system exists, then the piping system shall have the practical minimum number of joints, fittings and valves.

TEXT: 2.0 Conveyance of industrial liquid waste 2.3.2 Joints, fittings and valves – The number of joints, fittings and valves in the piping system shall be kept to a practical minimum.
LRML: if(exist(pipingSystem)), then(obligation(and(is(count(pipingSystem.joint), practicalMinimum), is(count(pipingSystem.fitting), practicalMinimum), is(count(pipingSystem.valve), practicalMinimum))))
PARAPHRASE: If a piping system exists, then the piping system shall have the practical minimum number of joints, fittings and valves.

TEXT: 2.0 Conveyance of industrial liquid waste 2.3.2 Joints, fittings and valves – The number of joints, fittings and valves in the piping system shall be kept to a practical minimum.
LRML: if(exist(pipingSystem)), then(obligation(and(is(count(pipingSystem.joint), practicalMinimum), is(count(pipingSystem.fitting), practicalMinimum), is(count(pipingSystem.valve), practicalMinimum))))
PARAPHRASE: If a piping system exists, then the piping system shall have the practical minimum number of joints, fittings and valves.

TEXT: 2.3.3 Bends shall have a centreline radius of no less than 1.5 times the nominal pipe diameter.
LRML: if(has(pipe, bend)), then(obligation(and(define(pipe.nominalDiameter, x0),greaterThanEqual(bend.centrelineRadius, '1.5 * x0'))))
PARAPHRASE: If a pipe has a bend, then the bend's centreline radius shall be no less than 1.5 times the nominal diameter of the pipe.

TEXT: 2.3.3 Bends shall have a centreline radius of no less than 1.5 times the nominal pipe diameter.
LRML: if(has(pipe, bend)), then(obligation(and(define(pipe.nominalDiameter, x0),greaterThanEqual(bend.centrelineRadius, '1.5 * x0'))))
PARAPHRASE: If a pipe has a bend, then the bend's centreline radius shall be no less than 1.5 times the nominal diameter of the pipe.

TEXT: 3.2.1 Free-standing tanks shall be secured against earthquake forces. The methods given in NZS 4219 are acceptable.
LRML: if(is(tank.type, freeStanding)), then(and(obligation(has(tank, seismicResistance)), permission(asPer(tank.seismicResistance, nzs_4219))))
PARAPHRASE: If a tank is free-standing, the tank shall have seismic resistance. The tank's seismic resistance can be as described in NZS 4219.
COMMENTS:
secured against earthquake forces - IFC: seismicResistance
complyWith

TEXT: 3.2.1 Free-standing tanks shall be secured against earthquake forces. The methods given in NZS 4219 are acceptable.
LRML: if(is(tank.type, freeStanding)), then(and(obligation(has(tank, seismicResistance)), permission(asPer(tank.seismicResistance, nzs_4219))))
PARAPHRASE: If a tank is free-standing, then the tank shall have seismic resistance. The tank's seismic resistance can be as described in NZS 4219.
COMMENTS:
secured against earthquake forces - IFC: seismicResistance
complyWith

TEXT: 1.0.1 The method of solid waste disposal in multi-unit and group dwellings shall be by the provision of moveable containers having a capacity of at least 80 litres for each dwelling unit.
LRML: if(is(building.type, or(multiUnitDwelling, groupDwelling))), then(obligation(and(    has(building, solidWasteDisposal),loop(forEach(building.dwellingUnit),and(is(solidWasteDisposal.method, moveableContainer),greaterThanEqual(moveableContainer.capacity, 80 l))))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building is a multi-unit dwelling or group dwelling, then the building shall have solid waste disposal and for each dwelling unit the method of solid waste disposal shall be a moveable container with capacity of at least 80 litres.

TEXT: In addition: f) Have minimum slopes of 8° for hidden gutters g) Hidden gutters receive no discharge from downpipes or spreaders.
LRML: if(is(gutter.type, hidden)), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(gutter.slope, 8 deg)), prohibition(and(into(downpipe.discharge, gutter),into(spreader.discharge, gutter)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the gutter type is hidden, then the gutter shall have minimum slopes of 8 deg and the gutter shall not receive discharge from downpipes or spreaders.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Where roof penetrations are required for large openings such as roof lights and chimneys, this Acceptable Solution is limited to the following requirements: Rules 8.1.7.0.2.a.1 and 8.1.7.0.2.b.1.
LRML: if(and(for(roof.penetration, opening), is(opening, large), similarTo(opening, and(roofLight, chimney)))), then(and(applyTo('nzbc_e2as1_8.1.7.0.2.a.1', penetration),applyTo('nzbc_e2as1_8.1.7.0.2.b.1', penetration)))
PARAPHRASE: If roof penetrations are for large openings such as roof lights and chimneys, then E2/AS1 Rules 8.1.7.0.2.a.1 and 8.1.7.0.2.b.1 apply to the penetration.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.2.1 Materials; Clay tiles shall meet the requirements of AS 2049.
LRML: if(is(tile.material, clay)), then(obligation(complyWith(tile, as_2049)))
PARAPHRASE: If the tile material is clay, then the tile shall meet the requirements of AS 2049.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Roof cladding; Where required in AS 2050 and Table 20, underlay shall comply with Table 23.
LRML: if(and(requires(roofCladding, underlay), asPer(underlay, and(as_2050, nzbc_e2as1_t20)))), then(obligation(complyWith(underlay, nzbc_e2as1_t23)))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof cladding requires and underlay in AS 2050 and E2/AS1 Table 20, then the underlay shall comply with E2/AS1 Table 23.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.0 Roof claddings 8.2.3 Installation; Fixing and fixing patterns shall be to NZS 4206, with the exception that nails shall penetrate a minimum of 35 mm into timber battens, and the minimum pitches and roof underlay shall be as described in Table 10 and Table 23.
LRML: if(has(roofCladding, or(fixing, fixingPattern))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(fixing, nzs_4206),complyWith(fixing.pattern ,nzs_4206),into(nail.penetration, batten),is(batten.material, timber), include(fixing, nail),greaterThanEqual(nail.penetration, 35 mm),asPer(roofCladding.pitch, and(nzbc_e2as1_t10,  nzbc_e2as1_t23)),asPer(roofCladding.underlay, and(nzbc_e2as1_t10,  nzbc_e2as1_t23)))))
PARAPHRASE: If roof claddings have fixings or fixing patterns, then the fixing and fixing patterns shall be to NZS 4206, with the exception that nails shall penetrate a minimum of 35 mm into timber battens, and the roof cladding pitches and roof cladding underlay shall be as described in E2/AS1 Table 10 and Table 23.
COMMENTS:
exceptions are just ands? would need a certain defeasibility strength?
roof cladding underlay?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.2.3 Installation; Where masonry tiles have been shown to comply with the dynamic weathertightness test requirements of AS 4046: Part 9, a lower pitch (as in Table 10) may be used providing it is not less than 15°.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.type, masonryTile), complyWith(cladding, dynamicWeathertightnessTestRequirement), asPer(dynamicWeathertightnessTestRequirement, as_4046_9))), then(and(permission(and(not(asPer(cladding.pitch, nzbc_e2as1_t10)),greaterThanEqual(cladding.pitch, 15 deg)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the cladding type is masonry tiles and the cladding complies with the dynamic weathertightness test requirements of AS 4046 Part 9, then the cladding pitch may not be as in E2/AS1 Table 10 providing the cladding pitch is not less than 15 deg.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.2.3 Installation; Where masonry tiles have been shown to comply with the dynamic weathertightness test requirements of AS 4046: Part 9, a lower pitch (as in Table 10) may be used providing it is not less than 15°.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.type, masonryTile), complyWith(cladding, dynamicWeathertightnessTestRequirement), asPer(dynamicWeathertightnessTestRequirement, as_4046_9))), then(permission(and(not(asPer(cladding.pitch, nzbc_e2as1_t10)),greaterThanEqual(cladding.pitch, 15 deg))))
PARAPHRASE: If the cladding type is masonry tiles and the cladding complies with the dynamic weathertightness test requirements of AS 4046 Part 9, then the cladding pitch may not be as in E2/AS1 Table 10 providing the cladding pitch is not less than 15 deg.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Masonry tile roofs with underlays shall have anti-ponding boards installed to Figure 25. Where anti-ponding boards are used, these shall be set to a minimum fall of 5° (1:12), and shall be treated minimum H1.2 for solid timber and H3 for plywood.
LRML: if(and(is(roof.type, masonryTile), has(roof, underlay))), then(obligation(and(has(roof, antiPondingBoard),asPer(antiPondingBoard.installation, nzbc_e2as1_f25),greaterThanEqual(antiPondingBoard.fall, 5 deg),or(and(greaterThanEqual(antiPondingBoard.treatment,'h1.2'),is(antiPondingBoard.material, solidTimber)),and(greaterThanEqual(antiPondingBoard.treatment, h3),is(antiPondingBoard.material, plywood))))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof type is masonry tile and the roof has an underlay, then the roof shall have anti-ponding boards installed to E2/AS1 Figure 25 and the anti-ponding boards shall have a minimum fall of 5 deg, and either the anti-ponding boards shall be treated minimum H1.2 and material solid timber or the anti-ponding boards shall be treated minimum H3 and be material plywood.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is limited to pressed metal tile roofs.
LRML: if(is(roof.type, pressedMetalTile)), then(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, roof))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof is pressed metal tile, then E2/AS1 is applicable to the roof.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.0 Roof Claddings 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles 8.3.10 Roof penetrations; Pipe penetrations shall be flashed using EPDM flashings similar to that shown for masonry tiles, Figure 29.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type,pressedMetalTile),has(roofCladding, penetration),for(penetration, pipe))),then(obligation(and(has(penetration, flashing),is(flashing.material, epdm),define(masonryTile.flashing, x0),similarTo(flashing, x0),asPer(x0, 'nzbc_e2as1_f29'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof cladding type is pressed metal tiles and the roof cladding has pipe penetrations, then the penetrations shall be flashed using EPDM flashings similar to masonry tile flashing in E2/AS1 Figure 29.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall have (see Figures 2 and 3): i) Adequate support from bedding and backfilling with: i) concrete no less than 75 mm thick surrounding the entire gully dish and which is separated from the building foundation, where the gully trap is likely to be damaged, and j) A minimum of 600 mm clear access space above the gully dish.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(and(obligation(has(gullyTrap, and(bedding, backfilling))), obligation(and(has(gullyTrap, gullyDish),around(concrete, gullyDish),greaterThanEqual(concrete.thickness, 75 mm),or(awayFrom(concrete, buildingFoundation),not(is(gullyTrap, damageProne))))),obligation(and(has(gullyDish,accessSpace),above(accessSpace,gullyDish),greaterThanEqual(accessSpace, 600 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If gully traps exists, then gully traps shall have: i) bedding and backfilling with: i) concrete no less than 75 mm thick surrounding the entire gully dish and either the concrete is away from the building foundation or the gully trap is not damage prone, and j) A minimum of 600 mm clear access space above the gully dish.

TEXT: 3.3.2 In order to provide overflow relief for the drainage system, every building used for Housing shall be provided with at least one gully trap which shall:.
LRML: if(is(building.classifiedUse, housing)), then(obligation(has(building, gullyTrap)))
PARAPHRASE: If a building classified use is housing, then the building shall be provided with at least one gully trap

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.2 Gully trap which shall: Have a grating that will allow surcharge.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(has(gullyTrap,grating),for(grating,surcharge))))
PARAPHRASE: If gully traps exists, then gully traps shall have a grating for surcharge.

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.2 Gully trap which shall: Be located in a visible position.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(obligation(is(gullyTrap.location, visible)))
PARAPHRASE: If gully traps exists, then gully traps shall be located in a visible position.

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.2 Gully trap which shall: Be installed so that surcharge cannot enter into or under buildings.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(and(prohibition(into(gullyTrap.surcharge, building)), prohibition(below(gullyTrap.surcharge, building))))
PARAPHRASE: If gully traps exists, then gully traps surcharge shall not enter into or under buildings.

TEXT: 3.4.2 In buildings other than Housing, grease traps shall be provided where waste water is likely to convey grease.
LRML: if(and(not(is(building.classifiedUse, housing)), include(building.wasteWater, grease))), then(obligation(has(drain, greaseTrap)))
PARAPHRASE: If a buildings classified use is not Housing and its waste water is likely to convey grease, then grease traps shall be provided for the drain.

TEXT: 3.4.3 The capacity of a grease trap shall be at least twice the capacity of all sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances discharging to it, and in no case less than 100 litres as shown in Figure 4.
LRML: if(exist(greaseTrap)), then(and(into(sanitaryFixtures.discharge, greaseTrap),define(sum(sanitaryFixtures.capacity), x0),into(sanitaryAppliances.discharge, greaseTrap),define(sum(sanitaryAppliances.capacity), x1),obligation(greaterThanEqual(greaseTrap.capacity, and('2 * (x0 + x1)', 100 l)))))
PARAPHRASE: If grease trap exists, then the capacity of a grease trap shall be at least twice the capacity of all sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances with discharge into it, and in no case less than 100 litres.

TEXT: 3.4.3 The capacity of a grease trap shall be at least twice the capacity of all sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances discharging to it, and in no case less than 100 litres as shown in Figure 4.
LRML: if(exist(greaseTrap)), then(and(into(sanitaryFixtures.discharge, greaseTrap),define(sum(sanitaryFixtures.capacity), x0),into(sanitaryAppliances.discharge, greaseTrap),define(sum(sanitaryAppliances.capacity), x1),obligation(greaterThanEqual(greaseTrap.capacity, and('2 * (x0 + x1)', 100 l)))))
PARAPHRASE: If grease traps exists, then the capacity of a grease trap shall be at least twice the capacity of all sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances with discharge into it, and in no case less than 100 litres.

TEXT: 3.4.4 For restaurants and cafés, the capacity of the grease trap shall be at least 5 litres for each person for whom seating is provided, and in no case less than that required by Paragraph 3.4.3.
LRML: if(is(building.activity, or(restaurant, cafe))), then(obligation(and(define(count(building.seating), x0),greaterThanEqual(greaseTrap.capacity, 'x0 * 5 l'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the building's acitivity is restaurant or cafe, then the capacity of the grease trap shall be at least 5 litres for each seating.

TEXT: 3.4 Grease traps 3.4.6 The top of the outlet junction shall be extended to finished ground level and fitted with a watertight rodding point access cover as shown in Figures 4 and 10.
LRML: if(has(greaseTrap,outletJunction)), then(obligation(and(is(topOf(outletJunction),finishedGroundLevel),has(outletJunction,roddingPoint),has(roddingPoint,accessCover),is(accessCover,watertight))))
PARAPHRASE: If the grease trap has a outlet junction, then the top of the outlet junction shall be extended to finished ground level and fitted with a watertight rodding point access cover as shown in Figures 4 and 10.

TEXT: 3.5.1 Drains shall: a) Be laid at an even grade, and b) Have no obstructions to flow.
LRML: if(exist(drain)), then(and(obligation(is(drain.grade, even)), obligation(not(has(drain.flow, obstruction)))))
PARAPHRASE: If drains exists, then drains shall be laid at an even grade, and have no obstructions to flow.

TEXT: 3.5.2 Drains shall be installed at the maximum practicable gradient.
LRML: if(is(drain.installation, true)), then(obligation(is(drain.gradient, maximumPracticable)))
PARAPHRASE: If drains exists, then drains shall be installed at the maximum practicable gradient.

TEXT: 3.5.3 The gradient of drainage pipes shall be not less than that required in Table 2 for the relevant discharge unit loading.
LRML: if(exist(drainPipe)), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(drainPipe.gradient, value)), obligation(asPer(value, nzbc_g13as2_t2))))
PARAPHRASE: If drain pipes exists, then the gradient of drain pipes shall be not less than the value required in G13/AS2 Table 2.

TEXT: 3.6.1 The diameter of a drain shall not decrease in size in the direction of flow.
LRML: if(exist(drain)), then(prohibition(and(has(drain.diameter,reduction),is(reduction.direction,flow))))
PARAPHRASE: If drains exists, then the diameter of a drain shall not decrease in the direction of flow.

TEXT: 4.1.1 The drainage system shall be ventilated to allow a flow of air and to minimise the build up of foul air.
LRML: if(exist(drain)), then(obligation(has(drain, ventilation)))
PARAPHRASE: If drains exists, then the drain shall be ventilated.

TEXT: Prevent sagging of roof underlay by either: For R1 underlays, fully support with a corrosion resistant material • For R2 self supporting underlays, laid to maximum 1.2 metre span between adjacent supports.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(or(obligation(and(is(underlay.type, r1), has(underlay, support),is(support.material, corrosionResistant))), obligation(and(is(underlay.type, r2), is(underlay, selfSupporting),lessThanEqual(underlay.span, 1.2 m),inBetween(underlay.span, adjacentSupports)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has an underlay, then the underlay type shall be either R1 and the underlay shall be fully support with a corrosion resistant material, or the underly shall be type R2 and self supporting and laid to maximum 1.2 metre span between adjacent supports.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.1.6 Gutters general; Gutters, downpipes and spreaders, including eaves gutters/spoutings are required for the drainage of roof water.
LRML: if(exist(roof)), then(obligation(and(has(roof.drainage,and(gutter,downpipe,spreader)),has(roof.drainage,or(eaveGutter,eaveSpouting)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a roof exists, then the roof drainage shall have gutters, downpipes and spreaders, also the roof drainage shall have eave gutters or eave spoutings.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.1.6 Gutters general; Gutters, downpipes and spreaders, including eaves gutters/spoutings are required for the drainage of roof water.
LRML: if(exist(roof)), then(obligation(and(has(roof.drainage,and(gutter,downpipe,spreader)),has(roof.drainage,or(eaveGutter,eaveSpouting)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a roof exists, then the roof drainage shall have gutters, downpipes and spreaders, and the roof drainage shall have eave gutters or eave spoutings.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.1.6 Gutters general; Gutters, downpipes and spreaders required for the drainage of roof water shall: a) Be to the minimum dimensions shown in this Acceptable Solution, or calculated to E1/AS1, whichever is the greater.
LRML: if(requires(roof.drainage, or(gutter, downpipe, spreader))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(gutter.dimension, or(nzbc_e2as1, nzbc_e1as1)),complyWith(downpipe.dimension, or(nzbc_e2as1, nzbc_e1as1)),complyWith(spreader.dimension, or(nzbc_e2as1, nzbc_e1as1)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof drainage requires gutters, downpipes and spreaders, then the gutters, downpipes and spreaders shall comply with the dimensions in E2/AS1 and E1/AS1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Roof; c) For internal, valley, and hidden gutters, have no fixings in gutter bottoms or sides, and be continuously supported on H1.2 minimum treated timber gutter boards or H3 ply which is separated from metal by roof underlay strip.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, gutter), is(gutter.type, or(internal, valley, hidden)))), then(obligation(and(not(has(gutter.bottom,fixing)),not(has(gutter.side,fixing)),is(gutter.support, continuous),or(and(on(gutter.support,board),is(board.material,timber),greaterThanEqual(timber.treatment,'h1.2')),and(on(gutter.support,plywood),is(plywood.treatment,h3),has(roof, underlay),inBetween(underlay.strip,and(plywood, metal)))))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are internal, valley, and hidden, then the gutter shall have no fixings in gutter bottoms or sides, and be continuously supported and the support is either on H1.2 minimum treated timber boards or the support is on H3 treated plywood and roof underlay strips are between the plywood and metal.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.1.6.1 Internal gutters; Internal gutters shall: a) Be formed with continuous butyl or EPDM strip complying with Paragraph 4.3.9, with no cross-joints in the gutter, or aluminium, copper, stainless steel, or zinc sheet to Paragraph 4.3, with joints that are welded.
LRML: if(is(gutter.type, internal)), then(obligation(or(and(is(gutter.material, or(butyl, epdm)),complyWith(gutter.material, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.9'),not(has(gutter, crossJoint))),and(is(gutter.material, or(aluminium,copper,stainlessSteel,zinc)),complyWith(gutter.material, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3'),is(gutter.joint, welded)))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are internal, then the gutter material shall be butyl or EPDM and comply with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.3.9, with no cross-joints in the gutter, or aluminium, copper, stainless steel, or zinc to E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.3, with gutter joints that are welded.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.1.6.1 Internal gutters; Internal gutters shall: b) Where butyl or EPDM, be minimum 1.5 mm membrane thickness, or 1.0 mm thickness for gutters less than 1 metre wide.
LRML: if(and(is(gutter.type, internal), is(gutter.material, or(butyl, epdm)))), then(obligation(or(and(greaterThanEqual(gutter.thickness, 1.5 mm),greaterThanEqual(gutter.width, 1 m)),and(greaterThanEqual(gutter.thickness, 1 mm),lessThan(gutter.width, 1 m)))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are internal and gutter material is butyl or EPDM, then the gutter shall be minimum 1.5 mm thickness and not less than 1 metre wide, or 1 mm thickness and gutters less than 1 metre wide.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.1.6.1 Internal gutters; Internal gutters shall: c) Have a minimum slope of 1:100.
LRML: if(is(gutter.type, internal)), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(gutter.slope, 1/100)))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are internal, then the gutter shall have a minimum slope of 1:100.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.1.6.1 Internal gutters; Internal gutters shall: d) Be constructed to at least the minimum dimensions shown in Figure 52, or the capacity calculated to E1/AS1 plus an additional freeboard depth of 20 mm minimum.
LRML: if(is(gutter.type, internal)), then(obligation(or(asPer(gutter.dimension, nzbc_e2as1_f52),and(define(gutter.capacity, x0),asPer(x0.calculation, nzbc_e1as1),define(freeboard.depth,x1),greaterThanEqual(x1, 20 mm),equal(gutter.capacity,'x0 + x1')))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are internal, then the gutter be at least the minimum dimensions shown in E2/AS1 Figure 52, or the gutter capacity calculated to E1/AS1 plus an additional freeboard depth of 20 mm minimum.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: G15 Solid waste 1.0.2 Where containers are stored in a common area within a building or part of a building, a space of at least 0.5 m x 0.5 m by 1 m high shall be provided for each dwelling unit.
LRML: if(and(is(wasteStorageArea.type, common), within(wasteStorageArea.location, building))), then(obligation(loop(forEach(building.dwellingUnit),and(greaterThanEqual(wasteStorageArea.length, 0.5 m), greaterThanEqual(wasteStorageArea.width, 0.5 m), greaterThanEqual(wasteStorageArea.height, 1 m)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the waste storage area is common and within a building, then there shall be for each dwelling unit a space of at least 0.5 m length, 0.5 m width, and 1 m height.
COMMENTS: multi dewlling in if? - If no dwelling unit obligtion will be still true.

TEXT: G15 Solid waste 1.0.2 Where containers are stored in a common area within a building or part of a building, a space of at least 0.5 m x 0.5 m by 1 m high shall be provided for each dwelling unit.
LRML: if(and(is(wasteStorageArea.type, common), within(wasteStorageArea.location, building))), then(obligation(loop(forEach(building.dwellingUnit),and(greaterThanEqual(wasteStorageArea.length, 0.5 m), greaterThanEqual(wasteStorageArea.width, 0.5 m), greaterThanEqual(wasteStorageArea.height, 1 m)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the waste storage area is common and within a building, then there shall be for each of the building's dwelling unit a space of at least 0.5 m length, 0.5 m width, and 1 m height.
COMMENTS: multi dewlling in if? - If no dwelling unit obligtion will be still true.

TEXT: G15 Solid waste 1.0.2 Where containers are stored in a common area within a building or part of a building, a space of at least 0.5 m x 0.5 m by 1 m high shall be provided for each dwelling unit.
LRML: if(and(is(wasteStorageArea.type, common), within(wasteStorageArea.location, building))), then(obligation(loop(forEach(building.dwellingUnit),and(greaterThanEqual(wasteStorageArea.length, 0.5 m), greaterThanEqual(wasteStorageArea.width, 0.5 m), greaterThanEqual(wasteStorageArea.height, 1 m)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the waste storage area is common and within a building, then there shall be for each of the building's dwelling unit a space of at least 0.5 m length, 0.5 m width, and 1 m height.
COMMENTS: multi dewlling in if? - If no dwelling unit obligtion will be still true.

TEXT: G15 Solid waste 1.0.2 Where containers are stored in a common area within a building or part of a building, a space of at least 0.5 m x 0.5 m by 1 m high shall be provided for each dwelling unit.
LRML: if(and(is(wasteStorageArea.type, common), within(wasteStorageArea.location, building))), then(obligation(loop(forEach(building.dwellingUnit),and(greaterThanEqual(wasteStorageArea.length, 0.5 m), greaterThanEqual(wasteStorageArea.width, 0.5 m), greaterThanEqual(wasteStorageArea.height, 1 m)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the waste storage area is common and located within a building, then there shall be for each of the building's dwelling unit a space of at least 0.5 m length, 0.5 m width, and 1 m height.
COMMENTS: multi dewlling in if? - If no dwelling unit obligtion will be still true.

TEXT: G15 Solid waste 1.0.2 Where containers are stored in a common area within a building or part of a building, a space of at least 0.5 m x 0.5 m by 1 m high shall be provided for each dwelling unit.
LRML: if(and(is(wasteStorageArea.type, common), within(wasteStorageArea.location, building))), then(obligation(loop(forEach(building.dwellingUnit),and(greaterThanEqual(wasteStorageArea.length, 0.5 m), greaterThanEqual(wasteStorageArea.width, 0.5 m), greaterThanEqual(wasteStorageArea.height, 1 m)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the waste storage area is common and located within a building, then there shall be for each of the building's dwelling unit a space of at least 0.5 m length, 0.5 m width, and 1 m height.
COMMENTS: multi dewlling in if? - If no dwelling unit obligtion will be still true.

TEXT: G15 Solid waste 1.0.3 If a common storage area such as a ground floor rubbish area is provided within the building, it shall be adequately ventilated to the open air in compliance with NZBC G4.
LRML: if(and(is(wasteStorageArea.type, common), within(wasteStorageArea.location, building))), then(obligation(and(has(wasteStorageArea, ventilation),into(ventilation, openAir),complyWith(ventilation, nzbc_g4))))
PARAPHRASE: If a waste storage area is common and located within the building, then the waste storage area shall be adequately ventilated to the open air in compliance with NZBC G4.

TEXT: 2.0.1 In multi-unit and group dwellings, the maximum carry distance between any occupancy and a common solid waste storage area or chute shall be 30 m.
LRML: if(and(is(building.type, or(multiUnitDwelling, groupDwelling)))), then(obligation(loop(forEach(building.occupancy),and(towards(occupancy.carryDistance, or(wasteStorageArea, solidWasteChute)),lessThanEqual(occupancy.carryDistance, 30 m)))))
PARAPHRASE: In a building is a multi-unit dwelling or group dwelling, then for each building occupancy, the maximum carry distance between any occupancy and a solid waste storage area or chute shall be 30 m.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
occupancy vs dwelling unit.
Drop common
Possibility use solidWasteDisposal?

TEXT: 3.0.1 An acceptable common storage area for solid waste (see Figure 1) shall: a) Have interior surfaces which are easily cleaned.
LRML: if(and(for(wasteStorageArea, solidWaste), is(wasteStorageArea.type, common))), then(obligation(is(wasteStorageArea.interiorSurface, easilyCleaned)))
PARAPHRASE: If a waste storage area is for solid waste and common, then the waste storage area shall have interior surfaces which are easily cleaned.

TEXT: 3.0.1 An acceptable common storage area for solid waste (see Figure 1) shall: a) Have interior surfaces which are easily cleaned.
LRML: if(and(for(wasteStorageArea, solidWaste), is(wasteStorageArea.type, common))), then(obligation(is(wasteStorageArea.interiorSurface, easilyCleaned)))
PARAPHRASE: If a waste storage area is for solid waste and common, then the waste storage area shall have interior surfaces which are easily cleaned.

TEXT: 3.0 Solid waste Storage Areas 3.0.1 An acceptable common storage area for solid waste (see Figure 1) shall: Be totally enclosed and separated from habitable spaces and food preparation areas.
LRML: if(and(for(wasteStorageArea, solidWaste), is(wasteStorageArea.type, common))), then(and(obligation(is(wasteStorageArea, fullyEnclosed)), obligation(awayFrom(wasteStorageArea, and(habitableSpace, foodPreparationArea)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a waste storage area is for solid waste and common, then the waste storage area shall be totally enclosed and separated from habitable spaces and food preparation areas.

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is limited to the following types of profiled metal roof cladding: a) Profiled as outlined in Paragraph 8.4.4, b) Valley gutters that do not change direction in plan, c) Not curved, and d) With sheets no more than 18 metres long.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), or(asPer(profiledMetal, 'nzbc_e2as1_8.4.4'),and(has(profiledMetal, gutter), is(gutter.type, valley), not(is(gutter.changeInDirection, inPlan))), not(is(profiledMetal, curved)), lessThanEqual(profiledMetal.length, 18 m)))), then(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, roofCladding))
PARAPHRASE: If roof cladding is profiled metal and the profiled metal is as outlined in E2/AS1 Paragraph 8.4.4, or the profiled metal has valley gutters that do not change direction in plan, or the profiled metal is not curved, or the profiled metal is no more than 18 metres long, then E2/AS1 applies to the roof cladding.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4.10 Allowance for expansion; Allowance shall be made for expansion of corrugated and trapezoidal roof cladding as shown in Table 16.
LRML: if(is(roofCladding, or(corrugated, trapezoidal))), then(obligation(asPer(roofCladding.expansionAllowance,nzbc_e2as1_t16)))
PARAPHRASE: If roof cladding is corrugated or trapezoidal, then the roof cladding shall have allowance for expansion as shown in E2/AS1 Table 16.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The roofing shall be flashed at all boundaries to comply with the following: a) At edges discharging to gutters with eaves flashings where required in Figure 45(a) b) Soft edge to cover flashings complying with Paragraph 4.6. Refer to Figure 41 for example of use and Tables 21 and 22.c) Notched turn-downs to cover flashings shall comply with Paragraph 4.6. Refer to Figure 42 for example of use. d) Materials for flashings shall be compatible with the roof cladding material as per Table 21 and Table 22, and shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.3. e) Provide expansion joints in accordance with Paragraph 4.5.2.
LRML: if(exist(roof)), then(and(obligation(has(roof.boundary, flashing)),obligation(and(has(roof.edge, discharge),towards(discharge, gutter),has(roof.edge, flashing),is(flashing.type, eave),asPer(flashing, 'nzbc_e2as1_f45.a'))),obligation(and(is(flashing.cover, softEdge),has(roof,softEdgeflashing),complyWith(softEdge, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.6'))),obligation(and(is(flashing.cover, notchedTurnDown),complyWith(notchedTurnDown,'nzbc_e2as1_4.6'))),obligation(and(define(flashing.material, x0),has(roof, roofCladding),define(roofCladding.material, x1),inBetween(compatibility, and(x0, x1)),asPer(compatibility, and(nzbc_e2as1_t21,nzbc_e2as1_t22,'nzbc_e2as1_4.3')))),obligation(and(has(flashing,expansionJoint),asPer(expansionJoint,'nzbc_e2as1_4.5.2')))))
PARAPHRASE: If a roof exists, then the roof boundaries shall have flashings and a) At edges discharging to gutters with eaves flashings where required in E2/AS1 Figure 45.a. The flashing shall have soft edge as cover, and the soft edge shall comply with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.6. The flashing shall have notched turn-downs as cover, and the notched turn-downs shall comply with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.6. Materials for flashings shall be compatible with the roof cladding material as per E2/AS1 Table 21 and Table 22 and Paragraph 4.3. The flashing shall have expansion joints in accordance with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.5.2.
COMMENTS:
softEdge, notchedTurnDown
asPer vs in accordance...
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.0.1 This Acceptable Solution applies to solar water heaters installed in or on buildings.
LRML: if(or(within(solarWaterHeater.installation, building), on(solarWaterHeater.installation, building))), then(applyTo(nzbc_g12as2, solarWaterHeater))
PARAPHRASE: If solar water heaters installed in or on buildings, then G12/AS2 applies to the solar water heaters.

TEXT: 1.0.2 To comply with this Acceptable Solution solar water heaters must also comply with the appropriate requirements of G12/AS1.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(obligation(complyWith(solarWaterHeater, nzbc_g12as1)))
PARAPHRASE: If solar water heaters exist, then the solar water heaters must comply with G12/AS1.

TEXT: 1.1.1 Where a building has not been specifically designed to support a solar water heater, this Acceptable Solution can be used for the support and fixing of a solar collector on buildings that meet the structural requirements specified in any one of the following: • NZS 3604: 1990 • NZS 3604: 1999 • NZS 3604: 2011 • NZS 4203 • AS/NZS 1170: Parts 0, 1, 2, 3 and NZS 1170: Part 5. But only when all of the following requirements are met: a) the weight of solar collector, including frames, fittings, and heat transfer fluid, has a combined weight of no more than 22 kg per square metre (based on the gross area of the solar collector), and b) the hot water storage tank is not installed on or above the roof.
LRML: if(and(not(for(building.specificDesign, solarWaterHeater)), on(solarCollector.installation, building), complyWith(building.structure, or(nzs_3604_1990, nzs_3604_1999, nzs_3604_2011, nzs_4203, nzs_1170_0, nzs_1170_1, nzs_1170_2, nzs_1170_3, nzs_1170_5)),include(solarCollector.combinedWeight, and(frame, fitting, heatTransferFluid)), define(solarCollector.grossArea, x0),lessThanEqual(solarCollector.combinedWeight, '22 kg/m2 * x0'), not(on(hotWaterStorageVessel.installation, roof)), not(above(hotWaterStorageVessel.installation, roof)))), then(and(permission(complyWith(solarCollector.support, nzbc_g12as2)), permission(complyWith(solarCollector.fixing, nzbc_g12as2))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building has not been specifically designed for a solar water heater, but the solar collector is on the building and the buildings structure complies with NZS 3604: 1990, NZS 3604: 1999, NZS 3604: 2011, NZS 4203, AS/NZS 1170: Parts 0, 1, 2, 3 or NZS 1170: Part 5. And only if the weight of solar collector, including frames, fittings, and heat transfer fluid, is no more than 22 kg per square metre (based on the gross area of the solar collector), and if the hot water storage tank is not installed on or above the roof. Then the support and fixing of a solar collector may comply with G12/AS2.

TEXT: 3.1.2 Tanks installed as part of a pumped solar water heater where the tank is separately mounted from the collector must comply with the minimum tank insulation requirements of AS/NZS 4692.2.
LRML: if(and(partOf(tank, solarWaterHeater), is(solarWaterHeater.type, pumped), awayFrom(tank, collector))), then(obligation(complyWith(tank.insulation, nzs_4692_2)))
PARAPHRASE: If tanks are part of a pumped solar water heater and the tank is separated from the collector, then the tank's insulation must comply with AS/NZS 4692.2.

TEXT: 3.6.2 Drains shall have a diameter of not less than 80 mm where the drain serves only waste water fixtures.
LRML: if(and(for(drain, wasteWaterFixture),not(for(drain, fixture)),not(is(fixture, wasteWaterFixture)))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(drain.diameter, 80 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: IF the drain serves waste water fixtures and not fixtures that are not waste water fixtures, then drains shall have a diameter of not less than 80 mm.

TEXT: 3.6.2 Drains shall have a diameter of not less than 100 mm where the drain does not serve only waste water fixtures.
LRML: if(and(for(drain, fixture),not(is(fixture, wasteWaterFixture)))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(drain.diameter, 100 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: IF the drain serves fixtures that are not waste water fixtures, then the drain shall have a diameter of not less than 100 mm.

TEXT: 4.1.2 Every main drain, and every branch drain longer than 10 m, shall be ventilated in accordance with Table 3.
LRML: if(or(is(drain.type, main), and(is(drain.type, branch), greaterThanEqual(drain.length, 10 m)))), then(obligation(and(has(drain, ventilation),asPer(ventilation, nzbc_g13as2_t3))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain is type main, and the branch drain is longer than 10 m, then the drain shall be ventilated in accordance with G13/AS2 Table 3.

TEXT: 4.2.1 A main drain vent shall have a minimum diameter of 80 mm, and shall comply with termination requirements of Paragraph 5.7.3 of G13/AS1 "Sanitary Plumbing".
LRML: if(and(is(drain.type, main), has(drain, ventilation))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(ventilation.diameter, 80 mm)), obligation(complyWith(ventilation.termination, 'nzbc_g13as1_5.7.3'))))
PARAPHRASE: If a main drain has ventilation, then the ventilation shall have a minimum diameter of 80 mm, and the ventilation shall comply with termination requirements of G13/AS1 Paragraph 5.7.3.

TEXT: 5.1.1 Rigid pipes shall have flexible joints to resist damage from differential settlement.
LRML: if(is(pipe, rigid)), then(obligation(and(has(pipe,joint),is(joint,flexible))))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes are rigid, then the pipe shall have flexible joints.

TEXT: 5.1.2 Jointing for PVC-U pipes and fittings shall be in accordance with the methods described in AS/NZS 2032.
LRML: if(or(is(pipe.material, pvcU), is(pipeFitting.material, pvcU))), then(obligation(and(asPer(pipe.joint, nzs_2032),asPer(pipeFitting.joint, nzs_2032))))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes or pipe fittings are PVC-U, then the pipe and pipe fitting joints shall be in accordance with the methods described in AS/NZS 2032.

TEXT: 5.1.2 Jointing for PVC-U pipes and fittings shall be in accordance with the methods described in AS/NZS 2032.
LRML: if(or(is(pipe.material, pvcU), is(pipeFitting.material, pvcU))), then(obligation(and(asPer(pipe.joint, nzs_2032),asPer(pipeFitting.joint, nzs_2032))))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes or pipe fittings are PVC-U, then the pipe and pipe fitting joints shall be in accordance with AS/NZS 2032.

TEXT: 5.1.2 Jointing for PVC-U pipes and fittings shall be in accordance with the methods described in AS/NZS 2032.
LRML: if(or(is(pipe.material, pvcU), is(pipeFitting.material, pvcU))), then(obligation(and(asPer(pipe.joint, nzs_2032),asPer(pipeFitting.joint, nzs_2032))))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes or pipe fittings are PVC-U, then the pipe and pipe fitting joints shall be in accordance with AS/NZS 2032.

TEXT: 5.10.1 Where a drain or part of a drain is no longer required, it shall be disconnected from the foul water drainage system at the junction with the live drain or at the property boundary.
LRML: if(or(not(is(drain, required)), not(is(drain.part, required)))), then(obligation(or(disconnect(drain, or(liveDrainJunction,propertyBoundary)),disconnect(drain.part, or(liveDrainJunction,propertyBoundary)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain or part of a drain is not required, then the drain and part of a drain shall be disconnected at the live drain junction or at the property boundary.

TEXT: 5.10.1 Where a drain or part of a drain is no longer required, it shall be disconnected from the foul water drainage system at the junction with the live drain or at the property boundary.
LRML: if(or(not(is(drain, required)), not(is(drain.part, required)))), then(obligation(or(disconnect(drain, or(liveDrainJunction,propertyBoundary)),disconnect(drain.part, or(liveDrainJunction,propertyBoundary)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain or part of a drain is not required, then the drain and part of a drain shall be disconnected at the live drain junction or at the property boundary.

TEXT: Where drains are laid at gradients of 1:80 or less, verifiable levelling devices shall be used to ensure uniform and accurate gradients.
LRML: if(lessThanEqual(drain.gradient, 1/80)), then(obligation(and(requires(drain.installation,levellingDevice),is(levellingDevice,verifiable))))
PARAPHRASE: If drains are laid at gradients of 1:80 or less, then a verifiable levelling devices shall is required for the drain installation.

TEXT: The width B of the trench shall be no less than the pipe diameter D plus 200 mm.
LRML: if(for(trench, pipe)), then(obligation(and(define(pipe.diameter, x0),greaterThanEqual(trench.width, 'x0 + 200 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the trench is for the pipe, then the width of the trench shall be no less than the pipe diameter plus 200 mm.

TEXT: The width of the trench at the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm unless the pipes in the trench are covered with concrete, as shown in Figure 7 (c).
LRML: if(and(in(pipe.location, trench), is(trench.cover, concrete))), then(obligation(and( define(topOf(pipe.elevation), x0), define(trench.elevation, x1), equal(x1, x0), greaterThan(trench.width, 600 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the pipes located in the trench are not covered with concrete, then the width of the trench whaere the trench elevation is the same as the elevation of the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm.

TEXT: The width of the trench at the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm unless the pipes in the trench are covered with concrete, as shown in Figure 7 (c).
LRML: if(and(in(pipe.location, trench), is(trench.cover, concrete))), then(obligation(and( define(topOf(pipe.elevation), x0), equal(trench.elevation, x0), greaterThan(trench.width, 600 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the pipes located in the trench are not covered with concrete, then the width of the trench where the trench elevation is the same as the elevation of the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm.

TEXT: 6.1.1 All sections of the drainage system shall be tested by water test or air test to ensure watertightness.
LRML: if(partOf(drainSection, drainageSystem)), then(obligation(test(drainSection.watertightness,  or(waterTest, airTest))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain section is part of the drainage system, then the drain section shall be tested for watertightness by water test or air test.

TEXT: Valley gutters and hidden gutters shall be constructed as shown in Figures 50 and 51 for the applicable roof cladding (except for membrane roofing) and: a) Not change direction in plan b) Have a minimum underlap to roof cladding as specified in Figures 27, 37, 50, and 51 for the relevant roof cladding c) Be formed from any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.3 except 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 d) Be fixed at upper ends only, and be secured with a purpose-made clip system for the remaining length to enable expansion/ contraction along the length of the gutter e) Discharge into an internal gutter or eaves gutter/spouting.
LRML: if(and(is(gutter.type, or(valley, hidden)),not(is(roof.type, membrane)))), then(obligation(and(asPer(gutter.construction,and(nzbc_e2as1_f50,nzbc_e2as1_f51)),not(is(gutter.changeInDirection,inPlan)),towards(gutter.underlap, cladding),asPer(gutter.underlap,and(nzbc_e2as1_f27,nzbc_e2as1_f37,nzbc_e2as1_f50,nzbc_e2as1_f51)),asPer(gutter.material,'nzbc_e2as1_4.3'),not(asPer(gutter.material,or('nzbc_e2as1_4.3.10','nzbc_e2as1_4.3.11'))),has(gutter.upperEnd, fixing),is(fixing.type, clipSystem),is(clipSystem, purposeMade),for(clipSystem,and(contractionAllowance, expansionAllowance)),into(gutter.discharge, or(internalGutter,eaveGutter)))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutter type is valley or hidden and the roof type is not membrane, then the gutter shall be constructed as shown in E2/AS1 Figures 50 and 51, and the gutter shall not change direction in plan, the gutter shall have a minimum underlap to roof cladding as specified in E2/AS1 Figures 27, 37, 50, and 51, and the gutter material shall be as outlined in E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.3 and not in 4.3.10 and 4.3.11, and the gutter shall be fixed at upper ends, and be secured with a purpose-made clip system to enable expansion/ contraction, and the gutter shall discharge into an internal gutter or eave gutter.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Valley gutters and hidden gutters shall be constructed as shown in Figures 50 and 51 for the applicable roof cladding (except for membrane roofing) and: a) Not change direction in plan b) Have a minimum underlap to roof cladding as specified in Figures 27, 37, 50, and 51 for the relevant roof cladding c) Be formed from any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.3 except 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 d) Be fixed at upper ends only, and be secured with a purpose-made clip system for the remaining length to enable expansion/ contraction along the length of the gutter e) Discharge into an internal gutter or eaves gutter/spouting.
LRML: if(and(is(gutter.type, or(valley, hidden)),not(is(roof.type, membrane)))), then(obligation(and(asPer(gutter.construction,and(nzbc_e2as1_f50,nzbc_e2as1_f51)),not(is(gutter.changeInDirection,inPlan)),towards(gutter.underlap, cladding),asPer(gutter.underlap,and(nzbc_e2as1_f27,nzbc_e2as1_f37,nzbc_e2as1_f50,nzbc_e2as1_f51)),asPer(gutter.material,'nzbc_e2as1_4.3'),not(asPer(gutter.material,or('nzbc_e2as1_4.3.10','nzbc_e2as1_4.3.11'))),has(gutter.upperEnd, fixing),is(fixing.type, clipSystem),is(clipSystem, purposeMade),for(clipSystem,and(contractionAllowance, expansionAllowance)),into(gutter.discharge, or(internalGutter,eaveGutter)))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutter type is valley or hidden and the roof type is not membrane, then the gutter shall be constructed as shown in E2/AS1 Figures 50 and 51, and the gutter shall not change direction in plan, the gutter shall have a minimum underlap to roof cladding as specified in E2/AS1 Figures 27, 37, 50, and 51, and the gutter material shall be as outlined in E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.3 and not in 4.3.10 and 4.3.11, and the gutter shall be fixed at upper ends, and be secured with a purpose-made clip system to allow expansion and contraction, and the gutter shall discharge into an internal gutter or eave gutter.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: In addition f) Have minimum slopes to Table 8 for valley gutters h) Spreaders not discharge directly into a valley gutter.
LRML: if(is(gutter.type, valley)), then(and(obligation(asPer(gutter.slope, nzbc_e2as1_t8)), prohibition(and(is(spreader.discharge, direct),into(spreader.discharge, gutter)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the gutter type is valley, then the gutter shall have minimum slopes to E2/AS1 Table 8 and spreaders shall not discharge directly into the gutter.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Valley gutters be minimum 250 mm wide where receiving run off from spreaders.
LRML: if(and(is(gutter.type, valley), into(spreader.discharge, gutter))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(gutter.width, 250 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: If the gutter type is valley and spreaders discharge into the gutter, then the gutter shall be minimum 250 mm wide.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.1.7 Roof penetrations; Roof penetrations shall be made weathertight in accordance with Paragraph 8.2 to Paragraph 8.5.
LRML: if(has(roof, penetration)), then(obligation(and(is(penetration, weathertight),complyWith(penetration, and('nzbc_e2as1_8.2 to nzbc_e2as1_8.5')))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has penetrations, then the penetration shall be made weathertight in accordance with E2/AS1 Paragraph 8.2 to Paragraph 8.5.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The edge of roofing penetrations over 200 mm wide shall be supported in either direction with additional framing as shown in Figure 21.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, penetration), greaterThan(penetration.width, 200 mm))), then(obligation(and(has(penetration, edge),loop(forEach(edge.direction),is(edge.support, framing)),asPer(framing, nzbc_e2as1_f21))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has penetrations over 200 mm wide, then the edge of the penetration shall be supported in either direction with additional framing as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 21.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: For the catchment area of the roof above the penetration as shown in Figure 22, the roof length shall be limited to: i) for profiled metal roofing, Table 17 ii) for other roof claddings, the areas shown in Table 9.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, penetration), above(roof.catchmentArea, penetration), asPer(roof.catchmentArea, nzbc_e2as1_f22))), then(or(obligation(and(is(roof.type,profiledMetal),asPer(roof.length, nzbc_e2as1_t17))), obligation(and(not(is(roof.type,profiledMetal)),asPer(roof.length, nzbc_e2as1_t9)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has a penetration and the catchment area of the roof is above the penetration and the catchment area is as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 22, then the roof length shall be limited to E2/AS1 Table 17 and roof type is profiled metal, or roof type is not profiled metal and the roof length is as shown in E2/AS1 Table 9.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.2.1 Materials; Concrete tiles shall meet the requirements of NZS 4206 or AS 2049.
LRML: if(is(tile.material, concrete)), then(obligation(complyWith(tile, or(nzs_4206, as_2049))))
PARAPHRASE: If the tile material is concrete, then the tile shall meet the requirements of NZS 4206 or AS 2049.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.1.3 Basic normal maintenance tasks shall include but not be limited to: a) Where applicable, following manufacturers' maintenance recommendations, b) Washing down surfaces, particularly exterior building elements subject to wind driven salt spray, c) Re-coating interior and exterior protective finishes, d) Replacing sealant, seals and gaskets in joints, e) Replacing valves, washers and similar high wear components in easily accessed service equipment and other building elements, f) Cleaning and replacing filters in building services systems, g) The regular servicing of boilers, cooling towers, lifts, escalators, emergency lighting and fire protection equipment, and h) The maintenance of signs for access, escape routes, emergency equipment and hazardous areas.
LRML: if(is(maintenance.type, or(normal, basic))), then(obligation(and(include(maintenance.task, manufacturersRecommendation), include(maintenance.task, washing), for(washing, surface), include(maintenance.task, recoating),for(recoating, and(interiorProtectiveFinish, exteriorProtectiveFinish)), include(maintenance.task, replacing),for(replacing, and(jointSealant, jointSeal, jointGasket, valve, washer, component)), is(component, highWear),include(maintenance.task, cleaning),for(cleaning, buildingServiceSystemFilter),for(replacing, buildingServiceSystemFilter),include(maintenance.task, service),is(service.type, regular),for(service, and(boiler, coolingTower, lift, escalator, emergencyLighting, fireProtectionEquipment)),include(maintenance.task, maintenance),for(maintenance, sign),is(sign.type, and(access, escapeRoute, emergencyEquipment, hazardousArea))  )))
PARAPHRASE: If the the maintenance is basic or normal, the maintenance tasks shall include the manufacturers recommendations, and the maintenance tasks shall include washing down surfaces, and the maintenance tasks shall include recoating interior protective finishes and exterior protective finishes, and the maintenance tasks shall include replacing joint sealant, joint seals, joint gaskets, valves, washers and high wear components, and the maintenance tasks shall include cleaning building services system filters and replacing building services system filters, and the maintenance tasks shall include the regular service of regular boiler, cooling tower, lift, escalator, emergency lighting, fire protection equipment, and the maintenance tasks shall include the maintenance for signs type access, escape route, emergency equipment and hazardous area.

TEXT: 2.1.3 Basic normal maintenance tasks shall include but not be limited to: a) Where applicable, following manufacturers' maintenance recommendations, b) Washing down surfaces, particularly exterior building elements subject to wind driven salt spray, c) Re-coating interior and exterior protective finishes, d) Replacing sealant, seals and gaskets in joints, e) Replacing valves, washers and similar high wear components in easily accessed service equipment and other building elements, f) Cleaning and replacing filters in building services systems, g) The regular servicing of boilers, cooling towers, lifts, escalators, emergency lighting and fire protection equipment, and h) The maintenance of signs for access, escape routes, emergency equipment and hazardous areas.
LRML: if(is(maintenance.type, or(normal, basic))), then(obligation(and(include(maintenance.task, manufacturersRecommendation), include(maintenance.task, washing), for(washing, surface), include(maintenance.task, recoating),for(recoating, and(interiorProtectiveFinish, exteriorProtectiveFinish)), include(maintenance.task, replacing),for(replacing, and(jointSealant, jointSeal, jointGasket, valve, washer, component)), is(component, highWear),include(maintenance.task, cleaning),for(cleaning, buildingServiceSystemFilter),for(replacing, buildingServiceSystemFilter),include(maintenance.task, servicing),is(servicing.type, regular),for(servicing, and(boiler, coolingTower, lift, escalator, emergencyLighting, fireProtectionEquipment)),include(maintenance.task, maintaining),for(maintaining, sign),is(sign.type, and(access, escapeRoute, emergencyEquipment, hazardousArea)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the the maintenance is basic or normal, the maintenance tasks shall include the manufacturers recommendations, and the maintenance tasks shall include washing down surfaces, and the maintenance tasks shall include recoating interior protective finishes and exterior protective finishes, and the maintenance tasks shall include replacing joint sealant, joint seals, joint gaskets, valves, washers and high wear components, and the maintenance tasks shall include cleaning building services system filters and replacing building services system filters, and the maintenance tasks shall include the regular servicing of boiler, cooling tower, lift, escalator, emergency lighting, fire protection equipment, and the maintenance tasks shall include maintaining signs type access, escape route, emergency equipment and hazardous area.

TEXT: Table 2 sets out the risk matrix that shall be used to define the risk score for a building within the scope of this Acceptable Solution. A risk score is calculated for each external face of the building. Claddings are then selected from Table 3 according to the risk scores.
LRML: if(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, building)), then(obligation(and(asPer(riskMatrix, nzbc_e2as1_t2),loop(forEach(building.exteriorFace), and(asPer(exteriorFace.riskScore, riskMatrix),asPer(exteriorFace.cladding, and(riskScore, nzbc_e2as1_t3)))))))
PARAPHRASE: If E2/AS1 applies to a building, the risk matrix shall be as in E2/AS1 Table 2, and the for each exterior face the risk score shall be calculated according to risk matrix and the exterior face's claddings shall be according to the risk score and E2/AS1 Table 3.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.2.1 Where a solar water heater has a controller, the controller must meet the requirements specified in AS/NZS 2712: clause 6.3.
LRML: if(has(solarWaterHeater, controller)), then(obligation(complyWith(controller, 'nzs_2712_6.3')))
PARAPHRASE: If a solar water heater has a controller, then the controller must meet the requirements specified in AS/NZS 2712: clause 6.3.

TEXT: 3.2.3 A solar water heater which meets the requirements described in Paragraphs 3.2.1 and/or 3.2.2 satisfies NZBC Clause H1.3.4.
LRML: if(complyWith(solarWaterHeater, or('nzbc_g12as2_3.2.1', 'nzbc_g12as2_3.2.2'))), then(complyWith(solarWaterHeater, 'nzbc_h1_3.4'))
PARAPHRASE: If a solar water heater meets the requirements described in G12/AS2 Paragraphs 3.2.1 or 3.2.2, then the solar water heater satisfies NZBC Clause H1 3.4.

TEXT: 3.3.1 Solar water heaters must have a minimum of 50 litres of hot water storage per square metre of collector area.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(and(obligation(and(has(solarWaterHeater, hotWaterStorage),has(solarWaterHeater, solarCollector),define(solarCollector.area, x0), greaterThanEqual(hotWaterStorage.capacity, '50 l/m2 * x0')))))
PARAPHRASE: If a solar water heater exists, then the solar water heater must have a minimum of 50 litres of hot water storage per square metre of collector area.
COMMENTS:
COMPLEX
ORDER
collector - buvo: solarCollector
infer capacity - : ifc property: waterStorageCapacity
is(x0.unit, m2) vs x0 m2

TEXT: 3.3.1 Solar water heaters must have a minimum of 50 litres of hot water storage per square metre of collector area.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(and(obligation(and(has(solarWaterHeater, hotWaterStorage),has(solarWaterHeater, solarCollector),define(solarCollector.area, x0), greaterThanEqual(hotWaterStorage.capacity, '50 l * x0')))))
PARAPHRASE: If a solar water heater exists, then the solar water heater must have a minimum of 50 litres of hot water storage per square metre of collector area.
COMMENTS:
COMPLEX
ORDER
collector - buvo: solarCollector
infer capacity - : ifc property: waterStorageCapacity
is(x0.unit, m2) vs x0 m2

TEXT: 3.3.1 Solar water heaters must have a minimum of 50 litres of hot water storage per square metre of collector area.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(and(obligation(and(has(solarWaterHeater, hotWaterStorage),has(solarWaterHeater, solarCollector),define(solarCollector.area, x0), greaterThanEqual(hotWaterStorage.capacity, '50 l * x0')))))
PARAPHRASE: If a solar water heater exists, then the solar water heater must have a minimum of 50 litres of hot water storage per square metre of collector area.
COMMENTS:

infer capacity - : ifc property: waterStorageCapacity

TEXT: Where the solar water heater stores potable water and is used as a pre-heater for an instantaneous water heater, either: a) the hot water storage tank connected to the solar collector must be fitted with supplementary heating and a controller operating to meet the conditions outlined in Paragraph 3.5.1, b) the instantaneous water heater must heat all water passing through it to not less than 70°C.
LRML: if(and(has(solarWaterHeater, potableWaterStorage), is(solarWaterHeater, preHeater), for(preHeater, instantaneousWaterHeater))), then(or(obligation(and(connect(solarWaterHeater.solarCollector, hotWaterStorageTank),has(hotWaterStorageTank, and(supplementaryHeating, controller)),complyWith(controller, 'nzbc_g12as2_3.5.1'))), obligation(and(through(water, instantaneousWaterHeater),greaterThanEqual(water.temperature, 70 degC)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the solar water heater has potable water storage and is used as a pre-heater for an instantaneous water heater, then either the hot water storage tank connected to the solar collector must be fitted with supplementary heating and a controller operating to meet the conditions outlined in G12/AS2 Paragraph 3.5.1, or the water passing through instantaneous water heater must be heated to not less than 70 degC.

TEXT: 4.2.1 Solar collectors must face within +/- 90 degrees of geographic north (ie between east and west) to satisfy the requirements of NZBC Clause H1.3.4(a).
LRML: if(exist(solarCollector)), then(obligation(within(solarCollector.orientation,' +/- 90 degreesOfGeographicalNorth')))
PARAPHRASE: Solar collectors must face within +/- 90 degrees of geographic north.

TEXT: 4.2.2 Solar collectors must be inclined at an angle within +/- 20 degrees of the angle of latitude (from the horizontal) to satisfy the requirements of NZBC Clause H1.3.4(a).
LRML: if(exist(solarCollector)), then(obligation(equal(solarCollector.inclinationAngle, '+/- 20 degreesOfTheAngleOfLatitude')))
PARAPHRASE: If solar collectors exist, then the solar collectors must be inclined at an angle within +/- 20 degrees of the angle of latitude.

TEXT: 5.0.1 Solar water heaters must be installed in accordance with the requirements of AS/NZS 3500 Part 4, unless modified by this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(or(obligation(complyWith(solarWaterHeater.installation, nzs_3500_4)), obligation(by(nzs_3500_4.modification, nzbc_g12as2))))
PARAPHRASE: If solar water heaters exist, then the solar water heaters must either be installed in accordance with the requirements of NZS 3500 Part 4, or NZS 3500 Part 4 is modified by G12/AS2.

TEXT: 5.0.2 Water storage tanks that form part of a solar water heater must have drain pipes that: a) have an easily reached isolating valve, and terminate with a cap or plug to empty the vessel for maintenance, or b) terminate outside the building with a cap only.
LRML: if(partOf(waterStorageTank, solarWaterHeater)), then(and(obligation(has(waterStorageTank, drainPipe)), or(obligation(and(has(drainPipe, isolatingValve),is(isolatingValve, easilyReached),has(drainPipe.terminationPoint, or(cap, plug)))), obligation(and(outside(drainPipe.terminationPoint, building), by(drainPipe.terminationPoint, cap))))))
PARAPHRASE: If water storage tanks are part of a solar water heater, then the water storage tank must have drain pipes that either have an easily reached isolating valve, and terminate with a cap or plug, or drain pipes that terminate outside the building with a cap.

TEXT: 5.0.3 Fixings used for the installation of a solar water heater must meet the requirements described in Paragraphs 2.1.1, 2.1.2, 2.1.3 and 2.1.4.
LRML: if(has(solarWaterHeater.installation, fixing)), then(obligation(complyWith(fixing, and('nzbc_g12as2_2.1.1', 'nzbc_g12as2_2.1.2', 'nzbc_g12as2_2.1.3', 'nzbc_g12as2_2.1.4'))))
PARAPHRASE: If fixings are used for the installation of a solar water heater, then the fixing must meet the requirements described in G12/AS1 Paragraphs 2.1.1, 2.1.2, 2.1.3 and 2.1.4.

TEXT: 2.1.3 Basic normal maintenance tasks shall include but not be limited to: a) Where applicable, following manufacturers' maintenance recommendations, b) Washing down surfaces, particularly exterior building elements subject to wind driven salt spray, c) Re-coating interior and exterior protective finishes, d) Replacing sealant, seals and gaskets in joints, e) Replacing valves, washers and similar high wear components in easily accessed service equipment and other building elements, f) Cleaning and replacing filters in building services systems, g) The regular servicing of boilers, cooling towers, lifts, escalators, emergency lighting and fire protection equipment, and h) The maintenance of signs for access, escape routes, emergency equipment and hazardous areas.
LRML: if(is(maintenance.type, or(normal, basic))), then(obligation(and(include(maintenance.task, manufacturersRecommendation), include(maintenance.task, washing), for(washing, surface), include(maintenance.task, recoating),for(recoating, and(interiorProtectiveFinish, exteriorProtectiveFinish)), include(maintenance.task, replacing),for(replacing, and(jointSeal, jointGasket, valve, washer, component)), is(component, highWear),include(maintenance.task, cleaning),for(cleaning, buildingServiceSystemFilter),for(replacing, buildingServiceSystemFilter),include(maintenance.task, service),is(service.type, regular),for(service, and(boiler, coolingTower, lift, escalator, emergencyLighting, fireProtectionEquipment)),include(maintenance.task, maintenance),for(maintenance, sign),is(sign.type, and(access, escapeRoute, emergencyEquipment, hazardousArea))  )))
PARAPHRASE: If the the maintenance is basic or normal, the maintenance tasks shall include the manufacturers recommendations, washing down surfaces, recoating interior protective finishes, recoating exterior protective finishes, replacing joint sealant, replacing joint seals, replacing joint gaskets, replacing valves, replacing washers and replacing high wear components, cleaning building services system filters and replacing building services system filters, regular boiler service, regular cooling tower service, regular lift service, regular escalator service, regular emergency lighting service, regular fire protection equipment service, access sign maintenance, escape route sign maintenance, emergency equipment sign maintenance and hazardous area sign maintenance.

TEXT: Table 2 sets out the risk matrix that shall be used to define the risk score for a building within the scope of this Acceptable Solution. A risk score is calculated for each external face of the building. Claddings are then selected from Table 3 according to the risk scores.
LRML: if(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, building)), then(obligation(and(asPer(riskMatrix, nzbc_e2as1_t2),asPer(building.riskScore, riskMatrix),loop(forEach(building.exteriorFace), and(asPer(exteriorFace.riskScore, riskMatrix),asPer(exteriorFace.cladding, and(riskScore, nzbc_e2as1_t3)))))))

TEXT: Flashings are required to shed or divert water at sensitive areas of the building cladding. These include at: a) The building periphery, except where gutters are present, b) Changes of direction in cladding materials, c) Intersections between cladding materials or with other buildings, and d) Roof or wall penetrations, including windows, doors and other penetrations.
LRML: if(and(has(building, cladding),or(is(cladding.area, sensitive), and(is(cladding.area, buildingPeriphery), not(within(cladding.area, gutter))), and(has(cladding.area, material),has(material, changeInDirection)),and(has(cladding.area, intersection), or(has(cladding, materials),inBetween(intersection, materials), towards(intersection, otherBuilding))),has(cladding.area, or(penetration, window, door))))), then(obligation(and(has(cladding.area, flashing),for(flashing,or(shedWater,divertWater)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the building cladding has a sensitive areas or the cladding area is the building periphery, and no gutters are in the cladding area, or the cladding area's material has changes of direction, or the cladding area has intersections between cladding materials or to other buildings, or the cladding area has penetrations, windows or doors, then the cladding area shall have flashings to shed water or divert water.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.9.1 Where two or more soil fixtures are connected to a branch drain beneath the building, access for cleaning shall be provided by a sealed floor level rodding point located downstream of the highest fixture connection to the branch drain (see Figures 10 and 13).
LRML: if(and(greaterThanEqual(soilFixture.count, 2), connect(soilFixture, drain), is(drain.type, branch), below(drain, building))), then(obligation(and(has(drain,cleaningAccess),is(cleaningAccess,roddingPoint),is(roddingPoint,floorLevel),is(roddingPoint.type,sealed),equal(roddingPoint.location,highestFixtureConnection))))
PARAPHRASE: If two or more soil fixtures are connected to a branch drain beneath the building, then access for cleaning shall be provided by a sealed floor level rodding point located at the highest fixture connection.

TEXT: 5.9.1 Where two or more soil fixtures are connected to a branch drain beneath the building, access for cleaning shall be provided by a sealed floor level rodding point located downstream of the highest fixture connection to the branch drain (see Figures 10 and 13).
LRML: if(and(greaterThanEqual(soilFixture.count, 2), connect(soilFixture, drain), is(drain.type, branch), below(drain, building))), then(obligation(and(has(drain,cleaningAccess),is(cleaningAccess,roddingPoint),is(roddingPoint,floorLevel),is(roddingPoint.type,sealed),equal(roddingPoint.location,highestFixtureConnection))))
PARAPHRASE: If two or more soil fixtures are connected to a branch drain beneath the building, then the drain shall have access for cleaning by a sealed floor level rodding point located at the highest fixture connection.

TEXT: 5.9.3 Access points may be located in a space containing a soil fixture.
LRML: if(exist(accessPoint)), then(permission(and(within(accessPoint.location, space),include(space, soilFixture))))
PARAPHRASE: If access points exists, then access points may be located in a space containing a soil fixture.

TEXT: 6.1.1 All sections of the drainage system shall be tested by water test or air test to ensure watertightness.
LRML: if(partOf(drainSection, drainageSystem)), then(obligation(test(drainSection.watertightness,  or(waterTest, airTest))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain section is part of the drainage system, then the drain section shall be tested for watertightness by water test or air test.

TEXT: 8.0 Roof claddings 8.2.3 Installation; Fixing and fixing patterns shall be to NZS 4206, with the exception that nails shall penetrate a minimum of 35 mm into timber battens, and the minimum pitches and roof underlay shall be as described in Table 10 and Table 23.
LRML: if(has(roofCladding, or(fixing, fixingPattern))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(fixing, nzs_4206),complyWith(fixing.pattern ,nzs_4206),into(nail.penetration, batten),is(batten.material, timber), include(fixing, nail),greaterThanEqual(nail.penetration, 35 mm),asPer(roofCladding.pitch, and(nzbc_e2as1_t10,  nzbc_e2as1_t23)),asPer(roofCladding.underlay, and(nzbc_e2as1_t10,  nzbc_e2as1_t23)))))
PARAPHRASE: If roof claddings have fixings or fixing patterns, then the fixing and fixing patterns shall be to NZS 4206, with the exception that nails shall penetrate a minimum of 35 mm into timber battens, and the roof cladding pitches and roof cladding underlay shall be as described in E2/AS1 Table 10 and Table 23.
COMMENTS:
exceptions are just ands? would need a certain defeasibility strength?
roof cladding underlay?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.0 Roof claddings 8.2.3 Installation; Fixing and fixing patterns shall be to NZS 4206, with the exception that nails shall penetrate a minimum of 35 mm into timber battens, and the minimum pitches and roof underlay shall be as described in Table 10 and Table 23.
LRML: if(has(roofCladding, or(fixing, fixingPattern))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(fixing, nzs_4206),complyWith(fixing.pattern, nzs_4206),into(nail.penetration, batten),is(batten.material, timber), include(fixing, nail),greaterThanEqual(nail.penetration, 35 mm),asPer(roofCladding.pitch, and(nzbc_e2as1_t10, nzbc_e2as1_t23)),asPer(roofCladding.underlay, and(nzbc_e2as1_t10, nzbc_e2as1_t23)))))
PARAPHRASE: If roof claddings have fixings or fixing patterns, then the fixing and fixing patterns shall be to NZS 4206, with the exception that fixing include nails and nails shall penetrate a minimum of 35 mm into timber battens, and the roof cladding pitches and roof cladding underlay shall be as described in E2/AS1 Table 10 and Table 23.
COMMENTS:
exceptions are just ands? would need a certain defeasibility strength?
roof cladding underlay?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Use 304 or 316 stainless steel fixings for corrosion zones B, C or hot dip galvanised fixings at 450 g/m2 for Zone B and Zone C.
LRML: if(and(is(corrosionZone, or(b, c)), for(fixing, corrosionZone))), then(obligation(or(and(is(fixing.material, stainlessSteel),is(stainlessSteel.grade, or(304, 306))),and(is(fixing.material, hotDipGalvanized),is(fixing.weight, 450g/m2)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the corrosion zones for the fixing is B or C, then the fixing material shall be 304 or 316 stainless steel or hot dip galvanised fixings at 450 g/m2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.0 Roof; Hips, ridges, valleys and barges shall be made weathertight by using flashings and seals as shown in Figure 23 to Figure 28.
LRML: if(is(roof.component, or(hip, ridge, valley, barge))), then(obligation(and(by(component.weathertightness, and(flashing, seal)),asPer(flashing, 'nzbc_e2as1_f23 to nzbc_e2as1_f28'),asPer(seal, 'nzbc_e2as1_f23 to nzbc_e2as1_f28'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof component is a hip, ridge, valley or barge, then the component shall be made weathertight by using flashings and seals, the flashings and seals shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 23 to Figure 28.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.2 Masonry Tiles 8.2.7 Penetrations; Holes in tiles for pipe penetrations shall be machine-cut to minimise the size of the hole.
LRML: if(and(has(masonryTiles, penetration), for(penetration, pipe))), then(obligation(is(penetration, machineCut)))
PARAPHRASE: If masonry tiles have penetrations for pipes, then the penetrations shall be machine-cut.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles 8.3.4.2 Steel; Paint coatings may include factory-applied finishes complying with AS/NZS 2728.
LRML: if(and(is(pressedMetalTile.material, steel), has(pressedMetalTile, paintCoating))), then(permission(and(include(paintCoating, factoryAppliedFinish),complyWith(factoryAppliedFinish, nzs_2728))))
PARAPHRASE: If the pressed metal tile's material is steel and the stell has paint coatings, then the paint coatings may include factory-applied finishes complying with NZS 2728.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Pressed metal tiles; For fixings through the top of the tiles, use neoprene washers containing no more than 15% by weight carbon black content.
LRML: if(has(pressedMetalTile.top, fixing)), then(obligation(and(is(fixing, neopreneWasher),lessThanEqual(neopreneWasher.carbonBlackContent, 15 percent))))
