PARAPHRASE: If the top of the pressed metal tile has a fixing, then the fixing shall be neoprene washers, and the neoprene washer's carbon black content shall be no more than 15 percent.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4.11.1 Fixing flashings a) When fixing flashings to the structure, use screws as for roofing (see Paragraph 8.4.8).
LRML: if(towards(flashing.fixing, roof)), then(obligation(and(is(fixing.type, screw),for(screw, roof))))
PARAPHRASE: If fixing flashings to the roof, then the fixing type shall be screws as for roofing.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4.11.1 Fixing flashings b) When fixing flashings to other flashings or to roofing use: i) for galvanized steel, 4 mm diameter monel metal or stainless steel rivets, where compatible as per Table 21, ii) for aluminium-zinc coated steel, 4 mm diameter aluminium rivets, iii) for aluminium, 4 mm diameter aluminium rivets.
LRML: if(towards(flashing.fixing, or(flashing, roof))), then(or(obligation(and(is(flashing.material,galvanisedSteel),is(roof.material,galvanisedSteel),is(fixing.type,rivet),is(fixing.material,or(monelMetal,stainlessSteel)),equal(fixing.diameter,4 mm),asPer(fixing,nzbc_e2as1_t21))), obligation(and(is(flashing.material,or(aluminiumZincCoatedSteel,aluminium)),is(roof.material,or(aluminiumZincCoatedSteel,aluminium)),is(fixing.type,rivet),is(fixing.material,aluminium),equal(fixing.diameter,4 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If fixing flashings to other flashings or to the roof, either the flashing and roof shall be galvanized steel and the fixing 4 mm diameter monel metal or stainless steel rivets as per E2/AS1 Table 21, or  the flashing and roof shall be aluminium-zinc coated steel or aluminium, and the fixings shall be 4 mm diameter aluminium rivets.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Flashings are required to shed or divert water at sensitive areas of the building cladding. These include at: a) The building periphery, except where gutters are present, b) Changes of direction in cladding materials, c) Intersections between cladding materials or with other buildings, and d) Roof or wall penetrations, including windows, doors and other penetrations.
LRML: if(and(has(building, cladding),or(is(cladding.area, sensitive), and(is(cladding.area, buildingPeriphery), not(within(cladding.area, gutter))), and(has(cladding.area, material),has(material, changeInDirection)),and(has(cladding.area, intersection), or(has(cladding, materials),inBetween(intersection, materials), towards(intersection, otherBuilding))),has(cladding.area, or(penetration, window, door))))), then(obligation(and(has(cladding.area, flashing),for(flashing,or(shedWater,divertWater)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the building cladding has a sensitive areas or the cladding area is the building periphery, and no gutters are in the cladding area, or the cladding area's material has changes of direction, or the cladding area has intersections between cladding materials or to other buildings, or the cladding area has penetrations, windows or doors, then the cladding area shall have flashings to shed water or divert water.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.0.1 An acceptable common storage area for solid waste (see Figure 1) shall: Be protected from high temperatures which could hasten putrification.
LRML: if(and(for(wasteStorageArea, solidWaste), is(wasteStorageArea.type, common))), then(obligation(and(has(wasteStorageArea, protection),for(protection, highTemperature))))
PARAPHRASE: If a waste storage area is for solid waste and common, then the waste storage area shall be protected from high temperatures.

TEXT: 3.0.1 An acceptable common storage area for solid waste (see Figure 1) shall: Be screened from habitable spaces to reduce visual impact.
LRML: if(and(for(wasteStorageArea, solidWaste), is(wasteStorageArea.type, common))), then(obligation(screenedFrom(wasteStorageArea, habitableSpace)))
PARAPHRASE: If a waste storage area is for solid waste and common, then the waste storage area shall be screened from habitable spaces.

TEXT: 3.0.10 Access between the storage area and collection vehicle shall comply with NZBC D1.
LRML: if(exist(wasteStorageArea)), then(obligation(and(inBetween(access, and(wasteStorageArea, collectionVehicle)),complyWith(access, nzbc_d1))))
PARAPHRASE: If a waste storage area exists, then the access between the waste storage area and collection vehicle shall comply with NZBC D1.

TEXT: 3.0 Solid waste Storage Areas 3.0.2 Concrete floors are acceptable if they have a U5 trowelled finish complying with NZS 3114 and are graded at 1 in 50 to a floor drain. Floor drains shall comply with NZBC G13.
LRML: if(and(is(floor.material, concrete), is(floor.location, wasteStorageArea))), then(and(obligation(and(is(floor.surfaceFinish, u5),complyWith(floor.surfaceFinish, nzs_3114))), obligation(and(equal(floor.slope, 50.0),towards(floor.slope, floorWaste))),obligation(complyWith(floorWaste, nzbc_g13))))
PARAPHRASE: If there are concrete floors in waste storage areas, then the floor shall have a U5 trowelled finish complying with NZS 3114 and a gradient of 1 in 50 to a floor drain. The floor drains shall comply with NZBC G13.
COMMENTS:
trowelled finish - buvo: surfaceFinish
floor drain - buvo: floorWaste

TEXT: 3.0 Solid waste Storage Areas 3.0.2 Concrete floors are acceptable if they have a U5 trowelled finish complying with NZS 3114 and are graded at 1 in 50 to a floor drain. Floor drains shall comply with NZBC G13.
LRML: if(and(is(floor.material, concrete), is(floor.location, wasteStorageArea))), then(and(obligation(and(is(floor.surfaceFinish, u5),complyWith(floor.surfaceFinish, nzs_3114))), obligation(and(equal(floor.slope, 1/50),towards(floor.slope, floorWaste))),obligation(complyWith(floorWaste, nzbc_g13))))
PARAPHRASE: If there are concrete floors in waste storage areas, then the floor shall have a U5 trowelled finish complying with NZS 3114 and a gradient of 1 in 50 to a floor drain. The floor drains shall comply with NZBC G13.
COMMENTS:
trowelled finish - buvo: surfaceFinish
floor drain - buvo: floorWaste

TEXT: 3.0.3 Walls in spaces where storage bins are likely to receive food wastes and are subject to spillage shall be constructed of concrete, galvanised sheet steel, vinyl or similar material.
LRML: if(and(has(space, and(wall, storageBin)),into(foodWaste, storageBin),has(storageBin, spillage))), then(obligation(or(is(wall.material, or(concrete, galvanisedSteelSheet, vinyl)),similarTo(wall.material, or(concrete, galvanisedSteelSheet, vinyl)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a space has walls and storage bins and the storage bins receive food waste and the storage bins may have spillage, then the walls of the space shall have the meterial of concrete, galvanised sheet steel, vinyl or material similar to concrete, galvanised sheet steel, vinyl.

TEXT: 3.0.3 Walls in spaces where storage bins are likely to receive food wastes and are subject to spillage shall be constructed of concrete, galvanised sheet steel, vinyl or similar material.
LRML: if(and(has(space, and(wall, storageBin)),into(foodWaste, storageBin),has(storageBin, spillage))), then(obligation(or(is(wall.material, or(concrete, galvanisedSteelSheet, vinyl)),similarTo(wall.material, or(concrete, galvanisedSteelSheet, vinyl)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a space has walls and storage bins and the storage bins receive food waste and the storage bins may have spillage, then the walls of the space shall have the material of concrete, galvanised sheet steel, vinyl or material similar to concrete, galvanised sheet steel, vinyl.

TEXT: 3.0.3 Walls in spaces where storage bins are likely to receive food wastes and are subject to spillage shall be constructed of concrete, galvanised sheet steel, vinyl or similar material.
LRML: if(and(has(space, and(wall, storageBin)),into(foodWaste, storageBin),has(storageBin, spillage))), then(obligation(or(is(wall.material, or(concrete, galvanisedSteelSheet, vinyl)),similarTo(wall.material, or(concrete, galvanisedSteelSheet, vinyl)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a space has walls and storage bins and the storage bins receive food waste and the storage bins may have spillage, then the walls of the space shall have the material of concrete, galvanised sheet steel, vinyl or material similar to concrete, galvanised sheet steel, vinyl.

TEXT: 3.0.5 An alternative solution is for perishable wastes to be stored within a refrigerated store room.
LRML: if(is(waste.type, perishable)), then(permission(and(for(wasteStorageArea, waste),has(wasteStorageArea, refrigeration))))
PARAPHRASE: If waste is perishable, then the waste storage room for the waste may have refrigeration.

TEXT: 5.1.1 Where water is heated by a wetback water heater and a solar collector, independent water pipe circuits must be installed for each heat source.
LRML: if(is(waterHeater, and(wetbackWaterHeater, solarCollector))), then(obligation(and(define(solarCollector.waterPipeCircuit, x0),not(equal(wetbackWaterHeater.waterPipeCircuit, x0)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a wetback water heater and a solar collector are used as water heater, then the water pipe circuits of the wetback water heater and the solar collectore must be independent.

TEXT: 5.1.1 Where water is heated by a wetback water heater and a solar collector, independent water pipe circuits must be installed for each heat source.
LRML: if(is(waterHeater, and(wetbackWaterHeater, solarCollector))), then(obligation(and(define(solarCollector.waterPipeCircuit, x0),not(equal(wetbackWaterHeater.waterPipeCircuit, x0)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a wetback water heater and a solar collector are used as water heater, then the water pipe circuits of the wetback water heater and the solar collectore must be independent.

TEXT: 5.1.2 A wetback water heater must have an open-vent connected to the: water tank, or wetback water heater flow pipe (see G12/AS1 Figure 5).
LRML: if(exist(wetbackWaterHeater)), then(and(obligation(has(wetbackWaterHeater, openVent)), obligation(connect(openVent, or(waterTank, flowPipe)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a wetback water heater exists, the wetback water heater must have an open-vent connected either to the water tank, or flow pipe.

TEXT: 5.1.2 A wetback water heater must have an open-vent connected to the: water tank, or wetback water heater flow pipe (see G12/AS1 Figure 5).
LRML: if(exist(wetbackWaterHeater)), then(and(obligation(has(wetbackWaterHeater, openVent)), obligation(connect(openVent, or(waterTank, flowPipe)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a wetback water heater exists, the wetback water heater must have an open-vent connected either to the water tank, or to the flow pipe.

TEXT: 5.2.10 Acetic cured silicone sealants may be used with stainless steel but must not be used on zinc or aluminium-zinc coatings.
LRML: if(is(sealant.type, aceticCuredSilicone)), then(and(permission(for(sealant, stainlessSteel)), prohibition(and(for(sealant, coating),is(coating.material, or(zincCoating, aluminiumZincCoating))))))
PARAPHRASE: If sealant type is acetic cured silicone, then the sealant may be used with stainless steel but must not be used on zinc coatings or aluminium-zinc coatings.

TEXT: 5.2.10 Acetic cured silicone sealants may be used with stainless steel but must not be used on zinc or aluminium-zinc coatings.
LRML: if(is(sealant.type, aceticCuredSilicone)), then(and(permission(for(sealant, stainlessSteel)), prohibition(and(for(sealant, coating),is(coating.material, or(zincCoating, aluminiumZincCoating))))))
PARAPHRASE: If sealant type is acetic cured silicone, then the sealant may be used with stainless steel but must not be used on zinc coatings or aluminium-zinc coatings.

TEXT: 5.2.4 Pipe penetrations in pressed metal tile roofs must be flashed using EPDM or silicone rubber boot flashings as shown in Figure 6.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, penetration),is(penetration.type, pipe),is(roof.type, pressedMetalTile))), then(obligation(and(has(penetration, flashing),is(flashing.type, or(epdmBoot, siliconeRubberBoot)),asPer(flashing, nzbc_g12as2_f6))))
PARAPHRASE: If a pipe penetrations is in pressed metal tile roofs, then the penetration must be flashed using EPDM boot flashings or silicone rubber boot flashings and the flashing shall be as shown in Figure 6.

TEXT: 5.2.4 Pipe penetrations in pressed metal tile roofs must be flashed using EPDM or silicone rubber boot flashings as shown in Figure 6.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, penetration),is(penetration.type, pipe),is(roof.type, pressedMetalTile))), then(obligation(and(has(penetration, flashing),is(flashing.type, or(epdmBoot, siliconeRubberBoot)),asPer(flashing, nzbc_g12as2_f6))))
PARAPHRASE: If a pipe penetrations is in pressed metal tile roofs, then the penetration must be flashed using EPDM boot flashings or silicone rubber boot flashings and the flashing shall be as shown in G12/AS2 Figure 6.

TEXT: 5.2.5 Roof penetrations in profiled metal roofs must be flashed as follows. Pipe penetrations up to 60 mm diameter must be flashed using an EPDM boot flashing as shown in Figure 6.
LRML: if(and(is(roof.type, profiledMetal), has(roof, penetration), is(penetration.type, pipe), lessThanEqual(penetration.diameter, 60 mm))), then(obligation(and(has(roof.penetration, flashing),is(flashing.type, epdmBoot),asPer(flashing, nzbc_g12as2_f6))))
PARAPHRASE: If pipe penetrations in profiled metal roofs are up to 60 mm diameter, then the penetration must be flashed using an EPDM boot flashing and the flashing shall be as shown in G12/AS2 Figure 6.

TEXT: 5.3.1 Pipes and their supports must be electrochemically compatible or be electrolytically separated (refer to Table 2).
LRML: if(has(pipe, support)), then(or(obligation(and(inBetween(compatibility, and(pipe, support)),is(compatibility.type, electrochemical))),obligation(and(inBetween(separation, and(pipe, support)),is(separation.type, electrolytical),asPer(separation, nzbc_g12as2_t2)))))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes have supports, then the pipe and support must be electrochemically compatible or be electrolytically separated, for the separation refer to Table 2.

TEXT: 5.3.2 Pipes must be installed and supported to permit thermal movement, except where anchor points are necessary.
LRML: if(not(is(pipe.anchorPoint, necessary))), then(obligation(and(include(pipe.installation, thermalMovement),include(pipe.support, thermalMovement))))
PARAPHRASE: If pipe anchor points are not necessary, then the pipe must be installed and supported to permit thermal movement
COMMENTS:
include vs permit
pipe vs pipe part

TEXT: 6.2.2 The installation of solar collectors must not dent, bend or distort the roof cladding or damage any protective coatings.
LRML: if(exist(solarCollector)), then(and(prohibition(and(cause(solarCollector.installation, damage),has(roofCladding, damage),is(damage.type, or(dent, bent, distortion)))),prohibition(and(cause(solarCollector.installation, damage),has(roofCladding.protectiveCoating, damage)))))
PARAPHRASE: If solar collectors exist, then the installation of solar collectors must not cause damages in form of dent, bend or distort of the roof cladding and the installation of solar collectors must not damage any protective coatings of the roof claddings.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
Added additional information to paraphrase.

TEXT: 6.1.3 Air tests may be carried out in accordance with either clause 15.3 of AS/NZS 3500.2 or paragraph 8.3 of E1/VM1.
LRML: if(exist(airTest)), then(permission(asPer(airTest, or('nzs_3500_2_15.3', 'nzbc_e1vm1_8.3'))))
PARAPHRASE: If air tests exists, then air tests may be in accordance with either clause 15.3 of NZS 3500.2 or paragraph 8.3 of E1/VM1.

TEXT: 6.1.3 Air tests may be carried out in accordance with either clause 15.3 of AS/NZS 3500.2 or paragraph 8.3 of E1/VM1.
LRML: if(exist(airTest)), then(permission(asPer(airTest, or('nzs_3500_2_15.3', 'nzbc_e1vm1_8.3'))))
PARAPHRASE: If air tests exists, then air tests may be in accordance with either clause 15.3 of NZS 3500.2 or paragraph 8.3 of E1/VM1.

TEXT: 6.1.3 Air tests may be carried out in accordance with either clause 15.3 of AS/NZS 3500.2 or paragraph 8.3 of E1/VM1.
LRML: if(exist(airTest)), then(permission(asPer(airTest, or('nzs_3500_2_15.3', 'nzbc_e1vm1_8.3'))))
PARAPHRASE: If air tests exists, then air tests may be in accordance with either NZS 3500.2 clause 15.3 or E1/VM1 paragraph 8.3.

TEXT: 6.1.5 Where a building is proposed to be built over an existing drain, the drain shall be verified as being sound both before and after construction.
LRML: if(and(above(building.construction, drain),is(drain, existing))), then(and(obligation(has(drain.soundness, verification)), obligation(before(verification, construction)), obligation(after(verification, construction))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building is constructed over an existing drain, then the drain soundness shall have verification both before and after construction.

TEXT: 6.1.5 Where a building is proposed to be built over an existing drain, the drain shall be verified as being sound both before and after construction.
LRML: if(and(above(building.construction, drain),exist(drain))), then(and(obligation(has(drain.soundness, verification)), obligation(before(verification, construction)), obligation(after(verification, construction))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building is constructed over an existing drain, then the drain soundness shall have verification both before and after construction.

TEXT: 6.1.5 Where a building is proposed to be built over an existing drain, the drain shall be verified as being sound both before and after construction.
LRML: if(and(above(building.construction, drain),exist(drain))), then(and(obligation(has(drain.soundness, verification)), obligation(before(verification, construction)), obligation(after(verification, construction))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building is constructed over an existing drain, then the drain soundness shall have verification both before and after construction.

TEXT: 1.1.1 A fence erected to ensure security against unauthorised access to storage and treatment facilities shall comply with F5/AS1 Construction and Demolition Hazards.
LRML: if(and(has(facility, securityFence),for(facility, or(storage, treatment)))), then(and(obligation(complyWith(securityFence, nzbc_f5as1))))
PARAPHRASE: If a security fence is for storage and treatment facilities, then the security fence shall comply with F5/AS1.

TEXT: 1.1.1 A fence erected to ensure security against unauthorised access to storage and treatment facilities shall comply with F5/AS1 Construction and Demolition Hazards.
LRML: if(or(has(storageFacility, securityFence),has(treatmentFacility, securityFence))), then(and(obligation(complyWith(securityFence, nzbc_f5as1))))
PARAPHRASE: If a security fence is for storage and treatment facilities, then the security fence shall comply with F5/AS1.

TEXT: 1.1.1 A fence erected to ensure security against unauthorised access to storage and treatment facilities shall comply with F5/AS1 Construction and Demolition Hazards.
LRML: if(or(has(storageFacility, securityFence),has(treatmentFacility, securityFence))), then(and(obligation(complyWith(securityFence, nzbc_f5as1))))
PARAPHRASE: If a storage or treatment facilities has a security fence, then the security fence shall comply with F5/AS1.

TEXT: 1.1.1 A fence erected to ensure security against unauthorised access to storage and treatment facilities shall comply with F5/AS1 Construction and Demolition Hazards.
LRML: if(or(has(storageFacility, securityFence),has(treatmentFacility, securityFence))), then(and(obligation(complyWith(securityFence, nzbc_f5as1))))
PARAPHRASE: If a storage or treatment facilities has a security fence, then the security fence shall comply with F5/AS1.

TEXT: 1.1.2 Where waste is hazardous, the storage facilities shall also comply with NZBC F3 Hazardous Substances and Processes.
LRML: if(for(storageFacility, hazardousWaste)), then(obligation(complyWith(storageFacility, nzbc_f3)))
PARAPHRASE: If a storage facility is for hazardous waste, then the storage facility shall comply with NZBC F3.
COMMENTS:
Hazardous is defined in AS.
Uniclass defines hazardous waste.

If we split hazardous we have many options:
is(waste.type, hazardous)
is(waste, hazardous)
hasProperty(waste, hazardous)
is(waste.isHazardous, true)

TEXT: 1.4.1 Collection facilities shall be located: a) In areas that will not create health or safety hazards.
LRML: if(exist(collectionFacility)), then(prohibition(cause(collectionFacility.location, or(healthHazard, safetyHazard))))
PARAPHRASE: If collection facilities exists, then collection facilities shall have a location that will not create health or safety hazards.

TEXT: 1.4.1 Storage facilities shall be located: In areas with sufficient access for cleaning, clearing of blockages, and maintenance.
LRML: if(exist(storageFacility)), then(obligation(and(has(storageFacility.location, access), for(access, or(cleaning, blockageClearing, maintenance)))))
PARAPHRASE: If storage facilities exists, then storage facilities shall have a location with access for cleaning, clearing of blockages and maintenance.

TEXT: 1.4.1 Treatment facilities shall be located: In areas with sufficient access for cleaning, clearing of blockages, and maintenance.
LRML: if(exist(treatmentFacility)), then(obligation(and(has(treatmentFacility.location, access), for(access, or(cleaning, blockageClearing, maintenance)))))
PARAPHRASE: If treatment facilities exists, then treatment facilities shall have a location with access for cleaning, clearing of blockages and maintenance.

TEXT: 1.4.1 Treatment facilities shall be located: a) In areas that will not create health or safety hazards.
LRML: if(exist(treatmentFacility)), then(prohibition(cause(treatmentFacility.location, or(healthHazard, safetyHazard))))
PARAPHRASE: If treatment facilities exists, then treatment facilities shall have a location that will not create health or safety hazards.

TEXT: 8.4.11.1 Fixing flashings b) When fixing flashings to other flashings or to roofing use: i) for galvanized steel, 4 mm diameter monel metal or stainless steel rivets, where compatible as per Table 21, ii) for aluminium-zinc coated steel, 4 mm diameter aluminium rivets, iii) for aluminium, 4 mm diameter aluminium rivets.
LRML: if(towards(flashing.fixing, or(flashing, roof))), then(or(obligation(and(is(flashing.material,galvanisedSteel),is(roof.material,galvanisedSteel),is(fixing.type,rivet),is(fixing.material,or(monelMetal,stainlessSteel)),equal(fixing.diameter,4 mm),asPer(fixing,nzbc_e2as1_t21))), obligation(and(is(flashing.material,or(aluminiumZincCoatedSteel,aluminium)),is(roof.material,or(aluminiumZincCoatedSteel,aluminium)),is(fixing.type,rivet),is(fixing.material,aluminium),equal(fixing.diameter,4 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If fixing flashings to other flashings or to the roof, then either the flashing and roof shall be galvanized steel and the fixing 4 mm diameter monel metal or stainless steel rivets as per E2/AS1 Table 21, or  the flashing and roof shall be aluminium-zinc coated steel or aluminium, and the fixings shall be 4 mm diameter aluminium rivets.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4.11.1 Fixing flashings b) When fixing flashings to other flashings or to roofing use: i) for galvanized steel, 4 mm diameter monel metal or stainless steel rivets, where compatible as per Table 21, ii) for aluminium-zinc coated steel, 4 mm diameter aluminium rivets, iii) for aluminium, 4 mm diameter aluminium rivets.
LRML: if(towards(flashing.fixing, or(flashing, roof))), then(or(obligation(and(is(flashing.material,galvanisedSteel),is(roof.material,galvanisedSteel),is(fixing.type,rivet),is(fixing.material,or(monelMetal,stainlessSteel)),equal(fixing.diameter,4 mm),asPer(fixing,nzbc_e2as1_t21))), obligation(and(is(flashing.material,or(aluminiumZincCoatedSteel,aluminium)),is(roof.material,or(aluminiumZincCoatedSteel,aluminium)),is(fixing.type,rivet),is(fixing.material,aluminium),equal(fixing.diameter,4 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If fixing flashings to other flashings or to the roof, then either the flashing and roof shall be galvanized steel and the fixing 4 mm diameter monel metal or stainless steel rivets as per E2/AS1 Table 21, or the flashing and roof shall be aluminium-zinc coated steel or aluminium, and the fixings shall be 4 mm diameter aluminium rivets.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Where end-laps are required in flashings, form these as shown in Figure 6 and, before joining the two parts, apply an 8 mm diameter bead of neutral cure sealant complying with: i) Type F, Class 20LM or 25LM of ISO 11600, or ii) low modulus Type II Class A of Federal Specification TT-S-00230C.
LRML: if(requires(flashing, endLap)), then(obligation(and(asPer(endLap, nzbc_e2as1_f6),before(endLap.join, flashing),has(endLap.join,bead),equal(bead.diameter, 8 mm),is(bead, sealant),is(sealant.type,neutralCure),complyWith(sealant,or(iso_11600_class_20lmTypeF,iso_11600_class_25lmTypeF,tts_00230cClassA_lowModulusType_2)))))
PARAPHRASE: If end-laps are required in flashings, then the end-lap shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 6 and, before joining the end-lap and flashing, apply an 8 mm diameter bead of neutral cure sealant and the sealant complying with ISO 11600 Class 20LM Type F or ISO 11600 Class 25LM Type F, or TT-S-00230C Class A low modulus Type II.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4.13 Stopends; The top ends of profiled metal roof cladding shall have stopends as shown in Figure 49 for trapezoidal and trough profile metal roof cladding, where: a) The roof pitch is less than 25°, or b) The building is in a High/Very High/Extra High wind zone.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding.profile, or(trapezoidal, trough)), or(lessThan(roof.pitch, 25 deg), is(building.windZone, or(high, veryHigh, extraHigh))))), then(obligation(and(has(cladding.topEnd, stopend), asPer(stopend, nzbc_e2as1_f49))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof cladding is profiled metal and the roof cladding have trapezoidal and trough profile and the roof pitch is less than 25°, or the building is in a High, Very High, or Extra High wind zone, then the roof claddings top ends shall have stopends as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 49.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Preformed compressible seals shall not be used at the eaves.
LRML: if(exist(eave)), then(prohibition(and(has(eave, seal),is(seal.type, and(preformed, compressible)))))
PARAPHRASE: If eaves exist, then the eave shall not have preformed compressible seals.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Internal gutters shall be as shown in Figure 52 and Paragraph 8.1.6.1.
LRML: if(is(gutter.type, internal)), then(obligation(complyWith(gutter, and(nzbc_e2as1_f52, 'nzbc_e2as1_8.1.6.1'))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are internal gutters, then the gutter shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 52 and Paragraph 8.1.6.1.

TEXT: Metal roof cladding and flashings shall be selected according to the exposure conditions in Table 20 as defined in: a) NZS 3604, or b) AS/NZS 2728.
LRML: if(or(is(roofCladding.material, metal), is(flashing.material, metal))), then(obligation(and(asPer(metal,exposureCondition),asPer(exposureCondition, nzbc_e2as1_t20),asPer(exposureCondition.definition,or(nzs_3604,nzs_2728)))))
PARAPHRASE: If roof cladding or flashings are metal, then the metal shall be according to the exposure conditions in E2/AS1 Table 20 and the exposure condition is defined in NZS 3604, or NZS 2728.

TEXT: Steel; The maximum span and fixing patterns of profiled metal roof cladding between purlins to comply with this Acceptable Solution are given in Table 11, Table 12 or Table 13, 14 and 15.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding.material, steel))), then(obligation(and(inBetween(roofCladding.span, purlins), inBetween(roofCladding.fixingPattern, purlins), asPer(max(roofCladding.span),and(nzbc_e2as1_t11,nzbc_e2as1_t12,nzbc_e2as1_t13,nzbc_e2as1_t14,nzbc_e2as1_t15)),asPer(roofCladding.fixingPattern,and(nzbc_e2as1_t11,nzbc_e2as1_t12,nzbc_e2as1_t13,nzbc_e2as1_t14,nzbc_e2as1_t15)))))
PARAPHRASE: If profiled metal roof cladding are from steel, then the maximum span between purlins and the fixing patterns between purlins are given in E2/AS1 Table 11, 12, 13, 14 and 15.

TEXT: 5.0.2 Water storage tanks that form part of a solar water heater must have drain pipes that: a) have an easily reached isolating valve, and terminate with a cap or plug to empty the vessel for maintenance, or b) terminate outside the building with a cap only.
LRML: if(partOf(waterStorageTank, solarWaterHeater)), then(and(obligation(has(waterStorageTank, drainPipe)), or(obligation(and(has(drainPipe, isolatingValve),is(isolatingValve, easilyReached),has(drainPipe.terminationPoint, or(cap, plug)))), obligation(and(outside(drainPipe.terminationPoint, building), by(drainPipe.terminationPoint, cap))))))
PARAPHRASE: If water storage tanks are part of a solar water heater, then the water storage tank must have drain pipes that either have an easily reached isolating valve, and terminate with a cap or plug, or drain pipes that terminate outside the building with a cap.

TEXT: 5.1.1 Where water is heated by a wetback water heater and a solar collector, independent water pipe circuits must be installed for each heat source.
LRML: if(is(waterHeater, and(wetbackWaterHeater, solarCollector))), then(obligation(and(define(wetbackWaterHeater.waterPipeCircuit, x0),define(solarCollector.waterPipeCircuit, x1),not(equal(x0, x1)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a wetback water heater and a solar collector are used as water heater, then the water pipe circuits of the wetback water heater and the solar collectore must be independent.

TEXT: 5.2.5 Roof penetrations in profiled metal roofs must be flashed as follows. b) Rectangular penetrations up to 1200 mm wide must be flashed using a soaker type flashing as shown in Figure 7.
LRML: if(and(is(roof.type, profiledMetal), has(roof, penetration), is(penetration.type, rectangular), lessThanEqual(penetration.width, 1200 mm))), then(obligation(and(has(roof.penetration, flashing),is(flashing.type, soaker),asPer(flashing, nzbc_g12as2_f7))))
PARAPHRASE: If rectangular penetrations in profiled metal roofs are up to 1200 mm wide, then the penetration must be flashed using an soaker type flashing and the flashing shall be as shown in G12/AS2 Figure 7.

TEXT: 5.2.7 Penetrations through membrane roofs must be as shown in Figure 8.
LRML: if(and(through(penetration, roof),is(roof.type, membrane))), then(obligation(complyWith(penetration, nzbc_g12as2_f8)))
PARAPHRASE: If penetrations are through membrane roofs, then the penetration must be as shown in G12/AS2 Figure 8.

TEXT: 5.3.1 Pipes and their supports must be electrochemically compatible or be electrolytically separated (refer to Table 2).
LRML: if(has(pipe, support)), then(or(obligation(and(inBetween(compatibility, and(pipe, support)),is(compatibility.type, electrochemical))),obligation(and(inBetween(separation, and(pipe, support)),is(separation.type, electrolytical),asPer(separation, nzbc_g12as2_t2)))))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes have supports, then the pipe and support must be electrochemically compatible or be electrolytically separated, for the separation refer to G12/AS2 Table 2.

TEXT: 6.2.2 The installation of solar collectors must not dent, bend or distort the roof cladding or damage any protective coatings.
LRML: if(exist(solarCollector)), then(and(prohibition(and(cause(solarCollector.installation, damage),has(roofCladding, damage),is(damage.type, or(dent, bent, distortion)))),prohibition(and(cause(solarCollector.installation, damage),has(roofCladding.protectiveCoating, damage)))))
PARAPHRASE: If solar collectors exist, then the installation of solar collectors must not cause damages in form of dent, bend or distort of the roof cladding and the installation of solar collectors must not damage any protective coatings of the roof claddings.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
Added additional information to paraphrase.

TEXT: 6.2.3 All fixings that penetrate metal cladding must be provided with sealing washers or boots to prevent leakage in accordance with Paragraph 5.2.
LRML: if(through(fixing, metalCladding)), then(and(obligation(has(fixing, or(sealingWasher, boot))), obligation(complyWith(fixing, 'nzbc_g12as2_5.2'))))
PARAPHRASE: If a fixing goes through metal cladding, then the fixing must be provided with sealing washers or boots in accordance with G12/AS2 Paragraph 5.2.

TEXT: Solar collectors; The outermost support points must be within 200 mm of the outside edge of the solar collector.
LRML: if(and(has(solarCollector, support), is(support.location, outermost))), then(obligation(and(define(solarCollector.outsideEdge, x0),inBetween(support.location, and(x0, 'x0 - 200 mm')))))
PARAPHRASE: If the support location of the solar collector is outermost, then the support location must be within 200 mm of the outside edge of the solar collector.

TEXT: 6.4.2 Solar collectors mounted parallel to the roof that are elevated up to 50 mm above the roof cladding must be supported by: a) underlying purlins conforming to Paragraph 6.4.1 (a) or (b), or b) underlying rafters or trusses with connections conforming with Paragraphs 6.4.1 (a) or (c), or c) collector support rails conforming to Paragraph 6.5.
LRML: if(and(is(solarCollector.orientation, parallel), towards(solarCollector.orientation, roof), above(solarCollector.elevation, roofCladding), lessThanEqual(solarCollector.elevation, 50 mm))), then(or(obligation(and(is(solarCollector.support, purlin),below(purlin, solarCollector),complyWith(purlin, or('nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.a', 'nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.b')))), obligation(and(is(solarCollector.support, rafter),below(rafter, solarCollector),complyWith(rafter.connection, or('nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.a', 'nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.c')))),obligation(and(is(solarCollector.support, truss),below(truss, solarCollector),complyWith(truss.connection, or('nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.a', 'nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.c')))),obligation(and(is(solarCollector.support, supportRail),complyWith(supportRail, 'nzbc_g12as2_6.5')))))
PARAPHRASE: If solar collectors are orientated parallel to the roof and elevated up to 50 mm above the roof cladding, then the solar collector must be supported by: a) purlins under the solar collector with the purlins conforming to G12/AS2 Paragraph 6.4.1.a or 6.4.1.b, or b) rafters under the solar collector with the rafter connections conforming with G12/AS2 Paragraphs 6.4.1.a or 6.4.1.c or trusses under the solar collector with the truss connections conforming with G12/AS2 Paragraphs 6.4.1.a or 6.4.1.c, or c) support rails conforming to G12/AS2 Paragraph 6.5.

TEXT: 8.4.13 Stopends; The top ends of profiled metal roof cladding shall have stopends as shown in Figure 49 for trapezoidal and trough profile metal roof cladding, where: a) The roof pitch is less than 25°, or b) The building is in a High/Very High/Extra High wind zone.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding.profile, or(trapezoidal, trough)), or(lessThan(roof.pitch, 25 deg), is(building.windZone, or(high, veryHigh, extraHigh))))), then(obligation(and(has(cladding.topEnd, stopend), asPer(stopend, nzbc_e2as1_f49))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof cladding is profiled metal and the roof cladding have trapezoidal and trough profile and the roof pitch is less than 25 deg, or the building is in a High, Very High, or Extra High wind zone, then the roof claddings top ends shall have stopends as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 49.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; 8.4.14 Turn-downs at gutters; The lower ends of trapezoidal and trough profile roofing shall be turned down at gutters, where the roof pitch is less than 10°. The turn-down shall be 30° from the plane of the sheet.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding.profile, or(trapezoidal, trough)), lessThan(roof.pitch, 10 deg))), then(obligation(and(has(roofCladding.lowerEnd,turnDown),is(turnDown.location, gutter),inBetween(turnDown.angle,and(turnDown,roofCladding)),equal(angle,30 deg))))
PARAPHRASE: If profiled metal roof cladding have trapezoidal or trough profile and the roof pitch is less than 10 deg, then the lower ends of the roof cladding shall be turned down at gutters. The turn-down angle between turn-down and roof cladding shall be 30 deg.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.17 Roof penetrations; The maximum length of profiled roof cladding above penetrations shall be as shown in Table 17.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), has(roofCladding, penetration))), then(obligation(and(above(cladding.length, penetration),asPer(max(cladding.length),nzbc_e2as1_t17))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof cladding is profiled metal roof and the roof cladding has a penetration, then the maximum length of the roof cladding above the penetration shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Table 17.

TEXT: Metal roof cladding and flashings shall be selected according to the exposure conditions in Table 20 as defined in: a) NZS 3604, or b) AS/NZS 2728.
LRML: if(or(is(roofCladding.material, metal), is(flashing.material, metal))), then(obligation(and(asPer(metal,exposureCondition),asPer(exposureCondition, nzbc_e2as1_t20),asPer(exposureCondition.definition,or(nzs_3604,nzs_2728)))))
PARAPHRASE: If roof cladding or flashings are metal, then the metal shall be according to the exposure conditions in E2/AS1 Table 20 as defined in NZS 3604, or NZS 2728.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Materials for the manufacture of profiled steel roof cladding shall: a) have a BMT of 0.4 mm minimum b) be grade G550, or G300 for rolled, crimped, or trough profile roofing c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding.material, steel))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(steel.baseMetalThickness, 0.4 mm)), obligation(or(and(is(steel.grade,g550),not(is(roofCladding.profile,and(rolled,crimped,trough)))),and(is(steel.grade,g300),is(roofCladding.profile,or(rolled,crimped,trough))))), obligation(and(for(steel.corrosionProtection, exposureZone),asPer(exposureZone, nzbc_e2as1_t20)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the material of profiled metal roof claddings is steel, then the steel shall have a base metal thickness of 0.4 mm minimum. The steel shall be grade G550 and not for rolled, crimped, or trough profile roof cladding, or the steel shall be grade G300 and rolled, crimped, or trough profile roof cladding. The steel shall be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in E2/AS1 Table 20.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Pre-painted aluminium roofing shall have a factory-applied finish complying with AS/NZS 2728.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding.material, aluminium),is(aluminium, prePainted))), then(obligation(and(has(roofCladding, factoryAppliedFinish),complyWith(factoryAppliedFinish,nzs_2728))))
PARAPHRASE: If the material of profiled metal roof claddings is pre-painted aluminium, then the roof cladding shall have a factory-applied finish complying with NZS 2728.

TEXT: Steel; The maximum span and fixing patterns of profiled metal roof cladding between purlins to comply with this Acceptable Solution are given in Table 11, Table 12 or Table 13, 14 and 15.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding.material, steel))), then(obligation(and(inBetween(roofCladding.span, purlins), inBetween(roofCladding.fixingPattern, purlins), asPer(max(roofCladding.span),and(nzbc_e2as1_t11,nzbc_e2as1_t12,nzbc_e2as1_t13,nzbc_e2as1_t14,nzbc_e2as1_t15)),asPer(roofCladding.fixingPattern,and(nzbc_e2as1_t11,nzbc_e2as1_t12,nzbc_e2as1_t13,nzbc_e2as1_t14,nzbc_e2as1_t15)))))
PARAPHRASE: If profiled metal roof cladding are from steel, then the maximum span between purlins and the fixing patterns between purlins are given in E2/AS1 Table 11, 12, 13, 14 and 15.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.7 Underlay; All profiled metal long-run roofing shall have a roof underlay installed to Table 23. See Paragraph 8.1.5 for installation details.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding, longRun))), then(obligation(and(has(roof,underlay),complyWith(underlay,nzbc_e2as1_t23),asPer(underlay.installation,'nzbc_e2as1_8.1.5'))))
PARAPHRASE: If Profiled Metal Roof Cladding is long-run, then the roof shall have a underlay complying with E2/AS1 Table 23 and the underlay installation shall be as seen in E2/AS1 Paragraph 8.1.5.

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: b) Expansion joints shall be provided for joined flashings with a combined length exceeding: i) 12 metres for light coloured steel and stainless steel. 8 metres for dark coloured steel, ii) 8 metres for copper, iii) 8 metres for aluminium.
LRML: if(and(is(flashings.material, metal), is(flashings, joined))), then(obligation(or(and(has(flashings, expansionJoint),is(flashings.material, or(lightColouredSteel,stainlessSteel)),greaterThan(sum(flashings.length), 12 m)),and(is(flashings.material,or(lightColouredSteel,stainlessSteel)),lessThanEqual(sum(flashings.length), 12 m)),and(has(flashings, expansionJoint),is(flashings.material,or(darkColouredSteel,copper,aluminium)),greaterThan(sum(flashings.length),8 m)),and(is(flashings.material, or(darkColouredSteel,copper,aluminium)),lessThanEqual(sum(flashings.length),8 m)))))
PARAPHRASE: If metal flashings are joined, then either the flashings shall have expansion joints and the sum of the flashing lengths exceed 12 metres and the flashings shall be light coloured steel or stainless steel, or the sum of the flashing lengths shall not exceed 12 metres and the flashings shall be light coloured steel or stainless steel, or the flashings shall have expansion joints and the sum of the flashing lengths exceed 8 metres and the flashings shall be dark coloured steel, copper or aluminium, or the sum of the flashing lengths shall not exceed 8 metres and the flashings is dark coloured steel, copper or aluminium.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE COMPLEX
Since the rule was not broken down, a separate negation case needed to be added into the then.
Cannot be represented in one rule?
joined flashing - has join vs is joined?
Minimum criteria (i.e. combined length) is required in if statement.
In fact it's still not translatable, since the materials should be part of if.

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is limited to membranes composed of butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates for: a) Roofs with a minimum fall of 2° (1:30), b) Decks with: i) a minimum fall of 1.5° (1:40), ii) a maximum area of 40 m2, iii) no steps in level within deck area except into gutters, iv) no integral roof gardens, and v) no downpipe direct discharge to deck, c) Internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100, with no cross seams in the gutters, and d) Decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in Figure 17A.
LRML: if(and(is(membrane.material, or(butyl, epdm)), above(membrane.installation, substrate), is(substrate.material, plywood), or(and(for(membrane, roof), greaterThanEqual(roof.fall, 2 deg)), and(for(membrane, deck), greaterThanEqual(deck.fall, 1.5 deg), lessThanEqual(deck.area, 40 m2), not(and(has(deck.area, stepInLevel),not(into(stepInLevel, gutter)))), not(has(deck.area, integralRoofGarden)), not(and(towards(downpipe.discharge, deck),is(downpipe.discharge, direct)))), and(is(membrane, gutter), is(gutter.type, internal), greaterThanEqual(gutter.fall, 1/100), not(within(crossSeam, gutter))), and(is(membrane.application, deck), has(deck, raisedSurface), is(raisedSurface, removable), for(raisedSurface, levelAccess),asPer(levelAccess, 'nzbc_e2as1_f17.a'))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, membrane))
PARAPHRASE: If membranes are material butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates and either the membrane is for a roof with a minimum fall of 2 deg, or the membrane is for decks with a minimum fall of 1.5 deg, and the deck has a maximum area of 40 m2, and the deck area has no steps in level except into gutters and the deck has no integral roof gardens and no downpipe direct discharge to the deck, or the membranes are for internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100 and there are no cross seams in the gutters, or the membrane is for decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 17.a.
COMMENTS:
fall vs slope
limited to would require negation?
Double negation for exception in iv?

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is limited to membranes composed of butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates for: a) Roofs with a minimum fall of 2° (1:30), b) Decks with: i) a minimum fall of 1.5° (1:40), ii) a maximum area of 40 m2, iii) no steps in level within deck area except into gutters, iv) no integral roof gardens, and v) no downpipe direct discharge to deck, c) Internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100, with no cross seams in the gutters, and d) Decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in Figure 17A.
LRML: if(and(is(membrane.material, or(butyl, epdm)), above(membrane.installation, substrate), is(substrate.material, plywood), or(and(for(membrane, roof), greaterThanEqual(roof.fall, 2 deg)), and(for(membrane, deck), greaterThanEqual(deck.fall, 1.5 deg), lessThanEqual(deck.area, 40 m2), not(and(has(deck.area, stepInLevel),not(into(stepInLevel, gutter)))), not(has(deck.area, integralRoofGarden)), not(and(towards(downpipe.discharge, deck),is(downpipe.discharge, direct)))), and(is(membrane, gutter), is(gutter.type, internal), greaterThanEqual(gutter.fall, 1/100), not(within(crossSeam, gutter))), and(is(membrane.application, deck), has(deck, raisedSurface), is(raisedSurface, removable), for(raisedSurface, levelAccess),asPer(levelAccess, 'nzbc_e2as1_f17.a'))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, membrane))
PARAPHRASE: If membranes are material butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates and either the membrane is for a roof with a minimum fall of 2 deg, or the membrane is for decks with a minimum fall of 1.5 deg, and the deck has a maximum area of 40 m2, and the deck area has no steps in level except into gutters and the deck has no integral roof gardens and no downpipe direct discharge to the deck, or the membranes are for internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100 and there are no cross seams in the gutters, or the membrane is for decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 17.a, then E2/AS1 does apply to the membrane.
COMMENTS:
fall vs slope
limited to would require negation?
Double negation for exception in iv?

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.8 Fixings: corrugated and trapezoidal; Fixings shall be as shown in Tables 11, 12, 14 and 15, and shall be a minimum 12-gauge screw, as shown in Figure 39, which complies with Class 4 of AS 3566: Part 2.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal),  is(roofCladding.profile, or(corrugated, trapezoidal)), has(roofCladding, fixing))), then(obligation(and(asPer(fixing,and(nzbc_e2as1_t11,nzbc_e2as1_t12,nzbc_e2as1_t14,nzbc_e2as1_t15)),is(fixing.type, screw),greaterThanEqual(screw.size, 12 gauge),asPer(screw,nzbc_e2as1_f39),complyWith(screw, as_3566_2_class_4))))
PARAPHRASE:
If the profile of Profiled Metal Roof Cladding is corrugated or trapezoidal, and the roof cladding has a fixing, then the fixing shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Tables 11, 12, 14 and 15, and the fixing shall be a minimum 12-gauge sized screw, as shown in 
E2/AS1 Figure 39, which complies with Class 4 of AS 3566: Part 2.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Fixings shall: Include sealing washers of: ii) profiled washer and EPDM washer where required to allow for expansion of the profiled metal roof cladding.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), has(roofCladding, fixing),requires(roofCladding, expansionAllowance))), then(obligation(and(include(fixing, sealingWasher),is(sealingWasher.type, and(profiledWasher,epdmWasher)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the profile of Profiled Metal Roof Cladding has a fixing and the roof cladding requires expansion allowance, then the fixings shall shall include sealing washers of profiled washer and EPDM washer.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Clip fixings for trough profiles and spans as shown in Table 13 shall be as shown in Figure 40, and shall: a) Have a minimum BMT of 0.9 mm b) Be a minimum width of 30 mm c) Be made from a material compatible with the cladding, refer to Tables 20 and 21 d) Have clips fastened with a minimum of two 10-gauge by 30 mm waferhead hot-dipped galvanised screws which comply with Class 3 of AS 3566: Part 2.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), has(roofCladding, fixing), is(fixing.type, clip),is(roofCladding.profile, trough), asPer(roofCladding.span, nzbc_e2as1_t20))), then(obligation(and(asPer(fixing, nzbc_e2as1_f40),greaterThanEqual(fixing.baseMetalThickness, 0.9 mm),greaterThanEqual(fixing.width,30 mm),has(fixing.material, compatibility),towards(compatibility, roofCladding),complyWith(fixing.material, and(nzbc_e2as1_t20,nzbc_e2as1_t21)),has(fixing, clip),is(clip.fastener, screw),greaterThanEqual(count(screw),2),is(screw.size,10 gauge),is(screw.length,30 mm),is(screw.type,and(waferhead,hotDippedGalvanised)),complyWith(screw,as_3566_2_class_3))))
PARAPHRASE: If the Profiled Metal Roof Cladding has clip fixings and the roof cladding profile is trough and the roof cladding span is as shown in E2/AS1 Table 13, then the fixing shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 40, and the fixing shall have a minimum base metal thickness of 0.9 mm, and the fixing shall be a minimum width of 30 mm, and the fixing shall be a material compatible with the roof cladding, for the fixing material refer to E2/AS1 Tables 20 and 21, and the fixing shall have clips fastened with a minimum of two screws, the screws are 10-gauge size and 30 mm length waferhead hot-dipped galvanised and the screws comply with Class 3 of AS 3566: Part 2.

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is limited to membranes composed of butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates for: a) Roofs with a minimum fall of 2° (1:30), b) Decks with: i) a minimum fall of 1.5° (1:40), ii) a maximum area of 40 m2, iii) no steps in level within deck area except into gutters, iv) no integral roof gardens, and v) no downpipe direct discharge to deck, c) Internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100, with no cross seams in the gutters, and d) Decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in Figure 17A.
LRML: if(and(is(membrane.material, or(butyl, epdm)), above(membrane.installation, substrate), is(substrate.material, plywood), or(and(for(membrane, roof), greaterThanEqual(roof.fall, 2 deg)), and(for(membrane, deck), greaterThanEqual(deck.fall, 1.5 deg), lessThanEqual(deck.area, 40 m2), not(and(has(deck.area, stepInLevel),not(into(stepInLevel, gutter)))), not(has(deck.area, integralRoofGarden)), not(and(towards(downpipe.discharge, deck),is(downpipe.discharge, direct)))), and(is(membrane, gutter), is(gutter.type, internal), greaterThanEqual(gutter.fall, 1/100), not(within(crossSeam, gutter))), and(is(membrane.application, deck), has(deck, raisedSurface), is(raisedSurface, removable), for(raisedSurface, levelAccess),asPer(levelAccess, 'nzbc_e2as1_f17.a'))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, membrane))
PARAPHRASE: If membranes are material butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates and either the membrane is for a roof with a minimum fall of 2 deg, or the membrane is for decks with a minimum fall of 1.5 deg and the deck has a maximum area of 40 m2 and the deck area has no steps in level except into gutters and the deck has no integral roof gardens and no downpipe direct discharge to the deck, or the membranes are for internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100 and there are no cross seams in the gutters, or the membrane is for decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 17.a, then E2/AS1 does apply to the membrane.
COMMENTS:
fall vs slope
limited to would require negation?
Double negation for exception in iv?

TEXT: Closed-in construction spaces under membrane roofs and decks require adequate ventilation to prevent the accumulation of moisture under the membrane.
LRML: if(and(is(space.type, closedInConstruction), below(space, or(roof, deck)), is(roof.type, membrane),is(deck.type, membrane))), then(obligation(prevent(space.ventilation, moistureAccumulation)))
PARAPHRASE: If closed-in construction spaces are under membrane roofs and decks, then the space shall have ventilation to prevent the accumulation of moisture.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
Closed-in construction spaces?
moistureAccumulation split

TEXT: Membrane roofs shall be constructed to provide: a) Falls as shown in Figure 56 and details in Figures 57–64.
LRML: if(is(roof.type, membrane)), then(obligation(and(asPer(roof.fall, nzbc_e2as1_f56),asPer(roof, 'nzbc_e2as1_f57 to nzbc_e2as1_f64'))))
PARAPHRASE: If roofs are membrane roofs, then the roof fall shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 56 and roofs as in E2/AS1 Figures 57 to Figure 64.

TEXT: 9.1 General; Wall claddings shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2.3.2 to E2.3.7, and comply with the provisions of Paragraph 9.1.1 to Paragraph 9.9.
LRML: if(exist(wallCladding)), then(and(obligation(complyWith(wallCladding, and('nzbc_e2_3.2 to nzbc_e2_3.7', 'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.1 to nzbc_e2as1_9.9'))), obligation(equal(rule.key, and(9.1, 9.2, 9.3, 9.4, 9.5, 9.6, 9.7, 9.8, 9.9)))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings exist, then the wall cladding shall comply with NZBC E2 3.2 to E2 3.7, and E2/AS1 Paragraph 9.1.1 to Paragraph 9.9.

TEXT: Solar collector 6.5.1 Collector support rails may either: a) run horizontally across the slope of the roof as provided for in Paragraph 6.5.2 and Figure 17, or b) run up the slope of the roof as provided for in Paragraph 6.5.3 and Figure 18.
LRML: if(has(solarCollector, supportRail)), then(or(obligation(and(is(supportRail.orientation, horizontal),define(roof.slope, x0),towards(supportRail.orientation, x0),asPer(supportRail, and('nzbc_g12as2_6.5.2', nzbc_g12as2_f17)))), obligation(and(is(supportRail.orientation, vertical),define(roof.slope, x0),towards(supportRail.orientation, x0),asPer(supportRail, and('nzbc_g12as2_6.5.3', nzbc_g12as2_f18))))))
PARAPHRASE: If the solar collector has support rails, then the support rails shall either be oriented horizontally to the slope of the roof as provided for in G12/AS2 Paragraph 6.5.2 and Figure 17, or the support rails shall be oriented verically to the slope of the roof as provided for in G12/AS2 Paragraph 6.5.3 and Figure 18.

TEXT: 6.6.1 Solar collectors mounted at a different pitch to the pitch of the roof must be installed with no less than 8 fixing points and must meet all the requirements described in Paragraph 6.6 and Figure 19.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, pitch),not(is(solarCollector.pitch, pitch)))), then(and(obligation(has(solarCollector, fixing)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(count(fixing.location), 8)), obligation(complyWith(solarCollector, and('nzbc_g12as2_6.6', nzbc_g12as2_f19)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has a pitch and the solar collector's pitch is not the roof pitch, then the solar collector must have fixing at no less than 8 locations and must meet all the requirements described in G12/AS2 Paragraph 6.6 and Figure 19.

TEXT: 6.6.1 Solar collectors mounted at a different pitch to the pitch of the roof must be installed with no less than 8 fixing points and must meet all the requirements described in Paragraph 6.6 and Figure 19.
LRML: if(and(has(roof, pitch),not(is(solarCollector.pitch, pitch)))), then(and(obligation(has(solarCollector, fixing)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(count(fixing.location), 8)), obligation(complyWith(solarCollector, and('nzbc_g12as2_6.6', nzbc_g12as2_f19)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has a pitch and the solar collector's pitch is not the roof pitch, then the solar collector must have fixing at no less than 8 locations and must meet all the requirements described in G12/AS2 Paragraph 6.6 and Figure 19.

TEXT: 6.6.3 The edge of the panel elevated above the roof plane is to be supported by hot dip galvanized steel or stainless steel angle struts which are: a) 25 x 25 x 3 mm angle for struts up to 1.0 m long.
LRML: if(and(is(panel, elevated), above(panel, roof), lessThanEqual(angleStrut.length, 1.0 m))), then(and(obligation(has(panel.edge, support)), obligation(is(support.type, angleStrut)), obligation(is(angleStrut.material, or(hotDipGalvanisedSteel, stainlessSteel))), obligation(equal(angleStrut.width, 40 mm)), obligation(equal(angleStrut.length, 40 mm)), obligation(equal(angleStrut.thickness, 3 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the panel is elevated and above the roof and angle struts are over 1.0 m long, then the edge of the paned is to be supported by hot dip galvanized steel angle struts or stainless steel angle struts which are: a) 25 mm width, 25 mm length, snd 3 mm thickness.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
Additional rule required which says that angle struts are required.

TEXT: 6.6.3 The edge of the panel elevated above the roof plane is to be supported by hot dip galvanized steel or stainless steel angle struts which are: 40 x 40 x 3 mm angle for struts up to 2.4 m long.
LRML: if(and(is(panel.edge, elevated), above(panel.edge, roof), lessThanEqual(angleStrut.length, 2.4 m))), then(and(obligation(has(panel.edge, support)), obligation(is(support.type, angleStrut)), obligation(is(angleStrut.material, or(hotDipGalvanisedSteel, stainlessSteel))), obligation(equal(angleStrut.width, 40 mm)), obligation(equal(angleStrut.length, 40 mm)), obligation(equal(angleStrut.thickness, 3 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the panel is elevated and above the roof and angle struts are over 2.4 m long, then the edge of the paned is to be supported by hot dip galvanized steel angle struts or stainless steel angle struts which are: a) 40 mm width, 40 mm length, and 3 mm thickness.

TEXT: Cuts or holes made in steel after galvanizing are to be protected from corrosion.
LRML: if(and(has(steel, penetration), after(penetration, galvanising))), then(obligation(has(penetration, corrosionProtection)))
PARAPHRASE: If penetrations are made in steel after galvanizing, then the penetration are to be protected from corrosion.

TEXT: Solar Water Heating System 7.1.1 A permanent label must be fixed to a prominent part of the system which includes all markings required in the appropriate Standard identified in Paragraph 3.1.1.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeatingSystem)), then(obligation(and(has(solarWaterHeatingSystem.part, label),is(label, permanent),is(solarWaterHeatingSystem.part, prominent),is(label.content, marking),asPer(marking, 'nzbc_g12as2_3.1.1'))))
PARAPHRASE: If solar water heating systems exist, then the solar water heating systems shall have a permanent label on a prominent part of the system. The label content has all markings required in the appropriate Standard identified in G12/AS2 Paragraph 3.1.1.

TEXT: Solar Water Heating System 7.1.1 A permanent label must be fixed to a prominent part of the system which includes all markings required in the appropriate Standard identified in Paragraph 3.1.1.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeatingSystem)), then(obligation(and(has(solarWaterHeatingSystem.part, label),is(label, permanent),is(solarWaterHeatingSystem.part, prominent),is(label.content, marking),asPer(marking, 'nzbc_g12as2_3.1.1'))))
PARAPHRASE: If solar water heating systems exist, then the solar water heating systems shall have a permanent label on a prominent part of the system. The label content has all markings required in the appropriate Standard identified in G12/AS2 Paragraph 3.1.1.

TEXT: 7.2.2 A solar water heater is easy to access and moderately difficult to replace and therefore the durability requirement is 15 years.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(solarWaterHeater.durability, 15 years)))
PARAPHRASE: If solar water heater exist, then the durability of the solar water heater shall be 15 years.

TEXT: 7.2.2 A solar water heater is easy to access and moderately difficult to replace and therefore the durability requirement is 15 years.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(solarWaterHeater.durability, 15 years)))
PARAPHRASE: If solar water heater exist, then the durability of the solar water heater shall be 15 years.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Fixings shall: a) Be fixed through crests, b) Penetrate purlins by a minimum of 40 mm for nail fixings and 30 mm for screw fixings, c) Include sealing washers of: i) neoprene (having a carbon black content of 15% or less by weight).
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), has(roofCladding, fixing))), then(obligation(and(has(roofCladding,crest),through(fixing,crest),into(fixing.penetration, purlin),or(and(is(fixing.type, nail),greaterThanEqual(fixing.penetration,40 mm)),and(is(fixing.type, screw),greaterThanEqual(fixing.penetration,30 mm))),include(fixing,sealingWasher),is(sealingWasher.type,neoprene),lessThanEqual(sealingWasher.carbonBlackContent,15 percent))))
PARAPHRASE: If the profile of Profiled Metal Roof Cladding has a fixing, then the fixings shall be through the crests of the roof cladding, the fixings shall penetrate purlins and either the fixings is a nail and the penetration is 40 mm or the fixing is a screw and the penetration is 30 mm, and the fixing shall include sealing washers of  neoprene and the sealing washer shall have a carbon black content of 15 percent or less.

TEXT: The design of control joints for membrane roofing is subject to specific design and is outside the scope of this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(and(is(roof.type, membrane), for(controlJoint, roof))), then(and(obligation(has(controlJoint, specificDesign)), not(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, controlJoint))))
PARAPHRASE: If the control joint is for a membrane roof, then the control joint shall have specific design and E2/AS1 does not apply to the control joint.

TEXT: 8.5.9 Penetrations; Penetrations through membrane roofs and decks shall be as shown in Figure 59 and Figure 60.
LRML: if(and(for(membrane, or(roof, deck)), has(membrane, penetration))), then(obligation(asPer(penetration,and(nzbc_e2as1_f59,nzbc_e2as1_f60))))
PARAPHRASE: If the membrane is for roofs or decks and the membrane has a penetration, then the penetration shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 59 and Figure 60.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; Claddings in Extra High wind zones require: a) Rigid underlays to Paragraph 9.1.7.2 b) Drained cavities to Paragraph 9.1.8 c) Hooks and hems on flashing upstands.
LRML: if(and(within(wallCladding, windZone), is(windZone, extraHigh))), then(obligation(and(has(wallCladding, underlay),is(underlay, rigid),complyWith(underlay,'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.7.2'),has(wallCladding,drainedCavity),complyWith(drainedCavity,'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.8'),has(wallCladding, flashing),has(flashing.upstand,and(hook,hem)))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are in Extra High wind zones, then the wall claddings shall have rigid underlays to Paragraph 9.1.7.2 and the wall claddings shall have drained cavities to Paragraph 9.1.8 and the wall cladding flashing upstands shall have hooks and hems.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; Claddings in Extra High wind zones require: a) Rigid underlays to Paragraph 9.1.7.2 b) Drained cavities to Paragraph 9.1.8 c) Hooks and hems on flashing upstands.
LRML: if(and(within(wallCladding, windZone), is(windZone, extraHigh))), then(obligation(and(has(wallCladding, underlay),is(underlay, rigid),complyWith(underlay,'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.7.2'),has(wallCladding,drainedCavity),complyWith(drainedCavity,'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.8'),has(wallCladding, flashing),has(flashing.upstand,and(hook,hem)))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are in Extra High wind zones, then the wall claddings shall have rigid underlays to E2/AS1 Paragraph 9.1.7.2 and the wall claddings shall have drained cavities to E2/AS1 Paragraph 9.1.8 and the wall cladding flashing upstands shall have hooks and hems.

TEXT: The height of the floor slab above finished ground level shall be in accordance with Figure 73D and as shown in Table 18.
LRML: if(exist(floorSlab)), then(obligation(and(above(floorSlab.height, finishedGroundLevel),asPer(floorSlab.height,and('nzbc_e2as1_f73.d',nzbc_e2as1_t18)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a floor slab exists, then the height of the floor slab above finished ground level shall be in accordance with E2/AS1 Figure 73.d and Table 18.

TEXT: 9.1.3.4 Garages and openings to garages; Garage spaces within, or attached to, the building envelope shall have: a) Openings provided with a 50 mm minimum total level change between the interior and the exterior paving, b) Provision to drain water away from the threshold of the opening c) Rigid wall underlays, to Table 23, where external garage walls are unlined d) linings to garage walls adjoining habitable spaces e) weather resisting garage doors f) window and door details (where included) to Paragraphs 9.2 to 9.9.
LRML: if(and(has(building, envelope),or(within(garage, envelope),connect(garage, envelope)))), then(obligation(and(has(garage.opening, interiorPaving),has(garage.opening, exteriorPaving),define(exteriorPaving.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(interiorPaving.elevation, 'x0 + 50 mm'),has(garage, drainage),awayFrom(drainage.direction, opening),or(and(is(garage.wall, external),not(has(garage.wall, lining)), has(garage.wall,underlay),is(underlay,rigid),asPer(underlay,nzbc_e2as1_t23)),and(        is(garage.wall, external),has(garage.wall, lining))),adjoin(garage.wall, habitableSpace), has(garage.wall,lining),is(garage.door,weatherResistant),asPer(garage.window, 'nzbc_e2as1_9.2 to nzbc_e2as1_9.9'),asPer(garage.door, 'nzbc_e2as1_9.2 to nzbc_e2as1_9.9'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the garage is within or attached to the building envelope, then the garage shall have openings with an interior paving elevation 50 mm minimum greater than the exterior paving elevation, and the garage shall have drainage away from the opening, and the garage shall either have external garage walls and the walls have rigid wall underlays, to E2/AS1 Table 23, and the garage walls have no linings, or the external garage walls shall have linings, and garage walls adjoining habitable spaces shall have linings, and garage doors shall be weather resistant, and garage window and door shall be to E2/AS1 Paragraphs 9.2 to 9.9.
COMMENTS:
garage spaces? space type?
Use as property defined opening
weatherResistant vs weatherResistance

TEXT: 9.1.3.5 Bottom of wall claddings for timber floor framing; Suspended timber floors shall meet the requirements of NZS 3604. Clearances from paved and unpaved surfaces to the wall framing shall be in accordance with NZS 3604, and Table 18.
LRML: if(and(adjacent(floor, wallCladding), is(floor, suspended), is(floor.material, timber))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(floor, nzs_3604),towards(wallCladding.clearance, surface),is(surface, or(paved, unpaved)),asPer(wallCladding.clearance,and(nzs_3604,nzbc_e2as1_t18)))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are next to suspended timber floors, then the floor shall meet the requirements of NZS 3604. The wall cladding clearances towards paved and unpaved surfaces shall be in accordance with NZS 3604, and E2/AS1 Table 18.

TEXT: 9.1.3.3 Bottom of wall claddings for concrete ground slabs (except masonry veneer); At concrete slab level, the base of the cladding system shall be as shown in Table 18, and: a) Finish a minimum of: i) 100 mm above a paved surface, or ii) 175 mm above finished unpaved surface, b) Overlap the concrete slab by 50 mm, and c) Be offset horizontally by a minimum of 6 mm for direct fixed claddings to prevent capillary action.
LRML: if(and(not(is(wallCladding.system, masonryVeneer)), adjoin(slab, wallCladding),is(slab.type, ground),is(slab.material, concrete))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(wallCladding.bottom,nzbc_e2as1_t18),or(and(adjoin(surface, wallCladding),is(surface.type, paved),define(surface.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(wallCladding.bottom, 'x0 + 100 mm')),and(adjoin(surface, wallCladding),not(is(surface.type, paved)),define(surface.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(distance, 'x0 + 175 mm'))),has(wallCladding.bottom, lap),towards(lap, slab),equal(lap.size, 50 mm),or(and(has(wallCladding.bottom, offset),is(offset, horizontal),greaterThanEqual(offset.size, 6 mm),is(wallCladding.type, directFixed),prevent(offset, capillaryAction)),not(is(wallCladding.type, directFixed))))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are not masonry veneer and the concrete ground slab adjoins the wall cladding, then the bottom of the wall cladding shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Table 18, and either the wall cladding bottom is at a minimum of 100 mm above a paved surface, or the wall cladding bottom is at a minimum of 175 mm above finished unpaved surface, and the wall cladding bottom overlaps the concrete slab by 50 mm size, and the wall cladding bottom shall be either offset horizontally by a minimum of 6 mm size for direct fixed claddings to prevent capillary action, or the wallcladding shall be not direct fixed.

TEXT: 2.1.3 Basic normal maintenance tasks shall include but not be limited to: a) Where applicable, following manufacturers' maintenance recommendations, b) Washing down surfaces, particularly exterior building elements subject to wind driven salt spray, c) Re-coating interior and exterior protective finishes, d) Replacing sealant, seals and gaskets in joints, e) Replacing valves, washers and similar high wear components in easily accessed service equipment and other building elements, f) Cleaning and replacing filters in building services systems, g) The regular servicing of boilers, cooling towers, lifts, escalators, emergency lighting and fire protection equipment, and h) The maintenance of signs for access, escape routes, emergency equipment and hazardous areas.
LRML: if(is(maintenance.type, or(normal, basic))), then(obligation(and(include(maintenance.task, manufacturersRecommendation), include(maintenance.task, washing), for(washing, surface), include(maintenance.task, recoating),for(recoating, and(interiorProtectiveFinish, exteriorProtectiveFinish)), include(maintenance.task, replacing),for(replacing, and(jointSealant, jointSeal, jointGasket, valve, washer, component)), is(component, highWear),include(maintenance.task, cleaning),for(cleaning, buildingServiceSystemFilter),for(replacing, buildingServiceSystemFilter),include(maintenance.task, service),is(service.type, regular),for(service, and(boiler, coolingTower, lift, escalator, emergencyLighting, fireProtectionEquipment)),include(maintenance.task, maintenance),for(maintenance, sign),is(sign.type, and(access, escapeRoute, emergencyEquipment, hazardousArea)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the the maintenance is basic or normal, the maintenance tasks shall include the manufacturers recommendations, and the maintenance tasks shall include washing down surfaces, and the maintenance tasks shall include recoating interior protective finishes and exterior protective finishes, and the maintenance tasks shall include replacing joint sealant, joint seals, joint gaskets, valves, washers and high wear components, and the maintenance tasks shall include cleaning building services system filters and replacing building services system filters, and the maintenance tasks shall include the regular service of regular boiler, cooling tower, lift, escalator, emergency lighting, fire protection equipment, and the maintenance tasks shall include the maintenance for signs type access, escape route, emergency equipment and hazardous area.

TEXT: Flashings are required to shed or divert water at sensitive areas of the building cladding. These include at: a) The building periphery, except where gutters are present, b) Changes of direction in cladding materials, c) Intersections between cladding materials or with other buildings, and d) Roof or wall penetrations, including windows, doors and other penetrations.
LRML: if(and(has(building, cladding),or(is(cladding.area, sensitive), and(is(cladding.area, buildingPeriphery), not(include(cladding.area, gutter))), has(cladding.area, changeInDirection), and(has(cladding.area, intersection), or(has(cladding, materials),inBetween(intersection, materials), towards(intersection, otherBuilding))), is(cladding.area, roofPenetration), and(is(cladding.area, wallPenetration), include(wallPenetration, and(window, door)))))), then(obligation(and(is(flashing.location,sensitiveArea),for(flashing,or(shedWater,divertWater)))))
PARAPHRASE: Flashings are required to shed or divert water at sensitive areas of the building cladding. These include at: a) The building periphery, except where gutters are present, b) Changes of direction, c) Intersections between cladding materials or with other buildings, and d) Roof or wall penetrations, including windows, doors and other penetrations.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 9.1.1 Limitations; This Acceptable Solution is limited to the wall cladding systems listed in Paragraph 3.3.
LRML: if(asPer(wallCladding, 'nzbc_e2as1_3.3')), then(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, wallCladding))
PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are listed in E2/AS1 Paragraph 3.3, then E2/AS1 applies to the wall cladding.

TEXT: 9.1.2 Maintenance; Maintenance of wall claddings shall be carried out as necessary to achieve the expected durability of the material – refer to Paragraph 2.5.
LRML: if(and(has(wallCladding.material, durability),asPer(durability, 'nzbc_e2as1_2.5'))), then(obligation(has(wallCladding, maintenance)))
PARAPHRASE: If the wall cladding material has a durability as per E2/AS1 Paragraph 2.5, then the wall cladding shall have the necessary maintenence.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; Separations, clearances to ground level, and overlaps shall be as shown in Figure 65 and Table 18.
LRML: if(exist(wallCladding)), then(obligation(and(asPer(wallCladding.separation,and(nzbc_e2as1_f65,nzbc_e2as1_t18)),towards(wallCladding.clearance, groundLevel), asPer(wallCladding.clearance,and(nzbc_e2as1_f65,nzbc_e2as1_t18)),asPer(wallCladding.lap,and(nzbc_e2as1_f65,nzbc_e2as1_t18)))))
PARAPHRASE: If there is a wall cladding, then the wall cladding's separations, clearances to ground level, and laps shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 65 and Table 18.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings 9.1.3.1 Concrete slabs; Slab levels shall be set to allow reinstatement of final landscaped ground levels as outlined in Figure 65 and Table 18.
LRML: if(and(adjacent(slab, wallCladding),is(slab.material, concrete))), then(obligation(and(above(slab.elevation, finishedGroundLevel),asPer(slab.elevation,and(nzbc_e2as1_f65,nzbc_e2as1_t18)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the concrete slab is adjacent to the wall cladding, then the slab's elevation shall be above finished ground levels as outlined in E2/AS1 Figure 65 and Table 18.

TEXT: 9.1.3.4 Garages and openings to garages; Garage spaces within, or attached to, the building envelope shall have: a) Openings provided with a 50 mm minimum total level change between the interior and the exterior paving, b) Provision to drain water away from the threshold of the opening c) Rigid wall underlays, to Table 23, where external garage walls are unlined d) linings to garage walls adjoining habitable spaces e) weather resisting garage doors f) window and door details (where included) to Paragraphs 9.2 to 9.9.
LRML: if(and(has(building, envelope),or(within(garage, envelope),connect(garage, envelope)))), then(obligation(and(has(garage.opening, interiorPaving),has(garage.opening, exteriorPaving),define(exteriorPaving.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(interiorPaving.elevation, 'x0 + 50 mm'),has(garage, drainage),awayFrom(drainage.direction, opening),or(and(is(garage.wall, external),not(has(garage.wall, lining)), has(garage.wall,underlay),is(underlay,rigid),asPer(underlay,nzbc_e2as1_t23)),and(        is(garage.wall, external),has(garage.wall, lining))),adjoin(garage.wall, habitableSpace), has(garage.wall,lining),is(garage.door,weatherResistant),asPer(garage.window, 'nzbc_e2as1_9.2 to nzbc_e2as1_9.9'),asPer(garage.door, 'nzbc_e2as1_9.2 to nzbc_e2as1_9.9'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the garage is within or attached to the building envelope, then the garage shall have openings with an interior paving elevation 50 mm minimum greater than the exterior paving elevation, and the garage shall have drainage away from the opening, and the garage shall either have external garage walls and the walls have rigid wall underlays, to E2/AS1 Table 23, and the garage walls have no linings, or the external garage walls shall have linings, and garage walls adjoining habitable spaces shall have linings, and garage doors shall be weather resistant, and garage window and door shall be to E2/AS1 Paragraphs 9.2 to 9.9.

garage spaces? space type?
Use as property defined opening
