TEXT: Barrier to airflow for external walls shall be in form of: a) Interior linings with all joints stopped for wind zones up to Very High, or b) Rigid underlays (and drained cavities) for buildings in Extra High wind zones - refer to Paragraph 9.1.7.2 c) Where walls are not lined, such as attic spaces at gable ends, an air barrier complying with Table 23, fixed to framing prior to fixing cladding or cavity battens d) For attached garages, underlays to Paragraph 9.1.3.4.
LRML: if(and(is(wall.type, external), has(wall, barrier),against(barrier, airflow))), then(or(obligation(and(by(barrier, interiorLining),is(interiorLining.joint,stopped),lessThanEqual(building.windZone, veryHigh))), obligation(and(by(barrier,and(underlay,drainedCavity)),is(underlay,rigid),is(building.windZone,extraHigh),asPer(underlay, 'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.7.2'),asPer(underlay, 'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.7.2'))), obligation(and(not(has(wall, lining)),is(barrier.type, airBarrier),complyWith(barrier, nzbc_e2as1_t23),has(wall,framing),towards(barrier.fixing,framing),before(barrier.fixing, and(cladding, cavityBatten)))), obligation(and(partOf(wall,garage),is(garage,attached),by(barrier, underlay),asPer(underlay, 'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.3.4')))))
PARAPHRASE: If an external wall has a barrier against airflow, then the barrier shall be in form of interior linings with all joints stopped for buildings in wind zones up to Very High, or the barrier shall be by rigid underlays and drained cavities for buildings in Extra High wind zones - refer to E2/AS1 Paragraph 9.1.7.2, or the walls are not lined and the barrier shall be an air barrier complying with E2/AS1 Table 23, fixed to framing prior to claddings or cavity battens, or if the wall is part of an attached garages, the barrier shall be by underlays to Paragraph 9.1.3.4.

TEXT: 9.1.5 Wall underlays to wall openings; Prior to window or door installation: a) Flexible wall underlay shall be cut and dressed into all sides of openings as per Figure 72A and B,.
LRML: if(and(has(wall, opening), is(opening.type, or(window, door)))), then(obligation(and(loop(forEach(opening.side),has(opening.side, underlay)),for(underlay, wall),is(underlay, flexible),asPer(underlay, and('nzbc_e2as1_f72.a', 'nzbc_e2as1_f72.b')),define(opening.installation, x0),before(underlay.installation, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If the wall has an opening and the opening type is window or door, then all sides of openings shall have underlays and the underlays shall be for walls and shall be flexible and as per E2/AS1 Figure 72.a and Figure 72.b, and the undlay installation shall be before the installation of the opening.
COMMENTS:
QUESIONABL - Installation time might be better?
wall opening?
installation vs installationTime - before implies time already?

TEXT: 3.4.1 Floor waste outlets shall have a removable grating that is flush with the floor.
LRML: if(has(floorWaste, outlet)), then(obligation(and(has(outlet,removableGrating),is(removableGrating.location,flushWithfloor))))
PARAPHRASE: If the floor waste has outlets, then the outlets shall have a removable grating that is flush with the floor.

TEXT: 3.4.2 The floor waste shall have a minimum diameter of 40 mm.
LRML: if(exist(floorWaste)), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(floorWaste.diameter, 40 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: If a floor waste exists, then the floor waste shall have a minimum diameter of 40 mm.

TEXT: 3.4.2 The floor waste, and the water trap if used, shall have a minimum diameter of 40 mm.
LRML: if(or(exist(floorWaste), exist(waterTrap))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(floorWaste.diameter,40 mm),greaterThanEqual(waterTrap.diameter,40 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If a floor waste or water trap exist, then the floor waste and water trap shall have a minimum diameter of 40 mm.
COMMENTS: TODO: Or in if-statement causes problems for then-statement (or/and?)

TEXT: Individual floor waste pipes connected to a floor waste stack need not be vented (see Figure 3).
LRML: if(within(pipe, floorWasteStack)), then(permission(not(has(pipe, ventilation))))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes are in a floor waste stack, the the pipes need not be vented.

TEXT: 4.2.1 Access points shall be provided in discharge pipes to allow the easy clearance of blockages.
LRML: if(exist(dischargePipe)), then(obligation(has(dischargePipe, accessPoint)))
PARAPHRASE: If discharge pipes exist, then the discharge pipes shall have access points.

TEXT: 4.4.1 The gradient of discharge pipes shall be not less than that required in Table 4 for the relevant discharge unit loading.
LRML: if(exist(dischargePipe)), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(dischargePipe.gradient,value),asPer(value,nzbc_g13as1_t4))))
PARAPHRASE: If discharge pipes exist, then the gradient of discharge pipes shall be not less than that required in G13/AS1 Table 4.

TEXT: 4.5.2 Water seal protection: Waste water fixture discharge pipes shall be vented to comply with Paragraph 5.0 and as required in Table 5.
LRML: if(has(wasteWaterFixture, dischargePipe)), then(obligation(and(has(dischargePipe,ventilation),complyWith(ventilation,'nzbc_g13as1_5.0'),asPer(ventilation,nzbc_g13as1_t5))))
PARAPHRASE: If waste water fixture have discharge pipes, then the discharge pipes shall have ventilation to comply with G13/AS1 Paragraph 5.0 and as required in Table 5.

TEXT: 4.6.1 Fixture discharge pipes serving soil fixtures shall discharge either: a) Directly to the drain, as shown in Figure 6(1), or b) To a stack, as in Paragraph 4.7 and as shown in Figures 7 and 8.
LRML: if(has(soilFixture, dischargePipe)), then(or(obligation(and(towards(dischargePipe.discharge,drain),asPer(dischargePipe.discharge,'nzbc_g13as1_f6.1'))), obligation(and(towards(dischargePipe.discharge,stack),asPer(dischargePipe.discharge,and('nzbc_g13as1_4.7',nzbc_g13as1_f7,nzbc_g13as1_f8))))))
PARAPHRASE: If a soil fixture has discharge pipes, then the dicharge pipes shall discharge either: a) To the drain, as shown in G13/AS1 Figure 6.1, or b) To a stack, as in G13/AS1 Paragraph 4.7 and Figures 7 and 8.

TEXT: 4.6.2 Water seal protection: Soil fixture discharge pipes shall be vented to comply with Paragraph 5.0 and as required in Table 5 (see Figure 6(2)).
LRML: if(has(soilFixture, dischargePipe)), then(obligation(and(has(dischargePipe,ventilation),complyWith(ventilation,'nzbc_g13as1_5.0'),asPer(ventilation,nzbc_g13as1_t5))))
PARAPHRASE: If discharge pipes have soil fixture, then the soil fixture shall have ventilation that complies with G13/AS1 Paragraph 5.0 and as required in Table 5.

TEXT: 5.1.1 Discharge pipes shall be vented where required by Table 5.
LRML: if(exist(dischargePipe)), then(obligation(asPer(dischargePipe.ventilation, nzbc_g13as1_t5)))
PARAPHRASE: If discharge pipes exist, then the discharge pipes shall be have ventilation where required by G13/AS1 Table 5.

TEXT: 5.7.1 Open vent pipes shall terminate outside the building in accordance with Paragraphs 5.7.2 and 5.7.3 or 5.7.4.
LRML: if(is(ventilationPipe.type, open)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(ventPipe,'nzbc_g13as1_5.7.2'),complyWith(ventPipe,or('nzbc_g13as1_5.7.3','nzbc_g13as1_5.7.4')))))
PARAPHRASE: If vent pipes are open, then the vent pipes shall terminate outside the building in accordance with G13/AS1 Paragraphs 5.7.2 and eiter 5.7.3 or 5.7.4.

TEXT: 5.8.1 General; Air admittance valves may be used as venting where specified in accordance with Table 5.
LRML: if(asPer(airAdmittanceValve, nzbc_g13as1_t5)), then(permission(has(ventilation, airAdmittanceValve)))
PARAPHRASE: If air admittance valves are specified in accordance with G13/AS1 Table 5, then the air admittance valves may be used as venting.

TEXT: Air admittance valves that form an integral part of a fixture trap shall only be used as a trap vent.
LRML: if(and(partOf(airAdmittanceValve, fixtureTrap), is(airAdmittanceValve, integral))), then(obligation(and(for(airAdmittanceValve, ventilation),for(ventilation, fixtureTrap),not(for(ventilation, other)))))
PARAPHRASE: If air admittance valves are part of a fixture trap and are integral, then the air admittance valves shall be used as ventilation for the fixture trap but not for other.

TEXT: G15 Solid waste 1.0.2 Where containers are stored in a common area within a building or part of a building, a space of at least 0.5 m x 0.5 m by 1 m high shall be provided for each dwelling unit.
LRML: if(and(is(wasteStorageArea.type, common), within(wasteStorageArea.location, building))), then(obligation(loop(forEach(building.dwellingUnit),and(greaterThanEqual(wasteStorageArea.length, 0.5 m), greaterThanEqual(wasteStorageArea.width, 0.5 m), greaterThanEqual(wasteStorageArea.height, 1 m)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the waste storage area is common and within a building, there shall be for each dwelling unit a space of at least 0.5 m length, 0.5 m width, and 1 m height.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall claddings; This Acceptable Solution is limited to masonry veneer cladding attached to timber wall framing outlined in NZS 3604. Masonry veneer is either: a) Clay brick, or b) Concrete brick or block.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall claddings; Masonry veneer shall be attached to wall framing by wall ties. Wall ties and their spacings and embedment shall be in accordance with the requirements of NZS 4210 and Tables 18A, 18B and 18C. Screw fixings shall be minimum 12 gauge, 35 mm long hex washer face, galvanised or stainless steel to suit the ties required under Table 18C.

PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are masonry veneer, then the wall cladding shall be connected to wall framing by wall ties. Wall ties and their spacings and embedment shall be in accordance with NZS 4210 and E2/AS1 Tables 18.a, 18.b and 18.c. Screw fixings for the wall ties shall be minimum size 12 gauge, 35 mm long hex washer face, galvanised or stainless steel.

TEXT: Where the tops to enclosed balustrades are formed using EIFS, they shall have a minimum fall of 10° (1:6), and be wrapped as shown in Figure 129 and 130, with a liquid waterproofing membrane approved by the supplier. TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; 9.9.8 Pipes and service penetrations; All pipes and service penetrations through the EIFS shall be made weatherproof.

TEXT: 6.2.2 The installation of solar collectors must not dent, bend or distort the roof cladding or damage any protective coatings.

TEXT: Flashings are required to shed or divert water at sensitive areas of the building cladding. These include at: a) The building periphery, except where gutters are present, b) Changes of direction in cladding materials, c) Intersections between cladding materials or with other buildings, and d) Roof or wall penetrations, including windows, doors and other penetrations.

If the building cladding has a sensitive areas or the cladding area is the building periphery, and no gutters are in the cladding area, or the cladding area has changes of direction, c) Intersections between cladding materials or to other buildings, and d) Roof or wall penetrations, including windows, doors and other penetrations.
Flashings are required to shed or divert water at sensitive areas of the building cladding.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Flashings are required to shed or divert water at sensitive areas of the building cladding. TEXT: 3.7.6 Drain under buildings; Any drain laid under a building shall be run in a straight line from one side to the other.
LRML: if(below(drain.section, building)), then(prohibition(include(drain.section, changeInDirection)))
PARAPHRASE: If the drain's section is under a building, then the drain's section shall not include any changes in direction.

TEXT: 3.7.7 Access to a drain laid under a building shall be provided immediately outside the building. These points of access shall be located within 2.0 m of an exterior wall.
LRML: if(below(drain, building)), then(obligation(and(has(drain, accessPoint),outside(accessPoint.location, building),has(building, externalWall),define(externalWall.location, x0),within(accessPoint.location, 'x0 + 2 m'))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain is under a building, then the drain's access point location shall be outside the building. These points of access shall be located within 2 m of an exterior wall of the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: These anti-scour blocks shall be: Keyed into the sides and floor of the trench by 150 mm.

TEXT: 3.9.3 Trench slope; These anti-scour blocks shall be: Extended to ground level where the drain cover is less than 300 mm.
LRML: if(and(has(trench, antiScourBlocks),within(drain, trench),has(drain, cover),lessThan(cover.depth, 300 mm))), then(obligation(is(antiScourBlocks.elevation, groundLevel)))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 9.0 Wall claddings; Where a drained cavity is required, it shall: a) Be installed over a wall underlay, either flexible or rigid, that: i) complies with Table 23, and ii) is fixed to wall framing, b) Be formed using vertical cavity battens, c) Restrict air movement between the drained cavity and: i) floor, wall and roof framing, ii) attic roof space, and iii) subfloor space, d) Be drained and open to the exterior at the bottom of cavities, e) Use vermin-proofing at the cavity base as per Paragraph 9.1.8.3 and Figure 66, f) Use cavity spacers as shown in Figure 67, where fixing is required between cavity battens. Alternative cavity spacers to those described in Paragraph 9.1.8.2 are permitted. Refer to Paragraph 9.1.8.4 f).
LRML: if(requires(wallCladding, drainedCavity)), then(obligation(and(above(drainedCavity.installation, underlay),for(underlay, wall),is(underlay.type,or(flexible,rigid)),complyWith(underlay,nzbc_e2as1_t23),towards(underlay.fixing,framing),has(wall, framing),is(drainedCavity.material,cavityBatten),is(cavityBatten.orientation,vertical), inBetween(airMovement.restriction,and(drainedCavity, floorFraming)),inBetween(airMovement.restriction,and(drainedCavity, wallFraming)),inBetween(airMovement.restriction,and(drainedCavity, roofFraming)),inBetween(airMovement.restriction,and(drainedCavity, atticRoofSpace)),inBetween(airMovement.restriction,and(drainedCavity, subfloorSpace)),has(drainedCavity.bottom,and(drainage,opening)),has(drainedCavity.base,verminProofing),asPer(verminProofing, and('nzbc_e2as1_9.1.8.3', nzbc_e2as1_f66)),or(and(inBetween(fixing,cavityBattens),has(cavityBatten,cavitySpacer),asPer(cavitySpacer, nzbc_e2as1_f67),or(asPer(cavitySpacer,'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.8.2'),asPer(cavitySpacer,'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.8.4.f'))),not(inBetween(fixing,cavityBattens))))))
PARAPHRASE: If the wall cladding requires a drained cavity, then the drained cavity shall be installed over a wall underlay, the underlay shall beeither flexible or rigid, and the underly complies with E2/AS1 Table 23, and the underlay is fixed to wall framing, the drained cavity shall be formed using vertical cavity battens. There shall be air movement restriction between the drained cavity and floor framing, drained cavity and wall framing, drained cavity and roof framing, drained cavity and attic roof space, and drained cavity and subfloor space. The bottom of drained cavities shall have drainage and openings. Use vermin-proofing at the cavity base as per E2/AS1 Paragraph 9.1.8.3 and Figure 66. Either there is fixing in between cavity battens and the cavity battens shall have cavity spacers as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 67 and either E2/AS1 Paragraph 9.1.8.2 or Pargraph 9.1.8.4, or no fixing is in between cavity battens and the cavity

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings 9.7.1 Limitations; This Acceptable Solution is limited to the following type of fibre cement sheet cladding systems: a) Flush-finished systems over a drained cavity using sheets of 7.5 mm minimum thickness, with i) fibre cement sheets manufactured with a rebated edge for this purpose, ii) if necessary for part sheets, rebated on site using a purpose-made tool, and iii) have all edges sealed, iv) joints, comprising a bedding compound and reinforcing tape, that are finished in accordance with Paragraph 9.7.10.4.

TEXT: 1.0.1 This acceptable solution applies to below ground and above ground piped water supply systems.
LRML: if(is(pipedWaterSupplySystem.type, or(belowGround, aboveGround))), then(applyTo(nzbc_g12as1, pipedWaterSupplySystem))
PARAPHRASE: If a piped water supply systems is below ground or above ground, then G12/AS1 applies to the piped water supply systems.

TEXT: 5.10.1 Where a drain or part of a drain is no longer required, it shall be disconnected from the foul water drainage system at the junction with the live drain or at the property boundary.
LRML: if(or(not(is(drain, required)), not(is(drain.part, required)))), then(obligation(or(disconnect(drain, or(liveDrainJunction,propertyBoundary)),disconnect(drain.part, or(liveDrainJunction,propertyBoundary)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain or part of a drain is not required, then the drain and part of a drain shall be disconnected at the live drain junction or at the property boundary.

TEXT: 5.3.1 Figure 7 gives acceptable methods for the bedding and backfilling of the drainage pipes listed in Table 1 except where: a) The trench is located within or above peat, b) Scouring of the trench is likely due to unstable soils, or d) The cover H to the pipe is more than 2.5 m.
LRML: if(and(asPer(drainPipe, nzbc_g13as2_t1), not(within(trench.location, peat)), not(above(trench.location, peat)), not(is(soil.type, unstable)), lessThanEqual(drainPipe.cover, 2.5 m))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(drain.bedding, nzbc_g13as2_f7),complyWith(drain.backfilling, nzbc_g13as2_f7))))
PARAPHRASE: If drainage pipes are listed in G13/AS2 Table 1, then the trench is not located within or above a peat, soil is not unstable, and the cover of the pipe is no more than 2.5 m, then bedding and backfilling may comply with G13/AS2 Figure 7.

TEXT: The width B of the trench shall be no less than the pipe diameter D plus 200 mm.
LRML: if(for(trench, pipe)), then(obligation(and(define(pipe.diameter, x0),greaterThanEqual(trench.width, 'x0 + 200 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the trench is for the pipe, then the width of the trench shall be no less than the pipe diameter plus 200 mm.

TEXT: The width of the trench at the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm unless the pipes in the trench are covered with concrete, as shown in Figure 7 (c).
LRML: if(and(within(pipe.location, trench), is(trench.cover, concrete))), then(obligation(and( define(topOf(pipe.elevation), x0), equal(trench.elevation, x0), greaterThan(trench.width, 600 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the pipes located in the trench are not covered with concrete, then the width of the trench where the trench elevation is the same as the elevation of the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm.

TEXT: Drainage; Junctions beneath the building joining at an angle of not more than 45° (see Figure 13).
LRML: if(and(below(junction, building))), then(obligation(lessThanEqual(junction.angle, 45 deg)))
PARAPHRASE: If junctions are beneath the building, then the junctions shall have an angle of not more than 45 deg.

TEXT: 5.9.1 Where two or more soil fixtures are connected to a branch drain beneath the building, access for cleaning shall be provided by a sealed floor level rodding point located downstream of the highest fixture connection to the branch drain (see Figures 10 and 13).
LRML: if(and(greaterThanEqual(soilFixture.count, 2), connect(soilFixture, drain), is(drain.type, branch), below(drain, building))), then(obligation(and(has(drain,cleaningAccess),is(cleaningAccess,roddingPoint),is(roddingPoint,floorLevel),is(roddingPoint.type,sealed),equal(roddingPoint.location,highestFixtureConnection))))
PARAPHRASE: If two or more soil fixtures are connected to a branch drain beneath the building, then the drain shall have access for cleaning by a sealed floor level rodding point located at the highest fixture connection.

TEXT: 6.1.3 Air tests may be carried out in accordance with either clause 15.3 of AS/NZS 3500.2 or paragraph 8.3 of E1/VM1.
LRML: if(exist(airTest)), then(permission(asPer(airTest, or('nzs_3500_2_15.3', 'nzbc_e1vm1_8.3'))))
PARAPHRASE: If air tests exists, then air tests may be in accordance with either NZS 3500.2 clause 15.3 or E1/VM1 paragraph 8.3.

TEXT: Where a disused drain is being reinstated, the disused drain shall be tested to verify that the drain is sound.
LRML: if(is(drain, and(disused, reinstated))), then(obligation(test(drain, soundness)))
PARAPHRASE: If a disused drain is being reinstated, then the disused drain shall be tested for soundness.

TEXT: 6.1.5 Where a building is proposed to be built over an existing drain, the drain shall be verified as being sound both before and after construction.
LRML: if(and(above(building.construction, drain),is(drain, existing))), then(and(obligation(has(drain.soundness, verification)), obligation(before(verification, construction)), obligation(after(verification, construction))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building is constructed over an existing drain, then the drain soundness shall have verification both before and after construction.

TEXT: 6.1.5 Where a building is proposed to be built over an existing drain, the drain shall be verified as being sound both before and after construction.
LRML: if(and(above(building.construction, drain),is(drain, existing))), then(and(obligation(has(drain.soundness, verification)), obligation(before(verification, construction)), obligation(after(verification, construction))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building is constructed over an existing drain, then the drain soundness shall have verification both before and after construction.

TEXT: 1.1.1 A fence erected to ensure security against unauthorised access to storage and treatment facilities shall comply with F5/AS1 Construction and Demolition Hazards.
LRML: if(or(has(storageFacility, securityFence),has(treatmentFacility, securityFence))), then(and(obligation(complyWith(securityFence, nzbc_f5as1))))
PARAPHRASE: If a security fence is for storage and treatment facilities, then the security fence shall comply with F5/AS1.

TEXT: 1.1.1 This document describes the requirements to be satisfied by specific design for systems used for the collection, storage, treatment and disposal of industrial liquid waste.
LRML: if(and( for(system, or(collection, storage, treatment, disposal)),for(system, industrialLiquidWaste))), then(obligation(complyWith(system.specificDesign, nzbc_g14vm1)))
PARAPHRASE: If a system is used for the collection, storage, treatment or disposal of industrial liquid waste, then the system's spefic design shall comply with G14/VM1.

TEXT: 1.4.1 Collection facilities shall be located: a) In areas that will not create health or safety hazards.
LRML: if(exist(collectionFacility)), then(prohibition(cause(collectionFacility.location, or(healthHazard, safetyHazard))))
PARAPHRASE: If collection facilities exists, then collection facilities shall have a location that will not cause health or safety hazards.

TEXT: 6.2.6 All screw fixings into roof framing timber must be installed with minimum distances from the centre of the fixing to the edge of the timber of: 25 mm for 14 gauge screws.
LRML: if(and(has(timberRoofFraming, fixing), is(fixing.type, screw), equal(screw.size, 14 gauge))), then(obligation(and(define(fixing.centre, x0), define(timberRoofFraming.edge, x1),inBetween(distance, and(x0, x1)),greaterThanEqual(distance, 25 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If a roof framing timber has screw fixings and the screws have the size 14 gauge, then the fixings must be installed with minimum distances from the centre of the fixing to the edge of the timber of 25 mm.

TEXT: 6.4.2 Solar collectors mounted parallel to the roof that are elevated up to 50 mm above the roof cladding must be supported by: a) underlying purlins conforming to Paragraph 6.4.1 (a) or (b), or b) underlying rafters or trusses with connections conforming with Paragraphs 6.4.1 (a) or (c), or c) collector support rails conforming to Paragraph 6.5.
LRML: if(and(is(solarCollector.orientation, parallel), towards(solarCollector.orientation, roof), above(solarCollector.elevation, roofCladding), lessThanEqual(solarCollector.elevation, 50 mm))), then(or(obligation(and(is(solarCollector.support, purlin),below(purlin, solarCollector),complyWith(purlin, or('nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.a', 'nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.b')))), obligation(and(is(solarCollector.support, rafter),below(rafter, solarCollector),complyWith(rafter.connection, or('nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.a', 'nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.c')))),obligation(and(is(solarCollector.support, truss),below(truss, solarCollector),complyWith(truss.connection, or('nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.a', 'nzbc_g12as2_6.4.1.c')))),obligation(and(is(solarCollector.support, supportRail),complyWith(supportRail, 'nzbc_g12as2_6.5')))))
PARAPHRASE: If solar collectors are orientated parallel to the roof and elevated up to 50 mm above the roof cladding, then the solar collector must be supported by either: a) purlins under the solar collector with the purlins conforming to G12/AS2 Paragraph 6.4.1.a or 6.4.1.b, or b) rafters under the solar collector with the rafter connections conforming with G12/AS2 Paragraphs 6.4.1.a or 6.4.1.c or trusses under the solar collector with the truss connections conforming with G12/AS2 Paragraphs 6.4.1.a or 6.4.1.c, or c) support rails conforming to G12/AS2 Paragraph 6.5.

TEXT: 6.6.3 The edge of the panel elevated above the roof plane is to be supported by hot dip galvanized steel or stainless steel angle struts which are: a) 25 x 25 x 3 mm angle for struts up to 1.0 m long.
LRML: if(and(is(panel, elevated), above(panel, roof), lessThanEqual(angleStrut.length, 1.0 m))), then(and(obligation(has(panel.edge, support)), obligation(is(support.type, angleStrut)), obligation(is(angleStrut.material, or(hotDipGalvanisedSteel, stainlessSteel))), obligation(equal(angleStrut.width, 40 mm)), obligation(equal(angleStrut.length, 40 mm)), obligation(equal(angleStrut.thickness, 3 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the panel is elevated and above the roof and angle struts are over 1.0 m long, then the edge of the paned is to be supported by hot dip galvanized steel angle struts or stainless steel angle struts which are: a) 25 mm width, 25 mm length, snd 3 mm thickness.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
Additional rule required which says that angle struts are required.

TEXT: 6.6.3 The edge of the panel elevated above the roof plane is to be supported by hot dip galvanized steel or stainless steel angle struts which are: 30 x 30 x 3 mm angle for struts up to 1.4 m long.
LRML: if(and(is(panel.edge, elevated), above(panel.edge, roof), lessThanEqual(angleStrut.length, 1.4 m))), then(and(obligation(has(panel.edge, support)), obligation(is(support.type, angleStrut)), obligation(is(angleStrut.material, or(hotDipGalvanisedSteel, stainlessSteel))), obligation(equal(angleStrut.width, 30 mm)), obligation(equal(angleStrut.length, 30 mm)), obligation(equal(angleStrut.thickness, 3 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the panel is elevated and above the roof and angle struts are over 1.4 m long, then the edge of the paned is to be supported by hot dip galvanized steel angle struts or stainless steel angle struts which are: a) 30 mm width, 30 mm length, and 3 mm thickness.

TEXT: 7.2.1 Solar water heaters and their components must meet the durability requirements specified in NZBC Clause B2.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(and(obligation(complyWith(solarWaterHeater.durability, nzbc_b2)), obligation(and(has(solarWaterHeater, component),complyWith(component.durability, nzbc_b2)))))
PARAPHRASE: If solar water heaters exist, then the solar water heaters and their components must meet the durability requirements specified in NZBC Clause B2.

TEXT: 1.0.1 This Acceptable Solution applies to above-ground non-pressure (gravity flow) sanitary plumbing for buildings having 3 levels or less and includes all pipework for foul water within, or on the building, including any basements.
LRML: if(and(is(sanitaryPlumbing, aboveGround), is(sanitaryPlumbing.type, or(nonPressure, gravityFlow)), for(sanitaryPlumbing, building), lessThanEqual(building.buildingStorey, 3))), then(and(applyTo(nzbc_g13as1, sanitaryPlumbing),include(sanitaryPlumbing, pipework),is(pipework.type, foulWater),or(within(pipework, building), on(pipework, building)),include(building, basement)))
PARAPHRASE: If sanitary plumbing is above-ground and non-pressure or gravity flow sanitary plumbing for buildings having 3 levels or less, then G13AS1 applies to the sanitary plumbing and includes all pipework for foul water within, or on the building, including any basements.

TEXT: Sanitary Plumbing 1.0.2 The solution does not include: The conveyance of industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer without pretreatment.
LRML: if(or(for(sanitaryPlumbing, or(industrialLiquidWaste, chemicalWaste, toxicWaste)), and(for(sanitaryPlumbing, waste),towards(waste.discharge, sewer), requires(waste.discharge, pretreatment)))), then(not(applyTo(nzbc_g13as1, sanitaryPlumbing)))
PARAPHRASE: If the sanitary plumbing conveys industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes or other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer if it has no treatment, then G13/AS1 does not apply to the sanitary plumbing

TEXT: 2.1.1 Materials for sanitary plumbing systems using gravity flow shall comply with Table 1.
LRML: if(is(sanitaryPlumbingSystem.type, gravityFlow)), then(obligation(complyWith(sanitaryPlumbingSystem.material, nzbc_g13as1_t1)))
PARAPHRASE: If sanitary plumbing uses gravity flow, then the material of the sanitary plumbing shall comply with G13/AS1 Table 1.

TEXT: 3.9.3 Trench slope; These anti-scour blocks shall be: Spaced at: 7.5 m centres for trench slopes between 1 in 8 and 1 in 5.
LRML: if(and(has(trench, antiScourBlocks), greaterThanEqual(trench.slope, 1/8), lessThanEqual(trench.slope, 1/5))), then(obligation(equal(antiScourBlocks.spacing, 5 mCentres)))
PARAPHRASE: If the trench has anti-scour blocks and the trench slopes greater than or equal 1 in 8 and less than or equal 1 in 5, then these anti-scour blocks shall be spaced at 7.5 m centres.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Acceptable fill materials shown in Figure 13 are: Ordinary fill which may comprise any fill or excavated material.
LRML: if(is(fillMaterial, ordinaryFill)), then(permission(include(fillMaterial, or(fill, excavatedMaterial))))
PARAPHRASE: If the fill material is ordinary fill, then the fill material may include any fill or excavated material
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.1.2 Downpipes, gutters, roofing, fastenings and all adjoining components shall be of the same or a compatible material to eliminate the risk of galvanic corrosion.
LRML: if(and(define(component, x0),define(component, x1),is(x0.type, or(downpipe, gutter, roofing, fastening)),or(is(x1.type, or(downpipe, gutter, roofing, fastening)),adjoin(x0, x1)))), then(obligation(and(define(x0.material, x2),define(x1.material, x3),or(equal(x2, x3),and(inBetween(compatibility, and(x0, x1)),is(compatibility.type, galvanic))))))
PARAPHRASE: Given two components, if both componenst are downpipes, gutters, roofing, or fastenings, or if on component is downpipes, gutters, roofing, fastenings and the other component is adjoining, then the components materials shall be equal or have galvanic compatibility between them.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.2.1 Downpipes sized using Table 5 are acceptable. Other downpipes are acceptable provided their cross-sectional area is no less than that required by Table 5, and they permit passage of a 50 mm diameter sphere.
LRML: if(exist(downpipe)), then(or(obligation(asPer(downpipe.size, nzbc_e1as1_t5)), obligation(and(complyWith(downpipe.crossSectionalArea, nzbc_e1as1_t5),greaterThan(downpipe.diameter, 50 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: Downpipes shall have a size acoording to E1/AS1 Table 5. Otherwise the downpipe have a cross-sectional area complying with E1/AS1 Table 5 and a diameter greater than 50 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.2.1 Downpipes sized using Table 5 are acceptable. Other downpipes are acceptable provided their cross-sectional area is no less than that required by Table 5, and they permit passage of a 50 mm diameter sphere.
LRML: if(exist(downpipe)), then(or(obligation(asPer(downpipe.size, nzbc_e1as1_t5)), obligation(and(complyWith(downpipe.crossSectionalArea, nzbc_e1as1_t5),greaterThan(downpipe.diameter, 50 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If downpipes exist, then the downpipes shall have a size acoording to E1/AS1 Table 5. Otherwise the downpipe have a cross-sectional area complying with E1/AS1 Table 5 and a diameter greater than 50 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.3.1 Where thermal movement of downpipes cannot be accommodated by movement of the guttering, expansion joints shall be incorporated.
LRML: if(and(define(downpipe.thermalExpansion, x0), has(downpipe.guttering, movement), lessThan(x0, movement))), then(obligation(has(downpipe, expansionJoint)))
PARAPHRASE: If the downpipe's thermal expansion is greater than the movement of the downpipe's guttering, then the downpipe shall have expansion joints.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.1.1 Roof gutters shall discharge to downpipes that are sized as given in Paragraph 4.2.
LRML: if(exist(roofGutter)), then(obligation(and(into(roofGutter.discharge, downpipe),asPer(downpipe.size, 'nzbc_e1as1_4.2'))))
PARAPHRASE: If roof gutters exist, the roof gutters shall discharge to downpipes that are sized as given in E1/AS1 Paragraph 4.2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.0 Roof Gutters 5.1.4 In no case shall the cross-sectional area of any gutter be less than 4000 mm2.
LRML: if(exist(roofGutter)), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(roofGutter.crossSectionalArea, 4000 mm2)))
PARAPHRASE: If roof gutters exist, then the roof gutters shall have a cross-sectional area of no less than 4000 mm2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.2.1 Roof gutter materials shall comply with the standards stated in Table 6.
LRML: if(exist(roofGutter)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(roofGutter.material, standards),asPer(standards, nzbc_e1as1_t6))))
PARAPHRASE: If roof gutters exist, then the roof gutter's materials shall comply with the standards give in Table 6.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.3.1 Roof gutters shall fall to an outlet.
LRML: if(exist(roofGutter)), then(obligation(towards(gutter.fall, outlet)))
PARAPHRASE: If roof gutters exist, then the roof gutters shall fall to an outlet.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.0 Roof Gutters 5.5.2 External gutters do not require overflow outlets but shall be installed to ensure any overflow from the gutter spills to the outside of the building.
LRML: if(is(roofGutter.type, external)), then(and(permission(not(has(roofGutter, overflowOutlet))), obligation(towards(roofGutter.overflow, buildingExterior))))
PARAPHRASE: If roof gutters are external, then the roof gutters do not require overflow outlets but overflow from the gutter  shall go to the outside of the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Boundary fences and other site development must not significantly hamper the flow of surface water from the site.
LRML: if(exist(siteDevelopment)), then(prohibition(and(not(cause(siteDevelopment, obstruction)),towards(obstruction, surfaceWaterFlow))))
PARAPHRASE: If site development exists, the site development must not cause obstruction to the flow of surface water.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Boundary fences and other site development must not significantly hamper the flow of surface water from the site.
LRML: if(exist(siteDevelopment)), then(prohibition(and(not(cause(siteDevelopment, obstruction)),towards(obstruction, surfaceWaterFlow))))
PARAPHRASE: If site development exists, then the site development must not cause obstruction to the flow of surface water.

Other only?
and not vs not asn

TEXT: Where buildings are based on NZS 3604, but require specific engineering design input, the framing shall be of at least equivalent stiffness to the framing provisions of NZS 3604.
LRML: if(and(asPer(building.design, nzs_3604), requires(building.engineering, specificDesign))), then(obligation(and(has(building, framing), complyWith(framing.stiffness, nzs_3604))))
PARAPHRASE: If buildings are based on NZS 3604a and the building engineering require specific design, then the building framing stiffness shall comply with NZS 3604.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Water supply system 3.4.5 The selection of the appropriate backflow protection for the cross connection hazard is given in Table 2.
LRML: if(has(waterSupplySystem, crossConnectionHazard)), then(obligation(asPer(waterSupplySystem.backflowProtection, nzbc_g12as1_t2)))
PARAPHRASE: If a water supply system has cross connection hazard, then the water supply system's backflow protection is given in G12/AS1 Table 2.

TEXT: 3.5.4 Where any fixture or tank has more than one supply pipe, the air gap separation shall be the greater of 25 mm or twice the sum of the inlet pipe diameters and shall also comply with Paragraph 3.5.2.
LRML: if(or(and(has(fixture, inletPipe), greaterThan(count(fixture.inletPipe), 1)), and(has(tank, inletPipe), greaterThan(count(tank.inletPipe), 1)))), then(and(obligation(and(define(sum(inletPipes.diameter), x0), greaterThan(airGapSeparation, and(25 mm, '2 * x0')))),obligation(complyWith(airGapSeparation, 'nzbc_g12as1_3.5.2'))))
PARAPHRASE: If any fixture or tank has more than one inlet pipe, then the air gap separation shall be greater than 25 mm and greater than twice the sum of the inlet pipe diameters and shall also comply with G12/AS1 3.5.2.

TEXT: Piped Water Supply System 3.7.2 Reduced pressure zone devices shall be tested and verified as meeting the test requirements of AS 2845.3 or NZ backflow testing standard.
LRML: if(has(pipedWaterSupplySystem, reducedPressureZoneDevice)), then(obligation(and(asPer(reducedPressureZoneDevice.testing, or(as_2845_3, nzBackflowTestingStandard)),asPer(reducedPressureZoneDevice.verifying, or(as_2845_3, nzBackflowTestingStandard)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the piped water supply system has a reduced pressure zone device, then the reduced pressure zone device shall be tested and verified as of AS 2845.3 or NZ backflow testing standard.

TEXT: 5.1.1 To ensure the health and safety of people in the event of the water main supply being interrupted, buildings having the classification of Community Care (e.g. hospitals, old people's homes, prisons) shall be provided with cold water storage of no less than 50 litres per person.
LRML: if(is(building.classifiedUse, communityCare)), then(and(obligation(has(building, coldWaterStorage)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(coldWaterStorage.capacity, 50 l/person))))
PARAPHRASE: If buildings have the classification of Community Care, the building shall be provided with cold water storage with a capacity of no less than 50 litres per person.

TEXT: 5.1.1 To ensure the health and safety of people in the event of the water main supply being interrupted, buildings having the classification of Community Care (e.g. hospitals, old people's homes, prisons) shall be provided with cold water storage of no less than 50 litres per person.
LRML: if(is(building.classifiedUse, communityCare)), then(and(obligation(has(building, coldWaterStorage)), obligation(greaterThanEqual(coldWaterStorage.capacity, 50 l/person))))
PARAPHRASE: If buildings have the classification of Community Care, then the building shall be provided with cold water storage with a capacity of no less than 50 litres per person.

TEXT: Water tanks in roof spaces shall be located and supported as detailed in Figure 4.
LRML: if(within(waterTank, roofSpace)), then(and(obligation(asPer(waterTank.location, nzbc_g12as1_f4)), obligation(asPer(waterTank.support, nzbc_g12as1_f4))))
PARAPHRASE: If water tanks are in roof spaces, then the water tanks shall be located and supported as detailed in Figure 4.
COMMENTS:
roofSpace - uniclass: roofSurfaceSpaces
supported - ifc: supportType

TEXT: Piped water supply system; Covers shall be provided to: All tanks located in roof spaces to prevent condensation damaging building elements.
LRML: if(and(has(pipedWaterSupplySystem, waterTank), within(waterTank.location, roofSpace))), then(obligation(has(waterTank, cover)))
PARAPHRASE: If a piped water supply system has a water tank and the water tank is located in roof spaces, then the water tank shall have a cover.

TEXT: Structural support; The method illustrated in Figure 4 is acceptable for water tanks up to 150 litre capacity and the maximum height to breadth ratio of 1:1.
LRML: if(and(has(pipedWaterSupplySystem, waterTank), lessThanEqual(waterTank.capacity, 150 l),lessThanEqual(waterTank.heightToBreadthRatio, 1/1))), then(permission(asPer(waterTank.structuralSupport, nzbc_g12as1_f4)))
PARAPHRASE: If a water tank has up to 150 litre capacity and the maximum height to breadth ratio of 1:1, the sturctural support method illustrated in G12/AS1 Figure 4 is acceptable.

TEXT: Structural support; The method illustrated in Figure 4 is acceptable for water tanks up to 150 litre capacity and the maximum height to breadth ratio of 1:1.
LRML: if(and(has(pipedWaterSupplySystem, waterTank), lessThanEqual(waterTank.capacity, 150 l),lessThanEqual(waterTank.heightToBreadthRatio, 1/1))), then(permission(asPer(waterTank.structuralSupport, nzbc_g12as1_f4)))
PARAPHRASE: If a water tank has up to 150 litre capacity and the maximum height to breadth ratio of 1:1, then the structural support method illustrated in G12/AS1 Figure 4 is acceptable.

TEXT: 6.1.1 Water heaters shall comply with Table 5.
LRML: if(exist(waterHeater)), then(obligation(complyWith(waterHeater, nzbc_g12as1_t5)))
PARAPHRASE: If water heaters exist, then the water heaters shall comply with G12/AS1 Table 5.

TEXT: 6.10.1 NZS 4607 is an acceptable solution for unvented (valve vented) storage water heaters, but may exceed the performance criteria of NZBC G12.
LRML: if(is(storageWaterHeater.type, or(unvented, valveVented))), then(permission(complyWith(storageWaterHeater, nzs_4607)))
PARAPHRASE: If storage water heaters are type unvented or valve vented, then the storage water heaters may comply with NZS 4607.

TEXT: 6.12.1 The diameter of hot water supply pipes from storage water heaters and to sanitary fixtures shall be no less than those required by Table 4.
LRML: if(inBetween(hotWaterSupplyPipe, and(storageWaterHeater, sanitaryFixture))), then(obligation(asPer(hotWaterSupplyPipe.diameter, nzbc_g12as1_t4)))
PARAPHRASE: If hot water supply pipes are between storage water heaters and sanitary fixtures, then the diameter of the hot water supply pipes shall be according to G12/AS1 Table 4.

TEXT: Wet-back water heater 6.13.2 Copper pipework shall be used between the wet-back and the water tank.
LRML: if(and(is(waterHeater.type, wetback), inBetween(pipework, and(waterHeater, waterTank)))), then(obligation(is(pipework.material, copper)))
PARAPHRASE: If pipework is between the wet-back water heater and the water tank, then the pipe work material shall be copper.

TEXT: R-values for walls, roofs and ceilings shall be no less than: For roof or ceilings of any construction, 1.5.
LRML: if( or(exist(roof), exist(ceiling))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(roof.rValue, 1.5), greaterThanEqual(ceiling.rValue, 1.5))))
PARAPHRASE: If roofs or ceilings exist, the R-values of the roofs and ceilings shall be no less than 1.5.

TEXT: Piped water supply systems 2.1.1 Components of the water supply system shall not contaminate potable water.
LRML: if(has(pipedWaterSupplySystem, component)), then(prohibition(and(cause(component, contamination),is(contamination.type, potableWater))))
PARAPHRASE: If piped water supply system have components, then the components shall not cause contamination of potable water.

TEXT: Piped water supply systems 2.2.1 Pipe and pipe fitting materials shall comply with Table 1.
LRML: if(for(material, or(pipe, pipeFitting))), then(obligation(complyWith(material, nzbc_g12as1_t1)))
PARAPHRASE: If materials are for pipe and pipe fitting, then the materials shall comply with G12/AS1 Table 1.
COMMENTS: material can be property or object

TEXT: 3.4.1 Backflow protection shall be provided where it is possible for water or contaminants to backflow into the potable water supply system.
LRML: if(and(is(waterSupplySystem.type, potable),is(waterSupplySystem.backflow, or(water, contaminant)),is(waterSupplySystem.backflow, possible))), then(obligation(has(waterSupplySystem, backflowProtection)))
PARAPHRASE: If in a potable water supply system backflow of water or contaminants is possible, then the water supply system shall have backflow protection.

TEXT: 3.4.6 All backflow prevention devices must be testable in service to verify effective performance.
LRML: if(exist(backflowPreventionDevice)), then(obligation(is(backflowPreventionDevice, testableInService)))
PARAPHRASE: If backflow prevention devices exist, then the backflow prevention devices must be testable in service.

TEXT: Water tanks in roof spaces shall be located and supported as detailed in Figure 4.
LRML: if(within(waterTank, roofSpace)), then(and(obligation(asPer(waterTank.location, nzbc_g12as1_f4)), obligation(asPer(waterTank.support, nzbc_g12as1_f4))))
PARAPHRASE: If water tanks are in roof spaces, then the water tanks shall be located and supported as detailed in G12/AS1 Figure 4.
COMMENTS:
roofSpace - uniclass: roofSurfaceSpaces
supported - ifc: supportType

TEXT: Piped water supply system 5.2.4 Covers; Covers shall be provided to: a) Potable water tanks to prevent contamination and the entry of vermin.
LRML: if(has(pipedWaterSupplySystem, potableWaterTank)), then(obligation(has(potableWaterTank, cover)))
PARAPHRASE: If a piped water supply system has a potable water tank, then the potable water tank shall have a cover.

TEXT: Structural support; The method illustrated in Figure 4 is acceptable for water tanks up to 150 litre capacity and the maximum height to breadth ratio of 1:1.
LRML: if(and(has(pipedWaterSupplySystem, waterTank), lessThanEqual(waterTank.capacity, 150 l),lessThanEqual(waterTank.heightToBreadthRatio, 1/1))), then(permission(asPer(waterTank.structuralSupport, nzbc_g12as1_f4)))
PARAPHRASE: If a water tank has up to 150 litre capacity and the maximum height to breadth ratio of 1:1, the sturctural support method illustrated in Figure 4 is acceptable.

TEXT: 5.3.1 Pipe sizing; Pipes shall be sized: a) To achieve the flow rates given in Table 3, or b) Using the sizes given in Table 4.
LRML: if(exist(pipe)), then(or(obligation(and(cause(pipe.size, flowRate),asPer(flowRate, nzbc_g12as1_t3))), obligation(asPer(pipe.size, nzbc_g12as1_t4))))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes exist, then the pipes shall be sized to achieve the flow rates given in G12/AS1 Table 3, or the pipes shall use the sizes given in G12/AS1 Table 4.

TEXT: 6.10.1 NZS 4607 is an acceptable solution for unvented (valve vented) storage water heaters, but may exceed the performance criteria of NZBC G12.
LRML: if(is(storageWaterHeater.type, or(unvented, valveVented))), then(permission(complyWith(storageWaterHeater, nzs_4607)))
PARAPHRASE: If storage water heaters are type unvented or valve vented, then the storage water heaters may comply with NZS 4607.

TEXT: 6.10.1 NZS 4607 is an acceptable solution for unvented (valve vented) storage water heaters, but may exceed the performance criteria of NZBC G12.
LRML: if(is(storageWaterHeater.type, or(unvented, valveVented))), then(permission(complyWith(storageWaterHeater, nzs_4607)))
PARAPHRASE: If storage water heaters are type unvented or valve vented, then the storage water heaters may comply with NZS 4607.

TEXT: 6.13.1 Wet-back water heaters shall be: a) Connected only to open vented storage water heaters, or a water storage vessel (see Figure 15), and b) Made of copper.
LRML: if(is(waterHeater.type, wetback)), then(and(obligation(or(and(is(storageWaterHeater.type, openVented),connect(waterHeater, storageWaterHeater)),connect(waterHeater, waterStorageVessel))), obligation(is(waterHeater.material, copper))))
PARAPHRASE: If water heaters are type wet-back, then the water heaters shall be connected to open vented storage water heaters or a water storage vessel, and the water heaters shall be made of copper.

TEXT: 6.14.4 The water temperatures within flow and return circulating systems shall be maintained at not less than 60°C.
LRML: if(exist(flowAndReturnCirculatingSystem)), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(flowAndReturnCirculatingSystem.waterTemperature, 60 degC)))
PARAPHRASE: If flow and return circulating systems exist, then the flow and return circulating systems shall have water temperatures of not less than 60 degC.

TEXT: 6.3.2 Open vented storage water heaters shall have a vent pipe complying with Paragraph 6.8.
LRML: if(is(storageWaterHeater.type, openVented)), then(obligation(and(has(storageWaterHeater, ventilationPipe),complyWith(ventilationPipe, 'nzbc_g12as1_6.8'))))
PARAPHRASE: If storage water heaters are type open vented, then the storage water heaters shall have a ventilation pipe complying with G12/AS1 Paragraph 6.8.

TEXT: Water heater system 6.3.3 Valve vented (unvented) systems shall have: a) An expansion control valve b) A vacuum relief valve to prevent collapse of the storage water heater where it is not designed to withstand a full vacuum, and c) Valves complying with Table 6.
LRML: if(is(waterHeaterSystem.type, or(valveVented, unvented))), then(and(obligation(has(waterHeaterSystem, expansionControlValve)),obligation(or(has(waterHeaterSystem, vacuumReliefValve),for(waterHeaterSystem.design, withstandFullVacuum))),obligation(complyWith(waterHeaterSystem.valve, nzbc_g12as1_t6))))
PARAPHRASE: If water heater system are type valve vented or unvented, then the water heater system shall have: a) An expansion control valve b) A vacuum relief valve or a design to withstand a full vacuum, and c) Valves complying with G12/AS1 Table 6.

TEXT: Piped water supply systems 2.2.1 Pipe and pipe fitting materials shall comply with Table 1.
LRML: if(for(material, or(pipe, pipeFitting))), then(obligation(complyWith(material, nzbc_g12as1_t1)))
PARAPHRASE: If materials are for pipe and pipe fitting, then the materials shall comply with G12/AS1 Table 1.
COMMENTS: material can be property or object

TEXT: Piped Water Supply System 3.7.2 Double check valves shall be tested and verified as meeting the test requirements of AS 2845.3 or NZ backflow testing standard.
LRML: if(has(pipedWaterSupplySystem, doubleCheckValve)), then(obligation(and(asPer(doubleCheckValve.testing, or(as_2845_3, nzBackflowTestingStandard)),asPer(doubleCheckValve.verifying, or(as_2845_3, nzBackflowTestingStandard)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the piped water supply system has a double check valve, then the double check valve shall be tested and verified as of AS 2845.3 or NZ backflow testing standard.

TEXT: Piped Water Supply System 3.7.2 Pressure vacuum breakers shall be tested and verified as meeting the test requirements of AS 2845.3 or NZ backflow testing standard.
LRML: if(has(pipedWaterSupplySystem, pressureVacuumBreaker)), then(obligation(and(asPer(pressureVacuumBreaker.testing, or(as_2845_3, nzBackflowTestingStandard)),asPer(pressureVacuumBreaker.verifying, or(as_2845_3, nzBackflowTestingStandard)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the piped water supply system has a pressure vacuum breaker, then the pressure vacuum breaker shall be tested and verified as of AS 2845.3 or NZ backflow testing standard.

TEXT: Covers to water tanks shall be removable or shall contain a covered opening to allow access for inspection and maintenance. A minimum height clearance of 350 mm above the opening is necessary for easy access.
LRML: if(has(waterTank, cover)), then(or(obligation(is(cover, removable)), obligation(and(has(cover, coveredOpening),above(coveredOpening, heightClearance),greaterThanEqual(heightClearance, 350 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If water tanks have covers, then the cover shall be removable or shall have a covered opening. A minimum height clearance of 350 mm above the opening is necessary.

TEXT: Covers to water tanks shall be removable or shall contain a covered opening to allow access for inspection and maintenance. A minimum height clearance of 350 mm above the opening is necessary for easy access.
LRML: if(has(waterTank, cover)), then(or(obligation(is(cover, removable)), obligation(and(has(cover, coveredOpening),above(coveredOpening, heightClearance),greaterThanEqual(heightClearance, 350 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If water tanks have covers, then the cover shall be removable or shall have a covered opening. A minimum height clearance of 350 mm above the opening is necessary.

TEXT: 5.4.3 Provision shall be made for draining storage water heaters in accordance with Figure 7.
LRML: if(exist(storageWaterHeater)), then(obligation(asPer(storageWaterHeater.drain, nzbc_g12as1_f7)))
PARAPHRASE: If storage water heaters exist, then the storage water heaters shall be drained in accordance with G12/AS1 Figure 7.

TEXT: 6.10.1 NZS 4607 is an acceptable solution for unvented (valve vented) storage water heaters, but may exceed the performance criteria of NZBC G12.
LRML: if(is(storageWaterHeater.type, or(unvented, valveVented))), then(permission(complyWith(storageWaterHeater, nzs_4607)))
PARAPHRASE: If storage water heaters are type unvented or valve vented, then the storage water heaters may comply with NZS 4607.

TEXT: 6.11.1 Water heaters shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions.
LRML: if(exist(waterHeater)), then(obligation(asPer(waterHeater.installation, manufacturerInstruction)))
PARAPHRASE: If water heaters exist, then the water heaters shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions.

TEXT: 6.14.3 Legionella bacteria; Irrespective of whether a mixing device is installed, the storage water heater control thermostat shall be set at a temperature of not less than 60°C to prevent the growth of Legionella bacteria.
LRML: if(has(storageWaterHeater, controlThermostat)), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(controlThermostat.temperature, 60 degC)))
PARAPHRASE: If the storage water heater has a control thermostat, then the control thermostat shall be set at a temperature of not less than 60 degC.

TEXT: 6.2.2 Storage water heaters supplied by other than a water tank shall include a non-return valve as shown in Figures 7, 8, 9 and 10 to prevent the storage water heater emptying and hot water flowing into the cold water supply and thence from the cold water taps.
LRML: if(and(has(storageWaterHeater, waterSupply), not(by(waterSupply, waterTank)))), then(and(obligation(has(storageWaterHeater, nonReturnValve)), obligation(asPer(nonReturnValve, and(nzbc_g12as1_f7, nzbc_g12as1_f8, nzbc_g12as1_f9, nzbc_g12as1_f10)))))
PARAPHRASE: If storage water heaters have water supply not by a water tank, then the storage water heaters shall include a non-return valve as shown in G12/AS1 Figures 7, 8, 9 and 10.

TEXT: 6.6.4 The following valves shall have an energy rating greater than that of the energy sources heating the water: Temperature/pressure relief valve.
LRML: if(has(waterHeater, temperaturePressureReliefValve)), then(and(obligation(and(has(waterHeater, energySource), define(energySource.energyRating, x0), greaterThan(temperaturePressureReliefValve.energyRating, x0)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the water heater has a temperature pressure relief valve, then the valve shall have an energy rating greater than that of the energy sources of the water heater.

TEXT: 6.8.1 Vent pipes for open vented storage water heaters shall comply with the provisions of Paragraphs 6.8.2 and 6.8.3.
LRML: if(and(is(storageWaterHeater.type, openVented), has(storageWaterHeater, ventilationPipe))), then(obligation(complyWith(ventilationPipe, and('nzbc_g12as1_6.8.2', 'nzbc_g12as1_6.8.3'))))
PARAPHRASE: If an open vented storage water heater has a ventilation pipe, then the ventilation pipe shall comply with G12/AS1 6.8.2 and 6.8.3.

TEXT: 6.9.1 NZS 4603 is an acceptable solution for open vented low pressure storage water heaters, but may exceed the performance criteria of NZBC G12.
LRML: if(is(storageWaterHeater.type, and(openVented, lowPressure))), then(permission(complyWith(storageWaterHeater, nzs_4603)))
PARAPHRASE: If storage water heaters are type open vented and low pressure, then the storage water heaters may comply with NZS 4603.

TEXT: Pipes penetrating concrete or masonry elements shall be either wrapped with a flexible material, or passed through a sleeve or duct, to permit free movement for expansion and contraction.
LRML: if(and(into(pipe, element), is(element.material, or(concrete, masonry)))), then(or(obligation(and(has(pipe, wrapping),is(wrapping.material, flexible))), obligation(through(pipe, and(sleeve, duct)))))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes go into concrete or masonry elements, then the pipes shall be either wrapped with a flexible material, or passed through a sleeve or duct.

TEXT: Buildings with drained cavities and acoustic requirements, as specified in NZBC Clause G6, are outside the scope of this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(and(has(building, and(drainedCavity, acousticRequirement)), asPer(acousticRequirement, nzbc_g6))), then(not(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, building)))
PARAPHRASE: If a building has drained cavities and acoustic requirements, as specified in NZBC Clause G6, then E2/AS1 does not apply to the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Specific design for preventing the ingress of snow melt water is required when the open ground snow load Sg, as defined in NZS 3604, exceeds 1.0 kPa, and the roof is constructed in a way that is likely to cause a build-up of snow.
LRML: if(and(asPer(openGroundSnowLoad, nzs_3604), greaterThan(openGroundSnowLoad, 1 kPa), cause(roof.construction, snowBuildUp))), then(obligation(and(has(roof, specificDesign),for(specificDesign, ingressPrevention), for(ingressPrevention, snowMeltWater))))
PARAPHRASE: If the open ground snow load defined in NZS 3604 exceeds 1 kPa, and the roof construction can cause build-up of snow, then the roof shall have specific design for ingress prevention of snow melt water.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Construction moisture includes the moisture contained in: a) Timber products as a result of a treatment or manufacturing process, b) Green timber, and timber or other materials that have been exposed to the weather, and c) Concrete, mortar or plaster that is not completely cured.
LRML: if(or(and(include(product, moisture), is(product.material, timber), by(moisture, or(treatmentProcess, manufacturingProcess))), and(include(material, moisture), or(is(material, and(greenTimber, timber)), has(material, weatherExposure))), and(include(material, moisture), is(material, or(concrete, mortar, plaster)), not(is(material, completelyCured))))),then(has(building.construction, moisture))
PARAPHRASE: If timber products include moisture as a result of a treatment or manufacturing process, materials include moisture and materials are green timber and timber or other materials that have been exposed to the weather, and materials include moisture and are concrete, mortar or plaster and is not completely cured, then the building construction has moisture.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The maximum moisture contents shall be: For timber weatherboards, 20% at the time of painting,.
LRML: if(is(weatherboard.material, timber)), then(obligation(and(lessThanEqual(weatherboard.moistureContent, 20 percent),define(weatherboard.paintingTime, x0), has(weatherboard, moistureContent), equal(moistureContent.measurementTime, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If weatherboards are timber, then the weatherboards' maximum moisture contents shall be 20 percent with the weatherboards painting time being equal the moisture contents measurement time.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 10.3 Measuring moisture content 10.3.2 Concrete floors; Measurement shall be made in accordance with BRANZ Bulletin 330 Thin Flooring Materials using hygrometers calibrated to ASTM E 104 - 2002 Standard practice for maintaining constant relative humidity by means of aqueous solutions.
LRML: if(is(floor.material, concrete)), then(obligation(and(has(floor, moistureContent),asPer(moistureContent.measurement,branzBulletin_330),by(moistureContent.measurement,hygrometer),asPer(hygrometer.calibration,astm_e_104_2002))))
PARAPHRASE: If floors are concrete, then the measurement of the floor's moisture content shall be made in accordance with BRANZ Bulletin 330 using hygrometers with calibration to ASTM E 104 - 2002.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Cladding systems shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2.2 to E2.3.7.
LRML: if(exist(claddingSystem)), then(obligation(complyWith(claddingSystem, 'nzbc_e2_2 to nzbc_e2_3.7'))))
PARAPHRASE: Cladding systems shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2 2 to NZBC E2.3.7.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Cladding systems shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2.2 to E2.3.7, and the provisions of this Acceptable Solution are acceptable means of achieving this.
LRML: if(complyWith(claddingSystem, nzbc_e2as1)), then(complyWith(claddingSystem, 'nzbc_e2_2 to nzbc_e2_3.7'))
PARAPHRASE: If caldding systems comply with E2/AS1, the cladding systems complies with NZBC E2 2 to NZBC E2 3.7.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Materials used to construct the building envelope shall be designed as a complete cladding system rather than as separate items.
LRML: if(include(building.envelope, material)), then(and(obligation(is(material.design, claddingSystem)), prohibition(is(material.design, item))))
PARAPHRASE: If the building envelope includes a material, the material shall be designed as a cladding system rather than as items.
COMMENTS:
completeCladdingSystem? separateItem?
reduced to claddingSystem, and item?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Finish colours for flush-finished fibre cement sheet and EIFS shall have a reflectivity of 40% or more when measured in accordance with ASTM C1549.
LRML: if(or(and(is(fibreCementSheet.type, flushFinished), has(fibreCementSheet, finishColour)), has(eifs, finishColour))), then(obligation(and(has(finishColour, reflectivity),greaterThanEqual(reflectivity,40 percent),asPer(reflectivity.measurement,astm_c1549))))
PARAPHRASE: If flush-finished fibre cement sheet or EIFS have finish colours, then the finish colour shall have a reflectivity of 40 percent or more when the reflectivity measurement is in accordance with ASTM C1549.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Maintenance shall be carried out as necessary (Rule 2.5.0.2) to achieve the required durability of materials, components and junctions.
LRML: if(or(requires(building.material, durability), requires(building.component, durability), requires(building.junction, durability))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.maintenance, 'nzbc_e2as1_2.5.0.2')))
PARAPHRASE: If the buildings materials, components or junctions require durability, then the building shall have maintenance complying to E2AS1 Rule 2.5.0.2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Maintenance shall be carried out as necessary (Rule 2.5.0.2) to achieve the required durability of materials, components and junctions.
LRML: if(or(requires(building.material, durability), requires(building.component, durability), requires(building.junction, durability))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.maintenance, 'nzbc_e2as1_2.5.0.2')))
PARAPHRASE: If the buildings materials, components or junctions require durability, then the building shall have maintenance complying with E2AS1 Rule 2.5.0.2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 6.14.3 Legionella bacteria; Irrespective of whether a mixing device is installed, the storage water heater control thermostat shall be set at a temperature of not less than 60°C to prevent the growth of Legionella bacteria.
LRML: if(has(storageWaterHeater, controlThermostat)), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(controlThermostat.temperature, 60 degC)))
PARAPHRASE: The storage water heater control thermostat shall be set at a temperature of not less than 60 degC.

TEXT: 6.2.1 Storage water heaters shall be supplied with cold water at a pressure not exceeding their working pressure by means of a: a) Water tank, b) Pressure reducing valve, c) Pressure limiting valve, or d) Mains pressure supply.
LRML: if(exist(storageWaterHeater)), then(obligation(and(has(storageWaterHeater, coldWaterSupply),define(storageWaterHeater.workingPressure, x0),lessThanEqual(coldWaterSupply.pressure, x0),by(coldWaterSupply, or(waterTank, pressureReducingValve, pressureLimitingValve, mainsPressureSupply)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a storage water heater exists, then the storage water heater shall have cold water supply at a pressure not exceeding the storage water heaters working pressure by means of a: a) Water tank, b) Pressure reducing valve, c) Pressure limiting valve, or d) Mains pressure supply.

TEXT: 6.3.1 Electric and gas storage water heaters shall have their temperature controlled by a thermostat on each heating unit.
LRML: if(is(storageWaterHeater.type, or(electric, gas))), then(obligation(loop(forEach(storageWaterHeater.heatingUnit),has(heatingUnit, thermostat))))
PARAPHRASE: If storage water heaters are of type electric or gas, then for each heating unit the storage water heaters shall have a thermostat.

TEXT: 6.3.1 Electric and gas storage water heaters shall have their temperature controlled by a thermostat on each heating unit.
LRML: if(is(storageWaterHeater.type, or(electric, gas))), then(obligation(loop(forEach(storageWaterHeater.heatingUnit),has(heatingUnit, thermostat))))
PARAPHRASE: If storage water heaters are of type electric or gas, then for each heating unit of the storage water heater, the storage water heaters shall have a thermostat.

TEXT: Water heater system 6.3.3 Valve vented (unvented) systems shall have: a) An expansion control valve b) A vacuum relief valve to prevent collapse of the storage water heater where it is not designed to withstand a full vacuum, and c) Valves complying with Table 6.
LRML: if(is(waterHeaterSystem.type, or(valveVented, unvented))), then(and(obligation(has(waterHeaterSystem, expansionControlValve)),obligation(or(has(waterHeaterSystem, vacuumReliefValve),for(waterHeaterSystem.design, withstandFullVacuum))),obligation(complyWith(waterHeaterSystem.valve, nzbc_g12as1_t6))))
PARAPHRASE: If water heater system are type valve vented or unvented, then the water heater system shall have: a) An expansion control valve b) A vacuum relief valve or a design to withstand a full vacuum, and c) Valves complying with G12/AS1 Table 6.

TEXT: 6.4.2 Free outlet (push through) water heaters shall have a relief valve.
LRML: if(is(waterHeater.type, or(freeOutlet, pushThrough))), then(obligation(has(waterHeater, reliefValve)))
PARAPHRASE: If water heaters are type free outlet or push through, then the water heaters shall have a relief valve.

TEXT: 6.5.2 Energy cut-off devices shall be designed to: a) Be reset manually.
LRML: if(exist(energyCutoffDevice)), then(obligation(has(energyCutoffDevice.design, manualReset)))
PARAPHRASE: If energy cut-off devices exist, then the energy cut-off devices shall be designed to have a manual reset.

TEXT: 6.1 Water heaters 6.5.2 Energy cut-off devices shall be designed to: b) Disconnect the energy supply before the water temperature exceeds 95°C.
LRML: if(has(waterHeater, energyCutoffDevice)), then(obligation(and(has(energyCutoffDevice.design, energySupplyDisconnect),define(greaterThan(waterHeater.waterTemperature, 90 degC), x0),before(x0, energySupplyDisconnect))))
PARAPHRASE: If a water heater has an energy cut-off device, then the energy cut-off device shall be designed to: b) Disconnect the energy supply before the waterHeater's water temperature exceeds 95 degC.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
energySupplyDisconnect - omniclass: electricalDisconnect (Different meaning though)
Nested function in define.

TEXT: 6.6.4 The following valves shall have an energy rating greater than that of the energy sources heating the water: Temperature/pressure relief valve.
LRML: if(has(waterHeater, temperaturePressureReliefValve)), then(and(obligation(and(has(waterHeater, energySource), define(energySource.energyRating, x0), greaterThan(temperaturePressureReliefValve.energyRating, x0)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the water heater has a temperature pressure relief valve, then the valve shall have an energy rating greater than that of the energy sources of the water heater.

TEXT: Pressure relief valves shall be located no further than 1 metre from the storage water heater.
LRML: if(and(has(storageWaterHeater, pressureReliefValve))), then( obligation(and(define(storageWaterHeater.location, x0),lessThanEqual(pressureReliefValve.location, 'x0 + 1 m'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the storage water heater hast a pressure relief valves, then the pressure relief valves shall be located no further than 1 metre from the storage water heater's location.

TEXT: 7.0.1 Water supply systems shall be installed to comply with the durability requirements of NZBC B2.
LRML: if(exist(waterSupplySystem)), then(obligation(complyWith(waterSupplySystem.durability, nzbc_b2)))
PARAPHRASE: If water supply systems exist, then the durability of water supply systems shall comply with NZBC B2.
COMMENTS: RULE: comply wiht durability requirements -> durability-property comply with...

TEXT: Pipes penetrating concrete or masonry elements shall be either wrapped with a flexible material, or passed through a sleeve or duct, to permit free movement for expansion and contraction.
LRML: if(and(into(pipe, element), is(element.material, or(concrete, masonry)))), then(or(obligation(and(has(pipe, wrapping),is(wrapping.material, flexible))), obligation(through(pipe, and(sleeve, duct)))))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes go into concrete or masonry elements, then the pipes shall be either wrapped with a flexible material, or passed through a sleeve or duct.

TEXT: Piped water supply system; 7.4.1 An acceptable method of installing uPVC pipe is given in NZS 7643.
LRML: if(is(pipe.material, uPvc)), then(permission(asPer(pipe.installation, nzs_7643)))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes are uPVC, then the installation of the pipe may follow NZS 7643.

TEXT: Piped water supply system; 7.4.1 An acceptable method of installing uPVC pipe is given in NZS 7643.
LRML: if(is(pipe.material, uPvc)), then(permission(asPer(pipe.installation, nzs_7643)))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes are material uPVC, then the installation of the pipe may follow NZS 7643.

TEXT: 8.4.13 Stopends; The top ends of profiled metal roof cladding shall have stopends as shown in Figure 49 for trapezoidal and trough profile metal roof cladding, where: a) The roof pitch is less than 25°, or b) The building is in a High/Very High/Extra High wind zone.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding.profile, or(trapezoidal, trough)), or(lessThan(roof.pitch, 25 deg), is(building.windZone, or(high, veryHigh, extraHigh))))), then(obligation(and(has(cladding.topEnd, stopend), asPer(stopend, nzbc_e2as1_f49))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof cladding is profiled metal and the roof cladding have trapezoidal and trough profile and either the roof pitch is less than 25 deg, or the building is in a High, Very High, or Extra High wind zone, then the roof claddings top ends shall have stopends as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 49.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Hidden, valley and internal gutters shall be in accordance with Paragraph 8.1.6.
LRML: if(and(is(gutter.type, or(hidden, valley, internal)))), then(obligation(asPer(gutter, 'nzbc_e2as1_8.1.6')))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are type hidden, valley or internal, then the guttters shall be in accordance with E2/AS1 Paragraph 8.1.6.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Parallel hidden gutters shall be as shown in Figure 50 and Paragraph 8.1.6.2.
LRML: if(and(is(gutter.type, hidden), is(gutter, parallel))), then(obligation(asPer(gutter, and(nzbc_e2as1_f50, 'nzbc_e2as1_8.1.6.2'))))
PARAPHRASE: If hidden gutters are parallel, then the gutter shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 50 and Paragraph 8.1.6.2.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; The edge of roofing penetrations over 200 mm wide shall be supported in either direction with additional framing as shown in Figure 21.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), has(roofCladding, penetration),greaterThan(penetration.width, 200 mm))), then(obligation(and(has(penetration, edge),loop(forEach(edge.direction),is(edge.support, framing)),asPer(framing, nzbc_e2as1_f21))))
PARAPHRASE: If profiled metal roof cladings have penetrations and the penetration is over 200 mm wide, then the edge of the penetration shall have for each direction framing as support, the framing shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 21.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.17 Roof penetrations; Roof penetrations shall be flashed as follows: a) Pipe penetrations up to 85 mm shall be flashed using an EPDM boot flashing as shown in Figure 53, b) Pipe penetrations up to 500 mm shall be flashed using a soaker flashing and EPDM boot flashing as shown in Figure 54, c) Rectangular penetrations up to 1200 mm wide shall be flashed using a soaker type flashing as shown in Figure 55.
LRML: if(and(is(roof.type, profiledMetal), has(roof, penetration))), then(or(obligation(and(is(penetration.type,pipe),lessThanEqual(penetration.width,85 mm),has(penetration,flashing),is(flashing.type, epdmBoot),asPer(flashing, nzbc_e2as1_f53))), obligation(and(is(penetration.type,pipe),lessThanEqual(penetration.width,500 mm),has(penetration,flashing),is(flashing.type,and(soaker,epdmBoot)),asPer(flashing, nzbc_e2as1_f54))), obligation(and(is(penetration.type,rectangular),lessThanEqual(penetration.width,1200 mm),has(penetration,flashing),is(flashing.type,soaker),asPer(flashing, nzbc_e2as1_f55)))))
PARAPHRASE: If Profiled Metal Roof Cladding have penetrations, then the penetrations shall be either for pipes and the penetrations shall be up to 85 mm wide shall and have an EPDM boot flashing as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 53, or the penetrations shall be for pipes and the penetration is up to 500 mm wide shall have a soaker flashing and EPDM boot flashing as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 54, or the enetrations shall be rectangular and up to 1200 mm wide and have a soaker type flashing as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 55.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding; Materials for the manufacture of profiled steel roof cladding shall: a) have a BMT of 0.4 mm minimum b) be grade G550, or G300 for rolled, crimped, or trough profile roofing c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding.material, steel))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(steel.baseMetalThickness, 0.4 mm)), obligation(or(and(is(steel.grade,g550),not(is(roofCladding.profile,and(rolled,crimped,trough)))),and(is(steel.grade,g300),is(roofCladding.profile,or(rolled,crimped,trough))))), obligation(and(for(steel.corrosionProtection, exposureZone),asPer(exposureZone, nzbc_e2as1_t20)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the material of profiled metal roof claddings is steel, then the steel shall have a base metal thickness of 0.4 mm minimum. The steel shall be grade G550 and not for rolled, crimped, or trough profile roof cladding, or the steel shall be grade G300 and rolled, crimped, or trough profile roof cladding. The steel shall be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in E2/AS1 Table 20.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.3.3 Aluminium; Aluminium for the manufacture of profiled aluminium roofing shall comply with AS/NZS 1734, and be a minimum: a) Base metal thickness (BMT) of 0.7 mm, b) 5000 series.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), is(roofCladding.material, aluminium))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(cladding.material,nzs_1734),greaterThanEqual(aluminium.baseMetalThickness,0.7 mm),greaterThanEqual(aluminium.grade, 5000 series))))
PARAPHRASE: If the material of profiled metal roof claddings is aluminium, then the aluminium shall comply with NZS 1734, and be a minimum base metal thickness of 0.7 mm, and minimum 5000 series.

TEXT: Piped water supply system; 7.4.1 An acceptable method of installing uPVC pipe is given in NZS 7643.
LRML: if(is(pipe.material, uPvc)), then(permission(asPer(pipe.installation, nzs_7643)))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes are material uPVC, then the installation of the pipe may follow NZS 7643.

TEXT: 1.1.1 Where a building has not been specifically designed to support a solar water heater, this Acceptable Solution can be used for the support and fixing of a solar collector on buildings that meet the structural requirements specified in any one of the following: • NZS 3604: 1990 • NZS 3604: 1999 • NZS 3604: 2011 • NZS 4203 • AS/NZS 1170: Parts 0, 1, 2, 3 and NZS 1170: Part 5. But only when all of the following requirements are met: a) the weight of solar collector, including frames, fittings, and heat transfer fluid, has a combined weight of no more than 22 kg per square metre (based on the gross area of the solar collector), and b) the hot water storage tank is not installed on or above the roof.
LRML: if(and(not(for(building.specificDesign, solarWaterHeater)), on(solarCollector.installation, building), complyWith(building.structure, or(nzs_3604_1990, nzs_3604_1999, nzs_3604_2011, nzs_4203, nzs_1170_0, nzs_1170_1, nzs_1170_2, nzs_1170_3, nzs_1170_5)),include(solarCollector.combinedWeight, and(frame, fitting, heatTransferFluid)), define(solarCollector.grossArea, x0),lessThanEqual(solarCollector.combinedWeight, '22 kg/m2 * x0'), not(on(hotWaterStorageVessel.installation, roof)), not(above(hotWaterStorageVessel.installation, roof)))), then(and(permission(complyWith(solarCollector.support, nzbc_g12as2)), permission(complyWith(solarCollector.fixing, nzbc_g12as2))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building has not been specifically designed for a solar water heater, but the solar collector is on the building and the buildings structure complies with NZS 3604: 1990, NZS 3604: 1999, NZS 3604: 2011, NZS 4203, AS/NZS 1170: Parts 0, 1, 2, 3 or NZS 1170: Part 5. And only if the weight of solar collector, including frames, fittings, and heat transfer fluid, is no more than 22 kg per square metre (based on the gross area of the solar collector), and if the hot water storage tank is not installed on or above the roof. Then the support and fixing of a solar collector may comply with G12/AS2.

TEXT: 3.1.1 Solar water heaters must comply with AS/NZS 2712.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(obligation(complyWith(solarWaterHeater, nzs_2712)))
PARAPHRASE: If solar water heaters exist, then solar water heaters must comply with AS/NZS 2712.

TEXT: 3.3.1 Solar water heaters must have a minimum of 50 litres of hot water storage per square metre of collector area.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(and(obligation(and(has(solarWaterHeater, hotWaterStorage),has(solarWaterHeater, solarCollector),define(solarCollector.area, x0), greaterThanEqual(hotWaterStorage.capacity, '50 l * x0')))))
PARAPHRASE: If a solar water heater exists, then the solar water heater must have a minimum of 50 litres of hot water storage per square metre of collector area.
COMMENTS:
COMPLEX
ORDER
collector - buvo: solarCollector
infer capacity - : ifc property: waterStorageCapacity
is(x0.unit, m2) vs x0 m2

TEXT: 3.4.1 Storage tanks in solar water heaters must have operating and safety devices that meet the requirements of G12/AS1 Paragraph 6.
LRML: if(within(storageTank, solarWaterHeater)), then(obligation(and(has(storageTank, and(operatingDevice, safetyDevice)),complyWith(operatingDevice, nzbc_g12as1_6),complyWith(safetyDevice, nzbc_g12as1_6))))
PARAPHRASE: If storage tanks are in solar water heaters, then the storage tank must have operating and safety devices that meet the requirements of G12/AS1 Paragraph 6.
COMMENTS:
Should in really be dropped? Could there be a external storage tank?
SPLIT device?

TEXT: Where the solar water heater stores potable water and is used as a pre-heater for an instantaneous water heater, either: a) the hot water storage tank connected to the solar collector must be fitted with supplementary heating and a controller operating to meet the conditions outlined in Paragraph 3.5.1, b) the instantaneous water heater must heat all water passing through it to not less than 70°C.
