LRML: if(and(has(solarWaterHeater, potableWaterStorage), is(solarWaterHeater, preHeater), for(preHeater, instantaneousWaterHeater))), then(or(obligation(and(connect(solarWaterHeater.solarCollector, hotWaterStorageTank),has(hotWaterStorageTank, and(supplementaryHeating, controller)),complyWith(controller, 'nzbc_g12as2_3.5.1'))), obligation(and(through(water, instantaneousWaterHeater),greaterThanEqual(water.temperature, 70 degC)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the solar water heater has potable water storage and is used as a pre-heater for an instantaneous water heater, then either the hot water storage tank connected to the solar collector must be fitted with supplementary heating and a controller operating to meet the conditions outlined in G12/AS2 Paragraph 3.5.1, or the water passing through instantaneous water heater must be heated to not less than 70 degC.

TEXT: 3.0 Solar Water Heater Requirements; For protection from freezing, collectors installed in climate zones 1 and 2 (as shown in Figure 1) must: pass the level 1 test described in AS/NZS 2712 Appendix E, or have an automatic drain-down system.
LRML: if(is(solarCollector.location, or(climateZone_1, climateZone_2))), then(or(obligation(and(test(solarCollector, level_1_test),asPer(level_1_test, nzs_2712_appendixE))), obligation(has(solarCollector, automaticDraindownSystem))))
PARAPHRASE: If the solar collectors are installed in climate zones 1 and 2, then the solar collectors must pass the level 1 test described in NZS 2712 Appendix E, or have an automatic drain-down system.

TEXT: 3.0 Solar Water Heater Requirements; For protection from freezing, collectors installed in climate zones 1 and 2 (as shown in Figure 1) must: pass the level 1 test described in AS/NZS 2712 Appendix E, or have an automatic drain-down system.
LRML: if(is(solarCollector.location, or(climateZone_1, climateZone_2))), then(or(obligation(and(test(solarCollector, level_1_test),asPer(level_1_test, nzs_2712_appendixE))), obligation(has(solarCollector, automaticDraindownSystem))))
PARAPHRASE: If the solar collectors are installed in climate zones 1 and 2, then the solar collector must either pass the level 1 test described in NZS 2712 Appendix E, or the solar collector must have an automatic drain-down system.

TEXT: The extent and nature of necessary maintenance is dependent on the: a) Type of cladding or components used, b) Position of cladding or components on the building, c) Geographical location of the building, and d) Specific site conditions.
LRML: if(has(building, maintenance)), then(obligation(and(has(maintenance.extent,dependency),has(maintenance.nature,dependency),is(dependency,or(claddingType,componentType)),is(dependency,or(claddingPosition,componentPosition)),is(dependency,and(buildingLocation,siteCondition)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the building has maintainance, then the extent and nature of the maintenance is dependent on the: a) Type of cladding or components, b) Position of cladding or components, c) location of the building, and d) site conditions.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: A risk assessment of the proposed design shall be carried out using a building envelope risk matrix. This allows the risks related to various features to be aggregated, resulting in a risk score for the design.
LRML: if(is(design, proposed)), then(obligation(and(has(design,riskAssessment),include(riskAssessment,buildingEnvelopeRiskMatrix),include(buildingEnvelopeRiskMatrix,riskAggregation),for(riskAggregation,features),is(riskAssessment.result,riskScore),has(design,riskScore))))
PARAPHRASE: If design is proposed, then the design shall have a risk assessment using a building envelope risk matrix. The building envelope risk matrix allows risk aggregation for various features with the result being a risk score of the design.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
Second sentence could be deleted?
for/of?
Process...
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Table 2 sets out the risk matrix that shall be used to define the risk score for a building within the scope of this Acceptable Solution. A risk score is calculated for each external face of the building. Claddings are then selected from Table 3 according to the risk scores.
LRML: if(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, building)), then(obligation(and(asPer(riskMatrix, nzbc_e2as1_t2),loop(forEach(building.exteriorFace), and(asPer(exteriorFace.riskScore, riskMatrix),asPer(exteriorFace.cladding, and(riskScore, nzbc_e2as1_t3)))))))
PARAPHRASE: If E2/AS1 applies to a building, then the risk matrix shall be as in E2/AS1 Table 2, and the for each exterior face the risk score shall be calculated according to risk matrix and the exterior face's claddings shall be according to the risk score and E2/AS1 Table 3.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Cladding system 4.1 Materials for flashings; Acceptable materials for flashing junctions and penetrations are described in Paragraph 4.3.
LRML: if(has(flashing, or(junction, penetration))), then(obligation(and(asPer(junction.material,'nzbc_e2_as1_4.3.0.1'),asPer(penetration.material,'nzbc_e2_as1_4.3.0.1'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the flashing has junctions or penetrations, then the junction and penetration materials shall be as described in E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.3.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Flashing materials shall take into account the following factors: a) The requirements of NZBC Clause B2 Durability, b) The environment where the building is located, c) The specific conditions of use, and d) Consideration of the surrounding materials.
LRML: if(exist(flashing)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(flashing.material,nzbc_b2),asPer(flashing.material,and(buildingEnvironment,conditionOfUse,surroundingMaterial)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a flashing exists, then the flashing materials shall comply with NZBC Clause B2, and be according to the building environment, the conditions of use, surrounding materials.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Flashing materials shall be selected according to the relevant exposure conditions as defined in Table 20 to minimise corrosion.
LRML: if(exist(flashing)), then(obligation(and(asPer(flashing.material,exposure),asPer(exposure,nzbc_e2as1_t20))))
PARAPHRASE: If a flashing exists, then the flashing materials shall be according to the exposure in E2/AS1 Table 20.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.3 Acceptable flashing materials; Tables 20, 21 and 22 shall be used to assess suitability of flashing materials for the required durability.
LRML: if(requires(flashing.material, durability)), then(obligation(complyWith(flashing.material, and(nzbc_e2as1_t20, nzbc_e2as1_t21, nzbc_e2as1_t22))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashing materials require durability, then the flashing material shall be as per E2/AS1 Tables 20, 21 and 22.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: uPVC flashings shall be a minimum of 0.75 mm thick. uPVC flashings shall comply with the requirements of the following Clauses of AS/NZS 4256: Part 2: a) Clause 9.2 Impact resistance, b) Clause 9.3 Tensile strength, and c)  Clause 9.4 Colourfastness and impact resistance following ultraviolet light exposure.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, uPvc)), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(flashing.thickness,0.75 mm),complyWith(flashing,and('nzs_4256_2_9.2','nzs_4256_2_9.3','nzs_4256_2_9.4')))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are made of uPVC, then the flashing shall be a minimum of 0.75 mm thick and comply with NZS 4256 Part 2 Clause 9.2, 9.3, and 9.4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: uPVC flashings shall have a finish colour with a reflectance of 40% or more, as outlined in Paragraph 2.4.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, uPvc)), then(obligation(and(has(flashing,finishColour),greaterThanEqual(finishColour.reflectance,40 percent),asPer(finishColour.reflectance, 'nzbc_e2as1_2.4'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the flashing material is uPVC, then the flashing shall have a finish colour with a reflectance of 40 percent or more and the finish colour reflectance shall be as outlined in E2/AS1 Paragraph 2.4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Flexible flashing tape shall comply with Parts 3.2 and 4 of ICBO Acceptance Criteria AC148, shall be compatible with adjacent building wall underlay or roof underlay, and be used only in fully concealed applications.
LRML: if(is(flashingTape, flexible)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(flashingTape,and('icbo_ac148_3.2',icbo_ac148_4)),has(adjacentBuilding,or(wallUnderlay,roofUnderlay)),towards(flashingTape.compatibility,or(wallUnderlay,roofUnderlay)),is(flashingTape.application,fullyConcealed))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashing tape is flexible, then the flashing tape shall comply with ICBO AC148 Parts 3.2 and 4, the flashing tape shall be compatible with adjacent building wall underlay or roof underlay, and the flashing tape shall be used only in fully concealed applications.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Solar water heater; This Acceptable Solution meets the requirements of NZBC Clauses B1, B2, E2, G12 and H1.
LRML: if(complyWith(solarWaterHeater, nzbc_g12as2)), then(complyWith(solarWaterHeater, and(nzbc_b1, nzbc_b2, nzbc_e2, nzbc_g12, nzbc_h1)))
PARAPHRASE: If a solar water heater complies with G12/AS2, then it complies with NZBC Clauses B1, B2, E2, G12 and H1.

TEXT: Solar water heater; This Acceptable Solution meets the requirements of NZBC Clauses B1, B2, E2, G12 and H1.
LRML: if(complyWith(solarWaterHeater, nzbc_g12as2)), then(complyWith(solarWaterHeater, and(nzbc_b1, nzbc_b2, nzbc_e2, nzbc_g12, nzbc_h1)))
PARAPHRASE: If a solar water heater complies with G12/AS2, then the solar water heater complies with NZBC Clauses B1, B2, E2, G12 and H1.

TEXT: 2.1.1 All material used to install the solar water heater must: a) meet the durability requirements of NZBC Clause B2, and b) be suitable for their use, location and environment as shown in Table 1, and c) be compatible with adjoining materials as shown in Table 2, and d) be compatible with materials subject to run-off as shown in Table 3 (except as described in Paragraph 2.1.2).
LRML: if(has(solarWaterHeater.installation, material)), then(and(obligation(complyWith(material.durability, nzbc_b2)),obligation(and(for(material.suitability, and(use, location, environment)),asPer(material.suitability,  nzbc_g12as2_t1))),obligation(and(define(solarWaterHeater.material, x0),adjoin(x0, material),inBetween(compatibility, and(x0, material)),asPer(compatibility,  nzbc_g12as2_t2))),obligation(and(define(solarWaterHeater.material, x0),adjoin(x0, material),exposedTo(material, runOff),inBetween(compatibility, and(x0, material)),asPer(compatibility,  nzbc_g12as2_t3),not(asPer(compatibility, 'nzbc_g12as2_2.1.2'))))))
PARAPHRASE: If material is used to install the solar water heater, then the material must: a) meet the durability requirements of NZBC Clause B2, and b) be suitable for their use, location and environment as shown in G12/AS2 Table 1, and c) be compatible with adjoining materials as shown in G12/AS2 Table 2, and d) be compatible with materials subject to run-off as shown in G12/AS2 Table 3 and not as described in G12/AS2 Paragraph 2.1.2.

TEXT: Solar Water Heaters 2.1.4 Table 2 shows that galvanized fixings must be used rather than stainless steel when in contact with galvanized cladding and zinc-aluminium-magnesium (combinations) coated cladding. (This includes mounting brackets and straps.).
LRML: if(and(has(solarWaterHeater, fixing), adjoin(fixing, or(galvanisedCladding, zincAluminiumMagnesiumCoatedCladding)))), then(obligation(and(is(fixing.material, galvanised),asPer(fixing.material, nzbc_g12a2_t2))))
PARAPHRASE: If the solar water heater's fixings are in contact with galvanized cladding and zinc-aluminium-magnesium coated cladding, then galvanized fixings shall be used as per G12/AS2 Table 2.

TEXT: 3.1.1 Solar water heaters must comply with AS/NZS 2712.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(obligation(complyWith(solarWaterHeater, nzs_2712)))
PARAPHRASE: If solar water heaters exist, then solar water heaters must comply with AS/NZS 2712.

TEXT: 3.0 Solar Water Heater Requirements; For protection from freezing, collectors installed in climate zones 1 and 2 (as shown in Figure 1) must: pass the level 1 test described in AS/NZS 2712 Appendix E, or have an automatic drain-down system.
LRML: if(is(solarCollector.location, or(climateZone_1, climateZone_2))), then(or(obligation(and(test(solarCollector, level_1_test),asPer(level_1_test, nzs_2712_appendixE))), obligation(has(solarCollector, automaticDraindownSystem))))
PARAPHRASE: If the solar collectors are installed in climate zones 1 and 2, then the solar collectors must pass the level 1 test described in NZS 2712 Appendix E, or have an automatic drain-down system.

TEXT: 4.2.1 Solar collectors must face within +/- 90 degrees of geographic north (ie between east and west) to satisfy the requirements of NZBC Clause H1.3.4(a).
LRML: if(exist(solarCollector)), then(obligation(within(solarCollector.orientation,' +/- 90 degreesOfGeographicalNorth')))
PARAPHRASE: If solar collectors exist, then the solar collectors must face within +/- 90 degrees of geographic north.

TEXT: 4.2.1 Solar collectors must face within +/- 90 degrees of geographic north (ie between east and west) to satisfy the requirements of NZBC Clause H1.3.4(a).
LRML: if(exist(solarCollector)), then(obligation(within(solarCollector.orientation,' +/- 90 degreesOfGeographicalNorth')))
PARAPHRASE: If solar collectors exist, then the solar collectors must face within +/- 90 degrees of geographic north.

TEXT: 5.0.1 Solar water heaters must be installed in accordance with the requirements of AS/NZS 3500 Part 4, unless modified by this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(or(obligation(complyWith(solarWaterHeater.installation, nzs_3500_4)), obligation(by(nzs_3500_4.modification, nzbc_g12as2))))
PARAPHRASE: If solar water heaters exist, then the solar water heaters must be installed in accordance with the requirements of AS/NZS 3500 Part 4, unless AS/NZS 3500 Part 4 is modified by G12/AS2.

TEXT: 5.0.1 Solar water heaters must be installed in accordance with the requirements of AS/NZS 3500 Part 4, unless modified by this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(or(obligation(complyWith(solarWaterHeater.installation, nzs_3500_4)), obligation(by(nzs_3500_4.modification, nzbc_g12as2))))
PARAPHRASE: If solar water heaters exist, then the solar water heaters must be installed in accordance with the requirements of AS/NZS 3500 Part 4, unless AS/NZS 3500 Part 4 is modified by G12/AS2.

TEXT: 5.0.1 Solar water heaters must be installed in accordance with the requirements of AS/NZS 3500 Part 4, unless modified by this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(or(obligation(complyWith(solarWaterHeater.installation, nzs_3500_4)), obligation(by(nzs_3500_4.modification, nzbc_g12as2))))
PARAPHRASE: If solar water heaters exist, then the solar water heaters must either be installed in accordance with the requirements of NZS 3500 Part 4, or NZS 3500 Part 4 is modified by G12/AS2.

TEXT: 5.0.1 Solar water heaters must be installed in accordance with the requirements of AS/NZS 3500 Part 4, unless modified by this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(or(obligation(complyWith(solarWaterHeater.installation, nzs_3500_4)), obligation(by(nzs_3500_4.modification, nzbc_g12as2))))
PARAPHRASE: If solar water heaters exist, then the solar water heaters must either be installed in accordance with the requirements of NZS 3500 Part 4, or NZS 3500 Part 4 is modified by G12/AS2.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.4 Profiles; Profiles covered in this Acceptable Solution are shown in Figure 38, and consist of: a) Corrugated – curved with a crest height of 16.5 mm minimum, b) Trapezoidal – symmetrical or asymmetrical with a minimum crest height of 19 mm, and for asymmetrical a flat or lightly profiled pan width of 210 mm maximum between crests, and c) Trough profile – with vertical ribs at a minimum height of 38 mm, and flat or lightly profiled pans of 210 mm maximum between crests.
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), asPer(roofCladding.profile, nzbc_e2as1_f38),or(and(is(roofCladding.profile, and(corrugated, curved)), has(roofCladding.profile, crest), greaterThanEqual(crest.height, 16.5 mm)), and(is(roofCladding.profile, and(trapezoidal, symmetrical)), has(roofCladding.profile, crest), greaterThanEqual(crest.height, 19 mm)), and(is(roofCladding.profile, and(trapezoidal, asymmetrical)), has(roofCladding.profile, crest), greaterThanEqual(crest.height, 19 mm), has(roofCladding.profile, pan), is(pan, or(flat, lightlyProfiled)), inBetween(pan.width, crests), lessThanEqual(pan.width, 210 mm)), and(is(roofCladding.profile, trough), has(roofCladding.profile, rib), is(rib.orientation, vertical),greaterThanEqual(rib.height, 38 mm), has(roofCladding.profile, pan), is(pan, or(flat, lightlyProfiled)), inBetween(pan.width, crests), lessThanEqual(pan.width, 210 mm))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, roofCladding))
PARAPHRASE: If Profiled Metal Roof Cladding have profiles as shown in  E2/AS1 Figure 38, and either the roof cladding profile is either corrugated and curved with a crest height of 16.5 mm minimum, or the roof cladding profile is trapezoidal and symmetrical with a minimum crest height of 19 mm or the roof cladding profile is trapezoidal and asymmetrical with a minimum crest height of 19 mm and have a flat or lightly profiled pan width of 210 mm maximum between crests, or the roof cladding profile is trough with vertically oriented ribs at a minimum height of 38 mm, and flat or lightly profiled pans of 210 mm maximum between crests, then E2/AS1 applies to the roof cladding.

TEXT: 8.4 Profiled Metal Roof Cladding 8.4.5 Roof pitch; For roofs up to 18 metres in length without end laps, pitches shall be: a) Corrugated – not less than 8° (1:7). b) Trapezoidal – not less than: i) 4° (1:14) where the crest height is less than 27 mm, or ii) 3° (1:20) where the crest height is 27 mm or higher. c) Trough profile – not less than 3° (1:20).
LRML: if(and(is(roofCladding.type, profiledMetal), lessThanEqual(roof.length, 18 m), not(include(roof.length, endLap)))), then(or(obligation(and(is(roofCladding.profile,corrugated),greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,8 deg))), obligation(and(is(roofCladding.profile,trapezoidal),greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,4 deg),has(roofCladding,crest),lessThan(crest.height,27 mm))), obligation(and(is(roofCladding.profile,trapezoidal),greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,3 deg),has(roofCladding,crest),greaterThanEqual(crest.height,27 mm))), obligation(and(is(roofCladding.profile,trough),greaterThanEqual(roof.pitch,3 deg)))))
PARAPHRASE: If roofs are up to 18 metres in length and the roof length does not include end laps, then either roof claddings shall be corrugated and roof pitches shall be not less than 8 deg, or roof cladding profile shall be trapezoidal and roof pitches shall be not less than 4 deg and the roof cladding's crest height is less than 27 mm, or roof cladding profile shall be trapezoidal and roof pitches shall be not less than 3 deg and the roof cladding's crest height is 27 mm or higher, or roof cladding profile shall be trough and roof pitches shall be not less than 3 deg.

TEXT: Closed-in construction spaces under membrane roofs and decks require adequate ventilation to prevent the accumulation of moisture under the membrane.
LRML: if(and(is(space.type, closedInConstruction), below(space, or(roof, deck)), is(roof.type, membrane),is(deck.type, membrane))), then(obligation(prevent(space.ventilation, moistureAccumulation)))
PARAPHRASE: If closed-in construction spaces are under membrane roofs and decks, then the space shall have ventilation to prevent the accumulation of moisture.

TEXT: Membranes composed of butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates 8.5.5 Installation 8.5.5.1 Plywood Substrates must be dry when membranes are applied. The plywood and timber substructure must be a maximum moisture content of 20% when a membrane is adhered.
LRML: if(and(is(membrane.material, or(butyl, epdm)), above(membrane.installation, substrate), is(substrate.material, plywood))), then(obligation(and(lessThanEqual(substructure.moistureContent,20 percent),is(substructure.material, or(timber, plywood)),before(substructure.moistureContent, installation))))
PARAPHRASE: If membranes are of butyl or epdm and installed over substrate of plywood, then the plywood and timber substructure must be a maximum moisture content of 20 percent before the membrane is installed.

TEXT: 9.1 General; Wall claddings shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2.3.2 to E2.3.7, and comply with the provisions of Paragraph 9.1.1 to Paragraph 9.9.
LRML: if(exist(wallCladding)), then(obligation(complyWith(wallCladding, and('nzbc_e2_3.2 to nzbc_e2_3.7', 'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.1 to nzbc_e2as1_9.9'))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings exist, then the wall cladding shall comply with NZBC E2 3.2 to E2 3.7, and E2/AS1 Paragraph 9.1.1 to Paragraph 9.9.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; Clearances to roof claddings and decks shall be minimum 35 mm – refer to Table 7 and Figure 18.
LRML: if(exist(wallCladding)), then(obligation(and(towards(wallCladding.clearance, and(roofCladding, deck)),greaterThanEqual(wallCladding.clearance,35 mm),asPer(wallCladding.clearance,and(nzbc_e2as1_t7,nzbc_e2as1_f18)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the wall cladding exists, then the clearance of the wall cladding to the roof cladding or the deck shall be minimum 35 mm as in E2/AS1 Table 7 and Figure 18.

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution requires external walls to have barriers to airflow.
LRML: if(and(is(wall.type, external))), then(obligation(and(has(wall, barrier),against(barrier, airflow))))
PARAPHRASE: If a wall is external, then the wall shall have barriers to airflow.

TEXT: 3.0 Solar Water Heater Requirements; Collectors installed in climate zone 3 (as shown in Figure 1) must: a) pass the level 2 test described in AS/NZS 2712 Appendix E, or have an automatic drain-down system.
LRML: if(is(solarCollector.location, climateZone_3)), then(or(obligation(and(test(solarCollector, level_2_test),asPer(level_2_test, nzs_2712_appendixE))), obligation(has(solarCollector, automaticDraindownSystem))))
PARAPHRASE: If solar collectors are installed in climate zone 3, then the solar collectors must pass the level 2 test described in NZS 2712 Appendix E, or have an automatic drain-down system.

TEXT: 3.0 Solar Water Heater Requirements; Collectors installed in climate zone 3 (as shown in Figure 1) must: a) pass the level 2 test described in AS/NZS 2712 Appendix E, or have an automatic drain-down system.
LRML: if(is(solarCollector.location, climateZone_3)), then(or(obligation(and(test(solarCollector, level_2_test),asPer(level_2_test, nzs_2712_appendixE))), obligation(has(solarCollector, automaticDraindownSystem))))
PARAPHRASE: If solar collectors are installed in climate zone 3, then the solar collector must either pass the level 2 test described in NZS 2712 Appendix E, or solar collector must have an automatic drain-down system.

TEXT: 4.2.2 Solar collectors must be inclined at an angle within +/- 20 degrees of the angle of latitude (from the horizontal) to satisfy the requirements of NZBC Clause H1.3.4(a).
LRML: if(exist(solarCollector)), then(obligation(equal(solarCollector.inclinationAngle, '+/- 20 degreesOfTheAngleOfLatitude')))
PARAPHRASE: If solar collectors exist, then the solar collectors must be inclined at an angle within +/- 20 degrees of the angle of latitude.

TEXT: 5.0.1 Solar water heaters must be installed in accordance with the requirements of AS/NZS 3500 Part 4, unless modified by this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(exist(solarWaterHeater)), then(or(obligation(complyWith(solarWaterHeater.installation, nzs_3500_4)), obligation(by(nzs_3500_4.modification, nzbc_g12as2))))
PARAPHRASE: If solar water heaters exist, then the solar water heaters must either be installed in accordance with the requirements of NZS 3500 Part 4, or NZS 3500 Part 4 is modified by G12/AS2.

TEXT: 3.1.1 Discharge points from sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances shall have a water trap to prevent foul air from the plumbing system entering the building.
LRML: if(or(has(sanitaryFixture, dischargePoint),has(sanitaryAppliance, dischargePoint))),then(obligation(has(dischargePoint, waterTrap)))
PARAPHRASE: If sanitary fixtures or sanitary appliances have discharge points, then the discharge points shall have a water trap.

TEXT: 3.1.2 Water traps shall be: a) Removable, b) Able to be dismantled, or c) Fitted with a cleaning eye.
LRML: if(exist(waterTrap)), then(obligation(or(is(waterTrap, or(removable, dismantleable)),has(waterTrap, cleaningEye))))
PARAPHRASE: If water traps exist, then water traps shall be removable, able to be dismantled, or have a cleaning eye.

TEXT: 3.1.2 Water traps shall be: a) Removable, b) Able to be dismantled, or c) Fitted with a cleaning eye.
LRML: if(exist(waterTrap)), then(obligation(or(is(waterTrap, or(removable, dismantleable)),has(waterTrap, cleaningEye))))
PARAPHRASE: If water traps exist, then water traps shall be either removable, able to be dismantled, or have a cleaning eye.

TEXT: 3.2.1 Under normal operating conditions, fixture traps shall retain a water seal depth of not less than 25 mm (see Figure 1).
LRML: if(is(fixtureTrap.operatingCondition, normal)), then(obligation(and(has(fixtureTrap, waterSeal),greaterThanEqual(waterSeal.depth, 25 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the fixture trap's operating condition is normal, then the fixture trap shall retain a water seal depth of not less than 25 mm.

TEXT: 3.2.2 The diameter of the water trap shall be not less than that given in Table 2.
LRML: if(exist(waterTrap)), then(obligation(asPer(waterTrap.diameter, nzbc_g13as1_t2)))
PARAPHRASE: If a water trap exists, then the diameter of the water trap shall be not less than that given in G13/AS1 Table 2.

TEXT: A floor waste shall: Be trapped, discharge 50 mm above the grating of a gully trap.
LRML: if(exist(floorWaste)), then(and(obligation(has(floorWaste,gullyTrap)),obligation(and(has(gullyTrap,grating),above(floorWaste.discharge,grating),inBetween(distance, and(discharge, grating)),equal(distance,50 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a floor waste exists, then the floor waste shall have a gully trap and the floor waste shall have discharge 50 mm above the grating of a gully trap.

TEXT: Floor waste pipes may be combined to form a floor waste stack and shall have a diameter not less than that given in Table 3 (see Figure 3).
LRML: if(has(floorWaste, pipes) ), then(and(permission(is(connect(pipes), floorWasteStack)), obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(pipe.diameter,value),asPer(value,nzbc_g13as1_t3)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the floor waste has pipes, then the pipes may be combined to form a floor waste stack and shall have a diameter not less than the values given in G13/AS1 Table 3.

TEXT: Individual floor waste pipes connected to a floor waste stack need not be vented (see Figure 3).
LRML: if(within(pipe, floorWasteStack)), then(permission(not(has(pipe, ventilation))))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes are in a floor waste stack, the the pipes need not be vented.

TEXT: All trap charging systems shall incorporate backflow prevention in accordance with G12/AS1.
LRML: if(exist(trapChargingSystem)), then(obligation(and(has(trapChargingSystem,backflowPrevention),complyWith(backflowPrevention,nzbc_g12as1))))
PARAPHRASE: If a trap charging system exists, then the trap charging system shall incorporate backflow prevention in accordance with G12/AS1.

TEXT: 4.4.1 The gradient of discharge pipes shall be not less than that required in Table 4 for the relevant discharge unit loading.
LRML: if(exist(dischargePipe)), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(dischargePipe.gradient,value),asPer(value,nzbc_g13as1_t4))))
PARAPHRASE: If discharge pipes exist, then the gradient of discharge pipes shall be not less than that required in Table 4.

TEXT: 4.5.1 Waste water fixture discharge pipes shall discharge either to: a) A gully trap, in accordance with Figure 5 of G13/AS1 and Figure 3 of G13/AS2, or b) A discharge stack as in Paragraph 4.7 and Figures 7 and 8.
LRML: if(has(wasteWaterFixture, dischargePipe)), then(or(obligation(and(towards(dischargePipe.discharge,gullyTrap),asPer(dischargePipe.discharge,and(nzbc_g13as1_f5,nzbc_g13as2_f3)))),obligation(and(towards(dischargePipe.discharge,dischargeStack),asPer(dischargePipe.discharge,and('nzbc_g13as1_4.7',nzbc_g13as1_f7, nzbc_g13as1_f8))))))
PARAPHRASE: If waste water fixture have discharge pipes, then the discharge pipes shall discharge either to: a) A gully trap, in accordance with Figure 5 of G13/AS1 and Figure 3 of G13/AS2, or b) A discharge stack as in G13/AS1 Paragraph 4.7 and Figures 7 and 8.

TEXT: Galvanized steel flashings shall: a) have a BMT of 0.55 mm minimum b) be grade G550, or G300 for rolled or crimped flashings c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.material, steel), is(steel.type, galvanised))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(flashing.baseMetalThickness, 0.55 mm)), obligation(or(equal(flashing.grade, g550),and(equal(flashing.grade, g300), is(flashing.type, or(rolled, crimped))))),obligation(and(asPer(flashing.corrosionProtection,intendedExposureZone),asPer(intendedExposureZone,nzbc_e2as1_t20)))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are made of galvanized steel, then the flashing shall have a base metal thickness of 0.55 mm minimum. Flashing shall be grade G550, or G300 for rolled or crimped flashings. The flashing's corrosion protection shall be according to the intended exposure zone as shown in E2/AS1 Table 20.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Aluminium-zinc-magnesium coated steel shall: a) have a BMT of 0.55 mm minimum b) be grade G550, or G300 for curved or crimped flashings c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.material, steel), is(steel.coating, aluminiumZincMagnesium))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(flashing.baseMetalThickness, 0.55 mm)), obligation(or(equal(flashing.grade, g550),and(equal(flashing.grade, g300), is(flashing.type, or(rolled, crimped))))),obligation(and(asPer(flashing.corrosionProtection,intendedExposureZone),asPer(intendedExposureZone,nzbc_e2as1_t20)))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are made of steel with aluminium-zinc-magnesium coating, then the flashing shall have a base metal thickness of 0.55 mm minimum. Flashing shall be grade G550, or G300 for rolled or crimped flashings. The flashing's corrosion protection shall be according to the intended exposure zone as shown in E2/AS1 Table 20.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Lead sheet flashings shall: a) Comply with AS 1804, and b) Have a minimum unit mass of 17 kg/m2.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, leadSheet)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(flashing,as_1804),greaterThanEqual(flashing.unitMass,17 kg/m2))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are of material lead sheet, then the flashings shall comply with AS 1804, and the flashings shall have a minimum unit mass of 17 kg/m2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Exposed bottom edges of flashings shall be folded to a kick-out or a bird's beak as shown in Figure 5.
LRML: if(and(has(flashing.bottomEdge, exposure))), then(obligation(and(is(flashing.bottomEdge, or(kickOut, birdBeak),asPer(flashing.bottomEdge, nzbc_e2as1_f5))))
PARAPHRASE: If the bottom edges of flashings is eposed, then the bottom edge shall be a kick-out or a bird's beak and the bottome edge shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 5.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Exposed bottom edges of flashings shall be folded to a kick-out or a bird's beak as shown in Figure 5.
LRML: if(and(has(flashing.bottomEdge, exposure))), then(obligation(and(is(flashing.bottomEdge, or(kickOut, birdBeak),asPer(flashing.bottomEdge, nzbc_e2as1_f5))))
PARAPHRASE: If the bottom edges of flashings is eposed, then the bottom edge shall be a kick-out or a bird's beak and the bottome edge shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 5.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: For Low, Medium, High and Very High wind zones, flashing upstands shall have either: 1) A hem or hook to Figure 5, with upstand dimensions as shown throughout the document, or 2) No hooks or hems, and flashing upstand dimensions increased by 25 mm beyond those shown.
LRML: if(and(is(windZone.type, or(low, medium, high, veryHigh)), has(flashing, upstand))), then(or(obligation(and(has(upstand,or(hem,hook)),asPer(hem, nzbc_e2as1_f5),asPer(hook, nzbc_e2as1_f5),asPer(upstand.dimension,nzbc_e2as1))), obligation(and(not(has(upstand,and(hem,hook))),greaterThanEqual(upstand.dimension, 'value + 25 mm'),asPer(value,nzbc_e2as1)))))
PARAPHRASE: If wind zones types are low, Medium, High or Very High and the flashing has upstands, then the upstand shall have a hem or hook to E2/AS1 Figure 5 with upstand dimensions as shown in E2/AS1, or the upstands shall have no hooks or hems, and flashing upstand dimensions shall be 25 mm greater than the values shown in E2/AS1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Where a turn-down to the cover flashing for profiled metal claddings is required, use: b) A notched turn-down or soft edge flashing for trapezoidal profiles with rib height not exceeding 30 mm and/or rib centres not exceeding 200 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.material, profiledMetal), has(cladding, flashing), is(flashing.type, cover), requires(flashing, turnDown), is(profiledMetal.type, trapezoidal), or(lessThanEqual(profiledMetal.ribHeight, 30 mm), lessThanEqual(profiledMetal.ribCentres, 200 mm)))), then(obligation(or(is(turnDown.type, notched),is(flashing.edge, soft))))
PARAPHRASE: If cladding material is profiled metal, the cladding has cover flashings, the flashing required a turn-down, and the profiled metal is trapezoidal and the profiled metal rib height is not exceeding 30 mm or profiled metal rib centres not exceeding 200 mm, then the turn-down shall be notched or flashing edges soft.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Overlap with roof claddings: Apron flashing cover over metal roofing: Parallel flashing: The apron shall: iii) for profiled metal roof cladding, overhang flashing a minimum 10 mm clear of crest and maximum 5 mm clear of trough as shown in Figure 47.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.type, apron), above(flashing, metalRoofing), is(flashing, parallel),has(metalRoofing, cladding),is(cladding.material, profiledMetal))), then(obligation(and(has(cladding, crest),towards(flashing.clearance, crest),greaterThanEqual(flashing.clearance, 10 mm),has(cladding, trough),towards(flashing.clearance,trough),lessThanEqual(flashing.clearance, 5 mm),asPer(clearance, nzbc_e2as1_f47))))
PARAPHRASE: If apron flashings are over metal roofing, the flashings are parallel, and the metal roofing has profiled metal roof cladding, then the flashing shall have a minimum 10 mm clearance to the cladding crest and maximum 5 mm clearance to the cladding trough as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 47.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.0.1 Materials for drainage pipes and joints shall comply with the appropriate standards shown in Table 1.
LRML: if(exist(drainPipe)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(drainPipe.material,nzbc_g13as2_t1),has(drainPipe, joint),complyWith(joint.material,nzbc_g13as2_t1))))
PARAPHRASE: If drain pipes exists, then materials for drain pipes and drain pipe joints shall comply with G13/AS2 Table 1.

TEXT: Below ground 2.1 Fill materials 2.1.1 Fill materials, as shown in Figure 7, shall be: a) Bedding material of clean granular non-cohesive material with a maximum particle size of 20 mm, b) Selected fill of fine-grained soil or granular material that is free from topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm, or c) Ordinary fill of excavated material.
LRML: if(exist(fillMaterial)), then(or(obligation(and(is(fillMaterial,beddingMaterial),is(beddingMaterial, and(clean,granular,nonCohesive)),lessThanEqual(beddingMaterial.particleSize, 20 mm))), obligation(and(is(fillMaterial,selectedFill),is(selectedFill,or(fineGrainedSoil,granularMaterial)),not(include(selectedFill,or(topsoil,rubbish))),lessThanEqual(selectedFill.particleSize,20 mm))), obligation(and(is(fillMaterial, ordinaryFill),is(ordinaryFill, excavatedMaterial)))))
PARAPHRASE: If fill materials exists, then fill materials shall be either: a) Bedding material that is clean, granular and non-cohesive and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm, b) Selected fill of fine-grained soil or granular material that does not include topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm, or c) Ordinary fill of excavated material.

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall have (see Figures 2 and 3): The overflow level of the gully dish no less than: 25 mm above paved surfaces.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(define(pavedSurface, x0),greaterThanEqual(gullyTrap.overflowLevel, 'x0 + 25 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If gully traps exists, then gully traps shall have a overflow level if no less than: 25 mm above paved surfaces.

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall have (see Figures 2 and 3): The overflow level of the gully dish no less than: 25 mm above paved surfaces.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(define(pavedSurface, x0),greaterThanEqual(gullyTrap.overflowLevel, 'x0 + 25 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If gully traps exists, then gully traps shall have a overflow level if no less than: 25 mm above paved surfaces.

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall have (see Figures 2 and 3): A minimum outlet pipe diameter of 100 mm.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(has(gullyTrap,outletPipe),greaterThanEqual(outletPipe.diameter, 100 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If gully traps exists, then gully traps shall have a outlet pipe with diameter with minimum of 100 mm.

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall have (see Figures 2 and 3): A minimum outlet pipe diameter of 100 mm.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(has(gullyTrap,outletPipe),greaterThanEqual(outletPipe.diameter, 100 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If gully traps exists, then gully traps shall have a outlet pipe with diameter with minimum of 100 mm.

TEXT: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall have (see Figures 2 and 3): At least one discharge pipe discharging to the gully trap to avoid waterseal evaporation,.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(obligation(towards(dischargePipe,gullyTrap)))
PARAPHRASE: If gully traps exists, then there shall be a discharge pipe towards the gully trap.

TEXT: 3.3.2 In order to provide overflow relief for the drainage system, every building used for Housing shall be provided with at least one gully trap which shall:.
LRML: if(is(building.classifiedUse, housing)), then(obligation(has(building, gullyTrap)))
PARAPHRASE: If a building classified use is housing, then the building shall have a gully trap

TEXT: 3.3.2 Gully trap which shall: a) Be positioned so that the top of the gully dish is no less than 150 mm below the overflow level of the lowest sanitary fixture served by the drainage system.
LRML: if(exist(gullyTrap)), then(obligation(and(define(topOf(gullyTrap.gullyDish), x0), for(gullyTrap, sanitaryFixture), is(min(sanitaryFixture.elevation), true), define(sanitaryFixture.overflowLevel, x1), greaterThanEqual(x0, 'x1 + 150 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If gully traps exists, then gully traps shall have the top of their gully dish no less than 150 mm below the overflow level of the sanitary fixture serving the gullyTrap with the lowest elevation.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
ERROR: Should be only for housing gullytraps
How to represent lowest sanitary fixture.

TEXT: 3.4.5 Grease traps located outside a building shall be configured as shown in Figure 4.
LRML: if(outside(greaseTrap.location, building)), then(obligation(asPer(greaseTrap.configuration, nzbc_g13as2_f4)))
PARAPHRASE: If grease traps are located outside a building, then the grease trap shall be configured as shown in G13/AS2 Figure 4.

TEXT: Other types of grease trap such as those that separate or digest grease must be approved by the network utility operator as required by G14/VM1 1.2.
LRML: if(is(greaseTrap.type, other)), then(obligation(and(approve(networkUtilityOperator, greaseTrap),complyWith(greaseTrap, 'nzbc_g14vm1_1.2'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the grease trap is type other, then the grease trap must be approved by the network utility operator as required by G14/VM1 1.2.

TEXT: 3.5.1 Drains shall: a) Be laid at an even grade, and b) Have no obstructions to flow.
LRML: if(exist(drain)), then(and(obligation(is(drain.grade, even)), obligation(not(has(drain.flow, obstruction)))))
PARAPHRASE: If drains exists, then drains shall be laid at an even grade, annd have no obstructions to flow.

TEXT: 3.5.2 Drains shall be installed at the maximum practicable gradient.
LRML: if(exist(drain)), then(obligation(is(drain.gradient, maximumPracticable)))
PARAPHRASE: If drains exists, then drains shall be installed at the maximum practicable gradient.

TEXT: 3.6.2 Drains shall have a diameter of not less than 80 mm where the drain serves only waste water fixtures.
LRML: if(and(for(drain, wasteWaterFixture),not(for(drain, fixture)),not(is(fixture, wasteWaterFixture)))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(drain.diameter, 80 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: IF the drain serves waste water fixtures and not fixtures that are not waste water fixtures, then drains shall have a diameter of not less than 80 mm.

TEXT: 4.2.2 Branch drain vents shall be sized in accordance with Table 6 in G13/AS1.
LRML: if(and(is(drain.type, branch), has(drain, ventilation))), then(obligation(complyWith(ventilation.size, nzbc_g13as1_t6)))
PARAPHRASE: If a branch drain has ventilation, then the ventilation shall be sized in accordance with Table 6 in G13/AS1.

TEXT: Barrier to airflow for external walls shall be in form of: a) Interior linings with all joints stopped for wind zones up to Very High, or b) Rigid underlays (and drained cavities) for buildings in Extra High wind zones - refer to Paragraph 9.1.7.2 c) Where walls are not lined, such as attic spaces at gable ends, an air barrier complying with Table 23, fixed to framing prior to fixing cladding or cavity battens d) For attached garages, underlays to Paragraph 9.1.3.4.
LRML: if(and(is(wall.type, external), has(wall, barrier),against(barrier, airflow))), then(or(obligation(and(by(barrier, interiorLining),is(interiorLining.joint,stopped),lessThanEqual(building.windZone, veryHigh))), obligation(and(by(barrier,and(underlay,drainedCavity)),is(underlay,rigid),is(building.windZone,extraHigh),asPer(underlay, 'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.7.2'),asPer(underlay, 'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.7.2'))), obligation(and(not(has(wall, lining)),is(barrier.type, airBarrier),complyWith(barrier, nzbc_e2as1_t23),has(wall,framing),towards(barrier.fixing,framing),before(barrier.fixing, and(cladding, cavityBatten)))), obligation(and(partOf(wall,garage),is(garage,attached),by(barrier, underlay),asPer(underlay, 'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.3.4')))))
PARAPHRASE: If an external wall has a barrier against airflow, then either the barrier shall be in form of interior linings with all joints stopped for buildings in wind zones up to Very High, or the barrier shall be by rigid underlays and drained cavities for buildings in Extra High wind zones - refer to E2/AS1 Paragraph 9.1.7.2, or the walls are not lined and the barrier shall be an air barrier complying with E2/AS1 Table 23, fixed to framing prior to claddings or cavity battens, or if the wall is part of an attached garages, the barrier shall be by underlays to Paragraph 9.1.3.4.

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; 9.7 Fibre Cement Sheet; Install sheets with: Paint seals to all sheet edges and cut edges, including 100 mm across back face from each edge.
LRML: if(and( is(wallCladding.type, sheet), is(sheet.material, fibreCement))), then(obligation(and(has(sheet.edge,seal),is(seal.type,paint),adjacent(sheet.backFace, edge),has(sheet.backFace, paint),equal(paint.width,100 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the wall cladding is type fibre cement sheets, then the sheets edges shall have paint seals and the back face adjacent to the edge shall have paint for 100 mm width.
COMMENTS:
foreach
sheet edge and cut edge -> sheet.edge

TEXT: Water heater system 6.3.3 Valve vented (unvented) systems shall have: a) An expansion control valve b) A vacuum relief valve to prevent collapse of the storage water heater where it is not designed to withstand a full vacuum, and c) Valves complying with Table 6.
LRML: if(is(waterHeaterSystem.type, or(valveVented, unvented))), then(and(obligation(has(waterHeaterSystem, expansionControlValve)),obligation(or(has(waterHeaterSystem, vacuumReliefValve),for(waterHeaterSystem.design, withstandFullVacuum))),obligation(complyWith(waterHeaterSystem.valve, nzbc_g12as1_t6))))
PARAPHRASE: If water heater system are type valve vented or unvented, then the water heater system shall have: a) An expansion control valve b) A vacuum relief valve or a design to withstand a full vacuum, and c) Valves complying with G12/AS1 Table 6.

TEXT: 6.5.1 Electric thermostats and energy cut-off devices shall comply with NZS 6214 or AS 1308.
LRML: if(is(device.type, or(electricThermostat, energyCutoffDevice))), then(obligation(complyWith(device, or(nzs_6214, as_1308))))
PARAPHRASE: If a device is an electric thermostats or an energy cut-off devices, then it shall comply with NZS 6214 or AS 1308.

TEXT: 6.1 Water heaters 6.5.2 Energy cut-off devices shall be designed to: b) Disconnect the energy supply before the water temperature exceeds 95°C.
LRML: if(has(waterHeater, energyCutoffDevice)), then(obligation(and(has(energyCutoffDevice.design, energySupplyDisconnect),define(greaterThan(waterHeater.waterTemperature, 90 degC), x0),before(x0, energySupplyDisconnect))))
PARAPHRASE: If a water heater has an energy cut-off device, then the energy cut-off device shall be designed to: b) Disconnect the energy supply before the waterHeater's water temperature exceeds 95 degC.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
energySupplyDisconnect - omniclass: electricalDisconnect (Different meaning though)
Nested function in define.

TEXT: 6.6.2 Pressure relief valves and expansion control valves shall have: a) A flow rate capacity of no less than the rate of cold water supply, and b) A maximum pressure rating of no more than the working pressure of the hot water storage vessel.
LRML: if(is(valve.type, or(pressureRelief, expansionControl))), then(and(obligation(and(define(coldWaterSupply.flowRate, x0),greaterThanEqual(valve.flowRateCapacity, x0))), obligation(and(define(hotWaterStorageVessel.workingPressure, x0), lessThanEqual(valve.maximumPressureRating, x0)))))
PARAPHRASE: If valves are pressure relief valves or expansion control valves, then the valves shall have: a) A flow rate capacity of no less than the flow rate of the cold water supply, and b) A maximum pressure rating of no more than the working pressure of the hot water storage vessel.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
RULE: If multiple related exist(object) and no other criteria or references needed, then find parent object + type.

TEXT: 6.6.3 Expansion control valves shall have a pressure rating of no less than that of the water supply pressure to the storage water heater, but less than the pressure rating of the relief valve.
LRML: if(has(storageWaterHeater, expansionControlValve)), then(and(obligation(and(has(storageWaterHeater, waterSupply),define(waterSupply.pressure, x0),greaterThanEqual(expansionControlValve.pressureRating, x0))), obligation(and(has(storageWaterHeater, reliefValve),define(reliefValve.pressureRating, x1),lessThan(expansionControlValve.pressureRating, x1)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a storage water heater has an expansion control valves, then the expansion control valves shall have a pressure rating of no less than that of the water supply pressure to the storage water heater, but the expansion control valves shall have a pressure rating less than the pressure rating of the relief valve.

TEXT: 6.6.4 The following valves shall have an energy rating greater than that of the energy sources heating the water: Temperature/pressure relief valve.
LRML: if(has(waterHeater, temperaturePressureReliefValve)), then(obligation(and(has(waterHeater, energySource), define(energySource.energyRating, x0), greaterThan(temperaturePressureReliefValve.energyRating, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If the water heater has a temperature pressure relief valve, then the valve shall have an energy rating greater than that of the energy sources of the water heater.

TEXT: 5.2.10 Acetic cured silicone sealants may be used with stainless steel but must not be used on zinc or aluminium-zinc coatings.
LRML: if(is(sealant.type, aceticCuredSilicone)), then(and(permission(for(sealant, stainlessSteel)), prohibition(and(for(sealant, coating),is(coating.material, or(zincCoating, aluminiumZincCoating))))))
PARAPHRASE: If sealant type is acetic cured silicone, then the sealant may be used with stainless steel but must not be used on zinc coatings or aluminium-zinc coatings.

TEXT: 5.2.12 All fixings or penetrations through the roof must be through the crests of the roof cladding.
LRML: if(or(through(fixing, roof),through(penetration, roof))),then(obligation(and(has(roof.cladding, crest),through(fixing, crest),through(penetration, crest))))
PARAPHRASE: If there are fixings or penetrations through the roof, then those fixings or penetration must be through the crest of the roof cladding

TEXT: 5.2.3 Penetrations through masonry tile roofs must be as shown in Figure 5.
LRML: if(and(through(penetration, roof),is(roof.type, masonryTile))), then(obligation(asPer(penetration, nzbc_g12as2_f5)))
PARAPHRASE: If penetrations are through masonry tile roofs, then the penetrations must be as shown in G12/AS2 Figure 5.

TEXT: 5.2.9 Sealant used in the installation of solar water heaters must be a neutral cure silicone sealant and must be used in conjunction with mechanical fasteners. The sealant must comply with: a) Type F, Class 2OLM or 25LM of ISO 11600, or b) low modulus Type II Class A of Federal Specification TT-S-00230C.
LRML: if(has(solarWaterHeater.installation, sealant)), then(and(obligation(is(sealant.type, neutralCureSilicone)), obligation(adjoin(sealant, mechanicalFastener)), obligation(complyWith(sealant, or(iso_11600_typeF, iso_11600_class_20lm, iso_11600_class_25lm, tts_00230cLowModulusTypeIiClassA)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the installation of solar water heaters uses sealant, then the sealant must be a neutral cure silicone sealant and must be used in conjunction with mechanical fasteners. The sealant must comply with: a) Type F of ISO 11600, Class 2OLM of ISO 11600 or Class 25LM of ISO 11600, or b) low modulus Type II Class A of TT-S-00230C.

TEXT: 5.3.1 Pipes and their supports must be electrochemically compatible or be electrolytically separated (refer to Table 2).

PARAPHRASE: If pipes have supports, then the pipe and support must be electrochemically compatible or be electrolytically separated, for the separation refer to G12/AS2 Table 2.

TEXT: 5.4.1 Hot water pipes must be insulated to satisfy the requirements of NZBC Clause H1.3.4, except where connected to a heat dissipation device.
LRML: if(not(connect(hotWaterPipe, heatDissipationDevice))), then(obligation(complyWith(hotWaterPipe.insulation, 'nzbc_h1_3.4')))
PARAPHRASE: If hot water pipes are not connected to a heat dissipation device, then the hot water pipe must be insulated to satisfy the requirements of NZBC Clause H1 3.4.

TEXT: 6.2.4 Solar collectors must be supported at no less than four points.

PARAPHRASE: If solar collectors exist, then solar collectors must have support at no less than four locations.

TEXT: 6.3.1 Solar collectors can be fixed directly to the roof as shown in Figures 10 and 11 or Figures 12 and 13, where the requirements described in Paragraph 6.3 are met.

TEXT: 6.6.3 The edge of the panel elevated above the roof plane is to be supported by hot dip galvanized steel or stainless steel angle struts which are: a) 25 x 25 x 3 mm angle for struts up to 1.0 m long.

TEXT: 4.0 Flashings 4.6.1.4 Roof- or deck-to-wall junctions; a) There shall be a total minimum upstand height of 110 mm, in accordance with Table 7, comprising a minimum: i) overlap cover of cladding to the flashing upstand of 75 mm, and ii) 35 mm clearance from bottom of the wall cladding to roof cladding or finished deck material.
LRML: if(and(for(flashing, junction), is(junction.type, or(roofToWall, deckToWall)))), then(obligation(and(has(flashing, upstand), greaterThanEqual(upstand.height, 110 mm),asPer(upstand.height, nzbc_e2as1_t7),include(upstand.height, overlapCover),inBetween(overlapCover, and(cladding, upstand)),greaterThanEqual(overlapCover, 75 mm),include(upstand.height, clearance),has(wallCladding, bottom),or(inBetween(clearance, and(bottom, roofCladding)),inBetween(clearance, and(bottom, finishedDeckMaterial))),greaterThanEqual(clearance, 35 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are for Roof- or deck-to-wall junctions, then the flashing shall have a minimum upstand height of 110 mm, in accordance with E2/AS1 Table 7. The upstand height included a overlap cover of cladding to the flashing upstand of minimum 75 mm, and the upstand height includes clearance from bottom of the wall cladding to roof cladding or finished deck material of minimum 35 mm.

TEXT: Where the roof finishes within the length of an adjacent wall, a kick-out or stopend as detailed in Figure 8B shall be provided to direct water out from the wall cladding onto the roof cladding and gutter.

TEXT: Soffit linings shall be finished to fascias, barges and wall claddings as outlined in Figure 8A generally, or Figure 114 for flush finished fibre cement. Wall underlays shall not be required behind soffit linings.

PARAPHRASE: If soffit linings exist, then soffit linings shall be finished to fascias, barges and wall claddings, and either the Soffit linings finish shall be as outlined in E2/AS1 Figure 8.a and the soffit linings material is not flush finished fibre cement, or the Soffit linings finish shall be as outlined in E2/AS1 Figure 114 and the soffit linings material is flush finished fibre cement. There may be no wall underlays behind soffit linings.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Parapets shall be constructed as shown in Figure 10, and shall comply with the following requirements: a) Timber for framing and cavity battens shall comply with B2/AS1, b) Sloped packers under cappings shall be polystyrene or timber treated to B2/AS1, or minimum 9 mm H3 plywood on packers, and c) Framing shall be fully enclosed with wall underlay or roof underlay, in accordance with Table 23 for the specific cladding. d) claddings shall be installed over a cavity in accordance with Paragraph 9.1.8.
LRML: if(exist(parapet)), then(and(obligation(asPer(parapet.construction, nzbc_e2as1_f10)),obligation(and(has(parapet, or(framing, cavityBatten)),is(framing.material, timber),is(cavityBatten.material, timber),complyWith(timber, nzbc_b2as1))),obligation(and(has(parapet, capping),below(slopedPacker, capping),is(slopedPacker.material, or(polystyrene, timber, h3Plywood)),asPer(polystyrene, nzbc_b2as1),asPer(timber, nzbc_b2as1),greaterThanEqual(h3Plywood.thickness, 9 mm))),obligation(and(is(framing.fullEnclosing, or(wallUnderlay, roofUnderlay)),asPer(framing.fullEnclosing, nzbc_e2as1_t23),above(cladding.installation, cavity),complyWith(cladding, 'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.8'))),obligation(and(above(cladding.installation, cavity),complyWith(cladding, 'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.8')))))
PARAPHRASE: If a parapet exists, then the parapets shall be constructed as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 10. a) The timber used in the parapet's framing and cavity battens shall comply with B2/AS1 b) Sloped packers under parapet cappings shall be polystyrene, timber or H3 plywood. Polystyrene and timber shall be treated to B2/AS1, and H3 plywood shall be minimum 9 mm thick. c) Framing shall be fully enclosed with wall underlay or roof underlay, in accordance with E2/AS1 Table 23. d) Claddings shall be installed over a cavity in accordance with E2/AS1 Paragraph 9.1.8.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 6.7.1 Relief valve drains (see Figures 12 and 13) shall be fitted to: a) Temperature/pressure relief valves, Pressure relief valves, and c) Expansion control valves.

TEXT: 6.7.1 Relief valve drains (see Figures 12 and 13) shall be fitted to: a) Temperature/pressure relief valves, Pressure relief valves, and c) Expansion control valves.

TEXT: 3.1.2 Water traps shall be: a) Removable, b) Able to be dismantled, or c) Fitted with a cleaning eye.
LRML: if(exist(waterTrap)), then(obligation(or(is(waterTrap, or(removable, dismantleable)),has(waterTrap, cleaningEye))))
PARAPHRASE: If water traps exist, then water traps shall be either removable, able to be dismantled, or have a cleaning eye.

TEXT: 3.2.2 The diameter of the water trap shall be not less than that given in Table 2.
LRML: if(exist(waterTrap)), then(obligation(asPer(waterTrap.diameter, nzbc_g13as1_t2)))
PARAPHRASE: If a water trap exists, then the diameter of the water trap shall be not less than that given in G13/AS1 Table 2.

TEXT: A floor waste shall: Be trapped, discharge 50 mm above the grating of a gully trap.
LRML: if(exist(floorWaste)), then(and(obligation(has(floorWaste,gullyTrap)),obligation(and(has(gullyTrap,grating),above(floorWaste.discharge,grating),inBetween(distance, and(discharge, grating)),equal(distance,50 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a floor waste exists, then the floor waste shall have a gully trap and the floor waste shall have discharge 50 mm above the grating of a gully trap.

PARAPHRASE: If the floor waste has pipes, then the pipes may be combined to form a floor waste stack and shall have a diameter not less than the values given in G13/AS1 Table 3.

TEXT: 4.5.1 Waste water fixture discharge pipes shall discharge either to: a) A gully trap, in accordance with Figure 5 of G13/AS1 and Figure 3 of G13/AS2, or b) A discharge stack as in Paragraph 4.7 and Figures 7 and 8.
LRML: if(has(wasteWaterFixture, dischargePipe)), then(or(obligation(and(towards(dischargePipe.discharge,gullyTrap),asPer(dischargePipe.discharge,and(nzbc_g13as1_f5,nzbc_g13as2_f3)))),obligation(and(towards(dischargePipe.discharge,dischargeStack),asPer(dischargePipe.discharge,and('nzbc_g13as1_4.7',nzbc_g13as1_f7, nzbc_g13as1_f8))))))
PARAPHRASE: If waste water fixture have discharge pipes, then the discharge pipes shall discharge either to: a) A gully trap, in accordance with Figure 5 of G13/AS1 and Figure 3 of G13/AS2, or b) A discharge stack as in G13/AS1 Paragraph 4.7 and Figures 7 and 8.

TEXT: 4.5.2 Water seal protection: Waste water fixture discharge pipes shall be vented to comply with Paragraph 5.0 and as required in Table 5.
LRML: if(has(wasteWaterFixture, dischargePipe)), then(obligation(and(has(dischargePipe,ventilation),complyWith(ventilation,'nzbc_g13as1_5.0'),asPer(ventilation,nzbc_g13as1_t5))))
PARAPHRASE: If waste water fixture discharge pipes shall have ventilation to comply with G13/AS1 Paragraph 5.0 and as required in Table 5.

TEXT: 4.6.2 Water seal protection: Soil fixture discharge pipes shall be vented to comply with Paragraph 5.0 and as required in Table 5 (see Figure 6(2)).
LRML: if(has(soilFixture, dischargePipe)), then(obligation(and(has(dischargePipe,ventilation),complyWith(ventilation,'nzbc_g13as1_5.0'),asPer(ventilation,nzbc_g13as1_t5))))
PARAPHRASE: If discharge pipes have soil fixture, then the soil fixture shall have ventilation that complies with Paragraph 5.0 and as required in Table 5.

TEXT: 4.6.2 Water seal protection: Soil fixture discharge pipes shall be vented to comply with Paragraph 5.0 and as required in Table 5 (see Figure 6(2)).
LRML: if(has(soilFixture, dischargePipe)), then(obligation(and(has(dischargePipe,ventilation),complyWith(ventilation,'nzbc_g13as1_5.0'),asPer(ventilation,nzbc_g13as1_t5))))
PARAPHRASE: If discharge pipes have soil fixture, then the soil fixture shall have ventilation that complies with G13/AS1 Paragraph 5.0 and as required in Table 5.

TEXT: 5.1.1 Discharge pipes shall be vented where required by Table 5.
LRML: if(exist(dischargePipe)), then(obligation(asPer(dischargePipe.ventilation, nzbc_g13as1_t5)))
PARAPHRASE: If discharge pipes exist, then the discharge pipes shall be have ventilation where required by G13/AS1 Table 5.

TEXT: 5.3.1 Fixture vent pipes, branch vent pipes, discharge stack vents and relief vents shall have a diameter of no less than that given in Table 6.
LRML: if(or(for(ventilationPipe, or(fixture, branch)), for(ventilation, or(dischargeStack, relief)))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(ventilationPipe.diameter, value),greaterThanEqual(ventilation.diameter, value),asPer(value, nzbc_g13as1_t6))))
PARAPHRASE: If ventilation pipes are either for fixtures or branches or ventilation for discharge stacks or reliefs, then ventilation pipe and ventilation shall have a diameter of no less than the value given in G13/AS1 Table 6.

TEXT: 5.3.1 Fixture vent pipes, branch vent pipes, discharge stack vents and relief vents shall have a diameter of no less than that given in Table 6.
LRML: if(or(for(ventilationPipe, or(fixture, branch)), for(ventilation, or(dischargeStack, relief)))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(ventilationPipe.diameter, value),greaterThanEqual(ventilation.diameter, value),asPer(value, nzbc_g13as1_t6))))
PARAPHRASE: If ventilation pipes are either for fixtures or branches or ventilation for discharge stacks or reliefs, then ventilation pipe and ventilation shall have a diameter of no less than the value given in G13/AS1 Table 6.

TEXT: 5.6.1 The discharge stack vent, if also acting as a drain vent pipe shall have a diameter of not less than 80 mm.
LRML: if(for(ventilation, and(dischargeStack, drainVentilationPipe))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(ventilation.diameter, 80 mm)))
PARAPHRASE: If the venilation is for discharge stack and drain vent pipe, then the ventilation shall have a diameter of not less than 80 mm.

TEXT: 2.1.1 Chimneys for solid fuel burning appliances shall comply with Paragraph 1.0 or with the relevant sections of AS/NZS 3869 and AS/NZS 2918 for sheetmetal chimneys.
LRML: if(and(for(chimney, appliance),is(appliance, burner),for(burner.type, solidFuel)  )), then(obligation(or(complyWith(chimney, nzbc_b1as3_1),and(is(chimney.material, sheetmetal),complyWith(chimney, and(nzs_3869, nzs_2918))))))
PARAPHRASE: Chimneys for solid fuel burning appliances shall comply with Paragraph 1.0 or sheetmetal chimneys shall comply with NZS 3869 and NZS 2918.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
Can sheetmetal chimneys comply with 1.0?
omniclass: solidFuelFireplace
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.1 Solid fuel burning domestic appliances weighing no more than 130 kg shall be supported on a 65 mm thick hearth slab that is: a) Reinforced with 665 mesh, or D10 rods at 300 mm centres each way, placed centrally in the slab thickness, b) Supported on a timber or concrete floor, or integral with a concrete floor. (The floor supporting the hearth slab shall comply with NZS 3604 or NZS 4229 as appropriate), and c) Comprised of ordinary grade concrete complying with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109.
LRML: if(and(for(chimney, appliance),is(appliance, burner),is(burner.type, and(solidFuel,domestic)),lessThanEqual(appliance.weight, 130 kg))),then(obligation(and(on(appliance.support, slab), is(slab.type, hearth), greaterThanEqual(slab.thickness, 65 mm), is(slab, reinforcing), or(and(is(reinforcing.type, mesh), is(mesh.size, 665),is(reinforcing.placement, centrallyInSlabThickness)), and(is(reinforcing.type, rod), is(rod.size, d10),loop(forEach(slab.way),is(reinforcing.spacing, 300 mmCentres)),is(reinforcing.placement, centrallyInSlabThickness))), or(and(on(slab.support, floor), is(floor.construction, or(timber, concrete)), complyWith(floor, or(nzs_3604, nzs_4229))), and(partOf(slab, floor), is(floor.construction, concrete))), is(concrete.grade, ordinary), complyWith(concrete.grade, nzs_3109))))
PARAPHRASE: If solid fuel burning domestic appliances are weighing no more than 130 kg, the appliance shall be supported on a 65 mm thick hearth slab, and the slab is reinforced with 665 mesh or D10 rods at 300 mm centres each way, placed centrally in the slab thickness, b) Supported on a timber or concrete floor, or integral with a concrete floor. (The floor supporting the hearth slab shall comply with NZS 3604 or NZS 4229 as appropriate), and c) Comprised of ordinary grade concrete complying with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109.
COMMENTS:
type?
centrallyInSlabThickness?
d10 size vs diameter 10 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.2 Hearth slabs on a timber floor shall be held in position by supporting members on all four sides of the hearth. These members shall each be held by four screws with a minimum shank diameter of 4.88 mm that penetrate the floor framing by 50 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(slab.type, hearth), on(slab.support, floor), is(floor.construction, timber))), then(obligation(and(loop(in(forEach(side), slab), and(has(side, support), by(support.fixing, screw), greaterThanEqual(count(screw), 4))), greaterThanEqual(screw.shankDiameter, 4.88 mm), equal(screw.penetration, 50 mm))))
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.4 Calculating occupant loads 1.4.1 The occupant load shall be determined from the risk group and number of people in each space of the building. The occupant load may need to be evaluated not only for each risk group but also for: a) A space or open floor area involving one or more activities, and b) A floor containing more than one risk group, and c) A single firecell, and d) Each floor within a firecell.
LRML: if(or(loop(in(forEach(buildingStorey), firecell), and(define(count(space.occupant), x0), define(space.riskGroup, x1), include(space, openFloorArea), greaterThan(count(space.activities), 1))), loop(in(forEach(space), firecell), and(define(count(space.occupant), x2), define(space.riskGroup, x3), include(space, openFloorArea), greaterThan(count(space.activities), 1))))), then(obligation(include(occupantLoad.calculation, and(x0, x2, x1, x3))))
PARAPHRASE: The occupant load shall be determined from the risk group and number of people in each space of the building. The occupant load may need to be evaluated not only for each risk group but also for: a) A space or open floor area involving one or more activities, and b) A floor containing more than one risk group, and c) A single firecell, and d) Each floor within a firecell.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.4.7 If, in a particular situation, the occupant load derived from Table 1.2 is clearly more than that which will occur, the basis of any proposal for a lesser occupant load shall be substantiated to the building consent authority.
LRML: if(and(asPer(space.occupantLoad, 'nzbc_cas2_t1.2'), lessThan(space.expectedOccupantLoad, occupantLoad))), then(permission(and(for(space.expectedOccupantLoad, fireSafetyDesign),approve(buildingConsentAuthority, expectedOccupantLoad))))
PARAPHRASE: If the expected occupant load of a space is less than the occupant load of the space as from C/AS2 Table 1.2, the space's expected occupant load may be used for the fire safety design if the building consent authority shall approve the expected occupant load.

TEXT: 2.2.4 For risk group VP firecells that require a fire sprinkler system (refer to Table 2.2d), the fire sprinkler system does not need to be extended throughout the remainder of the building where the risk group VP firecells are fire separated from the adjacent firecells. The fire separation between adjacent firecells is required to be provided with the greater of the property rating of the adjacent firecells (refer to Table 2.4).
LRML: if(and(is(firecell.riskGroup, vp), requires(firecell, fireSprinklerSystem), asPer(fireSprinklerSystem, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.2.d'),  has(firecell, fireSeparation), adjacent(firecells, firecell),towards(fireSeparation, firecells),define(max(firecells.propertyRating), x0),asPer(propertyRating, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.4'),is(fireSeparation.fireResistanceRating, x0))), then(permission(not(has(building.remainder, fireSprinklerSystem))))
PARAPHRASE: If the firecell's risk group is VP and the firecell require a fire sprinkler system as per Table 2.2.d and the risk group VP firecells are fire separated from the adjacent firecells and the fire resistance rating of the fire separation is the greater of the property rating of the adjacent firecells, with the property rating as in Table 2.4, then the remainder of the building may not have the fire sprinkler system.
COMMENTS:
adjacentFirecell to avoid problems with comparisons.
firerating in if

TEXT: Parapets shall be capped with metal, butyl or EPDM membrane. Cappings shall comply with the requirements of Paragraph 4.0.
LRML: if(has(parapet, capping)), then(obligation(and(is(capping.material, or(metal,butyl,epdmMembrane)),complyWith(capping, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.0'))))
PARAPHRASE: If parapets have cappings, then the capping material shall be metal, butyl or EPDM membrane. Cappings shall comply with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.0.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.6.1 Industrial liquid waste systems, storage and treatment tanks and piping systems shall be tested on completion to avoid contamination of any soil, ground water or waterways through run-off from washing-down, rain, accidental overflows or other causes.
LRML: if(or(and(is(system.type, or(industrialLiquidWaste, piping)),is(system, completed)),and(is(tank.type, or(storage, treatment)),is(tank, completed)))), then(obligation(and(test(system, and(soilContamination, groundWaterContamination, waterwayContamination)),test(tank, and(soilContamination, groundWaterContamination, waterwayContamination)))))
PARAPHRASE: If industrial liquid waste or piping systems, or storage or treatment tanks are completed, then the systems and tanks shall be tested to avoid soil contamination, groundwater contamination and waterway contamination.
COMMENTS:
Questionable
contaminatedLand
Does industrial liquid waste refer to all objects?
Is the test-Function a good idea?

TEXT: 1.6.2 The area containing waste storage facilities shall be impervious and contained so as to avoid contamination of any soil, ground water or waterways through run-off from washing-down, rain, accidental overflows or other causes.
LRML: if(exist(wasteStorageArea)), then(obligation(and(is(wasteStorageArea, impervious), is(wasteStorageArea, contained))))
PARAPHRASE: If waste storage areas exists, then waste storage areas shall be impervious and contained.

TEXT: 1.6.3 Industrial liquid waste facilities shall be installed to avoid contamination of any potable water supply, as required by NZBC G12 Water Supplies.

TEXT: 1.7.1 Separate systems shall be provided to convey and store industrial liquid wastes that require different treatment and/or disposal methods.
LRML: if(or(is(compare(industrialLiquidWastes.treatmentMethod), different),is(compare(industrialLiquidWastes.disposalMethod), different))),then(loop(forEach(industrialLiquidWastes), obligation(and(is(industrialLiquidWaste.conveyingSystem, separate),is(industrialLiquidWaste.storageSystem, separate)))))
PARAPHRASE: If multiple industrial liquid wastes require different treatment or disposal methods, then for each industrial liquid wastes, the industrial liquid waste conveying system and storage system shall be separate.

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is limited to membranes composed of butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates for: a) Roofs with a minimum fall of 2° (1:30), b) Decks with: i) a minimum fall of 1.5° (1:40), ii) a maximum area of 40 m2, iii) no steps in level within deck area except into gutters, iv) no integral roof gardens, and v) no downpipe direct discharge to deck, c) Internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100, with no cross seams in the gutters, and d) Decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in Figure 17A.
LRML: if(and(is(membrane.material, or(butyl, epdm)), above(membrane.installation, substrate), is(substrate.material, plywood), or(and(for(membrane, roof), greaterThanEqual(roof.fall, 2 deg)), and(for(membrane, deck), greaterThanEqual(deck.fall, 1.5 deg), lessThanEqual(deck.area, 40 m2), not(has(deck, and(stepInLevel, integralRoofGarden))), not(and(towards(downpipe.discharge, deck),is(downpipe.discharge, direct)))), and(is(membrane, gutter), is(gutter.type, internal), greaterThanEqual(gutter.fall, 1/100), not(within(crossSeam, gutter))), and(is(membrane.application, deck), has(deck, raisedSurface), is(raisedSurface, removable), for(raisedSurface, levelAccess),asPer(levelAccess, 'nzbc_e2as1_f17.a'))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, membrane))
PARAPHRASE: If membranes are material butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates and either the membrane is for a roof with a minimum fall of 2 deg, or the membrane is for decks with a minimum fall of 1.5 deg, and the decka has a maximum area of 40 m2, and the deck has no steps in level and the deck has no integral roof gardens and no downpipe direct discharge, or the membranes are for internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100 and there are no cross seams in the gutters, or the membrane is for decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in Figure 17.a.
COMMENTS:
fall vs slope
Removed exception in iv?

TEXT: Where not acting as a drain vent the discharge stack vent pipe shall have a diameter of not less than that required in Table 6.
LRML: if(and(for(ventilationPipe, dischargeStack),not(is(ventilationPipe, drainVentilationPipe)))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(ventilationPipe, value),asPer(value, nzbc_g13as1_t6))))
PARAPHRASE: If the ventilation pipe is for the discharge stack but not for the drain ventilation, then the ventilation pipe shall have a diameter of not less than the value required in G13/AS1 Table 6.

TEXT: 5.8.2 Air admittance valves shall be manufactured to ASSE 1050, ASSE 1051, EN 12380 or AS/NZS 4936.
LRML: if(exist(airAdmittanceValve)), then(obligation(complyWith(airAdmittanceValve.manufacturing, or(asse_1050, asse_1051, en_12380, nzs_4936))))
PARAPHRASE: If air admittance valves exist, then air admittance valves shall be manufactured to ASSE 1050, ASSE 1051, EN 12380 or AS/NZS 4936.

TEXT: 5.8.2 Air admittance valves shall be manufactured to ASSE 1050, ASSE 1051, EN 12380 or AS/NZS 4936.
LRML: if(exist(airAdmittanceValve)), then(obligation(complyWith(airAdmittanceValve.manufacturing, or(asse_1050, asse_1051, en_12380, nzs_4936))))
PARAPHRASE: If air admittance valves exist, then air admittance valves shall be manufactured to ASSE 1050, ASSE 1051, EN 12380 or AS/NZS 4936.

TEXT: Air admittance valves that form an integral part of a fixture trap shall only be used as a trap vent.
LRML: if(partOf(airAdmittanceValve, fixtureTrap)), then(obligation(and(for(airAdmittanceValve, ventilation),for(ventilation, fixtureTrap),not(for(ventilation, other)))))
PARAPHRASE: If air admittance valves are part of a fixture trap, then the air admittance valves shall be used as ventilation for the fixture trap but not for other.

TEXT: Air admittance valves that form an integral part of a fixture trap shall only be used as a trap vent.
LRML: if(partOf(airAdmittanceValve, fixtureTrap)), then(obligation(and(for(airAdmittanceValve, ventilation),for(ventilation, fixtureTrap),not(for(ventilation, other)))))
PARAPHRASE: If air admittance valves are part of a fixture trap, then the air admittance valves shall be used as ventilation for the fixture trap but not for other.

TEXT: 6.1.1 Jointing methods for PVC-U pipe shall comply with AS/NZS 2032.
LRML: if(is(pipe.material, pvcU)), then(obligation(complyWith(pipe.jointingMethod, nzs_2032)))
PARAPHRASE: If the pipe material is PVC-U, then the pipe jointing method shall comply with NZS 2032.

TEXT: 6.2.1 Pipes shall be supported at centres not exceeding those in Table 7.
LRML: if(exist(pipe)), then(obligation(and(has(pipe,support),is(support.location, centre), complyWith(support, nzbc_g13as1_t7))))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes exist, then the pipes shall be supported at centres complying with Table 7.

TEXT: 6.2.1 Pipes shall be supported at centres not exceeding those in Table 7.
LRML: if(exist(pipe)), then(obligation(and(has(pipe,support),is(support.location, centre), complyWith(support, nzbc_g13as1_t7))))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes exist, then the pipes shall be supported at centres complying with G13/AS1 Table 7.

TEXT: 6.2.1 Pipes shall be supported at centres not exceeding those in Table 7.
