PARAPHRASE: If pipes exist, then the pipes shall be supported at centres complying with G13/AS1 Table 7.

TEXT: 6.4.1 Fire stopping shall be fitted to pipes passing through fire separations in accordance with C/AS2 Paragraph 4.4.
LRML: if(through(pipe, fireSeparation)), then(obligation(and(has(pipe,fireStop),asPer(fireStop,'nzbc_cas2_4.4'))))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes pass through fire separations, then fire stops shall be fitted to the pipe in accordance with C/AS2 Paragraph 4.4.

TEXT: 1.0.2 It does not apply to foul water drainage systems where it is necessary to dispose of industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer without pre-treatment.
LRML: if(or(for(foulWaterDrain, or(industrialLiquidWaste, chemicalWaste, toxicWaste)), and(for(foulWaterDrain, waste),towards(waste.discharge, sewer), requires(waste.discharge, pretreatment)))), then(not(applyTo(nzbc_g13as1, foulWaterDrain)))
PARAPHRASE:
If foul water drains are for industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer without pre-treatment
G13/AS2 does not apply to foul water drains.

TEXT: 1.0.2 It does not apply to foul water drainage systems where it is necessary to dispose of industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes and other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer without pre-treatment.
LRML: if(or(for(foulWaterDrain, or(industrialLiquidWaste, chemicalWaste, toxicWaste)), and(for(foulWaterDrain, waste),towards(waste.discharge, sewer), requires(waste.discharge, pretreatment)))), then(not(applyTo(nzbc_g13as1, foulWaterDrain)))
PARAPHRASE: If foul water drains are for industrial liquid wastes, chemical or toxic wastes or other wastes which cannot be discharged to a sewer without pre-treatment, then G13/AS2 does not apply to foul water drains.

TEXT: 2.0.1 Materials for drainage pipes and joints shall comply with the appropriate standards shown in Table 1.
LRML: if(exist(drainPipe)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(drainPipe.material,nzbc_g13as2_t1),has(drainPipe, joint),complyWith(joint.material,nzbc_g13as2_t1))))
PARAPHRASE: If drain pipes exists, then materials for drain pipes and drain pipe joints shall comply with G13/AS2 Table 1.

TEXT: Below ground 2.1 Fill materials 2.1.1 Fill materials, as shown in Figure 7, shall be: a) Bedding material of clean granular non-cohesive material with a maximum particle size of 20 mm, b) Selected fill of fine-grained soil or granular material that is free from topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm, or c) Ordinary fill of excavated material.
LRML: if(exist(fillMaterial)), then(or(obligation(and(is(fillMaterial,beddingMaterial),is(beddingMaterial, and(clean,granular,nonCohesive)),lessThanEqual(beddingMaterial.particleSize, 20mm))), obligation(and(is(fillMaterial,selectedFill),is(selectedFill,or(fineGrainedSoil,granularMaterial)),not(include(selectedFill,or(topsoil,rubbish))),lessThanEqual(selectedFill.particleSize,20mm))), obligation(and(is(fillMaterial, ordinaryFill),is(ordinaryFill, excavatedMaterial)))))
PARAPHRASE: If fill materials exists, then fill materials shall be either: a) Bedding material that is clean, granular and non-cohesive and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm, b) Selected fill of fine-grained soil or granular material that does not include topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm, or c) Ordinary fill of excavated material.

TEXT: 6.5 Membrane cappings; Butyl rubber and EPDM cappings shall be in accordance with Paragraph 4.3.9, and comply with the following requirements: a) Tops of membrane cappings shall be free of any penetrations, and shall have a minimum slope of 10° (1:6).
LRML: if(is(capping.material, or(butylRubber, epdm))), then(obligation(and(asPer(capping, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.9'),has(capping, top),not(has(top, penetration)),greaterThanEqual(top.slope, 10 deg))))
PARAPHRASE: If the capping material is butyl rubber or EPDM, then the capping shall be in accordance with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.3.9, and the top of the capping shall be free of any penetrations, and shall have a minimum slope of 10 deg.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 7.1.2 Enclosed decks; This Acceptable Solution is limited to enclosed decks with a maximum area of 40 m2. For enclosed decks, the vertical separation between the opening threshold level and the upper surface of the finished deck surface shall be a minimum of 100 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(deck, enclosed), lessThanEqual(deck.area, 40 m2))), then(and(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, deck), obligation(and(is(deck.surface, finished), define(deck.thresholdLevel, x0),define(deck.upperSurfaceLevel, x1), inBetween(separation, and(x0, x1)),greaterThanEqual(separation, 100 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If enclosed decks have a maximum area of 40 m2, then E2/AS1 applies to the deck. The deck surface shall be finished and a separation between the threshold level and the deck's upper surface level shall be a minimum of 100 mm.
COMMENTS:
For correct apply to, we'd need to split into two rules?
ORDER
split further?
separation/gap?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 7.1.2 Enclosed decks; This Acceptable Solution is limited to enclosed decks with a maximum area of 40 m2. For enclosed decks, the vertical separation between the opening threshold level and the upper surface of the finished deck surface shall be a minimum of 100 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(deck, enclosed), lessThanEqual(deck.area, 40 m2))), then(and(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, deck), obligation(and(is(deck.surface, finished), define(deck.thresholdLevel, x0),define(deck.upperSurfaceLevel, x1), inBetween(separation, and(x0, x1)),greaterThanEqual(separation, 100 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If enclosed decks have a maximum area of 40 m2, then E2/AS1 applies to the deck. The deck surface shall be finished and a separation between the threshold level and the deck's upper surface level shall be a minimum of 100 mm.

TEXT: 7.2.1 Slatted timber decks to walls; Junctions of slatted timber decks with walls shall be made weathertight as shown in Figures 15 and 16.
LRML: if(and(is(deck, slatted), is(deck.material, timber), inBetween(junction, and(deck, wall)))), then(obligation(and(is(junction, weathertight),asPer(weathertight, and(nzbc_e2as1_f15, nzbc_e2as1_f16)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the deck is slatted and deck material is timber and a junction is between the deck and wall, then the junction shall be made weathertight as shown in E2/AS1 Figures 15 and 16.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Maintenance of claddings shall be carried out as necessary to achieve the expected durability of the materials - refer to Paragraph 2.5.
LRML: if(and(has(cladding.material, durability),asPer(durability, 'nzbc_e2as1_2.5'))), then(obligation(requires(cladding, maintenance)))
PARAPHRASE: If cladding materials have a durability as shown in E2/AS1 Paragraph 2.5, then the cladding requires maintenance.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Projecting eaves; Soffits and verges of all projecting eaves shall be closed in.
LRML: if(and(is(eave.type, projecting), has(eave, or(soffit, verge)))), then(obligation(and(is(soffit, closedIn),is(verge, closedIn))))
PARAPHRASE: If eaves are type projecting and has soffits and verges, then the soffits and verges shall be closed in.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.0 Roof Claddings 8.1.4 Fixings; Fixings shall be as specified in Paragraph 8.2 to Paragraph 8.5. Materials for fixing roof claddings and flashings, where necessary, shall be selected from Tables 20, 21 and 22 to minimise corrosion.
LRML: if(or(has(cladding, fixing), has(flashing, fixing))), then(obligation(and(asPer(fixing, and('nzbc_e2as1_8.1.2 to nzbc_e2as1_8.5')),asPer(fixing.material,and(nzbc_e2as1_t20, nzbc_e2as1_t21, nzbc_e2as1_t22)))))
PARAPHRASE: If roof claddings or flashings have fixings, then the fixings shall be as specified in E2/AS1 Paragraph 8.2 to Paragraph 8.5. The fixing materials shall be selected from Tables 20, 21 and 22.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.1.5 Roof underlays; Underlays shall be: • Layed with minimum numbers of laps • Lapped at all side and end laps by minimum 150 mm • Run horizontally for roof pitches below 10° • Run horizontally or vertically for roof pitches above 10° • Have anti-ponding boards at lower edges of masonry tiles, refer Figure 25(b) and Paragraph 8.2.5.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(and(obligation(is(count(underlay.lap), minimum)), obligation(and(has(underlay, lap),is(lap, or(end, side)),greaterThanEqual(lap.size, 150 mm))), or(obligation(and(is(underlay.orientation, horizontal),lessThan(roof.pitch, 10 deg))), obligation(and(is(underlay.orientation, or(horizontal, vertical)),greaterThan(roof.pitch, 10 deg)))), obligation(and(has(roof, masonryTile),has(masonryTile.lowerEdge, antiPondingBoard)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has underlays, then the underlay shall have a minimum cound of laps. The underlay shall have laps and the side laps and end laps shall be minimum 150 mm size. The underlay shall be either horizontally and roof pitches below 10 deg or the underlay shall be horizontally or vertically for roof pitches above 10 deg. The underlay shall have anti-ponding boards at lower edges of masonry tiles.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Prevent sagging of roof underlay by either: For R1 underlays, fully support with a corrosion resistant material • For R2 self supporting underlays, laid to maximum 1.2 metre span between adjacent supports.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(or(obligation(and(is(underlay.type, r1), has(underlay, support),is(support.material, corrosionResistant))), obligation(and(is(underlay.type, r2), is(underlay, selfSupporting),lessThanEqual(underlay.span, 1.2 m),inBetween(underlay.span, adjacentSupports)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has an underlay, then the underlay type shall be either R1 and the underlay shall be fully support with a corrosion resistant material, or the underly shall be type R2 and self supporting and laid to maximum 1.2 metre span between adjacent supports.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.1 Separate systems shall be provided to convey and store industrial liquid wastes that require different treatment and/or disposal methods.
LRML: if(or(is(compare(industrialLiquidWastes.treatmentMethod), different),is(compare(industrialLiquidWastes.disposalMethod), different))),then(loop(forEach(industrialLiquidWastes), obligation(and(is(industrialLiquidWaste.conveyingSystem, separate),is(industrialLiquidWaste.storageSystem, separate)))))
PARAPHRASE: If multiple industrial liquid wastes require different treatment or disposal methods, then for each industrial liquid wastes, the industrial liquid waste conveying system and storage system shall be separate.

TEXT: 1.7.1 Separate systems shall be provided to convey and store industrial liquid wastes that require different treatment methods, or where the wastes are incompatible.
LRML: if(or(is(compare(industrialLiquidWastes.treatmentMethod), different),not(is(compare(industrialLiquidWastes), compatible)))),then(loop(forEach(industrialLiquidWaste), obligation(and(is(industrialLiquidWaste.conveyingSystem, separate),is(industrialLiquidWaste.storageSystem, separate)))))
PARAPHRASE: If multiple industrial liquid wastes require different treatment methods or the industrial liquid wastes are incompatible, then the industrial liquid wastes conveying system and storage system shall be separate.

TEXT: 1.7.1 Separate systems shall be provided to convey and store industrial liquid wastes that require different treatment methods, or where the wastes are incompatible.
LRML: if(or(is(compare(industrialLiquidWastes.treatmentMethod), different),not(is(compare(industrialLiquidWastes), compatible)))),then(loop(forEach(industrialLiquidWaste), obligation(and(is(industrialLiquidWaste.conveyingSystem, separate),is(industrialLiquidWaste.storageSystem, separate)))))
PARAPHRASE: If multiple industrial liquid wastes require different treatment methods or the industrial liquid wastes are incompatible, then for each industrial liquid wastes, the industrial liquid waste conveying system and storage system shall be separate.

TEXT: 1.7.1 Separate systems shall be provided to convey and store industrial liquid wastes that require different treatment methods, or where the wastes are incompatible.
LRML: if(or(is(compare(industrialLiquidWastes.treatmentMethod), different),not(is(compare(industrialLiquidWastes), compatible)))),then(loop(forEach(industrialLiquidWaste), obligation(and(is(industrialLiquidWaste.conveyingSystem, separate),is(industrialLiquidWaste.storageSystem, separate)))))
PARAPHRASE: If multiple industrial liquid wastes require different treatment methods or the industrial liquid wastes are incompatible, then for each industrial liquid wastes, the industrial liquid waste conveying system and storage system shall be separate.

TEXT: 1.8.1 Vehicle access areas for the collection of industrial liquid waste shall: a) Comply with NZBC D1 Access Routes.
LRML: if(for(vehicleAccessArea, industrialLiquidWasteCollection)), then(obligation(complyWith(vehicleAccessArea, nzbc_d1)))
PARAPHRASE: If a vehicle access area is for industrial liquid waste collection, then the vehicle access area shall comply with NZBC D1.

for vs has?

LRML: if(for(vehicleAccessArea, industrialLiquidWasteCollection)), then(obligation(complyWith(vehicleAccessArea, nzbc_d1)))
PARAPHRASE: If a vehicle access area is for industrial liquid waste collection, then the vehicle access area shall comply with NZBC D1.

TEXT: 1.8.1 Vehicle access areas for the collection of industrial liquid waste shall: a) Comply with NZBC D1 Access Routes.
LRML: if(and(for(vehicleAccessArea, collection), is(collection.type, industrialLiquidWaste))), then(obligation(complyWith(vehicleAccessArea.area, nzbc_d1)))
PARAPHRASE: If a vehicle access area is for industrial liquid waste collection, then the vehicle access area shall comply with NZBC D1.

TEXT: 1.8.1 Vehicle access areas for the collection of industrial liquid waste shall: where possible, access layout shall provide sufficient space for vehicles to drive in and out of the facility without reversing or interference with other activities on the site.
LRML: if(and(for(vehicleAccessArea, collection), is(collection.type, industrialLiquidWaste),is(vehicleAccessArea.turningSpace, possible))),then(obligation(has(vehicleAccessArea, turningSpace)))
PARAPHRASE: If a vehicle access area is for industrial liquid waste collection and if possible, the vehicle access area shall provide sufficient space for turning.

TEXT: 1.8.1 Vehicle access areas for the collection of industrial liquid waste shall: where possible, access layout shall provide sufficient space for vehicles to drive in and out of the facility without reversing or interference with other activities on the site.
LRML: if(and(for(vehicleAccessArea, collection), is(collection.type, industrialLiquidWaste),is(vehicleAccessArea.turningSpace, possible))),then(obligation(has(vehicleAccessArea, turningSpace)))
PARAPHRASE: If a vehicle access area is for industrial liquid waste collection and if possible, then the vehicle access area shall provide sufficient space for turning.

TEXT: 1.8.1 Vehicle access areas for the collection of industrial liquid waste shall: Drain any spilled waste to a kerbed area sloped so that the waste does not collect under the vehicle, or drain in an uncontrolled manner to other areas of the plant.
LRML: if(and(for(vehicleAccessArea, collection), is(collection.type, industrialLiquidWaste))), then(obligation(and(has(vehicleAccessArea, drain),for(drain, waste),into(drain, kerbedArea))))
PARAPHRASE: If a vehicle access area is for industrial liquid waste collection, then the vehicle access area shall drain any spilled waste to a kerbed area.
COMMENTS:
spilledWaste or waste
Should so that be really removed?

TEXT: 1.8.1 Vehicle access areas for the collection of industrial liquid waste shall: Any spilled waste shall not enter the sewage system unless the spilled waste is acceptable as a discharge to the sewer by the network utility operator.
LRML: if(and(for(vehicleAccessArea, collection), is(collection.type, industrialLiquidWaste),not(accept(networkUtilityOperator, discharge)),into(discharge, sewer),is(discharge.type, waste))), then(prohibition(into(waste, sewer)))
PARAPHRASE: If a vehicle access area is for industrial liquid waste collection and the network utility operator does not accept the discharge of the waste to the sewer, spilled waste shall not enter the sewer.

TEXT: 1.7.15 Fixing brackets shall be spaced at no less than 480 mm centres for stacks up to 600 mm wide.
LRML: if(and(is(bracket.type, fixing), lessThanEqual(stack.width, 600 mm))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(bracket.spacing, 480 mmCentres)))
PARAPHRASE: If brackets are type fixing and stacks are up to 600 mm wide, then the brackets shall be spaced at no less than 480 mm centres.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.16 Fixing ties shall comprise 4 mm galvanised wire hairpins, which are hooked behind the reinforcing ducts and secured to the required adjacent double studding with four heavy duty fencing staples.
LRML: if(is(tie.type, fixing)), then(obligation(and(is(tie.type,wireHairpin),is(wireHairpin.type,galvanised),is(wireHairpin.size,4 mm),behind(tie.hook,reinforcingDuct),towards(tie.fixing,doubleStudding),adjacent(reinforcingDuct, doubleStudding),by(tie.fixing,fencingStaple),is(fencingStaple.type,heavyDuty),equal(count(fencingStaple),4))))
PARAPHRASE: If ties are type fixing, then the ties shall be 4 mm galvanised wire hairpins, which are hooked behind the reinforcing ducts and have fixing to the double studding adjacent to the reinforcing ducts. The ties fixing is done by four heavy duty fencing staples.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Fixing ties shall be located in mortar joints between the units.
LRML: if(is(tie.type, fixing)), then(and(obligation(and(within(tie.location, mortarJoint),inBetween(mortarJoint.location, units)))))
PARAPHRASE: If ties are type fixing, then the ties shall be located in mortar joints between the units.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Fixing Ties; The ties shall be located at no less than 320 mm centres for stacks up to 600 mm wide.
LRML: if(and(is(tie.type, fixing), for(tie, stack),lessThanEqual(stack.width, 600 mm))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(tie.location, 320 mmCentres)))
PARAPHRASE: If the fixing ties are for stacks up to 600 mm wide, then the ties shall be located at no less than 320 mm centres.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Fixing Ties; The ties shall be at no less than 160 mm centres for stacks wider than 600 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(tie.type, fixing), greaterThan(stack.width, 600 mm))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(tie.location, 160 mmCentres)))
PARAPHRASE: If fixing ties are for stacks wider than 600 mm, then the ties shall be at no less than 160 mm centres.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The brackets shall comprise a 50 mm x 4 mm hot dip galvanised steel strap placed around the chimney.
LRML: if(exist(bracket)), then(obligation(and(is(bracket.type,strap),equal(strap.length,50 mm),equal(strap.depth,4 mm),is(strap.material,steel),is(steel.type,hotDipGalvanised),around(strap,chimney))))
PARAPHRASE: If brackets exist, the brackets shall be a strap with 50 mm length, 4 mm depth with material hot dip galvanised steel and the strap is placed around the chimney.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.6 Brick chimneys; Brick chimneys shall be restrained at roof level by a zinc coated 50 x 1.0 mm mild steel 'U' strap used in conjunction with closely spaced wall ties.
LRML: if(is(chimney.material, brick)), then(and(obligation(and(has(chimney, fixing),is(fixing.elevation, roofLevel), include(fixing.type, and(uStrap, wallTie)), is(uStrap.material, mildSteel), is(uStrap.type, zincCoated), equal(uStrap.length, 50 mm), equal(uStrap.depth, 1 mm), is(wallTie.spacing, close)))))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys are brick, then the chimney shall be fixed at roof level by 'U' straps and wall ties. The 'U' straps are zinc coated 50 length, 1.0 mm depth, mild steel and wall ties are closely spaced.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.7 Wall ties (see Figure 7(a)) shall be located in mortar joints at 225 mm maximum centres up each side of the chimney for chimneys not wider than 600 mm.
LRML: if(and(lessThanEqual(chimney.width, 600 mm), has(chimney, wallTie))), then(obligation(loop(forEach(chimney.side),and(      within(wallTie,mortarJoint),lessThanEqual(wallTie.elevation, 225 mmCentres)))))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys are not wider than 600 mm and have wall ties, then for each side of the chimney the wall tie shall be located in mortar joints at 225 mm maximum centres elevation.
COMMENTS:
wallTie if or then?
up -> elevation?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.8 Wall ties shall be constructed from either 4 mm diameter galvanised bar or 25 x 1.5 mm zinc coated steel strip capable of withstanding a load of 1.2 kN without elongating or shortening by more than 1.5 mm.
LRML: if(exist(wallTie)), then(obligation(or(and(is(wallTie.type, bar),equal(bar.diameter,4 mm),is(bar.type,galavanised)),and(is(wallTie.material,strip),equal(strip.size,'25 x 1.5 mm'),is(strip.material,steel),is(steel.type,zincCoated),has(strip,loadResistance),equal(loadResistance.force, 1.2 kN),lessThanEqual(strip.shortening,1.5 mm),lessThanEqual(strip.elongating,1.5 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall ties exist, the wall ties shall be either a bar with 4 mm diameter and galvanised or the wall ties shall be e a strip with 25 x 1.5 mm size out of zinc coated steel and the strip shall be capable of withstanding a load of 1.2 kN force without the strip elongating or shortening by more than 1.5 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.8 Wall ties shall be constructed from either 4 mm diameter galvanised bar or 25 x 1.5 mm zinc coated steel strip capable of withstanding a load of 1.2 kN without elongating or shortening by more than 1.5 mm.
LRML: if(exist(wallTie)), then(obligation(or(and(is(wallTie.type, bar),equal(bar.diameter,4 mm),is(bar.type,galavanised)),and(is(wallTie.material,strip),equal(strip.size,'25 x 1.5 mm'),is(strip.material,steel),is(steel.type,zincCoated),has(strip,loadResistance),equal(loadResistance.force, 1.2 kN),lessThanEqual(strip.shortening,1.5 mm),lessThanEqual(strip.elongating,1.5 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall ties exist, then the wall ties shall be either a bar with 4 mm diameter and galvanised or the wall ties shall be e a strip with 25 x 1.5 mm size out of zinc coated steel and the strip shall be capable of withstanding a load of 1.2 kN force without the strip elongating or shortening by more than 1.5 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.9 Where zinc coating of components is required it shall be no less than 300 g/m2 in accordance with AS 1397.
LRML: if(requires(component, zincCoating)), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(zincCoating.density, 300 g/m2),asPer(zincCoating.density, as_1397))))
PARAPHRASE: If zinc coating of components is required, then the zinc coating shall be no less than 300 g/m2 in accordance with AS 1397.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.8.1 Brickwork; Brick chimney construction shall conform to the relevant sections of NZS 4210.
LRML: if(is(chimney.construction, brick)), then(obligation(complyWith(chimney.construction, nzs_4210)))
PARAPHRASE: If the chimney's construction is brick, the chimney's construction shall conform to NZS 4210.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The maximum moisture contents shall be: For reconstituted wood products, 18% at all times.
LRML: if(and(is(product.material, wood), is(wood.type, reconstituted))), then(obligation(lessThanEqual(product.moistureContent, 18 percent)))
PARAPHRASE: If products are wood that is reconstituted, then the product's maximum moisture contents shall be 18 percent.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Cladding systems shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2.2 to E2.3.7.
LRML: if(exist(claddingSystem)), then(obligation(complyWith(claddingSystem, 'nzbc_e2_2 to nzbc_e2_3.7'))))
PARAPHRASE: If cladding systems exist, then the cladding systems shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2 2 to NZBC E2.3.7.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Cladding systems shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2.2 to E2.3.7.
LRML: if(exist(claddingSystem)), then(obligation(complyWith(claddingSystem, 'nzbc_e2_2 to nzbc_e2_3.7')))
PARAPHRASE: If cladding systems exist, then the cladding systems shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2 2 to NZBC E2.3.7.

TEXT: Cladding systems shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2.2 to E2.3.7, and the provisions of this Acceptable Solution are acceptable means of achieving this.
LRML: if(complyWith(claddingSystem, nzbc_e2as1)), then(complyWith(claddingSystem, 'nzbc_e2_2 to nzbc_e2_3.7'))
PARAPHRASE: If caldding systems comply with E2/AS1, the cladding systems complies with NZBC E2 2 to NZBC E2 3.7.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Cladding systems shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2.2 to E2.3.7, and the provisions of this Acceptable Solution are acceptable means of achieving this.
LRML: if(complyWith(claddingSystem, nzbc_e2as1)), then(complyWith(claddingSystem, 'nzbc_e2_2 to nzbc_e2_3.7'))
PARAPHRASE: If caldding systems comply with E2/AS1, then the cladding systems complies with NZBC E2 2 to NZBC E2 3.7.

TEXT: Materials used to construct the building envelope shall be: a) In accordance with the durability requirements of NZBC B2, b) Suitable for their end-use, location and environment as shown in Table 20, and c) Compatible with adjoining materials as shown in Table 21 and Table 22.
LRML: if(include(building.envelope, material)), then(obligation(and(asPer(material.durability,nzbc_b2),include(material.suitability,and(endUse,location,environment)),asPer(material.suitability,nzbc_e2as1_t20),towards(material.compatibility,adjoiningMaterial),asPer(material.compatibility,and(nzbc_e2as1_t21,nzbc_e2as1_t22)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a material is included in the building envelope, then the material durability shall be: in accordance with NZBC B2, the material suitability shall include end-use, location and environment as shown in E2/AS1 Table 20, and the material compatibility with adjoining materials as shown in E2/AS1 Table 21 and Table 22.
COMMENTS:

SPLIT obligations?
in accordance with -> asPer or comply with?
adjoiningMaterial

TEXT: All building products shall be considered as part of a system, even if the components of that system are provided from different sources.

TEXT: Finish colours for flush-finished fibre cement sheet and EIFS shall have a reflectivity of 40% or more when measured in accordance with ASTM C1549.
LRML: if(or(and(is(fibreCementSheet.type, flushFinished), has(fibreCementSheet, finishColour)), has(eifs, finishColour))), then(obligation(and(has(finishColour, reflectivity),greaterThanEqual(reflectivity,40 percent),asPer(reflectivity.measurement,astm_c1549))))
PARAPHRASE: If flush-finished fibre cement sheet or EIFS have finish colours, then the finish colour shall have a reflectivity of 40% or more when the reflectivity measurement is in accordance with ASTM C1549.

TEXT: Cladding system 4.1 Materials for flashings; Acceptable materials for flashing junctions and penetrations are described in Paragraph 4.3.

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: b) Expansion joints shall be provided for joined flashings with a combined length exceeding: i) 12 metres for light coloured steel and stainless steel. 8 metres for dark coloured steel, ii) 8 metres for copper, iii) 8 metres for aluminium.
LRML: if(and(is(flashings.material, metal), is(flashings, joined))), then(and(obligation(for(expansionJoint.provision, flashing)), or(obligation(and(is(flashings.material, or(lightColouredSteel, stainlessSteel)),greaterThanEqual(sum(flashings.length) ,12 m))), obligation(and(is(flashings.material, or(darkColouredSteel, copper, aluminium)),greaterThanEqual(sum(flashings.length), 8 m))))))
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
Cannot be represented in one rule?
joined flashing - has join vs is joined?
Minimum criteria (i.e. combined length) is required in if statement.
In fact it's still not translatable, since the materials should be part of if.

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is limited to membranes composed of butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates for: a) Roofs with a minimum fall of 2° (1:30), b) Decks with: i) a minimum fall of 1.5° (1:40), ii) a maximum area of 40 m2, iii) no steps in level within deck area except into gutters, iv) no integral roof gardens, and v) no downpipe direct discharge to deck, c) Internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100, with no cross seams in the gutters, and d) Decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in Figure 17A.
LRML: if(and(is(membrane.material, or(butyl, epdm)), above(membrane.installation, substrate), is(substrate.material, plywood), or(and(for(membrane, roof), greaterThanEqual(roof.fall, 2 deg)), and(for(membrane, deck), greaterThanEqual(deck.fall, 1.5 deg), lessThanEqual(deck.area, 40 m2), not(has(deck, and(stepInLevel, integralRoofGarden))), not(and(towards(downpipe.discharge, deck),is(downpipe.discharge, direct)))), and(is(membrane, gutter), is(gutter.type, internal), greaterThanEqual(gutter.fall, 1/100), not(within(crossSeam, gutter))), and(is(membrane.application, deck), has(deck, raisedSurface), is(raisedSurface, removable), for(raisedSurface, levelAccess),asPer(levelAccess, 'nzbc_e2as1_f17.a'))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, membrane))
PARAPHRASE: If membranes are material butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates and either the membrane is for a roof with a minimum fall of 2 deg, or the membrane is for decks with a minimum fall of 1.5 deg, and the decka has a maximum area of 40 m2, and the deck has no steps in level and the deck has no integral roof gardens and no downpipe direct discharge, or the membranes are for internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100 and there are no cross seams in the gutters, or the membrane is for decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in Figure 17.a.
COMMENTS:
fall vs slope
Removed exception in iv?

TEXT: 9.1.3.4 Garages and openings to garages; Garage spaces within, or attached to, the building envelope shall have: a) Openings provided with a 50 mm minimum total level change between the interior and the exterior paving, b) Provision to drain water away from the threshold of the opening c) Rigid wall underlays, to Table 23, where external garage walls are unlined d) linings to garage walls adjoining habitable spaces e) weather resisting garage doors f) window and door details (where included) to Paragraphs 9.2 to 9.9.

PARAPHRASE: If the garage is within, or attached to, the building envelope, the garage shall have openings with an interior paving elevation 50 mm minimum greater than the exterior paving elevation, and the garage shall have drainage away from the opening, and the garage shall either have external garage walls and the walls have rigid wall underlays, to Table 23, and the garage walls have no linings, or the external garage walls shall have linings, and garage walls adjoining habitable spaces shall have linings, and garage doors shall be weather resistant, and garage window and door shall be to Paragraphs 9.2 to 9.9.

TEXT: 1.8.2 Chimney foundations of reinforced concrete shall comply with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109 for ordinary grade concrete.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, foundation), is(foundation.material, reinforcedConcrete), is(reinforcedConcrete.grade, ordinary))), then(obligation(complyWith(foundation, nzs_3109)))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys foundations are reinforced concrete and the reinforced concrete is ordinary grade, then the foundations shall comply with NZS 3109.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Pumice concrete units for use in precast chimneys shall: a) Have pumice aggregate which: i) is free of combustible and organic matter, and ii) has a maximum aggregate size of no greater than 19 mm, with at least 40% but not more than 60% of the aggregate retained by a 4.75 mm standard test sieve, and b) Have a mix ratio by volume of no more than five parts of mixed pumice aggregate to one part of cement, c) Have a compressive strength of no less than 7 MPa at 28 days when cured and tested in accordance with NZS 3112: Part 2, d) After adequate curing, be air dried and kept under cover during storage, transport and on the site, e) Be laid dry. (Work left unfinished should be protected from rain.) f) Be joined with mortar which complies with NZS 4210, and g) Have ducts filled with grout complying with NZS 4210.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.type, precast), has(chimney, unit), is(unit.material, pumiceConcrete))), then(obligation(and(has(pumiceConcrete, aggregate),not(include(aggregate, and(combustibleMaterial,organicMatter))),lessThanEqual(aggregate.size, 19 mm),test(sieve, aggregate),equal(sieve.size,4.75 mm),greaterThanEqual(sieve.remainder,40 percent),lessThanEqual(sieve.remainder,60 percent),define(aggregate.volume, x0),define(cement.volume, x1),greaterThanEqual(x1,'x0 / 5'),is(pumiceConcrete.mix,'x0 + x1'),has(aggregate,compressiveStrength),greaterThanEqual(pumiceConcrete.compressiveStrength,7 MPa),is(pumiceConcrete.compressiveStrength, 28 days),asPer(pumiceConcrete, nzs_3112_2),has(pumiceConcrete, protection),by(protection,and(curing,airDrying,covering)),within(protection,and(storage,transport,onSite)),against(protection,rain),connect(mortar,pumiceConcrete),complyWith(mortar, nzs_4210),has(unit, duct),include(duct, grout),complyWith(grout,nzs_4210))))
PARAPHRASE: If precast chimneys have pumice concrete units, then the pumice concrete shall have aggregate which is free of combustible material and organic matter, and the aggregate size shall be no greater than 19 mm, a sieve shall test the aggregate, with the sieve size of 4.75 mm with sieve remainder of at least 40 percent but not more than 60 percent, and the pummiceConcrete shall have a mix ratio by volume of no more than five parts of mixed pumice aggregate to one part of cement, and the pumice concrete shall have a compressive strength of no less than 7 MPa at 28 days when cured and tested in accordance with NZS 3112: Part 2, and the pumice concrete shall have protection curing, air drying and covering during storage, transport and on the site, and should be protected from rain, the mortar that connects the pumice concrete shall comply with NZS 4210, and the unit shall have ducts filled with grout complying with NZS 4210.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
retained?
Represent processes?
pumiceConcrete vs unit in obligation?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Reinforcing used in chimneys is to conform to AS/NZS 4671.

TEXT: Structural diaphragms shall be provided at roof/ceiling level and at each floor level to which the chimney is connected. The diaphragms shall comply with all relevant clauses of NZS 3604 and NZS 4229.
LRML: if(and(has(building, chimney), or(is(building.buildingStorey, or(roof, ceiling)), connect(building.buildingStorey, chimney)))), then(obligation(and(has(buildingStorey, diaphragm),complyWith(diaphragm, and(nzs_3604,nzs_4229)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the building has a chimney and the building storey is roof or ceiling level, or the building storey is connected to the chimney, then the building storey shall have diaphragms and the diaphragms shall comply with NZS 3604 and NZS 4229.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The bracing units required as determined from Paragraph 1.9.3 shall be provided solely by that wall.
LRML: if(asPer(bracing.unit, 'nzbc_b1as3_1.9.3')), then(obligation(by(bracing.unit, wall)))
PARAPHRASE: If the bracing's units are determined from B1/AS3 Paragraph 1.9.3, then the bracing's units shall be provided by that wall.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Galvanized steel flashings shall: a) have a BMT of 0.55 mm minimum b) be grade G550, or G300 for rolled or crimped flashings c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.material, steel), is(steel.type, galvanised))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(flashing.baseMetalThickness, 0.55 mm)), obligation(or(equal(flashing.grade, g550),and(equal(flashing.grade, g300), is(flashing.type, or(rolled, crimped))))),obligation(and(asPer(flashing.corrosionProtection,intendedExposureZone),asPer(intendedExposureZone,nzbc_e2as1_t20)))))

The flashing's corrosion protection shall be according to the intended exposure zone as shown in E2/AS1 Table 20.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Butyl rubber and EPDM flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 1.0 mm, and shall comply with the following parts of Table 1 in ASTM D6134: a) Tensile strength, b) Elongation, c) Water absorption, d) Water vapour permeance, and e) Heat aging followed by: i) tensile strength ii) elongation.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, or(butylRubber, epdm))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(flashing.thickness, 1 mm),complyWith(flashing.tensileStrength, astm_d6134_t1),complyWith(flashing.elongation, astm_d6134_t1),complyWith(flashing.waterAbsorption, astm_d6134_t1),complyWith(flashing.waterVapourPermeance, astm_d6134_t1),complyWith(flashing.heatAgingFollowedByTensileStrength, astm_d6134_t1),complyWith(flashing.heatAgingFollowedByElongation, astm_d6134_t1))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are butyl rubber or EPDM, then the flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 1.0 mm, and the flashing's Tensile strength, Elongation, Water absorption, Water vapour permeance, Heat aging followed by tensile strength, and Heat aging followed by elongation shall comply with ASTM D6134 Table 1.
COMMENTS:
1.0 -> 1
"Heat aging followed by: i) tensile strength ii) elongation" - Is it the title or shall I use after relation?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is limited to membranes composed of butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates for: a) Roofs with a minimum fall of 2° (1:30), b) Decks with: i) a minimum fall of 1.5° (1:40), ii) a maximum area of 40 m2, iii) no steps in level within deck area except into gutters, iv) no integral roof gardens, and v) no downpipe direct discharge to deck, c) Internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100, with no cross seams in the gutters, and d) Decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in Figure 17A.
LRML: if(and(is(membrane.material, or(butyl, epdm)), above(membrane.installation, substrate), is(substrate.material, plywood), or(and(for(membrane, roof), greaterThanEqual(roof.fall, 2 deg)), and(for(membrane, deck), greaterThanEqual(deck.fall, 1.5 deg), lessThanEqual(deck.area, 40 m2), not(and(has(deck.area, stepInLevel),not(into(stepInLevel, gutter)))), not(has(deck.area, integralRoofGarden)), not(and(towards(downpipe.discharge, deck),is(downpipe.discharge, direct)))), and(is(membrane, gutter), is(gutter.type, internal), greaterThanEqual(gutter.fall, 1/100), not(within(crossSeam, gutter))), and(is(membrane.application, deck), has(deck, raisedSurface), is(raisedSurface, removable), for(raisedSurface, levelAccess),asPer(levelAccess, 'nzbc_e2as1_f17.a'))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, membrane))
PARAPHRASE: If membranes are material butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates and either the membrane is for a roof with a minimum fall of 2 deg, or the membrane is for decks with a minimum fall of 1.5 deg, and the deck has a maximum area of 40 m2, and the deck area has no steps in level except into gutters and the deck has no integral roof gardens and no downpipe direct discharge to the deck, or the membranes are for internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100 and there are no cross seams in the gutters, or the membrane is for decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 17.a.
COMMENTS:
fall vs slope
Removed exception in iv?
limited to would require negation?

TEXT: 9.1.3.3 Bottom of wall claddings for concrete ground slabs (except masonry veneer); At concrete slab level, the base of the cladding system shall be as shown in Table 18, and: a) Finish a minimum of: i) 100 mm above a paved surface, or ii) 175 mm above finished unpaved surface, b) Overlap the concrete slab by 50 mm, and c) Be offset horizontally by a minimum of 6 mm for direct fixed claddings to prevent capillary action.
LRML: if(and(not(is(wallCladding.system, masonryVeneer)), adjoin(slab, wallCladding),is(slab.type, ground),is(slab.material, concrete))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(wallCladding.bottom,nzbc_e2as1_t18),or(and(adjoin(surface, wallCladding),is(surface.type, paved),define(surface.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(wallCladding.bottom, 'x0 + 100 mm')),and(adjoin(surface, wallCladding),not(is(surface.type, paved)),define(surface.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(distance, 'x0 + 175 mm'))),has(wallCladding.bottom, lap),towards(lap, slab),equal(lap.size, 50 mm),or(and(has(wallCladding.bottom, offset),is(offset, horizontal),greaterThanEqual(offset.size, 6 mm),is(wallCladding.type, directFixed),prevent(offset, capillaryAction)),not(is(wallCladding.type, directFixed))))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are not masonry veneer and the concrete ground slab adjoins the wall cladding, then the bottom of the wall cladding shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Table 18, and either the wall cladding bottom is at a minimum of 100 mm above a paved surface, or the wall cladding bottom is at a minimum of 175 mm above finished unpaved surface, and the wall cladding bottom overlaps the concrete slab by 50 mm size, and the wall cladding bottom shall be either offset horizontally by a minimum of 6 mm size for direct fixed claddings to prevent capillary action, or the wallcladding shall be not direct fixed.

TEXT: 9.1.3.3 Bottom of wall claddings for concrete ground slabs (except masonry veneer); At concrete slab level, the base of the cladding system shall be as shown in Table 18, and: a) Finish a minimum of: i) 100 mm above a paved surface, or ii) 175 mm above finished unpaved surface, b) Overlap the concrete slab by 50 mm, and c) Be offset horizontally by a minimum of 6 mm for direct fixed claddings to prevent capillary action.
LRML: if(and(not(is(wallCladding.system, masonryVeneer)), adjoin(slab, wallCladding),is(slab.type, ground),is(slab.material, concrete))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(wallCladding.bottom,nzbc_e2as1_t18),or(and(adjoin(surface, wallCladding),is(surface.type, paved),define(surface.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(wallCladding.bottom, 'x0 + 100 mm')),and(adjoin(surface, wallCladding),not(is(surface.type, paved)),define(surface.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(distance, 'x0 + 175 mm'))),has(wallCladding.bottom, lap),towards(lap, slab),equal(lap.size, 50 mm),or(and(has(wallCladding.bottom, offset),is(offset, horizontal),greaterThanEqual(offset.size, 6 mm),is(wallCladding.type, directFixed),prevent(offset, capillaryAction)),not(is(wallCladding.type, directFixed))))))

TEXT: 2.2.1 Solid fuel burning domestic appliances weighing no more than 130 kg shall be supported on a 65 mm thick hearth slab that is: a) Reinforced with 665 mesh, or D10 rods at 300 mm centres each way, placed centrally in the slab thickness, b) Supported on a timber or concrete floor, or integral with a concrete floor. PARAPHRASE: 2.2.1 Solid fuel burning domestic appliances weighing no more than 130 kg shall be supported on a 65 mm thick hearth slab that is: a) Reinforced with 665 mesh, or D10 rods at 300 mm centres each way, placed centrally in the slab thickness, b) Supported on a timber or concrete floor, or integral with a concrete floor. (The floor supporting the hearth slab shall comply with NZS 3604 or NZS 4229 as appropriate), and c) Comprised of ordinary grade concrete complying with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109.

TEXT: 2.2.2 Hearth slabs on a timber floor shall be held in position by supporting members on all four sides of the hearth. These members shall each be held by four screws with a minimum shank diameter of 4.88 mm that penetrate the floor framing by 50 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(slab.type, hearth), on(slab, floor), is(floor.material, timber))), then(obligation(and(loop(forEach(slab.side), and(has(slab.side, support), by(support.fixing, screw), greaterThanEqual(count(screw), 4))), greaterThanEqual(screw.shankDiameter, 4.88 mm), equal(screw.penetration, 50 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If hearth slabs are on a timber floor, then for each side of the slabs the slab side shall have support and the support has four screws. The screws shall have a minimum shank diameter of 4.88 mm that penetrate the floor framing by 50 mm.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
slab partOf hearth?
loop necessary?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.9.1 The bracing described in Paragraphs 1.9.2 to 1.9.6 shall be provided in those buildings where one or more of the following apply: a) The area of the room containing the chimney exceeds 24 m2, c) The floor area on any level of the building, for a given chimney type (see Table 2), is less than: i) 50 m2 for chimney Type 1, ii) 75 m2 for chimney Types 2, 3 and 4, iii) 150 m2 for chimney Types 5, 6 and 7.
LRML: if(or(and(include(building.space, chimney), greaterThan(space.area, 24 m2)), and(lessThan(buildingStorey.floorArea, 50 m2),is(chimney.type, type_1)),and(lessThan(buildingStorey.floorArea, 75 m2),is(chimney.type, or(type_2, type_3, type_4))),and(lessThan(buildingStorey.floorArea, 150 m2),is(chimney.type, or(type_5, type_6, type_7))))), then(obligation(and(has(building, bracing),asPer(bracing, 'nzbc_b1as3_1.9.2 to nzbc_b1as3_1.9.6'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the building's space containing the chimney exceeds an area of 24 m2, or the floor area of a building storey is less than 50 m2 and chimney is Type 1, or the floor area of a building storey is less than 75 m2 and chimney is Types 2, 3 or 4, or the floor area of a building storey is less than 150 m2 and chimney is Types 5, 6 and 7, then the building shall have bracing as described in B1/AS3 Paragraphs 1.9.2 to 1.9.6.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.9.4 A chimney shall be considered as connected to the building when: a) At roof level: it is held either by a roof bracket or by a roof tie.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, fixing),is(fixing.type, or(roofBracket, roofTie)),is(fixing.elevation, roofLevel))), then(connect(chimney, building))
PARAPHRASE: If a chimney is fixed by a roof bracket or by a roof tie and the fixing elevation is roof level, then the chimney is considered connected to the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.9.4 A chimney shall be considered as connected to the building when: At ground floor level: it is held by a floor bracket or the chimney base is integral with the building foundation wall,.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.elevation, groundFloorLevel), or(is(chimney.fixing, floorBracket), partOf(chimney.base, foundationWall)))), then(connect(chimney, building))
PARAPHRASE: If a chimney at ground floor level is fixed by a floor bracket or the chimney base is part of the building foundation wall, then the chimney is considered connected to the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structural diaphragms shall be provided at roof/ceiling level and at each floor level to which the chimney is connected. The diaphragms shall comply with all relevant clauses of NZS 3604 and NZS 4229.
LRML: if(and(has(building, chimney), or(is(building.buildingStorey, or(roof, ceiling)), connect(building.buildingStorey, chimney)))), then(obligation(and(has(buildingStorey, diaphragm),complyWith(diaphragm, and(nzs_3604,nzs_4229)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the building has a chimney and the building storey is roof or ceiling level, or the building storey is connected to the chimney, then the building storey shall have diaphragms and the diaphragms shall comply with NZS 3604 and NZS 4229.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.1.1 Chimneys for solid fuel burning appliances shall comply with Paragraph 1.0 or with the relevant sections of AS/NZS 3869 and AS/NZS 2918 for sheetmetal chimneys.
LRML: if(and(for(chimney, appliance),is(appliance, burner),for(burner.type, solidFuel))), then(obligation(or(complyWith(chimney, 'nzbc_b1as3_1.0'),and(is(chimney.material, sheetmetal),complyWith(chimney, and(nzs_3869, nzs_2918))))))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys are for solid fuel burning appliances, then the chimney shall comply with B1/AS3 Paragraph 1.0 or chimneys shall be sheetmetal and comply with NZS 3869 and NZS 2918.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
Can sheetmetal chimneys comply with 1.0?
omniclass: solidFuelFireplace
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.4 Hearth slabs for solid fuel burning appliances shall comply with AS/NZS 2918.
LRML: if(and(for(slab, appliance), is(slab.type, hearth),is(appliance, burner),for(burner.type, solidFuel))), then(obligation(complyWith(slab, nzs_2918)))
PARAPHRASE: If hearth slabs are for solid fuel burning appliances, then the slab shall comply with NZS 2918.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.1.2 It is the responsibility of the person specifying the building element to determine normal maintenance requirements. These may be based on the manufacturer's recommendations and may also include periodic inspections of elements not readily observable without a specific effort (e.g. access to roof or subfloor spaces).
LRML: if(has(building.element, specifier)), then(and(obligation(and(has(building.element, maintenanceRequirements),by(maintenanceRequirements, specifier))), permission(and(include(maintenanceRequirements, and(manufacturersRecommendation, periodicInspection)),for(periodicInspection, element),not(is(element, observable))))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building element has a specifier, then the building element shall have maintainance requirements specified by this specifier. These maintainance requirements may include manufacturer's recommendations and periodic inspections of elements not observable.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.1 Scheduled maintenance comprises the inspection, maintenance and reporting procedures for building elements required to have a compliance schedule in terms of section 44 of the Building Act. The relevant maintenance procedures may include total replacement.
LRML: if(obligation(and(has(building.element,maintenanceSchedule),asPer(maintenanceSchedule,buildingAct_44)))), then(and(obligation(and(include(maintenanceSchedule, procedures),for(procedures,and(inspection,maintenance,reporting)))),permission(include(procedures, totalReplacement))))
PARAPHRASE: If building elements are required to have a maintenance schedule in terms of section 44 of the Building Act, then the maintenance schedule includes procedures for inspection, maintenance and reporting. The procedures may include total replacement.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.3.1 NZS 4251: Part 1 is an acceptable solution for meeting the durability requirements of cement plasters for walls, ceilings and soffits within its scope.
LRML: if(for(cementPlaster, or(wall, ceiling, soffit))), then(permission(complyWith(cementPlaster.durability, nzs_4251_1)))
PARAPHRASE: If cement plasters are for walls, ceilings and soffits, then the cement plaster's durability may comply with NZS 4251: Part 1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.5.1 NZS 4223.2 is an Acceptable Solution for meeting the durability requirements of insulating glass units, within its scope.
LRML: if(exist(insulatedGlassUnit)), then(permission(complyWith(insulatedGlassUnit.durability, nzs_4223_2)))
PARAPHRASE: If insulating glass units exist, the durability of insulating glass units may comply with NZS 4297 and NZS 4299.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Butyl rubber and EPDM flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 1.0 mm, and shall comply with the following parts of Table 1 in ASTM D6134: a) Tensile strength, b) Elongation, c) Water absorption, d) Water vapour permeance, and e) Heat aging followed by: i) tensile strength ii) elongation.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, or(butylRubber, epdm))), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(flashing.thickness, 1 mm),complyWith(flashing.tensileStrength, astm_d6134_t1),complyWith(flashing.elongation, astm_d6134_t1),complyWith(flashing.waterAbsorption, astm_d6134_t1),complyWith(flashing.waterVapourPermeance, astm_d6134_t1),complyWith(flashing.heatAgingFollowedByTensileStrength, astm_d6134_t1),complyWith(flashing.heatAgingFollowedByElongation, astm_d6134_t1))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are butyl rubber or EPDM, then the flashings shall be a minimum thickness of 1.0 mm, and the flashing's Tensile strength, Elongation, Water absorption, Water vapour permeance, Heat aging followed by tensile strength, and Heat aging followed by elongation shall comply with ASTM D6134 Table 1.
COMMENTS:
1.0 -> 1
"Heat aging followed by: i) tensile strength ii) elongation" - Is it the title or shall I use after relation?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: All flashings shall have expansion joints where required in Paragraph 4.5.2 to provide for thermal expansion.
LRML: if(and(requires(flashing, expansionJoint),asPer(expansionJoint, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.5.2'))), then(obligation(and( has(flashing, expansionJoint),for(flashing.expansionJoint, thermalExpansion))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings require expansion joints in E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.5.2, then the flashing shall have expansion joints for thermal expansion.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.5.1 Edge treatments for flashings; Flashings shall be to the dimensions shown throughout this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(exist(flashing)), then(obligation(asPer(flashing.dimension, nzbc_e2as1)))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings exist, then the flashings shall be to the dimensions shown throughout E2/AS1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.5.1 Edge treatments for flashings; Flashings shall be to the dimensions shown throughout this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(exist(flashing)), then(obligation(asPer(flashing.dimension, nzbc_e2as1)))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings exist, then the flashings shall be to the dimensions shown throughout E2/AS1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: For Extra High wind zones, hooks and hems shall be used, and flashing upstand dimensions increased by 25 mm beyond those shown in Table 7 or elsewhere in the document.
LRML: if(and(is(windZone.type, extraHigh), has(flashing, upstand))), then(obligation(and(has(upstand,or(hem,hook)),greaterThanEqual(upstand.dimension, 'value + 25 mm'),asPer(value, and(nzbc_e2as1_t7, nzbc_e2as1)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the wind zone type is extra high and the flashing has an upstand, then the upstand shall have hooks and hems, and the upstand dimensions shall be 25 mm greater than the values shown in E2/AS1 Table 7 and E2/AS1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: a) Rivets used for joining and sealing laps shall be spaced at a maximum of 50 mm centres, and be: i) compatible with the flashing material as per Table 21 and Table 22, and ii) sealed against moisture, or iii) of a sealing type or blind rivet,.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.material, metal), has(flashing.join, rivet), for(rivet, and(joinLap, sealLap)))), then(obligation(and(lessThanEqual(rivet.spacing, 50 mmCentres),inBetween(compatibility, and(rivet, material)),complyWith(compatibility,and(nzbc_e2as1_t21, nzbc_e2as1_t22)),or(against(rivet.sealing, moisture),is(rivet.type, or(sealing, blind))))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are material metal and have joins with rivets to join laps and seal laps, then the rivets shall be spaced at a maximum of 50 mm centres, and there shall be compatibility between rivet and flashing material as per E2/AS1 Table 21 and Table 22, and the rivet shall either have sealing against moisture or be of type sealing or blind.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: b) Expansion joints shall be provided for joined flashings with a combined length exceeding: i) 12 metres for light coloured steel and stainless steel. 8 metres for dark coloured steel, ii) 8 metres for copper, iii) 8 metres for aluminium.
LRML: if(and(is(flashings.material, metal), is(flashings, joined))), then(obligation(or(and(has(flashings, expansionJoint),is(flashings.material, or(lightColouredSteel,stainlessSteel)),greaterThan(sum(flashings.length), 12 m)),and(is(flashings.material,or(lightColouredSteel,stainlessSteel)),lessThanEqual(sum(flashings.length), 12 m)),and(has(flashings, expansionJoint),is(flashings.material,or(darkColouredSteel,copper,aluminium)),greaterThan(sum(flashings.length),8 m)),and(is(flashings.material, or(darkColouredSteel,copper,aluminium)),lessThanEqual(sum(flashings.length),8 m)))))
PARAPHRASE: If metal multiple flashings are joined, then either the flashings shall have expansion joints and the sum of the flashing lengths exceed 12 metres and the flashings shall be light coloured steel or stainless steel, or the sum of the flashing lengths shall not exceed 12 metres and the flashings shall be light coloured steel or stainless steel, or the flashings shall have expansion joints and the sum of the flashing lengths exceed 8 metres and the flashings shall be dark coloured steel, copper or aluminium, or the sum of the flashing lengths shall not exceed 8 metres and the flashings is dark coloured steel, copper or aluminium.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE COMPLEX
Since the rule was not broken down, a separate negation case needed to be added into the then.
Cannot be represented in one rule?
joined flashing - has join vs is joined?
Minimum criteria (i.e. combined length) is required in if statement.
In fact it's still not translatable, since the materials should be part of if.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: Where both ends of a flashing are constrained, allowance shall be made for expansion.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.material, metal), has(flashing, join),loop(forEach(flashing.end),is(flashing.end, constrained)))), then(obligation(has(join, expansionAllowance)))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are material metal and have joins and each end of a flashing is constrained, then the join shall have expansion allowance.
COMMENTS:
expansionAllowance? less restrictive than expansionJoint?
both -> each?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.6 Flashing overlaps and upstands; Overlaps and upstands to flashings shall be as specified in this paragraph and Table 7.
LRML: if(has(flashing, or(lap, upstand))), then(obligation(and(asPer(lap, and('nzbc_e2as1_4.6', nzbc_e2as1_t7)),asPer(upstand, and('nzbc_e2as1_4.6', nzbc_e2as1_t7)))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings have laps or upstands, then the laps and upstands shall be as specified in E2/AS1 4.6 and E2/AS1 Table 7.
COMMENTS:
Two ways, exist(flashing) vs has(flashing, overlap or upstand).
Exist might be invoked more often, but is clearer regarding the and/or.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Regular maintenance of a building will include: a) Washing exterior surfaces, b) Inspecting surfaces and junctions, and repairing or replacing items when necessary, in order to preserve the weathertightness of the building. c) Maintaining clearances between cladding and external ground or paving as per Paragraph 9.1.3. d) Maintaining minimum 35 mm clearances between roofing and membrane decking, and wall cladding above e) Maintaining finish coatings especially for stucco, EIFS and fibre cement claddings.
LRML: if(and(has(building, maintenance), is(maintenance.type, regular))), then(and(include(maintenance.task, and(washing, inspecting, repairing, replacing, maintaining)), include(maintenance.task, washing), for(washing, exteriorSurface), include(maintenance.task, inspecting), for(inspecting, and(surface, junction)), include(maintenance.task, and(repairing, replacing)), or(for(repairing, object), for(replacing, object)),not(is(object, weathertight)),include(maintenance.task, maintaining), for(maintaining, clearance),or(inBetween(clearance, and(cladding, externalGround)), inBetween(clearance, and(cladding, paving))), asPer(clearance, 'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.3'), inBetween(clearance, and(roofing, membraneDecking)), greaterThanEqual(clearance, 35 mm), inBetween(clearance, and(roofing, membraneDecking)), greaterThanEqual(clearance, 35 mm),has(cladding, finishCoating),for(maintaining, finishCoating)))
PARAPHRASE: If maintenance of a building is type regular, then the maintenance tasks will include Washing exterior surfaces, and the maintenance tasks will include inspecting surfaces and junctions, and the maintenance tasks will include repairing or replacing items if they are not weathertight, and the maintenance tasks will include maintaining clearances between cladding and external ground or cladding and paving as per E2/AS1 Paragraph 9.1.3, and maintaining minimum 35 mm clearances between roof and membrane decking, and roof and wall cladding, and maintaining finish coatings of claddings.

TEXT: 2.1.3 Basic normal maintenance tasks shall include but not be limited to: a) Where applicable, following manufacturers' maintenance recommendations, b) Washing down surfaces, particularly exterior building elements subject to wind driven salt spray, c) Re-coating interior and exterior protective finishes, d) Replacing sealant, seals and gaskets in joints, e) Replacing valves, washers and similar high wear components in easily accessed service equipment and other building elements, f) Cleaning and replacing filters in building services systems, g) The regular servicing of boilers, cooling towers, lifts, escalators, emergency lighting and fire protection equipment, and h) The maintenance of signs for access, escape routes, emergency equipment and hazardous areas.
LRML: if(is(maintenance.type, or(normal, basic))), then(obligation(and(include(maintenance.task, manufacturersRecommendation), include(maintenance.task, washing), for(washing, surface), include(maintenance.task, recoating),for(recoating, and(interiorProtectiveFinish, exteriorProtectiveFinish)), include(maintenance.task, replacing),for(replacing, and(jointSealant, jointSeal, jointGasket, valve, washer, component)), is(component, highWear),include(maintenance.task, cleaning),for(cleaning, buildingServiceSystemFilter),for(replacing, buildingServiceSystemFilter),include(maintenance.task, service),is(service.type, regular),for(service, and(boiler, coolingTower, lift, escalator, emergencyLighting, fireProtectionEquipment)),include(maintenance.task, maintenance),for(maintenance, sign),is(sign.type, and(access, escapeRoute, emergencyEquipment, hazardousArea))  )))
PARAPHRASE: If the the maintenance is basic or normal, the maintenance tasks shall include the manufacturers recommendations, and the maintenance tasks shall include washing down surfaces, and the maintenance tasks shall include recoating interior protective finishes and exterior protective finishes, and the maintenance tasks shall include replacing joint sealant, joint seals, joint gaskets, valves, washers and high wear components, and the maintenance tasks shall include cleaning building services system filters and replacing building services system filters, and the maintenance tasks shall include the regular service of regular boiler, cooling tower, lift, escalator, emergency lighting, fire protection equipment, and the maintenance tasks shall include the maintenance for signs type access, escape route, emergency equipment and hazardous area.

TEXT: 2.1.3 Basic normal maintenance tasks shall include but not be limited to: a) Where applicable, following manufacturers' maintenance recommendations, b) Washing down surfaces, particularly exterior building elements subject to wind driven salt spray, c) Re-coating interior and exterior protective finishes, d) Replacing sealant, seals and gaskets in joints, e) Replacing valves, washers and similar high wear components in easily accessed service equipment and other building elements, f) Cleaning and replacing filters in building services systems, g) The regular servicing of boilers, cooling towers, lifts, escalators, emergency lighting and fire protection equipment, and h) The maintenance of signs for access, escape routes, emergency equipment and hazardous areas.

TEXT: 2.2.3 Hearth slabs on concrete floors shall be secured in position by four D10 starter rods. The rods shall be located in each corner of the hearth slab and they shall terminate each end with standard hooks complying with NZS 3109.
LRML: if(and(is(slab.type, hearth), on(slab, floor), is(floor.material, concrete))), then(obligation(and(is(slab.fixing, rod), is(rod.type, starter)equal(rod.size, d10), greaterThanEqual(count(rod), 4), loop(forEach(slab.corner), and(has(corner, support), has(starterRod.end, hook), complyWith(hook, nzs_3109))))))
PARAPHRASE: If hearth slabs are on concrete floors, the slabs shall be secured in position by four D10 starter rods. The rods shall be located in each corner of the hearth slab and they shall terminate each end with standard hooks complying with NZS 3109.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.3 Hearth slabs on concrete floors shall be secured in position by four D10 starter rods. The rods shall be located in each corner of the hearth slab and they shall terminate each end with standard hooks complying with NZS 3109.
LRML: if(and(is(slab.type, hearth), on(slab, floor), is(floor.material, concrete))), then(obligation(and(is(slab.fixing, rod), is(rod.type, starter),equal(rod.size, d10), greaterThanEqual(count(rod), 4), loop(forEach(slab.corner), and(has(slab.corner, rod), has(rod.end, hook), complyWith(hook, nzs_3109))))))
PARAPHRASE: If hearth slabs are on concrete floors, the slabs shall be fixed with four D10 starter rods. For each corner of the slab, the corner shall have a rod and the rods end shall have hooks complying with NZS 3109.
COMMENTS:
ORDER
proper quantification is missing - foreach vs any.
terminate vs end vs terminationPoint.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.4.5 The requirements of this Acceptable Solution account for the fact that other people may be present in the building or firecell and additional calculations are not required when an occupant load is derived by bed spaces (i.e. for risk groups SM and SI).
LRML: if(and(define(count(bed), x0), asPer(occupantLoad.calculation, x0),is(space.riskGroup, or(sm, si)))), then(permission(not(and(has(occupantLoad, calculation),is(calculation.type, additional)))))
PARAPHRASE: If an occupant load is calculated by the number of bed spaces and the risk group is SM or SI, then additional calculations are not required.

TEXT: 2.2.4 For risk group VP firecells that require a fire sprinkler system (refer to Table 2.2d), the fire sprinkler system does not need to be extended throughout the remainder of the building where the risk group VP firecells are fire separated from the adjacent firecells. The fire separation between adjacent firecells is required to be provided with the greater of the property rating of the adjacent firecells (refer to Table 2.4).
LRML: if(and(is(firecell.riskGroup, vp), requires(firecell, fireSprinklerSystem), asPer(fireSprinklerSystem, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.2.d'),  has(firecell, fireSeparation), adjacent(firecells, firecell),towards(fireSeparation, firecells),define(max(firecells.propertyRating), x0),asPer(propertyRating, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.4'),is(fireSeparation.fireResistanceRating, x0))), then(permission(not(has(building.remainder, fireSprinklerSystem))))
PARAPHRASE: If the firecell's risk group is VP and the firecell require a fire sprinkler system as per Table 2.2.d and the risk group VP firecells are fire separated from the adjacent firecells and the fire resistance rating of the fire separation is the greater of the property rating of the adjacent firecells, with the property rating as in Table 2.4, then the remainder of the building may not have the fire sprinkler system.
COMMENTS:
adjacentFirecell to avoid problems with comparisons.
fire separation firerating in if

TEXT: The scope of this Acceptable Solution is limited to the materials, products and processes contained herein, for buildings within the scope of NZS 3604, and: a) Up to 3 storeys with a height measured from lowest ground level adjacent to the building to the highest point of the roof (except for chimneys, aerials and the like) of 10 m or less, and b) With floor plan area limited only by seismic and structural control joints, and c) External walls that are vertical, and roofs that are 60° or less above the horizontal.
LRML: if(and(applyTo(nzs_3604, building), lessThanEqual(count(buildingStorey), 3),adjacent(building, groundLevel),define(min(groundLevel.elevation), x0),has(building, roof), define(max(roof.elevation), x1),exclude(max(roof.elevation), or(chimney, aerial)), inBetween(building.height, and(x0, x1)), lessThanEqual(building.height, 10 m),has(building, floorPlanArea), by(floorPlanArea.limit, and(seismicControlJoint, structuralControlJoint)), has(building, externalWall), is(externalWall.orientation, vertical), has(building, roof), lessThanEqual(roof.slope, 60 deg))), then(and(has(building, or(material, product, process)),applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, and(material, product, process))))
PARAPHRASE: If NZS 3604 applies to a building and the building has up to three storeys, and the building height in between the lowest ground level elevation adjacent to the building and the highest elevation of the roof excluding chimneys and aerials of 10 m or less, and the building's floor plan area limited by seismic control joints and structural control joints, and and the building's external walls are oriented vertical, and building roofs that are 60° or less slope.

TEXT: 3.3.1 NZS 4251: Part 1 is an acceptable solution for meeting the durability requirements of cement plasters for walls, ceilings and soffits within its scope.
LRML: if(for(cementPlaster, or(wall, ceiling, soffit))), then(permission(complyWith(cementPlaster.durability, nzs_4251_1)))
PARAPHRASE: If cement plasters are for walls, ceilings and soffits, then the cement plaster's durability may comply with NZS 4251: Part 1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.4.1 NZS 4297 and NZS 4299 are acceptable solutions for meeting the durability requirements of earth buildings within their scope.
LRML: if(is(building.material, earth)), then(permission(complyWith(building.durability, and(nzs_4297, nzs_4299))))
PARAPHRASE: If building material is earth, then the buildings durability may comply with NZS 4297 and NZS 4299.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.5.1 NZS 4223.2 is an Acceptable Solution for meeting the durability requirements of insulating glass units, within its scope.
LRML: if(exist(insulatedGlassUnit)), then(permission(complyWith(insulatedGlassUnit.durability, nzs_4223_2)))
PARAPHRASE: If insulating glass units exist, then the durability of insulating glass units may comply with NZS 4297 and NZS 4299.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is one of three Acceptable Solutions that provide a means of establishing compliance with NZBC Clauses C1 to C6 Protection from Fire. It can be used for the building activities covered by risk groups specified in Paragraph 1.1.1 and described in Table 1.1.
LRML: if(and(complyWith(building, nzbc_cas2), asPer(building.riskGroup, and('nzbc_cas2_1.1.1', 'nzbc_cas2_t1.1')))), then(complyWith(building.fireProtection, and(nzbc_c1, nzbc_c2, nzbc_c3, nzbc_c5, nzbc_c6)))
PARAPHRASE: If a building complies to CAS2 and the building risk groups are in C/AS2 Paragraph 1.1.1 and Table 1.1, then the building complies with NZBC Clauses C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, and C6.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Where a turn-down to the cover flashing for profiled metal claddings is required, use: a) A soft edge flashing for corrugated profiles.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.material, profiledMetal), has(cladding, flashing),is(flashing.type, cover), requires(flashing, turnDown), is(profiledMetal.type, corrugated))), then(obligation(is(flashing.edge, soft)))
PARAPHRASE: If cladding material is profiled metal, then the cladding has cover flashings, the flashing required a turn-down, and the profiled metal is corrugated, them the flashing shall have soft edges.
COMMENTS:
drop cover?
soft edges vs type softedge
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Where a turn-down to the cover flashing for profiled metal claddings is required, use: b) A notched turn-down or soft edge flashing for trapezoidal profiles with rib height not exceeding 30 mm and/or rib centres not exceeding 200 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.material, profiledMetal), has(cladding, flashing), is(flashing.type, cover), requires(flashing, turnDown), is(profiledMetal.type, trapezoidal), or(lessThanEqual(profiledMetal.ribHeight, 30 mm), lessThanEqual(profiledMetal.ribCentres, 200 mm)))), then(obligation(or(is(turnDown.type, notched),is(flashing.edge, soft))))
PARAPHRASE: If cladding material is profiled metal, then the cladding has cover flashings, the flashing required a turn-down, and the profiled metal is trapezoidal and the profiled metal rib height is not exceeding 30 mm or profiled metal rib centres not exceeding 200 mm, then the turn-down shall be notched or flashing edges soft.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.0 Flashings 4.6.1.3 Change in metal roof pitches; a) There shall be a minimum effective lap under roof cladding in accordance with Table 7, with a hem at upper edge.
LRML: if(and(has(metalRoofing.pitch, change),for(flashing, change))), then(obligation(and(below(lap, cladding),is(lap, minimumEffective),asPer(lap, nzbc_e2as1_t7),is(lap.edge, upper),has(lap.edge, hem))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are for changed metal roofing pitches, then there shall be a minimum effective lap under the cladding, and the lap shall be in accordance with E2/AS1 Table 7, have a hem at the upper edge.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The apron cover over the roof cladding shall be in accordance with Table 7.
LRML: if(and(above(cover, cladding), is(cover.type, apron))), then(obligation(asPer(cover, nzbc_e2as1_t7)))
PARAPHRASE: If the apron cover is over the roof cladding, then the cover shall be in accordance with E2/AS1 Table 7.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.0 Flashings 4.6.1.4 Roof- or deck-to-wall junctions; a) There shall be a total minimum upstand height of 110 mm, in accordance with Table 7, comprising a minimum: i) overlap cover of cladding to the flashing upstand of 75 mm, and ii) 35 mm clearance from bottom of the wall cladding to roof cladding or finished deck material.
LRML: if(and(for(flashing, junction), is(junction.type, or(roofToWall, deckToWall)))), then(obligation(and(has(flashing, upstand), greaterThanEqual(upstand.height, 110 mm),asPer(upstand.height, nzbc_e2as1_t7),include(upstand.height, overlapCover),inBetween(overlapCover, and(cladding, upstand)),greaterThanEqual(overlapCover, 75 mm),include(upstand.height, clearance),has(wallCladding, bottom),or(inBetween(clearance, and(bottom, roofCladding)),inBetween(clearance, and(bottom, finishedDeckMaterial))),greaterThanEqual(clearance, 35 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are for Roof- or deck-to-wall junctions, then the flashing shall have a minimum upstand height of 110 mm, in accordance with Table 7. The upstand height included a overlap cover of cladding to the flashing upstand of minimum 75 mm, and the upstand height includes clearance from bottom of the wall cladding to roof cladding or finished deck material of minimum 35 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.0 Flashings 4.6.1.5 Barges; a) There shall be a minimum effective overlap to the barge board, excluding the drip edge to the flashing, in accordance with Table 7.
LRML: if(is(flashing.type, barge)), then(obligation(and(has(barge, board),towards(flashing.lap, board),is(flashing.lap, minimumEffective),exclude(flashing.lap, dripEdge),towards(dripEdge, flashing),asPer(flashing.lap, nzbc_e2as1_t7))))
PARAPHRASE: If the flashing type is barge, then there shall be a minimum effective overlap to the barge board, excluding the drip edge to the flashing, in accordance with E2/AS1 Table 7.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: All roof-to-wall junctions shall be made weathertight by using an apron flashing as outlined in Paragraph 4.6.1.1, and shown in Figure 7, that: a) Provides a minimum lap under the wall cladding of 75 mm in accordance with Table 7.
LRML: if(is(junction.type, roofToWall)), then(obligation(and(is(junction, weathertight),has(junction, flashing),is(flashing.type, apron),asPer(flashing, and('nzbc_e2as1_4.6.1.1',nzbc_e2as1_t7)),has(flashing, lap),below(lap, wallCladding),greaterThanEqual(lap.size, 75 mm),asPer(lap, nzbc_e2as1_t7))))
PARAPHRASE: If a junction is type roof-to-wall, then the junction shall be weathertight and have an apron flashing as outlined in E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.6.1.1, and shown in E2/AS1 Figure 7. The flashing provides a lap under the wall cladding of minimum size of 75 mm in accordance with E2/AS1 Table 7.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Gutters, barges and fascias: Where eaves gutters/spoutings, barges or fascias terminate against claddings, these shall be installed after the wall cladding, and after any protective finishes have been applied.
LRML: if(or(and(has(eave, gutter), against(gutter.termination, wallCladding)),and(has(eave, barge), against(barge.termination, wallCladding)),and(has(eave, fascia), against(fascia.termination, wallCladding)))), then(obligation(and(after(gutter.installation, and(wallCladding, protectiveFinish)),after(barge.installation, and(wallCladding, protectiveFinish)),after(fascia.installation, and(wallCladding, protectiveFinish)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the eaves has gutters, barges or fascias and the gutters, barges or fascias terminate against claddings, then the gutters, barges and fascias shall be installed after the wall cladding, and after any protective finishes have been applied.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Eaves gutters/spouting, barges and fascias shall terminate so as to leave a gap of 10 mm from the finished wall cladding as shown in Figure 8B.
LRML: if(has(eave, or(gutter, barge, fascia))), then(obligation(and(include(gutter.termination, gap),include(barge.termination, gap),include(fascia.termination, gap),towards(gap, wallCladding),equal(gap.size, 10 mm), asPer(gap, 'nzbc_e2as1_f8.b'))))
PARAPHRASE: If eaves have gutters, barges and fascias, then the gutters, barges and fascias termination shall include a gap of 10 mm to the wall cladding as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 8.b.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Table 2 sets out the risk matrix that shall be used to define the risk score for a building within the scope of this Acceptable Solution. A risk score is calculated for each external face of the building. Claddings are then selected from Table 3 according to the risk scores.
LRML: if(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, building)), then(obligation(and(asPer(riskMatrix, nzbc_e2as1_t2),asPer(building.riskScore, riskMatrix),loop(forEach(building.exteriorFace), and(asPer(exteriorFace.riskScore, riskMatrix),asPer(exteriorFace.cladding, and(riskScore, nzbc_e2as1_t3)))))))

TEXT: Table 2 sets out the risk matrix that shall be used to define the risk score for a building within the scope of this Acceptable Solution. A risk score is calculated for each external face of the building. Claddings are then selected from Table 3 according to the risk scores.
LRML: if(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, building)), then(obligation(and(asPer(riskMatrix, nzbc_e2as1_t2),asPer(building.riskScore, riskMatrix),loop(forEach(building.exteriorFace), and(asPer(exteriorFace.riskScore, riskMatrix),asPer(exteriorFace.cladding, and(riskScore, nzbc_e2as1_t3)))))))

TEXT: All the area within the Christchurch City Council boundary is within Zone 2.
LRML: if(and(within(area, boundary), for(boundary, christchurchCityCouncil))), then(within(area, zone_2))
PARAPHRASE: If an area is within the Christchurch City Council boundary, then the area is within Zone 2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: for a single storey foundation, 15 Series masonry may be used and the minimum footing width may be 190 mm.
LRML: if(for(foundation, singleStorey)), then(permission(and(is(foundation.material,masonry),is(masonry.type, 15 series),greaterThanEqual(footing.width, 190 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the foundation is for a single storey, then the foundations material may be 15 Series masonry and the minimum footing width may be 190 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design 4.0 Earth Buildings 4.1 NZS 4299
LRML: if(is(structure.material, earth)), then(obligation(complyWith(structure.design, nzs_4299)))
PARAPHRASE: If the structure's material is earth, then the structure's design shall comply with NZS 4299
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design 5.0 Stucco 5.1 NZS 4251.

TEXT: Structure Design 5.0 Stucco 5.1 NZS 4251.
LRML: if(is(construction.material, stucco)), then(complyWith(structure.design, nzs_4251))
PARAPHRASE: If the structure's material is stucco, then the structure's design shall comply with NZS 4299.
