TEXT: Structure Design 6.0 Drains 6.1 AS/NZS 2566.1 6.2 AS/NZS 2566.2 6.3 AS/NZS 2032 6.4 AS/NZS 2033.
LRML: if(is(structure, drain)), then(complyWith(structure.design, and(nzs_2566_1, nzs_2566_2, nzs_2032, nzs_2033)))
PARAPHRASE: If the structure is for drains, then the structure's design shall comply with NZS 2566.1 6.2, NZS 2566.2 6.3, NZS 2032 6.4, and NZS 2033.

TEXT: Structure Design 6.0 Drains 6.1 AS/NZS 2566.1 6.2 AS/NZS 2566.2 6.3 AS/NZS 2032 6.4 AS/NZS 2033.
LRML: if(is(structure, drain)), then(complyWith(structure.design, and('nzs_2566_1_6.2', 'nzs_2566_2_6.3', 'nzs_2032_6.4', nzs_2033)))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design 7.0 Glazing 7.1 NZS 4223.1 7.2 NZS 4223.2 7.3 NZS 4223.3.
LRML: if(partOf(glazing, structure)), then(complyWith(glazing.design, and('nzs_4233_1_7.2', 'nzs_4233_2_7.3', nzs_4233_3)))

TEXT: NZS 4223.3 Glass design for these types shall comply with the following tables (see note 1): Table 16 - Structural balustrade – two-edge support;.

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design 7.0 Glazing; Table 14 - Structural balustrade – cantilevered glass; Table 15 - Structural balustrade – two-edge point fixed; Table 16 - Structural balustrade – two-edge support; Table 17 - Structural balustrade – three-edge support. Design types and glass types not shown in Tables 14 to 17 require specific design.
LRML: if(and(is(structure, balustrade), not(is(balustrade.design, and(cantileveredGlass, twoEdgePointFixed, twoEdgeSupport, threeEdgeSupport))))), then(obligation(is(balustrade.design, specificDesign)))

TEXT: Structure Design; The design of structural connections, fasteners and mounting hardware, that are part of the glass barrier, is outside the scope of this Standard and must be specifically designed.
LRML: if(and(has(barrier.material, glass), include(barrier, or(structuralConnection, fastener, mountingHardware)))), then(and(applyTo(nzbc_b1as1, and(structuralConnection, fastener, mountingHardware)),obligation(and(has(connection,specificDesign),has(fastener,specificDesign),has(mountingHardware,specificDesign)))))
PARAPHRASE: If structural connections, fasteners or mounting hardware are included in the glass barrier, then B1/AS1 does not apply to the structural connections, fasteners or mounting hardware and the structural connections, fasteners or mounting hardware shall have a specific design.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.1 Type; The acceptable solutions described in this document are for chimneys built of brickwork, concrete or precast pumice concrete, that are connected to timber frame or masonry buildings complying with NZS 3604 or NZS 4229.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.material, or(brickwork, concrete, precastPumiceConcrete)), connect(chimney, building), is(building.material, or(timberFrame, masonry)), complyWith(building, or(nzs_3604, nzs_4229)))), then(applyTo(nzbc_b1as3, chimney)))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys are built of brickwork, concrete or precast pumice concrete and the chimneys are connected to timber frame buildings or masonry buildings complying with NZS 3604 or NZS 4229, then B1/AS3 applies to the chimney.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The scope of this Acceptable Solution is limited to the materials, products and processes contained herein, for buildings within the scope of NZS 3604, and: a) Up to 3 storeys with a height measured from lowest ground level adjacent to the building to the highest point of the roof (except for chimneys, aerials and the like) of 10 m or less, and b) With floor plan area limited only by seismic and structural control joints, and c) External walls that are vertical, and roofs that are 60° or less above the horizontal.
LRML: if(and(applyTo(nzs_3604, building), lessThanEqual(count(buildingStorey), 3),adjacent(building, groundLevel),define(min(groundLevel.elevation), x0),has(building, roof), define(max(roof.elevation), x1),exclude(max(roof.elevation), or(chimney, aerial)), inBetween(building.height, and(x0, x1)), lessThanEqual(building.height, 10 m),has(building, floorPlanArea), by(floorPlanArea.limit, and(seismicControlJoint, structuralControlJoint)), has(building, externalWall), is(externalWall.orientation, vertical), has(building, roof), lessThanEqual(roof.slope, 60 deg))), then(and(has(building, or(material, product, process)),applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, and(material, product, process))))
PARAPHRASE: If NZS 3604 applies to a building and the building has up to three storeys, and the building height in between the lowest ground level elevation adjacent to the building and the highest elevation of the roof excluding chimneys and aerials of 10 m or less, and the building's floor plan area limited by seismic control joints and structural control joints, and and the building's external walls are oriented vertical, and building roofs that are 60° or less slope, then E2/AS1 applies to the buildings materials, products and processes.

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: b) Expansion joints shall be provided for joined flashings with a combined length exceeding: i) 12 metres for light coloured steel and stainless steel. 8 metres for dark coloured steel, ii) 8 metres for copper, iii) 8 metres for aluminium.
LRML: if(and(is(flashings.material, metal), is(flashings, joined))), then(obligation(or(and(has(flashings, expansionJoint),is(flashings.material, or(lightColouredSteel,stainlessSteel)),greaterThan(sum(flashings.length), 12 m)),and(is(flashings.material,or(lightColouredSteel,stainlessSteel)),lessThanEqual(sum(flashings.length), 12 m)),and(has(flashings, expansionJoint),is(flashings.material,or(darkColouredSteel,copper,aluminium)),greaterThan(sum(flashings.length),8 m)),and(is(flashings.material, or(darkColouredSteel,copper,aluminium)),lessThanEqual(sum(flashings.length),8 m)))))
PARAPHRASE: If metal flashings are joined, then either the flashings shall have expansion joints and the sum of the flashing lengths exceed 12 metres and the flashings shall be light coloured steel or stainless steel, or the sum of the flashing lengths shall not exceed 12 metres and the flashings shall be light coloured steel or stainless steel, or the flashings shall have expansion joints and the sum of the flashing lengths exceed 8 metres and the flashings shall be dark coloured steel, copper or aluminium, or the sum of the flashing lengths shall not exceed 8 metres and the flashings is dark coloured steel, copper or aluminium.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
Cannot be represented in one rule?
joined flashing - has join vs is joined?
Minimum criteria (i.e. combined length) is required in if statement.
In fact it's still not translatable, since the materials should be part of if.

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is limited to membranes composed of butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates for: a) Roofs with a minimum fall of 2° (1:30), b) Decks with: i) a minimum fall of 1.5° (1:40), ii) a maximum area of 40 m2, iii) no steps in level within deck area except into gutters, iv) no integral roof gardens, and v) no downpipe direct discharge to deck, c) Internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100, with no cross seams in the gutters, and d) Decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in Figure 17A.
LRML: if(and(is(membrane.material, or(butyl, epdm)), over(membrane.installation, substrate), is(substrate.material, plywood), or(and(for(membrane, roof), greaterThanEqual(roof.fall, 2 deg)), and(is(membrane.application, deck), greaterThanEqual(deck.fall, 1.5 deg), lessThanEqual(deck.area, 40 m2), not(has(deck.area, stepInLevel)), not(has(deck, and(integralRoofGarden, downpipeDirectDischarge)))), and(is(membrane.application, gutter), is(gutter.type, internal), greaterThanEqual(gutter.fall, 100.0), not(has(gutter, crossSeam))), and(is(membrane.application, deck), has(deck, raisedSurface), is(raisedSurface, removable), for(raisedSurface, levelAccess))))), then(permission(complyWith(membrane, nzbc_e2as1)))
PARAPHRASE: If membranes are material butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates and the membrane is for a roof with a minimum fall of 2° (1:30), b) Decks with: i) a minimum fall of 1.5° (1:40), ii) a maximum area of 40 m2, iii) no steps in level within deck area except into gutters, iv) no integral roof gardens, and v) no downpipe direct discharge to deck, c) Internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100, with no cross seams in the gutters, and d) Decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in Figure 17A.

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is one of three Acceptable Solutions that provide a means of establishing compliance with NZBC Clauses C1 to C6 Protection from Fire. It can be used for the building activities covered by risk groups specified in Paragraph 1.1.1 and described in Table 1.1.
LRML: if(and(complyWith(building, nzbc_cas2), asPer(building.riskGroup, and('nzbc_cas2_1.1.1', 'nzbc_cas2_t1.1')))), then(complyWith(building.fireProtection, and(nzbc_c1, nzbc_c2, nzbc_c3, nzbc_c5, nzbc_c6)))
PARAPHRASE: If a building complies to CAS2 and the building risk groups are in C/AS2 Paragraph 1.1.1 and Table 1.1, then the building complies with NZBC Clauses C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, and C6.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; For risk group SH, please refer to Acceptable Solution C/AS1.
LRML: if(is(building.riskGroup, sh)), then(permission(complyWith(building, nzbc_cas1)))
PARAPHRASE: If the building's risk group is SH, then the building may comply with C/AS1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; For backcountry huts, please refer to Acceptable Solution BCH/AS1.
LRML: if(is(building.activity, backcountryHut)), then(permission(complyWith(building, nzbc_bchas1)))
PARAPHRASE: If the building's activity is backcountry hut, then the building may comply with BCH/AS1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; For backcountry huts, please refer to Acceptable Solution BCH/AS1.
LRML: if(is(building.activity, backcountryHut)), then(permission(complyWith(building, nzbc_bchas1)))
PARAPHRASE: If the building's activity is backcountry hut, then the building may comply with BCH/AS1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.1 The scope of this Acceptable Solution is restricted to all risk groups listed in Table 1.1 except for risk group SH (refer to C/AS1).
LRML: if(and(asPer(building.riskGroup, 'nzbc_cas2_t1.1'), not(is(building.riskGroup, sh)))), then(applyTo(nzbc_cas2, building))
PARAPHRASE: If the building risk group is listed in Table 1.1 and the building's risk group is not SH, then C/AS1 applies to the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Sleep (SM).
LRML: if(or(is(building.activity, sleeping), is(building.riskGroup, sm),and(has(building, part),or(is(part.activity, sleeping),is(part.riskGroup, sm))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_cas2, and(building, part)))
PARAPHRASE: If a buildings or parts of buildings has activity Sleeping or risk group SM, then CAS2 applies to the building and part.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Are unable to self-evacuate without assistance through requiring special care or treatment, or they are restrained, or their liberties are restricted (SI).
LRML: if(or(is(building.activity, or(care, detention)), equal(building.riskGroup, si),and(has(building, part),or(    is(part.activity, or(care, detention)), equal(part.riskGroup, si))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_cas2, and(building, part)))
PARAPHRASE: If a buildings or parts of buildings has activity care or detention or risk group SI, then CAS2 applies to the building and part.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Congregate, participate in group activities or where professional services or retail are provided (CA).
LRML: if(or(is(building.activity, or(crowd, educational, personalService)), equal(building.riskGroup, ca),and(has(building, part),or(    is(part.activity, or(crowd, educational, personalService)), equal(part.riskGroup, ca))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_cas2, and(building, part)))
PARAPHRASE: If a buildings or parts of buildings has activity crowd, educational or personal service or risk group CA, then CAS2 applies to the building and part.

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Work (WB - Business, professional services, industrial).
LRML: if(or(is(building.activity, or(business, professionalService, industrial)), equal(building.riskGroup, wb),and(has(building, part),or(    is(part.activity, or(business, professionalService, industrial)), equal(part.riskGroup, wb))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_cas2, and(building, part)))
PARAPHRASE: If a buildings or parts of buildings has activity business, professional service or industrial or risk group wb, then CAS2 applies to the building and part.

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Work (WB - Business, professional services, industrial).
LRML: if(or(is(building.activity, or(business, professionalService, industrial)), equal(building.riskGroup, wb),and(has(building, part),or(    is(part.activity, or(business, professionalService, industrial)), equal(part.riskGroup, wb))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_cas2, and(building, part)))
PARAPHRASE: If a buildings or parts of buildings has activity business, professional service or industrial or risk group wb, then CAS2 applies to the building and part.

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Store goods and other materials (WS - Storage and trade service).
LRML: if(or(is(building.activity, or(storage, tradeService)), equal(building.riskGroup, ws),and(has(building, part),or(    is(part.activity, or(storage, tradeService)), equal(part.riskGroup, ws))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_cas2, and(building, part)))
PARAPHRASE: If a buildings or parts of buildings has activity storage or trade service or risk group ws, then CAS2 applies to the building and part.

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Park vehicles (VP).
LRML: if(or(is(building.activity, vehicleParking), equal(building.riskGroup, vp),and(has(building, part),or(    is(part.activity, vehicleParking), equal(part.riskGroup, vp))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_cas2, and(building, part)))
PARAPHRASE: If a buildings or parts of buildings has activity vehicle parking or risk group VP, then CAS2 applies to the building and part.

TEXT: 1.2.2 If a building contains a number of different activities which individually may be categorised in different risk groups, the risk group designated for a particular firecell within the building shall be that of the primary risk group. The primary risk group shall be that one within the firecell that has the most onerous fire safety requirements.
LRML: if(greaterThan(count(building.activity), 1)), then(obligation(and(has(building, firecell),is(firecell.riskGroup, primaryRiskGroup),has(building.firecell, riskGroups),define(max(riskgroups.fireSafetyRequirements), x0),is(primaryRiskGroup, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building contains a number of different activities, then the risk group designated for a particular firecell within the building shall be that of the primary risk group. The primary risk group shall be the firecell's risk group that has the maximum fire safety requirements.
COMMENTS:
COMPLEX
riskGroups
Should the primary risk group be handled in a separate rule?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Eaves shall be enclosed by installing soffit linings direct fixed to framing and comprising minimum 4.5 mm fibre cement sheet, or 7 mm H3 plywood, with joints, fixings and finishes as shown in Paragraphs 9.7 and 9.8.
LRML: if(exist(eave)), then(obligation(and(is(eave.enclosing,soffitLining),towards(soffitLining.fixing,framing),is(soffitLining.material,or(fibreCementSheet, h3Plywood)),greaterThanEqual(fibreCementSheet.thickness, 4.5 mm),greaterThanEqual(h3Plywood.thickness, 7 mm),has(soffitLining, and(joint, fixing, finish)),asPer(soffitLining, and('nzbc_e2as1_9.7','nzbc_e2as1_9.8')))))
PARAPHRASE: If eaves exist, then the eave shall have enclosing with soffit linings fixed to framing and the soffit linings shall be minimum 4.5 mm thick fibre cement sheet, or 7 mm thick H3 plywood, the soffit linings shall have joints, fixings and finishes as shown in E2/AS1 Paragraphs 9.7 and 9.8.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Soffit linings shall be finished to fascias, barges and wall claddings as outlined in Figure 8A generally, or Figure 114 for flush finished fibre cement. Wall underlays shall not be required behind soffit linings.
LRML: if(exist(soffitLining)), then(and(obligation(and(towards(soffitLining.finish, and(fascia, barge, wallCladding)),or(and(asPer(soffitLining.finish, nzbc_e2as1_f8a),not(is(soffitLining.material, flushFinishedFibreCement))),and(asPer(soffitLining.finish, nzbc_e2as1_f114),is(soffitLining.material, flushFinishedFibreCement))))), permission(not(behind(wallUnderlay, soffitLining)))))
PARAPHRASE: If soffit linings exist, then soffit linings shall be finished to fascias, barges and wall claddings, and either the Soffit linings finish shall be as outlined in E2/AS1 Figure 8A and the soffit linings material is not flush finished fibre cement, or the Soffit linings finish shall be as outlined in E2/AS1 Figure 114 and the soffit linings material is flush finished fibre cement. There may be no wall underlays behind soffit linings.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 6.1 Limitations; This Acceptable Solution does not cover parapet cappings that use stucco, EIFS and flush-finished fibre cement materials.
LRML: if(and(has(parapet, capping), is(capping.material, or(stucco, eifs, flushFinishedFibreCement)))), then(not(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, capping)))
PARAPHRASE: If the parapet cappings use stucco, EIFS and flush-finished fibre cement materials, then E2/AS1 does not apply to the capping.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Parapets shall be capped with metal, butyl or EPDM membrane. Cappings shall comply with the requirements of Paragraph 4.0.
LRML: if(has(parapet, capping)), then(obligation(and(is(capping.material, or(metal,butyl,epdmMembrane)),complyWith(capping, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.0'))))
PARAPHRASE: If parapets have cappings, then the capping material shall be metal, butyl or EPDM membrane. Cappings shall comply with the requirements of E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.0.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Parapets shall be capped with metal, butyl or EPDM membrane. Cappings shall comply with the requirements of Paragraph 4.0.
LRML: if(has(parapet, capping)), then(obligation(and(is(capping.material, or(metal,butyl,epdmMembrane)),complyWith(capping, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.0'))))
PARAPHRASE: If parapets have cappings, then the capping material shall be metal, butyl or EPDM membrane. Cappings shall comply with E2/AS1 Paragraph 4.0.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades, shall be as outlined in Paragraphs 6.0 and 7.4, and comply with the following requirements: a) Tops of cappings shall be free of any penetrations, b) Slope of top shall be 5° (1:12) minimum, c) The cover at the sides of the capping shall be in accordance with Table 7, d) All cappings shall have drip edges. e) Cappings shall be separated from underlying timber by roof underlay as shown in Figure 10.
LRML: if(and(is(capping.material, metal), above(capping.installation, or(parapet, balustrade)), is(balustrade, enclosed))), then(obligation(and(asPer(capping,and('nzbc_e2as1_6.0', 'nzbc_e2as1_7.4')),define(topOf(capping), x0),not(has(x0,penetration)),greaterThanEqual(x0.slope, 5 deg),has(capping.side, cover),asPer(cover, nzbc_e2as1_t7),has(capping, dripEdge),has(roof,underlay),inBetween(underlay,and(capping,timber)),below(timber, capping),asPer(underlay, nzbc_e2as1_f10))))
PARAPHRASE: If metal cappings are installed over parapets or enclosed balustrades, then the capping shall be as outlined in E2/AS1 Paragraphs 6.0 and 7.4, and the top of cappings shall be free of penetrations, and the slope of the top of the capping shall be 5 deg minimum, and the cover at the sides of the capping shall be in accordance with E2/AS1 Table 7, and the cappings shall have drip edges. The details shown in E2/AS1 Figure 5 are acceptable minimum drip edges for parapets, and roof underlay shall be between cappings and underlying timber as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 10.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades. h) Expansion joints shall be provided for joined cappings with a combined length exceeding: i) 12 metres for light coloured steel and stainless steel, 8 metres for dark coloured steel ii) 8 metres for copper iii) 8 metres for aluminium.
LRML: if(and(is(capping.material, metal), above(capping.installation, or(parapet, balustrade)), is(balustrade, enclosed), has(cappings, join),or(and(is(capping.material,or(lightColouredSteel,stainlessSteel)),greaterThanEqual(sum(cappings.length),12 m)),and(is(capping.material,or(darkColouredSteel,copper,aluminium)),greaterThanEqual(sum(cappings.length),8 m))))), then(obligation(for(expansionJoint,cappings)))
PARAPHRASE: If metal cappings are installed over parapets or enclosed balustrades and cappings are joined and either the capping's combined length exceeds 12 metres and capping material is light coloured steel or stainless steel, or the capping's combined length exceeds 8 metres and the capping material is dark coloured steel, copper, or aluminium, then expansion joints shall be provided for the cappings.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Cappings formed by using stucco, EIFS and flush-finished fibre cement materials shall not be used for parapets, (but may be used for enclosed balustrades as described in Paragraph 7.4).
LRML: if(is(capping.material, or(stucco, eifs, flushFinishedFibreCement))), then(and(prohibition(for(capping, parapet)), permission(and(for(capping, balustrade), is(balustrade, enclosed),asPer(capping, 'nzbc_e2as1_7.4')))))
PARAPHRASE: If the capping material is stucco, EIFS and flush-finished fibre cement, then the capping shall not be used for parapets, but the capping may be used for enclosed balustrades as described in E2/AS1 Paragraph 7.4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.3 Size; The width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed: a) For the foundation and chimney base – brickwork or concrete 1200 mm wide x 1050 mm deep.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.material, or(brickwork, concrete)),has(chimney, or(foundation,chimneyBase)))), then(obligation(and(or(define(foundation.width, x0), define(chimneyBase.width, x0)),is(x0.measurement, alongBuildingLine),or(define(foundation.depth, x1), define(chimneyBase.depth, x1)),is(x1.measurement, perpendicularBuildingLine), lessThanEqual(x0, 1200 mm),lessThanEqual(x1, 1050 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the chimney is brickwork or concrete and has foundation or chimney base, then the foundation or chimney base width (measured along the building line) and the foundation or chimney base depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed 1200 mm width and 1050 mm depth.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.3 Size; The width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed: For a brick chimney stack – single skin (see Figure 2) 500 mm wide x 500 mm deep.
LRML: if(and(is(chimneyStack.material, brick),is(brick.type, singleSkin))), then(obligation(and(define(chimneyStack.width, x0),is(x0.measurement, alongBuildingLine),define(chimneyStack.depth, x1),is(x1.measurement, perpendicularBuildingLine), lessThanEqual(x0, 500 mm),lessThanEqual(x1, 500 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If a chimney stack has material brick type single skin, then the chimney stack width (measured along the building line) and chimney stack depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed 500 mm width and 500 mm depth.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.2.1 Chimney wall thicknesses shall be no less than: Precast pumice concrete 85 mm.
LRML: if(is(chimney.material, precastPumiceConcrete)), then(obligation(and(has(chimney, wall),greaterThanEqual(wall.thickness, 85 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys are precast pumice concrete, then the chimney shall have a wall thicknes of no less than 85 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.3.3 The chimney foundation walls shall be 150 mm thick reinforced concrete, 190 mm thick concrete masonry, or brick construction complying with Figures 2 or 3. Vertical and horizontal reinforcing steel shall be as given in Paragraph 1.6.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, foundation), has(foundation, wall))), then(and(obligation(or(and(greaterThanEqual(wall.thickness,150 mm),is(wall.material,reinforcedConcrete)),and(greaterThanEqual(wall.thickness,190 mm),is(wall.material,concreteMasonry)),and(is(wall.material,brick),complyWith(wall, or(nzbc_b1as3_f2, nzbc_b1as3_f3))))),  obligation(asPer(wall.reinforcingSteel, 'nzbc_b1as3_1.6'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the chimney has foundation walls, then the wall shall be 150 mm thick reinforced concrete, 190 mm thick concrete masonry, or brick construction complying with B1/AS3 Figures 2 or 3. Reinforcing steel shall be as given in B1/AS3 Paragraph 1.6.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.4.1 Hearth slabs shall be of concrete no less than 75 mm thick, reinforced with D10 bars located centrally at 225 mm centres each way. See Figure 1.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, slab), is(slab.type, hearth))), then(obligation(and(is(slab.material,concrete),greaterThanEqual(slab.thickness,75 mm),has(slab,reinforcingSteel),is(reinforcingBar.type,d10),loop(forEach(slab.way), is(reinforcingBar.location, 225 mmCentres))))))
PARAPHRASE: Hearth slabs shall be of concrete no less than 75 mm thick and has reinforcing bar type D10 located at 225 mm centres each way of the slab.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.6.1 Reinforcing of foundation walls and chimney bases (including the gathers) (see Figures 2 to 5 inclusive) shall comprise: a) D12 bars at 400 mm maximum centres vertically. Laps in bars shall be no less than 300 mm. b) R6 bars at 200 mm centres horizontally. These will be in the form of U bars.
LRML: if(partOf(reinforcing, or(foundationWall, chimneyBase, chimneyGather))), then(and(obligation(and(include(reinforcing, reinforcingBar),is(reinforcingBar.type,d12),is(reinforcingBar.location,400 mmCentres),is(reinforcingBar.orientation, vertical),greaterThanEqual(reinforcingBar.lap,300 mm))),obligation(and(include(reinforcing, reinforcingBar),is(reinforcingBar.type,r6),is(reinforcingBar.location,200 mmCentres),is(reinforcingBar.orientation, horizontal),is(reinforcingBar.type,uBar)))))
PARAPHRASE: If reinforcing is part of foundation walls, chimney bases, and chimney gathers, then the reinforching shall include: a) D12 reinforcing bars at 400 mm maximum centres vertically. TEXT: 1.4 Calculating occupant loads 1.4.3 Duplication shall be avoided by: a) Ensuring that, where people may be involved in more than one activity, they are counted only once.
LRML: if(and(has(space, person), within(person, activity), greaterThan(count(activity), 1))), then(obligation(equal(count(person), 1)))
PARAPHRASE: If people are involved in more than one activity, then the people are counted only once.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.4 Calculating occupant loads 1.4.3 Duplication shall be avoided by: Not including an occupant load for exitways, or for the occupant load determined for areas such as lift lobbies or sanitary facilities that are used intermittently by people already counted elsewhere in the building.
LRML: if(and(has(space, person), or(is(space.type, exitway), is(space.usage, intermittent)))), then(obligation(not(has(space, occupantLoad))))
PARAPHRASE: If a space has people but is an exitway or used intermittently, then the space shall have no occupant load.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.4.4 Occupant load assessment shall take account of the actual arrangement and number of seats for fixed seating (see Paragraph 3.7.4). Where additional floor area abuts the fixed seating, additional occupants are permitted in that floor area based on standing space density (see Table 1.2), provided the escape route is not obstructed.
LRML: if(has(space, fixedSeating)), then(and(obligation(and(define(fixedSeating.arrangement, x0), define(count(fixedSeating.seat), x1), asPer(space.occupantLoad, and(x0, x1)))),permission(and(adjoin(floorArea, fixedSeating),define(floorArea.occupantLoad, x2), asPer(floorArea.occupantLoad, standingSpaceDensity), asPer(standingSpaceDensity, 'nzbc_cas2_t1.2'),include(space.occupantLoad, x2),not(has(space.escapeRoute, obstruction))))))
PARAPHRASE: If a space has fixed seating, then the occupant load shall take account of the actual arrangement and number of seats for fixed seating. Floor area adjacent to the fixed seating, the spaces occupant load may include the floor areas occupant load based on standing space density given in Table 1.2, provided the escape route is not obstructed.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.4.7 If, in a particular situation, the occupant load derived from Table 1.2 is clearly more than that which will occur, the basis of any proposal for a lesser occupant load shall be substantiated to the building consent authority.
LRML: if(and(asPer(space.occupantLoad, 'nzbc_cas2_t1.2'), lessThan(space.expectedOccupantLoad, occupantLoad))), then(permission(and(for(space.expectedOccupantLoad, fireSafetyDesign),approve(buildingConsentAuthority, expectedOccupantLoad))))
PARAPHRASE: If the expected occupant load of a space is less than the occupant load of the space as from C/AS2 Table 1.2, then the space's expected occupant load may be used for the fire safety design if the building consent authority shall approve the expected occupant load.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.1.1 The floor area of firecells shall be limited in accordance with Table 2.1.
LRML: if(exist(firecell)), then(obligation(asPer(firecell.floorArea, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.1')))
PARAPHRASE: If a firecell exists, then the floor area of firecells shall be limited in accordance with C/AS2 Table 2.1.

TEXT: 2.2.1 Fire safety system types, as defined in Table 2.2, shall be provided throughout firecells and be as specified in: Table 2.2a for risk groups SM and SI.
LRML: if(is(firecell.riskGroup, or(sm, si))), then(obligation(asPer(firecell.fireSafetySystem, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.2.a')))
PARAPHRASE: If firecells are risk groups SM and SI, then the firecell's fire safety system shall be as specified in C/AS2 Table 2.2a.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.1 Fire safety system types, as defined in Table 2.2, shall be provided throughout firecells and be as specified in: Table 2.2a for risk groups SM and SI.
LRML: if(is(firecell.riskGroup, or(sm, si))), then(obligation(asPer(firecell.fireSafetySystem, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.2.a')))
PARAPHRASE: If firecells are risk groups SM and SI, then the firecell's fire safety system shall be as specified in C/AS2 Table 2.2.a.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.1 Fire safety system types, as defined in Table 2.2, shall be provided throughout firecells and be as specified in: Table 2.2d for risk group VP.
LRML: if(is(firecell.riskGroup, vp)), then(obligation(asPer(firecell.fireSafetySystem, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.2.d')))
PARAPHRASE: If firecells are risk groups VP, then the firecell's fire safety system shall be as specified in Table 2.2.d.

TEXT: A direct connection to Fire and Emergency New Zealand is not required if automatic heat or smoke detection systems are provided in addition to the systems required by this Acceptable Solution.

TEXT: A direct connection to Fire and Emergency New Zealand is not required if automatic heat or smoke detection systems are provided in addition to the systems required by this Acceptable Solution.

TEXT: a) In single storey early childhood centres, dedicated sleeping areas shall be protected with supplementary smoke detectors. The alarm system and any smoke detection system shall comply with NZS 4512.

TEXT: Metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades. h) Expansion joints shall be provided for joined cappings with a combined length exceeding: i) 12 metres for light coloured steel and stainless steel, 8 metres for dark coloured steel ii) 8 metres for copper iii) 8 metres for aluminium.
LRML: if(and(is(capping.material, metal), above(capping.installation, or(parapet, balustrade)), is(balustrade, enclosed), has(cappings, join),or(and(is(capping.material,or(lightColouredSteel,stainlessSteel)),greaterThanEqual(sum(cappings.length),12 m)),and(is(capping.material,or(darkColouredSteel,copper,aluminium)),greaterThanEqual(sum(cappings.length),8 m))))), then(obligation(for(expansionJoint,cappings)))
PARAPHRASE: If metal cappings are installed over parapets or enclosed balustrades and multiple cappings are joined and either the capping's combined length exceeds 12 metres and capping material is light coloured steel or stainless steel, or the capping's combined length exceeds 8 metres and the capping material is dark coloured steel, copper, or aluminium, then expansion joints shall be provided for the cappings.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades. j) Where necessary, expansion joints shall be formed as shown in Figure 9 (g), and with: i) minimum 200 mm laps ii) sliding clips at both sides of the lap.
LRML: if(and(is(capping.material, metal), above(capping.installation, and(parapet, balustrade)), is(balustrade, enclosed))), then(obligation(and(has(capping, expansionJoint),asPer(expansionJoint, 'nzbc_e2as1_f9.g'),has(expansionJoint, lap),greaterThanEqual(lap.size, 200 mm),loop(forEach(lap.side),has(lap.side, slidingClip)))))
PARAPHRASE: If metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades, then the capping shall have expansion joints as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 9.g, and the expansion joint shall have minimum 200 mm sized laps and each side of the lap shall have sliding clips.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Butyl rubber and EPDM cappings shall comply with the following requirements: Joints shall be in accordance with Paragraph 8.5.5.2.
LRML: if(is(capping.material, or(butylRubber, epdm))), then(obligation(asPer(capping.expansionJoint, 'nzbc_e2as1_8.5.5.2')))
PARAPHRASE: If cappings are material butyl rubber and EPDM, then the joints shall be in accordance with E2/AS1 Paragraph 8.5.5.2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Cappings formed by using stucco, EIFS and flush-finished fibre cement materials shall not be used for parapets, (but may be used for enclosed balustrades as described in Paragraph 7.4).
LRML: if(is(capping.material, or(stucco, eifs, flushFinishedFibreCement))), then(and(prohibition(for(capping, parapet)), permission(and(for(capping, balustrade), is(balustrade, enclosed),asPer(capping, 'nzbc_e2as1_7.4')))))
PARAPHRASE: If the capping material is stucco, EIFS and flush-finished fibre cement, then the capping shall not be used for parapets, but the capping may be used for enclosed balustrades as described in E2/AS1 Paragraph 7.4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Timber used to construct decks, enclosed balustrades and other attachments such as pergolas shall comply with B2/AS1.
LRML: if(and(is(construction, or(deck, balustrade, attachment)),is(balustrade, enclosed),similarTo(attachment, pergola),is(construction.material, timber))), then(obligation(complyWith(timber, nzbc_b2as1)))
PARAPHRASE: If the construction is a deck, enclosed balustrade or attachment similar to pergola, and the construction material is timber, then the timber shall comply with B2/AS1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 7.1.1 Slatted decks; The level of the upper surface of the slatted deck: May be at the same level as the threshold for non-cantilevered decks that are formed as shown in Figure 14(c).
LRML: if(and(is(deck, slatted), not(is(deck, cantilevered)),asPer(deck, 'nzbc_e2as1_f14.c'))), then(permission(and(define(deck.thresholdLevel, x0),equal(deck.upperSurfaceLevel, x1))))
PARAPHRASE: If the deck is slatted and not cantilevered and as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 14.c, then the deck's upper surface level may be equal to the deck's threshold level.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: For slatted decks, a minimum gap of 12 mm shall be provided between the exterior wall and the adjacent decking slat.
LRML: if(is(deck, slatted)), then(obligation(and(adjacent(deck.slat, wall),is(wall.type, exterior), inBetween(gap, and(wall, slat)),greaterThanEqual(gap,12 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the deck is slatted, then a gap shall be provided between the exterior wall and the adjacent decking slat, the gap size shall be minimum 12 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 7.1.2 Enclosed decks; This Acceptable Solution is limited to enclosed decks with a maximum area of 40 m2. For enclosed decks, the vertical separation between the opening threshold level and the upper surface of the finished deck surface shall be a minimum of 100 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(deck, enclosed), lessThanEqual(deck.area, 40 m2))), then(and(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, deck), obligation(and(is(deck.surface, finished), define(deck.thresholdLevel, x0),define(deck.upperSurfaceLevel, x1), inBetween(separation, and(x0, x1)),greaterThanEqual(separation, 100 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If enclosed decks have a maximum area of 40 m2, E2/AS1 applies to the deck. The deck surface shall be finished and a separation between the threshold level and the deck's upper surface level shall be a minimum of 100 mm.

separation/gap?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.1.5 Roof underlays; Roof underlays shall be to Table 23 and NZS 2295, and be either: R1 heavy weight kraft, or R2 self supporting kraft.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(underlay, nzs_2295),complyWith(underlay, nzbc_e2as1_t23),is(underlay.type, or(r1HeavyWeightKraft,r2SelfSupportingKraft)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has underlays, then the underlay shall comply with E2/AS1 Table 23 and NZS 2295, and the underlay type shall be R1 heavy weight kraft or R2 self supporting kraft.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Prevent sagging of roof underlay by either: For R1 underlays, fully support with a corrosion resistant material • For R2 self supporting underlays, laid to maximum 1.2 metre span between adjacent supports.
LRML: if(has(roof, underlay)), then(or(obligation(and(is(underlay.type, r1), has(underlay, support),is(support.material, corrosionResistant))), obligation(and(is(underlay.type, r2), is(underlay, selfSupporting),lessThanEqual(underlay.span, 1.2 m),inBetween(underlay.span, adjacentSupports)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has an underlay, then the underlay type shall be either R1 and the underlay shall be fully support with a corrosion resistant material, or the underly shall be type R2 and self supporting and laid to maximum 1.2 metre span between adjacent supports.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.13 Precast pumice concrete chimneys; Precast pumice concrete chimneys shall be restrained at roof level either by a 50 x 1 mm 'U' strap wrapped around the chimney, or by a hot dip galvanised deformed 6 mm reinforcing bar placed into the grout around the reinforcing steel, together with either fixing brackets or fixing ties (see Figure 7(b)). Straps and bars shall satisfy the relevant requirements of Paragraphs 1.7.6 to 1.7.12.
LRML: if(is(chimney.material, precastPumiceConcrete)), then(obligation(and(has(chimney,restraint),is(restraint.location,roof),or(and(by(restraint, uStrap),is(uStrap.size,'50 x 1 mm'),is(chimney.wrapping, uStrap)),and(by(restraint,reinforcingBar),is(reinforcingBar.size, 6 mm),is(reinforcingBar.type,hotDipGalvanised),is(reinforcingBar, deformed),into(reinforcingBar, grout),around(grout, reinforcingSteel),include(restraint,or(bracket,tie)),asPer(restraint, 'nzbc_b1as3_f7.b'))),complyWith(reinforcingBar,'nzbc_b1as3_1.7.6 to nzbc_b1as3_1.7.12'),complyWith(uStrap,'nzbc_b1as3_1.7.6 to nzbc_b1as3_1.7.12'))))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys are precast pumice concrete, then the chimney shall be restrained at roof level either by a 50 x 1 mm 'U' strap wrapped around the chimney, or by a hot dip galvanised deformed 6 mm sized reinforcing bar placed into the grout around the reinforcing steel, the restraint shal include brackets or ties and be as seen in B1AS3 Figure 7.b. 'U' Straps and bars shall satisfy the relevant requirements of B1AS3 Paragraphs 1.7.6 to 1.7.12.

chimney type precast
chimney material pumice concrete ?
fixing brackets/ties?
50 mm x 1 mm?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.14 Fixing brackets (see Figure 7(b)) shall be made from 5.0 mm thick mild steel angle and drilled with: a) A 50 mm diameter hole to suit the reinforcing duct location, and b) A 14 mm diameter hole for the 12 mm diameter coach screw fixing to the double stud.
LRML: if(is(bracket.type, fixing)), then(obligation(and(is(bracket.type,angle),is(bracket.material, mildSteel),equal(bracket.thickness,5 mm),has(bracket,hole),equal(count(hole.type),2),is(hole, drilled),define(hole.type, and(x0, x1)), equal(x0.diameter,50 mm),for(x0,reinforcingDuct),equal(x1.diameter,14 mm),for(x1,screw),is(screw.type, coach),equal(screw.diameter,12 mm),towards(screw.fixing, doubleStud))))
PARAPHRASE: If there are fixing brackets, then the brackets shall be made from 5 mm thick mild steel angle and drilled with two holes. A 50 mm diameter hole to suit the reinforcing duct, and a 14 mm diameter hole for the 12 mm diameter coach screw fixing to the double stud.

TEXT: 1.7.15 Fixing brackets shall be spaced at no less than 320 mm centres for stacks wider than 600 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(bracket.type, fixing), greaterThan(stack.width, 600 mm))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(bracket.spacing, 320 mmCentres)))
PARAPHRASE: If brackets are type fixing and stacks are wider than 600 mm, then the brackets shall be spaced at no less than 320 mm centres.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.16 Fixing ties shall comprise 4 mm galvanised wire hairpins, which are hooked behind the reinforcing ducts and secured to the required adjacent double studding with four heavy duty fencing staples.
LRML: if(is(tie.type, fixing)), then(obligation(and(is(tie.type,wireHairpin),is(wireHairpin.type,galvanised),is(wireHairpin.size,4 mm),behind(tie.hook,reinforcingDuct),towards(tie.fixing,doubleStudding),adjacent(reinforcingDuct, doubleStudding),by(tie.fixing,fencingStaple),is(fencingStaple.type,heavyDuty),equal(count(fencingStaple),4))))
PARAPHRASE: If ties are type fixing, then the ties shall be 4 mm galvanised wire hairpins, which are hooked behind the reinforcing ducts and have fixing to the double studding adjacent to the reinforcing ducts. The ties fixing is done by four heavy duty fencing staples.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Fixing ties shall be located in mortar joints between the units.
LRML: if(is(tie.type, fixing)), then(obligation(and(within(tie.location, mortarJoint),inBetween(mortarJoint.location, units))))
PARAPHRASE: If ties are type fixing, then the ties shall be located in mortar joints between the units.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Fixing Ties; The ties shall be located at no less than 320 mm centres for stacks up to 600 mm wide.
LRML: if(and(is(tie.type, fixing), for(tie, stack),lessThanEqual(stack.width, 600 mm))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(tie.location, 320 mmCentres)))
PARAPHRASE: If the fixing ties are for stacks up to 600 mm wide, then the ties shall be located at no less than 320 mm centres.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.2 Where a packer (see Figures 2, 3, 6 and 7(b)) is shown between the chimney and building it shall be: a) Concrete, brick, steel (angle, channel or Z section), or any insulating material which has a long term operating temperature of no less than 150°C, b) Secured in place to prevent it dislodging, and c) Capable of withstanding a compressive force of 10 kN without shortening by more than 1.5 mm.
LRML: if(inBetween(packer, and(chimney, building))), then(obligation(and(or(is(packer.material,or(concrete,brick,steelAngle,steelChannel,steelZSection)),and(is(packer.material,insulating),has(packer.material,operatingTemperature),greaterThanEqual(operatingTemperature, 150 degC))),has(packer,fixing),has(packer,compressiveResistance),is(compressiveResistance.force,10 kN),lessThanEqual(packer.shortening, 1.5 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If a packer is between the chimney and building, then the packer shall be concrete, brick, steel angle, steel channel or steel Z section, or any insulating material which has a operating temperature of no less than 150 deg C, and the packer shall be fixed, and the packer shall have compressive resistance of 10 kN force without the packer shortening by more than 1.5 mm.

figure?

compressiveResistance - omniclass
force/strength

TEXT: 9.1.3.3 Bottom of wall claddings for concrete ground slabs (except masonry veneer); At concrete slab level, the base of the cladding system shall be as shown in Table 18, and: a) Finish a minimum of: i) 100 mm above a paved surface, or ii) 175 mm above finished unpaved surface, b) Overlap the concrete slab by 50 mm, and c) Be offset horizontally by a minimum of 6 mm for direct fixed claddings to prevent capillary action.
LRML: if(and(not(is(wallCladding.system, masonryVeneer)), adjoin(slab, wallCladding),is(slab.type, ground),is(slab.material, concrete))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(wallCladding.bottom,nzbc_e2as1_t18),or(and(adjoin(surface, wallCladding),is(surface.type, paved),define(surface.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(wallCladding.bottom, 'x0 + 100 mm')),and(adjoin(surface, wallCladding),not(is(surface.type, paved)),define(surface.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(distance, 'x0 + 175 mm'))),has(wallCladding.bottom, lap),towards(lap, slab),equal(lap.size, 50 mm),or(and(has(wallCladding.bottom, offset),is(offset, horizontal),greaterThanEqual(offset.size, 6 mm),is(wallCladding.type, directFixed),prevent(offset, capillaryAction)),not(is(wallCladding.type, directFixed))))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are not masonry veneer and the concrete ground slab adjoins the wall cladding, then the bottom of the wall cladding shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Table 18, and either the wall cladding bottom is at a minimum of 100 mm above a paved surface, or the wall cladding bottom is at a minimum of 175 mm above finished unpaved surface, and the wall cladding bottom overlaps the concrete slab by 50 mm size, and the wall cladding bottom shall be either offset horizontally by a minimum of 6 mm size for direct fixed claddings to prevent capillary action, or the wallcladding shall be not direct fixed.

TEXT: 2.2.4 For risk group VP firecells that require a fire sprinkler system (refer to Table 2.2d), the fire sprinkler system does not need to be extended throughout the remainder of the building where the risk group VP firecells are fire separated from the adjacent firecells. The fire separation between adjacent firecells is required to be provided with the greater of the property rating of the adjacent firecells (refer to Table 2.4).
LRML: if(and(is(firecell.riskGroup, vp), requires(firecell, fireSprinklerSystem), asPer(fireSprinklerSystem, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.2.d'),  has(firecell, fireSeparation), adjacent(firecells, firecell),towards(fireSeparation, firecells),define(max(firecells.propertyRating), x0),asPer(propertyRating, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.4'),is(fireSeparation.fireResistanceRating, x0))), then(permission(not(has(building.remainder, fireSprinklerSystem))))
PARAPHRASE: If the firecell's risk group is VP and the firecell require a fire sprinkler system as per Table 2.2.d and the risk group VP firecells are fire separated from the adjacent firecells and the fire resistance rating of the fire separation is the greater of the property rating of the adjacent firecells, with the property rating as in Table 2.4, then the remainder of the building may not have the fire sprinkler system.
COMMENTS:
adjacentFirecell to avoid problems with comparisons.
fire separation firerating in if
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: All slab-on-ground reinforcing shall extend to within 75 mm of the outside edge of the slab (including the foundation wall) and shall consist of a minimum 2.27kg/m2 welded Grade 500E reinforcing mesh sheets (1.14 kg/m2 in each direction), which shall be lapped at sheet joints such that the overlap measurement between the outermost cross wires of each fabric sheet is equal to the greater of one of the following: the spacing of cross wires plus 50 mm, 150 mm, or the manufacturer's requirements. Slabs shall have a maximum dimension of 18 m between free joints.
LRML: if(and(on(slab, ground),has(slab, reinforcing))), then(obligation(and(define(slab.outsideEdge, x0),within(reinforcing, 'x0 - 75 mm'),is(reinforcing, sheet),is(sheet.material, weldedReinforcingMesh),is(sheet.grade,500e),greaterThanEqual(sheets.weight,2.27 kg/m2),loop(forEach(slab.direction),greaterThanEqual(sheets.weight,1.14 kg/m2)),has(sheets.joint,lap),has(sheets, crossWires),is(crossWires.location, outermost),inBetween(lap.measurement,crossWires),define(crossWires.spacing, x1), greaterThanEqual(lap.measurement, 'x1 + 50 mm'), greaterThanEqual(lap.measurement, 150 mm), greaterThanEqual(lap.measurement, manufacturerRequirement),has(slab, joints), is(joints.type, free), inBetween(slab.dimension,joints),lessThanEqual(slab.dimension,18 m))))
PARAPHRASE: If slabs are on ground and have reinforcing, the reinforcing shall extend to within 75 mm of the outside edge of the slab and the reinforcing shall consist of sheets from welded reinforcing mesh with grade 500E and weight of minimum 2.27kg/m2 and the sheets shall have minimum 1.14 kg/m2 for each direction of the slab, and sheet joints shall be lapped such that the lap measurement is between the outermost cross wires of each fabric sheet and is greater than or equal the spacing of cross wires plus 50 mm, 150 mm, or the manufacturer's requirements. Slabs shall have a maximum dimension of 18 m between free joints.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
sheets?
max out of three values
equal to the greater of one of the following -> greater than equal all of them.
maximum dimension of 18 m -> All dimensions have to be smaller than 18m?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The lowest zone within the Selwyn or Waimakariri District Council boundaries is within Zone 2. Areas within Selwyn District that are designated as Zone 1 in NZS 3604 shall become Zone 2.
LRML: if(or(and(is(zone, lowest),within(zone, boundary), for(boundary, or(selwynDistrictCouncil, waimakaririDistrictCouncil))), and(within(area, selwynDistrictCouncil), is(area, zone_1),asPer(area, nzs_3604)))), then(and(within(zone, zone_2), is(area, zone_2)))
PARAPHRASE: If the zone is the lowest and within the Selwyn District Council or Waimakariri District Council boundaries is within Zone 2, or the areas within Selwyn District Council are designated as Zone 1 in NZS 3604, then the zone is is within Zone 2 and the area is is Zone 2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.8 Wall ties shall be constructed from either 4 mm diameter galvanised bar or 25 x 1.5 mm zinc coated steel strip capable of withstanding a load of 1.2 kN without elongating or shortening by more than 1.5 mm.

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 9.1.3.3 Bottom of wall claddings for concrete ground slabs (except masonry veneer); At concrete slab level, the base of the cladding system shall be as shown in Table 18, and: a) Finish a minimum of: i) 100 mm above a paved surface, or ii) 175 mm above finished unpaved surface, b) Overlap the concrete slab by 50 mm, and c) Be offset horizontally by a minimum of 6 mm for direct fixed claddings to prevent capillary action.

TEXT: 2.3.1 Unless explicitly stated otherwise in this Acceptable Solution, the fire resistance ratings (FRRs) that apply for each risk group shall be in accordance with Table 2.4.
LRML: if(and(not(has(riskGroup.fireResistanceRating, exception)), in(exception, nzbc_cas2))), then(obligation(asPer(riskGroup.fireResistanceRating, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.4')))
PARAPHRASE: If risk groups fire resistance rating has no exception in C/AS2, then the fire resistance ratings for each risk group shall be in accordance with C/AS2 Table 2.4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3.11 Structural framing members connected to building elements with an FRR shall be rated at no less than the building elements to which they are connected.
LRML: if(and(has(building, structuralFramingMember), has(building, element), connect(building.structuralFramingMember, element), has(element, fireResistanceRating))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(structuralFramingMember.fireResistanceRating, fireResistanceRating)))
PARAPHRASE: If the building's structural framing members and elements are connected and the element has a fire resistance rating, then the structural framing member's fire resistance rating shall be no less than the element's fire resistance rating.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.3 If there is more than one risk group on one floor in the building, the highest required FRR shall be applied to common spaces and shared escape routes for that floor level.
LRML: if(and(greaterThan(count(buildingStorey.riskGroup), 1), has(buildingStorey, space),or(is(space.type, common)),and(is(space.type, escapeRoute)),is(escapeRoute, shared))))), then(obligation(and(define(max(riskGroups.fireResistanceRating), x0),equal(space.fireResistanceRating, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If there is more than one risk group on one floor and the floor's space is a common space or shared escape route, then the highest fire resistance rating of the risk groups shall be applied to the space.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.7 The FRR of a primary element integral with a fire separation shall be no less than that of the fire separation.
LRML: if(and(is(element.type, primary), partOf(element, fireSeparation))), then(obligation(and(define(fireSeparation.fireResistanceRating, x0),greaterThanEqual(fireResistanceRating.element, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If a primary element is part of a fire separation, then the element's fire resistance ratings shall be no less than the fire resistance rating of the fire separation.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.6.1 Reinforcing of foundation walls and chimney bases (including the gathers) (see Figures 2 to 5 inclusive) shall comprise: a) D12 bars at 400 mm maximum centres vertically. 'U' Straps and bars shall satisfy the relevant requirements of B1AS3 Paragraphs 1.7.6 to 1.7.12.

TEXT: 1.7.15 Fixing brackets shall be located in mortar joints between the units.

PARAPHRASE: If brackets are type fixing, then the brackets shall be located in mortar joints between the units.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.15 Fixing brackets shall be spaced at no less than 480 mm centres for stacks up to 600 mm wide.
LRML: if(and(is(bracket.type, fixing), lessThanEqual(stack.width, 600 mm))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(bracket.spacing, 480 mmCentres)))
PARAPHRASE: If brackets are type fixing and stacks are up to 600 mm wide, then the brackets shall be spaced at no less than 480 mm centres.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.15 Fixing brackets shall be spaced at no less than 320 mm centres for stacks wider than 600 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(bracket.type, fixing), greaterThan(stack.width, 600 mm))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(bracket.spacing, 320 mmCentres)))
PARAPHRASE: If brackets are type fixing and stacks are wider than 600 mm, then the brackets shall be spaced at no less than 320 mm centres.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.7.16 Fixing ties shall comprise 4 mm galvanised wire hairpins, which are hooked behind the reinforcing ducts and secured to the required adjacent double studding with four heavy duty fencing staples.
LRML: if(is(tie.type, fixing)), then(obligation(and(is(tie.type,wireHairpin),is(wireHairpin.type,galvanised),is(wireHairpin.size,4 mm),behind(tie.hook,reinforcingDuct),towards(tie.fixing,doubleStudding),adjacent(reinforcingDuct, doubleStudding),by(tie.fixing,fencingStaple),is(fencingStaple.type,heavyDuty),equal(count(fencingStaple),4))))
PARAPHRASE: If ties are type fixing, the ties shall be 4 mm galvanised wire hairpins, which are hooked behind the reinforcing ducts and have fixing to the double studding adjacent to the reinforcing ducts. The ties fixing is done by four heavy duty fencing staples.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.9.4 A chimney shall be considered as connected to the building when: At an intermediate floor level: it is held either by a floor bracket or by closely spaced wall ties spanning the floor.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.elevation, intermediateFloor), or(is(chimney.fixing, floorBracket), and(is(chimney.fixing, wallTie), is(wallTie.spacing, close),inBetween(wallTie.span, floor))))), then(connect(chimney, building))
PARAPHRASE: If a chimney at an intermediate floor level is fixed by a floor bracket or by closely spaced wall ties spanning between the floor, then the chimney is considered connected to the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.1.1 Adjoining firecells are required to be fire separated from each other by the highest: a) Life rating specified in Paragraph 2.3 if both firecells are under common ownership, or b) Property rating specified in Paragraph 2.3 if both firecells are under different ownership.
LRML: if(adjoin(firecells)), then(obligation(and(inBetween(fireSeparation, firecells),max(firecells.rating), or(and(define(max(firecells.lifeRating), x0),asPer(firecells.lifeRating, 'nzbc_cas2_2.3.0'), is(fireSeparation.fireResistanceRating, x0), equal(firecells.owner)), and(define(max(firecells.propertyRating), x0),asPer(propertyRating, 'nzbc_cas2_2.3.0'),is(fireSeparation.fireResistanceRating, x0), not(equal(firecells.owner)))))))
PARAPHRASE: If multiple firecells are adjoining, then there shall be a fire separation between the firecells, the fire separation's fire resistance rating shall be either the highest life rating of the firecells as specified in C/AS2 Paragraph 2.3 and both firecells have the same owner, or the fire separation's fire resistance rating shall be the highest property rating of the firecells as specified in C/AS2 Paragraph 2.3 and both firecells have not the same owner.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Firecells shall be fire separated from each other by the higher of the two FRRs if the adjoining firecell has a higher FRR (refer to Paragraph 2.3).
LRML: if(and(adjoin(firecells), not(equal(firecells.fireResistanceRating)))), then(obligation(and(inBetween(fireSeparation, firecells),define(max(firecells.fireResistanceRating), x0),is(fireSeparation.fireResistanceRating, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If the adjoining firecells have different fire resistance ratings, then the firecells shall have fire separation between them, with the greater of the higher of the two fire resistance ratings.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.1 Accessible routes shall be provided to give direct access to the principal entrance to the building where practical.
LRML: if(and(has(building, entrance), is(entrance.type, principal),towards(route, entrance),is(route.type, and(direct, practical)))), then(obligation(is(route, accessibleRoute)))
PARAPHRASE: If the entrance to the building is the principal entrance and the route to the building is direct, and the route's accessibility is practical, then the route shall be the accessible route.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: If it is not practical, the alternative most direct practical route to the space served by the principal entrance shall be used.
LRML: if(and(has(building, entrance), is(entrance.type, principal),towards(route, entrance),is(route.type, direct),not(is(route.type, practical)))), then(obligation(and(for(entrance, space),towards(route, space),is(route.type, and(alternativeMostDirect, practical)),is(route, accessibleRoute))))
PARAPHRASE: If the entrance to the building is the principal entrance and the direct route to the entrance is not practical, then the alternative most direct practical route to the space served by the principal entrance shall be used.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.1 Solid fuel burning domestic appliances weighing no more than 130 kg shall be supported on a 65 mm thick hearth slab that is: a) Reinforced with 665 mesh, or D10 rods at 300 mm centres each way, placed centrally in the slab thickness, b) Supported on a timber or concrete floor, or integral with a concrete floor. (The floor supporting the hearth slab shall comply with NZS 3604 or NZS 4229 as appropriate), and c) Comprised of ordinary grade concrete complying with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109.
LRML: if(and(for(chimney, appliance),is(appliance, burner),is(burner.type, and(solidFuel,domestic)),lessThanEqual(appliance.weight, 130 kg))),then(obligation(and(on(appliance.support, slab), is(slab.type, hearth), greaterThanEqual(slab.thickness, 65 mm), is(slab, reinforcing), or(and(is(reinforcing.type, mesh), is(mesh.size, 665),is(reinforcing.placement, centrallyInSlabThickness)), and(is(reinforcing.type, rod), is(rod.size, d10),loop(forEach(slab.way),is(reinforcing.spacing, 300 mmCentres)),is(reinforcing.placement, centrallyInSlabThickness))), or(and(on(slab.support, floor), is(floor.construction, or(timber, concrete)), complyWith(floor, or(nzs_3604, nzs_4229))), and(partOf(slab, floor), is(floor.construction, concrete))), is(concrete.grade, ordinary), complyWith(concrete.grade, nzs_3109))))
PARAPHRASE: If solid fuel burning domestic appliances are weighing no more than 130 kg, the appliance shall be supported on a 65 mm thick hearth slab, and the slab is reinforced with 665 mesh or D10 rods at 300 mm centres each way, placed centrally in the slab thickness, b) Supported on a timber or concrete floor, or integral with a concrete floor. (The floor supporting the hearth slab shall comply with NZS 3604 or NZS 4229 as appropriate), and c) Comprised of ordinary grade concrete complying with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109.

TEXT: 2.2.3 Hearth slabs on concrete floors shall be secured in position by four D10 starter rods. The rods shall be located in each corner of the hearth slab and they shall terminate each end with standard hooks complying with NZS 3109.
LRML: if(and(is(slab.type, hearth), on(slab, floor), is(floor.material, concrete))), then(obligation(and(is(slab.fixing, rod), is(rod.type, starter),equal(rod.size, d10), greaterThanEqual(count(rod), 4), loop(forEach(slab.corner), and(has(slab.corner, rod), has(rod.end, hook), complyWith(hook, nzs_3109))))))

ORDER
proper quantification is missing - foreach vs any.

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.4.5 The requirements of this Acceptable Solution account for the fact that other people may be present in the building or firecell and additional calculations are not required when an occupant load is derived by bed spaces (i.e. for risk groups SM and SI).
LRML: if(and(define(count(bed), x0), asPer(occupantLoad.calculation, x0),is(space.riskGroup, or(sm, si)))), then(permission(not(and(has(occupantLoad, calculation),is(calculation.type, additional)))))
PARAPHRASE: If an occupant load is calculated by the number of bed spaces and the risk group is SM or SI, additional calculations are not required.

TEXT: 1.4.6 For the purposes of risk group SI the term 'bed' means the number of people that are under care or detention. It can include people on: a) Beds, or b) Recliner or lounge chairs, or c) Dentist chairs, or d) Treatment tables, or e) Any other furniture where an occupant may be for a period of treatment, in care or detention.
LRML: if(is(space.riskGroup, si)), then(and(is(bed, person),within(person, or(care, detention)),include(bed, or(recliner, loungeChair, dentistChair, treatmentTable, treatmentFurniture))))
PARAPHRASE: If the risk group is SI, a bed is a person under care or detention. A beds include recliner or lounge chairs, or dentist chairs, or treatment tables, or treatment furniture.

TEXT: 1.4.7 If, in a particular situation, the occupant load derived from Table 1.2 is clearly more than that which will occur, the basis of any proposal for a lesser occupant load shall be substantiated to the building consent authority.
LRML: if(and(asPer(space.occupantLoad, 'nzbc_cas2_t1.2'), lessThan(space.expectedOccupantLoad, occupantLoad))), then(permission(and(for(space.expectedOccupantLoad, fireSafetyDesign),approve(buildingConsentAuthority, expectedOccupantLoad))))
PARAPHRASE: If the expected occupant load of a space is less than the occupant load of the space as from C/AS2 Table 1.2, the space's expected occupant load may be used for the fire safety design if the building consent authority shall approve the expected occupant load.

TEXT: 1.4.7 If, in a particular situation, the occupant load derived from Table 1.2 is clearly more than that which will occur, the basis of any proposal for a lesser occupant load shall be substantiated to the building consent authority.
LRML: if(and(asPer(space.occupantLoad, 'nzbc_cas2_t1.2'), lessThan(space.expectedOccupantLoad, occupantLoad))), then(permission(and(for(space.expectedOccupantLoad, fireSafetyDesign),approve(buildingConsentAuthority, expectedOccupantLoad))))
PARAPHRASE: If the expected occupant load of a space is less than the occupant load of the space as from C/AS2 Table 1.2, the space's expected occupant load may be used for the fire safety design if the building consent authority shall approve the expected occupant load.

TEXT: 2.2.4 For risk group VP firecells that require a fire sprinkler system (refer to Table 2.2d), the fire sprinkler system does not need to be extended throughout the remainder of the building where the risk group VP firecells are fire separated from the adjacent firecells. The fire separation between adjacent firecells is required to be provided with the greater of the property rating of the adjacent firecells (refer to Table 2.4).
LRML: if(and(is(firecell.riskGroup, vp), requires(firecell, fireSprinklerSystem), asPer(fireSprinklerSystem, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.2.d'),  has(firecell, fireSeparation), adjacent(firecells, firecell),towards(fireSeparation, firecells),define(max(firecells.propertyRating), x0),asPer(propertyRating, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.4'),is(fireSeparation.fireResistanceRating, x0))), then(permission(not(has(building.remainder, fireSprinklerSystem))))
PARAPHRASE: If the firecell's risk group is VP and the firecell require a fire sprinkler system as per Table 2.2.d and the risk group VP firecells are fire separated from the adjacent firecells and the fire resistance rating of the fire separation is the greater of the property rating of the adjacent firecells, with the property rating as in Table 2.4, the fire sprinkler system does not need to be extended throughout the remainder of the building.

adjacentFirecell to avoid problems with comparisons.
firerating in if

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is one of three Acceptable Solutions that provide a means of establishing compliance with NZBC Clauses C1 to C6 Protection from Fire. It can be used for the building activities covered by risk groups specified in Paragraph 1.1.1 and described in Table 1.1.
LRML: if(and(complyWith(building, nzbc_cas2), asPer(building.riskGroup, and('nzbc_cas2_1.1.1', 'nzbc_cas2_t1.1')))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.fireProtection, and(nzbc_c1, nzbc_c2, nzbc_c3, nzbc_c5, nzbc_c6))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building complies to CAS2 and the building risk groups is in CAS2 Paragraph 1.1.1 and Table 1.1, then the building establishing compliance with NZBC Clauses C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, and C6.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is one of three Acceptable Solutions that provide a means of establishing compliance with NZBC Clauses C1 to C6 Protection from Fire. It can be used for the building activities covered by risk groups specified in Paragraph 1.1.1 and described in Table 1.1.

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Congregate, participate in group activities or where professional services or retail are provided (CA).
LRML: if(or(is(building.activity, or(crowd, educational, personalService)), equal(building.riskGroup, ca),and(has(building, part),or(    is(part.activity, or(crowd, educational, personalService)), equal(part.riskGroup, ca))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_cas2, and(building, part)))

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Park vehicles (VP).

TEXT: 1.4.2 Occupant loads shall be calculated from the occupant densities given in Table 1.2 based on the floor area of the part of the building housing the activity. Table 1.2 Occupant densities; Activity; Occupancy density (m2/ person).
LRML: if(has(building.part, activity)), then(and(define(part.floorArea, x0),define(part.occupantDensity, x1), asPer(x1, 'nzbc_cas2_t1.2'),equal(part.occupantLoad, 'x0 * x1')))
PARAPHRASE: If a building part has an activity, then the building part's occupant load shall be calculated by the parts floor area times the part's occupant density as given in C/AS2 Table 1.2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.4.4 Occupant load assessment shall take account of the actual arrangement and number of seats for fixed seating (see Paragraph 3.7.4). Where additional floor area abuts the fixed seating, additional occupants are permitted in that floor area based on standing space density (see Table 1.2), provided the escape route is not obstructed.

PARAPHRASE: If a space has fixed seating, then the occupant load shall take account of the actual arrangement and number of seats for fixed seating. Floor area adjacent to the fixed seating, the spaces occupant load may include the floor areas occupant load based on standing space density given in C/AS2 Table 1.2, provided the escape route is not obstructed.
AUTHOR: Stefan

PARAPHRASE: If the garage is within, or attached to, the building envelope, the garage shall have openings with an interior paving elevation 50 mm minimum greater than the exterior paving elevation, and the garage shall have drainage away from the opening, and the garage shall either have external garage walls and the walls have rigid wall underlays, to E2/AS1 Table 23, and the garage walls have no linings, or the external garage walls shall have linings, and garage walls adjoining habitable spaces shall have linings, and garage doors shall be weather resistant, and garage window and door shall be to E2/AS1 Paragraphs 9.2 to 9.9.

TEXT: 9.1.3.3 Bottom of wall claddings for concrete ground slabs (except masonry veneer); At concrete slab level, the base of the cladding system shall be as shown in Table 18, and: a) Finish a minimum of: i) 100 mm above a paved surface, or ii) 175 mm above finished unpaved surface, b) Overlap the concrete slab by 50 mm, and c) Be offset horizontally by a minimum of 6 mm for direct fixed claddings to prevent capillary action.
LRML: if(and(not(is(wallCladding.system, masonryVeneer)), adjoin(slab, wallCladding),is(slab.type, ground),is(slab.material, concrete))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(wallCladding.bottom,nzbc_e2as1_t18),or(and(adjoin(surface, wallCladding),is(surface.type, paved),define(surface.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(wallCladding.bottom, 'x0 + 100 mm')),and(adjoin(surface, wallCladding),not(is(surface.type, paved)),define(surface.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(wallCladding.bottom, 'x0 + 175 mm'))),has(wallCladding.bottom, lap),towards(lap, slab),equal(lap.size, 50 mm),or(and(has(wallCladding.bottom, offset),is(offset, horizontal),greaterThanEqual(offset.size, 6 mm),is(wallCladding.type, directFixed),prevent(offset, capillaryAction)),not(is(wallCladding.type, directFixed))))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are not masonry veneer and the concrete ground slab adjoins the wall cladding, then the bottom of the wall cladding shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Table 18, and either the wall cladding bottom is at a minimum of 100 mm above a paved surface, or the wall cladding bottom is at a minimum of 175 mm above finished unpaved surface, and the wall cladding bottom overlaps the concrete slab by 50 mm size, and the wall cladding bottom shall be either offset horizontally by a minimum of 6 mm size for direct fixed claddings to prevent capillary action, or the wallcladding shall be not direct fixed.

TEXT: 2.0.1 Suspended floors and slabs on ground shall be at least 150 mm above the finished level of the surrounding ground immediately adjacent to the building.
LRML: if(or(is(floor.type, suspended),on(slab, ground))), then(obligation(and(adjacent(ground, building),define(ground.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(floor.elevation, 'x0 + 150 mm'),greaterThanEqual(slab.elevation, 'x0 + 150 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If floors are type suspended or slabs are on ground, then the elevation of the floor and slab shall be at least 150 mm above the elevation of the ground adjacent to the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.0.1 Suspended floors and slabs on ground shall be, for sites below the road, no less than 150 mm above the lowest point on the site boundary (see Figure 2).
LRML: if(and(lessThan(site.elevation, road),or(is(floor.type, suspended),on(slab, ground)))), then(obligation(and(define(min(siteBoundary.elevation), x0),greaterThanEqual(floor.elevation,'x0 + 150 mm'),greaterThanEqual(slab.elevation,'x0 + 150 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If sites are below the road and floors are suspended or slabs are on ground, then the floors and slabs shall be no less than 150 mm above the lowest point on the site boundary.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.1.1 Pipe materials shall comply with the standards given in Table 1.
LRML: if(exist(pipe)), then(obligation(complyWith(pipe.material, nzbc_e1as1_t1)))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes exist, then the pipe materials shall comply with the standards given in E1/AS1 Table 1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.1.1 Pipe materials shall comply with the standards given in Table 1.
LRML: if(exist(pipe)), then(obligation(complyWith(pipe.material, nzbc_e1as1_t1)))
PARAPHRASE: If pipes exist, then the pipe materials shall comply with E1/AS1 Table 1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Drains shall be capable of handling the rainfall during a storm. No drain shall have an internal diameter of less than 85 mm.
LRML: if(exist(drain)), then(obligation(and(for(drain, stormWater),greaterThanEqual(drain.internalDiameter, 85 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If drains exist, then the drains shall be for storm water. Drain shall have an internal diameter of no less than 85 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.2.2 Figure 3 provides a method for selecting the correct pipe size for a calculated modified catchment area, given as: Modified catchment area = 0.01 Al, where A = area being drained comprising plan roof area (m2) plus paved area (m2), and l is rainfall intensity.
LRML: if(exist(modifiedCatchmentArea)), then(and(define(planRoof.area, x0), define(pavement.area, x1), define(rainfallIntensity, x2),equal(modifiedCatchmentArea, '0.01 * (x0 + x1) * x2'),permission(and(for(pipe, modifiedCatchmentArea),asPer(pipe.size, nzbc_e1as1_f3)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a pipe is for the modified catchment area, the modified catchment area equals 0.01 Al, where A is the plan roof area plus paved area and l is rainfall intensity, the pipe for the modified catchment area may have a pipe size as provided in E1/AS1 Figure 3.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The change in direction of a drain shall not exceed 90° at any point.
LRML: if(has(drain, changeInDirection)), then(obligation(lessThan(changeInDirection, 90 deg)))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain has a change in direction, then the change in direction shall not exceed 90 deg.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The change in direction of a drain where practical should be kept to less than 45° as illustrated in Figure 4.
LRML: if(and(has(drain, changeInDirection), is(changeInDirection.smallChange, practical))), then(obligation(lessThan(changeInDirection, 45 deg)))
PARAPHRASE: If a small change in direction of a drain is practical, then the change in direction should be less than 45 deg.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.3.2 Where two drains intersect, the directions of flow as shown in Figure 5 shall be at an angle of 60° or less.
LRML: if(intersect(drains)), then(obligation(lessThanEqual(drains.flowDirection, 60 deg)))
PARAPHRASE: If drains intersect, then the flow directions shall be 60 deg or less.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.3.2 Where two drains intersect, the directions of flow as shown in Figure 5 shall be at an angle of 60° or less.
LRML: if(intersect(drains)), then(obligation(lessThanEqual(drains.flowDirection, 60 deg)))
PARAPHRASE: If drains intersect, then the drain's flow directions shall be 60 deg or less.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.4.1 Minimum acceptable gradients for surface water drains are given in Table 2.
LRML: if(is(drain.type, surfaceWater)), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(drain.gradient, value),asPer(value, nzbc_e1as1_t2))))
PARAPHRASE: If the drain is a surface water drain, then the drains gradients shall be greater or equal as the value given in Table 2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.4 For risk group VP firecells that require a fire sprinkler system (refer to Table 2.2d), the fire sprinkler system does not need to be extended throughout the remainder of the building where the risk group VP firecells are fire separated from the adjacent firecells. The fire separation between adjacent firecells is required to be provided with the greater of the property rating of the adjacent firecells (refer to Table 2.4).
LRML: if(and(is(firecell.riskGroup, vp), requires(firecell, fireSprinklerSystem), asPer(fireSprinklerSystem, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.2.d'),  has(firecell, fireSeparation), adjacent(firecells, firecell),towards(fireSeparation, firecells),define(max(firecells.propertyRating), x0),asPer(propertyRating, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.4'),is(fireSeparation.fireResistanceRating, x0))), then(permission(not(has(building.remainder, fireSprinklerSystem))))
PARAPHRASE: If the firecell's risk group is VP and the firecell require a fire sprinkler system as per Table 2.2.d and the risk group VP firecells are fire separated from the adjacent firecells and the fire resistance rating of the fire separation is the greater of the property rating of the adjacent firecells, with the property rating as in Table 2.4, the fire sprinkler system does not need to be extended throughout the remainder of the building.
COMMENTS:
adjacentFirecell to avoid problems with comparisons.
firerating in if
