TEXT: 2.1.1 The floor area of firecells shall be limited in accordance with Table 2.1.
LRML: if(exist(firecell)), then(obligation(asPer(firecell.floorArea, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.1')))
PARAPHRASE: If a firecell exists, then the floor area of firecells shall be limited in accordance with C/AS2 Table 2.1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.1 Fire safety system types, as defined in Table 2.2, shall be provided throughout firecells and be as specified in: Table 2.2a for risk groups SM and SI.
LRML: if(is(firecell.riskGroup, or(sm, si))), then(obligation(asPer(firecell.fireSafetySystem, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.2.a')))
PARAPHRASE: If firecells are risk groups SM and SI, then the firecell's fire safety system shall be as specified in Table 2.2a.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.1 Fire safety system types, as defined in Table 2.2, shall be provided throughout firecells and be as specified in: Table 2.2b for risk group CA.
LRML: if(is(firecell.riskGroup, ca)), then(obligation(asPer(firecell.fireSafetySystem, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.2.b')))
PARAPHRASE: If firecells are risk group CA, then the firecell's fire safety system shall be as specified in Table 2.2.b.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.1 Fire safety system types, as defined in Table 2.2, shall be provided throughout firecells and be as specified in: Table 2.2c for risk groups WB and WS.
LRML: if(is(firecell.riskGroup, or(wb, ws))), then(obligation(asPer(firecell.fireSafetySystem, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.2.c')))
PARAPHRASE: If firecells are risk groups WB and WS, then the firecell's fire safety system shall be as specified in Table 2.2.c.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.1 Fire safety system types, as defined in Table 2.2, shall be provided throughout firecells and be as specified in: Table 2.2d for risk group VP.
LRML: if(is(firecell.riskGroup, vp)), then(obligation(asPer(firecell.fireSafetySystem, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.2.d')))
PARAPHRASE: If firecells are risk groups VP, then the firecell's fire safety system shall be as specified in Table 2.2.d.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: A direct connection to Fire and Emergency New Zealand is not required if automatic heat or smoke detection systems are provided in addition to the systems required by this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(and(has(space.fireSafetySystem, supplementary), is(fireSafetySystem.type, or(heatDetection, smokeDetection)), is(fireSafetySystem.type, automatic))), then(permission(not(has(fireSafetySystem, fireServiceDirectConnection))))
PARAPHRASE: If a space has an supplementary fire safety system for automatic heat or smoke detection, then a fire service direct connection is not required.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: the fire safety systems required for firecells in early childhood centres shall be as follows: Where the escape height of the early childhood centre is greater than 2.0 m, a Type 7 system shall be installed throughout the building.
LRML: if(and(is(firecell.activity, earlyChildhoodCentre), greaterThan(firecell.escapeHeight, 2 m))), then(obligation(is(building.fireSafetySystem, type_7)))
PARAPHRASE: If the firecell activity is early childhood centre and the firecell escape height is greater than 2.0 m, then a Type 7 fire safety system shall be installed throughout the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.4 For risk group VP firecells that require a fire sprinkler system (refer to Table 2.2d), the fire sprinkler system does not need to be extended throughout the remainder of the building where the risk group VP firecells are fire separated from the adjacent firecells. The fire separation between adjacent firecells is required to be provided with the greater of the property rating of the adjacent firecells (refer to Table 2.4).

TEXT: 2.3.11 Structural framing members connected to building elements with an FRR shall be rated at no less than the building elements to which they are connected.
LRML: if(and(has(building, structuralFramingMember), has(building, element), connect(building.structuralFramingMember, element), has(element, fireResistanceRating))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(structuralFramingMember.fireResistanceRating, fireResistanceRating)))
PARAPHRASE: If the building's structural framing members and elements are connected and the element has a fire resistance rating, then the structural framing member's fire resistance rating shall be no less than the element's fire resistance rating.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.3 Fire resistance ratings 2.3.6 Floors shall have an FRR for exposure from the underside.
LRML: if(exist(floor)), then(obligation(has(floor.underside, fireResistanceRating)))
PARAPHRASE: If a floor exists, then the underside of floors shall have an fire resistance ratings.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.1.1 All buildings shall have means of escape from fire which include escape routes. An escape route (see Figure 3.1) shall provide protection to any occupant escaping to a safe place from a fire within a building.
LRML: if(exist(building)), then(obligation(and(has(building,meansOfEscapeFromFire),include(meansOfEscapeFromFire,escapeRoute),has(escapeRoute, fireProtection))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building exists, then the building shall have means of escape from fire which include escape routes. An escape route shall provide protection from fire.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.1.2 The components of an escape route, in ascending order of protection, are the: a) Open paths, and b) Exitways, and c) Final exits (see Figure 3.1). Two or more of these components will be necessary.
LRML: if(include(escapeRoute.component, and(openPath, exitway, finalExit))), then(obligation(and(define(openPath.degreeOfProtection, x0), define(exitway.degreeOfProtection, x1), greaterThan(exitway.degreeOfProtection, x0),greaterThan(finalExit.degreeOfProtection, x1),greaterThanEqual(count(escapeRoute.component), 2))))
PARAPHRASE: If the component of an escape route includes Open paths, and Exitways, and Final exits, then the exitway's degree of protection shall be greater than the open path's degree of protection, and the final exit's degree of protection shall be greater than the exitway's degree of protection. Two or more of the escape route's components will be necessary.
COMMENTS:
COMPLEX
repeat allthough defined for readability?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 9.1.3.5 Bottom of wall claddings for timber floor framing; At ground floor level, the base of the cladding system shall: a) Overlap the timber floor structure by 50 mm minimum, and b) For walls with direct fixed claddings, be offset horizontally from a concrete foundation wall by a minimum of 6 mm c) Have no direct connection between sub-floor spaces and drained cavities.
LRML: if(and(adjoin(floor, wallCladding),is(floor.material, timber), is(floor.level, ground))), then(obligation(and(has(wallCladding.bottom, lap),towards(lap, foor),equal(lap.size, 50 mm),or(and(has(wallCladding.bottom, offset),is(offset, horizontal),towards(offset, wall),is(wall.type, foundation),is(wall.material, concrete),greaterThanEqual(offset.size, 6 mm),is(wallCladding.type, directFixed)),not(is(wallCladding.type, directFixed))),has(cladding, drainedCavity), not(towards(drainedCavity.directConnection, subFloorSpace)))))
PARAPHRASE: If timber floor framing adjoins the wall cladding and the floor is at ground level, then the wall cladding bottom overlaps the floor by 50 mm size, and the wall cladding bottom shall be either offset horizontally from a concrete foundation wall by a minimum of 6 mm size for direct fixed claddings, or the wallcladding shall be not direct fixed, and the wall cladding's drained cavities shall have no direct connection to sub-floor spaces.

TEXT: 9.1.3.5 Bottom of wall claddings for timber floor framing; At ground floor level, the base of the cladding system shall: a) Overlap the timber floor structure by 50 mm minimum, and b) For walls with direct fixed claddings, be offset horizontally from a concrete foundation wall by a minimum of 6 mm c) Have no direct connection between sub-floor spaces and drained cavities.
LRML: if(and(adjoin(floor, wallCladding),is(floor.material, timber), is(floor.level, ground))), then(obligation(and(has(wallCladding.bottom, lap),towards(lap, foor),equal(lap.size, 50 mm),or(and(has(wallCladding.bottom, offset),is(offset, horizontal),towards(offset, wall),is(wall.type, foundation),is(wall.material, concrete),greaterThanEqual(offset.size, 6 mm),is(wallCladding.type, directFixed)),not(is(wallCladding.type, directFixed))),has(cladding, drainedCavity), not(towards(drainedCavity.directConnection, subFloorSpace)))))
PARAPHRASE: If timber floor framing adjoins the wall cladding and the floor is at ground level, then the wall cladding bottom overlaps the floor by 50 mm size, and the wall cladding bottom shall be either offset horizontally from a concrete foundation wall by a minimum of 6 mm size for direct fixed claddings, or the wallcladding shall be not direct fixed, and the wall cladding's drained cavities shall have no direct connection to sub-floor spaces.
COMMENTS: prohibition vs obligation for last one?

TEXT: 9.1.3.5 Bottom of wall claddings for timber floor framing; At ground floor level, the base of the cladding system shall: a) Overlap the timber floor structure by 50 mm minimum, and b) For walls with direct fixed claddings, be offset horizontally from a concrete foundation wall by a minimum of 6 mm c) Have no direct connection between sub-floor spaces and drained cavities.

COMMENTS: prohibition vs obligation for last one?

TEXT: Barrier to airflow for external walls shall be in form of: a) Interior linings with all joints stopped for wind zones up to Very High, or b) Rigid underlays (and drained cavities) for buildings in Extra High wind zones - refer to Paragraph 9.1.7.2 c) Where walls are not lined, such as attic spaces at gable ends, an air barrier complying with Table 23, fixed to framing prior to fixing cladding or cavity battens d) For attached garages, underlays to Paragraph 9.1.3.4.
LRML: if(and(is(wall.type, external), has(wall, barrier),against(barrier, airflow))), then(or(obligation(and(by(barrier, interiorLining),is(interiorLining.joint,stopped),lessThanEqual(building.windZone, veryHigh))), obligation(and(by(barrier,and(underlay,drainedCavity)),is(underlay,rigid),is(building.windZone,extraHigh),asPer(underlay, 'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.7.2'),asPer(underlay, 'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.7.2'))), obligation(and(not(has(wall, lining)),is(barrier.type, airBarrier),complyWith(barrier, nzbc_e2as1_t23),has(wall,framing),towards(barrier.fixing,framing),before(barrier.fixing, and(cladding, cavityBatten)))), obligation(and(partOf(wall,garage),is(garage,attached),by(barrier, underlay),asPer(underlay, 'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.3.4')))))
PARAPHRASE: If an external wall has a barrier against airflow, the barrier shall be in form of interior linings with all joints stopped for buildings in wind zones up to Very High, or the barrier shall be by rigid underlays and drained cavities for buildings in Extra High wind zones - refer to E2/AS1 Paragraph 9.1.7.2, or the walls are not lined and the barrier shall be an air barrier complying with E2/AS1 Table 23, fixed to framing prior to claddings or cavity battens, or if the wall is part of an attached garages, the barrier shall be by underlays to Paragraph 9.1.3.4.

TEXT: 3.4.1 Minimum acceptable gradients for surface water drains are given in Table 2.

TEXT: 3.6.1 All surface water, except that collected directly from a roof, shall enter the drain via a sump.

garage spaces? space type?

TEXT: 9.1.3.4 Garages and openings to garages; Garage spaces within, or attached to, the building envelope shall have: a) Openings provided with a 50 mm minimum total level change between the interior and the exterior paving, b) Provision to drain water away from the threshold of the opening c) Rigid wall underlays, to Table 23, where external garage walls are unlined d) linings to garage walls adjoining habitable spaces e) weather resisting garage doors f) window and door details (where included) to Paragraphs 9.2 to 9.9.

TEXT: 3.1.2 Exitways (these may comprise of smoke lobbies and safe paths).
LRML: if(exist(exitway)), then(permission(include(exitway, or(smokeLobby, safePath))))
PARAPHRASE: If an exitway exists, then the exitway may include smoke lobbies and safe paths.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.1.4 Escape routes shall comply with NZBC D1.
LRML: if(exist(escapeRoute)), then(obligation(complyWith(escapeRoute, nzbc_d1)))
PARAPHRASE: If escape routes exist, then the escape routes shall comply with NZBC D1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Ramps, stairs, ladders, landings, handrails, doors, vision panels and openings shall comply with Acceptable Solution D1/AS1.
LRML: if(is(building.element, or(ramp, stair, ladder, landing, handrail, door, visionPanel, opening))), then(obligation(complyWith(building.element, nzbc_d1as1)))
PARAPHRASE: If the building's elements are ramps, stairs, ladders, landings, handrails, doors, vision panels and openings, then the building's element shall comply with D1/AS1.
COMMENTS:
building elements / element?
Check for usage of object instead of element?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.1 Accessible routes shall be provided to give direct access to the principal entrance to the building where practical.
LRML: if(and(has(building, entrance), is(entrance.type, principal),towards(route, entrance),is(route.type, and(direct, practical)))), then(obligation(is(route, accessibleRoute)))
PARAPHRASE: If the entrance to the building is the principal entrance and the route to the building is direct, and the route's accessibility is practical, then the route shall be the accessible route.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.3 Where accessible units of Community service buildings are provided, an accessible route shall connect all accessible units to reception areas, offices, shops, dining rooms, kitchens, laundries, ablution blocks, recreation rooms and any other communal facilities.
LRML: if(and(is(building.activity, communityService), has(building, unit), is(unit, accessible))), then(obligation(and(inBetween(accessibleRoute, and(unit, communalFacility)),include(communalFacility, and(reception, office, shop, diningRoom, kitchen, laundry, ablutionBlock, recreationRoom)))))
PARAPHRASE: If community service buildings have accessible units, then there shall be accessible routes between units and communal facilities. Communal facilities shall include reception areas, offices, shops, dining rooms, kitchens, laundries, ablution blocks, recreation rooms.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.3 Where accessible units of Community service buildings are provided, an accessible route shall connect all accessible units to reception areas, offices, shops, dining rooms, kitchens, laundries, ablution blocks, recreation rooms and any other communal facilities.

PARAPHRASE: If community service buildings have accessible units, then an accessible route shall be between units and communal facilities. Communal facilities shall include reception areas, offices, shops, dining rooms, kitchens, laundries, ablution blocks, recreation rooms.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.4 Figure 1 illustrates an acceptable solution with provision for people with disabilities to approach buildings.

PARAPHRASE: If a building exists, then the building's accessibility route may comply with D1/AS1 Figure 1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.3.1 Except in household units (risk group SH1) or where permitted by Paragraph 1.3.2, a single isolated step shall not be permitted.
LRML: if(and(not(is(building.classifiedUse, housing)),not(is(building.riskGroup, sh1)),not(is(building.singleIsolatedStep, permitted)),by(permitted, 'nzbc_d1as1_1.3.2'))), then(prohibition(has(building, singleIsolatedStep)))
PARAPHRASE: If a building is not classified as housing and not has risk group SH1 or where a a single isolated step for the building is permitted by D1/AS1 1.3.2, then it shall not be permitted that the building has a single isolated step.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Access Route; Single Isolated Step 1.3.2 Threshold weather stops projecting no more than 20 mm above the threshold finished surface are acceptable.

PARAPHRASE: If access routes exist, the access routes shall have height clearances complying with D1/AS1 Table 1 and as shown in D1/AS1 Figure 3.

TEXT: 2.0.1 Suspended floors and slabs on ground shall be at least 150 mm above the finished level of the surrounding ground immediately adjacent to the building.

TEXT: 2.0.1 Suspended floors and slabs on ground shall be at least 150 mm above the finished level of the surrounding ground immediately adjacent to the building.

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: b) Expansion joints shall be provided for joined flashings with a combined length exceeding: i) 12 metres for light coloured steel and stainless steel. 8 metres for dark coloured steel, ii) 8 metres for copper, iii) 8 metres for aluminium.
LRML: if(and(is(flashings.material, metal), is(flashings, joined))), then(obligation(or(and(has(flashings, expansionJoint),is(flashings.material, or(lightColouredSteel,stainlessSteel)),greaterThan(sum(flashings.length), 12 m)),and(is(flashings.material,or(lightColouredSteel,stainlessSteel)),lessThanEqual(sum(flashings.length), 12 m)),and(has(flashings, expansionJoint),is(flashings.material,or(darkColouredSteel,copper,aluminium)),greaterThan(sum(flashings.length),8 m)),and(is(flashings.material, or(darkColouredSteel,copper,aluminium)),lessThanEqual(sum(flashings.length),8 m)))))
PARAPHRASE: If metal flashings are joined, then either the flashings shall have expansion joints and the sum of the flashing lengths exceed 12 metres and the flashings shall be light coloured steel or stainless steel, or the sum of the flashing lengths shall not exceed 12 metres and the flashings shall be light coloured steel or stainless steel, or the flashings shall have expansion joints and the sum of the flashing lengths exceed 8 metres and the flashings shall be dark coloured steel, copper or aluminium, or the sum of the flashing lengths shall not exceed 8 metres and the flashings is dark coloured steel, copper or aluminium.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
Cannot be represented in one rule?
joined flashing - has join vs is joined?
Minimum criteria (i.e. combined length) is required in if statement.
In fact it's still not translatable, since the materials should be part of if.

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: b) Expansion joints shall be provided for joined flashings with a combined length exceeding: i) 12 metres for light coloured steel and stainless steel. 8 metres for dark coloured steel, ii) 8 metres for copper, iii) 8 metres for aluminium.
LRML: if(and(is(flashings.material, metal), is(flashings, joined))), then(obligation(or(and(has(flashings, expansionJoint),is(flashings.material, or(lightColouredSteel,stainlessSteel)),greaterThan(sum(flashings.length), 12 m)),and(is(flashings.material,or(lightColouredSteel,stainlessSteel)),lessThanEqual(sum(flashings.length), 12 m)),and(has(flashings, expansionJoint),is(flashings.material,or(darkColouredSteel,copper,aluminium)),greaterThan(sum(flashings.length),8 m)),and(is(flashings.material, or(darkColouredSteel,copper,aluminium)),lessThanEqual(sum(flashings.length),8 m)))))
PARAPHRASE: If metal flashings are joined, then either the flashings shall have expansion joints and the sum of the flashing lengths exceed 12 metres and the flashings shall be light coloured steel or stainless steel, or the sum of the flashing lengths shall not exceed 12 metres and the flashings shall be light coloured steel or stainless steel, or the flashings shall have expansion joints and the sum of the flashing lengths exceed 8 metres and the flashings shall be dark coloured steel, copper or aluminium, or the sum of the flashing lengths shall not exceed 8 metres and the flashings is dark coloured steel, copper or aluminium.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE COMPLEX
Since the rule was not broken down, a separate negation case needed to be added into the then.
Cannot be represented in one rule?
joined flashing - has join vs is joined?
Minimum criteria (i.e. combined length) is required in if statement.
In fact it's still not translatable, since the materials should be part of if.

TEXT: 3.6 Surface water inlets to drains; Via a sump which has: A submerged (or trapped) outlet which prevents floatable solids entering the drain.
LRML: if(exist(sump)), then(obligation(and(has(sump, outlet),is(outlet, or(submerged, trapped)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a sump exists, the sump shall have a submerged or trapped outlet.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.2 Points of access shall be spaced at no further than: a) 50 m where rodding points are used.
LRML: if(is(accessPoint, roddingPoint)), then(obligation(lessThanEqual(accessPoint.spacing, 50 m)))
PARAPHRASE: If access points are rodding points, then the access points shall be spaced at no further than 50 m.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.2 Points of access shall be spaced at no further than: a) 50 m where rodding points are used.
LRML: if(is(accessPoint, roddingPoint)), then(obligation(lessThanEqual(accessPoint.spacing, 50 m)))
PARAPHRASE: If access points are rodding points, then the access points shall be spaced at no further than 50 m.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.6 Surface water inlets to drains; Via a sump which has: A submerged (or trapped) outlet which prevents floatable solids entering the drain.
LRML: if(exist(sump)), then(obligation(and(has(sump, outlet),is(outlet, or(submerged, trapped)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a sump exists, then the sump shall have a submerged or trapped outlet.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.6 Surface water inlets to drains; Via a sump which has: Capacity at the bottom for settlement of silt and debris.
LRML: if(exist(sump)), then(obligation(and(has(sump.bottom, capacity),for(capacity, settlement),is(settlement, and(silt, debris)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a sump exists, then the sump shall have capacity at the bottom for settlement of silt and debris.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.6 Surface water inlets to drains; Via a sump which has: a) A grating, hinged or removable for maintenance access. The grating shall comprise at least 35% openings. The smaller dimension of any individual opening shall not exceed 35 mm.
LRML: if(exist(sump)), then(obligation(and(has(sump, grating),is(grating, or(hinged, removable)),has(grating, openings),define(grating.area, x0),greaterThanEqual(openings.area, '0.35 * x0'),lessThanEqual(min(opening.dimension), 35 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If a sump exists, then the sump shall have a grating that is hinged or removable. The grating shall have openings, where the openings area is at least 35 percent of the gratings area. The smaller dimension of any individual opening shall not exceed 35 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.2 Points of access shall be spaced at no further than: 100 m where inspection points, inspection chambers or access chambers are used.
LRML: if(is(accessPoint, or(inspectionPoint, inspectionChamber, accessChamber))), then(obligation(lessThanEqual(accessPoint.spacing, 100 m)))
PARAPHRASE: If access points are inspection points, inspection chambers or access chambers, then the access points shall be spaced at no further than 100 m.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.3 Points of access are required at: Changes in gradient of greater than 45°.
LRML: if(and(has(drain, changeInGradient), greaterThan(changeInGradient, 45 deg))), then(obligation(and(has(drain,accessPoint),is(accessPoint.location,changeInGradient))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain has changes in gradient of greater than 45 deg, then the drain shall have an access point at the change in gradient.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.3 Points of access are required at: Junctions of drains other than a drain, serving a single downpipe, that is less than 2.0 m long.
LRML: if(and(has(drain, junction), not(and(into(drain.flow, downpipe), equal(count(downpipe), 1), lessThan(downpipe.length, 2 m))))), then(and(obligation(has(drain, accessPoint)), obligation(is(accessPoint.location, junction))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain has a junction, and the drain flows not into a single downpipe, that is less than 2 m long, then the drain shall have an access point at the junction.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
flow?
Nest and in not?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.3 Points of access are required at: Junctions of drains other than a drain, serving a single downpipe, that is less than 2.0 m long.
LRML: if(and(has(drain, junction), not(and(into(drain.flow, downpipe), equal(count(downpipe), 1), lessThan(downpipe.length, 2 m))))), then(obligation(and(has(drain,accessPoint),is(accessPoint.location,junction))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain has a junction, and the drain flows not into a single downpipe, that is less than 2 m long, then the drain shall have an access point at the junction.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
flow?
Nest and in not?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.4 Inspection chambers or access chambers (see Figures 11 and 12) shall be provided where changes in both gradient and direction occur and where either is greater than 22.5°.
LRML: if(and(include(drain, and(changeInDirection, changeInGradient)), define(changeInGradient.location, x0), define(changeInDirection.location, x1), equal(x0, x1), or(greaterThan(changeInDirection, 22.5 deg), greaterThan(changeInGradient, 22.5 deg)))), then(obligation(and(has(drain, accessPoint),is(accessPoint.type, or(inspectionChamber, accessChamber)),is(accessPoint.location, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If changes in both gradient and direction occur in the same location and the change in gradient or change in direction is greater than 22.5 deg, then access points shall be provided as inspection chambers or access chambers at the location of the change.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.4 Inspection chambers or access chambers (see Figures 11 and 12) shall be provided where changes in both gradient and direction occur and where either is greater than 22.5°.
LRML: if(and(include(drain, and(changeInDirection, changeInGradient)), define(changeInGradient.location, x0), equal(changeInDirection.location, x0), or(greaterThan(changeInDirection, 22.5 deg), greaterThan(changeInGradient, 22.5 deg)))), then(obligation(and(has(drain, accessPoint),is(accessPoint.type, or(inspectionChamber, accessChamber)),is(accessPoint.location, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If changes in both gradient and direction occur in the same location and the change in gradient or change in direction is greater than 22.5 deg, then access points shall be provided as inspection chambers or access chambers at the location of the change.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.6 Drain under buildings; Any drain laid under a building shall be run in a straight line from one side to the other.
LRML: if(below(drain.section, building)), then(prohibition(include(drain.section, changeInDirection)))
PARAPHRASE: If the drain's section is under a building, the drain's section shall not include any changes in direction.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Rodding points rather than inspection points are preferred in landscaped or sealed areas.
LRML: if(is(area, or(landscaped, sealed))), then(is(accessPoint.preference, roddingPoint))
PARAPHRASE: If an area is landscaped or sealed, then the access points are preferred to be rodding points.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 9.1.3.5 Bottom of wall claddings for timber floor framing; At ground floor level, the base of the cladding system shall: a) Overlap the timber floor structure by 50 mm minimum, and b) For walls with direct fixed claddings, be offset horizontally from a concrete foundation wall by a minimum of 6 mm c) Have no direct connection between sub-floor spaces and drained cavities.

TEXT: 9.1.3.5 Bottom of wall claddings for timber floor framing; At ground floor level, the base of the cladding system shall: a) Overlap the timber floor structure by 50 mm minimum, and b) For walls with direct fixed claddings, be offset horizontally from a concrete foundation wall by a minimum of 6 mm c) Have no direct connection between sub-floor spaces and drained cavities.

TEXT: 9.1.3.5 Bottom of wall claddings for timber floor framing; At ground floor level, the base of the cladding system shall: a) Overlap the timber floor structure by 50 mm minimum, and b) For walls with direct fixed claddings, be offset horizontally from a concrete foundation wall by a minimum of 6 mm c) Have no direct connection between sub-floor spaces and drained cavities.

TEXT: Structure Design 1.1 B1/AS1 contains Acceptable Solutions for Masonry (Paragraph 2.0), Timber (Paragraph 3.0), Earth Buildings (Paragraph 4.0) and Stucco (Paragraph 5.0), Drains (Paragraph 6.0) and Glazing (Paragraph 7.0).
LRML: if(or(is(structure.material, or(masonry, timber, earth, stucco)), for(structure, drain), partOf(glazing, structure))), then(applyTo(nzbc_b1as1, structure))
PARAPHRASE: If the structure materials are Masonry, Timber, Earth or Stucco, or structures for Drains or glazing is part of structures, then B1/AS1 applies to the structure.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.1.3 NZS 4229; Grade 500E welded steel mesh; Where Grade 500E welded steel mesh is specified, it shall meet the requirements of Paragraph 14.0 in B1/VM1.
LRML: if(is(weldedSteelMesh.grade, 500e)), then(obligation(complyWith(weldedSteelMesh, nzbc_b1vm1_14)))
PARAPHRASE: If Grade 500E welded steel mesh is used, then the welded steel mesh shall meet the requirements of Paragraph 14.0 in B1/VM1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.0.1 Suspended floors and slabs on ground: a) For sites level with or above the road shall no less than 150 mm above the road crown.
LRML: if(and(greaterThanEqual(site.elevation, road),or(is(floor.type, suspended),on(slab, ground)))), then(obligation(and(define(roadCrown.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(floor.elevation,'x0 + 150 mm'),greaterThanEqual(slab.elevation,'x0 + 150 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the site's elevation is with or above the road and floors are suspended and slabs are on ground, then the floors and slabs shall be no less than 150 mm above the road crown.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Drains shall be capable of handling the rainfall during a storm. No drain shall have an internal diameter of less than 85 mm.
LRML: if(exist(drain)), then(obligation(and(for(drain, stormWater),greaterThanEqual(drain.internalDiameter, 85 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If drains exist, then the drains shall be for storm water. Drain shall have an internal diameter of no less than 85 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.2.2 Figure 3 provides a method for selecting the correct pipe size for a calculated modified catchment area, given as: Modified catchment area = 0.01 Al, where A = area being drained comprising plan roof area (m2) plus paved area (m2), and l is rainfall intensity.
LRML: if(exist(modifiedCatchmentArea)), then(and(permission(and(for(pipe, modifiedCatchmentArea),asPer(pipe.size, nzbc_e1as1_f3))),define(planRoof.area, x0), define(pavement.area, x1), define(rainfallIntensity, x2),equal(modifiedCatchmentArea, '0.01 * (x0 + x1) * x2')))
PARAPHRASE: If a modified catchment area exists, the pipe for the modified catchment area may have a pipe size as provided in E1/AS1 Figure 3 and the modified catchment area equals 0.01 Al, where A is the plan roof area plus paved area and l is rainfall intensity.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.3.1 Drains shall be laid on a uniform line and gradient between points of access (see Paragraph 3.7).
LRML: if(inBetween(drain.section, accessPoints)), then(obligation(not(include(drain.section, and(changeInDirection, changeInGradient)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drains section is between points of access, then the drain section shall not include any changes in direction and gradient.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.4.1 Minimum acceptable gradients for surface water drains are given in Table 2.
LRML: if(is(drain.type, surfaceWater)), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(drain.gradient, value),asPer(value, nzbc_e1as1_t2))))
PARAPHRASE: If the drain is a surface water drain, then the drains gradients shall be greater or equal as the value given in Table 2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.0 Drainage System Materials and Construction; 3.4.2 Restricted fall to outlet; Where the surface water sewer, road channel or other outfall is at too high a level to allow the gradient required by Table 2, the bubble-up chamber system shown in Figures 6 and 7 may be used.
LRML: if(and(greaterThan(outfall.elevation, value), asPer(value, nzbc_e1as1_t2))), then(permission(has(drain, bubbleupChamber)))
PARAPHRASE: If the outfall elevation has a greater value as required by E1/AS1 Table 2, then the drain may have a bubble-up chamber.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
include(outfall, or(water sewer, road channel, other outfal) seems problematic, so removed it?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The ground level adjacent to any downpipe discharging to the bubble-up chamber is at least 150 mm higher than the level of the top of the chamber outlet.
LRML: if(into(downpipe.discharge, bubbleupChamber)), then(obligation(and(adjacent(ground, downpipe), define(topOf(bubbleupChamber.outlet), x0),define(x0.elevation, x1),greaterThanEqual(ground.elevation, 'x1 + 150'))))
PARAPHRASE: If adownpipe is discharging to the bubble-up chamber, then the elevation of the ground adjacent to the downpipe shall be at least 150 mm higher than the elevation of the top of the bubble-up chamber outlet.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.0 Drainage System Materials and Construction; The bubble-up chamber system shown in Figures 6 and 7 may be used provided that: The connections between the drain and downpipes are sealed.
LRML: if(has(drain, bubbleupChamber)), then(obligation(and(inBetween(connection,and(drain,downpipe)),is(connection,sealed))))
PARAPHRASE: If the drain has a bubble-up chamber, then the connections between the drain and downpipes shall be sealed.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.0 Drainage System Materials and Construction; The bubble-up chamber system shown in Figures 6 and 7 may be used provided that: The total chamber depth does not exceed 1.0 m.
LRML: if(has(drain, bubbleupChamber)), then(obligation(lessThanEqual(bubbleupChamber.depth, 1 m)))
PARAPHRASE: If the drain has a bubble-up chamber, then the total bubble-up chamber depth shall not exceed 1.0 m.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.0 Drainage System Materials and Construction; The bubble-up chamber system shown in Figures 6 and 7 may be used provided that: The total chamber depth does not exceed 1.0 m.
LRML: if(has(drain, bubbleupChamber)), then(obligation(lessThanEqual(bubbleupChamber.depth, 1 m)))
PARAPHRASE: If the drain has a bubble-up chamber, then the bubble-up chamber depth shall not exceed 1 m.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is limited to membranes composed of butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates for: a) Roofs with a minimum fall of 2° (1:30), b) Decks with: i) a minimum fall of 1.5° (1:40), ii) a maximum area of 40 m2, iii) no steps in level within deck area except into gutters, iv) no integral roof gardens, and v) no downpipe direct discharge to deck, c) Internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100, with no cross seams in the gutters, and d) Decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in Figure 17A.
LRML: if(and(is(membrane.material, or(butyl, epdm)), above(membrane.installation, substrate), is(substrate.material, plywood), or(and(for(membrane, roof), greaterThanEqual(roof.fall, 2 deg)), and(for(membrane, deck), greaterThanEqual(deck.fall, 1.5 deg), lessThanEqual(deck.area, 40 m2), not(has(deck, and(stepInLevel, integralRoofGarden))), not(and(towards(downpipe.discharge, deck),is(downpipe.discharge, direct))), and(is(membrane, gutter), is(gutter.type, internal), greaterThanEqual(gutter.fall, 1/100), not(within(crossSeam, gutter))), and(is(membrane.application, deck), has(deck, raisedSurface), is(raisedSurface, removable), for(raisedSurface, levelAccess),asPer(levelAccess, 'nzbc_e2as1_f17.a'))))), then(permission(complyWith(membrane, nzbc_e2as1)))
PARAPHRASE: If membranes are material butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates and either the membrane is for a roof with a minimum fall of 2 deg, or the membrane is for decks with a minimum fall of 1.5 deg, and the decka has a maximum area of 40 m2, and the deck has no steps in level and the deck has no integral roof gardens and no downpipe direct discharge, or the membranes are for internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100 and there are no cross seams in the gutters, or the membrane is for decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in Figure 17.a.
COMMENTS:
fall vs slope
Removed exception in iv?

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is limited to membranes composed of butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates for: a) Roofs with a minimum fall of 2° (1:30), b) Decks with: i) a minimum fall of 1.5° (1:40), ii) a maximum area of 40 m2, iii) no steps in level within deck area except into gutters, iv) no integral roof gardens, and v) no downpipe direct discharge to deck, c) Internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100, with no cross seams in the gutters, and d) Decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in Figure 17A.

TEXT: 9.1.3.3 Bottom of wall claddings for concrete ground slabs (except masonry veneer); At concrete slab level, the base of the cladding system shall be as shown in Table 18, and: a) Finish a minimum of: i) 100 mm above a paved surface, or ii) 175 mm above finished unpaved surface, b) Overlap the concrete slab by 50 mm, and c) Be offset horizontally by a minimum of 6 mm for direct fixed claddings to prevent capillary action.
LRML: if(and(not(is(wallCladding.system, masonryVeneer)), adjoin(slab, wallCladding),is(slab.type, ground),is(slab.material, concrete))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(wallCladding.bottom,nzbc_e2as1_t18),or(and(adjoin(surface, wallCladding),is(surface.type, paved),define(surface.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(wallCladding.bottom, 'x0 + 100 mm')),and(adjoin(surface, wallCladding),not(is(surface.type, paved)),define(surface.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(distance, 'x0 + 175 mm'))),has(wallCladding.bottom, lap),towards(lap, slab),equal(lap.size, 50 mm),or(and(has(wallCladding.bottom, offset),is(offset, horizontal),greaterThanEqual(offset.size, 6 mm),is(wallCladding.type, directFixed),prevent(offset, capillaryAction)),not(is(wallCladding.type, directFixed))))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are not masonry veneer and the concrete ground slab adjoins the wall cladding, then the bottom of the wall cladding shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Table 18, and either the wall cladding bottom is at a minimum of 100 mm above a paved surface, or the wall cladding bottom is at a minimum of 175 mm above finished unpaved surface, and the wall cladding bottom overlaps the concrete slab by 50 mm size, and the wall cladding bottom shall be either offset horizontally by a minimum of 6 mm size for direct fixed claddings to prevent capillary action, or the wallcladding shall be not direct fixed.

TEXT: Rodding points rather than inspection points are preferred in landscaped or sealed areas.
LRML: if(is(area, or(landscaped, sealed))), then(is(accessPoint.preference, roddingPoint))
PARAPHRASE: If an area is landscaped or sealed, then the access points are preferred to be rodding points.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The maximum moisture contents shall be: For reconstituted wood products, 18% at all times.
LRML: if(and(is(product.material, wood), is(wood.type, reconstituted))), then(obligation(lessThanEqual(product.moistureContent, 18 percent)))
PARAPHRASE: If products are wood that is reconstituted, then the product's maximum moisture contents shall be 18 percent.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 10.3 Measuring moisture content 10.3.2 Concrete floors; Measurement shall be made in accordance with BRANZ Bulletin 330 Thin Flooring Materials using hygrometers calibrated to ASTM E 104 - 2002 Standard practice for maintaining constant relative humidity by means of aqueous solutions.
LRML: if(is(floor.material, concrete)), then(obligation(and(has(floor, moistureContent),asPer(moistureContent.measurement,branzBulletin_330),by(moistureContent.measurement,hygrometer),asPer(hygrometer.calibration,astm_e_104_2002))))
PARAPHRASE: If floors are concrete, then the measurement of the floor's moisture content shall be made in accordance with BRANZ Bulletin 330 using hygrometers with calibration to ASTM E 104 - 2002.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Cladding systems shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2.2 to E2.3.7.
LRML: if(exist(claddingSystem)), then(obligation(complyWith(claddingSystem, 'nzbc_e2_2 to nzbc_e2_3.7'))))
PARAPHRASE: Cladding systems shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2 2 to NZBC E2.3.7.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Cladding systems shall meet the requirements of NZBC E2.2 to E2.3.7.

TEXT: Materials used to construct the building envelope shall be designed as a complete cladding system rather than as separate items.
LRML: if(include(building.envelope, material)), then(and(obligation(is(material.design, claddingSystem)), prohibition(is(material.design, item))))
PARAPHRASE: If the building envelope includes a material, the material shall be designed as a cladding system and the material shall be not designed as item.

completeCladdingSystem? separateItem?
reduced to claddingSystem, and item?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Finish colours for flush-finished fibre cement sheet and EIFS shall have a reflectivity of 40% or more when measured in accordance with ASTM C1549.
LRML: if(or(and(is(fibreCementSheet.type, flushFinished), has(fibreCementSheet, finishColour)), has(eifs, finishColour))), then(obligation(and(has(finishColour, reflectivity),greaterThanEqual(reflectivity,40 percent),asPer(reflectivity.measurement,astm_c1549))))
PARAPHRASE: If flush-finished fibre cement sheet or EIFS have finish colours, then the finish colour shall have a reflectivity of 40 percent or more when the reflectivity measurement is in accordance with ASTM C1549.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Finish colours for flush-finished fibre cement sheet and EIFS shall have a reflectivity of 40% or more when measured in accordance with ASTM C1549.
LRML: if(or(and(is(fibreCementSheet.type, flushFinished), has(fibreCementSheet, finishColour)), has(eifs, finishColour))), then(obligation(and(has(finishColour, reflectivity),greaterThanEqual(reflectivity,40 percent),asPer(reflectivity.measurement,astm_c1549))))
PARAPHRASE: If flush-finished fibre cement sheet or EIFS have finish colours, then the finish colour shall have a reflectivity of 40 percent or more when the reflectivity measurement is in accordance with ASTM C1549.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Table 1 sets out the definitions of risk levels relating to the location and design features of the building.
LRML: if(has(building, or(location, designFeature))), then(and(for(riskLevel, and(location, designFeature)),asPer(riskLevel.definition, nzbc_e2as1_t1)))
PARAPHRASE: If the building has a location or design feature, then the definitions of the risk level for the location and design feature are described in E2/AS1 Table 1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Risk score 3.4.1.1 As all faces score low, cladding options from Table 3 are: a) Direct fixed claddings: i) Timber weatherboards – all types shown ii) Fibre cement weatherboards iii) Vertical profiled metal – corrugated and symmetrical trapezoidal only iv) Fibre cement sheet – not flush-finished v) Plywood sheet.
LRML: if(and(has(building.faces, riskScore),is(riskScore, low))), then(permission(and(has(building, cladding),has(cladding, fixing),is(fixing, direct),is(cladding.type, or(timberWeatherboard, fibreCementWeatherboard, verticalProfiledMetal, fibreCementSheet, plywoodSheet)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the risk scores for all faces of the building are low, then the building cladding may be direct fixed and be of type Timber weatherboards, Fibre cement weatherboards, Vertical profiled metal, Fibre cement sheet, or Plywood sheet.
COMMENTS:
Example
should forEach be used?
Relevant information removed?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.2.2 Surrounding materials; Metals which are in contact in locations where they will become wet, or where water can flow over metals or certain plastics onto another metal, shall be selected in accordance with Table 21 and Table 22.
LRML: if(and(is(material, metal), has(material.exposure, water))), then(obligation(asPer(material, and(nzbc_e2as1_t21, nzbc_e2as1_t22))))
PARAPHRASE: If the material is metals and has exposure to water, then the material shall be in accordance with E2/AS1 Table 21 and Table 22.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.2.2 Surrounding materials; Uncoated metals shall not be used where carbon deposits or chemical contaminants may accumulate.
LRML: if(and(has(material, accumulation),is(accumulation.type, and(carbonDeposit, chemicalContamination)))), then(prohibition(and(is(material, metal),is(metal.type, uncoated))))
PARAPHRASE: If the material has accumulation of carbon deposits or chemical contaminants, then the material shall not be metals that are uncoated.
AUTHOR: Stefan

PARAPHRASE: If the garage is within, or attached to, the building envelope, the garage shall have openings provided with a 50 mm minimum total level change between the interior and the exterior paving, b) Provision to drain water away from the threshold of the opening c) Rigid wall underlays, to Table 23, where external garage walls are unlined d) linings to garage walls adjoining habitable spaces e) weather resisting garage doors f) window and door details (where included) to Paragraphs 9.2 to 9.9.

TEXT: 3.5.1 All joints in drains shall be watertight and prevent the infiltration of groundwater and the intrusion of tree roots.
LRML: if(has(drain, joint)), then(obligation(and(is(joint,watertight),prevent(joint,and(groundwaterInfiltration,treeRootIntrusion)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the drain has joints, the joints shall be watertight and prevent the infiltration of groundwater and the intrusion of tree roots.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.6 Surface water inlets to drains; Via a sump which has: a) A grating, hinged or removable for maintenance access. The grating shall comprise at least 35% openings. The smaller dimension of any individual opening shall not exceed 35 mm.
LRML: if(exist(sump)), then(obligation(and(has(sump, grating),is(grating, or(hinged, removable)),has(grating, openings),define(grating.area, x0),greaterThanEqual(openings.area, '0.35 * x0'),lessThanEqual(min(opening.dimension), 35 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If a sump exists, the sump shall have a grating that is hinged or removable. The grating shall have openings, where the openings area is at least 35% of the gratings area. The smaller dimension of any individual opening shall not exceed 35 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.6 Surface water inlets to drains; Via a sump which has: a) A grating, hinged or removable for maintenance access. The grating shall comprise at least 35% openings. The smaller dimension of any individual opening shall not exceed 35 mm.
LRML: if(exist(sump)), then(obligation(and(has(sump, grating),is(grating, or(hinged, removable)),has(grating, openings),define(grating.area, x0),greaterThanEqual(openings.area, '0.35 * x0'),lessThanEqual(min(opening.dimension), 35 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If a sump exists, the sump shall have a grating that is hinged or removable. The grating shall have openings, where the openings area is at least 35 percent of the gratings area. The smaller dimension of any individual opening shall not exceed 35 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.6 Surface water inlets to drains; Via a sump which has: Capacity at the bottom for settlement of silt and debris.
LRML: if(exist(sump)), then(obligation(and(has(sump.bottom, capacity),for(capacity, settlement),is(settlement, and(silt, debris)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a sump exists, the sump shall have capacity at the bottom for settlement of silt and debris.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.1 Access for maintenance shall be provided on all drains.
LRML: if(exist(drain)), then(obligation(has(drain, accessPoint)))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain exists, then the drain shall have access points.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.3 Points of access are required at: Changes in direction of greater than 45°,.
LRML: if(and(has(drain, changeInDirection), greaterThan(changeInDirection, 45 deg))), then(obligation(and(has(drain,accessPoint),is(accessPoint.location,changeInDirection))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain has changes in direction of greater than 45 deg, then the drain shall have an access point at the change in direction
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.3 Points of access are required at: Junctions of drains other than a drain, serving a single downpipe, that is less than 2.0 m long.
LRML: if(and(has(drain, junction), not(and(into(drain.flow, downpipe), equal(count(downpipe), 1), lessThan(downpipe.length, 2 m))))), then(obligation(and(has(drain,accessPoint),is(accessPoint.location,junction))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain has a junction, and the drain flows not into a single downpipe, that is less than 2 m long, then the drain shall have an access point at the junction.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
flow?
Nest and in not?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.4 Inspection chambers or access chambers (see Figures 11 and 12) shall be provided where changes in both gradient and direction occur and where either is greater than 22.5°.
LRML: if(and(include(drain, and(changeInDirection, changeInGradient)), define(changeInGradient.location, x0), equal(changeInDirection.location, x0), or(greaterThan(changeInDirection, 22.5 deg), greaterThan(changeInGradient, 22.5 deg)))), then(obligation(and(has(drain, accessPoint),is(accessPoint.type, or(inspectionChamber, accessChamber)),is(accessPoint.location, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If changes in both gradient and direction occur in the same location and the change in gradient or change in direction is greater than 22.5 deg, then access points shall be provided as inspection chambers or access chambers at the location of the change.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.4 Inspection chambers or access chambers (see Figures 11 and 12) shall be provided where changes in both gradient and direction occur and where either is greater than 22.5°.
LRML: if(and(include(drain, and(changeInDirection, changeInGradient)), define(changeInGradient.location, x0), equal(changeInDirection.location, x0), or(greaterThan(changeInDirection, 22.5 deg), greaterThan(changeInGradient, 22.5 deg)))), then(obligation(and(has(drain, accessPoint),is(accessPoint.type, or(inspectionChamber, accessChamber)),is(accessPoint.location, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If changes in both gradient and direction occur in the same location and the change in gradient or change in direction is greater than 22.5 deg, then access points shall be provided as inspection chambers or access chambers at the location of the change.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.5 Where the depth to the invert of the drain exceeds 1.0 m, an inspection chamber is not acceptable and an access chamber shall be used.
LRML: if(and(towards(drain.depth, invert), greaterThan(drain.depth, 1 m))), then(and(prohibition(is(accessPoint.type, inspectionChamber)), obligation(is(accessPoint.type, accessChamber))))
PARAPHRASE: IF the depth to the invert of the drain exceeds 1 m, then an inspection chamber is not acceptable as access point but an access chamber shall be used.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.5 Where the depth to the invert of the drain exceeds 1.0 m, an inspection chamber is not acceptable and an access chamber shall be used.
LRML: if(and(towards(drain.depth, invert), greaterThan(drain.depth, 1 m))), then(and(prohibition(is(accessPoint.type, inspectionChamber)), obligation(is(accessPoint.type, accessChamber))))
PARAPHRASE: IF the depth to the invert of the drain exceeds 1 m, then an inspection chamber is not acceptable as access point but an access chamber shall be used.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.6 Drain under buildings; Any drain laid under a building shall be run in a straight line from one side to the other.
LRML: if(below(drain.section, building)), then(prohibition(include(drain.section, changeInDirection)))
PARAPHRASE: If the drain's section is under a building, the drain's section shall not include any changes in direction.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.8 Under a building the only acceptable inlets to a drain are from sealed roof-water downpipes.
LRML: if(below(drain.inlet, building)), then(obligation(and(is(inlet.type, downpipe),is(downpipe.type, sealed),for(downpipe, roofWater))))
PARAPHRASE: If the drain inlet is under the building, then the inlet shall be a sealed roof-water downpipe.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design 3.0 Timber 3.1 NZS 3604.

PARAPHRASE: If the material of a structure is timer, then the structures design shall comply with NZS 3604.

TEXT: At free joints, slab reinforcement shall be terminated and there shall be no bonding between vertical concrete faces (prevented by using building paper or a bituminous coating).

bonding between faces? connect?
delete bonding?

TEXT: All the area within the Christchurch City Council boundary is within Zone 2.

TEXT: 4.2.2 Surrounding materials; Uncoated metals shall not be used where carbon deposits or chemical contaminants may accumulate.

TEXT: uPVC flashings shall be a minimum of 0.75 mm thick. uPVC flashings shall comply with the requirements of the following Clauses of AS/NZS 4256: Part 2: a) Clause 9.2 Impact resistance, b) Clause 9.3 Tensile strength, and c)  Clause 9.4 Colourfastness and impact resistance following ultraviolet light exposure.
LRML: if(is(flashing.material, uPvc)), then(obligation(and(greaterThanEqual(flashing.thickness,0.75 mm),complyWith(flashing,and('nzs_4256_2_9.2','nzs_4256_2_9.3','nzs_4256_2_9.4')))))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Barrier to airflow for external walls shall be in form of: a) Interior linings with all joints stopped for wind zones up to Very High, or b) Rigid underlays (and drained cavities) for buildings in Extra High wind zones - refer to Paragraph 9.1.7.2 c) Where walls are not lined, such as attic spaces at gable ends, an air barrier complying with Table 23, fixed to framing prior to fixing cladding or cavity battens d) For attached garages, underlays to Paragraph 9.1.3.4.

PARAPHRASE: If an external wall has a barrier against airflow, the barrier shall be in form of interior linings with all joints stopped for buildings in wind zones up to Very High, or the barrier shall be by rigid underlays and drained cavities for buildings in Extra High wind zones - refer to E2/AS1 Paragraph 9.1.7.2, or the walls are not lined and the barrier shall be an air barrier complying with E2/AS1 Table 23, fixed to framing prior to claddings or cavity battens, or if the wall is part of an attached garages, the barrier shall be by underlays to Paragraph 9.1.3.4.

TEXT: 2.1.1 Chimneys for solid fuel burning appliances shall comply with Paragraph 1.0 or with the relevant sections of AS/NZS 3869 and AS/NZS 2918 for sheetmetal chimneys.

TEXT: 2.2.1 Solid fuel burning domestic appliances weighing no more than 130 kg shall be supported on a 65 mm thick hearth slab that is: a) Reinforced with 665 mesh, or D10 rods at 300 mm centres each way, placed centrally in the slab thickness, b) Supported on a timber or concrete floor, or integral with a concrete floor. (The floor supporting the hearth slab shall comply with NZS 3604 or NZS 4229 as appropriate), and c) Comprised of ordinary grade concrete complying with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109.

TEXT: 2.2.2 Hearth slabs on a timber floor shall be held in position by supporting members on all four sides of the hearth. These members shall each be held by four screws with a minimum shank diameter of 4.88 mm that penetrate the floor framing by 50 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(slab.type, hearth), on(slab, floor), is(floor.material, timber))), then(obligation(and(loop(in(forEach(side), slab), and(has(side, support), by(support.fixing, screw), greaterThanEqual(count(screw), 4))), greaterThanEqual(screw.shankDiameter, 4.88 mm), equal(screw.penetration, 50 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If hearth slabs are on a timber floor, the slabs shall be held in position by supporting members on all four sides of the hearth. These members shall each be held by four screws with a minimum shank diameter of 4.88 mm that penetrate the floor framing by 50 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.3 Hearth slabs on concrete floors shall be secured in position by four D10 starter rods. The rods shall be located in each corner of the hearth slab and they shall terminate each end with standard hooks complying with NZS 3109.
LRML: if(and(is(slab.type, hearth), on(slab, floor), is(floor.material, concrete))), then(obligation(and(is(slab.fixture, starterRod), equal(starterRod.size, d10), greaterThanEqual(count(starterRod), 4), loop(in(forEach(corner), slab), and(has(corner, support), has(starterRod.end, hook), complyWith(hook, nzs_3109))))))
PARAPHRASE: Hearth slabs on concrete floors shall be secured in position by four D10 starter rods. The rods shall be located in each corner of the hearth slab and they shall terminate each end with standard hooks complying with NZS 3109.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.4.5 The requirements of this Acceptable Solution account for the fact that other people may be present in the building or firecell and additional calculations are not required when an occupant load is derived by bed spaces (i.e. for risk groups SM and SI).
LRML: if(and(define(count(bed), x0), asPer(occupantLoad.calculation, x0),is(space.riskGroup, or(sm, si)))), then(permission(not(and(has(occupantLoad, calculation),is(calculation.type, additional)))))
PARAPHRASE: If an occupant load is calculated by the number of bed spaces and the risk group is SM or SI, additional calculations are not required.

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is limited to membranes composed of butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates for: a) Roofs with a minimum fall of 2° (1:30), b) Decks with: i) a minimum fall of 1.5° (1:40), ii) a maximum area of 40 m2, iii) no steps in level within deck area except into gutters, iv) no integral roof gardens, and v) no downpipe direct discharge to deck, c) Internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100, with no cross seams in the gutters, and d) Decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in Figure 17A.
LRML: if(and(is(membrane.material, or(butyl, epdm)), above(membrane.installation, substrate), is(substrate.material, plywood), or(and(for(membrane, roof), greaterThanEqual(roof.fall, 2 deg)), and(for(membrane, deck), greaterThanEqual(deck.fall, 1.5 deg), lessThanEqual(deck.area, 40 m2), not(has(deck, and(stepInLevel, integralRoofGarden))), not(and(towards(downpipe.discharge, deck),is(downpipe.discharge, direct)))), and(is(membrane, gutter), is(gutter.type, internal), greaterThanEqual(gutter.fall, 1/100), not(within(crossSeam, gutter))), and(is(membrane.application, deck), has(deck, raisedSurface), is(raisedSurface, removable), for(raisedSurface, levelAccess),asPer(levelAccess, 'nzbc_e2as1_f17.a'))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, membrane))
PARAPHRASE: If membranes are material butyl or EPDM installed over plywood substrates and either the membrane is for a roof with a minimum fall of 2 deg, or the membrane is for decks with a minimum fall of 1.5 deg, and the deck has a maximum area of 40 m2, and the deck has no steps in level and the deck has no integral roof gardens and no downpipe direct discharge to the deck, or the membranes are for internal gutters with a minimum fall of 1 in 100 and there are no cross seams in the gutters, or the membrane is for decks with removable raised surfaces to give level access as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 17.a.

TEXT: 9.1.3.3 Bottom of wall claddings for concrete ground slabs (except masonry veneer); At concrete slab level, the base of the cladding system shall be as shown in Table 18, and: a) Finish a minimum of: i) 100 mm above a paved surface, or ii) 175 mm above finished unpaved surface, b) Overlap the concrete slab by 50 mm, and c) Be offset horizontally by a minimum of 6 mm for direct fixed claddings to prevent capillary action.
LRML: if(and(not(is(wallCladding.system, masonryVeneer)), adjoin(slab, wallCladding),is(slab.type, ground),is(slab.material, concrete))), then(obligation(and(complyWith(wallCladding.bottom,nzbc_e2as1_t18),or(and(adjoin(surface, wallCladding),is(surface.type, paved),define(surface.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(wallCladding.bottom, 'x0 + 100 mm')),and(adjoin(surface, wallCladding),not(is(surface.type, paved)),define(surface.elevation, x0),greaterThanEqual(distance, 'x0 + 175 mm'))),has(wallCladding.bottom, lap),towards(lap, slab),equal(lap.size, 50 mm),or(and(has(wallCladding.bottom, offset),is(offset, horizontal),greaterThanEqual(offset.size, 6 mm),is(wallCladding.type, directFixed),prevent(offset, capillaryAction)),not(is(wallCladding.type, directFixed))))))
PARAPHRASE: If wall claddings are not masonry veneer and the concrete ground slab adjoins the wall cladding, then the bottom of the wall cladding shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Table 18, and either the wall cladding bottom is at a minimum of 100 mm above a paved surface, or the wall cladding bottom is at a minimum of 175 mm above finished unpaved surface, and the wall cladding bottom overlaps the concrete slab by 50 mm size, and the wall cladding bottom shall be either offset horizontally by a minimum of 6 mm size for direct fixed claddings to prevent capillary action, or the wallcladding shall be not direct fixed.

TEXT: Clause 7.5.8.1 All slab-on-ground floors shall be reinforced concrete in accordance with Clauses 7.5.8.3, 7.5.8.4 and 7.5.8.6.4. All reinforcing steel, including welded mesh, shall be Ductility Class E in accordance with NZS 4671.
LRML: if(is(floor.type, slabOnGround)), then(obligation(and(is(floor.material, reinforcedConcrete),asPer(reinforcedConcrete,and('nzbc_b1as1_7.5.8.3','nzbc_b1as1_7.5.8.4','nzbc_b1as1_7.5.8.6.4')),is(reinforcedConcrete.reinforcedSteel,ductlityClassE),is(reinforcedConcrete.weldedMesh,ductlityClassE),asPer(ductlityClassE,nzs_4671))))
PARAPHRASE: If floors are slab-on-ground, then the floor shall have the material reinforced concrete in accordance with B1/AS1 Clauses 7.5.8.3, 7.5.8.4 and 7.5.8.6.4. The reinforcing steel and welded mesh of the reinforced concrete shall be Ductility Class E in accordance with NZS 4671.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design 6.0 Drains 6.1 AS/NZS 2566.1 6.2 AS/NZS 2566.2 6.3 AS/NZS 2032 6.4 AS/NZS 2033.
