TEXT: NZS 4223.3 Glass design for these types shall comply with the following tables (see note 1): Table 14 - Structural balustrade – cantilevered glass;.
LRML: if(and(is(structure, balustrade), is(balustrade.design, cantileveredGlass))), then(obligation(complyWith(balustrade.design, nzs_4223_3_t14)))
PARAPHRASE: If the design of a structural balustrade is cantilevered glass, then the balustrade's design shall comply with NZS 4223.3 Table 14.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: NZS 4223.3 Glass design for these types shall comply with the following tables (see note 1): Table 14 - Structural balustrade – cantilevered glass;.
LRML: if(and(is(structure, balustrade), is(balustrade.design, cantileveredGlass))), then(obligation(complyWith(balustrade.design, nzs_4223_3_t14)))
PARAPHRASE: If the design of a structural balustrade is cantilevered glass, then the balustrade's design shall comply with NZS 4223 3 Table 14.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: NZS 4223.3 Glass design for these types shall comply with the following tables (see note 1): Table 15 - Structural balustrade – two-edge point fixed;.
LRML: if(and(is(structure, ballustrade), is(balustrade.design, twoEdgePointFixed))), then(obligation(complyWith(balustrade.design, nzs_4223_3_t15)))
PARAPHRASE: If the design of a structural balustrade is two-edge point fixed, then the balustrade' design shall comply with NZS 4223.3 Table 15.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.7.7 Access to a drain laid under a building shall be provided immediately outside the building. These points of access shall be located within 2.0 m of an exterior wall.
LRML: if(below(drain, building)), then(obligation(and(has(drain, accessPoint),outside(accessPoint.location, building),has(building, externalWall),define(externalWall.location, x0),within(accessPoint.location, 'x0 + 2 m'))))
PARAPHRASE: If a drain is under a building, then the drain's access point location shall be outside the building. These access points shall be located within 2 m of an exterior wall of the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.9.3 Trench slope; Where the slope of the trench is 1 in 8 or greater, anti-scour blocks shall be provided.
LRML: if(greaterThanEqual(trench.slope, 1/8)), then(obligation(has(trench, antiScourBlocks)))
PARAPHRASE: If the slope of the trench is 1 in 8 or greater, then the trench shall have anti-scour blocks.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: These anti-scour blocks shall be: Constructed from 150 mm thick concrete (17 MPa).
LRML: if(exist(antiScourBlocks)), then(obligation(and(is(antiScourBlocks.material, concrete),equal(antiScourBlocks.thickness, 150 mm),equal(antiScourBlocks.strength, 17 MPa))))
PARAPHRASE: If anti-scour blocks exist, then the anti-scour blocks shall be made of 150 mm thick concrete with strength 17 MPa.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.9.3 Trench slope; These anti-scour blocks shall be: Extended to ground level where the drain cover is less than 300 mm.
LRML: if(and(has(trench, antiScourBlocks),within(drain, trench),has(drain, cover),lessThan(cover.depth, 300 mm))), then(obligation(is(antiScourBlocks.elevation, groundLevel)))
PARAPHRASE: If the trench has anti-scour blocks, the drain is in the trench, and the drain cover is less than 300 mm, then these anti-scour blocks shall be ground level elevation.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.9.3 Trench slope; These anti-scour blocks shall be: Extended to ground level where the drain cover is less than 300 mm.
LRML: if(and(has(trench, antiScourBlocks),within(drain, trench),has(drain, cover),lessThan(cover.depth, 300 mm))), then(obligation(is(antiScourBlocks.elevation, groundLevel)))
PARAPHRASE: If the trench has anti-scour blocks, the drain is in the trench, and the drain cover is less than 300 mm, then these anti-scour blocks shall be ground level elevation.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.9.3 Trench slope; These anti-scour blocks shall be: Spaced at: 5.0 m centres for trench slopes greater than 1 in 5.
LRML: if(and(has(trench, antiScourBlocks), greaterThan(trench.slope, 1/5))), then(obligation(equal(antiScourBlocks.spacing, 5 mCentres)))
PARAPHRASE: If the trench has anti-scour blocks and the trench slopes greater than 1 in 5, then these anti-scour blocks shall be spaced at  5 m centres.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Acceptable fill materials shown in Figure 13 are: Bedding material of clean granular non-cohesive material with a maximum particle size of 20 mm.
LRML: if(is(fillMaterial, beddingMaterial)), then(obligation(and(is(fillMaterial,and(clean,granular,nonCohesive)),lessThanEqual(fillMaterial.particleSize,20 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the fill material is bedding material, then the fill material shall be of clean granular non-cohesive material with a maximum particle size of 20 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Acceptable fill materials shown in Figure 13 are: Selected compacted fill of any fine-grained soil or granular material which is free from topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(fillMaterial, beddingMaterial),is(fillMaterial.type, compacted))), then(obligation(and(is(fillMaterial,or(fineGrainedSoil, granular)),not(include(fillMaterial, and(topsoil, rubbish))),lessThanEqual(fillMaterial.particleSize,20 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the fill materials is selected compacted fill, then the fill materials shall be of any fine-grained soil or granular material, the fill material shall not include topsoil and rubbish and has a maximum particle size of 20 mm.
COMMENTS:
obligation/permission?
if/then?
According to figure, this might be the best way to specify?
MAybe parent rule should still say that fillMaterial may be beddingMaterial or selected fill asPer f13
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.1.1 Materials for downpipes shall comply with Table 4.
LRML: if(exist(downpipe)), then(obligation(complyWith(downpipe.material, nzbc_e1as1_t4)))
PARAPHRASE: If downpipes exist, then the materials of downpipes shall comply with E1/AS1 Table 4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.1.2 Downpipes, gutters, roofing, fastenings and all adjoining components shall be of the same or a compatible material to eliminate the risk of galvanic corrosion.
LRML: if(and(define(component, x0),define(component, x1),is(x0.type, or(downpipe, gutter, roofing, fastening)),or(is(x1.type, or(downpipe, gutter, roofing, fastening)),adjoin(x0, x1)))), then(obligation(and(define(x0.material, x2),define(x1.material, x3),or(equal(x2, x3),and(inBetween(compatibility, and(x0, x1)),is(compatibility.type, galvanic))))))
PARAPHRASE: Given two components, if both componenst are downpipes, gutters, roofing, or fastenings, or if on component is downpipes, gutters, roofing, fastenings and the other component is adjoining, then the components materials shall be equal or have galvanic compatibility between them.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.2.1 Downpipes sized using Table 5 are acceptable. Other downpipes are acceptable provided their cross-sectional area is no less than that required by Table 5, and they permit passage of a 50 mm diameter sphere.
LRML: if(exist(downpipe)), then(or(obligation(asPer(downpipe.size, nzbc_e1as1_t5)), obligation(and(complyWith(downpipe.crossSectionalArea, nzbc_e1as1_t5),greaterThan(downpipe.diameter, 50 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If downpipes exist, then the downpipes shall have either a size acoording to E1/AS1 Table 5, or the downpipe have a cross-sectional area complying with E1/AS1 Table 5 and a diameter greater than 50 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.3.2 All internal downpipes shall withstand without leakage, a water test with an applied head of 1.5 m of water, or a high pressure air test as described in E1/VM1 Paragraph 8.3.
LRML: if(is(downpipe.location, internal)), then(or(obligation(and(test(downpipe,waterTest),equal(waterTest.appliedHead,1.5m))), obligation(and(test(downpipe,airTest),is(airTest.type, highPressure),asPer(airTest,'nzbc_e1vm1_8.3')))))
PARAPHRASE: If the downpipes is located internal, then the downpipe shall be tested with a water test with an applied head of 1.5 m, or tested with a high pressure air test as described in E1/VM1 Paragraph 8.3.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.1.1 Roof gutters shall discharge to downpipes that are sized as given in Paragraph 4.2.
LRML: if(exist(roofGutter)), then(obligation(and(into(roofGutter.discharge, downpipe),asPer(downpipe.size, 'nzbc_e1as1_4.2'))))
PARAPHRASE: if roof gutters exist, the roof gutters shall discharge to downpipes that are sized as given in E1/AS1 Paragraph 4.2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.1.1 Chimneys for solid fuel burning appliances shall comply with Paragraph 1.0 or with the relevant sections of AS/NZS 3869 and AS/NZS 2918 for sheetmetal chimneys.
LRML: if(and(for(chimney, appliance),is(appliance, burner),for(burner.type, solidFuel))), then(obligation(or(complyWith(chimney, nzbc_b1as3_1),and(is(chimney.material, sheetmetal),complyWith(chimney, and(nzs_3869, nzs_2918))))))
PARAPHRASE: Chimneys for solid fuel burning appliances shall comply with Paragraph 1.0 or sheetmetal chimneys shall comply with NZS 3869 and NZS 2918.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
Can sheetmetal chimneys comply with 1.0?
omniclass: solidFuelFireplace
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.1 Solid fuel burning domestic appliances weighing no more than 130 kg shall be supported on a 65 mm thick hearth slab that is: a) Reinforced with 665 mesh, or D10 rods at 300 mm centres each way, placed centrally in the slab thickness, b) Supported on a timber or concrete floor, or integral with a concrete floor. (The floor supporting the hearth slab shall comply with NZS 3604 or NZS 4229 as appropriate), and c) Comprised of ordinary grade concrete complying with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109.
LRML: if(and(for(chimney, appliance),is(appliance, burner),is(burner.type, and(solidFuel,domestic)),lessThanEqual(appliance.weight, 130 kg))),then(obligation(and(on(appliance.support, slab), is(slab.type, hearth), greaterThanEqual(slab.thickness, 65 mm), is(slab, reinforcing), or(and(is(reinforcing.type, mesh), is(mesh.size, 665),is(reinforcing.placement, centrallyInSlabThickness)), and(is(reinforcing.type, rod), is(rod.size, d10),loop(forEach(slab.way),is(reinforcing.spacing, 300 mmCentres)),is(reinforcing.placement, centrallyInSlabThickness))), or(and(on(slab.support, floor), is(floor.construction, or(timber, concrete)), complyWith(floor, or(nzs_3604, nzs_4229))), and(partOf(slab, floor), is(floor.construction, concrete))), is(concrete.grade, ordinary), complyWith(concrete.grade, nzs_3109))))
PARAPHRASE: If solid fuel burning domestic appliances are weighing no more than 130 kg, the appliance shall be supported on a 65 mm thick hearth slab, and the slab is reinforced with 665 mesh or D10 rods at 300 mm centres each way, placed centrally in the slab thickness, b) Supported on a timber or concrete floor, or integral with a concrete floor. (The floor supporting the hearth slab shall comply with NZS 3604 or NZS 4229 as appropriate), and c) Comprised of ordinary grade concrete complying with the relevant clauses of NZS 3109.
COMMENTS:
type?
centrallyInSlabThickness?
d10 size vs diameter 10 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.2 Hearth slabs on a timber floor shall be held in position by supporting members on all four sides of the hearth. These members shall each be held by four screws with a minimum shank diameter of 4.88 mm that penetrate the floor framing by 50 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(slab.type, hearth), on(slab, floor), is(floor.construction, timber))), then(obligation(and(loop(in(forEach(side), slab), and(has(side, support), by(support.fixing, screw), greaterThanEqual(count(screw), 4))), greaterThanEqual(screw.shankDiameter, 4.88 mm), equal(screw.penetration, 50 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If hearth slabs are on a timber floor, the slabs shall be held in position by supporting members on all four sides of the hearth. These members shall each be held by four screws with a minimum shank diameter of 4.88 mm that penetrate the floor framing by 50 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.2 Hearth slabs on a timber floor shall be held in position by supporting members on all four sides of the hearth. These members shall each be held by four screws with a minimum shank diameter of 4.88 mm that penetrate the floor framing by 50 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(slab.type, hearth), on(slab, floor), is(floor.material, timber))), then(obligation(and(loop(forEach(slab.side), and(has(slab.side, support), by(support.fixing, screw), greaterThanEqual(count(screw), 4))), greaterThanEqual(screw.shankDiameter, 4.88 mm), equal(screw.penetration, 50 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If hearth slabs are on a timber floor, then for each side of the slabs the slab side shall have support and the support has four screws. The screws shall have a minimum shank diameter of 4.88 mm that penetrate the floor framing by 50 mm.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
slab partOf hearth?
loop necessary?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.2.3 Hearth slabs on concrete floors shall be secured in position by four D10 starter rods. The rods shall be located in each corner of the hearth slab and they shall terminate each end with standard hooks complying with NZS 3109.
LRML: if(and(is(slab.type, hearth), on(slab, floor), is(floor.material, concrete))), then(obligation(and(is(slab.fixing, rod), is(rod.type, starter),equal(rod.size, d10), greaterThanEqual(count(rod), 4), loop(forEach(slab.corner), and(has(slab.corner, rod), has(starterRod.end, hook), complyWith(hook, nzs_3109))))))
PARAPHRASE: If hearth slabs are on concrete floors, the slabs shall be fixed with four D10 starter rods. For each corner of the slab The rods shall be located in each corner of the hearth slab and they shall terminate each end with standard hooks complying with NZS 3109.
COMMENTS:
ORDER
proper quantification is missing - foreach vs any.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.4.5 The requirements of this Acceptable Solution account for the fact that other people may be present in the building or firecell and additional calculations are not required when an occupant load is derived by bed spaces (i.e. for risk groups SM and SI).
LRML: if(and(define(count(bed), x0), asPer(occupantLoad.calculation, x0),is(space.riskGroup, or(sm, si)))), then(permission(not(and(has(occupantLoad, calculation),is(calculation.type, additional)))))
PARAPHRASE: If an occupant load is calculated by the number of bed spaces and the risk group is SM or SI, then additional calculations of the occupant load are not required.

TEXT: 1.4.7 If, in a particular situation, the occupant load derived from Table 1.2 is clearly more than that which will occur, the basis of any proposal for a lesser occupant load shall be substantiated to the building consent authority.
LRML: if(and(asPer(space.occupantLoad, 'nzbc_cas2_t1.2'), greaterThan(space.expectedOccupantLoad, occupantLoad))), then(obligation(and(for(space.expectedOccupantLoad, fireSafetyDesign),approve(buildingConsentAuthority, expectedOccupantLoad))))

TEXT: 1.4.7 If, in a particular situation, the occupant load derived from Table 1.2 is clearly more than that which will occur, the basis of any proposal for a lesser occupant load shall be substantiated to the building consent authority.
LRML: if(and(asPer(space.occupantLoad, 'nzbc_cas2_t1.2'), greaterThan(space.expectedOccupantLoad, occupantLoad))), then(obligation(and(for(space.expectedOccupantLoad, fireSafetyDesign),approve(buildingConsentAuthority, expectedOccupantLoad))))

TEXT: 1.4.6 For the purposes of risk group SI the term 'bed' means the number of people that are under care or detention. It can include people on: a) Beds, or b) Recliner or lounge chairs, or c) Dentist chairs, or d) Treatment tables, or e) Any other furniture where an occupant may be for a period of treatment, in care or detention.
LRML: if(is(space.riskGroup, si)), then(and(is(bed, person),within(person, or(care, detention)),include(bed, or(recliner, loungeChair, dentistChair, treatmentTable, treatmentFurniture))))
PARAPHRASE: If the risk group is SI, a bed is a person under care or detention. A beds include recliner or lounge chairs, or dentist chairs, or treatment tables, or treatment furniture.

TEXT: 2.2.4 For risk group VP firecells that require a fire sprinkler system (refer to Table 2.2d), the fire sprinkler system does not need to be extended throughout the remainder of the building where the risk group VP firecells are fire separated from the adjacent firecells. The fire separation between adjacent firecells is required to be provided with the greater of the property rating of the adjacent firecells (refer to Table 2.4).
LRML: if(and(is(firecell.riskGroup, vp), requires(firecell, fireSprinklerSystem), asPer(fireSprinklerSystem, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.2.d'),  has(firecell, fireSeparation), adjacent(firecells, firecell),towards(fireSeparation, firecells),define(max(firecells.propertyRating), x0),asPer(propertyRating, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.4'),is(fireSeparation.fireResistanceRating, x0))), then(permission(not(has(building.remainder, fireSprinklerSystem))))
PARAPHRASE: If the firecell's risk group is VP and the firecell require a fire sprinkler system as per Table 2.2.d and the risk group VP firecells are fire separated from the adjacent firecells and the fire resistance rating of the fire separation is the greater of the property rating of the adjacent firecells, with the property rating as in Table 2.4, then the remainder of the building may not have the fire sprinkler system.
COMMENTS:
adjacentFirecell to avoid problems with comparisons.
firerating in if

TEXT: 2.2.4 For risk group VP firecells that require a fire sprinkler system (refer to Table 2.2d), the fire sprinkler system does not need to be extended throughout the remainder of the building where the risk group VP firecells are fire separated from the adjacent firecells. The fire separation between adjacent firecells is required to be provided with the greater of the property rating of the adjacent firecells (refer to Table 2.4).
LRML: if(and(is(firecell.riskGroup, vp), requires(firecell, fireSprinklerSystem), asPer(fireSprinklerSystem, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.2.d'),  has(firecell, fireSeparation), adjacent(firecells, firecell),towards(fireSeparation, firecells),define(max(firecells.propertyRating), x0),asPer(propertyRating, 'nzbc_cas2_t2.4'),is(fireSeparation.fireResistanceRating, x0))), then(permission(not(has(building.remainder, fireSprinklerSystem))))
PARAPHRASE: If the firecell's risk group is VP and the firecell require a fire sprinkler system as per Table 2.2.d and the risk group VP firecells are fire separated from the adjacent firecells and the fire resistance rating of the fire separation is the greater of the property rating of the adjacent firecells, with the property rating as in Table 2.4, then the remainder of the building may not have the fire sprinkler system.
COMMENTS:
adjacentFirecell to avoid problems with comparisons.
fire separation firerating in if

TEXT: 3.8.1 Surface water drains shall be capable of passing one of the tests described in E1/VM1 Paragraph 8.0.
LRML: if(is(drain.type, surfaceWater)), then(obligation(and(asPer(test(drain), 'nzbc_e1vm1_8.0'),equal(count(test(drain), 1)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the drain type is surface water, then the drain shall pass one of the tests described in E1/VM1 Paragraph 8.0.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.9.3 Trench slope; These anti-scour blocks shall be: Spaced at: 7.5 m centres for trench slopes between 1 in 8 and 1 in 5.

TEXT: Trench 3.9.6 Placing and compacting a) Granular bedding and selected fill shall be placed in layers of no greater than 100 mm loose thickness and compacted.
LRML: if(or(exist(granularMaterial),exist(selectedFill))), then(obligation(and(within(granularBedding,layer),within(selectedFill,layer),lessThanEqual(layer.thickness,100 mm),is(layer,compacted))))
PARAPHRASE: If granular bedding or selected fill exist, then the granular bedding and selected fill shall be placed in layers of no greater than 100 mm loose thickness and the layer shall be compacted.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: NZS 4223.3 Glass design for these types shall comply with the following tables (see note 1): Table 17 - Structural balustrade – three-edge support.
LRML: if(and(is(structure, balustrade), is(balustrade.design, threeEdgeSupport))), then(obligation(complyWith(balustrade.design, nzs_4223_3_t17)))
PARAPHRASE: If the design of a structural balustrade is three-edge support, then the balustrade's design shall comply with NZS 4223.3 Table 17.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design 7.0 Glazing; All structural glass barriers safeguarding a fall of 1000 mm or more shall have interlinking rails.
LRML: if(and(is(structure.material, glass), is(structure, safetyBarrier), against(safetyBarrier, fall), greaterThanEqual(fall.height, 1000 mm))), then(obligation(and(has(structure,rail),is(rail,interlinked))))
PARAPHRASE: If a structure is made of glass and is a safety barrier against a fall of 1000 mm or more, then the structure shall have interlinking rails.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.2 Height; The height of any chimney measured from the top of the chimney foundation slab to the top of the chimney stack shall not exceed 9 m.
LRML: if(exist(chimney)), then(obligation(and(has(chimney, foundation), define(topOf(foundation.slab), x0), define(topOf(chimney.stack), x1), inBetween(chimney.height, and(x0, x1)),lessThanEqual(chimney.height, 9 m))))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys exist, then the height of the chimney measured from the top of the chimney foundation slab to the top of the chimney stack shall not exceed 9 m.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Chimneys shall not cantilever more than 2.4 m above the fixing at roof level (refer Paragraph 1.7).
LRML: if(exist(chimney)), then(obligation(and(above(chimney.height, fixing),has(chimney, fixing),is(fixing.elevation, roofLevel),lessThanEqual(chimney.height, 2.4 m))))
PARAPHRASE: If chimneys exist, then the chimney height above the fixing at roof level shall not be more than 2.4 m.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.3 Size; The width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed: a) For the foundation and chimney base – precast pumice concrete 1600 mm wide x 1050 mm deep.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.material, precastPumiceConcrete),has(chimney, or(foundation,chimneyBase)))), then(obligation(and(or(define(foundation.width, x0), define(chimneyBase.width, x0)),is(x0.measurement, alongBuildingLine),or(define(foundation.depth, x1), define(chimneyBase.depth, x1)),is(x1.measurement, perpendicularBuildingLine), lessThanEqual(x0, 1600 mm),lessThanEqual(x1, 1050 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the chimney is precast pumice concrete and has a foundation or chimney base, then the width measured along the building line and depth measured perpendicular to the building line shall not exceed 1600 mm width and 1050 mm depth.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.3 Size; The width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed: a) For the foundation and chimney base – precast pumice concrete 1600 mm wide x 1050 mm deep.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.material, precastPumiceConcrete),has(chimney, or(foundation,chimneyBase)))), then(obligation(and(or(define(foundation.width, x0), define(chimneyBase.width, x0)),is(x0.measurement, alongBuildingLine),or(define(foundation.depth, x1), define(chimneyBase.depth, x1)),is(x1.measurement, perpendicularBuildingLine), lessThanEqual(x0, 1600 mm),lessThanEqual(x1, 1050 mm))))

AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.3 Size; The width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed: For a brick chimney stack – double skin (see Figure 3) - 1200 mm wide x 680 mm deep.
LRML: if(and(is(chimneyStack.material, brick),is(brick.type, doubleSkin))), then(obligation(and(define(chimneyStack.width, x0),is(x0.measurement, alongBuildingLine),define(chimneyStack.depth, x1),is(x1.measurement, perpendicularBuildingLine), lessThanEqual(x0, 1200 mm),lessThanEqual(x1, 680 mm))))

TEXT: 1.1.3 Size; The width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed: For a concrete or precast pumice concrete chimney stack - 1200 mm wide x 700 mm deep.
LRML: if(is(chimneyStack.material, or(concrete, precastPumiceConcrete))), then(obligation(and(define(chimneyStack.width, x0),is(x0.measurement, alongBuildingLine),define(chimneyStack.depth, x1),is(x1.measurement, perpendicularBuildingLine), lessThanEqual(x0, 1200 mm),lessThanEqual(x1, 700 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If a chimney stack is concrete or precast pumice concrete, then the chimney stack width (measured along the building line) and chimney stack depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed 1200 mm width and 700 mm depth.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.3 Size; The width (measured along the building line) and depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed: For a concrete or precast pumice concrete chimney stack - 1200 mm wide x 700 mm deep.
LRML: if(is(chimneyStack.material, or(concrete, precastPumiceConcrete))), then(obligation(and(define(chimneyStack.width, x0),is(x0.measurement, alongBuildingLine),define(chimneyStack.depth, x1),is(x1.measurement, perpendicularBuildingLine), lessThanEqual(x0, 1200 mm),lessThanEqual(x1, 700 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If a chimney stack is concrete or precast pumice concrete, then the chimney stack width (measured along the building line) and chimney stack depth (measured perpendicular to the building line) shall not exceed 1200 mm width and 700 mm depth.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.4 Chimney liners; Where chimney liners are used they are to be separated from the chimney to ensure free thermal movement. This shall be achieved by coating the liner with a suitable debonding agent or by wrapping it in a combustible material no less than 0.25 mm thick.
LRML: if(has(chimney, chimneyLiner)), then(or(obligation(and(has(chimneyLiner,coating),is(coating.material,debondingAgent))), obligation(and(has(chimneyLiner,wrapping),is(wrapping.material,combustible),greaterThanEqual(wrapping.thickness,0.25 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the chimney has chimney liners, then the chimney liners shall have coating with a debonding agent or wrapping with combustible material and the wrapping is no less than 0.25 mm thick.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.2.1 Roof gutter materials shall comply with the standards stated in Table 6.
LRML: if(exist(roofGutter)), then(obligation(and(complyWith(roofGutter.material, standards),asPer(standards, nzbc_e1as1_t6))))
PARAPHRASE: If roof gutters exist, then the roof gutter's materials shall comply with the standards as given in E1/AS1 Table 6.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.0 Roof Gutters 5.5.1 All internal gutters shall be fitted with overflow outlets which drain to the exterior of the building. The top of the outlet shall be set at least 50 mm below the top of the gutter.
LRML: if(is(roofGutter.type, internal)), then(obligation(and(has(roofGutter,overflowOutlet),towards(overflowOutlet.drain, buildingExterior),define(roofGutter.top, x0),lessThanEqual(overflowOutlet.top,'x0 - 50 mm'))))
PARAPHRASE: If a roof gutter is internal, then the roof gutter shall be fitted with overflow outlets which drain to the exterior of the building. The top of the overflow outlet shall be set at least 50 mm below the top of the gutter.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.0 Roof Gutters 5.5.2 External gutters do not require overflow outlets but shall be installed to ensure any overflow from the gutter spills to the outside of the building.
LRML: if(is(roofGutter.type, external)), then(and(permission(not(has(roofGutter, overflowOutlet))), obligation(towards(roofGutter.overflow, buildingExterior))))
PARAPHRASE: If roof gutters are external, then the roof gutters do not require overflow outlets but overflow from the gutter shall go to the outside of the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Where buildings are based on NZS 3604, but require specific engineering design input, the framing shall be of at least equivalent stiffness to the framing provisions of NZS 3604.

PARAPHRASE: If buildings are based on NZS 3604, but require specific design for engineering, then the building framing stiffness shall comply with NZS 3604.

TEXT: Attached garages that are integral with the weathertightness envelope of the building are included within the scope of this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(and(for(building.envelope, weathertightness), partOf(garage, envelope))), then(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, garage))
PARAPHRASE: If the building envelope is for weathertightness and the garage is part of the envelope, then E2AS1 applies to the garage.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Buildings with drained cavities and spread-of-flame requirements, as specified in NZBC C Clauses, are outside the scope of this Acceptable Solution. Cavities in such circumstances must be specifically designed for both weathertightness and spread of flame.
LRML: if(and(has(building, and(drainedCavity, spreadOfFlameRequirement)), asPer(spreadOfFlameRequirement, nzbc_c))), then(and(not(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, building)), obligation(for(drainedCavity.specificDesign,and(weathertightness,spreadOfFlame)))))
PARAPHRASE: If a buildings has drained cavities and spread-of-flame requirements, as specified in NZBC C Clauses, then E2AS1 does not apply to that buidling. The drained cavities must have specific design for weathertightness and spread of flame.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Buildings with drained cavities and acoustic requirements, as specified in NZBC Clause G6, are outside the scope of this Acceptable Solution.
LRML: if(and(has(building, and(drainedCavity, acousticRequirement)), asPer(acousticRequirement, nzbc_g6))), then(not(applyTo(nzbc_e2as1, building)))
PARAPHRASE: If a building has drained cavities and acoustic requirements, as specified in NZBC Clause G6, E2/AS1 does not apply to the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The maximum moisture contents shall be: a) For timber framing at the time of installing interior linings, the maximum acceptable moisture content shall be the lesser of: i) 20% for insulated buildings, 24% for non-insulated buildings, or ii) as specified in NZS 3602,.

TEXT: The maximum moisture contents shall be: For timber weatherboards, 20% at the time of painting,.
LRML: if(is(weatherboard.material, timber)), then(obligation(and(lessThanEqual(weatherboard.moistureContent, 20 percent),define(weatherboard.paintingTime, x0), has(weatherboard, moistureContent), equal(moistureContent.measurementTime, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If weatherboards are timber, then the weatherboards' maximum moisture contents shall be 20 percent with the weatherboards painting time being equal the moisture contents measurement time.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The maximum moisture contents shall be: For timber exterior joinery, 20% at the time of painting,.
LRML: if(is(exteriorJoinery.material, timber)), then(obligation(and(lessThanEqual(exteriorJoinery.moistureContent, 20 percent),define(exteriorJoinery.paintingTime, x0), has(exteriorJoinery, moistureContent), equal(moistureContent.measurementTime, x0))))

TEXT: Regular maintenance of a building will include: a) Washing exterior surfaces, b) Inspecting surfaces and junctions, and repairing or replacing items when necessary, in order to preserve the weathertightness of the building. c) Maintaining clearances between cladding and external ground or paving as per Paragraph 9.1.3. d) Maintaining minimum 35 mm clearances between roofing and membrane decking, and wall cladding above e) Maintaining finish coatings especially for stucco, EIFS and fibre cement claddings.

TEXT: 4.1.1 Materials for downpipes shall comply with Table 4.
LRML: if(exist(downpipe)), then(obligation(complyWith(downpipe.material, nzbc_e1as1_t4)))
PARAPHRASE: If downpipes exist, then the materials of downpipes shall comply with E1/AS1 Table 4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.1.2 Downpipes, gutters, roofing, fastenings and all adjoining components shall be of the same or a compatible material to eliminate the risk of galvanic corrosion.
LRML: if(and(define(component, x0),define(component, x1),is(x0.type, or(downpipe, gutter, roofing, fastening)),or(is(x1.type, or(downpipe, gutter, roofing, fastening)),adjoin(x0, x1)))), then(obligation(and(define(x0.material, x2),define(x1.material, x3),or(equal(x2, x3),and(inBetween(compatibility, and(x0, x1)),is(compatibility.type, galvanic))))))
PARAPHRASE: If given two components, both componenst are downpipes, gutters, roofing, or fastenings, or if on component is downpipes, gutters, roofing, fastenings and the other component is adjoining, then the components materials shall be equal or have galvanic compatibility between them.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.2.1 Downpipes sized using Table 5 are acceptable. Other downpipes are acceptable provided their cross-sectional area is no less than that required by Table 5, and they permit passage of a 50 mm diameter sphere.
LRML: if(exist(downpipe)), then(or(obligation(asPer(downpipe.size, nzbc_e1as1_t5)), obligation(and(complyWith(downpipe.crossSectionalArea, nzbc_e1as1_t5),greaterThan(downpipe.diameter, 50 mm)))))
PARAPHRASE: If downpipes exist, then the downpipes shall have either a size acoording to E1/AS1 Table 5, or the downpipe have a cross-sectional area complying with E1/AS1 Table 5 and a diameter greater than 50 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.3.1 Where thermal movement of downpipes cannot be accommodated by movement of the guttering, expansion joints shall be incorporated.
LRML: if(and(define(downpipe.thermalExpansion, x0), has(downpipe.guttering, movement), lessThan(x0, movement))), then(obligation(has(downpipe, expansionJoint)))
PARAPHRASE: If the downpipe's thermal expansion is greater than the movement downpipe's guttering, then the downpipe shall have expansion joints.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.3.2 All internal downpipes shall withstand without leakage, a water test with an applied head of 1.5 m of water, or a high pressure air test as described in E1/VM1 Paragraph 8.3.
LRML: if(is(downpipe.location, internal)), then(or(obligation(and(test(downpipe,waterTest),equal(waterTest.appliedHead,1.5m))), obligation(and(test(downpipe,airTest),is(airTest.type, highPressure),asPer(airTest,'nzbc_e1vm1_8.3')))))
PARAPHRASE: If the downpipes is located internal, then the downpipe shall be tested with a water test with an applied head of 1.5 m, or tested with a high pressure air test as described in E1/VM1 Paragraph 8.3.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 5.1.1 Roof gutters shall discharge to downpipes that are sized as given in Paragraph 4.2.

TEXT: 5.0 Roof Gutters 5.5.1 All internal gutters shall be fitted with overflow outlets which drain to the exterior of the building. The top of the outlet shall be set at least 50 mm below the top of the gutter.
LRML: if(is(roofGutter.type, internal)), then(obligation(and(has(roofGutter,overflowOutlet),towards(overflowOutlet.drain, buildingExterior),define(roofGutter.top, x0),lessThanEqual(overflowOutlet.top,'x0 - 50 mm'))))

TEXT: 5.0 Roof Gutters 5.5.2 External gutters do not require overflow outlets but shall be installed to ensure any overflow from the gutter spills to the outside of the building.

TEXT: 1.2.1 Chimney wall thicknesses shall be no less than: a) Brick – single skin (see Figure 2) 155 mm.

TEXT: 1.2.1 Chimney wall thicknesses shall be no less than: Concrete 170 mm.

TEXT: 1.2.1 Chimney wall thicknesses shall be no less than: Precast pumice concrete 85 mm.

TEXT: 1.4.1 Hearth slabs shall be of concrete no less than 75 mm thick, reinforced with D10 bars located centrally at 225 mm centres each way. See Figure 1.

TEXT: 1.6.1 Reinforcing of chimney stacks (see Figures 2 to 5 inclusive) shall comprise: a) D12 bars at 400 mm maximum centres vertically. Laps in bars shall be no less than 300 mm. b) R6 bars at 200 mm centres horizontally. These will be in the form of closed stirrups in the stack.

TEXT: 1.7.10 Nails used to fix straps to roof or ceiling framing shall be spaced at no less than 35 m in Radiata Pine.

TEXT: 1.7.14 Fixing brackets (see Figure 7(b)) shall be made from 5.0 mm thick mild steel angle and drilled with: a) A 50 mm diameter hole to suit the reinforcing duct location, and b) A 14 mm diameter hole for the 12 mm diameter coach screw fixing to the double stud.

TEXT: 4.0.2 Side-entry hoppers (see Figure 2) shall: a) Have a maximum opening diameter of 250 mm, b) Have self-closing, tight-fitting doors to prevent odours escaping, c) Have an easily cleaned wall surface surrounding the opening for 300 mm (this may be galvanised steel, ceramic tiles or similar material), d) Be located outside any dwelling or enclosed stair access, and away from any habitable space or food preparation area, and e) Have adequate ventilation, preferably by being located in the open air (e.g. on an outside balcony). Where hoppers are inside buildings, they shall be located in separate ventilated compartments complying with NZBC G4.

TEXT: 1.2.2 Natural ventilation of occupied spaces must be achieved by providing a net openable area of windows or other openings to the outside of no less than 5% of the floor area.

COMMENTS:

Should '0.05 * x1' be replaced by a multiply(0.05, x1): 
Natural ventilation is a precondition. This rule stands only if a natural ventilation was chosen or is required.
Do we need to infer the wall as an intermediate, or just define the opening (Refering to openableElement in IFC).
Do I have all of the logic in the obligation or in the then branch?
Should different notations be used: Objects -> Upper Case, Properties, Lower Case. opening vs openings.
How about nested dot-notations? Difficult to translate back into LRML?

Syntaxerror: define(sum(opening.netArea, x0)) -> define(sum(opening.netArea), x0)
Both are allowed, so how to avoid??

TEXT: The lowest zone within the Selwyn or Waimakariri District Council boundaries is within Zone 2. Areas within Selwyn District that are designated as Zone 1 in NZS 3604 shall become Zone 2.

PARAPHRASE: If either the zone is the lowest and either within the Selwyn District Council or Waimakariri District Council boundaries is within Zone 2, or the areas within Selwyn District Council are designated as Zone 1 in NZS 3604, then the zone is is within Zone 2 and the area is is Zone 2.

TEXT: 1.9.4 A chimney shall be considered as connected to the building when: At ground floor level: it is held by a floor bracket or the chimney base is integral with the building foundation wall,.

TEXT: 1.0.1 This Acceptable Solution is limited to buildings and sitework having a catchment area of no more than 0.25 hectares and which are: a) Free from a history of flooding, b) Not adjacent to a watercourse, c) Not located in low lying area, and d) Not located in a secondary flow path.

TEXT: For Low, Medium, High and Very High wind zones, flashing upstands shall have either: 1) A hem or hook to Figure 5, with upstand dimensions as shown throughout the document, or 2) No hooks or hems, and flashing upstand dimensions increased by 25 mm beyond those shown.

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: f) When using uncoated or coated lead flashings, maximum continuous lengths shall be 1300 mm for 17 kg or 1500 mm for 20 kg lead. Where the pitch of the flashing is greater than 15° at the join, the lap at the join shall be 100 mm minimum. Where the pitch of the flashing is 15° or less at the join, the lap at the join shall be 200 mm minimum and the flashing underneath the lap shall have a hook at the edge,.

PARAPHRASE: If flashings are material metal and have joins and flahsings are uncoated or coated lead, then the maximum continuous lengths of the lead shall either be 1300 mm and lead weight be 17 kg or the maximum continuous lengths of the lead shall be 1500 mm and lead weight 20 kg. The pitch at the join shall either be greater than 15 deg and the lap at the join shall be 100 mm minimum or the pitch at the join shall be 15 deg or less and the lap at the join shall be 200 mm minimum and the flashing underneath the lap shall have a hook at the edge.

TEXT: 8.1.6.1 Internal gutters; Internal gutters shall: a) Be formed with continuous butyl or EPDM strip complying with Paragraph 4.3.9, with no cross-joints in the gutter, or aluminium, copper, stainless steel, or zinc sheet to Paragraph 4.3, with joints that are welded.

TEXT: This Acceptable Solution is limited to the following types of profiled metal roof cladding: a) Profiled as outlined in Paragraph 8.4.4, b) Valley gutters that do not change direction in plan, c) Not curved, and d) With sheets no more than 18 metres long.

Slabs shall have a maximum dimension of 18 m between free joints.

TEXT: Rails, which in the event a glass pane breaks, spans the broken pane at the required barrier height and, i) resists Line and Concentrated design loads (SLS) specified in Tables 14 to 17, and ii) does not deflect more than 100 mm, in any direction, under the design loads.
LRML: if(and(around(rail, pane),is(pane.material, glass), is(pane, broken))), then(obligation(and(for(rail.span, pane),define(barrier.height, x0),equal(rail.span,x0),against(rail.resistance, and(lineDesignLoad, concentratedDesignLoad)),asPer(lineDesignLoad,'nzbc_b1as1_t14 to nzbc_b1as1_t17'),asPer(concentratedDesignLoad,'nzbc_b1as1_t14 to nzbc_b1as1_t17'),has(rail,deflection),lessThanEqual(rail.deflection,100 mm),towards(rail.deflection,anyDirection),by(rail.deflection, designLoad))))
PARAPHRASE: If the rails are around a glass pane and the glass pane is broken, then the rail spans the broken pane at the barrier height and, the rails shall resist line design loads and concentrated design loads specified in B1/AS1 Tables 14 to 17, and the rails do not deflect more than 100 mm, towards any direction, by the design loads.
COMMENTS:
5
broken -> Would not be executed.
rail.span location?
resistance required? for?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design; Interlinking rails are not required for a heat-strengthened or toughened laminated safety glass barrier that: has two or three edges supported by structural sealant joints or continuous clamps, and will, when both panes of the laminate are fractured, resist a 0.2 kN concentrated load and not deflect more than 250 mm (see note 2).
LRML: if(and(is(safetyBarrier.material, glass), is(glass.type, laminated), is(glass, or(heatStrengthened, toughened)), equal(count(safetyBarrier.edge), or(2, 3)), is(edge.support, or(sealantJoint, continuousClamp)), is(safetyBarrier.panes, and(laminate, fractured)),against(panes.resistance, concentratedLoad), lessThanEqual(concentratedLoad, 0.2 kN), is(resistance.type, concentratedLoad), lessThanEqual(panes.deflection, 250 mm))), then(permission(not(is(safetyBarrier.rail, interlinked))))
PARAPHRASE: If the safety barrier is glass and the glass is laminated and heat-strengthened or toughened, and the safety barrier has two or three edges supported by sealant joints or continuous clamps and both safety barrier panes of the laminate are fractured and the panes resists a 0.2 kN concentrated load and the panes deflection is less than or equal 250 mm, then the safety barrier may not have interlinking rails.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design; Interlinking rails are not required for a heat-strengthened or toughened laminated safety glass barrier that: has a stiff interlayer and will, when both panes of the laminate are fractured, resist a 0.2 kN concentrated load and not deflect more than 250 mm (see note 2).
LRML: if(and(is(safetyBarrier.material, glass), is(glass.type, laminated), is(glass, or(heatStrengthened, toughened)), has(safetyBarrier, stiffInterlayer), is(safetyBarrier.panes, and(laminate, fractured)),against(panes.resistance, concentratedLoad), lessThanEqual(concentratedLoad, 0.2 kN), is(resistance.type, concentratedLoad), lessThanEqual(panes.deflection, 250 mm))), then(permission(not(is(safetyBarrier.rail, interlinked))))
PARAPHRASE: If the safety barrier is glass and the glass is laminated and heat-strengthened or toughened, and the safety barrier has a stiff interlayer and both safety barrier panes of the laminate are fractured and the panes resists a 0.2 kN concentrated load and the panes deflection is less than or equal 250 mm, then the safety barrier may not have interlinking rails.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design; The design of structural connections, fasteners and mounting hardware, that are part of the glass barrier, is outside the scope of this Standard and must be specifically designed.
LRML: if(and(has(barrier.material, glass), include(barrier, or(structuralConnection, fastener, mountingHardware)))), then(and(applyTo(nzbc_b1as1, and(structuralConnection, fastener, mountingHardware)),obligation(and(has(connection,specificDesign),has(fastener,specificDesign),has(mountingHardware,specificDesign)))))
PARAPHRASE: If structural connections, fasteners or mounting hardware are included in the glass barrier, then B1/AS1 does not apply to the structural connections, fasteners or mounting hardware and the structural connections, fasteners or mounting hardware shall have a specific design.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Prevent sagging of roof underlay by either: For R1 underlays, fully support with a corrosion resistant material • For R2 self supporting underlays, laid to maximum 1.2 metre span between adjacent supports.
LRML: if(include(roof.drainage,spreader)),then(obligation(and(asPer(spreader.material,nzbc_e2as1_4.1),not(asPer(spreader.material,or(nzbc_e2as1_4.3.9,nzbc_e2as1_4.3.10,nzbc_e2as1_4.3.11))),asPer(spreader,nzbc_e2as1_4.1),or(not(is(roof.type,masonryTile)),and(is(roof.type,masonryTile),has(roof,underlay))),has(roof,and(lap,penetration)),awayFrom(spreader.discharge,lap),not(has(spreader.discharge,penetration)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the roof has an underlay, then the underlay type shall be either R1 and the underlay shall be fully support with a corrosion resistant material, or the underly shall be type R2 and self supporting and laid to maximum 1.2 metre span between adjacent supports.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Hot water systems for sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances having a storage water heater capacity of up to 700 litres shall comply with NZS 4305.
LRML: if(and(for(hotWaterSystem, or(sanitaryFixture, sanitaryAppliance)),include(hotWaterSystem, storageWaterHeater),lessThanEqual(storageWaterHeater.capacity, 700 l))), then(obligation(complyWith(hotWaterSystem, nzs_4305)))

TEXT: 3.0.7 A water supply tap, complying with NZBC G12, shall be provided for washing down common waste storage areas.
LRML: if(is(wasteStorageArea.type, common)), then(obligation(and(has(wasteStorageArea, waterSupplyTap), complyWith(waterSupplyTap, nzbc_g12))))
PARAPHRASE: If the waste storage area is type common, then the waste storage area shall have a water supply tap complying with NZBC G12.

TEXT: 3.0.8 Ventilation: Storage areas located indoors shall be adequately ventilated to open air in compliance with NZBC G4.
LRML: if(has(building, wasteStorageArea)), then(obligation(and(has(wasteStorageArea, ventilation),towards(ventilation, openAir),complyWith(ventilation, nzbc_g4))))
PARAPHRASE: If a waste storage area is located indoors, the waste storage area shall have ventilation to open air in compliance with NZBC G4.

TEXT: 4.0.2 Side-entry hoppers (see Figure 2) shall: a) Have a maximum opening diameter of 250 mm, b) Have self-closing, tight-fitting doors to prevent odours escaping, c) Have an easily cleaned wall surface surrounding the opening for 300 mm (this may be galvanised steel, ceramic tiles or similar material), d) Be located outside any dwelling or enclosed stair access, and away from any habitable space or food preparation area, and e) Have adequate ventilation, preferably by being located in the open air (e.g. on an outside balcony). Where hoppers are inside buildings, they shall be located in separate ventilated compartments complying with NZBC G4.

PARAPHRASE: If side-entry hoppers exist, then side-entry hoppers shall: a) Have a maximum opening diameter of 250 mm, b) Have self-closing, tight-fitting doors, c) Have an easily cleaned wall surface surrounding the opening for 300 mm, d) Be located outside any dwelling or enclosed stair access, and located away from any habitable space or food preparation area, and e) Have adequate ventilation and is located in the open air or located in separate ventilated compartments complying with NZBC G4.
COMMENTS:
has(sideEntryHopper, wall) -> This could be also written into a define statement, since it is not really a part of the obligation.
(this may be galvanised steel, ceramic tiles or similar material) -> Removed
has(sideEntryHopper, ventilation) -> Removable?
ventilatedCompartment not grounded

TEXT: 3.0.4 Windows facing north in any food waste storage area shall be screened from direct sunlight in order to reduce the likelihood of putrification.
LRML: if(and(is(window.orientation, north),within(window, wasteStorageArea), for(wasteStorageArea, food))), then(obligation(screenedFrom(wasteStorageArea, directSunlight)))
PARAPHRASE: If windows facing north in any food waste storage area shall be screened from direct sunlight in order to reduce the likelihood of putrification.

TEXT: 3.0.4 Windows facing north in any food waste storage area shall be screened from direct sunlight in order to reduce the likelihood of putrification.
LRML: if(and(is(window.orientation, north),within(window, wasteStorageArea), for(wasteStorageArea, food))), then(obligation(screenedFrom(wasteStorageArea, directSunlight)))
PARAPHRASE: If windows facing north in any food waste storage area, then the waste storage area shall be screened from direct sunlight.

TEXT: 3.0.8 Ventilation: Storage areas located indoors shall be adequately ventilated to open air in compliance with NZBC G4.
LRML: if(has(building, wasteStorageArea)), then(obligation(and(has(wasteStorageArea, ventilation),towards(ventilation, openAir),complyWith(ventilation, nzbc_g4))))
PARAPHRASE: If a waste storage area is located indoors, the waste storage area shall have ventilation to open air in compliance with NZBC G4.

TEXT: 3.0.9 Mechanical ventilation: Where mechanical ventilation is used, it shall: a) Provide no less than 6 air changes per hour, b) Maintain a negative pressure within the storage area relative to adjacent areas (if any), and c) Discharge foul air to a safe place to avoid the likelihood of exhaust air entering any building.
LRML: if(and(has(wasteStorageArea, ventilation),is(ventilation.type, mechanical))),then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(ventilation.rate, 6 airChangesPerHour)), obligation(and(is(wasteStorageArea.airPressure, negative),towards(wasteStorageArea.airPressure, area),adjacent(area, wasteStorageArea))), obligation(towards(ventilation.discharge, safePlace))))
PARAPHRASE: If the waste storage area has ventilation and the ventilation is mechanical, then the ventilation shall have a ventilation rate of no less than 6 air changes per hour, the ventilation shall maintain a negative pressure within the storage area relative to adjacent areas, and the ventilation shall discharge to a safe place.
COMMENTS:
COMPLEX
Ventilation rate added.
align negateive pressure relative to adjacent areas to uniclas: absoluteAirPressure
towards vs relativeTo

TEXT: 3.1.1 NZS 4304 Section 6.2 is another Acceptable Solution for storage areas, but may exceed the performance criteria of NZBC G15.

COMMENTS: Might be also written as a fact.

TEXT: 1.2.2 Natural ventilation of occupied spaces must be achieved by providing a net openable area of windows or other openings to the outside of no less than 5% of the floor area.
LRML: if(and(has(space, naturalVentilation),greaterThan(space.occupantLoad, 0))), then(obligation(and(has(space, opening),is(opening.isExternal, true),define(sum(opening.netArea), x0),define(space.floorArea, x1),greaterThanEqual(x0, '0.05 * x1'))))
PARAPHRASE: If a space has natural ventilation and is occupied, then the net area of openings to the outside must be greater than 5 percent of the floor area.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE

Should '0.05 * x1' be replaced by a multiply(0.05, x1): 
Natural ventilation is a precondition. This rule stands only if a natural ventilation was chosen or is required.
Do we need to infer the wall as an intermediate, or just define the opening (Refering to openableElement in IFC).
Do I have all of the logic in the obligation or in the then branch?
Should different notations be used: Objects -> Upper Case, Properties, Lower Case. opening vs openings.
How about nested dot-notations? Difficult to translate back into LRML?

Syntaxerror: define(sum(opening.netArea, x0)) -> define(sum(opening.netArea), x0)
Both are allowed, so how to avoid??

occupied

TEXT: At free joints, slab reinforcement shall be terminated and there shall be no bonding between vertical concrete faces (prevented by using building paper or a bituminous coating).
LRML: if(and(has(slab, joint), is(joint.type, free), has(slab, reinforcing))), then(obligation(and(has(reinforcing, termination),is(termination.location, joint),has(slab, faces),is(faces.material, concrete),is(faces.orientation, vertical),or(inBetween(buildingPaper, faces),inBetween(bituminousCoating, faces)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the slab has free joints and reinforcement, then the reinforcement shall be terminated  at the joint, and there shall be either building paper or a bituminous coating betwenn the faces.
COMMENTS:
bonding between faces? connect?
delete bonding?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The lowest zone within the Selwyn or Waimakariri District Council boundaries is within Zone 2. Areas within Selwyn District that are designated as Zone 1 in NZS 3604 shall become Zone 2.
LRML: if(or(and(is(zone, lowest),within(zone, boundary), for(boundary, or(selwynDistrictCouncil, waimakaririDistrictCouncil))), and(within(area, selwynDistrictCouncil), is(area, zone_1),asPer(area, nzs_3604)))), then(and(within(zone, zone_2), is(area, zone_2)))
PARAPHRASE: If either the zone is the lowest and within the Selwyn District Council or Waimakariri District Council boundaries is within Zone 2, or the areas within Selwyn District Council are designated as Zone 1 in NZS 3604, then the zone is is within Zone 2 and the area is is Zone 2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Table 2 sets out the risk matrix that shall be used to define the risk score for a building within the scope of this Acceptable Solution. A risk score is calculated for each external face of the building. Claddings are then selected from Table 3 according to the risk scores.
LRML: if(and(equal(table.key, t2), include(t2, riskMatrix), has(building, riskScore), complyWith(building, nzbc_e2as1))), then(and(obligation(by(riskScore.definition, riskMatrix)), loop(in(forEach(externalFace), building), and(obligation(define(externalFace.riskScore, x0)), obligation(asPer(cladding.selection, x0)), obligation(from(cladding.selection, table)), obligation(equal(table.key, t3))))))
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Are unable to self-evacuate without assistance through requiring special care or treatment, or they are restrained, or their liberties are restricted (SI).
LRML: if(or(is(building.activity, or(care, detention)), is(building.riskGroup, si),and(has(building, part),or(    is(part.activity, or(care, detention)), is(part.riskGroup, si))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_cas2, and(building, part)))
PARAPHRASE: If either a buildings is either activity care or detention, or risk group SI, or parts of buildings is either activity care or detention, or risk group SI, then CAS2 applies to the building and part.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Work (WB - Business, professional services, industrial).
LRML: if(or(is(building.activity, or(business, professionalService, industrial)), equal(building.riskGroup, wb),and(has(building, part),or(    is(part.activity, or(business, professionalService, industrial)), equal(part.riskGroup, wb))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_cas2, and(building, part)))
PARAPHRASE: If either a building is activity business, professional service or industrial or risk group wb, or parts of buildings are activity business, professional service or industrial or risk group wb, then CAS2 applies to the building and part.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.4 Calculating occupant loads 1.4.3 Duplication shall be avoided by: Not including an occupant load for exitways, or for the occupant load determined for areas such as lift lobbies or sanitary facilities that are used intermittently by people already counted elsewhere in the building.
LRML: if(and(has(space, person), or(is(space.type, exitway), is(space.usage, intermittent)))), then(obligation(not(has(space, occupantLoad))))
PARAPHRASE: If a space has people but is either an exitway or used intermittently, then the space shall have no occupant load.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.9.4 Trench width; The width B of the trench shall be no less than the pipe diameter D plus 200 mm. Trench width at the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm unless the pipe(s) in the trench are covered with concrete, as shown in Figure 13 (c).
LRML: if(within(pipe, trench)), then(and(obligation(and(define(pipe.diameter, x0),greaterThanEqual(trench.width, 'x0 + 200 mm'))), or(obligation(and(define(topOf(pipe), x1),define(trench.width, x2),is(x2.elevation, x1),lessThanEqual(x2, 600 mm))), obligation(and(has(pipe, cover),is(cover.material, concrete))))))
PARAPHRASE: If the pipe is in a trench, then the width of the trench shall be no less than the pipe diameter plus 200 mm. Either trench width at the top of the pipe shall be no more than 600 mm or the pipis covered with concrete.
COMMENTS:
QUESTIONABLE
within/for
width at top of -> trench.width.elevation
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.1.2 Downpipes, gutters, roofing, fastenings and all adjoining components shall be of the same or a compatible material to eliminate the risk of galvanic corrosion.
LRML: if(and(define(component, x0),define(component, x1),or(and(is(x0.type, or(downpipe, gutter, roofing, fastening)),is(x1.type, or(downpipe, gutter, roofing, fastening))),and(is(x0.type, or(downpipe, gutter, roofing, fastening)),adjoin(x0, x1))))), then(obligation(and(define(x0.material, x2),define(x1.material, x3),or(equal(x2, x3),and(inBetween(compatibility, and(x0, x1)),is(compatibility.type, galvanic))))))
PARAPHRASE: If given two components, either both componenst are downpipes, gutters, roofing, or fastenings, or if one component is downpipes, gutters, roofing, fastenings and the other component is adjoining, then the components materials shall either be equal or have galvanic compatibility between them.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Construction moisture includes the moisture contained in: a) Timber products as a result of a treatment or manufacturing process, b) Green timber, and timber or other materials that have been exposed to the weather, and c) Concrete, mortar or plaster that is not completely cured.
LRML: if(or(and(include(product, moisture), is(product.material, timber), by(moisture, or(treatmentProcess, manufacturingProcess))), and(include(material, moisture), or(is(material, and(greenTimber, timber)), has(material, weatherExposure))), and(include(material, moisture), is(material, or(concrete, mortar, plaster)), not(is(material, completelyCured))))),then(has(building.construction, moisture))
PARAPHRASE: If timber products include moisture as a result of a treatment or manufacturing process, materials include moisture and either materials are green timber or timber, or materials are exposed to the weather, and materials include moisture and are concrete, mortar or plaster and is not completely cured, then the building construction has moisture.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Galvanized steel flashings shall: a) have a BMT of 0.55 mm minimum b) be grade G550, or G300 for rolled or crimped flashings c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.material, steel), is(steel.type, galvanised))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(flashing.baseMetalThickness, 0.55 mm)), obligation(or(equal(flashing.grade, g550),and(equal(flashing.grade, g300), is(flashing.type, or(rolled, crimped))))),obligation(and(asPer(flashing.corrosionProtection,intendedExposureZone),asPer(intendedExposureZone,nzbc_e2as1_t20)))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are made of galvanized steel, then the flashing shall have a base metal thickness of 0.55 mm minimum. Either flashing shall be grade G550, or G300 for rolled or crimped flashings. The flashing's corrosion protection shall be according to the intended exposure zone as shown in E2/AS1 Table 20.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Aluminium-zinc-magnesium coated steel shall: a) have a BMT of 0.55 mm minimum b) be grade G550, or G300 for curved or crimped flashings c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.
LRML: if(and(is(flashing.material, steel), is(steel.coating, aluminiumZincMagnesium))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(flashing.baseMetalThickness, 0.55 mm)), obligation(or(equal(flashing.grade, g550),and(equal(flashing.grade, g300), is(flashing.type, or(rolled, crimped))))),obligation(and(asPer(flashing.corrosionProtection,intendedExposureZone),asPer(intendedExposureZone,nzbc_e2as1_t20)))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are made of steel with aluminium-zinc-magnesium coating, then the flashing shall have a base metal thickness of 0.55 mm minimum. Either flashing shall be grade G550, or G300 for rolled or crimped flashings. The flashing's corrosion protection shall be according to the intended exposure zone as shown in E2/AS1 Table 20.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.4 Calculating occupant loads 1.4.3 Duplication shall be avoided by: a) Ensuring that, where people may be involved in more than one activity, they are counted only once.
LRML: if(and(has(space, person), partOf(person, activity), greaterThan(count(activity), 1))), then(obligation(equal(count(person), 1)))
PARAPHRASE: If people are involved in more than one activity, then the people are counted only once.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Exposed bottom edges of flashings shall be folded to a kick-out or a bird's beak as shown in Figure 5.
LRML: if(and(has(flashing.bottomEdge, exposure))), then(obligation(and(is(flashing.bottomEdge, or(kickOut, birdBeak)),asPer(flashing.bottomEdge, nzbc_e2as1_f5))))
PARAPHRASE: If the bottom edges of flashings is eposed, then the bottom edge shall be a kick-out or a bird's beak and the bottome edge shall be as shown in E2/AS1 Figure 5.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: f) When using uncoated or coated lead flashings, maximum continuous lengths shall be 1300 mm for 17 kg or 1500 mm for 20 kg lead. Where the pitch of the flashing is greater than 15° at the join, the lap at the join shall be 100 mm minimum. Where the pitch of the flashing is 15° or less at the join, the lap at the join shall be 200 mm minimum and the flashing underneath the lap shall have a hook at the edge,.
LRML: if(  and(is(flashing.material, metal), has(flashing, join), is(flashing.material, lead),is(lead.type, or(coated, uncoated)))), then(and(obligation(or(and(lessThanEqual(lead.continuousLength, 1300 mm),equal(lead.weight, 17 kg)),and(lessThanEqual(lead.continuousLength, 1500 mm),equal(lead.weight, 20 kg)))), obligation(or(and(greaterThan(join.pitch, 15 deg),greaterThanEqual(join.lap, 100 mm)),and(lessThanEqual(join.pitch, 15 deg),greaterThanEqual(join.lap, 200 mm),below(flashing, lap),has(flashing.edge, hook))))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are material metal and have joins and flahsings are uncoated or coated lead, then the maximum continuous lengths of the lead shall either be 1300 mm and lead weight be 17 kg or the maximum continuous lengths of the lead shall be 1500 mm and lead weight 20 kg. The pitch at the join shall either be greater than 15 deg and the lap at the join shall be 100 mm minimum or the pitch at the join shall be 15 deg or less and the lap at the join shall be 200 mm minimum and the flashing underneath the lap shall have a hook at the edge,.
COMMENTS:
Questionable
lead or flashing for requirement one?
At instead of location would resolve many problems and result in shorter representations.
Ignored the at for now.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Where a turn-down to the cover flashing for profiled metal claddings is required, use: b) A notched turn-down or soft edge flashing for trapezoidal profiles with rib height not exceeding 30 mm and/or rib centres not exceeding 200 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.material, profiledMetal), has(cladding, flashing), is(flashing.type, cover), requires(flashing, turnDown), is(profiledMetal.type, trapezoidal), or(lessThanEqual(profiledMetal.ribHeight, 30 mm), lessThanEqual(profiledMetal.ribCentres, 200 mm)))), then(obligation(or(is(turnDown.type, notched),is(flashing.edge, soft))))
PARAPHRASE: If cladding material is profiled metal, the cladding has cover flashings, the flashing required a turn-down, and the profiled metal is trapezoidal and either the profiled metal rib height is not exceeding 30 mm or profiled metal rib centres not exceeding 200 mm, then the turn-down shall be notched or flashing edges be soft.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Where a turn-down to the cover flashing for profiled metal claddings is required, use: c) A notched turn-down for trapezoidal profiles with rib height exceeding 30 mm and/or rib centres exceeding 200 mm.
LRML: if(and(is(cladding.material, profiledMetal), has(cladding, flashing), is(flashing.type, cover), requires(flashing, turnDown), is(profiledMetal.type, trapezoidal), or(greaterThan(cladding.ribHeight, 30 mm), greaterThan(cladding.ribCentres, 200 mm)))), then(obligation(is(turnDown.type, notched)))
PARAPHRASE: If cladding material is profiled metal, the cladding has cover flashings, the flashing required a turn-down, and the profiled metal is trapezoidal and either the profiled metal rib height is exceeding 30 mm or profiled metal rib centres exceeding 200 mm, then the turn-down shall be notched.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.0 Flashings 4.6.1.4 Roof- or deck-to-wall junctions; a) There shall be a total minimum upstand height of 110 mm, in accordance with Table 7, comprising a minimum: i) overlap cover of cladding to the flashing upstand of 75 mm, and ii) 35 mm clearance from bottom of the wall cladding to roof cladding or finished deck material.
LRML: if(and(for(flashing, junction), is(junction.type, or(roofToWall, deckToWall)))), then(obligation(and(has(flashing, upstand), greaterThanEqual(upstand.height, 110 mm),asPer(upstand.height, nzbc_e2as1_t7),include(upstand.height, overlapCover),inBetween(overlapCover, and(cladding, upstand)),greaterThanEqual(overlapCover, 75 mm),include(upstand.height, clearance),has(wallCladding, bottom),or(inBetween(clearance, and(bottom, roofCladding)),inBetween(clearance, and(bottom, finishedDeckMaterial))),greaterThanEqual(clearance, 35 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are for Roof- or deck-to-wall junctions, then the flashing shall have a minimum upstand height of 110 mm, in accordance with E2/AS1 Table 7. The upstand height included a overlap cover of cladding to the flashing upstand of minimum 75 mm, and the upstand height includes clearance from bottom of the wall cladding to either roof cladding or finished deck material of minimum 35 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Use 304 or 316 stainless steel fixings for corrosion zones B, C or hot dip galvanised fixings at 450 g/m2 for Zone B and Zone C.
LRML: if(and(is(corrosionZone, or(b, c)), for(fixing, corrosionZone))), then(obligation(or(and(is(fixing.material, stainlessSteel),is(stainlessSteel.grade, or(304, 306))),and(is(fixing.material, hotDipGalvanized),is(fixing.weight, 450 g/m2)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the corrosion zones for the fixing is B or C, then either the fixing material shall be 304 or 316 stainless steel or the fixing material shall be hot dip galvanised fixings at 450 g/m2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 9.0 Wall Claddings; 9.9.8 Pipes and service penetrations; All pipes and service penetrations through the EIFS shall be made weatherproof.
LRML: if(and(is(wallCladding.type, eifs), or(through(pipe, wallCladding),and(through(penetration, wallCladding),for(penetration, service))))), then(obligation(and(is(pipe, weatherProof),is(penetration, weatherProof))))
PARAPHRASE: If the wall claddings are EIFS and either pipes or service penetrations are through the wall clading, then the pipes and penetrations shall be weatherproof.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Hot water systems for sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances having a storage water heater capacity of up to 700 litres shall comply with NZS 4305.
LRML: // Hot water systems for sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances // having a storage water heater capacity of up to 700 litres // shall comply with NZS 4305.if(and(for(hotWaterSystem, or(sanitaryFixture, sanitaryAppliance)),include(hotWaterSystem, storageWaterHeater),lessThanEqual(storageWaterHeater.capacity, 700 l))), then(obligation(complyWith(hotWaterSystem, nzs_4305)))

TEXT: Hot water systems for sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances having a storage water heater capacity of up to 700 litres shall comply with NZS 4305.
LRML: if(and(for(hotWaterSystem, or(sanitaryFixture, sanitaryAppliance)),include(hotWaterSystem, storageWaterHeater),lessThanEqual(storageWaterHeater.capacity, 700 l))), then(obligation(complyWith(hotWaterSystem, nzs_4305)))

TEXT: Hot water systems for sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances having a storage water heater capacity of up to 700 litres shall comply with NZS 4305.
LRML: if(and(for(hotWaterSystem, and(sanitaryFixture, sanitaryAppliance)), has(sanitaryAppliance, storageWaterHeater), greaterThanEqual(storageWaterHeater.capacity, 700 l))), then(obligation(complyWith(hotWaterSystem, nzs_4305)))
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The clear width of an accessible route shall be no less than 1200 mm.
LRML: if(and(exist(accessibleRoute),is(route.type, accessible))), then(obligation(greaterThanEqual(accessibleRoute.clearWidth, 1200 mm)))
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.0.4 Windows facing north in any food waste storage area shall be screened from direct sunlight in order to reduce the likelihood of putrification.
LRML: if(and(is(window.orientation, north),within(window, wasteStorageArea), for(wasteStorageArea, food))), then(obligation(screenedFrom(wasteStorageArea, directSunlight)))
PARAPHRASE: If windows facing north in any food waste storage area, then the waste storage area shall be screened from direct sunlight in order to reduce the likelihood of putrification.

TEXT: Waste Storage Area 3.0.6 opening windows shall be screened to prevent entry by insects and other vermin.
LRML: if(and(has(wasteStorageArea, window), is(window, openable))), then(obligation(screenedFrom(window, vermin)))
PARAPHRASE: If a waste storage area has openable windows, then the windows shall be screened from vermin.

TEXT: 3.0.9 Mechanical ventilation: Where mechanical ventilation is used, it shall: a) Provide no less than 6 air changes per hour, b) Maintain a negative pressure within the storage area relative to adjacent areas (if any), and c) Discharge foul air to a safe place to avoid the likelihood of exhaust air entering any building.
LRML: if(and(has(wasteStorageArea, ventilation),is(ventilation.type, mechanical))),then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(ventilation.rate, 6 airChangesPerHour)), obligation(and(is(wasteStorageArea.airPressure, negative),towards(wasteStorageArea.airPressure, area),adjacent(area, wasteStorageArea))), obligation(towards(ventilation.discharge, safePlace))))
PARAPHRASE: Where the waste storage area has ventilation and the ventilation is mechanical, the ventilation shall: a) have a ventilation rate of no less than 6 air changes per hour, b) Maintain a negative pressure within the storage area relative to adjacent areas, and c) Discharge to a safe place.
COMMENTS:
COMPLEX
Ventilation rate added.
align negateive pressure relative to adjacent areas to uniclas: absoluteAirPressure
towards vs relativeTo

TEXT: 4.0.1 Where waste chutes with side-entry hoppers (see Figure 2) are used as an alternative to common storage areas, the chute shall: a) Have a minimum internal diameter of 450 mm, b) Be self-cleaning, vertical and have smooth joints, c) Be vented at the top above the roof line, and at the bottom above the container, and d) Terminate centrally over a suitable container located in a room complying with Paragraphs 3.0.1 to 3.0.9.
LRML: if(and(has(wasteChute, siteEntryHopper),not(exist(wasteStorageArea)),is(wasteStorageArea.type, common))), then(and(obligation(greaterThanEqual(wasteChute.internalDiameter, 450 mm)), obligation(is(wasteChute, selfCleaning)), obligation(is(wasteChute, vertical)), obligation(is(wasteChute.joint, smooth)), obligation(and(has(wasteChute.top, ventilation),above(ventilation, roofLine))), obligation(and(has(wasteChute.bottom, ventilation),above(ventilation, container))), obligation(and(is(wasteChute.terminationPoint, central),above(wasteChute.terminationPoint, container),is(container.location, space),complyWith(space, 'nzbc_g15as1_3.0.1 to nzbc_g15as1_3.0.9'))))))
PARAPHRASE: If a waste chute has side-entry hoppers and no common waste storage area exists, then the waste chute shall have a minimum internal diameter of 450 mm, the waste chute shall be self-cleaning, vertical and have smooth joints, the waste chute shall have ventilation at the top above the roof line, and the waste chute shall have ventilation at the bottom above the container, and the waste chute shall terminate centrally over a suitable container located in a room complying with G15/AS1 Paragraphs 3.0.1 to 3.0.9.

TEXT: 1.9.1 Where unauthorised access to treatment facilities may be hazardous, security shall be provided by: b) An external security fence with lockable gates if located in the open.
LRML: if(and(has(treatmentFacility, accessControl), is(treatmentFacility, hazardous), outside(treatmentFacility.location, building))), then(obligation(and(has(treatmentFacility, securityFence), is(securityFence, external), has(securityFence, lockableGate))))
PARAPHRASE: If unauthorised access to treatment facilities may be hazardous and the treatment facility is located outside, then the treatment facility shall have an external security fence with lockable gates.

TEXT: The construction R-values of individual building elements shall be determined in accordance with Subsection 2.1.4.
LRML: if(and(has(building, element), is(element.construction, rValue),))

TEXT: 5.9.1 Where two or more soil fixtures are connected to a branch drain beneath the building, access for cleaning shall be provided by a sealed floor level rodding point located downstream of the highest fixture connection to the branch drain (see Figures 10 and 13).
LRML: if(and(greaterThanEqual(soilFixture.count, 2), connect(soilFixture, drain), is(drain.type, branch), below(drain, building))), then(obligation(and(has(drain,cleaningAccess),is(cleaningAccess,roddingPoint),is(roddingPoint,floorLevel),is(roddingPoint.type,sealed),equal(roddingPoint.location,highestFixtureConnection))))
PARAPHRASE: If two or more soil fixtures are connected to a branch drain beneath the building, then the drain shall have access for cleaning by a sealed floor level rodding point located at the highest fixture connection.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.1.1 Sanitary facilities are required in occupied buildings.
LRML: if(has(building, occupancy)), then(has(building, sanitaryFacilities))
PARAPHRASE: If a building has occupancy, then the building shall have sanitary facilities.

TEXT: 1.1.2 WC pans and basins are required in any building where people: a) live or are accommodated.
LRML: if(is(building.activity, or(living, accomodation))), then(and(has(building, wcPan),has(building, basin)))
PARAPHRASE: If the building activity is living or accomodation, then the building shall have wc pans and basins.

TEXT: 1.2.2 Natural ventilation of occupied spaces must be achieved by providing a net openable area of windows or other openings to the outside of no less than 5% of the floor area.
LRML: if(and(is(space.naturalVentilation, true),greaterThan(space.occupantLoad, 0))), then(obligation(and(has(space, opening),is(opening.isExternal, true),define(sum(opening.netArea), x0),define(space.floorArea, x1),greaterThanEqual(x0, '0.05 * x1'))))
PARAPHRASE: If a space has natural ventilation and is occupied, then the net area of openings to the outside must be greater than 5 percent of the floor area.
COMMENTS:
Should '0.05 * x1' be replaced by a multiply(0.05, x1): 
Natural ventilation is a precondition. This rule stands only if a natural ventilation was chosen or is required.
Do we need to infer the wall as an intermediate, or just define the opening (Refering to openableElement in IFC).
Do I have all of the logic in the obligation or in the then branch?
Should different notations be used: Objects -> Upper Case, Properties, Lower Case. opening vs openings.
How about nested dot-notations? Difficult to translate back into LRML?

Syntaxerror: define(sum(opening.netArea, x0)) -> define(sum(opening.netArea), x0)
Both are allowed, so how to avoid??

occupied
