TEXT: Structure Design 1.1 B1/AS1 contains Acceptable Solutions for Masonry (Paragraph 2.0), Timber (Paragraph 3.0), Earth Buildings (Paragraph 4.0) and Stucco (Paragraph 5.0), Drains (Paragraph 6.0) and Glazing (Paragraph 7.0).
LRML: if(or(is(structure.material, or(masonry, timber, earth, stucco)), for(structure, drain), partOf(glazing, structure))), then(applyTo(nzbc_b1as1, structure))
PARAPHRASE: If either the structure materials are Masonry, Timber, Earth or Stucco, or structures for Drains or glazing is part of structures, then B1/AS1 applies to the structure.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.3.3 The chimney foundation walls shall be 150 mm thick reinforced concrete, 190 mm thick concrete masonry, or brick construction complying with Figures 2 or 3. Vertical and horizontal reinforcing steel shall be as given in Paragraph 1.6.
LRML: if(and(has(chimney, foundation), has(foundation, wall))), then(and(obligation(or(and(greaterThanEqual(wall.thickness,150 mm),is(wall.material,reinforcedConcrete)),and(greaterThanEqual(wall.thickness,190 mm),is(wall.material,concreteMasonry)),and(is(wall.material,brick),complyWith(wall, or(nzbc_b1as3_f2, nzbc_b1as3_f3))))),  obligation(asPer(wall.reinforcingSteel, 'nzbc_b1as3_1.6'))))
PARAPHRASE: If the chimney has foundation walls, then the wall shall be either 150 mm thick reinforced concrete, 190 mm thick concrete masonry, or brick construction complying with B1/AS3 Figures 2 or 3. Reinforcing steel shall be as given in B1/AS3 Paragraph 1.6.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.9.1 The bracing described in Paragraphs 1.9.2 to 1.9.6 shall be provided in those buildings where one or more of the following apply: a) The area of the room containing the chimney exceeds 24 m2, c) The floor area on any level of the building, for a given chimney type (see Table 2), is less than: i) 50 m2 for chimney Type 1, ii) 75 m2 for chimney Types 2, 3 and 4, iii) 150 m2 for chimney Types 5, 6 and 7.
LRML: if(or(and(include(building.space, chimney), greaterThan(space.area, 24 m2)), and(lessThan(buildingStorey.floorArea, 50 m2),is(chimney.type, type_1)),and(lessThan(buildingStorey.floorArea, 75 m2),is(chimney.type, or(type_2, type_3, type_4))),and(lessThan(buildingStorey.floorArea, 150 m2),is(chimney.type, or(type_5, type_6, type_7))))), then(obligation(and(has(building, bracing),asPer(bracing, 'nzbc_b1as3_1.9.2 to nzbc_b1as3_1.9.6'))))
PARAPHRASE: If either the building's space containing the chimney exceeds an area of 24 m2, or the floor area of a building storey is less than 50 m2 and chimney is Type 1, or the floor area of a building storey is less than 75 m2 and chimney is Types 2, 3 or 4, or the floor area of a building storey is less than 150 m2 and chimney is Types 5, 6 and 7, then the building shall have bracing as described in B1/AS3 Paragraphs 1.9.2 to 1.9.6.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.9.4 A chimney shall be considered as connected to the building when: At an intermediate floor level: it is held either by a floor bracket or by closely spaced wall ties spanning the floor.
LRML: if(and(is(chimney.elevation, intermediateFloor), or(is(chimney.fixing, floorBracket), and(is(chimney.fixing, wallTie), is(wallTie.spacing, close),inBetween(wallTie.span, floor))))), then(connect(chimney, building))
PARAPHRASE: If a chimney at an intermediate floor level is fixed by either a floor bracket or by closely spaced wall ties spanning between the floor, then the chimney is considered connected to the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 1.2.2 If a building contains a number of different activities which individually may be categorised in different risk groups, the risk group designated for a particular firecell within the building shall be that of the primary risk group. The primary risk group shall be that one within the firecell that has the most onerous fire safety requirements.
LRML: if(greaterThan(count(building.activity),1)),then(obligation(and(has(building,firecell),is(firecell.riskGroup,primaryRiskGroup),has(building.firecell,riskGroups),define(max(riskgroups.fireSafetyRequirements),x0),is(primaryRiskGroup,x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If a building contains a number of different activities, then the risk group designated for a particular firecell within the building shall be that of the primary risk group. The primary risk group shall be the firecell's risk group that has the maximum fire safety requirements.
COMMENTS:
COMPLEX
riskGroups
Should the primary risk group be handled in a separate rule?

TEXT: For housing, communal residential, communal non-residential assembly care, and commercial buildings, the building envelope shall be provided with construction that provides adequate thermal resistance.

TEXT: For housing, communal residential, communal non-residential assembly care, and commercial buildings, the building envelope shall be provided with construction that provides adequate thermal resistance.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: For housing, communal residential, communal non-residential assembly care, and commercial buildings, the building envelope shall be provided with construction that provides adequate thermal resistance.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: For housing, communal residential, communal non-residential assembly care, and commercial buildings, the building envelope shall be provided with construction that provides adequate thermal resistance. The minimum required construction R-values shall be determined through the use of: a) The Schedule method in Subsection 2.1.2, or b) The Calculation method in Subsection 2.1.3, or c) The Modelling method in H1/VM1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The requirements for the Schedule method and Calculation method are separated based on the relevant climate zone for the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The requirements for the Schedule method and Calculation method are separated based on the relevant climate zone for the building.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: For building elements with embedded heating systems, the minimum construction R-values shall be determined through the Schedule method. These apply whenever building elements that are part of the thermal envelope include heating systems and may not be reduced by applying the Calculation method in Subsection 2.1.3.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The construction R-values of individual building elements shall be determined in accordance with Subsection 2.1.4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The construction R-values of individual building elements shall be determined in accordance with Subsection 2.1.4.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structural diaphragms shall be provided at roof/ceiling level and at each floor level to which the chimney is connected. The diaphragms shall comply with all relevant clauses of NZS 3604 and NZS 4229.
LRML: if(and(has(building, chimney), or(is(building.buildingStorey, or(roof, ceiling)), connect(building.buildingStorey, chimney)))), then(obligation(and(has(buildingStorey, diaphragm),complyWith(diaphragm, and(nzs_3604,nzs_4229)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the building has a chimney and either the building storey is roof or ceiling level, or the building storey is connected to the chimney, then the building storey shall have diaphragms and the diaphragms shall comply with NZS 3604 and NZS 4229.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: C1-C6 Protection from Fire; It covers buildings or parts of buildings where people: Congregate, participate in group activities or where professional services or retail are provided (CA).
LRML: if(or(is(building.activity, or(crowd, educational, personalService)), is(building.riskGroup, ca),and(has(building, part),or(    is(part.activity, or(crowd, educational, personalService)), is(part.riskGroup, ca))))), then(applyTo(nzbc_cas2, and(building, part)))

PARAPHRASE: If either a building is activity business, professional service or industrial or risk group wb, or parts of buildings are activity business, professional service or industrial or risk group wb, then CAS2 applies to the building and part.

TEXT: 3.7.4 Inspection chambers or access chambers (see Figures 11 and 12) shall be provided where changes in both gradient and direction occur and where either is greater than 22.5°.
LRML: if(and(include(drain, and(changeInDirection, changeInGradient)), define(changeInGradient.location, x0), equal(changeInDirection.location, x0), or(greaterThan(changeInDirection, 22.5 deg), greaterThan(changeInGradient, 22.5 deg)))), then(obligation(and(has(drain, accessPoint),is(accessPoint.type, or(inspectionChamber, accessChamber)),is(accessPoint.location, x0))))
PARAPHRASE: If changes in both gradient and direction occur in the same location and either the change in gradient or change in direction is greater than 22.5 deg, then access points shall be provided as inspection chambers or access chambers at the location of the change.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.1.2 Downpipes, gutters, roofing, fastenings and all adjoining components shall be of the same or a compatible material to eliminate the risk of galvanic corrosion.
LRML: if(and(define(component, x0),define(component, x1),or(and(is(x0.type, or(downpipe, gutter, roofing, fastening)),is(x1.type, or(downpipe, gutter, roofing, fastening))),and(is(x0.type, or(downpipe, gutter, roofing, fastening)),adjoin(x0, x1))))), then(obligation(and(define(x0.material, x2),define(x1.material, x3),or(equal(x2, x3),and(inBetween(compatibility, and(x0, x1)),is(compatibility.type, galvanic))))))
PARAPHRASE: If given two components, either both componenst are downpipes, gutters, roofing, or fastenings, or if one component is downpipes, gutters, roofing, fastenings and the other component is adjoining, then the components materials shall be equal or have galvanic compatibility between them.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design 1.1 B1/AS1 contains Acceptable Solutions for Masonry (Paragraph 2.0), Timber (Paragraph 3.0), Earth Buildings (Paragraph 4.0) and Stucco (Paragraph 5.0), Drains (Paragraph 6.0) and Glazing (Paragraph 7.0).
LRML: if(or(is(structure.material, or(masonry, timber, earth, stucco)), for(structure, drain), partOf(glazing, structure))), then(applyTo(nzbc_b1as1, structure))
PARAPHRASE: If either the structure materials are Masonry, Timber, Earth or Stucco, or structures for Drains or glazing is part of structures, then B1/AS1 applies to the structure.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design 1.2 B1/AS gives an Acceptable Solution for small chimneys (referred to in Paragraph 8.0).
LRML: if(and(is(structure, chimney), is(chimney.size, small))), then(applyTo(nzbc_b1as1, structure))
PARAPHRASE: If the structure is a small sized chimney, then B1/AS1 applies to the structure.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 2.1.3 NZS 4229; Grade 500E welded steel mesh; Where Grade 500E welded steel mesh is specified, it shall meet the requirements of Paragraph 14.0 in B1/VM1.
LRML: if(is(weldedSteelMesh.grade, 500e)), then(obligation(complyWith(weldedSteelMesh, nzbc_b1vm1_14)))
PARAPHRASE: If Grade 500E welded steel mesh is used, then the welded steel mesh shall meet the requirements of Paragraph 14.0 in B1/VM1.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: The lowest zone within the Selwyn or Waimakariri District Council boundaries is within Zone 2. Areas within Selwyn District that are designated as Zone 1 in NZS 3604 shall become Zone 2.
LRML: if(or(and(is(zone, lowest),within(zone, boundary), for(boundary, or(selwynDistrictCouncil, waimakaririDistrictCouncil))), and(within(area, selwynDistrictCouncil), is(area, zone_1),asPer(area, nzs_3604)))), then(and(within(zone, zone_2), is(area, zone_2)))
PARAPHRASE: If either the zone is the lowest and either within the Selwyn District Council or Waimakariri District Council boundaries is within Zone 2, or the areas within Selwyn District Council are designated as Zone 1 in NZS 3604, then the zone is is within Zone 2 and the area is is Zone 2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 3.0 Timber; The combined foundation and edge details shall be constructed as shown in Figures 7.13(B), 7.14(B) or (C).

PARAPHRASE: If the consturction material is Timber, then the foundation and edge shall be constructed as shown in B1/AS1 Figures 7.13.b, 7.14.b or 7.14.c.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: For a single storey foundation, 15 Series masonry may be used and the minimum footing width may be 190 mm.
LRML: if(for(foundation, singleStorey)), then(permission(and(is(foundation.material,masonry),is(masonry.type, 15 series),greaterThanEqual(footing.width, 190 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If the foundation is for a single storey, then the foundations material may be 15 Series masonry and the minimum footing width may be 190 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: All slab-on-ground reinforcing shall extend to within 75 mm of the outside edge of the slab (including the foundation wall) and shall consist of a minimum 2.27kg/m2 welded Grade 500E reinforcing mesh sheets (1.14 kg/m2 in each direction), which shall be lapped at sheet joints such that the overlap measurement between the outermost cross wires of each fabric sheet is equal to the greater of one of the following: the spacing of cross wires plus 50 mm, 150 mm, or the manufacturer's requirements. Slabs shall have a maximum dimension of 18 m between free joints.
LRML: if(is(reinforcing.type, slabOnGround)), then(obligation(and(define(slab.outsideEdge, x0),within(reinforcing, 'x0 - 75 mm'),is(reinforcing, sheet),is(sheet.material, weldedReinforcingMesh),is(sheet.grade,500e),greaterThanEqual(sheets.weight,2.27 kg/m2),loop(forEach(slab.direction),greaterThanEqual(sheets.weight,1.14 kg/m2)),has(sheets.joint,lap),has(sheets, crossWires),is(crossWires.location, outermost),inBetween(lap.measurement,crossWires),define(crossWires.spacing, x1), greaterThanEqual(lap.measurement, 'x1 + 50 mm'), greaterThanEqual(lap.measurement, 150 mm), greaterThanEqual(lap.measurement, manufacturerRequirement),has(slab, joints), is(joints.type, free), inBetween(slab.dimension,joints),lessThanEqual(slab.dimension,18 m))))
PARAPHRASE: If slabs are on ground and have reinforcing, the reinforcing shall extend to within 75 mm of the outside edge of the slab and the reinforcing shall consist of sheets from welded reinforcing mesh with grade 500E and weight of minimum 2.27kg/m2 and the sheets shall have minimum 1.14 kg/m2 for each direction of the slab, and sheet joints shall be lapped such that the lap measurement is between the outermost cross wires of each fabric sheet and is greater than or equal the spacing of cross wires plus 50 mm, 150 mm, or the manufacturer's requirements. Slabs shall have a maximum dimension of 18 m between free joints.
COMMENTS:
5

sheets?
max out of three values
equal to the greater of one of the following -> greater than equal all of them.
maximum dimension of 18 m -> All dimensions have to be smaller than 18m?
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design 6.0 Drains 6.1 AS/NZS 2566.1 6.2 AS/NZS 2566.2 6.3 AS/NZS 2032 6.4 AS/NZS 2033.
LRML: if(is(structure, drain)), then(complyWith(structure.design, and('nzs_2566_1_6.2', 'nzs_2566_2_6.3', 'nzs_2032_6.4', nzs_2033)))

TEXT: Construction moisture includes the moisture contained in: a) Timber products as a result of a treatment or manufacturing process, b) Green timber, and timber or other materials that have been exposed to the weather, and c) Concrete, mortar or plaster that is not completely cured.
LRML: if(or(and(include(product, moisture), is(product.material, timber), by(moisture, or(treatmentProcess, manufacturingProcess))), and(include(material, moisture), or(is(material, and(greenTimber, timber)), has(material, weatherExposure))), and(include(material, moisture), is(material, or(concrete, mortar, plaster)), not(is(material, completelyCured))))),then(has(building.construction, moisture))
PARAPHRASE: If timber products include moisture as a result of a treatment or manufacturing process, materials include moisture and either materials are green timber or timber, or materials are exposed to the weather, and materials include moisture and are concrete, mortar or plaster and is not completely cured, then the building construction has moisture.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Regular maintenance of a building will include: a) Washing exterior surfaces, b) Inspecting surfaces and junctions, and repairing or replacing items when necessary, in order to preserve the weathertightness of the building. c) Maintaining clearances between cladding and external ground or paving as per Paragraph 9.1.3. d) Maintaining minimum 35 mm clearances between roofing and membrane decking, and wall cladding above e) Maintaining finish coatings especially for stucco, EIFS and fibre cement claddings.
LRML: if(and(has(building, maintenance), is(maintenance.type, regular))), then(and(include(maintenance.task, and(washing, inspecting, repairing, replacing, maintaining)), include(maintenance.task, washing), for(washing, exteriorSurface), include(maintenance.task, inspecting), for(inspecting, and(surface, junction)), include(maintenance.task, and(repairing, replacing)), or(for(repairing, object), for(replacing, object)),not(is(object, weathertight)),include(maintenance.task, maintaining), for(maintaining, clearance),or(inBetween(clearance, and(cladding, externalGround)), inBetween(clearance, and(cladding, paving))), asPer(clearance, 'nzbc_e2as1_9.1.3'), inBetween(clearance, and(roofing, membraneDecking)), greaterThanEqual(clearance, 35 mm), inBetween(clearance, and(roofing, membraneDecking)), greaterThanEqual(clearance, 35 mm),has(cladding, finishCoating),for(maintaining, finishCoating)))
PARAPHRASE: If maintenance of a building is type regular, then the maintenance tasks will include Washing exterior surfaces, and the maintenance tasks will include inspecting surfaces and junctions, and the maintenance tasks will include repairing or replacing items if they are not weathertight, and the maintenance tasks will include maintaining clearances between either cladding and external ground or cladding and paving as per E2/AS1 Paragraph 9.1.3, and maintaining minimum 35 mm clearances between roof and membrane decking, and roof and wall cladding, and maintaining finish coatings of claddings.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Flashings are required to shed or divert water at sensitive areas of the building cladding. These include at: a) The building periphery, except where gutters are present, b) Changes of direction in cladding materials, c) Intersections between cladding materials or with other buildings, and d) Roof or wall penetrations, including windows, doors and other penetrations.
LRML: if(and(has(building, cladding),or(is(cladding.area, sensitive), and(is(cladding.area, buildingPeriphery), not(within(cladding.area, gutter))), and(has(cladding.area, material),has(material, changeInDirection)),and(has(cladding.area, intersection), or(has(cladding, materials),inBetween(intersection, materials), towards(intersection, otherBuilding))),has(cladding.area, or(penetration, window, door))))), then(obligation(and(has(cladding.area, flashing),for(flashing,or(shedWater,divertWater)))))
PARAPHRASE: If the building cladding has either a sensitive areas or the cladding area is the building periphery, and no gutters are in the cladding area, or the cladding area's material has changes of direction, or the cladding area has intersections between cladding materials or to other buildings, or the cladding area has penetrations, windows or doors, then the cladding area shall have flashings to shed water or divert water.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 4.0 Flashings 4.6.1.4 Roof- or deck-to-wall junctions; a) There shall be a total minimum upstand height of 110 mm, in accordance with Table 7, comprising a minimum: i) overlap cover of cladding to the flashing upstand of 75 mm, and ii) 35 mm clearance from bottom of the wall cladding to roof cladding or finished deck material.
LRML: if(and(for(flashing, junction), is(junction.type, or(roofToWall, deckToWall)))), then(obligation(and(has(flashing, upstand), greaterThanEqual(upstand.height, 110 mm),asPer(upstand.height, nzbc_e2as1_t7),include(upstand.height, overlapCover),inBetween(overlapCover, and(cladding, upstand)),greaterThanEqual(overlapCover, 75 mm),include(upstand.height, clearance),has(wallCladding, bottom),or(inBetween(clearance, and(bottom, roofCladding)),inBetween(clearance, and(bottom, finishedDeckMaterial))),greaterThanEqual(clearance, 35 mm))))
PARAPHRASE: If flashings are for Roof- or deck-to-wall junctions, then the flashing shall have a minimum upstand height of 110 mm, in accordance with E2/AS1 Table 7. The upstand height included a overlap cover of cladding to the flashing upstand of minimum 75 mm, and the upstand height includes clearance from bottom of the wall cladding to either roof cladding or finished deck material, and the clearnace shall be of minimum 35 mm.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: NZS 4223.3 Glass design for these types shall comply with the following tables (see note 1): Table 14 - Structural balustrade – cantilevered glass;.

TEXT: Rails, which in the event a glass pane breaks, spans the broken pane at the required barrier height and, i) resists Line and Concentrated design loads (SLS) specified in Tables 14 to 17, and ii) does not deflect more than 100 mm, in any direction, under the design loads.
LRML: if(and(around(rail, pane),is(pane.material, glass), is(pane, broken))), then(obligation(and(for(rail.span, pane),define(barrier.height, x0),equal(rail.span,x0),against(rail.resistance, and(lineDesignLoad, concentratedDesignLoad)),asPer(lineDesignLoad,'nzbc_b1as1_t14 to nzbc_b1as1_t17'),asPer(concentratedDesignLoad,'nzbc_b1as1_t14 to nzbc_b1as1_t17'),has(rail,deflection),lessThanEqual(rail.deflection,100 mm),towards(rail.deflection,anyDirection),by(rail.deflection, designLoad))))
PARAPHRASE: If the rails are around a glass pane and the glass pane is broken, then the rail spans the broken pane at the barrier height and, the rails shall resist line design loads and concentrated design loads specified in B1/AS1 Tables 14 to 17, and the rails do not deflect more than 100 mm, towards any direction, by the design loads.

TEXT: Structure Design; Interlinking rails are not required for a heat-strengthened or toughened laminated safety glass barrier that: has a top capping, corner brackets or a proprietary system and will, when both panes of the laminate are fractured, resist a 0.2 kN concentrated load and not deflect more than 250 mm (see note 2).
LRML: if(and(is(safetyBarrier.material, glass), is(glass.type, laminated), is(glass, or(heatStrengthened, toughened)), has(glass, or(topCapping, cornerBracket, proprietaryProtectionSystem)), is(safetyBarrier.panes, and(laminate, fractured)),against(panes.resistance, concentratedLoad), lessThanEqual(concentratedLoad, 0.2 kN), is(resistance.type, concentratedLoad), lessThanEqual(panes.deflection, 250 mm))), then(permission(not(is(safetyBarrier.rail, interlinked))))
PARAPHRASE: If the safety barrier is glass and the glass is laminated and heat-strengthened or toughened, and the safety barrier has a top capping, corner brackets or a proprietary protection system and both safety barrier panes of the laminate are fractured and the panes resists a 0.2 kN concentrated load and the panes deflection is less than or equal 250 mm, then the safety barrier may not have interlinking rails.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design; Interlinking rails are not required for a heat-strengthened or toughened laminated safety glass barrier that: has two or three edges supported by structural sealant joints or continuous clamps, and will, when both panes of the laminate are fractured, resist a 0.2 kN concentrated load and not deflect more than 250 mm (see note 2).
LRML: if(and(is(safetyBarrier.material, glass), is(glass.type, laminated), is(glass, or(heatStrengthened, toughened)), equal(count(safetyBarrier.edge), or(2, 3)), is(edge.support, or(sealantJoint, continuousClamp)), is(safetyBarrier.panes, and(laminate, fractured)),against(panes.resistance, concentratedLoad), lessThanEqual(concentratedLoad, 0.2 kN), is(resistance.type, concentratedLoad), lessThanEqual(panes.deflection, 250 mm))), then(permission(not(is(safetyBarrier.rail, interlinked))))
PARAPHRASE: If the safety barrier is glass and the glass is laminated and heat-strengthened or toughened, and the safety barrier has two or three edges supported by sealant joints or continuous clamps and both safety barrier panes of the laminate are fractured and the panes resists a 0.2 kN concentrated load and the panes deflection is less than or equal 250 mm, then the safety barrier may not have interlinking rails.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Physical testing of glass barriers must include all components of the barrier system, including all structural connections. Loads and deflections must be applied and measured horizontally, at midspan, at the required barrier height. The concentrated load shall be applied over an area of 100 mm x 100 mm and for at least one minute.
LRML: if(and(is(barrier.material, glass), has(barrier, physicalTesting))), then(obligation(and(has(barrier, or(component, structuralConnection)),include(physicalTesting,and(component, structuralConnection)),is(physicalTesting.type,and(load,deflection)),is(physicalTesting.method,and(application,measurement)),is(physicalTesting.location,and(horizontal,midspan,requiredBarrierHeight)),is(load.applicationArea,'100 mm x 100 mm'),greaterThanEqual(load.applicationDuration,1 minute))))
PARAPHRASE: If glass barriers have physical testing, then the physical testing must include all components and structural connections of the barrier system. Loads and deflections of the physical testing must be applied and measured horizontally, at midspan, at the required barrier height. The load shall be applied over an area of 100 mm x 100 mm and for at least one minute.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Structure Design; The design of structural connections, fasteners and mounting hardware, that are part of the glass barrier, is outside the scope of this Standard and must be specifically designed.
LRML: if(and(has(barrier.material, glass), include(barrier, or(structuralConnection, fastener, mountingHardware)))), then(and(applyTo(nzbc_b1as1, and(structuralConnection, fastener, mountingHardware)),obligation(and(has(connection,specificDesign),has(fastener,specificDesign),has(mountingHardware,specificDesign)))))
PARAPHRASE: If structural connections, fasteners or mounting hardware are included in the glass barrier, then B1/AS1 does not apply to the structural connections, fasteners or mounting hardware and the structural connections, fasteners or mounting hardware shall have a specific design.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Downpipes shall: g) Be formed from any of the materials outlined for flashings in Paragraph 4.1 except 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11 h) Upper roofs shall drain via downpipes directly to ground level where possible, or i) Where discharging to a lower roof, be fitted with a spreader as detailed in Figure 20 j) Have a maximum catchment area of 25 m2 if discharging on to a lower roof area.
LRML: if(exist(downpipe)), then(obligation(and(asPer(downpipe.material, 'nzbc_e2as1_4.1'),not(asPer(downpipe.material, or('nzbc_e2as1_4.3.9', 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.10', 'nzbc_e2as1_4.3.11'))),through(upperRoof.drainage, downpipe),or(towards(upperRoof.drainage,groundLevel),and(towards(upperRoof.drainage, lowerRoof),is(downpipe.fixture,spreader),asPer(downpipe.fixture, nzbc_e2as1_f20),lessThanEqual(downpipe.catchmentArea, 25 m2))))))
PARAPHRASE: If downpipes exist, then the dowpipe shall be any of the materials outlined in E2/AS1 4.1 and not outlined in E2/AS1 4.3.9, 4.3.10 and 4.3.11. Either upper roofs shall have drainage through downpipes to the ground level, or upper roofs shall have drainage towards a lower roof, the downpipe shall be fitted with a spreader as detailed in E2/AS1 Figure 20 and the downpipe shall have a maximum catchment area of 25 m2.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: 8.1.6.1 Internal gutters; Internal gutters shall: b) Where butyl or EPDM, be minimum 1.5 mm membrane thickness, or 1.0 mm thickness for gutters less than 1 metre wide.
LRML: if(and(is(gutter.type, internal), is(gutter.material, or(butyl, epdm)))), then(obligation(or(and(greaterThanEqual(gutter.thickness, 1.5 mm),greaterThanEqual(gutter.width, 1 m)),and(greaterThanEqual(gutter.thickness, 1 mm),lessThan(gutter.width, 1 m)))))
PARAPHRASE: If gutters are internal and gutter material is butyl or EPDM, then either the gutter shall be minimum 1.5 mm thickness and not less than 1 metre wide, or the gutter shall be 1 mm thickness and gutters less than 1 metre wide.
AUTHOR: Stefan

TEXT: Hot water systems for sanitary fixtures and sanitary appliances having a storage water heater capacity of up to 700 litres shall comply with NZS 4305.
AUTHOR: Stefan
